Yes, the fight is spiced up with some new stuff, but overall, it is just the one you've seen in the last movie... or the movie before that, or the movie before that, etc.Aside from these "unskippable" beats, there are a lot of jokes, that fall flat - the film must have had at least 50 jokes in it, and I remember laughing at three of those (I guess there were some chuckles too, but you are not going to the movies for chuckles).Throughout the movie some characters acted like they were pretty dumb, which took me out of the setting, and lastly, while most of the movie was technically sound, I did have a problem with the pacing here and there. Some scenes took way too long to build up to their climaxes, which weren't even that strong, and this made the movie kind of overstay its welcome.However, there were also plenty of good things, and I believe a lot of people just hate this movie for never being as good as the original JP trilogy. And while I think that's true, I can also appreciate the JW trilogy as it is - as a different trilogy, that takes place in the same world as JP. This is a more action-packed, less serious trilogy, but on its own it is fine (as far as blockbusters go).Now, that we accepted it as a different set of movies than the first three, let's see what was good about it!For one, everything you would expect was just as good, or even better than before. The visual effects, the sound design, the music (although it was too much sometimes, but I actually liked how it was not trying to nostalgia-bait me every second), these were all great. I also think they were at their most creative, when it came to the set pieces, places and action scenes. There was some real variety in here, which I really appreciate, and contrary to what most say, I didn't think they left the set pieces too quickly, because the movie did a great job at showing us (with aerial shots, for example), that they were connected.Another good thing, that you might not expect, was the characters and their interactions (aside from a new side character, who did nothing but drive and make bad jokes throughout the whole movie, which became boring, fast). The old and new crew all performed very well, and every single one of them had something to do, without it feeling forced, disconnected, or contrived. Well, aside from a certain scene, that didn't really had to happen like that, and most probably was just the way it was for nostalgia. This one scene didn't ruin it all for me though, and I liked how the characters behaved like themselves, without it becoming exhaustingly similar to the previous films, and without them being someone who barely resembles them (looking at you, Star Wars).Okay, now take a deep breath and bear with me, because what I'm about to say might shock you... I actually liked where they took the story. I know, crazy! But to me it matters a lot, that the story stepped out of the boundaries of being "just another Jurassic Park episode". This is one of the things I meant, when I wrote that they did their best to create something that's not just mimicing a popular franchise. And while yes, it had a lot of the same story beats, it was still different enough, that I have to give credit for it. Of course the viewer has to keep in mind, that in the end this IS a new Jurassic World movie, and that there are some boundaries that it simply can not step out of. Still, the story of the girl, made the whole movie a little more personal, than just another "big dino goes roar" movie. It's certainly not groundbraking, but I think it added some depth to it, which was mostly missing from the previous two films. This accompanied with the good acting, fun character interactions and great sets, action and visuals, made for a very enjoyable experience for me.In short, my takeaway is that if you go into this movie with the right expectations, you can have a good time. This is not Jurassic Park, this is Jurassic World. It's bigger, prettier, shallow, but can be just as fun. It has several shortcomings, but this movie (not the previous ones) makes up for it with some extra care and creativity, which ultimately helps it become the best of the three JW movies. It's not great, but certainly a very enjoyable, slightly better than average blockbuster popcorn movie - but only if YOU allow it to be.

title: Dinosaur disappointment
text: A passable film as far as visual effects are concerned, but the story and characters are both underwhelming. For me it is the worst film of the saga, it does not reach the sufficiency.

title: Acceptable but flawed sequel with lots of action , chills, thrills and screams
text: The epic conclusion of the Jurassic era is set some years later the destruction of Isla Nublar , Biosyn operatives run by owner Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott) attempt to track down Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon) , while Dr Ellie Sattler (laura Dern) investigates a genetically engineered swarm of giant insects. After demise of the island , Owen Grady and Claire Dearing took in young Maisie Lockwood. They've been living under the radar to protect Maisie, but she feels like a prisoner . When Maisie goes missing , Owen (Chris Pratt , former Jurassic Park manager) and Claire (Bryce Dallas Howard , the previous founder of the Dinosaur Protection Group) set out to find her . Paleobotanist Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) , Paleontologist Alan Grant (Sam Neill) , and Chaotician Ian Malcolm (Jeff Glodblum) set out to help them . Once again to save the Jurassic Dinosaurs and other colosal carnivorous unwisely cloned from extinction when the location where they live. Life finds a way . The park is gone . Off the island . Into your home . The next stage of evolution. T all started here.Passable sequel with noisy action , thrills , chills and impressive special effects. This is a decent and amusing sequel , following the original premises of the Franchise created by Michael Chricton and Steven Spielberg , being written by Derek Connolly, Emily Carmichael and director Colin Trevorrow himself . As usual, here appears the ordinary monsters such as Brontosaurius , Triceratops , Gigantosaurius , the smaller but more intelligent flesh-eaters Velociraptors , Tyrannosaurus Rex, and other new astonishing creatures with special bloody skills . Basically, the plot is a pretext to allow the roles to be pursued through lush jungles in the fantastic location , as well as a breathtaking confrontation in the Byosin company . The plot line is simplistic , though it has some twists , and so various characters are predictable , but it is a good entertainment . Along with duo starring Bryce Dallas Howard , Chris Pratt appear accompanied by nice actors , this time the cast is better than previous entries , such as : Laura Dern , Sam Neill , Jeff Goldblum , DeWanda Wise , Mamoudou Athie , Isabella Sermon , Campbell Scott , BD Wong, Omar Sy and , of course, Jeff Goldblum.It packs a colorful and brilliant cinematography by cameraman John Schwartzman . As well as vibrant and rousing musical score by Michael Giacchino , including the classic Jurassic sounds from John Williams .The picture was professionally written and directed by filmmaker Colin Trevorrow . This quickly became one of the largest grossing in the year because it gives audiences exactamente what they want , only more so . Trevorrow is a fine craftsman , he wrote and directed "Home Base" that became one of the early viral successes on the internet. His first feature film was the succesful "Safety Not Guaranteed" and following Jurassic World (2015) and The Book of Henry (2017). Rating : 5.5/10. Acceptable and passable.The Jurassic Franchise is formed by the following installments : Jurassic Park (1993) with Sam Neill, Laura Dern , Bob Peck, Richard Attemborough , Joseph Mazzelo, D. B Wong , Ariana Richards. The Lost World Jurassic Park (1997) with Jeff Goldblum , Julianne Moore, Pete Postlewaite , Richard Attemborough . Jurassic Park III by Joel Johnson with Sam Neill, William H Macy, Tea Leoni, Michael Jeter , John Diehl, Bruce A. Young . Jurassic World (2015) by Colin Trevorrow with Chis Pratt , Bryce Dallas Howard , Vincent D'Onofrio, Omar Sy , Judy Greer , BD Wong . Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018) by J. A. Bayona with Chris Pratt , Bryce Dallas Howard, Rafe Spall, Daniella Pineda, James Cromwell, Toby Jones. Jurassic world : Dominion (2020) with Bryce Dallas Howard , Chris Pratt and TV series Jurassic World : Camp Cretaceous (2020-2022) , 49 episodes , with Paul Williams, Jenna Ortega, Glenn Powell.

title: Best Jurassic movie so far IMO
text: Now I said it already - "best Jurassic movie so far" - and ok, I'll happily admit I didn't have too high expectations, because I didn't like the previous two installments much tbh, but this one, at first I was thinking "pretty slow start", followed by "but hey, they're actually building up a pretty good story that makes me care about what happens to the characters next" and with a drive of a star wars or James Bond movie keeping your attention, and with pretty good CGI supporting the story, not the other way around. No honestly, this felt like a more "mature" Jurassic movie compared to previous ones, I really enjoyed this one and left the movie theatre with a big smile on my face - this is what a night at the movies is all about.

title: The old Jurassic formula just doesn't work anymore
text: It's time to end the Jurassic franchise. This movie is just more of the same. They added giant locust in this one, so there's that. But really there was no reason to make this film. It's the same dinosaurs. The same dinosaur sounds. The same running jumping climbing swimming and hiding from dinosaurs. The same dramatic drawn out camera angles on the actors faces as they look either scared, concerned or all-knowing before scrambling to safety just in the nick of time. There was no real suspense because we knew our main characters would make it home safely. If the creators are insistent on making ANOTHER Jurassic film, please update the formula!

title: I dont know why people didn't like it
text: I enjoyed the action little jump scare and the og characters. Also lived the new dinos and characters I wish people appreciated movies more. I really recommend people don't listen to the bad reviews caie you might enjoy it.

title: Entertaining: Sure!
text: Yeah, it's another one of the *World editions of Jurassic Park.It's really cheesy, like all the *World movies, but it's still entertaining. This one has a really weak story, which you figure out almost within minutes of the movie. The dinos are so very much in the background here compared to the other movies.

title: Don't waste your money
text: Wasted 2.5 hrs. No story line. Forced characters. Doesn't make sense. Revisiting old scenes were awful. CGI is too game like. I remember watching the 1st Jurassic Park as a kid and thought the T. Rex was going to jump out of the screen. Overall one of the worse movie. Don't waste your time and money. It felt like a money grab by these movie makers exploiting a good classic movie. How much more can they milk this.

title: Awesome VFX but lacks a good storyline
text: There was good VFX, beautiful scenery and they didn't compromise to show dinosaurs but the story line was not up to the mark as it lacks good content and talking about thrill in jurassic Park movies should be must but this movies lacks in that too.

title: When it's not laughably poor, it's boring. Or annoying.
text: Jurassic World Dominion scrapes away the very last traces of legacy remaining from the original Jurassic Park film (which still stands as a great movie). From the opening few minutes the scene is set for a dumb, unimaginative, tension-free, forgettable and utterly wasteful film.The dinosaurs are either upstaged by insects or relegated to jump-scare caricatures constantly popping out of every dark corner when the movie needs them to.There is no attempt to build up tension, as exemplified in the very opening sequence when the sea monster from the previous film pops up again to zero effect. That opening lasts less than a minute but probably amounted to more than many indie films entire budget.Chris Pratt completes his journey from promising new screen presence to bland franchise prop and together with Bryce Dallas Howard, achieves some sort of record as least amount of on-screen chemistry between a couple.The old crew return but only to prove that decent actors capable of creating interesting on-screen relationships can be totally undermined by a terrible script and poor direction. Meanwhile, new additions to the cast such as Dewanda Wise, Mamoudie Athie and Campbell Scott are devoid of screen charisma, acting ability or anything interesting to contribute. Scott in particular is probably one of the most ineffectual and dull on-screen 'villians' I've ever seen.Every single minute contained something stupid, irritating or unintentionally funny.As just one example, the film begins with the cliche of an exposition News item - designed to get the viewer up to speed - in which the presenter informs the populace that dinosaurs are now a global phenonmenon and have been for quite some time.Stop for a moment and consider if a single dinosaur had really been resurrected in our world, does anybody think that in a 24 hour news culture combined with ubiquitous social media and internet access - that anybody capable of watching the news would be unaware of that fact?On top of this, we are informed that the global death toll attributed to dinosaurs is 37. A minute, you ask? No, 37 in a year. Presumably that's not including the entire ship that just got destroyed by our aforementioned jaws stand-in?In the past fifteen years, 74 people have been killed by cows - in the UK alone. Cows.Allosaurs, pterodactyls and T. Rex are roaming our natural habitat and less people are killed than by accidents with butter knives.Shame on you, Mr Spielberg, for endorsing this trash.

title: The direction feels like it was mixed live like a dinosaur concert
text: This must be one of the most stupidly misconceived big budget films I've ever seen. A storyline that actively resists your interest, even though you know that there will be dinosaurs. Direction so incapable, it feels like it was mixed live like some kind of dinosaur concert. No doubt there were countless talented creatives involved in this mega-production, its just unfortunate none of them were at the very top.

title: Pure awesomeness in 4DX!!!
text: This is the perfect film for 4DX. Full of nostalgia too. Any Jurassic fan can enjoy this installment if you just go with an open mind and not nitpicking the script.

title: Good CGI's and that's about it.
text: I rated Jurassic World Dominion with a seven because I like that kind of movies, adventures with prehistoric animals but in all fairness the story wasn't the greatest. It was much too exaggerated, much too simple at times, and the acting was sometimes not that great either. I've never been a big fan of Chris Pratt, think he's just a mediocre actor and that didn't change with this movie. And Laura Dern isn't an actress I appreciate a lot either so those two combined isn't a success formula for me. The only reason I score it this high, maybe too high, is because of the CGI's which were very good, and that's what made it entertaining. Maybe it's time to call it a day with the Jurassic franchise. At one point enough is enough.

title: A Decent End To An Amazing Franchise
text: I'll be honest here, I went into this movie with low expectations, this is because I read some of the reviews about how rubbish it is and how it's just a cash grab. But now that I have seen it I can proudly say it was a good movie and ending to a franchise.But I will say this there is so much plot holes in this film so if your going to see it just for the plot you will come out really disappointed. It's a leave your brain at the door film. Just enjoy it for what it is.

title: Jurassic Bond- 007
text: If you were asked to guess the plot of this movie by watching the last 5 minutes off Fallen Kingdom, you would stand no chance.I thought we would spend the film with dinosaurs running riot on earth. Ruining towns, attempts at domesticating, things like that. But no. Instead we get like a spy movie?Is it nice to see the old characters? Sure but because there are two groups on two completely separate "missions", it can feel lob sided and underdeveloped. Crisp Rat and BDH literally spend the whole movie journeying to their destination. That is there plot. "Take plane....arrive at climax". They may as well have not been there.Also the CGI just looked bad. It looks like cartoons. Like Dinosaur King. Just look at the first Jurassic Park movie, the dinosaurs look so good, they feel real, but I never felt like we're are real here.

title: more is not always merrier
text: It's four years after Isla Nublar. Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and Claire Deering (Bryce Dallas Howard) are hiding Maisie from the world. Dinosaurs are roaming the world. Biosyn is a genetics company run by Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott) and given the legal rights over them. Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) suspects them of reviving an ancient locust which threatens the world food supply. She recruits a reluctant Alan Grant (Sam Neill) to help. They have Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) as their inside man.The franchise is trying to bring together the newer iteration with the original three. Filmmaker Colin Trevorrow seems to be in charge. His success rate is mixed. He has a tendency not to recognize when his films get into awkward positions. In this one, there is a lot of convenient coincidences. There is one section when I'm yelling at the characters to shoot. They have guns and I don't think dinosaurs are bulletproof. I question the world building exercise here. Some of it is silly. I don't mind bringing back the original three. I like continuing their stories and visiting old friends. There is a lot going on with the two sides and I wouldn't mind if they could be connected more smoothly. They only run into the other group because they are both coming after the company. Instead of turning Chris Pratt into Bourne Identity, they could identify Biosyn early on and zero in on Ian Malcolm as their way in. They could be the people to recruit Ellie and Alan. It's a more natural way to connect the two groups. While I love the idea of the locust, I don't understand why they got released. It's a messy movie. This is a lot. It's overloaded. Some of it is fun and I can hold on to that.

title: Terribleosaurus.....
text: Lots of cgi as usual, with creatures chasing people, as usual, but they seem to have spent more time focusing on the female action girl quota than they did on any story. Oh, the acting is poor and unconvincing too. Just watch some David Attenborough stuff instead....

title: The original cast is back!
text: "Jurassic World Dominion" is an entertaining movie whose script is full of fanservice, especially for those like me who loved the first movie, it's quite nice to see Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum together again. In terms of logic, the script has many flaws that are justified by the science fiction theme that the film touches on. The soundtrack is good, especially the theme used in suspenseful scenes. The cinematography is powerful and provides some great visuals. The performances are good and the director does a good job. An entertaining movie but with nothing more to offer.

title: Not good
text: 1. In the first 10 minutes seeing Chris Pratt drag down a dinosaur by hand....when filming/editing don't they consider basic physics? It looked ridiculous and from then on I couldn't take the film seriously.2. Watching Laura Dern (an icon!) recreate the sunglasses removal from JP1 - just why?! Poorly thought out and executed.3. Bringing back the villain Dodgson from JP1 was genius...until you learn it is played by a different actor...who obviously didn't get the part from his acting skills.4. Making the film NOT about dinosaurs in the wild and more about rogue company BioSyn and giant bugs was a mistake...even Ellie Satler and Alan Grant could not inject interest into this boring spectacle.Overall not a good film and a poor addition to the JP franchise.A lot of Chris Pratt scenes against the green screens look very poorly executed (ie standing in front of Blue the velociraptor) and I didn't believe his character. His daughter in the film is poorly acted and annoying...Overall 2/10. Very disappointing. Just shows how hard it is so make an iconic film like the original JP and even the JP2 Lost World. Spielberg is incredibly talented and I hope he can share his filmmaking secrets so the future of cinema doesn't end up like the poorly acted, badly written, unnecessary movie Dominion. Had so much potential - very sad.

title: Why all the bad reviews? I don't get it!
text: I loved this movie! In my opinion it comes in 2nd, after the original Jurassic Park! It's a dinosaur movie for God sake, what are people expecting! I loved the return of the original cast. They were in the movie more than I expected! It's slow to start but once the storyline merged the two sets of characters it was fantastic! I am ready to go see it again!

title: Why all the hate??
text: I just don't get it! I've just seen it and was actually reluctant to go after reading quite a bit of negativity about it BUT it's actually not bad! It's a solid 7.5/10, I was entertained, the set prices were great and the old and the new cast blended well. Go see it expecting to be entertained and you'll have fun!

title: Worst Jurassic Park yet!
text: I was so excited to see this movie and it was so, so disappointing. CGI was like a low budget indie for Netflix. Acting was the same... You could have gone out and gotten better performances from a high school production.The screenwriters should be banned from ever being allowed to write anything ever again. Ever.No story, terrible acting, terrible special effects... Only redeeming quality was some amazing stunts.What a disappointing end to such a great franchise!

title: Won't win any Oscars but it's entertaining!
text:
Not nearly as bad as some people are making it out to be. There is too much action, and a lot of it is ridiculous. There are too many characters, and not all the performances are great. The story is somehow both simple and complex.But this might is genuinely fun. There are some cool dinosaurs, new and old. While some callbacks are a bit heavy-handed, most are pretty light and enjoyable. Big improvement from Fallen Kingdom.Here's the definitive ranking of the movies for reference:
Jurassic Park
Jurassic World
Dominion
JP3
Lost World
Fallen Kingdom.

title: A must watch!
text: It's amazing to see the original cast of Jurassic Park and Jurassic World! It's like a reunion adventure movie! I was expecting a more in depth connection of those characters but seems it gave us a small treat or preview only, given the run time, they could combine more further. Nevertheless, it was a great movie to see especially to those Dino fans like me!

title: Not the usual standard from Jurassic
text: We enjoyed all the other Jurassic park and world movies, this one was not the same standard at all. So drawn out, two stories in one bringing back the original characters. Kids were bored, people were leaving the cinema, wouldn't recommend.

title: Predictable but still enjoyable.......mostly.
text: Ok plot wise this movie is bad and has a bit of a slow start however the action scenes are fun if not a bit Predicable, but being the 6th movie they are out of ideas so you can enjoy the movie if you focus on the Dinos which do not disappoint. In the end it could be worse.

title: Just didn't work
text: I mean, I get how cool "dinosaurs in a car chase in a city" sounded but it just didn't work. There were a lot of places where I could tell the director thought I would be overjoyed with nostalgia but nothing felt earned. I thought Chris Pratt barely got the raptors he trained for years to stop with his magic had motion but suddenly it works in every dinosaur on planet earth?The story was so weak I'm surprised anyone thought it was worth making. Oh wait, no I'm not, it seems like executives heard nostalgia and thought "nostalgia equals money and we love money." Well, I like good stories. Too bad you didn't try for that.

title: This is why you can't trust IMDB User reviews!
text: I read review after review of bad this is, how there are no dinosaurs, how the plot sucks...so I thought, OK, I wont see it...but my son wanted to go so I took him...Those reviews were SO OFF!! There are as many dinosaurs in this as there were in ANY of the JP/JW films. It's an absolutely blast! It's a really fun, exciting summer movie!! How heartfelt and amazing does the plot have to be???? It's a summer blockbuster and as a fan of the original JP films, I thought it was great!!! Don't blindly trust reviews - see for yourself.

title: It was good
text: I don't know why everybody hates it, I will agree the movie isn't as much about dinosaurs as it should be and it's more about that girl, but I still enjoyed it. It's nothing special but still a good entertaining movie.

title: The most exhausting movie ever
text: My review is 2,582 so I feel I can say anything I want because who on earth is going to see this one!!This was the most exhausting movie I've watched in recent memory.So many chases - all with animals, of course. Dinos. The first hour had so many non-stop chases, that it was actually exhausting to watch. I'd have to stop and go do something. A little bit of this, a little bit of that. Then back to the chase. If it had a motorcycle in it, it was Chris Pratt.There was one scene that was very much like the bar scene in Star Wars. So all the big movies now are "borrowing" from Star Wars. If Tom Cruise in Top Gun 2 could do it, then so could they. It'll be interesting to see how many more movies copy Star Wars.That said, one can only hope that if enough of us point out that we actually see their plagiarisms and call them on it, maybe we can get some original movies out of Hollywood. What a concept!!

title: Not what I expected
text: Jurassic Park is a franchise that has been milked to death, that can't be denied. Universal is claiming that Jurassic World: Dominion will be the last of the franchise, and that's probably for the best. They took the extra measure, as most franchises have done this day, of bringing back the original cast - Sam Neill, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum - for this last movie. Well, they credit at least for treating them well, unlike a certain other sci-fi franchise. This aside, Dominion is a thoroughly mediocre blockbuster that contains virtually nothing you've never seen before. Oddly enough, it really wasn't what I expected it to be, for better or for worse.Dominion is essentially two movies in one, with a common link. There's the OG cast going undercover at the BioSyn lab, and there's Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard trying to save Maisie from the corporation. The story with the originals isn't too special, but it was nice to see them, and they still acted like themselves. The plot with the new characters was something completely different. For a while, the movie essentially becomes Taken with dinosaurs. On one hand, it is a fun action scene. On the other hand, this is so far removed from the previous films that it's glaring. When they come together at the end and escape from dinos the old-fashioned way, it's entertaining.One thing this movie does really wrong is that it fails to deliver on the premise set up by Fallen Kingdom's ending. The ending of Fallen Kingdom has it that dinosaurs roam the entire world, not just Isla Nublar. Aside from the beginning and end of Dominion, you'd never know. The writing is bad. The characters don't feel like people, they feel more like tools to get the story going. On the other hand, there are some good things. The visual effects are noticeably improved from the first film, and Michael Giacchino delivered another solid score. Wu got a nice redemption arc. Dominion does have some interesting attributes, but it doesn't necessarily make it a good film. If this really is the end for this franchise, then it's been quite a run. Nothing comes close to the original in the end.

title: Jurassic Trash
text: Two and a half hours too long. Worst ending to one of my favorite franchises. Do not waste your time or money. Zero redeeming qualities. Complete garbage.

title: A great fun and entry to the jurassic saga
text: I have been a fan of this series since the first trailer for the original jurassic park came out. So every sequel I have expected certain things or the story to explain more in the past park and characters. This film delivered on some of them but opened more questions. As an adult I wished the film was longer and certain things could be explained more but it felt like the studio made the director cut alot out for timing purposes to get more showing in the theatre. However this is still a good movie and I am lucky to have been a child when the first one game out and now being a father watched this with my two sons. They loved this movie saying it was the best. They loved the Dino action, they loved all the character returning and they wanted more and hoping for more jurassic films. This is a Dino movie and children love them. Ignore what the critics are saying and if you've got kids, go and see this movie. It's enjoyable and worth a watch.

title: I was embarrassed of how bad and boring it is
text: The plot was a mix between Mission Imposible/Stranger Things ( two different teams teaming up at the end)/ and some Jurassic park at the end. So it was the multiverse of no plot, so badly written that I wonder if I could do better with the same budget.It's sad, just sad and boring.

title: Full of nostalgia and fun
text: If you love Jurassic park, and know everything about it and will notice all the Easter eggs, from certain parts in the script, even to camera angles, you'll like, not love, but like this film. You can tell they tried really hard to make reference to the original movie here, which I appreciated and I enjoyed picking out Easter egg after Easter egg. Are there certain parts that don't make sense, yes, but it's Jurassic World, does any of it really make sense? Who cares, just bury the logic and enjoy the ride and have fun with it.With some great callbacks and final resolutions for some story arcs, it's worth a watch for any Jurassic fan!

title: The end of nostalgia. Not the best nor worst.
text: Lets face it, it could be better. Not the best Jurassic movie, but yet I liked it. I'm a big fan of Jurassic park and I was really happy when they announced the Jurassic world. My childhood came to life.For this movie, I knew it wasn't going to surprise me, but I wanted the end, I wanted to say goodbye to my beloved dinos. And even it wasn't the best, I was pretty satisfied. I think we got a lot of closures. Maisie's origin, much more dinos than ever, old actors back together and their own "moment" :D and I was really glad for Henry, he always wanted to do something incredible and most of time it didn't work, but this time he gets his redemption. Overall it's not the best but it did make my heart flutter one last time. Still loves the franchise and I hope for those who loved the original trilogy will find the same satisfactory like I did...Life always finds a way.... this time we were given coexisting world, when dinos live with us. I don't know about you guys but I was more than okay with the ending like this. :)

title: Good, but manage your expectations
text: Jurrassic Park was a Pop Culture masterpiece. Sequels will not recapture that initial magic. However I found Jurassic World Dominion fun and satisfying for the most part. It was great to see the union and reunion of past and present characters. There were nice character arcs and cool dinosaurs and action scenes. That's all I needed. I'm not sure why the critics raged it so poorly. Most average viewers enjoyed it. Just enjoy it for what it is.

title: This movie is terrible. Don't waste your time!
text: The first Jurassic Park was a classic, this one is not even close.The scriptwriting and directing were atrocious - how could they release such an unfinished product? It's painful to watch now that I've seen it all in person because there are some truly cringe worthy moments where you can't help but say "wow...they really missed the mark".Can't believe I wasted three hours of my life watching this garbage. The acting was terrible, the plot was nonsensical, and the special effects were laughably bad.2022 is shaping up to be a pretty terrible year for movies. This has got to be the worst one yet!

title: It was good. Watch the movie with a fresh outlook.
text: Do not reminisce over the old jurassic park movies. Watch it with a fresh perspective and it will be very entertaining. Old and new characters and scenes are combined in this movie to make the franchise go out with a bang!Ignore the other reviews. It was a good movie.

title: I enjoyed it, great in 3D 4DX!
text: I heard mixed opinions before going, but having seen the franchise from the beginning in 1993...Was only right to go see!Not sure about the reviews of 1s & 2s but it held my attention with plenty of action and good set pieces.. Dinosaurs looked great and some great jumpy bits!** No spoilers - But... Ending could of been better, but overall, decent watch!

title: Entertaining
text: This movie is entertaining. For me that was good.I've watched all the other Jurassic movies but I'm not a huge fan to where I'll nitpick every detail. I'm not expecting to see some thought provoking, mind blowing movie with this one. I was entertained and would recommend to anyone else wanting to watch the movie.

title: Avoid Like the Plague
text: Life once found a way. Now, I hope it loses itself.Jurassic World Dominion has its positives, namely the fantastic Legacy character's wonderful return and, well, that's it. I enjoyed their presence, especially Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum - the latter who had the best lines, as always. The rest...yeah, I sincerely hope this is the last Jurassic Anything.All throughout this movie, the word "Dumb" just kept popping up in my head. Dumb script. Dumb dialogue. Dumb luck with all the hilariously impossible coincidences. Too many Dumb references to this series and other Steven Spielberg classics. And the two Dumbest characters in the franchise are back: Clone Girl Maisie who hates all mankind for her decision in the last entry and that screaming boy, Franklin, though, THANK GOD, he doesn't scream in this one like all the scenes he ruined in the last one.With a huge missed opportunity to expand on the actual title of Jurassic World, this hopefully last chapter just has society dealing with dinos killing people and the economy while debating if they should be extinguished. But, never mind that, this series has always been around greed and the ineptest baddie of the franchise with the most hilariously bad security detail is up to no good and only our 1,500 heroes in this movie can stop him!While the second half is monstrously better than the first half, I still couldn't wait for this movie to be over. Sure, it's better than the two worst sequels: III and Fallen Kingdom, but not by much. Like the Terminator, this franchise should've stopped at #2 in The Lost World.The movie's absolutely boring, even with multiple action scenes and there are literally no stakes. In fact, I was always hoping throughout the first two acts, they'd have the balls to kill off any of the characters. As much as I would love to see the Legacy characters make it - forgetting about the new Jurassic World characters, never liked them much - at least the movie would've taken chances.I'm done with this series. Like Transformers 4 and Pirates of the Caribbean 4, even if they make another one (like they did with those franchises,) I won't be watching another one. This was just crap.***Final Thoughts: Easy listing of the Series. Hint: Only watch the 1st three listed below.1. Jurassic Park2. The Lost World: Jurassic Park3. Jurassic World97. Jurassic World Dominion98. Jurassic Park III99. Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom.

title: A big wasted opportunity.
text: A not very funny and too long film, the script does not shine and the characters neither. A big wasted opportunity, a mediocre short film. Jurrrasic World disappointment.

title: Dinosaurs popping up at every possible location...
text: Essentially "Jurassic World Dominion" is just a rather weak storyline based on nostalgia and following the same formula throughout the course of the entire movie.But I am getting ahead of myself here. Sure, I was thrilled to sit down and watch the 2022 movie "Jurassic World Dominion", as a conclusion to the movies. And I will say that the movie definitely was off with a bang.The storyline in "Jurassic World Dominion", as written by Emily Carmichael, Colin Trevorrow and Derek Connolly was a bit weak. And by that I mean it wasn't a rather wholesome or particularly profound and deep storyline here. It was essentially just taking the protagonists of the movie, which now included members of the original "Jurassic Park" trilogy, members of the "Jurassic World" trilogy and some new ones, and having them move from A to B while intercepted by a dangerous dinosaur, then move from B to C while intercepted by a dangerous dinosaur, and moving from C to D while intercepted by, and you guessed it, a dangerous dinosaur but also by oversized mutated locusts this time.The writers cater a lot to viewers of the original trilogy with lots of props and events that you can recognize if you have watched and enjoyed the first trilogy. And sure, it does work, but it just becomes a little bit tacky as the movie progresses. But at the same time it was also somewhat enjoyable to watch things again on the screen that was seen or done in other movies in the franchise, sort of the circling being completed in a way.Visually then "Jurassic World Dominion" was phenomenal. The special effects and CGI team really are working magic to brink the dinosaurs and the world to life. I enjoyed this CGI extravagance, and it is actually a major part of the movie. If a movie like "Jurassic World Dominion" had dubious CGI, it just wouldn't work. But luckily the CGI here is amazing to look at; pure eye-candy.The movie does have a good cast ensemble. It is a cast ensemble that unites the members of the original trilogy with those of the new trilogy; so you have Laura Dern, Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum teaming up with Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard and Isabella Sermon. And the movie also have a wonderful appearance by BD Wong, and also by DeWanda Wise. I am not sure about whether or not I really liked Campbell Scott's part in the movie, sure I liked his performance, but the character was just too much something resembling Steve Jobs."Jurassic World Dominion" is a movie that is worth watching if you have enjoyed the five previous movies, of course it is. And it is entertaining enough for what it turns out to be. Sure, I wasn't expecting director Colin Trevorrow to re-invent the wheel here with this 2022 action adventure. If for nothing else, then watch "Jurassic World Dominion" for the special effects and CGI.The whole concept of humans and the wildlife of today's world coexisting with dinosaurs was just a bit far fetched for my liking. But hey, it looked good - and sappy - on the screen.My rating of "Jurassic World Dominion" lands on a solid six out of ten stars. It is definitely well worth the time.

title: Not gonna watch any more movies by Colin Trevorrow anymore
text: This is just bad enough to make me write this review.So bad that made me doubt if the first ever Jurassic Park was even overrated. You had all the topics, actors and nostalgia and you still screw this up this bad. I am sorry but Colin Trevorrow really failed not just this movie but the entire franchise. Money back requested.

title: It's a dinosaur movie !!
text: I question those trying to find the meaning of life and Academy Award performances from a dinosaur movie. I found the movie quite entertaining and true to the original Jurassic Park concept. The movie lines up with the old Saturday afternoon thrillers, monster movies and science fiction epics. The movie is fun. That is all one really needs to know.

title: Fun but long
text: Fun movie dinos eating people little story in there action sequence were great but story felt plausible and rushed. Great to see the old school introduce to new school and a few surprises thrown in not what I thought it was gonna be but not as bad as lost world just get some popcorn shut off ur mind and have fun.

title: Soooo Bad
text: I have no idea where to start. Bad script, bad acting, bad direction, BAD special effects (original was better). It was like watching an episode of Scooby Doo where they battle dinosaurs...but not 2 hours long. Just...don't bother.

title: The biggest disappointment of 2022!
text: Wow, foiled again, a movie from my youth gets a long awaited follow up, it has a great cast, with some familiar faces, a big budget, so there's action galore, and some wonderful music, but a plot..... a plot that could have been written by a random stranger walking past the studio.How on Earth is it possible for such a film to feel so vacuous, so empty, this film made me feel nothing, other than boredom. 40 that could have been used on so many other things.It's not ok these days to simply try and dazzle us with some awesome visuals, there needs to be some sort of plot, but there just isn't one, in simplistic terms it asks if man can live with dinosaurs, but of course you know what's going to happen. Some of the visuals are great, epic, some scenes though....did they run out of time?Chris Pratt, didn't do it for me, the old cast tried, but it felt hollow.Like the dinosaurs themselves, this franchise should have been left in the past. 3/10.

title: Too long of a dino drama.
text: This was just too overstuffed, underwhelming and exhausting to have to sit through a 147 min runtime story that could've easily been told in 90 minutes. It was too much filler and not enough substance in between the UFC dino bouts, that it felt we were watching a five-hour movie marathon. Even the performances and actors' expressions when they were face to face with the dinos felt more like a Disney Jurassic Park themed ride promo commercial.

title: Boring.
text: Jurassic World Dominion is a film that never takes off, filled with inconclusive subplots, ugly dialogue, uninteresting characters, an unconvincing plot, and a really bad montage of the film.

title: Welcome to Jurassic World
text: I really liked this one. A nice hommage with it's own style. Old school summer blockbuster with an interesting story and great dinosaur effects (both practical and digital). Just sit back and enjoy the ride.

title: Watch it for dinosaurs
text: Though you thought the plot will revolve about the coexistence of Humans and Dinosaurs, they failed to do that.Still love the CGI of the Dinosaurs, so worth the watch.

title: Everything wrong with movies today in one sitting
text: What an abomination. Not a single scene that doesn't have a problem or contradiction with logical flow. Hurt to watch until giving up after 30 mins in.

title: It could be beter
text: The film is of course not innovative and is also a film where two worlds come together. And to finish it off well, it's not going well. The cast of the first three films and the last two. And then a story has to be made of it. And that's where it goes wrong. Just like the montages. The story is also not accurate in time. And the dolomites is a huge area. And yet the beasts can get inside in a short time. In short, the film has to rely on the dinosaurs, locations, humor, scary moments and good film images. The film survives that. Especially the scene with the water is beautifully filmed. But the bad guy isn't a bad guy and it won't work out. But it's like transformers. Dinosaurs save the movie. So it remains sufficient.

title: Entertaining, but not the epic ending that was promised....
text: The original Jurassic Park is a classic. Steven Spielberg created a sense of wonder with his great direction and some very good CGI and practical effects. It was very sispenful at times but mostly audiences lived the dinosaurs. The scene when we see the T-Rex is one of the great sequences in cinema. Since that first film in 1993 I have gone from not.liking the sequels to ultimately thinking that the franchise never could recreate what made the first film so special...None of the Jurassic Park or Jurassic World films are terrible but none of them hold a candle to the original film.When Jurassic World came out I liked it but it just seemed it wasn't that memorable. Fallen Kingdom came next and I just didn't like it.This new film is being sold as an epic conclusion and they brought back three of the main characters from the first film. So obviously they are selling nostalgia, which is fine and it's been done incessantly since The Force Awakens was so successful. If done right? It works. If not it seems like desperation. Here it is pretty flat. The inclusion of Dr. Grant, Dr. Sattler, and Ian Malcolm is to me anti-climactic. Sam Neil, Laura Deen and Jeff Gold Blum are ok as these characters and but it just seems they were brought in for nostalgia and it doesn't work as much as it should. Even though the first film is beloved I don't consider these characters as beloved so it's nice to see them but it's like seeing Harrison Ford as Han in Episode 7. It's of course a fusing of the new characters from the old franchise and the new ones. Chris Pratt is fine as Owen and Bryce Dallas Howard as Claire are is ok too but nothing new happens with these characters.The dinosaurs of course are the reason to see these films and some scenes are really well done but again the sense of wonder is gone. The story is just the standard science for profit yarn mixed in with the kidnapping of the cloned girl from Fallen Kingdom. As with so many 3rd parts of a trilogy it is very overstuffed and feels unfocused fur the first half of the running time but once it gets going it does get fun. But like so many blockbusters these days you pretty much forget it by the time you leave the theater.Just average....Grade: C.

title: Boring, lacklustre and nothing novel
text: Jurassic Park is a movie that I rewatch again and again and the believability factor reigns supreme. Unfortunately with this, I switched off from the very beginning-Pros- Jeff Goldbloom, Sam Neill, somewhat nostalgic.Cons- So many continuity errors, entomological inaccuracies, scientific inaccuracies, no flow (chaotic story telling- such a tendency nowadays to overstimulate the audience rather than captivate them, poor acting)

title: Good dinosaur scenes, but allot of 'what?' moments
text: The only thing i really liked about the movie was the ending which had some cool scenes. The movie felt empty, generic and unsurprising. As seen in teasers the cast of the Jurassic Park movies were introduces without a wow element so to speak, the movie felt rushed even when it has quite a runtime and nothing really made sense as someone else has also reviewed.Scenes did not make sense, the hand thing from Owen was weird and overused as if that does anything with a predator dinosaur... The threat from them was also non existent. I wanted to love this movie but simply could not. The 'getting the gang back together' trope could have worked allot better had they taken more time in making the plot more clear.I would wait to see it until it shows on a streaming service so you don't waste your money on a film ticket.

title: Great ode to the original
text: As a fan, it's everything you would want. I'm not going to do any spoilers but obviously the original crew is in the movie and the most recent characters are also featured and it is a great and balanced combination of the current and previous generation.

title: It was a great way to end the series.
text: It was a great way to end the series. It was great seeing all the original characters back from the first movie in 1993. So long ago. I give them credit for showing how mankind lives with dinosaurs now instead of the usual dinosaurs escaping from captivity and they have to out run them. There were a few points in the movie where the dialogue seemed choppy however there was plenty of action and plenty of dinosaurs and I thought the actors were terrific. I saw Top Gun Maverick a few weeks ago which is a repeat from an older movie and I thought they did a better job on that one however Jurassic World is still very good!

title: Exploiting my nostalgia
text: This movie's plot makes zero sense; people go back and forth to far off locations in no time and also dinosaurs inconceivably show up in logistically illogical places. They dumbed down the OG cast and gave them barely anything to do. The whole movie is just a mix of predictable jump scares mixed with Fast and the Furious like action scenes that does nothing to the plot.

title: Fun pop corn flick with lots of dinosaurs
text: I went into this movie to be entertained, and that's exactly what it did. It reminded me at times more of Indiana Jones than JP, but whatever. It has a ton of dinosaurs, descent action sequences and goofy call backs that I found a bit dumb but entertaining. In all, it's not mind blowing but it is a fun summer flick.

title: Terrible. Absolutely terrible.
text: What an insult to Michael Crichton's original work. It's sad that this is how the franchise is put out to pasture, but thankfully it's over.It. Is. Done.

title: Not the best out of the series, still fun!
text: I love the Jurassic Parc franchise, but there has never been much of a plot, except people screaming and running away from those CGI animals.The last installment is the same formula. They tried to put some disturbing plot into play, but it hadn't much of a use. For me it's all about the suspense/action parts, and some of the scenes were all bit the same thing I have seen before. I think the best action sequence was the scene in Malta. Well edited and amazing camera work. I loved DeWanda Wise, she gave a lot of flair to her performance. Absolutely loved to see the original 3 have a big part in the movie (Laura Dern cracks me up!). And Bryce Dallas Howard always puts on a great, scary performance. Plus points for the cast for sure.I absolutely enjoyed myself for 2h30, but it won't be my favourite one of the full installment. Still more than recommend to watch this at the cinema!

title: Visual Effects Barely Compensate for Terrible Plot
text: This movie was a little disappointing on that the plot was really bad. The visual effects, sound and score are great but they barely compensate for the dumb story. The previous one was better imo.

title: Returning to 'Jurassic World'
text: The original 'Jurassic Park' still holds up as a genre landmark (the quintessential dinosaur adventure) and is still a great film in its own way. It has been years since seeing the two 'Jurassic Park' sequels, but do remember not caring for them all that much at all (especially the third film). The first 'Jurassic World' was a lot of fun, though with flaws, and actually liked 'Fallen Kingdom' more than most while acknowledging that it had a lot of issues and that it wasn't great.'Jurassic World: Dominion' did sound interesting and was over the moon to see the original cast reuniting. Despite all of that, 'Jurassic World: Dominion' turned out to be a big disappointment and was something of an uncomfortable experience seeing it in the cinema. To me, it wasn't terrible and not as bad as has been said by some with some good things. But there are also a lot of faults that cannot be overlooked, even when taking the film for what it is and what it was aiming for.Beginning with the good, the scenery is absolutely beautiful and shot with a lot of slick style and atmosphere. There are some good action sequences here and some inventive stunt work, the whole Malta sequence is exhilarating and when the film finally shows some degree of energy. Also standing out in a good way is Claire's very tense horror film-like encounter with the dinosaur. The dinosaurs look absolutely great and show a lot of personality, the predatory ones being very creepy.Some of the performances are good, a wonderfully sarcastic Jeff Goldblum and DeWanda Wise stealing all their scenes. Also really enjoyed the chemistry between quietly charismatic Sam Neill and perky Laura Dern, that evoked a lot of nostalgia. The music score is suitably rousing.However, a lot is wrong here. The script is far too exposition heavy and tends to over-explain, shining only with Goldblum's sarcastic quips. Plus everything with ByoSen is incredibly heavy handed and says nothing illuminating or insightful about corruption. The film is much too long, half an hour could easily have been trimmed which would have been achieved if the story got going sooner and if the climax was shorter. It also drags quite badly, especially the very slight and dully paced first act and the climax does lack tension and felt dragged out, was actually feeling the minutes rather than being enthralled. The whole ByoSen subplot feels like a different film and a marginally more interesting but still heavy handed and convoluted one at that, a lot of the second half does not make sense and left more questions than answers. Wu's part could have been left out completely.Did feel overall that 'Jurassic World: Dominion' could have done with a lot more tension and suspense and quite frankly the later action sequences did leave me feel exhausted and felt too much visually and audibly. There is no heart, charm or soul here, neither are there any brains, which play completely second fiddle to the big and loud approach taken through. The other performances do not convince, Bryce Dallas Howard does her best but has too little to do while Chris Pratt's frequently out stretched do all the emoting. Isabella Ferman came over as annoying and BD Wong is too much in Dr George Huang mode which doesn't gel with the rest of the film. Worst of all is an incredibly bland and a long way from menacing Campbell Scott as the very underwritten and afterthought-like villain.In conclusion, could have been so much better. 5/10.

title: Jurassic World: Dominion
text: 7/10 - maybe I'm just a sucker for a legacy cast return a la Scream and Spider-Man: No Way Home, but if you can get past the rambling and frankly unnecessary first hour, some bad acting from the majority of the cast (Dern, Wise, Athie, and Howard are the major exceptions), and some not good and maybe even bad cinematography, you will find a lot to enjoy in this sixth installment and end of a Jurassic era even with its flaws.

title: Lazy writing
text: Result of Poor writing . Only thing that satisfied me was action sequence before the interval , it really gave a seat edge experience , other than that whole movie was underwhelming . Script was too weak and lame . Except few places , film majorly missed the engaging factor . First half was slow and second half was predictable and boring . 2hrs 30mins was too long , literally tested my patience . Cast done their job . Technically visuals were good . Editing was inferior . Overall , unexpectedly a disastrous end to Jurassic saga . Watch at your own risk .

title: I don't know what everyone is mad about.
text: We watched it and enjoyed it. It is a sixth installment. Those are usually terrible and enjoyed mostly by people who enjoy repetitiveness. We didn't get that vibe here. It felt like closing the circle with the iconic first movie. Perhaps people keep expecting another experience like in 1993, but that's impossible because that was the only time we were able to be vowed by a very first seemingly realistic look at dinosaurs. It was mind blowing. But that can never be recreated.Of course, this installment has no unexpected plot. If it did, THAT would actually kill the vibe. This movie is based on nostalgia, on the joy of getting the old trio of Laura Dern, Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum back together and them meeting the Jurassic World leads.We were very pleasantly surprised and liked 6 better than 4 and 5. Or even 2 and 3. They did fine with this!

title: Worst Jurassic movie by far
text: Despite having the most potential and the original trilogy cast finally returning, Jurassic World: Dominion manages to squander all of that potential in an overly long, pointless mess with no stakes, cheap nostalgia and a level of stupid that's a new low even for this trilogy.It's constantly swapping ideas and genres in all the worst ways, barely feeling like an actual Jurassic movie. The dinosaurs are barely in it and have little to no effect on the narrative, instead simply used for a few entertaining set pieces and then quickly forgotten.Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard are somehow given less depth the third time round, making their characters even more forgettable and bland. However, the original cast are obviously great and elevate the extremely weak material given to them.The music by Michael Giacchino is a huge letdown. It does nothing new and is simply content in repeating all the familiar tunes from previous ones but they're not even integrated well, almost always feeling random and out of place.However, the film looks nice overall with visuals that are a league above the average blockbuster. There is a lot of satisfying practicality when it comes to the dinosaurs which is really nice to see, even if some look cheap.

title: The one star is for the dinosaurs...
text: This was terrible in every way. Bad acting, terrible script, bad CGI and stupid decisions (on and off the screen) cannot rely on nostalgia for a good film.1. Ellie is not as stupid as the film makes her out to be, as one of the characters signposts the fact that he is a double agent and she apparently doesn't pick up on it.2. Everyone seems to be phoning in their parts. They know the film will make money, so in their minds why bother I guess? The absolute worst culprit Campbell Scott who plays Dogson- I have no words. He's terrible and I can't tell if it's due to the script or he wasn't right for this part. It might be both. The original cast are awful- they don't seem enthusiastic to be there and I don't blame them.3. The plot makes no sense. After lengthy exposition opening the film we dive headfirst into one bad and nonsensical decision after another. For example, despite knowing that everyone is looking for her Maisie goes into town, despite being told not to, sees a dinosaur at a construction site then comes back. What was the point of this?! And this is just in the first 10 minutes- there are plenty more. Also, Owen is catching Parasaurolophus with a lasso on a horse, despite the fact that if the dinosaur spooks for any reason it will drag both him and the horse along for the ride? He was dragged from the horse already- surely he's learned his lesson?4. The callbacks to the original film take you out of the story. Instead of being subtle they practically scream "notice me!"5. The CGI is bad and doesn't blend well with the puppets they clearly used in some scenes. I applaud the fact that they are going back to puppetry, but it needs to be seamless with the CGI.6. The script. Wow. Some of the lines are so cringeworthy I can't believe they made it into a Hollywood blockbuster. Just... wow.Do yourself a favour and watch the original Jurassic Park- pretend this one and Fallen Kingdom don't exist.

title: Why?
text: I don't understand this, don't they watch their own movie before release? The script is bad, director was worst, editing tried to save some of it, but no... I will not watch this ever again, I don't recommend it! Don't waste your time or money, go watch the first jurassic park again. What a waste.. Fx are great, but with that kind of money, it has to be... 2 nice moments can't save the film. Why would you do this?

title: Don't listen to the haters
text: Yes, the bad guys are predictable. So are the good guys. Some characters are redeemed. This brings back memories and old faces, it saves the day, and just makes for a fun watch.

title: Jurassic World Dominion is sadly the worst in the franchise
text: The basic premise that dinosaurs are everywhere on the Earth opened up an entire world of possibilities for the script writers and unfortunately they fell back into some very basic Hollywood themes that are no longer interesting and in fact are more often than not insulting to the audience.The legacy characters were so good in comparison that it should have been obvious to everyone the final movie would have been a lot better with just them with a cameo by Chris Pratt.To try and explain the plot would take six different reviews because there were basically six plots that are very loosely connected and mostly don't resolve. I could go into them and discuss them but that would mean I was putting more effort in than the screenwriters did.Since it's Hollywood in the 2020s, you know the good guys and bad guys based on facial hair and skin tone. As Quentin Tarantino has commented many times, we have regressed to 1950s style serialized television.Run from this one like you are being chased by a velociraptor.

title: Not as bad as the critics make out
text: The concept and premis for the could have been improved but did a good job of uniting lead characters from the early and later franchised movies.The Kayla Watts character was poorly represented by the actor Dewanda Wise, not a reflection on her acting ability but the casting.The many references to earlier movies and the evolution of Henry Wu was enjoyable.Not perfect but a satisfactory end to the franchise.If I had to rate the franchise in order of personal appreciation I would place it at no. 4.

title: Quite a fun. Dont understand the hate over this movie.
text:
I almost skipped this movie after going through the comments in IMDB section.But when I watched it was completely entertaining. Afterall fun and entertainment is the reason to go to movies.Pros
Cons
I also dont understand why in the last few movies Trex is being projected as kind of a hero and is made to kill the main villain.

title: They slaught the franchise to the very end!
text: The only momment satisfied me was that seeing Dr. Grant and Dr. Ellie together again, everything else just was unbearable: the lazy scripting, poorly written conversation, over-the-place film flow, lame music, super-hero character, cliche action, random & lack of coherent cut scences... like you put all materials of JP + JW, mix them all together and hope new movie finds a way?! No, just same thing but different labelling number! What is the good VFX for if the story does not tell the story????Could not belive they can do this to their fans. Contradicting to the promise of the director, this final chapter delivers nothing but disappointment and anger! I respect the crew, cast and all the efforts they put into making this but to me, the movie is a flop.Would not recommend to watch in theater. Big no no!

title: Don't over think it. A fun old school romp mainly for kids
text: Do not trust the bad reviews. Dominion is back to it's roots in a fun, cheesy romp with scary dinos.People are honestly overanalyzing this, it's not meant to be a masterpiece, it never was. Most people are rating it as overthinking adults and forgetting they watched it as kids with open imagination.It's incredibly cheesy and often over acted, but like most of the greats it's what also makes it fun..the CGI is great the "dinos per minute" was perfect for the kids. My kids never got bored watching adults talk on screen about a story they likely didn't really care about and over explaining the science. The pacing was great to keep them entertained from scene to scene.I absolutely loved the nostalgia and think it did a great job honouring the original whilst bringing the story to a close.But advised not to watch with boring adult head on. Just go in, have fun and enjoy the dinosaurs and cheese.

title: Thank God Crichton is not with us anymore
text: This movie is an outrage to the original work.I mean, everything that is beautiful and astonishing in the Jurassic Park concept is completely absent in this film.They actually shot a movie that looks like it came out of the monsterverse (but of poor quality), taking out the dinosaurs and adding random stuff. If already in the first two of the World saga, the creatures have completely stopped behaving like animals but have been humanized to excess (do you remember the smile of the indoraptor? I remember it while I sleep), here they are a simple outline to totally unrelated events. The cast is simply out of control. The only positive aspect that comes to mind about this so-called movie is that Crichton is no longer with us and he would not be able to witness this abomination. Trevorrow had the incredible merit of making me reevaluate Star Wars episode IX.

title: Better than they say
text: Enjoy the ride...very good addition to the franchise...being panned by people who don't get it...highly recommend with a big box of popcorn. The back story has pathos if slightly wacky but the dinosaurs are everywhere and that's what it's all about surely.

title: Great Jurassic Fun!
text: Absolutely loved this movie! Great fun to see with your kids and felt so good to see the original cast again. Lots of tongue-in-cheek references for those of us who know the first ones by heart. Now It's not perfect, but then it isn't meant to be! Watch it for the fun, the action, the magnificent dinosaurs and brilliant chemistry between the cast members. Don't forget the popcorn.

title: Overly Long and Repetitive
text: The reviews have not been kind to this movie. It is better than expected and overly long and repetitive. The plot is good guys get in bad situation with dinosaurs, then bad guys get in same situation and get their just rewards. Repeat. Repeat. Repeat.This movie is simply too long. It throws in characters from the first three Jurrassic Park films (from the 1990's), puts them in dangerous situations which they luckily, sometimes cleverly, escape. Luck never runs out for our heroes but the bad guys eventually shoot craps.It would be much better if twenty to thirty minutes were cut. Perhaps if one of the protagonists actually didn't escape every time?

title: Tons of fan service, yet still disappointing
text:
IN A NUTSHELL:
I readily admit that I have been a huge fan of this dinosaur franchise since the very beginning. Not all of the movies in the series have been as good as others, but I've still enjoyed each one. From Jurassic World architect and director Colin Trevorrow, Dominion takes place four years after Isla Nublar has been destroyed. Dinosaurs now live-and hunt-alongside humans all over the world. This fragile balance will reshape the future and determine, once and for all, whether human beings are to remain the apex predators on a planet they now share with history's most fearsome creatures.Movie Review Mom GRADE: BTHINGS I LIKED:
I absolutely loved, loved, seeing the original cast members blend with the newer ones from the final trilogy. So fun! When Chris Pratt found out the old cast was returning, he excitedly claimed, "Just in case you hadn't seen the news. It's finally happening. Get ready for what is absolutely, without a doubt going to be the biggest, baddest and best, movie of the franchise." He also described this final episode like the Marvel "Endgame" of the Jurassic franchise.The cast includes Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Lauren Dern, Jeff Goldblum, Sam Neill, BD Wong, Campbell Scott, Mamoudou Athie, Omar Sy, among others.There are plenty of action sequences. Chris Pratt dropped weight and gained muscles to be in sharp form and is still absolutely believable as the action hero in the movie.I loved that there was a plausible reason for bringing back a biologist and dinosaur expert in this movie.We're also introduced to some new characters.As filmmaking technology improves, the CGI of these movies gets more and more incredible. Even still, this addition to the franchise has even more animatronics than the last 2.There are a lot of respectful nods to the first movie, which made me so happy. Easter eggs abound in visual and spoken forms.We get to see a new kind of dinosaur called a "Pyroraptor." Fun! It was a real dinosaur recently discovered, but its size was supposedly smaller than a turkey.We get to travel to destinations around the world.It cracked me up when Jeff Goldblum's shirt was open and he said, "Oh!" ha ha He had some of the best lines of the movie, as always. There are a few moments worthy of a chuckle.Every dinosaur we know and love from the previous movies gets a decent amount of screen time.THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE:
The last time we saw Ellie Sattler and Alan Grant, they were good friends, so I was surprised when they didn't even hug each other when they were first reunited in this movie.I was surprised by the high number of bad editing moments.I'm sure I'm not the only Jeff Goldblum fan who wanted a more epic moment when we first saw him on screen in this movie.There has been some criticism about the believability of the plot. Agreed.It has been stated that this will NOT be the last film in the Jurassic Park franchise. Did you want this to be? Are you ready for more?It's not really well explained how the land dinosaurs migrated to all of the continents around the world, just that they did.Some of the new characters just aren't very compelling. Some are even annoying.The plot and scenes are pretty chaotic and scattered.I admit that the tension seemed fairly low simply because our favorite characters never seem to die. I wasn't really worried about them and didn't feel as emotionally invested in them as I was in the very first movie. SPOILER: Who knew just holding your hand out in front of a dinosaur was all it took?Soooo many lines are repeated word for word from previous movies in the franchise. The first few times, it was charming, but then it kind of seemed manipulative and even lazy. A lot of the dialogue is clunky. Because of that, some of the acting suffers.Is it terrible and crazy to admit that I was a little bit bored at times?The villains are definitely underwhelming.TIPS FOR PARENTS:
People and animals in perilous situations
Some profanity
A girl flips the bird
Young children might be frightened by the scary dinosaurs.THEMES:
Technology
Nature
Balance
Friendship
Humanity vs. Animals YouTube channel.

title: Watch and be amazed... at how bad.
text: If you're truly bored and have 2h40m and want to poke fun, criticize, and be astonished how Hollywood can screw up a franchise, feel free. I would not pay money for it. I feel for those that did.I won't offer spoiler alerts. There's not much of a plot anyway. I will share, however, what I learned.If this evers come to life, we need to have and do some things. One, hold our hands up and palms out. Apparently this is effective and is understood by dinos. Two, have a taser and knife. These are apparently way more effective than guns. Dinos try to eat people in the movie, but they should not be harmed, right. Three, guns are bad, mm-kay? What a stupid, asinine place to put an agenda. It's a dino movie.Poorly done, Hollywood. I understand contractual obligations, but man, Pratt should apologize for this one, and the legacy stars deserve an apology.Burt Macklin would have done better especially without open hands, tasers, and knives.

title: Down blue, sit ...good blue.
text: That scene with Chris Pratt with his hand out and Blue with its baby. That's exactly what it looked like to me. Good blue, roll over... I'm being generous giving this movie three stars out of 10. What was that madness? What a ridiculous way to end the Jurassic Park legacy. Coexisting with a planet of dinosaurs?? I can't imagine anyone being in a theater subjected to that mess. Cocaine is alive and well amongst the writers.As I watched it all I could do was try to relate to it as a Hollywood cartoon or animated fantasy just to give myself a reason to keep watching it. The level of melodrama was astounding. At least in the original Jurassic Park there was an air of possibility. Michael Crichton's story. True wonderment.

title: Maybe not the best JP ever, but still very entertaining
text: So shoot me, but I liked it! It's apparently going against the general grain, seeing the many negative reviews here on IMDb, but to me it had everything to make watching this movie a rewarding and entertaining experience: apart from a few more talkative sequences the pace is mostly high, with many very exciting pursuits, the CGI of the dinosaurs is great (so I don't agree with the negative reports on that either), and the acting of all concerned is as adequate as could be expected.That doesn't mean that I didn't have some reservations too. Especially in the first half hour the number of different characters is too high, with a hard-to-follow and a bit chaotic story as a consequence. The music is at times so roaringly epic that it at some point became almost preposterous. I guess the oldies (Laura Dern, Sam Neill, Jeff Goldblum) had a ball being together again, but it felt a bit too easy, as if the makers primarily brought them in as a guarantee to skyrocket the box office earnings. Of those three, the only one that did add something substantial to the movie was Goldblum, with his priceless ironic ad-libs. But on the other hand Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard both were great again, and I absolutely loved DeWanda Wise!In short, maybe not the best movie ever, but still a nice and entertaining watch!

title: What a waste of over 2 hours!!
text: That was terrible!!Terrible story, terrible CGI, cheesy as hell and a total betrayal to the first 2 Jurassic World films and the amazing original Jurassic Park!!Whoever gave this 10 stars needs to get their eyes checked lol!! Please don't waste your time and money on this, if you're a Jurassic Park/World fan STAY AWAY!!!

title: A must-see for true Jurassic Park fans!
text: Incredible movie. It has emotion, nostalgia, humour, and is just a great film overall! The addition of a new cast of dinosaurs combined with a much different storyline keeps things fresh, but the inclusion of original cast members, throwback scenes, and nostalgic item inclusions gives that true Jurassic Park feeling.

title: What do you expect?
text: Its a generic hollywood blockbuster. Like the other 5 movies before. The story in all movies: people running away and hide from dinos. Thats all. Why do we watch this? We want to see many perfect created dinosaurs. You will get many this time! The story is stupid, of course. But its not an arthouse movie.

title: Non-stop clichs
text: How disappointing can a movie be, watch this and you will find out.Had great expectations for this, bringing some of the old characters back, but even that couldn't help this b grade (at best) movie.So many clichsand no real story.This really should now be the end of the Jurassic Park franchise.The first two with Chris pratt were enjoyable, but this is just absolute garbage. Nothing to do with pratt or any of the actors, it's the writers who should hang their heads in shame.

title: The best Jurassic park movie ever!!!
text: Jurassic world dominion is the best movie of the Jurassic park franchise and I hate the it has a bad rating, it doesn't deserve a bad rating. And if you haven't seen it go watch it now.

title: Same old Romp and Stomp, Run and Shout Pop Song.
text: How to make this movie.Step One. Take the Dinosaurs and add every surviving actor from the franchise.Step Two. Take all the previous franchise scripts and select pages at random to create the new script.Step Three. Add lots of screaming and running. Mix and pour.

title: Mold
text: Long, boring and predictable movie. Since Spielberg created Jurassic Park, no one has been able to go further. Same format, same stupid story, same gags in every movie. How boring!!! Who says that the dinosaurs every time they have to eat you, they have to mwttwrsi to scream like idiots ??? In the midst of an immense forest, how likely are you to encounter a tyrannosaurus? And to find 3 of them all together near the helicopter ??? In the obsession of surprising, in reality, you are bored. Everything already seen, reviewed and seen again !!! Do you want to surprise? Do something more realistic. These scripts smell of mold.

title: Messy story but cool dinosaurs and characters
text: Look I know the plot of this movie is all over the place but tbh. I really liked and enjoyed it. Jurassic Park was my childhood, I've watched it so many times and seeing the OG Cast finally back on the big screen made me soo happy. Also I'm a huge Dino-Nerd, so I'm maybe a little bit biased.I really liked that some lesser known or non mainstream "dinos" got the spotlight. The chemistry between the old and new cast worked great. There are many shots/scenes which are really cinematic and look absolutely gorgeous.Overall story/plot is okay but messy, great cast and chemistry, cool dinosaurs that usually don't get enough spotlight, some really cool looking scenes which I would love to have as a wallpaper and lots of fanservice and callbacks to the old movies.

title: Just indescribably horrible
text: I just can't believe how bad this movie is. One of the lamest, most pathetic, banal and uninteresting movies I've ever seen. It couldn't be farther from the original Jurassic Park, in any possible way. The acting is quite bad, everything is sooo predictable, dinosaurs have almost no relevance to the plot, but the worst thing is the amount of cheesy cheap good feelings the movie is packed with, those murdering monsters being treated like pets... What an incredible waste of money and time (both theirs and mine).

title: A perfect ending to a long running franchise
text: I can understand those who don't like the film as it's one for those who have been with Jurassic park from the start.I watched them all as they came out and went to cinema and for me this movie was great from a nostalgic point of view.It was fab to see the original cast and learn how they had evolved over the year and come full circle.There are multiple storylines running along side each other, the old versus the new, and yet these storylines are all running towards joining the old and the new together.I watched the extended version and feel like as a fan and viewer I've been given the perfect ending to a storyline I grew up with.

title: A decent ending for a 30 year long journey
text: We get a final gathering of all the familiar faces in this maybe final episode. It's a lightweight, feelgood movie that focuses on the core elements of what made Jurassic Park so great. Without annoying child characters.And the new reality, exploring the consequences of dinosaurs coexisting with humanity, offers something we haven't seen yet. It's not as thrilling and doesn't have these in-awe moments. But that's OK. It's still a great adventure in the Jurassic Park universe and a fine end for its legacy.The CGI was great most of the time.With its fine balance between nostalgia and innovation it's a recommend-watch for fans of the series.

title: Utter nonsense
text: Never underestimate Hollywood's ability to take something phenomenal and cherished and suck the life out of it for money. The dinosaurs felt more like window dressing than the focus.
