Disjointed, impossible to keep up with or care about the myriad of story lines. Actually walked out with 30 minutes left because the ending is just a conclusion to a ridiculous dumpster fire.

title: Wrap Up
text: I don't see why this movie gets so much hate. It is a bit of a rehash of old ideas, but it was always intended to wrap up the story. There were multiple story lines in different locations including the Mediterranean. The movie went in a positive direction, with a message about coexistence, which is a different take from the previous movies. The dinosaurs were stunning as always. The movie also had a lot of likable characters who made a lot of sacrifices to do what they think was right. I suppose people were expecting an apocalypse movie. Instead, it made me wonder if we should bring back extinct creatures and give them a chance in the wild in real life.

title: A wonderful self aware performance by Jeff Goldblum and a star making turn by DeWanda Wise are literally the only things holding this bloated mess of a Jurassic film up.
text: Tired, bloated and overlong supposedly final film in the Jurassic series (Yea right) finds the legacy characters from Jurassic Park crossing paths with the Jurassic World characters in a film that makes its first major mistake by not only not paring them up sooner (They only meet in the last twenty minutes of the film) but have them run separate and equally dumb storylines that really has nothing to do with dinosaurs or what this film was advertised to do. (Planet of the dinosaurs anyone?) . Of the pair of storylines running in this movie, the mutant locus one, (while it has nothing to do with dinosaurs at all) is the better of the two and the reason why because despite it being still dumb and having nothing to with dinosaurs, it's actually more interesting and better acted. The Jurassic Park characters which includes a rejuvenated and game Sam Neill (who redeems his terrible performance from Jurassic Park 3 ) Laura Dern (Who was barley in Jurassic Park 3, thank god) and a top of his game Jeff Goldblum ( who was in this franchise's only fairly good and solid sequel "The Lost World" and mercifully only had few minutes of screen times in its second worst sequel "Fallen Kingdom") all try their best with the hooky yet brainless material they are working with and for the most part they succeed. Both Sam Neill and Laura Dern pick up seamlessly their natural chemistry from the original Jurassic Park and it's sweet and compelling while Jeff Goldblum naturally picks up Ian Malcolm's sense of self righteous bitting wit and disarming charm. While the script has some of the worst dialogue all three actors have had to work with, only Goldblum manages to turn the tables on the terrible screenplay he was had to work with some quick witted improvisation that gotten the biggest laughs in the entire movie which has him almost breaking what they call the 4th wall and making fun of most of things that are happening in this film, which is a god sent because Jeff is really telling the audience that he knows this movies sinks and he understands what the audience is going through. A brilliant master stroke that only a great actor like Goldblum can pull off undetected from the director and producers of a film they are working on that they think stinks.The second of the storylines while more action oriented, is not only more dimwitted but lacks focus and is barely even acted at all. It's a continuation of the plot threads that was left over from the last movie and it's tries to recon certain revelations but still ends up worthless and uninspired. Chris Pratt phones in his performance and you can sense he knows this film is not very good. Bryce Dallas Howard tried her best but her character still is as underdeveloped as ever and the only actor who comes out of this storyline with her head high is Dewanda Wise, manages to not only steal the spotlight from Pratt and Howard but her character manages to be a hell of a lot more interesting . Unfortunately, not even her great acting talent can overcome the terrible script that does no one any favors and rips off several action sequences from "The Borne Ultimatum" which involves a roof top and motorcycle chase in a foreign city. In this film, those rip off sequences added raptors and James Bond bad guys to chase our heroes in the city of "Malta" and even with those added elements, they lacked the kinetic energy and intensity that "Borne" movie had in spades.In conclusion, the movie while better than the brain dead "Fallen Kingdom", it's still a bloated mess. And despite the game efforts by the returning Jurassic Park cast (Especially a great self aware performance by Jeff Goldblum) and a scene stealing, star making turn by Dewanda Wise, it's probably time to end this franchise before they turn out a movie that is "Jurassic Park 3" bad.

title: Boring and Too Long
text: I WISH they would have kept the show focused on Chris Pratt instead of doing equal time to all these other characters. You can definitely tell Hollywood to cramming all these female actors down our throats. FINE! But THIS movie started Chris Pratt I'm expecting to see mostly Chris Pratt! Ugh! Show up an hr into the movie and you'll be fine. It was more of a mini series crammed into 2.5hrs, and it didn't work. Should have kept the focus on the main character and his relationship with Blue and her baby. If you have nothing else to watch and it's really hot where you live right now AND you need a good nap, go see it.

title: If you're a fan of the films you'll like it.
text: It's exactly what the movie should be. It calls back to the first three, it reminds you of the excitement of the first one, it brings everyone together and ties the story up. I really enjoyed it.

title: The power of the hand
text: Well the movie is pretty predictable no surprises. We now know however, holding out your right hand will prevent all dinosaurs large or small from eating you. It's the power of the hand!

title: Oh god... nooooo
text:
Well, the idiocy is off the scale with this one...
The entire budget was blown on the CGI.. no money left for anyone to provide any guidance on anything remotely scientific and intelligent...
Multiple efforts to ram "the message"... down your throat are included as is the forced diversity resulting in unbelievable characters...
Yes, it is as bad as you have heard.., sorry...
Idiotic characters. Idiotic story. Lack of anything remotely close to logic
Watch it without the dialogue..
it makes no difference.

title: Worth the Penny but not worth the Trequel
text:
Watched it last night at Cineworld on a 4DX 3D screen.(If anyone has watch it prefer 4D/3D at least)A true Jurassic Park and Jurassic World series fan BUT this time they have messed with the plot, tone, aura for what Jurassic movies are known for.Back in time, these movies were used to be Dinosaur centric, revolving around their habitat, that real feeling of
human's trapped with no way out. Legend 'Steven Spielberg' has executed it brilliantly and so did the characters.What I personally feel, Colin Trevorrow is losing the indigenous taste from the previous Jurassic Park/World movies (except Fallen Kingdom which was a disaster too).If something has to be appreciated about this movie then it has to be the reunion of the original trio (Alan Grant, Ellie)A true Jurassic Park and Jurassic World series fan BUT this time they have messed with the plot, tone, aura for what Jurassic movies are known for.Back in time, these movies were used to be Dinosaur centric, revolving around their habitat, that real feeling of
human's trapped with no way out. Legend 'Steven Spielberg' has executed it brilliantly and so did the characters.What I personally feel, Colin Trevorrow is losing the indigenous taste from the previous Jurassic Park/World movies (except Fallen Kingdom which was a disaster too).If something has to be appreciated about this movie then it has to be the reunion of the original trio (Alan Grant, Ellie)A true Jurassic Park and Jurassic World series fan BUT this time they have messed with the plot, tone, aura for what Jurassic movies are known for.Back in time, these movies were used to be Dinosaur centric, revolving around their habitat, that real feeling of
human's trapped with no way out. Legend 'Steven Spielberg' has executed it brilliantly and so did the characters.What I personally feel, Colin Trevorrow is losing the indigenous taste from the previous Jurassic Park/World movies (except Fallen Kingdom which was a disaster too).If something has to be appreciated about this movie then it has to be the reunion of the original trio (Alan Grant, Ellie Sattler, Ian Malcom).Again, no need to forcefully create those nostalgic moments from the previous parts unless they actually fit in there.It fails at switching between the scenes and connecting the dots.In a nutshell, we don't want to see any unnecessary new technology additions. Stick to the original flavour. Don't spoil the Franchise with any unrealistic experiments. Dinosaurs are scary even without any genome modification, that would make them sound more like a robot and less like a dinosaur.*FROM A DIE-HARD JURASSIC MOVIE SERIES FAN*

title: Not the best and not the worst Jurassic Park.. Worth seeing though!
text: Reel Tunez Movie Review (6/11/22): "Jurassic Park Dominion".Not the best J. P. Not the worst J. P. But it does bring both the initial three and most recent two Jurassic Parks together and wraps up the series.It's cool bringing the original cast back together, and bringing them into the new Jurassic Park world.At about 2 1/2 hours, it runs long and is full of actions, screams, and loudness. It's a fun popcorn movie.. and the effect look good (though not further improved from the last two). It's worth seeing on the big screen!It does seem like they really chopped it at the last minute, almost haphazardly as a blonde villain character was on the scene, made a big presence, than just seemed to vanish.I'd give it about a 6.0 out of 10. Certainly worth seeing, but also it probably won't be the best movie (or even top 5) you see this year.

title: What they think we want vs what we want...
text: Sorry Hollywood, there must have been some sort of misunderstanding here.You had the budget, you had the return of the legacy cast, you had the source material, two amazing novels and the original movies to draw inspiration from, yet you come up with this? I've played Jurassic Park video games that have a more competent, creative and entertaining story. Everyone involved with the writing of this story should be embarrassed with themselves. Pretty much every scene that occurred I was waiting for Vin Diesel to show up and say something about family.I think I speak for everyone when I say we don't want laser pen controlled Raptors chasing Chris Pratt around Malta on a motorbike. If there's anyone out there who disagrees, I hope you are happy.At this point I think this franchise needs to call it quits and that's coming from someone who has a special place in their heart for Jurassic Park and dinosaurs in general.Seriously, how did the dinosaurs look better in 1993 than they do now hahahaha.

title: Enjoyable Jurassic film. A bit repetitive but enjoyable
text: I felt Dominion was a bit of a Mish mash of Jurassic Park and Jurassic world. We had similarities to both trilogies but not too much that was new and that we had not seen before. Even the ending was similar to Jurassic World 1. I felt like the editing was a bit choppy and it all felt a bit rushed. I've heard a directors cut is coming out, so I do hope it will tidy up the film. It was fun and great to see a mix of the original and sequel casts coming together. I look forward to seeing it again when released on blu ray/iTunes. There were alot of special dinosaur scenes which I loved, but the fact that the films story stretched too so many areas. I think this spoilt the narrative a bit and brought you out of the journey from time to time. I can't wait for the release to own and look forward to the directors cut!

title: Colin Trevorrow should apologize for this scam.
text: So, this is what trevorrow had planned out for years? The film is so bad it should be called "Jurassic whack." They really went downhill the path to follow Fast & Furious!!. I mean seriously? How could you turn one of the most popular franchise into disaster?Everytime I think they can they can't do any worse, yet they find a way to prove me wrong. Speaking without spoilers, this film have got almost everything wrong. Starting from the storytelling to the execution, even the background musics are bad. The first half of the film felt like rushed. Even the old cast members could not make it any better. Grant, Sattler, Malcom everyone is here just for the sake of being in the movie and they do nothing but crack disney jokes. Sometime I got confused whether I am watching a Jurassic film or comedy film made by disney.Finally, if we talk about dinosaurs, they had cool designs no doubt yet were looking so fake just like in every Jurassic World film. They main antagonist Giganotosaurus had almost close to zero screentime whatsoever. What was the point of making him the so called " The largest carnivore world has ever seen," if you can't give him a proper role? He did not have any sort of impact on the story.I won't go for other parts as it will make it too long. Just gonna put it right there. One last thing, I wanna thank Trevorrow for ruining my favourite franchise. You have done enough damage to the series. Now, please take leave and never ever come back again.

title: Much better than expected!
text: Yes, movie started off slow, but overall a great ending to the Jurassic Park/World era.....I've watched this series since the beginning (when in high school), & is near & dear to my heart (especially the music). I do not agree with the low reviews by critics/movie watchers whatsoever! Our audience clapped at the end of the movie & we all left very pleased!

title: Poor
text: How on earth this damp effort is taking as much as 3x as much as Maverick is beyond me. I am speechless. Revisited way too often to make a credible impact. Overlong and time to call it quits.

title: It deserves to be seen without stereotyped prejudces
text: In my opinion, the mistake lies in having to compare the last film of the saga with the first and unattainable Jurassic Park, and compare Treworrow to Spielberg"Jurassic World Dominion" is not a great movie, nor something that will go down in history like Jurassic Park. It is not a particularly bold or in-depth film in the themes, although we were pleased to see several animatronics as well as the CGIIt remains a good adventure film, in line with the other Jurassic World, even if in my humble opinion, the chorality of the two parallel stories is successful and certainly the old "magical trio" brings something more to the film than the two previous filmsIt is not a hair-pulling film, but certainly a good film, with excellent rhythm, good narrative arc and nostalgic at the right point, without forcibly leveraging the past and giving everyone functional roles to the storyAlthough the main role is entrusted to the new characters, it would be wrong to say that the old ones have been reinserted just for "fanservice", their story is still dealt with in a worthy way and well interpretedBeyond some scientific forcings, however present throughout the franchise which, however, does not want to represent the pure dinosaurs but admittedly allows some legitimate licenses, the film is of a good standard, and indeed has the merit of including other different species of dinosaurs, with scientific accuracy, demonstrating how scientific knowledge has evolvedThe film turned out to be pleasant and I give it, on a scale of 1 out of 10, a good 7, like the first Jurassic World, to which a nice + must be added, thanks to the presence of the performer Jeff Goldblum, the exceptional Laura Dern and the stainless Sam NeillSo the film is more than good for me, I place it only behind the first two of Spielberg and a little above the first Jurassic WorldI do not agree with the reviews that even, at the moment, give it to the last place of the new trilogy (even if it is still early)Something revolutionary or equal to the first film could not be expectedSo it deserves to be seen without the sometimes stereotyped prejudices, of some criticism.

title: Good Entertainer. The franchise is losing steam though.
text: It seems like they're running out of ideas to make new movies in the franchise.The movie itself is a good entertainer with very well directed thrill sequences like the chases and human interactions with the mighty predators. In that sense, it a very good watch.What one may be disappointed with is the story line as there is hardly anything novel to offer. They tried to cash in the following of Sam Neill and Laura Dern but that doesn't help beyond a point.I would still recommend it to watch for the execution brilliance of whatever they had on their plate.

title: Dull and predictable. Kill that franchise please
text: Everything is said in the title. What a disappointment of a film. A mess from start to finish. It was good to see the return of Sam neill. Jeff goldblum and Laura Dern but it's not interesting at all. I though they could not do any worst than Jurassic World. But this is far worse.

title: Chris Pratt is golden
text:
Thank you Chris & keep up the good work. Entertaining and mostly clean! I appreciate it! Today's family wants to take all the kids to a movie together. We highly appreciate a film that doesn't make us squirm from inappropriate garbage. I'm thankful for Vid Angel because I use it to clean up what we watch at home. I decide to watch whatever the bleep I want it hear what I want instead of garbage. Parents is time to take out the garbage
I support clean family movies!Thank you Chris!

title: Everythingsourus
text: This was so fun to watch!, I really think this was a great ending for the famous Jurassic World movies... the plot was amazing, the new dinosaurs species made me have actual fear HAHA, but in general I'll give this a 7 out of 10.

title: Predictable and way too long
text: At 2 hours and 26 minutes, this marks the longest movie in the Jurassic series. May he Rest In Peace, but it's probably good that Michael Crichton wasn't alive to see this abomination of a film. The only reason I'm even giving an extra star is because the dinosaurs looked good and some of the cinematography was on point, but my god this was unbearable to watch.My biggest problem with this film is how predictable the story was and how shallow of a character its antagonist was. Nothing against Campbell Scott, I'm sure he's a swell guy, but watching him play this character was like watching a lifeless Dave Wallace from The Office. He had no depth, no angle, and every choice he made could be seen from 100 miles away.Another reason I couldn't stand this movie was how many times Chris Pratt got everyone out of trouble by putting his hand up to the dinosaurs. I can't tell you how badly I wanted him to try it just to have one of them take a couple fingers off. It might've added some excitement to the movie.I really wish I could keep going and tell you about how bad the whole thing was; but since I fell asleep for fifteen minutes of the movie, I guess it wouldn't be very honest of me to say I saw the entire thing. This is supposed to be the last movie of the series, so I was expecting some crazy things to be happening. I wanted to see dinosaurs fighting in the city, knocking into buildings, and stepping on cars. Instead, we were served a recycled plot with generic action and storytelling.Give me a job, Universal, and I'll write a better script with my eyes closed. Or go outside your doors and find the nearest crackhead because I'd guarantee you 100% they could write a better movie, too.

title: Awesome!!
text: Look this movie like every blockbuster has its flaws but it's expected with these films. I'm a Jurassic Park fan and you'll never beat the OG but this movie is very entertaining and fast paced, probably too fast paced for some and maybe that's one of its flaws or pros depending how you look at it. Hopefully the extended version when it releases helps with that.But overall this movie is awesome, even after seeing it twice

title: The worst jurassic movie so far
text:
I have nothing to say
I truly miss the jurassic PARK movies and idc what anyone says, they were the best.Now everything has to be involved with some sort of tech.. and the writing keeps getting worse
& CGI wont fix a bad movie.

title: Mission Impossible: Jurassic World
text: I went into this film with high expectations and they were barely met which is okay. This didn't feel like a Jurassic film. It felt like a Mission Impossible movie with dinosaurs. There's some call backs to Kenner artwork which felt like a nice touch. Jeff Goldblum in my opinion carried this film. His character felt the most important. You should never go into this film expecting an Oscar winning script. These films have never made sense so when you apply realism to this franchise resort it to the dinosaurs. I loved the animatronics which made it feel like the first film allot. Don't listen to critics and go see this movie. If you love dinosaurs and you turn your brain off you'll have a great time with friends.

title: Chris Pratt's magic hand
text: I love that screenwriters and film studios alike have such a lack of creativity or they think of their audience being so stupid/gullible that we'd just accept Chris Pratt's character having some connection with dinosaurs that they all do his bidding whenever he puts his magic hand up.5 minutes in and I was already rolling my eyes. Charlotte Lockwood isn't an interesting character-she's so lackluster in fact that we don't care her, and I suppose she's meant to serve as the emotional core of the film? I can't believe Laura Dern and Sam Neill came back for this.Sam Neill asks "why would anyone do that?" at one point in the film and I keep asking myself why would anyone put this piece of garbage masquerading as "cinema" out in the world? At the what do actors step up and say "this is crap" or are their paychecks so big they don't care anymore?

title: AS THE FINALE, IT FALLS FLAT.
text: Was it a bit corny? Yes. Was there a lot of fan service? Obviously yes. Was it a fun movie? Also yes. You can go in expecting a fun movie and not have the need for it to be a masterpiece. As a regular Jurassic movie, it would be great but as the finale, it falls flat.

title: Average attempt to wrap up the dinos-gone-wild story
text: 'Jurassic World Dominion' (or Jurassic Park 6) is the presumed end of this second trilogy. It primarily follows Owen (Pratt), Claire (Howard) & their adopted daughter Maisie (Sermon), as she's hunted/kidnapped by bad guys that think she's a clone. Then they throw in the original team of Ellie (Dern), Alan (Neill, struggling to find his accent from the original film) and Ian (Goldblum) who are working to bring down Biosyn Corp and their GE locusts, led by Dodgson (Scott). They have help from Kayla (Wise), Ramsay (Athie) and Barry (Sy), and BD Wong is also back as Dr Wu.While the premise of dinosaurs roaming wild is an interesting concept, it's not fully explored and only hinted at in parts. Where it is shown, such as Owen wrangling the Parasaurolophus, there's more questions as to the potential realness of it, i.e. Reptiles living in the snow, horses being as fast as them, their calmness. There's a lot of "really?!" moments in this film. There's some funny moments and some good action scenes, but it all seems to have too many chefs and lack focus/seems rushed.This is nowhere near the quality of the original film - probably slightly better than 'Jurassic Park III' and 'Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom', not that that means much. Oddly, while we see a few dinosaurs, including some new ones, but mostly the tried & tested favourites - there seems to be not that many scenes where dinosaurs are the main focus. While not horribly slow, it doesn't feel like it all comes together and starts working until the final 40min, which isn't much of the 2 hour 20min running time.

title: Trailer Park Dominium
text:
I see I'm the 'bad guy' again, you know, the evil stupid bumbling white male.This movie was... (pick only 3)
a. LONG
b. Diverse
c. Catering to the Alphabet Soup Nazis
d. Boring
e. Cash grab
f. Plotless
g. Pointless
h. RidiculousIn summary... wait for this to be free on late night cable and you require a sleep aid.

title: It's too repetitious
text: Despite it's attempt at renewing the sequence of events that gets these Dino experts on the wrong side of the fence, plot has a strange aimlessness to it. Commercialisation of the Isla Nublar's live stock might have been a good card to play or at least a militarisation gone wrong would have succeeded as a spin-off. Also there's certainly a good amount of documenting the magnificent giants but some bits don't really add up a significant value to the succession. These end up carving craters in which the hype gets lost. All this clumsiness directs at the lack of originality to the story; a common singular nemesis this time even without known origins and ending up exactly the same way as indominus is more like a gut punch to the hopeful viewer. Dominion may age soon despite being the flashy new instalment but for all it's carefully arranged encounters of new kinds it's worth a watch.

title: Awful
text: What a disaster movie. The story is so shallow, predictable with unbelievable actions. With such a good cast, you should make a diamond not this awfulness. Disastrous visual effects. I'm really disappointed as a big fan of Jurassic Park movies.

title: Not nostalgic enough without good soundtrack, but still Watchable
text: Don't care what the critics said, the film is fine, with the cast from original JP, wat else can u demand more?The franchise is too expensive to end, there will be more in future, and tat time I will bring my kids to watch, to continue the legacy.The sad thing about this film is the soundtrack "Welcome to Jurassic World" doesn't played much in this finale, it is a very powerful, touching and touching music.

title: Worst Jurassic Park movie in the saga
text: I can honestly say in good faith that Jurassic World: Dominion is the worst film in the entire series. And people thought Jurassic Park III was horrible. Jeez, this one here takes the cake. The plot has nothing to do with dinosaurs.You don't miss anything by not watching it. Personally, Jurassic Park is the best film, followed by Lost World, Jurassic Park III, Jurassic World, Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom, and Dominion. Yes, the films got worse with every new entry. I was least entertained by the previous two entries.I can't help but feel this inconsistent, out-of-place trilogy deserves a quick comparison to the Star Wars sequel trilogy. Jurassic World hits the same beats as The Force Awakens. Rehash anyone? While the setup is there and you can build off it, originality is nonexistent.Then came The Last Jedi, which derailed the Star Wars saga. Fallen Kingdom was just boring. I can't consider it anything better than average. Its plot was nonsensical, and viewers begin to care less about our Jurassic World characters by the end of Act 3. That's never a good thing.Now, Dominion is on par with Rise of Skywalker for being so fast paced, poorly edited, introducing new things (species) every couple of minutes, bringing back dead or old characters for nostalgia bait, abusing special effects and letting action scenes carry the film, etc.Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) lost his charisma in this one. The only times I felt genuinely entertained was seeing Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) make subtle quips. If you want to see Pratt's potential, watch the Guardians of the Galaxy and Avengers films.You can skip Fallen Kingdom and Dominion and not miss anything. The story does not make a positive impact on prior films nor does it add substance to the overarching narrative, which is the study of dinosaurs. There's nothing of value here. Give it a few years for the die-hard fans to wake up. The Jurassic World trilogy offers very little re-watchability.

title: Phenomenal FILM.
text: Watched it twice so far, including in 3D: IMAX (bring a pair of ear plugs)...! FANTASTIC Missed 3d "dbox" version though - apparently, elvis was more important to certain decision makers in the st. Petersburg, florida FILM businass!

title: Dominion
text: Dominion had a rough initial start. But it thankfully ramps up the fun the more the movie gets going. But seriously, lets never do that cringeworthy introduction video of a modern day news feed again, it genuinely felt like a parody or comedy but no-one in the theater was laughing. This type of start obviously gave me a hard time to get into the movie. The dialog is under-par, the characters are meh, and people are sitting around a too much for what is a world filled with dinosaurs. Also, realistically speaking, no current day government would ever allow these dinosaurs to just roam around. So you really do need to allow some fantasy, even though this show tries to be real (like that news feed segment).But then, the trip to Malta happens and imo this is where the movie kicks off and pretty much does. Not. Let. Go. It's almost action piece after action piece. First off the Malta scenes reminded me a ton of a watching a James Bond movie. The action directing is absolutely excellent here and really engaging. It genuinely caught me off guard how good it was and I was finally hooked into the movie. Then a bit later then reintroduce the original characters, now I already knew this before hand, so no surprises for me, but it was nice seeing them and they at least had something to do, except for Ian Malcolm who was a bit more absent. Regarding the original characters, there are a few but imo not excessive amount of call backs/nostalgia hooks. The only one I thought was a bit much was having Malcolm distract the dino with a torch again, oh well, you know what you are getting into. Also the Barbasol can had no place whatsoever in this movie, felt really random.There are enough dinosaurs here to satisfy your needs, at least mine were met well enough. If I'd had to guess we've had more encounters than any previous movie. And with the disappointment that was Fallen Kingdom and it's awful auction plot this was a return to form imo. The types of dinosaurs are also fantastic, loved that they tried to do some new stuff and also bring in some new development in how some dinosaurs might have looked (feathers). What is a running theme though is that the dinosaurs a lot of the times just ''appear'' out of thin air it seems, they might have a short announcement of a yell or something but they pop up everywhere. That does in turn make encounters less impactful.Directing overall was good, though the action directing being the standout. Acting was all good, didn't really expect anything surprising from these actors and their characters didn't require much range besides Bryce which did great.Characters, I only have a gripe with the main ''villain'' who they made a current day awkward billionaire CEO, he looked like he walked straight out of the Apple building. Imo, this didn't really work for me. He wasn't annoying enough to be funny, nor evil enough to be hated and feel the satisfaction when he is down on his luck. His decisions are weird, and overall it just felt like a character that wasn't real. The clone girl storyline was improved, it was basic but it needed to be done for her to have any meaning in the movie, though her scenes still felt like ''get it over with''.Music was pretty good, they brought back some of the Williams stuff but kept it subtle, which I think was a tasteful decision not to go overboard. But it shows that the JW trilogy lacks a good score. The music for action scenes once again was good too, and they opted for some action scenes to not use any music which I can appreciate, it just adds that bit more intensity when the music is gone.The movie ends again sadly with a bit of that cringe worthy writing that it started with, so...wish they didn't do that. Character storylines are wrapped up vaguely, guess they keep them open for whatever comes next.All in all I had more fun here than I expected.

title: Please stop now.
text: A Jurassic Park and Jurassic World mish mash. I could go on and on but I'm tired after struggling through the movie. Using the same old ideas, putting the same old actors with some new ones and adding lots of computer graphics does not mean its will be a good movie. Bigger dinosaurs with more noise is just BORING. I couldn't wait for the movie to end. The scariest part of the movie is that it is doing well at the box-office, so there will probably be another bad sequel. Jurassic Universe - or Multiverse??? Please, think it through or just let it die.

title: Average movie with some good scenes.
text: I didn't like this movie as much as the previous ones. Pratt who is supposed to be the main guy, doesn't get as much air time as other boring characters. Claire's facial expressions were very good. It was good to see some old characters but I kept wanting to see Pratt more. And I hate all this "girl is the key to everything" crap. The black actress was an interesting character. The chase scenes were the only really enjoyable parts. But unfortunately once again the character writing is bad as with other Hollywood movies. But at least it wasn't as woke as other movies.

title: Fast and Furious with Dinosaurs
text: The first Jurassic Park was a thought-provoking science fiction film with enormous entertainment value.But after the first film, pseudoscientific realism was thrown in the trash can, emphasis was placed just on the popcorn factor, making these movies falling into the spectrum of a good visual festival with a mediocre narrative.This film is perhaps the one that takes this principle further. The story is generic, it serves as a pretext to go from action scene to action scene, with dinosaurs, explosions, bar fights, impossible pursuits with vehicles on land and in the air.However, it still has some well-crafted nostalgia factor. I really enjoyed seeing Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum together once again. And to the film's credit, these characters are more than glorified appearances, taking up quite a bit of space in the film.Conclusion: It's a brainless action movie with plenty of nostalgia, good character moments, and a corny b-plot narrative that is very bland and shallow.I enjoyed this movie more than the previous one. If you don't expect much from it, it might be fun.

title: This franchise jumped the shark
text: Watch this movie and watch the original classic Jurassic Park. The contrast is staggering on how stupid and Hollywood these movies have become. It feels like they are trying to capture the same stupidity of the Fast & the Furious franchise's latest entries. The movie has high production value and decent acting but like many Hollywood turds the script is just unbelievably stupid. I absolutely hated Fallen Kingdom for that very reason and this movie is no different. Watch the movie to see how stupid it is for yourself if you don't believe me.

title: Great characters, tired storyline
text: Amazing to see the original cast back in action, they nail their roles and paired well with the new leads. A few decent newcomers to the cast as well. However, the storyline is tired - all of it been there done that, from the dinosaur fights to genetics, nothing new.

title: Watch for the CGI dinosaur fighting and suspense but not the story
text: If you are a fan of dinosaurs fighting each other, this movie is for you. If you are a fan of suspenseful moments where dinosaurs are hunting humans and the humans are trying to escape death, boy, you're in for a real treat. I was in awe by the action scenes in this movie and how realistic the graphics of the dinosaurs were. The last section of the movie is packed with dinosaur fighting scenes, you'll love it. There were a few notable scenes, especially the ones with the baby raptor dinosaur, where it looked TOO fake with too much CGI because it didn't blend well with the forest background. It didn't detract too much from the immersion of the movie but it was definitely noticeable.The story was decent. It does a decent job of recapping the previous movie story a little bit. You will greatly benefit if you remember what happened in the earlier movies because they pretty much get into the story and continue it. The relationship between the characters will make much more sense if you remember what they did in the past. I didn't like how the movie just drops newly introduced characters. Especially in the first half, there are times where they introduce a new actor and then the story changes locations and you never see that actor again. They introduce dinosaurs that react to lazer pointers but you never see them again after that.I'm not a big fan of the middle part since it drags on a little bit. The part where people are sneaking into the lab and there's heavy dialog wasn't presented interesting enough to me..The acting is superb from all the actors. The way they acted terrified from these fake CGI dinosaurs were very believable. Jeff Goldblum was funny and talked eloquently as he always does. The audience at my movie theatre laughed at some of his dialog. I didn't see the other jurassic park movies from the 90's with the original actors. But i still felt like i this was going to be epic when the original actors and the new actors from the jurassic world story arc joined together.I'm not a huge fan of the villain, he was evil but his motivation other than greed money was kinda shallow. He was also kind of weak, depending totally on his workers to just blindly follow him.All in all, come for the action and suspense. You'll appreciate this movie so much more if you remember the previous movies and if you know the actors from their other movies.

title: cool dinosaurs, but a 'meh' plot
text: The movie has some good points but is also underwhelming in a lot of others. It was amazing seeing the original cast come back to this film, but it felt like some other things returned from the original jurassic park. There were multiple times this movie where it felt like it was nabbed straight from the original jurassic park, which felt more like lazy writing which did not really do the movie any good.The plot in short was not too good, there were a lot of 'but why?' moments, but then who really goes to a jurassic park/world movie for the amazing plot. The main attraction is, of course, the dinosaurs. The CGI on the dinosaurs was really well done and the action scenes are a thrill to watch! But it does feel like, after five movies, the 'magic' of seeing these dinosaurs on screen is a bit gone. Especially when there is not a big bad evil dinosaur this movie focusses on, like there was in the other jurassic world movies (indominus rex and indoraptor).The acting in this movie was fine, but not outstanding and the plot was, as mentioned, okay at best. The great action scenes and the beautiful scenery and cgi make up for that a bit, though, and I'd say the movie is fun to watch.

title: A tried and tested formula. But with new dinosaurs!
text: You know what's going to happen almost from the off. But don't let this detract from the fact that this film is hugely enjoyable. And brings the gang together!

title: Know what you are going into!
text: Is it great? No. Can you be entertained while watching it? Absolutely. Know what you are going into - this is no where near the caliber of the first one (or any blockbuster hit, for that matter), but if you go in with the mindset that "This will not be good", you will enjoy yourself.

title: It was so bad that everyone laughed at the end!
text: I don't know where to start, but everything about this movie is actually bad! All the dialogs are out of place! It's full of forced quotes from the previous movies! All the performances are very very awful, even the original cast acted so bad (and we're talking about people like Laura Dern, Sam Neil and Jeff Goldblum). The plot it's so dumb and occasionally nosense! Also photography, directing, visual effects and editing are very low tier if we think about the franchise and the budget!!

title: Good value
text: Plenty of action, some impressive sequences, and fun (unlike JP: Fallen Kingdom which was just miserable). If you're expecting "high art" (when has JP ever been that?) you'll be disappointed, but if you've plenty of popcorn and are out for an evening without having to think too much, it's good value entertainment.

title: No Lessons Learned
text: You would think that Jurassic World Dominion learn the lessons from Disney Star Wars. Just because you bring back the original Jurassic Park characters they thought they can bring back and it would be successful but not. Poor Laura Dern history repeats itself again.

title: All in all, it was entertaining
text: Sure, it was not the best of the JP movies. (Jurassic Park and Jurassic World were my favorites.) But it certainly was not as bad as some of the other reviews stated. And it was better than some of the other sequels they have been churning out.My husband and I thought the movie was pretty good (my husband often falls asleep during the bad ones), and I really enjoyed seeing all the characters from the JP movies come together (even if it was near the end). I thought that the movie would have been better if it were edited down to 2 hours; it was a bit long (I was looking at my watch near the end of the movie) and cutting it back would have made the plot tighter and the movie more interesting.

title: So bad I wanted to walk out
text: One of worst written and directed big budget movies I've seen in a long time. Made Transformers look like Seventh Seal.It starts with the 4 minutes of narration at the beginning to try to make the rest of it make any kind of sense. This fails. Then there are the other obvious re-shot or dubbed lines to try to make things make sense. These also fail.Forget the black ops CIA agents easily defeating humans armed with machine guns, then throwing their guns down and turning their backs when confronted with some dinosaurs trained to literally run up and bite them. Forget that the controls for the mainframe that needs to be turned off is in the same room where they kept the experimental grasshoppers and which had been soaked in lighter fluid and set on fire earlier. Forget that restarting the mainframe also brought the grasshoppers who were burned to a crisp hours earlier back to life. Forget all that, and answer this: Did Kayla steal that airplane from Baloo from TailSpin? It's obviously the same plane, did she pay for it? Do talking bear pilots exist in the Jurassic Park universe?

title: It's fun!! Brings back good memories!!
text: Plot is decent. No real need to develop new characters. It is fun, fast paced and not so gory. It was a good way to wrap things up. It was better then the second one of this Trilogy.

title: Never left me in the SoD zone
text: Bad acting or directing? Maybe too small a sound stage with too much green screen? Everybody always seemed to be standing so close to each other. I dunno, it felt low-budget, and maybe even lazy because they didn't seem to be trying to being anything new to the table. Just resting on their laurels to bring in the views.Anyway, I didn't feel the nostalgia for the first movie like I think I was supposed to, I used the fast-forward button a lot - which I never do the first time I watch a film - and I just couldn't find myself "in it" like I did in most of the others.It's too bad, too, because I would really have liked to feel that nostalgia and I *really* wanted to suspend my disbelief.This is a rare review from me. I'm actually sorry that I felt I needed to write it.

title: Michael Crichton would be proud.
text: As someone who has read Crichton's books, (darn near all of them, still haven't read Airframe), this movie was all the things. Wrap it up, full circle, deep commentary on the scientific power we wield as humans with both miraculous and disastrous consequences. This is not a crowd-pleasing, no need to think, monster-action movie. Which is something Michael Crichton's original novel was never meant to be. At long last, the second franchise finally got back to the roots of what the books were really about. And I loved every second of it.

title: 7/10 Rollercoaster end to the jurassic movie films epic and exciting
text: Jurassic World Dominion a fitting end to a epic trilogy of jurassic sized movies, almost a avengers style sized movie that brings the new trio and old trio together in an attempt to save humanity on the brink of extinction.Upon reading reviews and reports I was sceptical about going to see this expecting dissatisfaction and disappointment and but got a rollercoaster end to a epic movie franchise. I won't be relying on movie reviews to see future cinema movies.Thrillingly exciting with epic turns and twists at every turn. A final curtain call on the jurassic era of cinema films. A must see movie to end the journey.... #excitingmovie excitingmovie7/10 stars#jurassicworlddominion2022 #moviereviews #moviereviewsblog #moviereviewer #SpoilerFreeReview.

title: should have ended after park
text: This movie relies on fan service by bringing back the old characters from Jurassic park, but they forget to write a story. They should of killed off some of the characters in this movie cause any one who is about to die (get eaten by a dinosaur) another character will arrive just in time to save them, I mean come on this is final movie why didn't they kill off anyone, the only characters that die is the villain, and random background characters. Owen's daughter ( I don't remember her name nor do I care) just says something sassy, and has zero character even though she is the plot of this movie. The actress also does a bad accent through out the film and its just so annoying.

title: Jurassic Francise has Run Its Course
text: So amazing CGI dinosaurs is old stuff now. Been there, done that. World Dominion is going for the nostalgic play by bringing back the original cast of the 1993 "Jurassic Park". That was cool, but somehow even with the original stars, the old magic could not be restored. The Francise has run its course, and the way they left it does not sit right with me. Dinosaurs have a right to live alongside us? That seems terrifying and not a happy way to leave things. I still give this movie a 7 due to exciting action scenes. I often found I was tensing in suspense from the action. And that is really what you come to expect from these movies; good dinosaur action.

title: More Minion than Dominion. Rehashed.
text: The build up to this feature seems somewhat fake: being the idea that we'll see the world ravaged by the impact of these dinosaurs finally free to live unfettered and feast on the 7 billion of us, many of whom anticipated a thrilling end to the saga. Even the title "Dominion" suggests some victorious claimant of Terra Firma as we expect to be the ones cast back into evolutionary obscurity in a battle which humans haven't a chance of winning. Well, that's what it suggested anyway, the trailer, the title, that we'd see the world overrun. But instead, the writers seem to have shuffled through all of the prior films and screenplays and then finally picked up Michael Crichton's first book and said, "eh I've bright idea ... let's set it in a park for Dinosaurs like l, eh I dunno ... Jurassic Park maybe, huh?" Duh!And that's precisely what we get, Jurassic Park again, only worse, way worse. Couple that with rubber animatronics, bad CGI, wooden acting and we're left with a giant pile of Dino-dung that stinks. Any menace one might have expected from the world being the dominion of these creatures dissappears when they decided to concentrate on an environmental disaster caused by locusts the size of rats and forget that there are flocks of Pterosaurs on high that just might eat the kids for lunch, but they won't because we've decided that we can all hold a hand up in a staying manner and control every single one of them, and if that doesn't work we'll just get Chris Pratt to talk to them, he's great at that and they seem to like his voice. He even teaches Dr Grant how to hold a hand up to a Velociraptor, unaware that Dr Grant perfected the staying hand in JP III.And the decision to have the Pilot for hire explain to the dinosaur trainer and the former head of Jurassic World the names and characteristics of certain dinosaurs seems so lazy and ill-thought out as to be ridiculous. It is an obvious attempt to give the character lines, but simply isn't believable.If only the writers of this rubbish would embrace prehistory, for their work certainly needs somewhere to go to, preferably into obscurity.Instead they brush over the fact that the thing which was to avoided at all costs throughout all of the prior movies, that these animals shouldn't ever be set free, really isn't that bad and we'll all have to learn to share. It's an insulting side-step, insulting to fans, and to concentrate the majority of the film in yet another Dinosaur park, left me dumbfounded, I still can't believe they went there.The return of the original cast was largely wasted and there was no intelligent integration of their roles with the Jurassic World cast, it was a wasted opportunity and the promise of the trailers and excitement at this merging was squandered. The one sure thing to create atmosphere, John William's renowned score was also wasted and the music at times was so bad, it sounded like a score for any generic TV action show. Only hints of the original score surfaced and were so clipped as to be annoying and pointless.If they had crowd-sourced ideas from the fans and thrown it all in the air and grabbed what they could, they could have done way better than what was written here. And, I can only say that the opening to this film is one of the most crappy wasted opportunities of all the franchise, opening with some ridiculous newsreader monologue segment as a mechanism to get the story into our heads. It was terrible and some of the worst writing I've seen across a franchise known for enticing, exciting openings. It seems the old saying, too many cooks spoil the broth, is appropriate to the writing here.The acting seems rushed, unfocused, and unrehearsed and a lot of that is down to the director, who is ultimately responsible for shouting cut. Overall, it's a huge disjointed, disappointment that even the cast seem perplexed by.If looking for wonder, rewatch the original, if you do so after watching this mess, then you'll realise exactly how bad it is.

title: Not too taxing but enjoyable all the same
text: There's a few low scores on this film, but overall I enjoyed it.Yes I agree the story line isn't the best in the world, but what do you expect, it's going to be about dinosaurs, people being bad, and people being nibbled a bit... it's what all the other films where about!Perhaps 7 is a little high, but I'll stick with it - I enjoyed the film. If you liked the other ones, the chances are you'll like this one.

title: A series of scenes, with zero character development
text: This movie is amazingly bad. A series of scenes which don't seem to have a real connection, but angry dinosaurs being involved. It seems like seeing the same sequence multiple times, once in a city, a forest, a frozen lake, but it's basically all the same. What really baffles me is the complete lack of character development. Basically every character remains flat and ends up where he has been before. This is the worst movie I have seen in a long time.

title: Well, it could have been good
text: Top Gun sequel took 4 or 5 steps up compared to the first, while Dominion took 4 or 5 steps down. There were a lot of action scenes that were OK to watch, and some were actual fun to. The problem is the story did not, at all, have the suspense of the first one. It never drew you into the plot, it just became too preachy. Sad, since it could have been good, but it wasn't.

title: Great!!
text: Love how they took from the first movie and honored it by adding little Easter eggs. The cast was amazing and it wasn't drawn out the plot was to the point. One of my favorite out of the entire series.

title: Always the same story
text: Why is the corporate always the villain. Time for realty check, the true heroes of todays world are the big industries. Time to grow up from unrealistic plots.

title: No words needed
text: What a bad bad bad movie. What have you done producers! What with franchise. Non watchable.Predictable too much.It's not even little good anymore.I am sad for Chris, Sam and Jeff cuz they are good actors. Don't film it anymore cuz you ruined it.Jurrasic Parks were perfect.Jurassic world 1 was great.Jurrasic park 2 was good and everything later that was catastrophic.Honestly I stopped watching it after 90 minutes.My time is more important then this .Maybe for some teenagers will be ok, cuz they like just some action and dinosaurs. But for adults who like good filmed movie with good story is this not recommendable.Don't watch it.

title: Slow but watchable
text: Very boring with slow start .. not for entertainment of kids. Story a bit complicated. One of the interesting scientists resembled Dr. Fauci, who did some shady research too. Actions were thrilling and interesting.

title: Mediocre
text: Due to this film being one of the first films being filmed in lockdown it really wasnt that bad. I felt the dialogue was a bit messy especially when Alan Grant and Ellie are speaking with the antagonist at the beginning. However, there were some good scenes, but again like most films it was in the trailer. Apart from that the detail on the dinosaurs is astonishing and where there is action there really isn't anything wrong with it.Slow beginning and an alright ending. I would recommend watching it though.

title: 6.3 Good Action, eventually
text: This movie took awhile to get going. They were doing so much building of the plot it felt like it was never gonna start. Once it got going and this dinosaur movie had some good dinosaur action, it was pretty enjoyable.It is a long line of pretty good movies that I'm glad we are getting, but that's all they are, pretty good, not great.

title: Mediocre
text: I... enjoyed it. But. Just enjoyed. The best part of the movie was the return of the original cast. Jeff Goldblum of course was phenomenal and fell right back into the role of Ian Malcolm. We gotta all be honest here though... the first two movies of JP were amazing because they were done by Spielberg and based on the books. Everything after just feels like a cheap rip off.

title: Killed a masterpiece!!!
text: Jurassic park was a masterpiece of a film and these new films have slowly killed its reputation. Even the cgi is worse. Creativity in films as died in recent years and this film proves it. The old cast should of been embarrassed to sign up.

title: You ask for too much if you couldn't enjoy this
text: Having grown up in the 90's Jurassic Park was a big part of my life. I have enjoyed the movies for years. This newest movie is fantastic. I loved it, as did the five other people I went with. It was fun to see all the separate stories come together, and seeing old favorites was exciting. It was all really well done...acting, effects, music, writing, the action, the humor. If you can't enjoy a movie like this, then you want too much.Gone are the days when people can just go to a movie and enjoy it as it is, and not expect it to change their entire life. Movies are meant to be enjoyed, they are meant to take you away for a short time. When did it stop being like that? If you want to be shocked, and scared, and changed...watch the freakin news.

title: Good fun action for those who loved Jurassic park.
text: Not sure why this has such a low score. It's full of action, dinosaurs and nostalgic cheese. Just sit back and enjoy. IMDB is going to get ruined by ridiculous scores. There is no way this deserves so many low ratings. If you don't like it, fine! Let's add some *'s for production, acting, sound, effects and entertainment value.

title: Absolutely no suspense and a huge disappointment
text: The worst thing about writing this review is that I had extremely high hopes for watching this movie. I remember watching the original as a little boy in the theaters being blown away at the ground breaking effects and breakthrough in filmmaking. I was excited to watch this movie with my own children, hoping it would somehow be a repeat of the magic I experienced watching the first one. I also thought thought that this was going to be some sort of homage to the magic of the first movie since they brought back the original cast. When the movie starts, there is no build up to seeing the dinosaurs all of a sudden they just live amongst everyone and the magic of seeing a dinosaur is completely null. I thought there was going to be a very emotional sentiment by seeing the original cast however, it didn't bring any added value other than viewers who remember the original to say oh hey, there they are. The action feels generic, and there was never any points during the movie that gave you the suspense we all experienced during the first one. This was one of the biggest letdowns I have ever had.

title: the movie that finally starts feeling like a "jurrasic world" instead of just another park.
text: Gonna cut right to the chase and say die hard fans of the jurassic series will love this one, including myself. Compared to the first 2 jurassic world movies, this was an improvement. But by all means, this movie was good, but not great. I didn't enjoy jurassic world because it felt like a bad attempt at a remake of jurassic park. And don't get me started on fallen kingdom, I don't know how I sat through that movie when it was in theaters. It was just so awful, the worst jurassic movie of them all. So my expectations for this movie were pretty low. This is what the first jurassic world movie should have been. It reminded me of the rise of the planet of the apes series. But, If you're looking for a realistic interpretation of how dinosaurs would live among humans, this movie isn't for you. This movie is purely entertainment. If it were realistic the main characters would've been dead a long time ago. The action can be cheesy and predictable, but it's fun, and some of the action sequences had me ready to jump, something i haven't felt since the first jurassic park. This movie was definitely carried by the return of the original jurassic park cast, i would not have enjoyed it as much as i did if they weren't in it. This movie actually felt like it had somewhat of a plot. And somehow still doesn't feel like the end of the series. I would not be mad if they made another jurassic world movie, as long as they continue to expand the world of the story.

title: Fun with popcorn
text: I think others have been to harsh. Yes, it's familiar territory but well edited, good acting and some laughs (spot 'The Shining' reference). I thought the running time would be too long but it my attention throughout. Screen time is well shared among the cast and the sub plots work well together. Nice to see Laura and Sam get together at the end and and Isabella Sermon and Wanda deWise are very watchable. Some people really need to chill out and just eat their popcorn...

title: Breaks my heart to have to write this...
text: I'd heard it was bad..but I've been a die hard fan of Jurassic Park since I saw it at the cinema on my 13th birthday. All I can say is that I really do hope that this film franchise is now dead and extinct forever, because it was TERRIBLE!The characters, I didn't care about. Dodgson even less. It was nice to see the three original characters back together but the story and bad writing overshadowed all of this. The story was so long winded and boring that I nearly turned it off midway. I only finished it (and that was incredibly difficult) because I felt I owed it to Jurassic park to finish the final installment.Instantly forgettable, forever regrettable. You will be wasting your time watching this..it's all been done and been seen in the previous five movies. Shame but like most things, it's had it's day and unfortunately it was on my 13th birthday!

title: Quite nice
text: If you liked the Jurassic Worlds (1&2) and loved Jurassic Park (1), you'll have loads of things to like in this movie too. But I'm biased, the movie has dinosaurs, was filmed partly in Malta while I lived there (we had news of the movie every day haha) AND in my favourite place on earth: the Dolomites.

title: Poor plot - disjointed
text: Lots of meaningless action. Same old boring predictable near death experiences. Feels like it was written so badly to make sure it's the last one. Script older than the dinosaurs. Relying on the mix of actors to get bums on seats. I'd recommend not bothering to be one of them bums on seats.

title: What a final let down. Such high expectations!
text: If they had focused more on how awesome it would of looked day to day for Dinosaurs and animals and humans co-existed after the previous films. It could have been jaw dropping.So many characters the dinosaurs were more like extras!This is the first film I had no jumps or felt zero tension.Thank god we finally saw the Dimetrodon.I just wish after films the plesiosaur got some screen time.Sad it was in production this long and we got an action film not a dinosaur film.

title: Thank f for the dinosaurs
text:
Imagine the fast and furious franchise made a b-grade, straight to dvd, attempt at a remake of the original. It has the same cast and crew, but they're all washed up, sad and lonely and then blatantly scripted the same lines and scenes as the first film?! But they don't care anymore; it's been done to death and even the script writer's busy going to parties, getting high and smashing French champagne. They're all done with Toretto's, over the franchise, over worked, and legitimately now only in it for the money....
It's like that, but with dinosaurs.

title: Great way to tie up and end!
text: I feel that this final film in the saga goes back to the roots of the original Jurassic park. It focuses on overreach of the power with technology(mainly biotechnology). It was a good way to bring the new cast and original together in a way that felt believable. Also added a couple of great new characters. The realistic true form dinosaurs were quite neat and the touch of nostalgia here and there was great.

title: Didn't Mind It
text: You know what? The nostalgia sorta works here for me. It's endearing, to see the old cast again, some iconic scenes recreations, now with a sort of poke at the generational gap, I dig it. It brought me back a piece of my childhood and a movie ain't good unless it can connect you to something. I don't watch Jurassic Park for perfect plot lines or complexities, I do it for the majestic Dino recreation. This one just works.There are also some very uniquely terrifying situations and I've seen every which genre of thriller/horror so that was kinda nice. The actors were all playing their character really well and they all seems to genuinely like working with each other.Overall I liked everything.

title: nope
text: All this movie has to offer is cliches and boring plots. Not much of interest happens and all of it feels like the movie needed to check a couple of Jurassic world/park movie boxes and then they were finished.

title: End of an Era
text: I went into this 6th instalment of the Jurassic saga with a lot of trepidation. All the negative reviews had me lower my expectations.And you know what? It's not as awful as everyone made it out to be.Not as good as the original trilogy nor the 4th entry, Jurassic World. But it's definitely miles better than Forbidden Kingdom.Having the original trio of Neill, Dern and Goldblum reprising their classic roles, did bring more nostalgia than I anticipated. Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard, the hero's of the new trilogy, were definitely pushed into the backseat for this new film.But it was fun popcorn entertainment with some stunning visuals and action packed set pieces laced with tension.Sure, the whole "locust" subplot felt out of place and stupid, but it didn't impact my enjoyment one bit.It's a fine addition to the franchise. Maybe not the send off we wanted, but not awful either.

title: Money Money Money
text: Why JW Dominion is The worst JW ever?!!1. The script is extremely weak.2. Bring back the old character only for money.3. Its so predicatable.(there is more.)The only thing they care is add L.gbt character in story,i don't have problem with them but in every movie i recently watched they added by force even at the cost of destroying the story.

title: Emily Carmichael is a bad writer
text: I rarely blame the writer for a bad movie as more than often it's the result of a studio or producer's ego - but the writing was objectively poor.The industry has been so hot on Carmichael for awhile, and honestly, it seems like she had never even watched Jurassic Park or read Crichton's books. It felt more like Fast & Furious plus dinosaurs with sappy dialogue and non-sensical plot points, one after another. And even though we have an army of characters that barely got any development, the story insisted on introducing more, which were boring additions.Clearly this story also was pushing some agendas, and its painful philosophical discussions make the OG movie sound like Socrates and Plato compared to this rubbish.Just look at the ridiculous outfits Emily Carmichael wears to premieres, and tell me this person should be writing the Jurassic Park franchise...If you're going to make another Jurassic Park film, get a writer who lives and breathes this franchise, who knows the book by heart and is bursting with creativity - not the hot writer agents tell you to work with.

title: Nostalgic Rollercoaster Ride
text: Jurassic Park was my childhood. When the movie came out in theaters, I was only 1 years old. I remember owning Jurassic Park years later on vhs, and it becoming one of my most prized possessions. The story, characters, pacing, special effects, and music are pitch perfect. When the Lost World: Jurassic Park came out, I was 5 years old, and I did not see it in theaters either. While it was a flawed sequel, I enjoyed watching it on vhs. The music, set pieces, and the inclusion of more dinosaurs made it a fun addition to the series. Jurassic Park III was the first film in the franchise that I actually saw in theaters in 2001. I remember loving it when I was 9 years old, but now it is my least favorite of the sequels. The runtime is too short, and I'm not just referring to humans running away from dinosaurs. The dialogue and characters and poorly written, and the quality of the cgi was downgraded. With that being said, the animatronic work still mostly holds up, except the Spinosaurus. Fast forward 14 and 17 years later, and I finally saw both Jurassic World and Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom in theaters. The experience of seeing the park finally open in Jurassic World was such an en incredible feeling. It was the closest to capturing the magic of the original Jurassic Park. Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom, like Jurassic Park III, tends to get better when repeat watches, but it is a lesser sequel in almost every way. This brings me to Jurassic World Dominion. While the film does have tonal issues and missteps, seeing the original trio together is worth the price of admission alone. While I think the current reviews are a bit harsh, the film is flawed. I would summarize the biggest issue as missed opportunities for the characters and story. The movie wraps up all six films in an interesting enough way, but doesn't completely satisfy or answer every question that you may have. Visually, the movie is gorgeous, and it has the most animatronics of any film in the franchise, with the cgi mixing well with the practical effects. Overall, Jurassic World Dominion is a nostalgic rollercoaster ride that thrilled me, slightly disappointed me, but never bored me.

title: Well, at least they honored legacy characters well
text: That gives it a leg up over other franchises.Otherwise, it's bloated, confusing and unearned. Disappointing ending to this franchise. Hope to see more.

title: Biggest Disappointment
text: I was fan of Jurassic world part 1 and 2. So I expected more from part 3. And seriously after seeing the disaster part 3, it will be shame to call me as a Jurassic fan. They don't apply any good story, just made it for money. But u lost our love and respect.

title: We still can't capture the magic from the original. Love the action and cast, but not the story.
text: Jurassic World Dominion is a different film, to say the least.I was so excited for this movie and the hype was so big. The trailers showed dinosaurs around the world and a rescue mission, again. But I was so delusional and thought it was gonna be pretty good. And I walk into the theater, on my birthday, and I'm still sort of shocked. We got a film about genetically modified locusts, cooperate espionage, CIA missions to save a annoying girl and a raptor apparently? You made a promise to a dinosaur? Oh yeah, and there's the hamd. Wanna see a 7 inch hand to calm every dinosaur in this entire FILM?! Well, here you go, it works on wild parasaurs, 20 feet tall carnivore dinosaurs, laser guided raptors, and on a mindless baby raptor and blue. The pacing is dogwater, screenplay/ dialogue is absolutely awful, and there is too many locusts to fill up the conspiracy theories. But I did like the Freddy Krueger dinosaur scene with Claire, best scene in the movie. Like the cowboy dinosaur scene, just ignore the stupid hand, it adds emotion. I love the old cast returning. Jeff Goldblum steals the show. Ramsay Cole is a ok Jeff Goldblum, Kayla Watts is a decent character, apart from being a LGBTQ. The swimming dinosaur in the frozen lake scene is good, just isn't Owen gonna freeze from it. I love Biosyn valley, I just hate the Biosyn building. I love the CGI in this film and the cinematography is good and real enough. The extended cut is a slightly better than the film, but still a bit disappointed by this Jurassic film. But as a fun movie to turn your brain off, it's perfect to get the nonsense away from you.

title: Bad film
text: Jurassic World Dominion is a film with ugly dialogue and a really bad montage of the film. I didn't like the story, neither is the management of the characters. Disappointing.

title: Franchise kaputt !
text:
It needs a special kind of stupid incompetence to have so much budget and so many stars and still produce total crap.What did they try to achieve ?A mission impossible clon with spontanous dinosaur appearances ?A James Bond cover with some snakeskin ?A fast and furious remake on the lizard side ?No one will ever know.Only thing that remains sure is:
This is the end of Jurassic Park,
the whole franchise,
forever.

title: I've Seen Worse, But Definitely Have Seen Better.
text: Pros: The second half of the film was really fun. The OG cast was awesome. The effects were good.Cons: The current cast got progressively worse as the film progressed. The first half of the film was mainly nonsense and really dragged by. The conclusion was honestly lame for a trilogy finale.Also: The Dilophosaurus still horrifies me like I'm rewatching the original Jurassic Park.I've seen worse, but definitely have seen better.6/10.

title: Omg what is this?
text: I'm just at the intro and I'm laughing so hard. Considering these are dangerous creatures. They are not like bears or lions. These are bigger, faster, and eat much more, the goverments would surely contain them and just make another jurassic world island to contain them all rather than making them live freely in the city.How many people would get eaten + pets too!!Im surprised they only have 37 deaths in the past year too. That number would surely be up considering how dangerous the ocean would be + flying as well.This is like some fanfiction story that bend reality and logic and much worst. The rest of the story doesn't help much.

title: Awful!!!!!!
text: This is less about the warnings of man playing god and our creation tuning on us and more that man is just awful and really bad because we are breathing and exist, rather than correct the mistake, let's conserve them and complain about us and the resolve is surprising giving the original premise.

title: Loved it.
text: Worth checking out. Great closure to the series. Don't listen to the critics, just go and have a great time! Loved that the old cast came back to join the new cast. We'll done everyone!

title: Another and another
text: It seems they are trying to see how long they can keep this story going. The story line was OK, bringing all the past and present together seemed to struggle to find its cohesion throughout the movie, at times it felt to be two different movies with the old cast and new cast in the same studio on different sets with no barrier. It's hard to rate visual effects anymore with technology what it is, everyone has almost the same skill set, so you have to come back to the story and the actors telling it. I give it a 7/10 only because of the Jurassic franchise as I've always been a fan. Just feels like they could have done better.

title: Boring, uncreative and exhausting
text: There is never any really any sense of danger and the plot, if you can call it that, just quietly plays out. One of the few movies I wish was shorter.Not even the dinosaurs were as good as in the earlier installments.In the end its a sad waste of talented actors who combined with a little bit of nostalgia provide just enough to call it a movie.

title: One Of The Worst Films Of The Year So Far
text: Continuing the Jurassic Park franchise tradition of every subsequent sequel being weaker than the previous one, Jurassic World Dominion is as embarrassing & incompetent as any blockbuster can get. An insipid, moronic & lacklustre entry with nonsensical plot, soulless characters & dull action, this sixth & final instalment is possibly the weakest of all entries in the series and is one of the worst films of the year so far.Directed by Colin Trevorrow (Jurassic World), the film picks what Fallen Kingdom had setup with its ending and discards it for a much safer, less ambitious & far more idiotic premise. And then it fails at executing that properly too. The new characters are cringe, reprising ones remain just as uninteresting as they were before and they also make the original trio return to pander fans, pick an easy paycheck & add nothing to the saga.The film suffers from not having a clearly defined set of priorities. It wants to be too many things yet ends up being nothing but a waste of time & money. For a plot set in a world now run over by dinosaurs, the possibilities were endless yet it spends too much time on characters investigating a conspiracy and narrates it with such ineptitude that we are never invested in it. And if that isn't enough, the editing on display is an absolute horror show.Overall, Jurassic Park Dominion doesn't have an ounce of magic, wonder or sense of adventure that the series once basked in and is a bland, generic, emotionally vacant & creatively bankrupt conclusion to a franchise that should've remained a duology at best. Blockbuster filmmaking at its most hollow, this film not only makes the same mistakes as before but also several new ones and despite few crowd-pleasing dino set pieces, it remains a forgettable ride.

title: Nostalgia with no real plot line
text: The reunion of characters and iconic scenes can warm the heart of any Jurassic Park fan, however outside of those moments, the story fails to stand on its own. It seems the direction of the film is often sidetracked by implementing these nostalgic moments, even some iconic dinosaurs were merely reduced to memories of better scenes in the past.

title: Decent enough movie but I think it's time to stop
text: I love the Jurassic Park franchise and this had good moments but the story was a bit flat. The original characters were great to see together again and their little personal moments were fantastic but the dinosaurs were almost secondary. It was almost like it was about the young girl.The original Jurassic Park had science fiction but it was really believable and the story was fantastic with great characters too. The first Jurassic World recaptured this and stretched out the reality but that was fine but the story in this one wasn't the best.I think it is time to leave this franchise now and let it go down as one of the best in the last 30 years.

title: Honestly, four stars may be too generous.
text: I love Jurassic Park. The first film I had been on of my favorite film was my entire life. And for the most part, I've enjoyed the Jurassic World films up until now. This movie was just ridiculous. It starts with Chris Pratt Lassoing dinosaur and just quickly goes downhill from there. This film was closer to her fast and furious movie (and not one of the good ones). It was contrived, it was predictable, and it was ultimately boring. The whole movie felt like they were just trying to remind you of the great movie. Jurassic Park that they had once made it was gratuitous. Well, I wouldn't see the last two movies were great films. They were at least fun dinosaur movies, this isn't even that.

title: The Dominion of the Jurassic Franchise Is Slightly Disappointing.
text:
There are no spoilers in this review.Jurassic World Dominion take its setting four years after the events of Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom. Dominion is the grand, spectacular, finale of the Jurassic World trilogy, and the Jurassic Park franchise as a whole. At least... that's what it was supposed to be.First off, I did not hate the film. It's not a film that I would never watch again in my life. The reason for my slight disappointment, I state below.CONS:
There are absolutely no character arcs in this film, besides one character, which I won't spoil here. Maisie Lockwood may also have a small arc from her behavior... but that's it. Second off, I thought that this film was too focused on demonstrating action sequences. Rather than exploring the scientific narrative behind the story, it chose to have a jam-packed film filled with action. Sometimes, that's not bad. Colin Trevorrow, the Director of this and the first Jurassic World film, had to please both the action-seeking audience AND the story-seeking audience. I am part of the latter half. So, I understand the action sequences, but it gets overwhelming at points. Focus less on biking/escaping/running/fighting scenes, and concoct a better story! That leads me to my next point. The story feels very hollow and rushed. For a 2-and-a-half-hour-long film, you'd expect the ending to have a magnitude that's different from the ending of the previous film. However, nothing changes. Dinosaurs still roam across the world. Maybe there are two character arcs, but other than that, there's no change from the ending of JW:FK.PROS:
There is a well-written plot twist midway through the film that I enjoyed watching. It gives some more expansion to the JW "lore". Some moments in JWD gave me some seriously intense moments, where I felt like I was going to sweat. Mr. Trevorrow did fantastic on that sweet, sweet, tension.
