The addition of a few new characters is nice to see. Now, we have the classic characters, the classic JW characters, and the newer characters. Jeff Goldblum is phenomenal in this film and had some humor that made me laugh out loud. A lot of people disliked the locust side story, but personally, I saw it as a way to connect the two stories into one. It was a way to bring the classic characters into the story. I liked that there were also multiple plot lines to follow. Some say that this should have been split into two parts, but these stories happen at the same time, so it would be confusing to have two parts.Overall, JWD had some major flaws in its production, but I respect and admire the crew's work and struggle through COVID-19. They did the best they could. This movie may not be the best installment, but it's certainly better that JPIII.Also, this movie doesn't deserve the rotten tomatoes score it has. It's really not THAT bad...

title: A confusing story, very underwhelming
text: I have to admit, I had such high hopes for this movie after seeing Fallen Kingdom and absolutely loving it. However, Dominion fell short on so many things. Yes, the original cast was reunited and that would normally make the film better, but the movie just felt rushed and the actors just didn't have that spark that they did in previous movies. I would have liked to see much more dinosaur action, though. I mean, if you're going to give us a confusing enough storyline to follow that branches off into so many directions in Dominion, at least include the animal that made the franchise so popular. Maisie was really annoying and just not a likable character, and her storyline was very stupid, in my opinion. She was just another character, easily forgettable. I ended up almost falling asleep because Dominion was just so boring and the storyline was hard to catch up with. Watched it with my grandparents in the theater and was very underwhelmed, and watched it with my parents and they said it was garbage. It's a shame, because the movie had so much potential, but they didn't plan it out right and it was just another forgettable film of 2022. Very disappointed in the movie.

title: Fun ride
text: Lots of suspense beginning to end. Funny parts too. Came in with low expectations because of the reviews, and was pleasantly surprised. Will definitely watch this one a lot with the fam.

title: Can't ask for more.
text: While some of the reviews are fight about plot holes and what not, this is a Dinosaur movie. We don't need Oscar worthy performances or solid story lines.We all have a child within us that wakes from sleep when we see or hear anything about dinosaurs.

title: oh man what to even say
text:
I will try to keep it short as possible.Starts off as a typical low budget nonsense movie made by college kids then slowly starts to make some sense and rolls out into a coherent plot.The entire setting is completely unrealistic. Ironic it might sound since its fiction but still the main point of my argument is that people would not survive in the world full of dinosaurs. Allegedly the dinos spread the entire world, yeah that means humans would either extinct or be in survival mode.One time they say how living with dinos is a struggle (especially pointed out in the intro) the next we are shown places and events like dinos don't exist at all and somehow the locusts are the only problem...
No other problems, no dinos to make a mess etc. Like make up your mind.The events in the movie are completely off, all the characters would pretty much die off in their 1st crashes and especially their 1st encounters with dinos but they somehow always survive and find their way to a secure place, or secure enough. Magically only the villians get killed almost instant, like magically dinos know who is ''good'' or ''bad''. When a good character is attacked the dinos basically more often just toy around they don't attack for a kill.In the real world, we don't need locusts and dinosaurs to be a problem, we are the biggest problem and we are our own enemy ... the movie seems like a metaphor for a typical brainwashed human behavior, blame everything else but us.This movie is such a mishmash of things, it's like trying hard to please every fanbase there is. Campy horror, JP3 fans (do they even exist...) bringing back old characters and putting lots of nods to old JP1 and 2 but still manage to middle finger it too... this movie seriously doesn't know what it wants to be at all.

title: Big disappointment
text: This was pretty much a copy of every other film in the series but not as fun as most. They put just about everyone who survived all of the other films into one. They were cutting between at least three groups or individuals in the middle act and by the end, there's nine people running to get off the island. It was all a bit much.

title: Bad Bad BAD
text: Jurassic Park meets James Bond, No story and pretty ordinary action sequences. What happened to this franchise. The original cast meets the new cast a mish mash of cliches and new cgi that just doesn't work. Watching movie reminded of a theme park ride rather a movie. Should stop at 3 maybe even 1 Hollywood keep churning out this garbage.

title: Strictly a Fan Service
text: Looking at how zestfully it demonstrates a broad variety of dinosaurs, draws forthright references to some famous scenes from the erstwhile features, and also the fact that they bring the original cast back, speaks a lot about their intentions thus, I can safely tell that more than anything, Jurassic World Dominion is a movie strictly made for the fans and fans only. Since this was presumed to mark the denouement of this decade-long franchise, this was rather an obvious decision from their end to bank upon the element of nostalgia for one last time.Not that I'm complaining though; as a fan of Jurassic Park and these wondrous critters in general, I couldn't have asked for more to be honest. Yet, my biggest complaint is that amid all this flashiness and showboating, the makers for whatever reason forgot to look after the core storyline. The plot is quite unstable, it is indeed inconsistent and is certainly plagued with an awful lot of expositions and pointless maneuvers. Most importantly, it doesn't seem to provide any of the thrill or the suspense a film of this stature requires or rather insists upon!

title: Just awful
text: Apart from the terrible script, terrible story line and just awful acting.The return of original cast members don't really add anything to the story or the overall outcome, not to mention the T Rex from the original movie as well....again nothing but nostalgia for franchise fansI went in to this movie with very little expectation after the last couple but I honestly didn't think that this one would be as bad as it was. Chris Pratt in his huge popularity couldn't save this car crashAnd one last thing, I need someone to tell me how it's possible for a movie to look so much worse than the original one made three decades ago. It shouldn't be possible.

title: Disappointed that it didn't live up to the other films
text: Overall it was decent and I enjoyed the old cast meeting the new. But it felt very underwhelming with the plot and action. I think more time was spent trying to do all the storylines rather than more creativeness and action.

title: Disappointing
text: Another case of a film better left unmade- just designed to suck money out of people. Actors were great, story was just a rehash of everything before.

title: A perfectly paced dino action with an unexpected storyline and mind blowing visual and sound effects.
text: This was amazing. On the genetic aspect the movie might be thin but on the ecological aspect this movie hits hard. The way it depicts the beauty of evolution and the importance of coexistence is incredible. Coexistence is something humanity needs to do with the rest of the planet to achieve balance and prevent all the world threatening problems. I know that there are a lot of negative reviews about this movie but what I am saying is this movie conveys a really tough message. It is a true science fiction film not like the superhero movies which are made just for entertainment. It not just a movie it's an emotion.

title: Passable
text: The best thing I can really say about this movie is that isn't as bad as the previous one... It's just a passable action flick with a pretty weak story and an uneven pace.

title: So embarrassing for everyone involved
text: Dialogue and plot are simply a disaster. Every good rule of the Spielberg era was ignored. I'm especially sorry for the original cast members as it's just painfully embarrassing to watch them play in this movie. What Jaws 4 was to Jaws, Jurassic World 1-3 is to Jurassic Park. And such a director and author get paid millions. Disgusting.I don't know where Spielberg was but definitely not on that set and apparently not in the editing room, too.

title: Nostalgic and enjoyable, that's it I'm afraid!
text: The Jurassic Park movies used to be about cracking boundaries, whether that was by scientifically bringing back dinosaurs, or showing us that we can enjoy a movie about monsters eating people whilst still feeling small and real and have that out of worldly feeling. I'm afraid in this instalment, the only new ground being struck is the fact that we see all of these beloved characters interact together for the first time, and then appropriately be chased by dinosaurs.

title: A tolal waste of time
text: This is one of the worst dinosaur related movies ever. This movie is like bland mashed potatoes and analy destructive spicy food at the same time. It feels like they made this movie for brain dead people and they filmed this only on Monday mornings when all the people involved had a hangover.

title: Evil Tim Cook
text: Terrible acting. Horrendous and ridiculous story and hardly any dinosaurs.Evil Tim Cook's acting was so terrible it was laughable.Total mess of a final movie. Skip this one.

title: Disappointed
text: This is my least favorite of all the Jurassic park movies. There are some scenes i could say are great but that's all, only some scenes, I thought because it was last one they could it did something amazing like other franchises but I was so wrong.

title: Quickly
text: TERRORble. My new word just for this movies. It really encompasses all aspects including acting, directing, music and plot.Like anything in an inflationary environment, you get poor value for bloated costly actors and the Hollywood industry. Go see Maverick....a properly done sequel.

title: Epic, beautiful, scary, and has some ridiculousness at times!
text: Mixed bag of greatness and mediocre. A really enjoyable blockbuster for what it is, has some poor dialogue in some scenes and a little cheesy bits with the boss of Bryson. The cast though is excellent, cinematography is amaze balls, and there's plenty of awesome high budgeted action sequences throughout. I loved a lot of it though I must say it's great fun especially in IMAX! There was even a great Q&A I got to see was silly when someone said finally when that ended I was thinking why pay for the longer version with extras if you don't want to see that aspect some don't make sense. I crave any special feature I'd work on film if I could and I'd say Jurassic World: Dominion is a worth seeing.

title: Disappointed
text: Laura Dern and Sam Neill are terrible. Could have done without them in the movie. Dern gives the worst performance I've seen on the big screen in a long, long time. Her action looked forced and reminds me of a high school freshman in drama class. Sam Neil looks lost in all his scenes. Could have done without both of them in the movie.Jeff Goldblum was the opposite and made the best of a badly written movie. At least his parts were entertaining.The movie was disappointing for it could have /even so much more.

title: Jurassic Grasshopper
text: Grasshopper... that's all I have to say.It tells me the review needs to be 150 characters so, I'd say this is the 4th to 5th best Jurassic movie there is. If you want to watch a movie about dinosaurs this isn't the one.

title: Decent just decent
text: I will say this movie doesn't fail to keep you entertained with the entry of so many new dinosaur species. I would say that this movie is still pretty good apart from having a few corny bits sprinkled in.

title: why would you even give a green light for something like this?
text: It's absolutely unwatchable. Scenes alter with no logical storyline, original characters are introduced like in a '90s sitcom, it's a new era of Jurassic World where we all live together, and it just does not make any sense. It feels like something made this movie, and it wasn't a human being. Like a deep fake.It is worst than the first Jurassic World film, and that one was pretty bad. Pratt is below average in both.I'd rather rewatch Spielberg's original masterpiece, or reread the book. Or just sit and stare at the wall.

title: What happens when pacing slows down
text: Going into it I knew this was not gonna be an amazing movie. I could tell they were running out of ideas and didn't know what to do. One problem I had was the pacing. Unlike it's 2018 counterpart (Jurassic World fallen Kingdom). This movie is just to slow and incredibly boring when action is not going on. The introduction of the new characters's were not as likable as I wanted them to be and to me should have been fleshed out more. But when the action scenes happened, those were the best parts of the movie. The sequence in Malta was very cool and entertaining and what I thought Dominion was gonna be like. Another thing that I liked were the resurrection of old characters. Without giving too much away Ellie, Allen and Malcom we're by far the best part of this movie. The old and new characters did blend well and I thought they fit together enough to create a good cast of characters. As a diehard fan of the series, I thought the movie was mediocre. But, it did what it was supposed to and had nice callbacks to the original Jurassic Park and was good enough to end mine, and others, childhood movie series.

title: Welcome - to This Boring Park
text: Most of the original cast is reunited, and they still sparkle together. Pratt and Howard reprise their decent onscreen chemistry. The special effects are bigger than ever, the casting is fairly solid, the audience only expects a mindless popcorn movie anyway. What could go wrong? How about a screenplay so convoluted, loud, and boring that the whole thing falls apart?Jurassic World: Dominion (JWD) is yet another example of how Hollywood is handing multibillion-dollar franchises to inept, unqualified screenwriters. Like so many other high-profile, big-budget theatrical releases and streaming series from about 2017-2022, the screenwriters don't seem to understand how real people interact with each other or form sentences. JWD is a collection of digital set pieces in which human actors spout one-liners while jumping away from CG monsters. Dialogue is on the nose and frequently describes what we already see onscreen. Stock villains from sci-fi, westerns, 80s action flicks, and spy capers abound. None of it matches up coherently.This nonsense can be fun when an overall story doesn't take itself too seriously (I actually enjoyed the incredibly goofy take on Kong-versus-Godzilla in 2021); but JWD takes on heavy-hitting subjects such as global warming, the worldwide food chain, a child's life, an important baby dinosaur, black-market weapons dealers, and -wait, did I lose you?Everything is loud! And important! Right now! Immediately! And just like a loud storm can eventually lull you to sleep, about 45 minutes into the movie, you won't care what happens; and you'll realize there's still 1-1/2 hours to slog through to the end.I gave it two stars for a handful of animatronic/puppet dinosaurs (always nice to see a real prop when the other dinosaurs look like cartoons), plus a clever throwaway gag involving the original cast and a loud espresso machine.

title: Good, but predictable
text: I really enjoyed this movie. I went to see it with my cousins a couple days ago, and I liked it.However, it's just too predictable. I always knew what was gonna happen a minute before it actually did, taking away the charm that this movie was supposed to have.

title: Dino Rampage Done Pretty Well
text:
I have reached at a phase in my life where I have learnt to be unbiased in my judgement of films even if it features my favourite stars. But like everything other facet of life, this principle also has its exceptions - I cannot help but be biased about the Jurassic Park films and there are several factors contributing to that bias:
1. My love for films kick-started with "Jurassic Park" (the first film I had watched at a theatre, way back in 1994) and that film and most of its scenes have become iconic over the years - a feat unmatched by any monster film of the past and the present.2. Having watched the original in 1994, the child has ever since been fascinated by the jaw-dropping, awe-inspiring dinosaurs. They had occupied a world of fantasy for the kid who was by nature an introvert. From collecting dino toys to owning dino t-shirts, I have done it all and continue to do it now, when given a chance, as I am still preoccupied by these mighty beasts.3. The sequels and the spin-offs to the original have had hits and misses in them, never touching the iconic moments of the original but have always continued to be watchable even now. I didn't like "Jurassic Park III" but I have never overlooked it, having watched it multiple times as well. Despite the flaws, they define an integral part of my childhood and every new film is a stroll down the lanes of nostalgia for this 31-year old guy. They are special to me, no matter what.Jurassic World: Dominion takes place four years after the cataclysmic events of the previous film and the dinosaurs are out in the human world. They are colliding into one another and learning to live together as well. Metaphor for COVID-19? Yes, could be. The film also touches on issues like food scarcity and plagues and the side effects of bioengineering in agriculture. It is in some of these moments in the first half that the film suffers from pacing issues and from lack of being in a tight knot. But once the pre-interval scene comes up, the film changes track. The scene changes to the park and the essence of Jurassic Park is back. There are numerous dinosaurs, scene after scene, some new (like the Therizinosaurus, the Pyroraptor, the Atrociraptor, and the big daddy of them all - the Giganatosaurus) and some old (like the Velociraptors, the Tyrannosaurus Rex, the venom-spitting Dilophosaurus, Brachiosaurus, Triceratops, among many others) - a dream world for a dino lover like me. The cinematography is jaw-dropping and the mixture of special effects and animatronics seal the deal effectively well. Despite the flaws in the screenplay, the film is salvaged by the breathtaking second half. Among the actors, Bryce Dallas Howard gets the best character arc and newcomer DeWanda Wise turns in a commendable performance. But it was great fun to watch the OG cast - the dynamics between the trio of Alan, Ellie, and Ian can beat any newcomer, after all they are the heart of the franchise and it was worth having them to close the chapters on dinosaurs forever.

title: Awful Plot
text: This plot was so god awful and was bad to watch throughout this film. I'm very disappointed in this movie as I expected huge things and really looked forward to it but my expectations were shot down and I didn't really enjoy this at times. There was some good moments at times but overall I didn't really like this one.

title: Bad!
text: Bad writing, full of cliches, some scenes are just plain stupid. The expectation from title or trailer is that this is a post-apocaliptic movie set Jurassic Park universe, but in reality this is bad spy movie, with dinosaurs as motorcycles and rogue agents. This is a perfect example of how you could ruin a beloved and nostalgic universe. If it was up to me writers and producers of this movie would never get another job in film industry. Disgrace! All of the stars in the movie can't do anything, can't save it. There is lack of logic in every event that happens in the movie.Like, one in the beginning, the girl gets scared of the raptor outside the house, literally 2 minutes after she grabs her bike and goes to ride.Also world where dinosaurs and human are roaming the earth is too calm. Seems like this movie was made by radical creationists who teach kids that Noah had dinosaurs on his arc.

title: Too long and very predictable, but good dinosaur fun.
text: To start with the 5 main cast members seemed to be paying tribute to the franchise and banking their cheques rather than adding anything new. Jeff Goldblum was especially guilty of this and at times you could almost imagine he was merging his character from Independence Day. The bright spots in the cast were DeWanda Wise as Kayla and Isabella Sermon as Maisie who brought freshness and some multi-dimensionality to their characters.The story seemed to have been patchworked together from a series of unrelated set pieces and the whole of the Malta segment could have been missed out without impacting the story, saving about 15-30 minutes of the running time.Plot lines seem to have been cobbled together from a random selection of films, leaning heavily on Schwarzenegger's Commando and Predator, but with a bit of Alien thrown in and a major homage to Indiana Jones, plus a bit of the James Bond Tomorrow Never Dies with the motor cycling segment.However, saying all that the film was unadulterated dinosaur fun despite it's predictability and lack of story telling. It finished off the franchise much as the Rise of Skywalker did to Star Wars, but does not leave you wanting more.As a final comment, I saw Jurassic Park in Reykjavik with Icelandic subtitles in 1993, and this is the only other one I've seen in a cinema. If was on a small screen I would not have survived to the end.

title: Confusing as hell...
text: Boy is it a confused film. Not because of the storyline, but because it is genuinely all over the place.There is good: the original and new teams in the same film. A different premise, which sort of makes sense. Some heart stopping action sequences (with caveats). Certainly not boring.The negatives. Even more preposterous than it should be. Yes, it obviously IS preposterous, but some of the occurrences are laughable. Some of the action is painful. Claire doing Jason Bourne over the rooftops? Oh well, no high heels. Some great CGI, some not so much. Tbh the ORIGINAL cgi was more believable.Perhaps just too much, all in all. 7 May be generous, but the excitement just about makes it worthwhile. The original Spielberg is still by far the best, by a big margin.

title: I just want my two hours back
text: This movie simply does not need to exist. It is aimed at nobody: New fans don't care about the legacy characters, the original fans don't care about domesticating raptors and big locusts. The effects are still worse than in the first one from >30 years ago. The environmentalistic message is even more on the nose and mispresented than in the last one.This movie believes in nothing, it stands for nothing and the worst part: It entertains no one. It is an empty shell of a movie. It isn't a work of art, it is box ticking product No. 3 in the "franchise". I'm just so over all this. And I think the gernal audience is fed up as well.

title: It was alright to say the least
text: Some of these reviews, I can't seem to fathom or understand. I just watch the movie, and I seemed to have enjoyed it. I wasn't expecting it, as most were. I was surprised with how the director and writers of the movie were gathering most of the past Jurassic park characters together. That was fun to watch. However, what I was disinterested about was the fact that the movie took nearly an hour to build up its action, which was half of its timing. However, that wasn't much of a bug for me. Nonetheless, it was a fun ride and overall, it was a decent movie. Don't listen to some of these reviews!! You enjoy it.

title: A sad way to end a saga
text: Feels like a school team project where everyone did their part at home and then the team leader assembled the pieces one hour before the deadline... there was just too much people, too little dinosaurs and lots of unfinished stories, a very sad way to end a saga...the only fun part were the callbacks to the original movie..First time reviewing a movie

title: Not as good as it was before
text: This is high budget movies so I expected more from this movies. Quite disappointed. This story is predictable and not suspense much like previous sequel. However still good acting and props. Maybe scriptwriting need to improve storyline so not so clich.

title: No
text: What a horrid movie. One of the few movies that unfortunately made it in the 1 billion dollar club. Jurassic World was fun despite its flaws, Fallen Kingdom was just kind of eh, but this is an absolute disaster. It's just sunk down a downward spiral that leads to hell. It's bad enough to the point I'm pretty convinced it was made more for money than it was for an actually good movie, and that's sad. I don't care for this movie or this franchise anymore; the creative team leaders certainly didn't so why should I? One year later and nobody talks or cares about it. But sadly people will take advantage of the money they made and make some more Jurassic Park garbage. Why did people flock to see it, WHY?!? Everybody I've talked to who watched it instantly regretted buying tickets for this and not some other movie. What a piece of garbage.

title: Excellent ending, not sure what others watched.
text: I love this movie, its a great ending to the series (or at least this storyline). Lost of cameos and lore that tie even more things together. Got to see alot of new things to enjoy. I especially enjoyed how the very end was because I wasn't sure how they would go about it.I feel the biggest reason the movie(s) are disliked is young people today think they are all movie critics and follow the Oscars. Thus they think the only good movie is something that is Oscar worthy. Movies exist to entertain us, not just win awards.JP/JW were never super deep movies with deep stories, deep lines and deep everything. They were your normal summer fun films. The kind you just shut off your brain for and enjoy. If you liked all the movies so far, you will also enjoy this one. That simple.Again, ignore the very bad reviews since they obviously are not able to just enjoy a movie and have fun. And to note, actually read the popular negative reviews, they all mention the hated the movies are predictable, ignore issues with plotholes...etc. Then they say the only good things about the movies are "they are fun". See? The movies are about fun and they don't like they are fun, to them fun is not enough. Hence the reviews are so bad, people lost the ability to have fun.

title: Don't judge this movie based on the reviews
text: We watched the first 5 Jurassic films and except of part 2 we enjoyed all of them thoroughly, so we didn't want to miss this one. Part 2 was a bit boring.I've read the reviews before we watched this film and think they don't do this movie any justice. Neither is the 6th Jurassic film boring nor is there a dinosaur attack every 3 minutes. People tend to exaggerate. Don't take them serious.Part 6 has Laura Dern, Ed Neill, Jeff Goldblum, and the two major actors from the previous films reunited and we also see Blue, the cute raptor. She now has a baby and the scenes with Blue and the baby are particularly touching.What I also enjoyed about this 6th part was for one thing the filming locations (Malta) and lots of new dinosaur types in close up scenes.Forget about all these lousy reviews, simply give it a chance and enjoy this truly entertaining movie!

title: Rawr
text: I absolutely had a blast seeing this dinosaurs flick! It's heavy on nostalgia but it's fun! It was a lot of fun to see the mix of both the new and the old. I'm sad to see this series is over! Overall not perfect but such a awesome cinematic experience!

title: The worst in Dinosaur Franchise!!!
text: They try so hard to make it more exciting, complex and fun. But sorry it's confusing. To put old cast with the new ones is a good idea but the story is not strong enough to make me believe that they belong together. It's just weak!!!

text:
I cant belive what im about to write,
so first off,before i will tell anything your about to think im dumb.this film was better then jurassic park. I know im suprise you.But this film just has it all

but melcolm role here was felt kind small very sad he didnt got a big role but exsept it it was perfectrun!!

title: Terrible
text: Who green lit this crap? This is not the Jurassic Park/World we all know and love. This is some CIA operative action flick with underground dinosaur markets and new terrible characters that make no sense. Yes, they bring back the old characters, but they are used in a completely different type of side story. The "bad guys" are an added part that just take over the story. So this movie is less about dinosaurs and more about bad people trying to take over the world. Nothing saves this movie. I am so glad we watched this when it was free cause it's absolutely terrible! Don't waste your time. Just to reach the max words needed, again, it's terrible!!

title: Could have been more
text: Well, well, well. I had so much hope for this movie, I anticipated something really grandiose, but it derailed somewhere.The plot itself was mediocre, but it was obvious, these movies are not really about the plot itself. Maybe, it could have been better with less character lines. I know, I know, it had a great feeling that everyone came back again, and we had new faces, but because of that it became superficial.CGI itself, good as always. The dinosaurs were great, their movement, fight scenes and the landscapes as well where we could find them. However I could not understood, why they had to finish the movie with that fight scene. I don't really see the point in it, but it is my problem.2,5 hours of playing time. Too much, definitely. You get so many boredom parts in the movie, which scenes are not neccessary in my opinion. I was anticipated a little more fights with that screen time.Overall, it was not the worst movie ever, but definitely the worst, out of the 3 movies. I don't regret that I spent money on it, but it is not going to become my favourite. If you have some superfluous time and money, it worth a movie ticket.

title: Review bombing much?
text: Wow, is anyone really surprised that review bombing is becoming the new past time for people who have nothing better to do? This movie rules. Please do not listen to all these negative reviews. This is easily one of the best films in the franchise!

title: Just enjoy and Don't over think it.
text: Ignore the haters,it's not a great masterpiece but it's fun. I really liked all the Easter eggs and it was great to see the old cast back. Worth the money to see on the big screen. Don't understand the hate because it's non stop action and a fun ride.

title: Not as Entertainingly Bad as the Previous, But Still BAD
text: A lot of apologists for the previous Jurassic World movie, assured people that it was just a "bridge" movie. "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom" may have been a bad movie, but it was doing the leg work so that we'd finally get the movie where dinosaurs are loose and running amuck around the world. That is what the series had been teasing since "Lost World". That is what all the advertising for this movie promised. Those promos that Colin Trevorrow directed where dinosaurs were attacking at campgrounds and weddings. Finally, dinosaurs loose in the cities, not just confined to an island or reserve. So, what does this movie do? Start with most of the dinosaurs captured and put onto islands and reserves. The main villains of this movie aren't dinosaurs, they're locus. Why do you do this movie? Why do you lie to us?The movie follows Owen and Claire from the previous movies. Tagging along with them this time is the clone girl from the end of the last one. The movie makes the bold choice to make this clone girl an obnoxious brat that the audience actively roots against.The three "legacy characters" played by Jeff Goldblum, Laura Dern and Sam Neil feel like they are in a completely different movie. They are in a corporate espionage movie and Chris Pratt and them, are in a jungle survival movie. Despite what the marketing may imply the two groups don't spend much time together.This "Jurassic World" franchise has been a mess. Characters act completely different from movie to movie. The plots don't seem to have any coherent narrative through line. The dumb rules they make up for these dinosaurs change from movie to movie. But the dinosaurs look pretty cool.At this point the movies are passed the bad of being funny bad, they're just depressing bad.

title: Money burning challenge: a million dollars per minute
text: Jurassic World Dominion is an uninspired corporate product designed by a committee based on various graphs and research results from the test groups.They did the basic scheme of 1) Pour a lot of money into a known IP; 2) Dust off the actors from 25 years ago; 3) ...; 4) Profit.A very costly but uninspired undertaking. Only the product design team and the CGI crew showed their bests. The actors knew what they were getting into, and this shows. It's slow, full of cliches and self-repeats. Nobody is trying. The message the film solidifies in the end was already solidified in 5 previous movies.I don't want to dig deeper into this. There is no point. It bored me to death, and all the shots of the old cast with nostalgic music made me feel angry and manipulated. I can't rate this either. Rating this film a 1/10 would offend everyone who worked on it, but I can't give it more.The best thing about this film was that it created jobs and paid people for their work. Thanks for that.Not recommended.

title: Breath taking visuals
text: The movie is a 6 however one has to acknowledge the skills and hard work of those involved with creating this visual masterpiece. The story wasn't much but I suspect the makers had a larger audience in mind considering school's out, and kept it simple.

title: Sattler-light of Love.
text: I didn't much like "Fallen Kingdom". I thought that it replayed the various facets of the series that we'd seen before, just in a remixed fashion. I did say that I though that the ending might tease a possibility of something a bit different for the next film. It did, a bit, and whilst I wouldn't say Dominion was a good film, I don't think it's as bad as the last one, or as the critics have generally suggested.With the technology of dino genes now in the hands of Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott) and his company Biosyn, the world has come to an uneasy alliance with the escaped dinosaurs now forming part of everyday life. Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) is investigating a swarm of giant locusts, that are threatening the very ecostructure of the planet and believes that Biosyn are involved. She convinces Alan Grant (Sam Neill) to join her on a visit. Biosyn have never stopped looking for Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon) and when one of their spies kidnaps her, Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard) undertake a rescue mission.I mean, just to reiterate, I didn't think that this was great - but I went in with expectations so low that when it turned out to be alright I was pleasantly surprised. The dinosaurs in unusual environment sections are interesting, particularly the scenes in Malta. Towards the end we settle back into more familiar environment, a "lost world" jungle setting and science labs. I thought the integration of the two-story strands was OK, and it was nice - if not particularly thrilling - to see the old cast and new interacting. The look of the film is good, with nice camera work and CGI creatures.There are aspects that I didn't like, particularly from the ending, without spoilers when the Dinosaurs of different species teamed up in the finale of "Jurassic World" I thought it was a bit stilly - and I still think that now. I felt it was a bit disappointing when, given the freedom of the whole world, to go to a laboratory near a remote jungle. It's another organisation that thinks they can control nature but whose shiny facility is quickly torn to bits when things go wrong. I also cannot make myself care about the clone human storyline, sorry.Again, I don't think it's bad - just a bit too much stuff that you've seen before.

title: Too much going on
text: Too much of everything. Too much political drama, too many dinosours everywhere, too many characters that you are supposed to care about (but you don't). It would have been better to kill a few of them off early on to add some tension.Because the dinosours are everywhere it has a numbing effect and you don't even care when they appear.The kid is super annoying. The only positive thing about the movie is all the beloved characters from earlier movies including Dr. Grant and Ellie (although neither can save the movie). I wish the movie had just mainly focused on these two and Ian, it would have been enough and added nostalgia.This was by far the worst of the franchise I would say. All the other movies were at least OK, I've even seen all of them at least once in spite of serious flaws.

title: Jurassic World Dominion a fun night out. Ignore the haters.
text: I went to see Jurassic World Dominion last night in IMAX and was surprised at just how much I enjoyed it. I wasn't expecting to like it, but I actually like it so much that I want to see it again on the big screen.Sure, the return of old characters are in place to give fan service to those of us who love the original movie. And ok, the story line is a little light. But if you can get past these 2 minor issues, you will really enjoy the movie. Laura Dern and the rest of the cast all look great, and Jeff Goldblum plays his best Jeff Goldblum since Thor: Ragnarok. Everyone clearly had alot of fun making this movie.The stars of the movie are of course, the Dinosaurs, and wow the artists and wizards behind the scenes really went all out this time. At a time where we are all used to VFX and where they can all seem kind of bland, Dominion really takes things to the next level. I don't quite understand what I am seeing, but the level of realism has been turned up to 1000. I wish I could describe it better.There are a few scenes which really stood out. A scene with Bryce Dallas Howard's "Clair Dearing" being chased though city streets and buildings by a Dinosaur, all seemingly shot with hand-held cameras, was especially well done.Anyway, ignore the haters and treat yourself.

title: Just horrible
text: No resemblance to anything related to the franchise. Please disregard this mess and hopefully they will make another actual Jurassic park movie to finish the series. No excuse for this crap.

title: Did not expect much from it.
text: Well, I am not surprised by the output of this movie as I did not expect much from it in the first place.This movie follows the same routine of Jurassic World (2015) and Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018), popcorn movies and nothing more.Out of the 6 Jurassic Park and Jurassic World movies, the very first Jurassic Park movie (1993) was the most exciting and valuable one to watch.

title: Giganotosaurus is NOT the largest carnivore!
text: Spinosaurus is the largest carnivore then Giganotosaurus but despite the movie being wrong, this movie was weak in all aspects. Of course, I expected some wokeness in the film. Jeff Goldblum was the only reason I watched this. Only the first two Jurassic movies were good. 3, was ok but too short & was the shortest of the series but it was cool to see Spinosaurus. 4 was mediocre & should have ended there. 5 & this one was trash.

title: Pretty much what you'd expect
text: Lots of dinosaurs, action and explosions. It felt like quite a long couple of hours. I thought is was an OK movie and contained all the Jurassic sequel elements you'd expect, but that was about it. I feel pretty bad leaving this as a review considering there was obviously 'no expense spared' in the making of this film and the cast that was put together to bring it to the big screen. But in short it was just OK, not one I'll be looking out for when it if released onto streaming channels.

title: I'd rather visit the dentist
text: I had a tooth extraction yesterday and I had a better time at the dentist than watching this film. It's that bad, how did the stars agree to such madness...save your money don't waste 2.5 hours of your life.

title: Disappointment
text: The film is not bad but it disappointed me. New and historical characters are not used convincingly, and history has bored me. A disappointing film that does not end the Jurassic World saga as it should.

title: Most entertaining sequal since the original
text: I enjoyed this one more then any other sequal before this. It's got everything. The sleazy (Tim Cook clone) villain just nails it for me. The CGI effects are better then most of ot's current competition. It cotains some solid action scenes and a few subtle funny moments as well. Though it could have been a little better if they wrapped it up within two hours. It's just a little too long. And, though the story is a bit predictable, it's different from it's predecessors. So if you just want to enjoy yourself without expecting a believable or deep storyline then this one's for you! I recommand this one even if you only saw the original. It simply does the job in serving it's purpose.

title: A satisfactory conclusion to both the "Park" and "World" stories that should hold fans over until the inevitable future installments
text: "Jurassic World: Dominion" is the third "Jurassic World" film and the sixth film in the "Jurassic Park" series. Directed and co-written by Colin Trevorrow ("Safety Not Guaranteed", "The Book of Henry"), it is a satisfactory conclusion to both the "Park" and "World" stories that should hold fans over until the inevitable future installments.Four years after the events of "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom", Isla Nublar has been destroyed by a volcano and dinosaurs have now escaped into the real world. As a result, the future of the planet is in doubt since these once extinct creatures are reclaiming the Earth, making life increasingly difficult for all the other human beings and animals who are forced to co-exist alongside them. In an effort to curb this problem, a secret experiment involving more genetic engineering is underway in a secluded location, which, if successful, will allow humanity to regain its place at the top of the food chain and keep these ancient beasts under control.Since the release of the first film back in 1993, the "Jurassic Park/World" series has had an interesting run among filmgoers. The original featured groundbreaking special effects, a great cast of memorable characters, and that iconic John Williams musical score to help cement it as one of the most iconic films of the 90s. On the other hand, all of the sequels have yielded less favourable results in terms of entertainment value, ranging from decent popcorn flicks to downright insulting to longtime fans. It seems the one that started it all has simply set the bar so high that everything else following it looks so poor in comparison. After almost three decades, the story that began so long ago finally draws to a close here in "Jurassic World Dominion", which ends things on a fairly acceptable note.I've never been one to take the "Jurassic Park/World" films too seriously considering their entire premise is pretty farfetched. I mean, how seriously can you really take the concept of bringing dinosaurs back to life using mosquito blood and frog DNA? But despite that, I still find them highly entertaining for what they are, and that is watching dinosaurs wreaking havoc and exposing the hubris of humanity. I still remember being wowed by the original film as a kid and rewatching it as an adult made me realise how well it holds up today. "Jurassic World Dominion", which is intended to be the final film in the franchise to focus around the initial story set up in 1993, features all of this and then some, so if that's what you're craving, the film delivers just that.For the most part, this film's effects look pretty good but still not as good as how they did back in the 1993 film. This is because that one used animatronics for whenever the filmmakers showed the dinosaurs up close and CGI only for when they were seen at a distance. However, since the first "Jurassic World" film back in 2015, the animatronics appear to have been completely discarded in favour of entirely CGI dinosaurs, which I have mixed feelings about. Sure, some of the computer-generated dinosaurs seem naturally integrated into a shot but others look so obviously added in during post-production that they stick out like a sore thumb. I understand that it's cheaper to use CGI nowadays but if these modern filmmakers truly wanted to leave an impression on viewers, then they should have at least used some animatronics wherever possible.One major problem I had with this film was its bloated second act. Without giving away spoilers, all I will say is that there are three different stories going on at once, each with a different emotional feeling. For example, one moment we might see characters being chased by dinosaurs through a busy city street and then immediately after we'll see a slow paced scene of expository dialogue that feels shoehorned in there for storytelling purposes. These parts would have worked out better if they each had some kind of overarching link to one another but instead these weird shifts in tone causes the film drag at the most inopportune times. This is where I started to lose interest in the human side of the story and wished everyone would just meet up with one another already just to get things over with.I do think the film made good use of the idea of humans and dinosaurs being made to co-exist with one another. Some people are shown trying to rescue the dinosaurs to take care of them while others trade them on the black market as exotic pets. There are also a number of brief but well-shot scenes of a group of triceratops and elephants walking side-by-side along the African Serengeti as well as some large pterosaurs patrolling the skies of New York City, with some even settling nests on the tops of skyscrapers. I guess I just like seeing such a jarring juxtaposition of the old and new inhabitants of the world being forced to live in the same eco-system, but at the same time being reminded that this is not the natural order of things. It's like what Dr. John Hammond (Richard Attenborough) said at the end of "The Lost World: Jurassic Park" in that "...these creatures require our absence to survive, not our help".As a pair, both Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard were fun dual protagonists as Owen and Claire, but they are rarely shown doing anything solo in this film. Though I liked that the two were a loving couple at first, I would have preferred if we could have seen them do things on their own to allow for their characters to develop individually, instead of being two inseparable halves throughout most of the film. Additionally, the young Isabella Sermon felt like she was going to waste as Maisie Lockwood, the pair's adoptive daughter. Maisie never felt like an actual fleshed-out character but rather a plot device used to advance the film forward until the climax. It's a shame because I saw potential in her back in the conclusion of "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom", but I suppose that was never meant to be.It was also nice to see the original trio of Sam Neill, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum return after almost 30 years as Dr. Alan Grant, Dr. Ellie Sattler, and Dr. Ian Malcolm, respectively. Though their reunion here is based entirely on nostalgia, their presence at least helped elevate the film above what could have been a forgettable conclusion to this long-running series. Again, like with the dinosaurs and humans, I liked the juxtaposition of the three characters from the "Park" films with the new "World" ones of Owen and Claire. There was something satisfying about watching the five of them work together to outsmart the dinosaurs with their different levels of general knowledge in their respective fields, whether it be Dr. Grant's palaeontology or Owen's ability to communicate with Velociraptors.Although it's clear by now the series has run its course, I will admit that for all intents and purposes, I've enjoyed watching all six of these "Jurassic" films for the popcorn entertainment they are. Through the good and bad, I have nonetheless loved seeing how the filmmakers made dinosaurs live again and had them roar their deafening roars. But if you ask me, the series needs to go on a lengthy hiatus before we ever see these cretaceous creatures on the big screen again. Though knowing what a cash cow the franchise has become (like a certain sci-fi series set in a galaxy far, far away), it's only a matter of time before Universal Studios decides to milk it even further with spin-offs, prequels, video games, etc. Until then, let's just appreciate what we've got for now.I rate it 6.5/10.

title: The end of Jurassic Park
text: Sorry, this is just awful. The story line and plot are just bad. It is unfortunate, because it had a really great cast and a lot of potential. It honestly didn't even feel like it was a film about dinosaurs. Too many subplots and pedestrian narratives at play.

title: Wasn't the epic conclusion they hyped it up to be
text: I love the original movie, and I thought The Lost World was a great sequel. While Jurassic Park 3 certainly has its flaws, it still felt like a "Jurassic Park" movie to me. I grew up watching these movies.Let's go back to the year 2015, after 14 years of rumors of another JP movie with the most bizarre concepts (Google them, they're out there) being tossed around, they finally landed on Jurassic World. I couldn't believe they finally figured out a script and production had actually happened. The movie was done. Finally!Well, after waiting all those years I went to see Jurassic World opening night, I couldn't have been more excited to finally see it. Was it good? Eh. There some moments that were good, but the overuse of CGI watered it down. Training raptors to follow commands? What happened to the blood thirsty raptors from the first 2 movies? Now they take orders from humans?Then we have Fallen Kinngdom. I really enjoyed the tension of the opening scene. The flash of lightning that shows Rexy sneak up behind the guy trying to close the gates was chilling. I thought I was in for a treat. Goldblum is wasted in a 4 minute scene... It turned into some convoluted hybrid mess with a terrible subplot to set up for Dominion.Now, we finally get this supposed "epic conclusion" to the franchise that brings back Grant, Sattler and Malcom combined with our new "heroes" and it all sounds good on paper. What we have instead is a giant mess of way too many CGI dinosaur action sequences. I thought Owen riding along side the raptors in the first World movie was bad.... Jeez. There are no great or epic moments, hardly any tension., it's just a bunch of computer animated dinosaurs thrown together on screen just for the sake of it. Unfortunately these movies get worse with each entry, and this is no exception. While we do get a couple nods and homages to the original movie, it just felt forced. Nothing about this movie felt genuine. Even the actors from the original trilogy felt like they were just bored.... And how many times are we going to have raptors encounter people just to have them stop immediately cause they someone put their hand up in front of them.I don't know, go see the movie for yourself, but don't expect any of the magic or charisma that first trilogy brought to the table. What we have is another watered down, CGI fest with no real emotion or thought put behind it. It just felt really stale. Fell flat on its face.

title: JUST NO!
text: Stupid: 400%Acting: IshSoundtrak: hardlyCGI: SubparDialog/ Script: random wordsAction: Lots & lots & lots Everyone is a CIA superspy/expert in everything/ Science/ unarmed combat/ computers.Screaming: lots of it per usual.Dwarma: 1000% through the whole dumbassed mess!I would rather get sunstroke than watch this pile of dino dung ever again! & I thought 2012 was bad!

title: Jurassic World: Dumbinion
text: Without a doubt the worst yet, something to surpass Jurassic Park 3 and Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom, this is the final nail. Such a terrible movie: convenience at every turn, shoehorned in political correctness, and nostalgia treatment of the lowest quality that tries, failingly, to bridge the plot and make sense of what is happening. From boring character to boring character, there was lots of nothing going on. A sad finale, though one that has been long coming.

title: Complete Garbage
text: Worst Jurassic movie I have ever seen there is an unnecessary dinosaur fight every 10 minutes and just when you think the problem is resolved another dinosaur emerges out of nowhere. I can't believe I paid to see that, I'd rather sit on the toilet and watch my pubes grow. I saw my grandad hack up flem this year and jurassic world domination is still number one on my most disgusting watch of 2022 list.Do not even get me started on the clone girl " Charlotte Lockwood" like don't get me wrong the acting must be pretty good because for me to be so physically angered by one character. Do yourself a favour and don't waste your money on watching it because now I have to waste my money on therapy after seeing that.

title: A good Jurassic World sequel
text: It is an entertaining, but long movie entry into the Jurassic World Series. It is intriguing, has good acting, and a story that prolonging itself as it can. You get to see how Mazie (young girl) was born, why is she so important to the scientists, and more dinosaurs as you can predict.

title: Not as good as the previous movies...
text: First of all, when I first watched the official trailer of the movie I really liked it and I was so hyped about it, because I really enjoyed the previous two movies. Eventually, it wasn't as good as I had imagined and it's probably the worst movie of the trilogy. The plot of the 3rd movie was very interesting, mysterious and kinda different then the two previous movies of the franchise. The storyline was kinda well-written and some parts were well-explained, but it wasn't as good as the previous movies. The characters were very interesting, well-developed and really likeable. The filming locations of the movie was the real world, because now the dinosaurs coexist with the humans. Also, it was a very intense movie and full of dinosaur attack scenes, but not as action-filled as the previous ones. The dinosaur's design was as good as the previous movies, the CGI effects were very well edited and they were kinda terrifying. Moreover, the duration of the movie was too long and it was kinda slow paced. In my opinion, it wasn't a nice conclusion of the trilogy, because I expected something way better. The killcount of the movie wasn't bloody, at all and most kills were done off-screen, so nothing explicit was shown. Overall, "Jurassic World Dominion" was just an average sequel, kinda adventurous and I would probably recommend it to my friends. Last but not least, I really hope they're gonna make a 4th movie!

title: Another poor woke infused joke of a movie
text: It is sad to see how poor in their essence, story, and execution the woke movies are. I struggled to watch this to the end. Same distorted narrative about negative vs positive characters that don't reflect any reality. The old characters are lifeless and it is easy to see they don't believe in the plot. I love Sam Neill acting but in this case it was pretty sad to digest his acting. The same has happened to many classics like Starwars. Matrix and others. They became unwatchable.Where are the Hollywood movies of the 20th century that were positive, optimistic, full of life, and fun to watch? I am actually wondering for how long Hollywood can keep this up until money talks and revenues bite. Good luck keeping the audience engaged with these fake stories.

title: Typical storyline but treat to watch
text: Typical storyline of jurassic world. Vfx are also not amazing. But superb mind blowing audio work with the superb clarity of dolby atmos mixing. But still the first jurassic park movie is better than this. The dinosaurs are very realistic though it was 1993. This is not up to the level but nice and treat to watch. Definitely watch in a theatre. Otherwise useless.

title: Cash milking hodgepodge
text: The first half of the movie is a mishmash with too many characters and too many storylines to follow. I wanted a family movie, not a B-rated spy action with some dinosaurs on the back.C. I. A. vs. Mercenaries vs. Other mercenaries who hire more mercenaries... My 7yo watched the motorcycle chase with zero interest and finally asked "wait, who's chasing who again?" My 14yo just gave up, and reached for her iphone.Oh, and let's throw in some old characters into this mess. Because fan service. Cha-ching.It gets better in the second half of the movie, where it all goes back to the "nature + adventure" format. But overall it's still a disaster.P. S. Jeff Goldblum still rocks though.

title: Entertaining
text: I don't agree with people who nitpick. The movie delivered everything you want in a movie. It's entertaining, exciting and contrary to many movies today, actually has an ending. We left the theater happy to have spent the time watching this. Highly recommend and I don't say that lightly.

title: We Got Dodgson Here! Nobody Cares
text: Filled with characters and scenes to capture the nostalgia of 'Jurassic Park', but failed to succeed in the general feeling of the original. They couldn't even keep it in the same genre. 'Dominion' is a straight up action movie, just with dinosaurs. It's more reminiscent of a 'Mission Impossible' movie than a 'Jurassic Park' film. The original was actually full of suspense and terror, even a bit of gore. In this there is really none of that.Grant, Sattler, and Malcolm's return was the saving grace. And actually making Dodgson the antagonist was pretty cool as well. It was a showcase for some new dinosaurs, but otherwise not much else going for it.I will always love this franchise based on the original and how revolutionary it was in filmmaking. I've enjoyed the other films, they look amazing, and they have thoroughly entertained, including this one. But, I'm glad this is the end (for now), because the story telling has run its course, and you can tell it's exhausted. Possibly in 20 years they could look at continuing it in some way, but a very long break is needed.

title: an insult
text: This movie is an insult to its viewers. Last time I felt like this was after watching transformers 2. It is just a giant mess. The story is convoluted and has no meaning. The supposedly scary encounters with the carnivores do not produce any atmospheric impact. Woke messaging of course included as well. This movie shall be remembered as part of the prime degeneracy of hollywood.

title: Almost as good as the original. Solid summer enjoyment.
text: "We're racing toward the extinction of our species. We not only lack dominion over nature, we're subordinate to it." Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum)Jurassic World Dominion may arguably be almost as good as the original. Anyway, it's quite entertaining summer adventure fare with the CGI dinosaurs more realistic than ever, including the biggest carnivore in the world, yes more fearsome than T Rex. The real dinosaurs are the returning veterans Laura Dern, Bryce Dallas Howard, Sam Neill, and the inimitable Jeff Goldblum. You just can't put them down even with the failure of at least two other theme parks.In order to fulfill the rigid requirements of the adventure genre, there must be a serious bad guy, and this Jurassic has Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott). He runs a sanctuary lab that houses homeless dinos but really serves as a platform for world dominion.You got it-the four heroes go through innumerable dino encounters to stop the maniac genius. But enough plot, of which there is nary a nuance, because the relationships of good people throughout are pleasantly emphasized so that we care about each one.We saw this Jurassic in a Phoenix Theater's Dolby Atmos, a splendid screening venue that titillates with sound moving your seat ever so slightly. When the dino stomps, our seats respond with a tingle. So, our Jurassic joy is watching and feeling the best motion pictures have to offer. Together with the most comfortable seats in town, it's a pleasant safari with monstrous animals, some over 60 million years old.The larger point writer/director Colin Trevorrow and writer Emily Carmichael make is about cooperation-be it among family and co-workers or dinos and humans, we have no choice but to work in harmony. Or otherwise, damnation it is or total annihilation. Having lived in the last three years with a microscopic monster, it's nice to see ones big as buildings with the hope that we will survive together, if only in the salutary world of Hollywood dreams.Jurassic World Dominion is a most pleasant way to enjoy a summer night out, even when it hints of extinction:"The doomsday clock might be out of time." Ian Malcolm.

title: Satisfied
text: Not a perfect movie by any means but to me it felt very true to what Jurassic Park is and it was a decent conclusion. They wrapped things up nicely for every character and let me just say it has some amazing shots.

title: After careful consideration, I've decided... not to endorse this movie.
text: The previous films never held a candle to the original but they nevertheless had a cohesive plot we could grasp and follow the characters as they progressed through the dangers of Jurassic Park. I cannot say the same at all about this film. This film has more plot holes and poor character choices than a Steven Seagal film, it makes Jurassic Park 3 look like Citizen Kane. Bringing back the old characters felt more like window dressing out of nostalgia for the 1993 film rather than make them important characters in this film.

title: "Science is about truth"
text: A return of all the originals! What more could you ask for to wrap up the 2nd trilogy? Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum were my highlights. I'm glad it seemed all 6 of the main cast got equal screen time and it wasn't overpowered by the Bryce Dallas Howard and Pratt. TBH, I had completely forgotten the storyline with the girl but overall I thought it was a very fun action Dinosaur movie.

title: A soulless, empty husk of a movie that feels like it was generated by an algorithim
text: Remember the scene with the Brachiosaurus in Jurassic Park? Remember the sense of wonder and excitement you felt? How about the horror and anxiety you felt when the Velociraptors were stalking the children in the kitchen? There is nothing like that in this corporate, bland piece of uninspired trash they call a movie. Somehow they managed to make dinosaurs uninteresting and boring, while completely squandering the talent of Jeff Goldblum, Sam Neill and Laura Dern. It really is a remarkable feat. The film feels like it was designed by an AI. It is a vacuous, empty, soulless experience that absolutely defecates all over the legacy of Jurassic Park and why people loved it in the first place.The writing is abysmal. Locusts and genetically modified children take center stage while the dinosaurs are reduced to flashy CGI showpieces that occasionally pop out to eat somebody or menacingly stalk the main characters before they are tamed by Chris Pratt's magic hands. The entire Malta scene was basically a Mission Impossible knockoff complete with some snazzy British villainess and a car chase. It felt so utterly out of place. Unfortunately once all the main characters get to Apple HQ... I mean Biosyn, the film gets even worse. The entire film feels weightless and empty. There are no stakes, the audience doesn't care about any of the two dimensional characters that are introduced and nothing feels earned. There is no sense of urgency or danger because the movie is too cowardly to kill anyone or put anyone in actual peril. Trevorrow then desperately tries to cram mindless nostalgia down your throat in an effort to mask his horrible film making and complete lack of originality.Some of the dinosaur scenes are cool, but this film just feels like a celebration of mediocrity. The original cast are reduced to parodies of themselves while all the interesting and thought provoking ideas from the first film are thrown out the window in exchange for some mindless plot about GMOs and giant insect swarms. Jurassic Park was good because it was intelligent. It was thought provoking. The dinosaurs were shown sparingly, and the scenes with the human characters were equally as important and interesting. In comparison, Dominion is stupid, bland and unoriginal, and makes Jurassic World look like a masterpiece. And what a waste. The Jurassic World Series had so much potential and it was utterly squandered.I can't even recommend this film as a 'turn off your brain and enjoy the special effects' kind of movie like Transformers or Fast and Furious. This movie is utterly uninteresting, and no amount of CGI dinosaurs can save it from being a total waste of your time and money. It is a Frankenstein Jurassic Park drained of all the magic, warmth and charm of the original. Skip it, and watch the dinosaur scenes on YouTube.

title: dinosaurs and story need their peril factor...
text:
RATED 7/10
Language: EnglishCompared to previous version, this one is little disappointment. But still entertainment to watch. The initial scenes and the dominion was nicely shown, after that it travels to the templated evil scientist and his money minded inventions.If they concentrated more on dinosaurs then the science, it would be sure hit. The dinosaurs become Pet and less dangerous. We can use taser to control the dinosaurs. And some scenes the GFX is clearly visible.One time watchable, if you are expecting pure masala action movie with dinosaurs....

title: Overblown, Underwritten, Too Many Characters, Expensive
text: Banging around to all points on the globe, this synthetic, committee-written, mess recalls too many old characters and introduces too many new characters who take turns being nipped at by expertly created dinos at well-timed intervals. As usual, a rich white man is the source of all evil and characters of various ethnicities and sexual orientations save the day. If it was written by a computer, kudos to the programmer. If it was written by humans, I need to check your papers... and your pulse.

title: Absolutely Loved it.
text: Huge fan of Jurassic Park. Loved the story line and how they were successfully able to connect the past and new characters so well. It was brilliant how they were able to bring back little bits from all the previous movies while adding a new dimension to this one. Such a great film and so worth seeing in theater. It goes to show how great the films have been and how great the fans have been when all the characters are willing to come back for a finale showdown.

title: Watched extended 4k, better then fallen kingdom
text: Ya the movie is kind of dumb and crazy, but also your on #6 of a dinosaur franchise. So ya things are ridiculous but lots of cool action and definitely better then fallen kingdom, that one's just dumb and not much redeeming in it.

title: A movie with lots of dinosaurs but not a dinosaur movie.
text: I am a huge fan of Jurassic Park, always been. The new World series was not great but it had it's moments with a descent plot and dinosaurs being in the centre. I was looking forward to Dominion. Unfortunately, the third and final movie does not deliver and probably is the worst of all. I am not going to go into details but it feels as if someone wanted to record a movie with dinosaurs but lost the essence behind it. The film has a lot of dinosaurs in it, multiple species, but the randomness, poor plot and lack of heart from the director make this a forgettable experience.

title: Boring
text: There's nothing like what those former Jurassic Park sequels. Just hope this is the last. So hollow and pointless. So boring because there's no essence in this movie that's interesting enough to hold our attention. Is put up one hand with palm forward the only way to hold off the dinosaurs, a hand gesture these wild vicious creatures would recognize and start thinking "Hmm, that's an universal traditional friendly STOP sign so popularly accepted by our species not to attack?" "Are these human traffic cops trying to direct our movements?" "No Right Turn on RED?" This is one of the most boring movies so far in 2022.

title: Disappointing end to an era
text: The film starts off a bit disjointed whilst it introduces (and reintroduces) it's characters. I must say it was good to see the original gang together again, and cool to see both generations finally come together towards the end, however by that time it felt like too many characters having to share the scenes.I'm so happy that they used practical effects and animatronics as well as the usual cgi and digital effects. The dinosaurs look just as real as anything else in the film. Great set design too.The big issue I had with this film is the overall lack of dinosaurs. In parts the film felt more like a Mission Impossible film or another generic action movie. Overall they reduced the dinosaurs to background characters.The acting isn't great, and Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard's characters don't have the same chemistry as they did in previous films which is disappointing. The addition of new characters in the final film felt pointless when they had characters from the previous film who weren't used in this one, that could have taken the place of these new additions.There was no real conclusion and this film ended in a similar way to how the previous one did. Some fun Easter eggs to please the fans but overall disappointing for what's meant to be the end of the era.

title: Not as bad as people make it out to be
text: I was turned down by many negative reviews and almost did not want to see this movie.But in the ends its a pretty fun ride. The FX are top notch the story is somewhat, yeah we have seen it before but even then.Its not the best movie ever but its better than the last 2 Jurassic world movies.

title: Now that's a huge piece of s#@*
text:
I went to have fun. It's Colin and millions of dollars. It should be good right....
The story was so convoluted. It was always tense and unease but no threat. It was bad dialogue by a grade actors.The cgi was hit and miss. Some was absolutely spectacular. Others stood out like a saw thumb. And the ending...... It was lack luster.Honestly wait for tv.

title: Just No
text: Whoever made the brilliant decision to give the keys to the Jurassic franchise to Colin Trevorrow and to let him write all three of these atrocities should be fired.It's actually shocking how they are doing exactly what the original film was against. Also bringing back the original cast just so the masses will go "I remember that" and clap like the morons they are is exactly what is wrong with Hollywood films today.These producers "Were So Preoccupied With Whether Or Not They Could, They Didn't Stop To Think If They Should."

title: A downgraded from previous series

The special effect is just average but the stunts are poor.Directorship is below average this time.The story should be re-written because too common, nothing exciting. The director also did not make it good enough to be excited.I cannot give high due to the dropped standard from previous series. The most is 6.5/10 only. This is just another average movie nothing to get really excite and not worth top pay watch in cinema. I only recommend to watch at home with a small charges if you are a fan.

title: Perfect ending to an era of great movies
text:
This movie brought it all to a perfect close
Loved it ! Absolutely loved it! Definitely recommend this movie to any fans ! It's amazing the span of 30 years and it pays homage to all the movies.

title: Not bad but same story

Now , first I will talk about positive things . Nobody will gonna accept that it has very good VFX , it gives reallastic shot second new dinosaures and third that featuring kiddnapping of blue'child . Now , negitave weak polt , same story and predictable action and climax . So if you are interested to watch the flim , you can with your family and don't expect any new thing.
