title: Hot Garbage - Don't waste your money
text: I don't usually write reviews but this movie was so bad I felt I needed too. I was extremely excited for this movie and I should have just walked out. I kept holding on that it might get better, it never did. This is on the worst movies I have seen in recent memory. This movie had absolutely nothing to do with dinosaurs, they were just kind of there while this script chased two different story lines trying desperately to merge them together at the end. Neither of which had anything to do with dinosaurs or co-existing together. That came at the last 5mins. Terrible way to end an otherwise outstanding franchise. Don't waste your money.

title: Horrible writing. Horrible script.
text: What a horrible movie. How much did they spend? All the main charactors did a lousy job in acting. After about 20 minutes I saw four actors looking into the camera (they are supposed to avert or close their eyes). Many of the secondary actors did a nice job, but it is obvious their scripts were poorly written. The best actors in this movie are all the dinasaurs. They did a great job. I am so proud of them.Can I just say stupid, predictable, self-centered kid as usual. One minute on screen and she's complaining, yelling, doesn't care about anyone, etc. Doesn't any of the Hollywood script writers have nice, polite, courteous kids??Is this movie worth watching for all you adults with kids out there. NO. The dinasaur action is great. After that, it is dumb, a poor example for what you want your kid to be, at every corner, it is so predictable AND unrealistic in almost all the action sceens. There is absolutey nothing new in this movie, nothing unexpected (one example; plain crashes into solid ice, buried in the ice, totally destroyed, the two actors jump out unharmed, not a scratch, all makeup intact. Just stupid.But if you have laundry to do, make dinner, vacuum, clean the windows, than this is the movie for you for background noise.Thank you for your time.

title: both gangs team up
text: Greetings again from the darkness. It's been almost 30 years since Steve Spielberg captivated us, and John Hammond (the late Sir Richard Attenborough) "spared no expense" in stunning Dr. Alan Grant (Sam Neill) with our first look at dinosaurs in JURASSIC PARK (1993). Best-selling author Michael Crichton's original characters and ideas have since spun off into THE LOST WORLD: JURASSIC PARK (1997), JURASSIC PARK III (2001), JURASSIC WORLD (2015), and JURASSIC WORLD: FALLEN KINGDOM (2018). We now have this latest franchise entry to cap off the second dinosaur trilogy, and it finds director Colin Trevorrow back at the helm. He also wrote the story and screenplay with Derek Connolly and Emily Carmichael.The big news here (other than the dinosaurs) is the 4-doctor reunion of Dr. Alan Grant (Neill), Dr. Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern), Dr. Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum), and Dr. Henry Wu (BD Wong). It's the first time all of these characters have reunited since the original, and those of us who hold a special place in our movie heart for the transformative 1993 film, are most appreciative of the nostalgic touch. However, the hopes for a magical finale to conclude the franchise are dashed in the film's opening segment ... a cringe-worthy "news" report designed to catch us up four years after the destruction of Isla Numbar, and set the stage for what's to come.You might assume that dinosaurs roaming our planet would be the headliner, but somehow locusts get the nod. Well, they are genetically modified locusts threatening the world's non-Biosyn food supply. See, Biosyn is the evil corporation run by twitchy CEO Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott) that is attempting to control dinosaurs, the food supply, and even human cloning via DNA manipulation. It's that last part that brings Maisie Lockwood (an excellent Isabella Sermon) into the fold, and the DNA-mix also provides an easy punchline to Trevorrow's approach to this final film (blending DNA from the two trilogies). Maisie has been living deep in the Sierra Nevada forest with Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard). When poachers nab both the offspring of Owen's favorite raptor and his quasi-offspring Maisie, the hunt is on. The only question remaining is how are they going to finesse this so that the old crew (Grant and Ellie) collides with the new crew (Owen and Claire)?A stop in Malta to confront smuggler Santos (an impeccably dressed Dichen Lachman) results in the film's most frenetic action sequence. As Owen eludes trained killer-raptors while zipping his motorcycle across streets, alleys, and stairwells, Claire is sprinting (not in high heels) across rooftops like she's Jason Bourne or James Bond. While Owen and Claire deliver the heart-pounding action, Ellie has tracked down Grant on a dig in New Mexico, where he's "educating" a group of teenagers who remain glued to their mobile devices. Ellie convinces Grant to help in her mission to expose Biosyn, but we get the feeling he's making the trip for her, not to save humanity. With an assist from ice-cold pilot-for-hire Kayla Watts (DeWanda Wise), everyone ends in Italy's Dolomite Mountains at Biosyn's stunning headquarters. Slowly the connections become apparent, as it's Malcolm (Goldblum) who is the resident philosopher (all evil corps need one), and the one who has been feeding intel to Ellie.The rest of the movie exists so that all of these characters, along with Biosyn whistleblower Ramsay (Mamoudou Athie) can get in and out of trouble and dodge various stages of peril. The callbacks and nods to previous 'Jurassic' films are numerous. Some work and some don't. Malcolm's sardonic quips are mostly in tune, Grant's grumping and knowledge are spot on, and Ellie has remarkably little to do for someone who is responsible for one of the two main plot lines. Owen and Claire spend the bulk of their non-Malta time consistently recreating the facial expressions that have become all too familiar, though of course, Owen does get to hold out his palm in an attempt at controlling dinosaurs. There is a well-timed small dose of John Williams' iconic score from 1993, but it's the musical work of composer Michael Giacchino who mostly guides us along the way.Credit goes to director Trevorrow for the multiple location shoots around the globe, which helps minimize the set pieces ... most of which disappoint. Especially surprising was the weak CGI effort in the mines as some of the characters end up where they shouldn't be. DNA manipulation run amok is perhaps the underlying theme, but we have to ask why this is ... all we really desire are cool dinosaurs and a story that makes sense. Despite the film's best shot coming at the end - a Mosasaurus underwater - we do hope that, in regards to continuing the franchise, Hollywood doesn't find a way.Opens in theaters on June 10, 2022.

title: Script probably written by a 15yo for diversity reasons.
text: It's a shame they got all those actors back together to waste them on such a script.This movie is a total mess. First half of it, is wasted between boring teenage angst situations and useless scenes in some underground bazaar, where we are introduced to characters that we will never hear from again in the movie and that fulfil no useful role.When the movie finally picks up and we go to the company facilities, where we should have gone much earlier, the movie is again wasted in meaningless heroics, plane crashes without a scratch, swimming through freezing water and such goodies.In the meantime, everything comes too fast and too easy. Everything is there at the moment that is needed and every bad guy, and gal, immediately tell the truth about their purposes at the first question as if we just wanna move quickly to the next scene without adding any depth.This movie has too many characters. They try to give a significant part to each one of them and of course in the end this falls short, as expected when you stretch a script so thin.Maybe they could have saved it if they spent more time in the jungle as we all hoped, but no.This better be the last Jurassic park, before they go the fast and furious way.5/10 and that's generous.

title: Qualifies for the worst movie ever.
text: From the opening seconds onwards this movie is so so so bad and brainless. And it doesn't get better throughout.I seriously thought this is a parody. At least I had a good laugh over how bad this is compared to the original Jurassic Park.

title: Far better than Fallen Kingdom and a worthy conclusion
text: I don't know what people were expecting with this movie and why many seem to be up in arms about it. I am a big fan of the first film and saw it in theaters as a child upon its release. For many, including myself, the magic of that first movie is never going to be topped and it's impossible to think it could be.That said, the second film has always been dull to me (and Jeff Goldblum seemed to be playing a different character than Ian Malcolm altogether). The third has solid moments but some silly ones as well. Jurassic World seemed to rejuvenate the franchise and was a good movie overall, but nothing mind-blowing in my opinion.Then we have Fallen Kingdom, which I believe is easily the worst in the series. Strange plot, terrible pacing, weird directorial choices left and right. The main characters and their motivations seemed completely different than what you would have expected from their portrayal in Jurassic World.That movie also ended with the concept of a world filled with dinosaurs - a point which people seem to be rolling their eyes about, now that Dominion has to address it.This is unfair. Dominion is a movie that must take the plot threads that are limply presented in Fallen Kingdom and then spin a sequel out of them. On top of that, it must weave in the cast of the beloved first film and make a satisfying conclusion out of both stories.And guess what? I think it accomplishes this, and much better than I expected it would. The movie is exciting, well-paced, well-acted, and has far fewer eyeroll moments than the critics would have you believe.At this point, I think you're either along for the ride or you aren't. If you're only casually aware of Jurassic Park and you go into this movie somewhat blind, it would probably seem like a mess of convoluted plot points. But if you're coming off of Fallen Kingdom, this feels like a breath of fresh air and a fun ride.I would honestly rank this movie as the second best Jurassic Park movie, behind the original. And Ian Malcolm's portrayal in this film is perfect, unlike what we got in Lost World. It's a joy to see.

title: Not a single drop of blood. Nuff said.
text: Not scary, not even thrilling. There were kids in the theater and even they were bored.The whole point of Jurassic Park is the fear that the ancient predators are SUPPOSED to invoke. The terror from the original for me came when chars did everything logical and still got eaten. In this, you can out run raptors on foot, hide barely a inch underwater, slowly walk away from a dino as long as there's a car between you, and if you do get cornered without a weapon... just hold out your hand. WTF?! The writers have been watching too much How to Train Your Dragon. Why was the whole movie about locusts and not the dinosaurs?! They could've at least made them carnivorous locusts and had a scene where they stripped a bronto to bones in minutes. At least there's be some real threat in this pointless movie. I'm joking but it might've been a better movie if they took half the human leads out and had Blue the raptor fight her way through all the new species herself.Save your money. Gas, food, and tickets are too expensive now to be wasted on this movie.

title: seen this yesterday in cinemas...
text: Been super hyped and left super impressed. Wasnt surprised about dodgson being a replaced actor though and a menace and dumb***. Also i dont understand the woke negativity of jurassic world 3. As i was completely fine with it and not seeing what the critics saw. The story was brilliant and thrilling and very action packed and menacing. And very adorable. And the legacy and current cast blending is somewhat outstanding. This movie gave me so many memories in many scenes with how the scenes played out. The issue is dont take someone to see a film if they dont understand the story arc. Just dont take anyone with you who lacks interest. Otherwise the experience for you will get ruined. Ive seen all the jurassic films going way back to the first film in 93. The hype for me was worth it and if your in the UK for 4.99 a ticket at VUE cinemas is so worth it. Make sure you bring a gallon of soda because you will get thirsty for 3hrs...

title: Fantastic effects, ridiculous script!
text: Now where have we heard this before? Why is it the Hollywood trend appears to be finding the balance of the better the special effects, the sillier the story.This one takes the biscuit. Throw in the compulsory wonderful /genius blm advert 'characters' to even further break down the fourth wall and basically it's only worth watching for the (albeit impressive) effects so bring your eyeballs but leave your brains at home.Was nice to wear the 3D specs again, although nothing really jumped out at me.

title: WARNING: MAY CONTAIN DINOSAURS.
text:
Thats actually a lie.I love monster films,

lets bring the original characters, and plot lines, and more of the same,

title: what kind of movie requires plants to write reviews
text: Haven't seen it, haven't put a score, but just clicked on all 10/10 reviews and what a surprise that the only review those users have ever written are of this movie. I'll just leave it at that. Those reviews are obviously too shallow to be credible, but it's just sad.

title: This was a fun popcorn flick as long as you go in with the right mind set
text: Jurassic World: Dominion (2022) is a movie we watched as a family in theatres last night. The storyline follows a world that is trying to adjust to dinosaurs being a regular part of every day life. Meanwhile an evil organization looks to exploit circumstances by creating genetically engineered locusts to destroy the Earths food so you need to rely on them to survive...oh, and they want to steal Hammond's cloned niece. It will take the heroes from every movie of the Jurassic Park series to save the day.This movie is directed by Colin Trevorrow (Jurassic World) and stars Chris Pratt (Guardians of the Galaxy), Jeff Goldblum (The Fly), Sam Neill (Event Horizon), Bryce Dallas Howard (The Help), Mamoudou Athie (Uncorked) and Laura Dern (Blue Velvet).This movie, unfortunately, it's about the same as Jurassic World: Kingdom. The dinosaurs and special effects are awesome. There's some tremendous species of dinosaurs and dinosaur battles, especially the last one. Unfortunately for the storyline, it reminded me of John Wick 3, just an excuse for dinosaur scenes like that John Wick was just an excuse for action scenes with a flimsy clich storyline. There were also too many subplots going on in here - some were fun and entertaining (black market and underground trade was well done, locusts and cloned child not so much). The acting was fine but the cast could have been way better utilized with better writing.Overall this was a fun popcorn flick as long as you go in with the right mind set. Think of it like watching Fast and Furious, Transformers and John Wick; no it's not going to be a good movie, but the dinosaurs are cool. I would score this a 6/10 and recommend seeing it once.

title: Not even worth laughing at
text: It's interesting how most of the 1 star reviews are very short, this says a lot, basically that we don't want this film to take up anymore time we wasted watching it.This movie is made for the late fans of jurassic park, the original movie has far more impact, the original movie has only 7% dino screen time where this film has about 80% dino screen time which kills everything about what jurassic park set out to do.The worst part of the movie is how much the director tries to tie in scenes and recreate scenarios and legendary moments from the original film. Spielberg did this because he is a fantastic filmmaker, this director did this to please fans. Nothing comes good from people pleasing in any situation in life.

title: Underwheliming in spite of reuniting the trio of JURASSIC PARK
text: JURASSIC WORLD DOMINION (2022) **1/2 Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Sam Neill, Jeff Goldblum, Laura Dern, Isabella Sermon, DeWanda Wise, Campbell Scott, Mamoudou Athie, B. D. Wong. Underwhelming - and possibly final chapter - in the blockbuster sci-fi franchise imagines dinos now living amongst mankind while under threat from a sinister bio-tech organization (shocker) which reunites the first film's trio of heroes Alan Grant, Ellie Satler & Ian Malcom (welcome back Neill, Dern and Goldblum) while 'dinosaur whisperer Owen Grady (*eyeroll*) and on-and-off gal pal Claire Dearing (Pratt and Howard reprising the couple) are en route to save their surrogate daughter Sermon, who provides a DNA link uniting pretty much everyone. Filmmaker Colin Trevorrow (who co-scripted the janky screenplay with Emily Carmichael) returns as well to balance the CGI and practical f/x with some skill and finesse in spite of its tone deaf dialogue.

title: The Jurassic art of cliche Dominion
text:
Millions of dollars, hours, work, etc. To end up with this great ball of cliches... And it's even worst, mix and mush up; Jurassic Park, Indiana Jones, Impossible mission; Avatar, and many many others films: then you have this result...
Of course is mi absolute subjective point of view, but I wonder why Hollywood in the last ten or more years have decided to ruin almost everything that was built.

title: It's a romp
text:
OK, it was an enjoyable movie for a rainy afternoon. So comfortable but I have trouble remembering the actual plot now.... it's people we care about and rogue dinosaurs...you should know what you're getting into by now. Thankfully no running in high heels.I did spend a lot of time worrying about the corn Bryce Dallas Howard was shucking when she had to run after the dinos. It was a perfect looking cob of corn. Bright yellow. Luscious
kernels. Best enjoyed immediately, she could have waited a few minutes! ...and then when they return home later, I was looking for the corn. What happened to it? Did it survive or did the worms get it? Were there more perfect ears of corn for them to eat? Really felt the story was incomplete and I find myself wondering....

title: Should have stopped after the first one
text: Jurassic Park was wonderful. Very good adaptation of Crichton's novel. The sequels? Meh and more meh. And Dominion is a perfect example of how Hollywood has *one* good idea and then beats it into the ground over and over because they have no imagination or creativity.The best thing I can say about Dominion is that I got to watch it for free, so I wasn't out any money on it.

title: Truly an Emotional, Epic Conclusion
text: Epic finale for the Jurassic Park franchise! Everyone has their opportunity to shine in this romp of a movie. Couple characters from the last movie fell by the wayside which is understandable given the triumphant return of the original cast. Viceral action sequences. The cgi was great. Loved the scale of this movie as everything comes full circle. I really enjoyed it.

title: Holding Too Much Dominion Over Mediocrity
text:
LIKES:
The Comedy: The Jurassic Park series has always had some string of comedy sprinkled in the darker world of the survival pictures. Dominion goes a little more into this realm, working to make it very funny and sometimes in the modern style of more is better. Pratt and Goldblum are the primary haulers of the comedy, while the other characters sneak their own levels of laughs into the mix. Yet my favorite styles were some of the dinosaur moments and how the managed to make several of them have a little more human side and deliver that comedic punch to rock our worlds. Though forced a bit at times, the comedy really is decently done and feels back to being natural and well-placed like the first movies.Lots of Dinosaurs: It's a movie about dinosaurs and well you get dinosaurs... where others have shown their cards and given you a few species to enjoy and get glimpses of, Dominion really makes this supposed final act, have all the dinosaurs that you could want in this short run time. While some of them are the classic monsters you remember, there are other species from various eras that arise from the shadows and most of them feel just as sinister and destructive as you hope for in this series. So for those tired of the typical thunder lizards, you'll be in for a treat at the variety the movie brought with it.The Musical Score: Hands down another great lineage to this movie, the musical score is certainly one that still gives me goosebumps when I hear it boom over the speakers. Like the sound editing that brings the roars to life, the sixth part of the saga has the powerful orchestra work to add emotion to the scene and pull you into the full experience. Softer tones accompany or proceed the pounding orchestra blast that this series does super well. It's part of the movie theater experience worthy tone of this movie series and one of my favorite parts of the movie.The Pace: While certainly not the target pace of the first film, Dominion manages to still keep the action going and keep things moving. For all the story elements this movie juggled, it did not do a half-bad job for me in them working it to remain entertaining. From the opening moments that sum up the events before to getting into the Dinosaur action and solutions, it really just keeps a steady pace without dawdling too much on the truth. Again, the result is an entertaining adventure for fans of the series to enjoy and just get more Dinosaur carnage and rampaging on the screen.The Acting: While certainly not the most unique or Oscar worthy in terms of roles and performances, the movie's repertoire of actors and actresses accomplishes the fun I like to see in these movies. Pratt is Pratt, he's goofy, but action hero epic, as he does his best to tame the primitive and fearsome beasts that are on the screen. He's the typical hero role we've come to love in him, and he has some great moves to finish this series off. Howard is probably the one with the most dynamic range in this film, her character getting a lot more time and scenarios than other characters at this time. As a result, she accomplished much in her character's growth and ability, really selling the emotions for the most part and giving me more to like about Claire while avoiding going too far down the stoic warrior path. As for Dern, she's a master of her trade, and I liked the new Ellie that was still the same quality components we got in number one, but still adding some new qualities that shows what she has been doing for the last three decades. As for the rest of the group, they do a great job with the parts handed and there are too many to go through given how loaded the film is. However, the summary is: Neal is great if a bit underutilized, Sermon is funny and replays the role quite well, Wise is tough, funny, and reminiscent of the American pilot trope from Spielberg films, while Goldblum accomplishes much in that same steal the show moment you love.The Character Use: While nowhere near perfect, Dominion does a better job than I intended of keeping the cast involved in the entire film, at least the human cast. With all sorts of characters to try and pull into one final act, you have a lot of stories, actors, and teams to try and keep ingrained in the tale. Old cast may not be the most involved at times, but hit at the moments that matter and give the loyal fans everything they need to wrap up this portion of the Jurassic World series, including laughs and a few tropes that you might be wanting to see. As for the new ones this part of the series, they get a lot more of the time and again accomplish the goal of expanding the story, whilst still being fun avatars to live through in this world.The Chase Scene/Action At Times: The trailers showed an exciting scene of dinosaurs and bikes, and you know what... it accomplished it big time. I loved the race through the streets, a feeling of Mission Impossible meeting Dinos as they raced for survival in this CGI world. I absolutely loved this moment and felt it was the highlight of the action for this movie and the true climactic experience, if not a little cheesy at times. Other action scenes felt very part of the world, and there is a few big beast fights that you'll be wanting to see that really have some fun qualities to them, including one epic finish. As such, the action does accomplish its role for this series and should have the extreme fanatics stomping their feet in delight.The Graphics: By far, the ability of studios to make dinosaurs come to life is still something that, to quote Laura Dern, "you never get used to!". For me, I love seeing the beasts come to life, finding the balance between computer graphic use and animatronics to bring these ancient creatures back to life. With modern technology, the computer work has never looked better in textures and stationary shots, while the robots are still impressive, but a little more artificial at times, though still doing a fantastic job of making them pop off the screen.The Action At Times: Again, more beasts and humans, means a bit more of other qualities being scattered and the action is again one of those moments. Prior to the new trilogy, Jurassic Park's action was mostly about survival in the world of the largest carnivores. While some of that does exist, Dominion seems to have diluted most of it to the modern day action, leading to some great moments mentioned above, but also weaker elements you had hoped would be a bit more intense in the long run. The result is less intense action moments and feel like there are less stakes to be had.The Subplots: Characters have to have arcs and backgrounds to be engaging right? Well, Jurassic World: Dominion does have that, only with so many characters in the mix they are a little diluted and bland. Both old and new have things they can certainly pursue, but sadly don't do well with everybody on the screen. The new pilot who lives life dangerously, Malcolm's story over the last two decades of what's happened with him, even Ellie to an extent all feel very simplistic given what it could have been. It's not horrible, and checks the box for complete, but for those invested in the characters, don't expect the most thought out character plots for others.The Main Story: By far the weaker of the tales, was indeed the story of Jurassic World Dominion. Painting a very broad stroke and keeping all the characters in it, this movie is not quite the focused feature the others have been. While most merely just want a survival film filled with dinosaurs and more dinosaurs, others again want to be engaged with the film. Again, for me, this film diluted both and the great overarching story is a little more political story than actually engaging feature. The villain is simplified and boring, the solutions to the problems almost as dry and uncreative, as they simply work through things. Throw in the predictability, the lack of suspense, and the statistical probability of what is going to happen and the plot becomes less impressive in favor of the flash in a pan gimmick.The Lack of Suspense and Terror: By far, the lack of suspense and terror is what I was missing in this film. Jurassic World has lost so much of the thing that drew us into the first series, the intensity of surviving the next encounter and how they got out, racking us with terror as the fake monsters tried to tear their way to food. For me, that feeling has been gone since number three, replaced with an almost action/drama feel that while it has it's good parts, is still not the same edge it once had. I did not find myself talking to the screen encouraging them to go, go, go like I once did and that was a bit sad for me really. It was this lack of intensity that II think was the weakest component of the movie and the lack of intensity is the component that really made the movie drawl in my case.The VERDICT:The supposed last installment of the great dinosaur movie was entertaining and fun, with the effects being the main thing to experience in theater. It juggles the cast well, makes for a fun use of multiple dinosaur species, and breaks open the music and technology to craft the world. It handles the cast decently well and keeps that engaging pace you want in a movie like this, devoid of any complex plot of processing. However, even the simple adventure like that lacks the bite of the original series, putting almost too much in one film that it spreads the quality across the two-hours unevenly and in many ways less than the potential it had. The biggest disappointment with me was in fact the lack of terror and suspense, this component almost washed out entirely given the predictability of the tale. So, factoring that in my scores of the movie are:Action/Adventure/sci-fi: 7.0
Movie Overall: 6.0.

title: I quit movies
text: If I were the guy being paid 6 figures to watch a movie and determine if it was ready for theaters or not, I'd have quit just to avoid finishing this train wreck.No fluid plot, horrible consistency (my girl outran a velociraptor that then outran a speeding vehicle), everything about this was just aweful. The silliest Fast&Furious mock-up doesn't compete with how absolutely attrocious this movie was. Even the dinosaurs special effects seemed to have taken a dive in quality? This is the movie version of taping a banana on a wall and calling it abstract art, and literally paying millions for it.

title: It's all about the special effects
text: The first one is still by far the best story of them all, and this one has a story I wasn't particularly interested in, but I'd feel like a total heal to rate this any lower than a 7 due to the effort that went into creating the incredible special effects. If it wasn't for those, this would basically put you to sleep, and I did find myself nodding off during one of the few moments lacking much action. But go into this to admire the artistry in the movie making itself, and I think you'll enjoy the experience. That said, I sure hope they don't make another one, because there is no more story to tell, and they've reached the peak on dinosaur action.

title: Top 5 Worst
text: Movies I've ever seen in my life. Almost walked out of the theater, but my wife wouldn't let me. Everyone involved in the making of this film should retire from their work immediately. It was that bad. Sorta like 99.9% of everything else outta the entertainment business in the last decade.

title: Nostalgic and entertaining at face value
text: I think it wrapped up closure for other plot lines in the series that fans wanted to see. It had similar scenes but those are to be expected in the franchise. It was nostalgic and cool to see how they merged the two casts into a unified plot line. Lots of action. Wish it had more dinosaurs. Some of it was predictable. But I love the franchise and support it. It was entertaining and I think everyone will have a different perspective of what they think would have made it better. I am glad the original cast came back! The acting was better than expected. Scenes seemed to flow well. It was high action at times.

title: A WORTHLESS PIECE OF TRASH! Colin Trevaro and his writing team are the worst of the worst!
text: The people who wrote and directed this should NEVER BE ABLE TO write and/or direct another movie again. Colin Trevaro and his fellow writing goons are an embarrassment to hollywood and an embarrassment to cinema. I normally wouldn't review a movie on here but I signed only so could leave this review (it's that BAD. I felt like I had to. I felt that passionate). This movie was a worthless embarrassing piece of garbage. The people who made this and the "Jurassic World Series" destroyed a legacy, and that a beautiful one made by Steven Spielberg and his team. This movie and the entire Jurassic World series need to be erased from the Jurassic canon. And Colin Trevaro and the writers he works with need to be banned from making movies. What a joke. What an absolute joke.

title: I actually liked it
text: I see most everyone didn't like it but I digress. I liked that Laura Dern , Sam Neil, and Jeff Goldblum were in it because it's a mix of the old with the new. Nothing wrong about that. Not only that, but they ended up hiding from the T-Rex's in and around an upside down vehicle much like in the first film. Honestly, I found it to be exciting. Really loved the scene wher Pratt's character was on the motorcycle being chased by velociraptors. I can say that the difference people feel between this and the original was probably Spielberg's involvement in the direction initially. For me, the picture held my attention so I can give it some credence.

title: Utter disappointment
text: Horrible plot, Dinosaurs were simply windowdressing for a locust-movie and everything else was simply pandering to memories, hints at and copies from previous titles in regards to characters actions. I had to force my way through this one and it left me wondering. When they watched the final cut before release, how can they step back and be happy with what they've made?

title: I don't get the bad reviews, loved every minute!
text: I get that people are frustrated about revisiting old characters, but that's why I loved it. I grew up looking up to these amazing characters and having them be a part of what's new and to show how far the world (this fictional universe where Dinosaurs exist) has gone since the first park is fun to see.I loved that they had a new plot line that added back some different science fiction elements. They aren't terribly new plots, but they aren't necessarily the traditional Jurassic park plots. I am pretty sure they took inspiration from Christons other book Prey (this is a wild leap because I haven't read the book just heard the synopsis).They had action, they had humor, they had moral dilemma, they had philosophy, they had romance, they had familial love, they had science fiction and most importantly, they had loads and loads of dinosaurs. They even had updated ones using the most recent knowledge from paleontology.I get it was a lot of "fanporn" so some people are upset, but that's why I am giving it a good review. I LOVED it and it wasn't so overwhelming that it made the story horrible (like Force Awakens).I hope it gets some more good reviews!

title: Stunning Visuals but what a messy storyline
text: Even OG cast couldn't save the atrocious storyline. I guess the writer completely missed the mark on what we fans were expecting. The last movie Dinosaurs escaped to mainland and now humans and dinosaurs will need to coexist. It's like the writers didn't even see what happened in Jurassic Park part 2 lost world where T-Rex caused havoc when loose on mainland. This movie should've been more of an apocalyptic feel, humans trying to survive, Government/Armies failing, safe zones being breached and overall carnage where the OG cast somehow ends up reuniting to come up with a plan to save human species.Instead we get the same crap as the last 2 movies, a fancy secure building that gets breached, a rich greedy CEO, and everything just falling apart as usual. No purpose for OG cast to be there. Super lazy writing and screenplay. No originality feeling. Felt like a hotpodge cash grab mess.On positive side, visuals were stunning.

title: lots of fun, outrageous action and some laughably stupid decisions, but the high quantity and quality animatronics are laudable; equal character screentime
text: Much better than anticipated with all the criticism. I wouldn't say it's too long; they crammed a lot into 2 and half hours, it only felt long for the first 50min because it wasn't until then that any actual action occurred. We do get to see plenty of dinosaurs in that time, though, a lot in fact, as they had accumulated across the world and been processed/handled appropriately by the government. This they did really well on writing and execution. The whole Maisie situation was eyeroll heavy but not as bad as Fallen Kingdom in my opinion. Some of my biggest gripes were dinosaur behavior (a herbivore killing deer and challenging apex predators), characters not using their guns during standoffs with raptors, and the inaccurate design of the Giga. But hey, all in good fun, right? The action was abundant, even if the characters were invincible, Grant and Sattler had a lot of screentime, Malcolm too, Pratt was great and my favorite, Claire, possibly had all of the best scenes. New raptor designs were immensely appreciated, I just wish they had been involved in more than a predictable chase scene. The amount of animatronics and practical effects were shocking, I give major props to that; the dimetrodon sequence was amazing! Sure, the flick has its flaws and hiccups, but what JW doesn't? It felt like a sound conclusion to the series to me, though I still yearn for more.

title: Jurassic World Dominion Roars Back into Theaters
text: Jurassic World: Dominion opened in theaters this weekend. It is the highly anticipated sixth installment in the Jurassic Park franchise. In Dominion, we find out whether the dinosaurs, who were released into the world at the end of Fallen Kingdom, have been integrated into the greater society and what effect their presence has on the broader ecosystem. It's been almost 30 years since we were first introduced to dinosaurs in modern times; but, six films later, are we still in awe of the scientific feats of DNA splicing and cloning? Here's whether going back to Jurassic World is worth all of that anticipation.Jurassic World: Dominion brings back Owen Grady (Pratt) and Claire Dearing (Howard), who are raising the teenage clone, Maisie Lockwood (Sermon). They are protecting her from evil corporate interests who seek to capture and study her for their own nefarious reasons. Also, Elli Sattler (Dern) and Alan Grant (Neill) are back to investigate a potential ecological disaster brought on by genetically modified locusts rabidly devouring the world's crops. Then, there is Ian Malcolm (Goldblum) and Ramsay Cole (Athie) as fixtures of the corporation, Biosyn, which is at the center of all of these machinations. There's also a dynamic pilot, Kayla Watts (Wise), and a manipulative CEO of Biosyn, Lewis Dodgson (Scott). Oh man, did I forget anything? Um... prehistoric ravenous hijinks ensue.Okay, as you can see, there is a lot going on in Jurassic World: Dominion. It's not necessarily complicated, but it is a lot to follow. These Jurassic Park movies always have a bit of an issue getting bogged down explaining the science of this all. In Dominion, they have to talk about genetic splicing and cloning and ecology, and it just goes on and on. Sattler and Grant are focused on stealing the DNA of these destructive locusts to prove that Biosyn is evil. Owen and Claire are focused on protecting Maisie from Biosyn. In a sense, it feels like so much is going on that there is not enough time for the characters to run and scream from the dinosaurs. That's the unfortunate part if you really like that aspect from the original.Despite these reservations of the plot, the movie does have its exciting parts. There are dinosaur chases through the streets, through the jungle and through the Biosyn facilities. DeWanda Wise plays a tough-as-nails, wisecracking pilot, who seems to be the most competent of all of our characters. She gets good one-liners and has a magnetic personality. Her presence adds a lot of energy to what could become stale. I'll also note that the legacy characters of Sattler, Grant and Malcolm give exactly what you want. It's like no time has passed at all. The nostalgia is very high and they effectively scratch that Jurassic Park itch.Ultimately, Jurassic World: Dominion is an enjoyable, escapist summer blockbuster. The problem here is that there is too much going on and it doesn't exactly all come together. There are probably too many characters that distract from the main attraction - the dinosaurs. Nevertheless, there are good dinosaur chases and exciting moments with a great new character played by DeWanda Wise. While I wouldn't call Jurassic World: Dominion essential, it certainly is good enough for a matinee viewing, so get your bowl of popcorn.

title: Sorry.. no.
text: This was the laziest way to end the Jurassic 'World' trilogy.. such sad and poor writing. Nothing wrong with the acting obviously; when someone can't act in big budget film .. it's noticeable. Just a lousy way to end the franchise.

title: Jurassic Parody
text: An absolute fail to remake some classic scenes from the 1st movie. There were plenty of flashback elements but obviously done really bad. It looked like amateur made fan movie on the whole. Sad for all the great actors to be part of this parody.

title: Jurassic Dark
text: Life on Earth has existed for hundreds of millions of years. It has come in many shapes and sizes. Different life forms have been around for different amounts of time. They have also occupied different corners of the world depending on temperature, terrain and other circumstances. We, humans, have been around for a very short time yet. Right now, though, we are dominant. The planet is ours. There is no telling for how much longer, considering how we, humanity, tend to handle the world around us and each other. But there was once, let's say, a group of creatures that are well-known for two reasons, at least. Their "once" lasted for around one and a half hundred million years. During that "once", they absolutely dominated pretty much every corner of the planet. No other group of life forms has ever dominated the planet as long. That's "one". They were also the largest creatures that have ever walked. Possibly, so big nothing will ever beat them. Gravity and air conditions limit the size of animals. Dinosaurs were both the biggest herbivore and carnivore creatures ever to inhabit the dry-land. That's "two". They had, let's say, relatives both in the water and in the air. Both were also huge. Sixty-five million years ago, all of them went extinct, dinosaurs, water and air reptiles, all of them. Since we discovered them, we've been fascinated by them. How numerous they were, how various they were, and how enormous some of them were. "Jurassic World: Dominion" is the sixth one in the biggest dinosaur related film series. Like most old and famous ones, this film series hasn't been feeling so good lately. How is "Dominion" doing?Whoever watches these movies because of dinosaurs only, will probably see it as the weakest in the series. The dinosaur visual effects that these movies use were once groundbreaking. Since then, however, they haven't gone anywhere new. They no longer surprise audiences. And some of them may have even degraded. Also, cinematography in general could have been better. If that doesn't bother dinosaur fans, then a complication in the plot of the film can do that. "Dominion" isn't exactly a dinosaur movie. Rather, it is a movie about a possible end of the world. What's good about it, though, is the movie uses no miracle to solve the problem, it relies on science. This isn't "Interstellar". Whoever watches these movies because of picturesque locations will see something new, rather than yet another tropical island. Seriously, it's nice to see familiar dinosaurs in new environments. What's even nicer is how the film shows the dinosaurs disoriented and scared. They are not your typical "movie monsters" here. Unless they have been caged and treated in ways that would turn any living thing into a monster. Whoever watches these movies because of characters will see the old heroes and the new heroes going on dangerous missions and joining forces to take down the bad guys. By the way, the old heroes do not return for a handful of minutes and they do not return to be humiliated by the plot. They return because of their experience and the authority they have gained previously on this series. This is not "Disney Star Wars".In conclusion, the movie could have focused more on dinosaurs. The visuals could have been better. The story could have been simpler. Or it could have been enough for two movies, two big parts of one story, like some big budget movies do sometimes. But even with all the weak spots, "Jurassic World: Dominion" isn't pointless. Nor is it heartless. It does deserve a chance.

title: A fun Action movie
text: This is a fun action movie with dinosaurs, however the politics of the films creators do not need to show up in every other scene of the movie. Other than that it's great.

title: Hangs Heavily on Nostalgia
text: As the conclusion of the Jurassic World trilogy, it, unfortunately, had similarities to Rise of Skywalker. A lot of things were going on. Some fun moments. Great nostalgia with the legacy cast. Lots of dino action. But it also felt like they had so much going on that they ran out of time to highlight characters and make us care. I will always love Jurassic Park, so this movie got a little boost in rating because of nostalgia from me.Overall : Not as bad as reviews say, but go in with reasonable expectations.

title: What a let down
text: With this much money and this many iconic actors coming back you would think they could make something good. What a complete 180 from the original movie. It was just sad watching all of the new Jurassic series. I wish the would start making movies like they used to. Take risks, hire people based on talent, START with an excellent story. Anyway do not watch this movie is you care about good story and good film making. This movie was just sad and hard to watch. It was all just pointless. It was all just boring. You didnt care. Colin Trevor needs to stop being allowed to make movies. He is probably one of the worst directors in the industry.

title: IT WAS OK AND....FUN
text: I'm not sure how I feel about this movie. It's basically the same movie as the last one with a weaker and more tedious plot. But it just has more big action, dinosaurs, and previous as well as new characters. I honestly don't understand why they made this, the story doesn't even have a connection to the finale. Because it's about a genetics corporation called Biosyn who genetically made a big grasshopper (or whatever they're called) to snuff out humanity's main food chain across the globe. The dinosaurs don't even have a big part in the movie or the plot. It's just like they give these characters one last adventure before they can finally rest and coexist with the dinosaurs which they already did like four years ago. But overall, it was really a fun and exciting adventure, the actions are the best in the trilogy.The cinematography, production design, and camera work are definitely the best as well. It's so aesthetic and eye-pleasing, especially when every time they introduce a new dinosaur and in the final minutes.(NOTE: the movie can be too loud at some point, so brace yourself)

title: Boring and laughable at the same time
text: New drinking game idea! Take a shot every time Chris Pratt holds his hand up in the air and has a staring contest with a dinosaur. Guaranteed you'll be wasted within the first forty minutes of the movie. It was fun to see the original cast come back and it had some good dinosaur scenes that my little brother really enjoyed. Beyond that though, this installment just didn't do it for me, which is a shame because I love Jurassic Park and thought the first Jurassic World was actually very decent. But this one is way too long and drawn out, cringe writing at times, annoying characters, and strange pacing. The "villain" aka the guy who looks eerily identical to Apple CEO Tim Cook (did they do that on purpose?) was terribly written and completely useless. I'm glad I waited to watch this at home instead of going to the theater, at least that way I could doze off between scenes in the comfort of my living room.

title: I loved it
text: The third and final entry in the Jurassic World trilogy and an overall conclusion to the original Jurassic Park series. A satisfying conclusion with lots of entertainment and thrillful moments. The best entry in the Jurassic World trilogy and I don't care about the unnecessary hate this film getting and I find it ridiculous because this film made especially for the true Jurassic Park fans.

title: Jurassic world dominion
text: I saw this movie is weste totally waste of time my verdict is don't watch the movie because it's totally lag and it's a normal Hollywood movies and there is no high graphics weast movie. As we all know, science fiction, when it is done well, reflects social and political tensions back to the culture in disguised forms so that we take them in and metabolize them without really knowing what it is that we are consuming. In Jurassic World, we are transported into the perilous mindscape of radical feminism where, in accordance with the tradition, and finally i says about the movie is totally boring.

title: Silly fun spectacle like Jurassic movies should be
text: I enjoyed the callbacks and the new stuff, I'd give a ten just for the chase scene that involved a Kei class van and dinosaurs, laughed a bit in that part and can I forgive any plot holes and supposition. Easy to watch and I'm glad I did.

title: Iconic way to close a franchise
text: We all know what we want from these movies and I think this movie succeeded at that. It has a a bit of everything , the storyline is well paced ( could have been shorter tho ) the action was so cool ; especially the Malta parts . However I do think the movie was suffocating itself with so many characters and dialogues.

title: I don't know the names of the actors, but it's boring
text: I never really got the Jurassic Park thing. This was sort of a way to tie it into modern genetics and give us a bunch of famous actors. But there was so much pointless dinosaur violence that just stopped being suspenseful. And another trope of the big bad corporation that was so predictable the whole time. Throw in a black lady with attitude, and it just seems like the goal was less telling a story and more appealing to constituents. And people are right. 2.5 hours is way too long for this simple story when nothing of significance warranted it.I think the final problem form me was the now common story element: telling us our elected government officials can or will take care of a major problem such as corporate malfeasance. Yeah, right. Pretty amazing cynicism in this day and age.

title: I want to go to toliet
text:
I want to go to toliet.Then go home and sleep...
I have nothing to comment it.Just waste of money, don't buy ticket to watch...Not worth....
And i have to force myself to write 150 characters.

title: Not so bad
text: Not a bad film. Good cinematography takes us through an action packed adventure. Some lines are cheesy, expected as this is a commercial family film. I enjoyed this much more than Jurassic world 2, I found the story to be far more engaging and old characters sure spiced it up. Undeniably though the plot was too scripted, at times you would just wait for the good guys to triumph as it is impossible for them to lose, a sense of risk or realism would have helped to keep the audience on their toes.Not a bad watch at all, 7/10.

title: Straight Up Trash
text: Pathetic, boring and poor writing destroyed what could have been so much better. Should have stuck with works...dinosaurs and chaos  This movie just replaced Caddyshack 2 as the worst movie of all time.

title: Fun movie, interesting story
text: I just saw the movie on streaming. Now I wish I would have seen it in theaters. At that time, it was getting bad reviews online, so I did not go.Anyway, it was a pretty good movie, some action, interesting story with Ellie and Grant doing some 007 like detective work.The storyline with Owen and Blue was a little overdone, but it did not detract too much from enjoying the movie.I really don't understand the bad reviews, it is a sci-fi dinosaur movie!!! Don't expect these types of movie to always make sense and follow real world science.Dominion is a fun and entertaining movie and I plan to watch it again!

title: Please write a story
text: Most of this film is how can we hurt the dinosaurs or have them hurt each other. No character has growth, no positive development through the story. Last movie was kill all the dinosaurs in a volcano eruption and watch them die and this time, lets put them all in a sanctuary and then burn it down! Why the constant need to kill all the dinos? This crew should really be able to do better by this point. Very unimpressed.

title: Tired franchise. Tired presentation.
text: Something or everything just seemed way off about this movie. The actors were not all there and their interactions with their environment and dinosaur counterparts were so uneven unnatural and inharmonious.The attempt at reunion of two generations of actors was too on the nose to have any impact. Most of the screen play was just a rehearsal of what has been seen before. There was also too many overly convenient set pieces to push forward an already absent plot. Too easy for the characters to get out of seemingly dangerous situations and all attempts at any tension fell flat. Also, no character development what so ever. Agreed, these are characters we are already familiar with but not a single character can have a progression, come on. The villain also is a joke as are the locusts and their pointless involvement in the story.It's not all bad because there's is outstanding visuals and some world building that was left unexplored. Not enough to save this movie from being forgettable.

title: People Expect Dinosaur Day Afternoon..
text: Not quite sure what people are expecting when they go see a movie about dinosaurs running wild in the real world. I've loved this franchise since I saw the original at 10 years old and being able to take my son to his first movie might make me a little biased, but I loved it more than him. That has everything you want in a summer block buster. Great set pieces, mediocre acting, and dinosaurs fighting each other. Of course it's stupid. Of course it's campy. Of course it's cheesy. Have you not seen any of the other ones for the past 30 years?I made the mistake of looking at the reviews before hand and thought I was going to be wasting 2 hours. Not only would I have loved it solo, but I made a core memory for me and my kid. I'm sure if I spent hours afterwards analyzing the plot and the character arcs I would feel the same way, but I don't do that with movies starring Chris Pratt. If you like dinosaurs or any of the Jurassic Parks/Worlds, see this. There are a few throwback jokes to the original which make it all worth it for the old crowd and my five-year-old was at the edge of his seat the whole time - probably because he had to pee, but more likely because of the Giganotosaurus and Quetzalcoatlus. See the movie. Enjoy yourself. And for 2 1/2 hours try not to think about the chaos that we are actually living in.

title: Generic, way to action packed, unrealistic movie and overuse of CGI
text: Another generic Jurassic Park movie full of bad CGI.Actors are good, but the CGI makes the movie look tame and unrealistic.I wish they made the Jurassic Park movies like the first two movies. More practical effects as it looks more realistic (compare T-Rex or Velociraptors from the first movie with this... Its day and night.This is just another cheap (maybe not the budget, but how it looks) generic, way to action-packed, child friendly movie like Hollywood is spamming out now'a'days.I wish movie makers had the balls to take chances like they did back in the day when Hollywood was good.Now they rely too much on CGI because its safe. But it makes the movies not have a realistic feeling to it.I'd say I will give it a 3 star max, and thats solely because of the actors makes it watchable.Without them, it would be a 1 star.

title: Disappointed
text: If I wasn't such a huge fan of dinosaurs and held the original Jurassic Park (and 2+3, I know sue me) then this would've been given 6 stars. I enjoyed seeing the dinosaurs that was probably my favourite part of the movie, that and Alan Grant of course, that's when they were on screen anyway and not giant locus. It definitely lacked that feel of dinosaurs being everywhere overall as they decided to make it cricket focused instead for some reason and to have a big bad be the science corporations and not the dinosaurs running around which is what I would have preferred. The movie was also kind of messy with many plots going on all at once with some cheesy dialogue thrown in. I wanted to love this movie but they made a really uninteresting plot that still could've been better. The dinosaurs were great though I loved seeing all the unique species to this movie and even got some surprises in there too. I loved seeing the dinosaurs around the real world and co existing or at least trying to, I thought that made for a really unique couple of scenes. I definitely enjoyed the movie but if I wanted to watch it again I'd probably skip to the scenes with the dinosaurs I liked as the plot was all over the place. To be fair I only come to see dinosaurs in these movies and action scenes of sorts and I definitely got them but overall it was only brief moments in the entirety of the movie. I hope they do more and make a movie about the dinosaurs living among the humans more. I do have to say the cinematography with the dinosaurs was really beautiful on the screen and the music was great which I found out at the end to be the same person who did the Batman music. Anyway for now I'll stick to the original trilogy.

title: This film needs a director. And a screenwriter.
text: This film had a $160 million budget.Two-and-a-half minutes in, I noticed that the Biosyn CEO had a jacket on that looked like it was bought for $29.99, and it didn't fit the actor.Six minutes in, I thought, "With all that money, they couldn't get a screenwriter?" The script for "Jurassic World Dominion" couldn't possibly get a passing grade in a college screenwriting class. No chance.Seven minutes in, I thought, "With all that money, they couldn't get a director?" It's really as if there was no director, just a cinematographer who said, "Start acting."Around minute 33:00, I thought, "They could have hired actors who can act, for the smaller roles, but for some reason they chose not to." (Sentiment reconfirmed in the helicopter scenes and then, perhaps even more brutally, if such a thing is possible, in the scenes after the helicopter landed.)I'm a screenwriter and a playwright, and I work really hard on my scripts. It is an interesting fact that Hollywood consistently produces scripts that are, at best, notes for a screenplay. It's as if the script is of no consequence at all to Hollywood execs. Does this seem odd to anyone?The world needs great stories and great scripts . . . And we have neither in the film, "Jurassic World Dominion." Imagine the wonderful independent films, based on great stories, that could have been produced for the $160 million price-tag of this absurd "blockbuster."Who allowed this script? Where was the director? Can someone tell me?I know where the audience members are. They are back home, thinking, "What did I just waste my money on?"

title: Not quite as bad as the reviews suggest.
text: It is far form being the best of the Jurassic movies for sure, but it is nowhere near as bad as I feared from reading some of the reviews. Yes, the storyline is not great and the first 25 minute or so were less than exciting. It did however, get better as it went on and it was great to see Drs. Grant, Sattler and Malcolm from the original three films and if one can put the plot weakness out of mind for a time, there are some genuinely thrilling and exciting moments in the movie. Above all, there are the dinosaurs, the real stars of the show - and don't they know it. We get to see new ones like Baryonyx, Allosaurus and Atrociraptor, as well as old favourites such as Brachiosaurus, Velociraptor and of course, T-Rex, without which no Jurassic movie would be complete. (Yes, T-Rex was from the Upper Cretaceous, as were most animals in these movies, but just go with it.) So, if you love dinosaurs, it's worth watching just to see them in action once more, especially T-Rex who never disappoints!

title: Racking up the air miles
text: I'm hoping with all the traveling in the first 40 minutes we could use the airline miles to get a better movie. Even the actors are like "wow this is a terrible script." The "convenience" of everything going on and how they just "happen to get the information" is just so terrible. Please STOP making Jurassic Park movies. The nostalgia wore off a long time ago.

title: Good addition to the franchise!
text: Not wonderful but still a good, summertime movie and fits right in with the other five movies. Loved the callbacks to the other movies--you can't make sequels without having callbacks :-) Not nearly as bad a movie as all of these reviews are making it out to be; 7.5 out of 10 stars.

title: Solid Effort
text: I just watched "Jurassic World Dominion" and I found it to be perhaps the best of the sequels. I'm not sure why people are bashing this film so much. Are they paid trolls? Is it as good and original as the first film? No, but relative to what films are being produced currently this is a good effort and holds its own. You can tell they put a lot of effort into filming all of these scenes, even if there is a lot of CGI, it looks pretty good. Honestly the first couple minutes of the film were the worst, which is odd, why that didn't look better. I will rate this film a 7/10. Is it slightly long and unoriginal? Yes, but still worth watching. They respect the characters and universe well enough and provide decent entertainment for 2+ hours. Don't be a hater, 1,2, or 3 rating is too harsh, and I gave the previous installment a 2, but this film is better, hence this review.

title: And the Theri and Rex got married and lived happily ever after.
text: Does it matter? The dinosaurs barely got any screen time. This is the worst movie in the franchise. The writing is poor, the acting is off, and it isn't engaging.How the hell are people out in civilization living their lives normally when there are dinosaurs loose?What sums up how poorly done this movie is can be seen just in the intro. The Giga and the Rex did not live in the same time period, come on.

title: Lavish from Outside, Hollow from Inside
text: Seeing the original trio returning to the Jurassic franchise was an ineffable experience, but was that enough? JW: Dominion, the sixth film of the Jurassic franchise, takes the idea of co-existence to the next level, where dinosaurs roam freely in this world like any other animal species. Believe me, it's dumber than it sounds, but somehow, I managed to trick my mind to get along with the idea (like we had any other choice). Anyways, following the events of JW: Fallen Kingdom, dinosaurs are being illegally exported to different parts of the world and Maisie Lockwood now lives with Owen (Chris Pratt) and Claire (Bryce Dallas Howard). Also Blue have a baby now. Two different storylines lead our Jurassic World team to meet the Jurassic Park team in the third act of the film.It won't be wrong to say that there are as many reasons to dislike this film as we have to like it. Let's first talk about the likeable aspects of the film. The visuals of this film are unlike any other film in the franchise and the production value is much higher. Without any doubt, with the advancement of CGI and VFX technology, from a design perspective Dominion is far better than most of its predecessor films. There are lots of new dinosaurs we get to see throughout the film and for those who just want to see cool dinosaurs on the big screen, it's a treat. The cinematography is brilliant. As mentioned earlier it was a one-time kind of experience to watch the original cast back all together and also they have a proper role to play and contribute to the story with balanced screentime. Jeff Goldblum stands out with his skilful performance and humorous dialogues. The film expands Maisie's story and reveals more about her past. The opening sequence might end up being one of my favourite opening sequences of this franchise and the first 10-12 mins were very satisfying.All this looks great when we see them as individual set pieces but director Colin Trevorrow in establishing his vision forgot what we the audience wanted from him. The thrill, the tension and the horror. Dominion lacks all of these. Even Jurassic Park III is more thrilling compared to this film. The core idea of co-existence itself was flawed but nothing was more painful and disappointing than seeing dinosaurs being sidelined as they aren't much of a threat now. The trailer was too revealing. A few scenes seem extremely fake and the stakes were too low because we already know that nothing can happen to our protagonist. Campbell Scott as the main villain was not at all compelling and in an overly-crowded film, no one demanded his presence either. Trevorrow co-wrote this with Derek Connolly, but still, it seems heavily inspired by countless movies. Dominion feels more like a Tom Cruise spy film than a science-fiction adventure. Writing is not only unpleasant but depends heavily on coincidences.Dominion lacks the awesomeness of Spielberg's OG nail-biting horror adventure and the terror of Trevorrow's own Jurassic World. Jurassic Park (I, II and III) were all about dinosaurs and Dominion should have kept itself confined inside that predefined boundary. No matter how rich and lavish Dominion looks from the outside, from inside it's completely hollow. There is no doubt that fans of this franchise (including myself) won't be relying on any reviews and hence like all films of the franchise, this one too is going to be a massive success no matter what. Looking forward to your thoughts on this film in the comments (Letterboxd: m_movie_reviews) if you have watched it.Rating: 6.2/10.

title: good but weak
text: I think overall dominion was a bit of let down. Don't get me wrong I enjoyed this film for its entertainment purposes but for the end of the trilogy it needed more. Where fallen kingdom left of I thought now some of the dinosaurs would have caused so much destruction that earth turned into the planet of the apes style world. But no for the most part everyone is getting on. Owen and claire have their adopted daughter and live in a cabin but when a threat of mutated locusts appears for some reason that becomes the focal point of everything. The strongest thing here was bringing back legacy characters, which in my opinion they did well. Neil,durn and goldbloom brought charm that we needed and really them being in this film made it so much better. Of course though the dinosaur threat could have been better but still an enjoyable film for what it is.

title: I am stunned
text:
By how awful this is.The red head has always been...and continues to be terrible.Is Chris Pratt even in this movie?Justice Smiths character is so over working dinosaurs.And I know this little girl is what...14 years old or whatever...and she was in the last one???But she is absolutely atrocious.It isn't her fault
She's a child. It's the adults at fault.The evil woman...whatever.As I watched this hoping to be entertained. I had no expectations. It was...oh. Another Jurassic park movie...I haven't seen it yet. I'll watch it.Opening scene...ok. Alright.Many different ways u could start..ok.Quickly... garbage.As I continued...my thought was...this is just a movie.The first Jurassic was more than a movie.It was an event.It was a thing.It was...man...did u see how awesome that was etc.Of course..it was unique back then bc it was new and first and exciting.Now.Just a movie.Nothing memorable.No kid in 20 years is gonna say...remember watching Jurassic...oh it was awesome.Nope.But hey. .what it's really all about...
It made a billion dollars.So-oooooo......

title: 6.5 you're expecting to much
text: The movie was fine nothing special. We get to see dinosaurs as if we lived with them.You need to remember this is the 6th dinosaurs movie like it doesnt really have anywhere to go to be special.Enjoy it for what it is the 6th movie about humans bring dinosaurs back to life and now they live amongst us.

title: It's a good way to end Jurassic
text:
Problem being it was more about crickets and the girl
Instead of dinosaurs. But it had more of a far share of Dino's overall it was a good way to end. And we all know Jurassic is a legend!

title: Hollywood has gone PC overboard as usual again.
text: Look all the negative comments on the movie is already stated below, with the boring script, lack of suspense, so on.Oh, that hand Chris Pratt holds up, that'll really ward off those dinosaurs. What kind of idiot thought that was a good idea?Look my problem is the total PC always in theses movies. What's the point of narrative, when it comes to the main point, it lacking in what you want on this type of film.I would not recommend this movie to even my enemies, that's how bad it was, that's saying something. It is a marketing movie, not a movie for the future to look back and say that was a great because of ABC reasons.Rubbish, totally forgettable movie.Hope this director is NOT making movie's in the future.

title: Absolute trash, I loved it
text: Don't expect a thoughtful movie. It's full of flaws and incoherent characters, but that's what makes it entertaining.Full of callbacks and fan service, very fun to watch as long as it's not taken seriously.

title: We could've waited another 65 million years, this film would still be awful
text: To paraphrase the great Dr. Ian Malcolm: they were so concerned with whether they could make five Jurassic Park sequels that they didn't think about whether they should make five Jurassic Park sequels. What a piece of junk the latest one is!! It's plodding and predictable. It offers nothing new, just supposed "homages" and Easter eggs. Thankfully I have Regal Unlimited! Two hours and twenty six minutes long and it felt like four hours!! Sam Neill doesn't seem to realize he's supposed to be playing the same character that he did in the original. Chris Pratt is more annoying by the second. I sincerely hope that his MCU role is almost at an end. Didn't Bryce Dallas Howard have a promising career at one point? And she and Laura Dern's Ellie Sadler are total badasses! Until they have to walk over some bugs,...then the shrieking begins. What crap! What tripe! What an utter waste of time!!

title: More of the same, starring more of the same.
text: It's amusing to me that Director Colin Trevorrow thinks that there should have only been one Jurassic Park (1993), even after directing two of the sequels in the Jurassic World franchise. I mean, he's not wrong. Spielberg's film is a perfect blend of practical effects that helped bring the horror of rampaging dinosaurs to life. I'd forgive any of the sequels if they actually did anything interesting with the concept past what the original did. As it stands, even bringing back three members of the original cast for Jurassic World: Dominion (2022) just highlighted how repetitive this franchise has become.At the end of Fallen Kingdom (2018), there was a whole wide world of dinosaurs to explore, but the Park and World crews instead team up to go to yet another island filled with resurrected dinosaurs. Sure, some of them have feathers this time around, and we get a few "new" dinosaurs fighting old favorites, but it's literally the same plot as ever. Even Jeff Goldblum's character is literally lecturing this fact to the residents of knock-off Apple island. Also, the irony of literal man-eating dinosaurs roaming the world and the human population being more concerned about "rEtUrNiNg tO tHe bEaCh" had such strong Jaws (1975) vibes that echo true today.Now, in my opinion, Dominion isn't terrible. It has its fun moments and wraps up some storylines from previous films in the World franchise. The bits in the "real world" were a great way to show some moments of potential peaceful human/dinosaur scenarios-which is rare in this franchise. I also found the new character of Kayla Watts (DeWandaWise) to be an extremely interesting individual, both in her background and in sheer awesome character design. More of her, please.More of the same, starring more of the same, I give Jurassic World: Dominion 3.0 stars out of 5.

title: Disappointed.
text: The visuals are great and there is many references to the original movie, but the plot was fast and bit too much. They realy used dinosaurs to the fullest. Also very inaccurate in the dinosaur department. They were a bit too smart, being kind to the main characters and ganging up on the evil ones. Also living in cold weather and land dinosaurs swimming uder an ice??. As a big fan of the movies I'm kind of disappointed.

title: Terrible !
text: First of all, I love Pratt and Neill (and the rest of the cast) but they need a good story line. Dominion does not that. Very weak and one bizarre scene after another... see Maverick instead if you are seeking sentiment. SKIP!

title: An agricultural movie that showcases a turkey, locusts and James Bond
text: Colin Trevarrow has hit the final nail on the franchise's coffin by deviating from the central dinosaur themed storyline, with bland dinosaur shots, introducing new uninteresting characters and a weak antagonist. The movie takes inspiration from modern day kaiju movies where the characters are secondary to the primary monster duels which has greatly affected the orginal franchise's plot and character based storyline. The movie could have been directed better by Michael Bay with more explosions and no dinosaurs. The movie makes dinosaur lovers grind their teeths in frustration. Overall a disappointing conclusion to a great franchise.

title: Can I please get my 2 hours and 27 minutes back?
text: This was just awful. We ended up counting how many times Chris Pratt holds his hand up to the dinosaurs. Jurassic Park was MAGIC. This was a bad gas station bathroom in comparison. Do not waste your money.

title: Story not that great of Jurassic Park Level .. .. .. But still better than many other studios
text:
Though many of us may feel including me may feel sometimes that story is not that good but I will highlight Pros and Cons that I observed.PROS:
CONS:

title: Why this was a bad movie...
text: I guess I care more about a plot (it was all over the place so basically there wasn't one), the original Jurassic Park magic (zero here just a show and tell of beasts and the exact same escape situations you've seen 100 times before), the acting (the little girl was HORRIBLE, Chris Pratt was wooden and seemed irritated that the other actors were in the movie, Laura Dern thought she was in a fashion show instead of a movie, Jeff Goldblum was just plain weird and must have gone off script so the film editor hacked up his dialogue). All of those in a movie are distracting and not enjoyable.The only good things were Sam Neill at 74 looked AMAZING and I loved this black lady who was a pilot (yet she only had about 8-minutes of screen time).Also, I absolutely hate it when a movie preaches to me and then ends the movie with what they THINK is an original, profound statement that you've seen and heard a 1,000,000 times before which was - "we can all get along and live in harmony no matter how different we are". Yawn.

title: Technically spectacular, but bit disappointing . . .
text: Technically spectacular, but bit disappointing . . .Visually, perhaps the best yet in the artform of bringing dinosaurs to life. No problem with the suspension of disbelief there, especially with the added details of feathers, and other such anatomically precise renderings.But the story and acting, well, more than a bit disappointing.It seems they were trying too hard to play up the nostalgia and humorous dialogue woven into this. As for generic family viewing, this really is more of a movie for kids, with the parents and adults getting their layers of content almost as more of an afterthought.The one character that really stood out was DeWanda Wise's "Kayla", the gritty, been around the block a few times pilot who loves her flying machinery, and takes life as it comes.The usual suspect crew from the previous films in the series gave the story continuity, but the "magic" just wasn't there. Not sure how to put this exactly, but it just seemed canned, forced, clicheic, to the point where you could tell what their next line was going to be long before they said it.Isabella Sermon did as good a job as can be expected being the young "Maisie", trying to discover the real truth about who she is, where did she come from and so on.The most unfortunate was Jeff Goldblum, who could have been given much better material to work with, but was cast in this very narrow caricature that he had to be confined to.The actual story itself was a bit odd, not so much about dinosaurs living in a human world, but about the evil BioSyn corporation and swarms of giant locusts wreaking havoc upon the civilized world. I get the implications suggested, but it was more than a bit preachy, depicting the popular "woke" notion of evil biotech saturated with corruption and ill intent. The ending was Pollyannaish to an extreme, but again, aimed at kids for the most part.This could have been so much more than what it turned out to be, but then again it could have also been worse.If there is a next one of these, maybe they'll get it closer to what it could become.

title: A heist movie at best
text: This is a boring, confusing instalment of a once beloved franchise. There's barely any dinosaur scenes? Not substantial, edge of your seat, cinematic dinosaur scenes that we've come to love. Very boring, no real storyline.

title: Not A Bad Movie
text: I saw the ratings here on IMDB and waited for it to stream instead of seeing it in theaters. I regret that decision. It was a fairly decent movie. I'd say that the story line used a lot of elements that I've already seen in other movies and wasn't original such as the evil corporation. Also, the movie was a bit too long. I was expecting more of an "End of the World" vibe and it was certainly lacking in that department. That being said it doesn't deserve less than a six rating. I give it a seven. I love that they brought back so many actors from the original Jurassic Park and the urban scenes were really cool. There just needed to be more and they just barely missed the mark.

title: ...I actually liked it!
text: I saw the reviews before going to see this movie, so I had low expectations, but I gotta say, this movie isn't that bad, in fact it's pretty good. It's a TON of fun, and the original characters add some life to this movie that felt missing from the other Jurassic World films. The plot is the only thing that kind of doesn't work, but even so it's not bad, it's just passable. The action scenes are amazing, and the adventurous globetrotting feel of this movie makes it stand out from the others. The dinosaurs, of course, are awesome, and there are some touching scenes with them here. In the end, it's kind of the dinosaurs themselves that are the emotional center of this film.
