Best Jurassic movie since The Lost World.

title: Jurassic World Dominion - The Last Jurassic World?
text: I have to say that I liked it, I really enjoyed it. I watched in the cinema with my wife, we both did like it.Of course it has some flaws and some movie/logic mistakes. But it's a movie, I'm here to enjoy it and not search for every little tiny bit that I didn't like about it.For me it was a must-watch just because of the old cast coming back for it. Sam Neill, Jeff Goldblum and Laura Dern. (If you grew up with the first Jurassic Park movie and liked the old cast, it definitely is worth seeing it.)The plot has some holes and it isn't perfect, but I went there to see some dinosaurs and it serves some dinosaurs. Also it has some references to the old Jurassic Park movies with some scenes and some quotes to it. I liked it for what it was, the plot could have been a bit better and not so predictable, but what should you expect after already 5 Jurassic Park/Jurassic World movies. We got some new dinosaurs to see, the CGI is great, the sounds that they created for it were nice and unique. I'd have wanted a little bit more dinosaurs, more Spinosaurus and more raptors and less subplot, but I still enjoyed it.

title: This movie should be rated B for boring!
text: It is unrealistic too drawn out the plot is lousy and seems non existent. It just has scenes that are action packed yet unsatisfying. The timing makes it more absurd. The lines are so vapid. The stars featured do not distract me from how bad it is.The most original things are little noticable things that still do not make it worthwhile such as a flying motorcycle and people sneaking into a prohibited area. It is sickening. I am glad that I was treated to this garbage but disheartened that I had to sit through it. I recommend skipping it!

title: For fans only
text: Four years after Isla Nublar was destroyed, dinosaurs now live-and hunt-alongside humans all over the world. This fragile balance will reshape the future and determine, once and for all, whether human beings are to remain the apex predators on a planet they now share with history's most fearsome creatures.The movie is driven by action and visual effects, with little care given to things like character development or a well-written plot. The pace is fast, and the movie is exciting, but it's forgettable. The dialogue is often cheesy, and the acting is just okay with Sam Neill, Jeff Goldblum, and Chris Pratt phoning it in. There are a few themes that pop up such as the dangers of messing with nature, but they are quickly abandoned in favour of more action.Jurassic World Dominion is a movie that is best enjoyed as a mindless popcorn flick. It's not going to win any awards, but it's entertaining enough. If you're a fan of the franchise, you'll enjoy it. If you're not, this movie isn't going to change your mind.

title: Not exactly what I was expecting, but a decent movie
text: I am not going to lie, I didn't hate this movie but I also didn't love this movie. The movie flipped and flopped between multiple locations and had a ton of action scenes and it felt overwhelming at times. The movie (at times) felt like it didn't follow a singular storyline and it made it hard to follow sometimes. I thought the actors did a great job, but the movie felt like it relied on a bunch of cgi dinosaur scenes to keep it going. The movie also brought in characters from the original movies and it relied on you kind of knowing who they are to really care about them. Thus it's a little hard to care about a quarter of the cast if you haven't seen the original movies. Don't get me wrong, I love all of these movies for different reasons and this movie is not excluded from that. The movie was really well made and I really enjoyed the combination of old and new characters. I was not expecting to see the original characters throughout pretty much the whole movie and I felt it was a little awkward to throw them into this already established story and character connections in this Jurassic world storyline. I think this would be a good bookend to this movie franchise. No matter, this movie was a pretty good movie.

title: Is this mission impossible 9 or a Jurassic Park movie?
text: First off this feels like a mission impossible movie with dinosaurs. LOL!The animation on this is horrible as well. The puppets are just as bad. The original movie that was made 30 years ago had better animation and puppets. What is going on?They charge us full cinema prices but they skimp on animation? I'm done.Chris Pratt, what are you doing man? Enough is enough. You are an A list movie start. Don't sell out.

title: Nostalgia time!
text: A long back then, who never felt the dinosaur hype? This movie clearly to lit our nostalgic memories about that hype! All the cast from the old movies to the latest movies are perfectly aligned in this movie. Also, rumors said this is the last movie for Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard to be cast.There are 2 main plots: a) the special kid of brilliant dinosaurs scientist, Maisie Lockwood accidentally hunted down coz she have special DNA; and b) Biosyn company that secretly develops illegal research about dinosaurs, their crop product, and gonna create unintentional global disaster. Ofc, both plots brought us to all the old cast and the new cast.Nostalgia seems vividly can be felt. The screenplay looks like purposively creates nostalgia, especially the scene and the moment. The great cast also supports the greatness of this movie blockbuster. They are well-performed to give specific char personality.However, the main cons are the ordinary storyline. Nothin great or amusing enough. Thrillin sensation or emotional moment? Nah-uh! Besides, every char seems just standard quality or nothing prominent enough. Maybe because they're trying to be fair to give equal screen time for a lot of great actors. Nevertheless, the visuals and music are just fine.In conclusion, it's a good movie to lit our nostalgia for dinosaur phenomenon. It makes us more soothed as if we've passed a long-life journey coz we barely realized how long have been passed since the 1st movie of these came to us. Watch it or missed it, nothin' special but it is still good.6/10.

title: Do not waste your money
text: Very disappointing.CGI has many flaws and the storyline is not coherent. They have tried to improve the movie by bringing the original stars from the previous movies but that did not help. The story is weak and lacks coherent.

title: Not good, not terrible
text: The movie was full of exciting and fascinating effects (as usual), but the storyline seemed too forced, the original trilogy's adventure/fantasy vibe has gone totally, transformed into a blockbuster action movie, full of clichs and overused elements. Forced and fabricated character developments, or no change at all. New, seemingly exciting, charismatic, but pretty much expected characters along with old, returning characters, who have acted as 'reminders' of the original concept of the movie. The story is still unfinished, could be continued with some new twist, what can be said about this - and the two previous - movies. The acting was average, neither horrible, nor astounding, as expected from a movie like this. Overall, it was exciting and fun to watch, but looking at it more closely, the movie didn't really have a point, it has a strong message though - the same message that appeared in every 'Jurassic Park' movie: do not interfere with nature's laws. The sensible outcome - according to this movie - is symbiosis and peaceful cohabitating. Humanity's greed and curiousity will never change, but it can be 'cured'. However, in order to achieve that, we need certain punches from life, or else we'll never learn from our mistakes - suggests the movie (series).

title: Terrible plot & storyline.
text: I took ten 12yo boys to this movie to kick off summer vacation and we almost left we were all so bored. My son & I loved the other movies but this was embarrassing. Can't believe the corny dialog. No story. What a waste. Waited a year and a total disappointment. Surprised all of the actors signed on, I know its $ but :/

title: Amazing End To The "World" Franchise...
text: I personally thought that this final chapter was done amazingly.The live action dinosaurs and CGI versions of the dinosaurs were ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE. They all looked so real. This movie also had THE MOST scenes with the live action puppet versions of the DINO's... and all together the most scenes with dinosaurs than any other previous movie.I see many reviews complaining about the "lack of" story about dinosaurs... that's completely not true in any fashion. They do have a few storylines consisting of several non important stories that bring ALL the characters together in the final act. But how much more could the story tellers teach us about these dinosaurs we've seen and studied since the original Jurassic Park in 1993??!!?? We know how they were made and how they've evolved the past 29 years.In closing... THIS MOVIE WAS VISUALLY STUNNING, SCARY, & BEAUTIFULLY PUT TOGETHER. The story was great for each and every character. A beautiful ending to an amazing franchise that has spanned over almost 30 years.I'm very excited where they will take this franchise next??!! I hope they continue with a new storyline and new characters in the next 5 years!If you're a fan of any Jurassic movie... you will definitely love this action filled, dinosaur packed finale! Trust me, you'll be glad you got to see this in the theater and on the big screen! We went to IMAX to see the film this evening.

title: Jurassic World: Dominion - Movie Review
text: Jurassic World: Dominion is a messy, but fun movie. Seeing the old and new cast and characters interact was just awesome, but the many plotpoints get overwhelming at times, and make it hard to follow along with the story. The dinosaurs don't really get the spotlight, as the movie has a Political Theme going on with life living with the Dinosaurs. The size and scope is the biggest we've ever gotten from a Jurassic Movie, spanning to different continents and locations, which makes for some fun scenes with Dinosaur Chases and Dinosaur. Overall, not what I had in mind to be the epic conclusion to the saga, but still enjoyable. So, as the tagline for this review I have to call it fun but really flawed. It didn't bore me in any way, and I was still able to enjoy the movie and have fun with it.. but it had a HECK TON of Problems.

title: pretty fun if you start a third of the way through
text: Dominion starts with a cute little news report explaining how dinosaurs have moved into the rest of the world. It shows dinosaurs all over, including in cities, and there's some fun shots like one of a jungle cat chasing a dog sized dinosaur. It's actually what a lot of the trailer for the movie is pulled from, which is why I was expecting a neat movie about dinosaurs in the cities and countryside instead of what I got, which is another movie with dinosaurs mainly in a big Park type place. (It's a shame the people who made the movie didn't understand what the person who made the trailer did, that a dinosaurs in the city movie would be a really cool thing.)After that enjoyable opening, nothing worth watching happens for about another 45 minutes. It's just tedious dreck and I almost gave up on the movie all together. But at around the 50 minute mark the movie actually starts getting fun. I would recommend skipping forward until you find the place where they're fighting dinosaurs in a skeezy club, which puts you right before a fun chase scene. From there on the movie is actually pretty enjoyable.If you're worried that the movie won't make any sense if you skip the first third don't worry about it because the movie really doesn't make much sense anyway. Just go to Wikipedia and read the first part of the plot summary if you want to feel oriented.Overall this movie is less terrible than the one before it. If they had simply turned the first third of it into like maybe 10 minutes this might actually be a movie that verged on genuinely good.If you've watched all the other movies I'd say go ahead and watch this one too. It's deeply flawed but it has its moments, the cast is good, and the special effects are terrific.

title: Wow.......awful!
text: The only way this film would have been worse is if the Velociraptor started speaking to Chris Pratt. Ridiculous! Joyless Cash-Grab.Lazy acting....script must have been written by a toddler who has a dinosaur figure......mixed with actors who won't get a big payout like this for the rest of their careers.......except Chris Pratt.Tragic!

title: Its like fast & furious but with dinosaurs
text: This is so far the worst movie of the series. If they want to make another Jurassic movie, i hope they go back into horror root instead of this stupid action, mission impossible, fast & furious chris pratt movie.

title: Absolutely Boring Trash With Stupid Hand
text: The story doesn't make any sense. Too much bland and unnecessary long runtime. It's a just short 15 min movie. The movie just looped the same 15 min again and again in different places. Please showcase the hand of Chris Patt in the museum to stop tsunamis and any upcoming diseases. Just show the hand and it will automatically solve all the problems.The whole movie wasn't about dinosaurs, it's all about the stupid hand of Chris Patt.The writer is confused about what to write for the movie! Completely disaster. Jurassic Park should stop and make the movie named " The problem Solver hand".

title: When worlds collide.
text: A good ride for the last of the latest trilogy,l found the long running time didnt go against it.the two worlds of dinosaurs and our own animals living together side by side,plus the old guard of the earlier films mashing together with the younger group makes for an exciting mix.as ever the special effects are top notch but I'm afraid now that audiences have become complacent about such things.another number one film that doesn't own its merit to DC or marvel.

title: Nice Family Movie
text: The film was really a last Goodbye saying thing.Nice to watch, well done, digital perfection, nice entertainment but easy to forget again.But I do not regret, that I watched the last film of this kind.But do not forget > we are the Dinos now!

title: The Rise of Skywalker of the Jurassic Park saga
text:
JW Dominion felt overlong, somewhat emotionless, mildly boring, utterly silly and at odds with all previous 5 movies. This is as disheartening to see as The Rise of Skywalker. Something you wish never happened and saddens you because they used beloved characters just to keep churning out green milk from a now dying cow.First of all I want to point out how stupid Chris Pratt's character has become. A reflection of how blatantly stupid this movie is. Somebody help me understand why he is not worried at all about having a killing machine (Blue) roaming in the nearby forest. I mean, he might start caring once hikers, workers from the wood company, children and the like start appearing dead and severely mutilated all along the area. Not to mention the ecological disaster that means letting the world's apex predator freely roam in the wild. One that would quickly and eventually trigger the extinction of any other carnivore mammals living in the area like wolves, foxes, bears, lynx or pumas.The same goes for the herbivore mammals. Much bigger and more dangerous herbivores
like the Pachycephalosaurus or the Triceratops would eventually displace too the former from their habitats.No one seems to bother.So for me this movie turned Owen and Claire into idiotic and dislikeable characters because of them acting just like 'dinoaddict' morons.Dinosaurs in this movie are just a complement. Every scene they pop up on the screen they remind me of the rides in theme parks. They are there just for the shock value like in "oh a Carnotaurus... oh look there, a Quetzalcosaurus... oh over there! A feathered Velociraptor... oh wow! Look a Therizinosaurus... oh cute, the Dilophosaurus... oh over there, finally! Dimetrodons.....". And so on and on.I could go on with how senseless and unjustified Alan Grant's role in the movie is. I don't think he himself has a clue about what he is actually doing in the movie apart from delivering some fan-service.The issue of the locusts... It's like going to see The Exorcist and instead of the plot revolving around the girl's possession, it revolved around solving the murder of the butler with a candlestick. For example.Another issue. Hispanic people make up 20% of the US population. Where on Earth do you have Latin Americans in this movie? Because the character of Zia Rodriguez has just 10 or less seconds of screen-time. For a 2 hour and 27 minute long movie. Talking about diversity...Roles in JW Dominion:White males: just either evil or mildly stupid.White females: evil, mildly stupid or heroines.Black guys: all heroes.Black girls: heroine (there's only one).Asian guy: he is the smartest among them all but since he is a man he is forced to spend the whole movie in a sad mood saying sorry and acknowledging he is just garbage compared to almighty Virgin Maisie.Latin Americans: Oh I guess they were all working in the fields devastated by the giant locusts. Right?And by the way, this movie 'retcons' the previous movie that had already 'retconned' the previous four installments of the saga. What the h...?So John Hammond was a greedy evil man for trying to create an electrically-fenced theme park with dinosaurs in a remote island, but Dr. Virgin Maisie who magically gave birth to a perfect clone of herself (no need for a man, either father or donor) is the final heroine and savior of the world and the most gracious, brave and brilliant among them all.And just at the eleventh hour we get to know all this..... Oh you cheap hack Trevorrow. You spent way too much time listening to Jar Jar Abrams's ludicrous tricks: 'Mystery boxes! Mystery boxes!!'.After so many decades discussing the moral, ethical and legal implications of cloning perfect human beings... And it just so happens to be the blessing of this world... and of a saga about dinosaurs. Yep.And little Maise, not only is it impossible to connect with her since she behaves like a know-it-all brat, but she has spent four full years living with an all-American couple and she still speaks with the thickest of British accents. The one you only get by attending an Oxford school day in, day out. Just like Rey in Star Wars.... Oh don't get me started on that.And what about the ending. Sweet baby Jesus... it's the same one as in the first Jurassic World but they just changed two of the three dinosaurs...
Wow Colin Trevorrow. You have 'rianjohnsoned' the Jurassic Park saga. Good job.I cannot go on with this.All in all, this movie left me with the same bad taste in the mouth as after one of those long naps when you drool all over your pillow and feel damp and disgusted.Now I hope more people can re-appreciate the likes of The Lost World and Jurassic Park III. Multiple Academy award-winning films compared with this chock-full CGI (I doubt Chris Pratt ever really set foot in Malta) pile of Triceratops manure.

title: Better than i expected......still the worst in the series
text: Well......i went to see this with low expectations after the reviews i read and the negative comments and although the movie indeed suffered here and there and had serious flaws still overall it was enjoyable and had more positives than negatives so it was better than i expected it to be.Overall.......first half an hour was not bad although it could have done more with the story and it was great to see the couple from the jurassic world 1 and 2 films now living together up in the woods with that kid but after that we got like another half an hour of useless chaces with dinos in a kind of a city like mad max atmosphere boredoom but then the movie was fixed and last half an hour was great showing an epic battle between t-rex and gigantosaurus but there should have been more dino battles during the film. Overall not near as good as the previous two JW films but still it was above average and on the plus u get to see also dr alan grant and his love affair from the original 1993 film and of course jeff was back as well. The original cast we all loved was a plus and reason enough to watch this film. If u like dinos films then u should add this to your dvd collection when it's out and complete your DVD JP FILM COLLECTION.GRADE C+

title: A bit bloated but a fun ride overall
text: The first half an hour or so is a bit messy as the film has so many storylines going in different directions. Eventually the film picks up and the actions scenes are well done (although a bit repetitive) . Dont expect anything too complex or innovative, but its a fun popcorn film.

title: Booooring
text: After the ending of the last film it left me and I'm sure everyone else very excited to see what the action will be like when the dinosaurs will roam the planet. Disappointingly there was hardly any action it was so slow and long that I was begging for the film to end. Save yourself time and money and avoid this boring film!

title: A sad ending for JP fans
text: Ultimately a movie that tries to pay homage to the past movies and ends up being a reunion rather than a story. Lots of silly references to the earlier movies, crowbarred in, often leaving gaping plot holes. The movie also seems to try and cram in lots of additional species missed from the earlier films, presumably in a bid to please fans, but instead it interferes with the story or leads to poor action scenes (the final Dino fight for instance).Ultimately disjointed, it feels like half of the movie is on the cutting room floor. It surely would've worked better in 2 parts, with more story building. There are also just too many 'dumb' moments (characters teleporting to the same place, extras ignoring giant.theropods eating people right behind them, characters forgetting that guns kill dinos, I could go on).As a huge JP fan this is a sad ending to the reboot. Sadly all mindless action and reminiscing. If you turn your brain off, it's fun enough, but ultimately the worst film of them all by some margin.

title: They all phoned it in
text: Take all the things that made the original great - acting, script, cgi, score and scenery - remove that and you have this movie. What an absolute trash homage with actors phoning it in for an international audience.

title: Terrific action scenes but the "plot" strains credibility
text: "Jurassic Park Dominion" (2022 release; 147 min.) is the 6th (and last?) movie in the Jurassic Park franchise, and concludes the Jurassic World trilogy. I typically start my movie reviews with a very brief description of how the movie opens plot-wise, and I'm going to skip that in this instance, as the plot of "Jurassic Park Dominion" strains credibility in every which way. So let me get to my main comments instead."Jurassic Park Dominion" is written and directed by Colin Trevorrow, who also did the honors on the first Jurassic World, and co-wrote the second one. I, and millions of viewers, primarily come to watch this in order to get really good action scenes, and at that level, the movie delivers, primarily in the second half. It's as if this brings all of the best action scenes of the previous Jurassic franchise into a single film. The casting, which combines the stars of the original movies with the stars of the Jurassic World movies, reminded me immediately of "Star Trek Generations" where they combine the original Star Trek stars with the Star Trek The Next Generation stars. But in the end, the REAL stars of Jurassic World Dominion are of course the dinosaurs, looking more real than ever before. There is no reason that this movie needs to last 2 1/2 hours. Cut out 20-30 minutes of meaningless "plot" and you'd still have the same blockbuster summer movie smash."Jurassic Park Dominion" opened 2 weekends ago to mega-size box office (although not quite as high as "Top Gun Maverick"). The Tuesday early evening (discount) screening where I saw this at here in Cincinnati was attended okay but not great (about 10 people), and that was quite alright with me. If you are a fan of the Jurassic franchise, you'll want to keep expectations in line, and then enjoy if for the action scenes. Nothing more, nothing less.

title: NO ONE CARES ANYMORE
text: This franchise should have been extinct since 1997. The original cast is here for the paycheck. The new cast is laughable. The plot is... Does this movie even have one? The CGI looks fake as hell. It's boring! Nothing specially thrilling happens. There's no payoff. Rubbish.

title: Fun, emotional and exciting but nothing new.
text:
Unlike JW Fallen Kingdom which featured amazing classic horror elements this movie doesn't present something new to the franchise and that's not bad but it could have done something better.Instead of feeling like a dinosaur movie with action and adventure it feels like an action movie with dinasaurs in it.*Minor spoiler incoming:
JW Fallen Kingdom ended in a high note and it settled the ground for a great third movie, instead of focusing on how the world deals with dinasaurs they focused in Teenage Mutant Bugs... for some reason??Still, it's a fun movie and it was great to see Sam Neill and Laura Dern once again, Sam Neill steals the show with his charming, grumpy performance as Dr. Alan Grant.

title: The original cast is what makes it float
text:
Jurassic World Review-Pros:
The nostalgia! I watched the original Jurassic Park the night before watching this movie and I'm so glad I did because there are a lot of nods to the original film! It was really fun seeing the original cast back again for the first time in 30 years!Visual and sound. The sound editing and mixing as well as the visual effects I thought were really great, I didn't see it in XD/IMAX but I wish I did because that's the way it was meant to be seen. Especially the sound.Strong family vibes & morals. I love the relationship that all the characters have with each other. I love the role they all take in being such good parents, friends, romantic partners, etc. There were parts that were very sweet and I appreciated it, even in a dinosaur movie they don't overlook how important it is to have these bonds with other people. When the original cast meets the new cast it's almost like watching different avengers meet each other for the first time, I loved that.Cons:Kinda confusing. There are parts that are kind of confusing and you definitely need subtitles for if you are used to watching subtitles at home. If you remember Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom there are some scenes where they talk about clones and people that are clones which honestly is annoying and I wish they would've just taken all that out because it makes the science and technology of this movie more complicated.Parts that are boring. The movie doesn't take off for a while as soon as they are all in the jungle and then they all meet each other is when the movie really gets going and gets good. But you have to get past some boring scenes.Some bad acting. The villain in this movie has horrible acting. I'm not sure what the actors name is but he is Peter Parker's dad on the Amazing Spider-Man. I thought he would be great since he's great in that movie but in this one he is really really bad. It's almost like he forgot all of his lines or something. Maybe should of recast.Too long. The movie is pretty long it's 2 1/2 hours. This is the longest Jurassic movie ever done and it could of been shortened, especially during the first half part of the film.All in all I would rate it a 7/10. Purely because the original characters are so great.

title: Slept most of the time
text: Except the action sequences because the noise wouldn't let me, I slept most of the time. Actors have acted pathetically. Two stars for the bike chase sequence, rest is all seen multiple times before. Stop making Jurassic movies.

title: I can't understand the be critics
text: It was nice to see the ob cast return, the Dino's and cgi were beautiful and the action was great, all in all a great experience, Dont understand the bad critics. I mean what did u expect it's a dinosaur Movie.

title: I was rooting for the dinosaurs to just eat everyone
text: How can this movie be done so poorly? How can the special effects be so bad in 2022? Also, why do we have the same old tired lines and dialogue decades later? Why does a dinosaur take so long to eat someone? It's it has to look above the car, under the car, into the prey's eyes and then pose for a photoshoot. It all seemed so stupid. I mean at the beginning of the movie Chris Pratt makes a promise to a dinosaur! It's insulting to the audience. This movie was long and boring and I was actually hoping the dinosaurs get to eat some of these boring, tired characters. I could not care less about what happens to any of them. I still have 30 min left of the movie, but I felt compelled to write this review while still watching it.

title: Better and smarter than the average blockbuster
text: In 1993 Steven Spielberg's 'Jurassic Park' was an awe-inspiring spectacle like relatively few pictures can claim. For however well made subsequent films were made, in retrospect it's not wrong to say that the franchise kind of feels like B-movies writ large, like what SyFy original movies might look like if they had the largest of budgets and best of all resources. When the first trailer dropped for 'Jurassic World Dominion,' whatever else might end up being true of the picture, at least in concept it struck me as the dinosaur movie we've been waiting thirty years to see. To have read more about the production, and to have finally watched the finished product, this is even more true than I could have hoped. This isn't to say that JWD is perfect by any means, but of course it's incredibly well made, and acted, and for the most part very well written. It's smarter and more thoughtful than the average blockbuster, and if it falters along the way, it's not for lack of effort, but maybe just too much.What's most notable is how very different this picture feels compared to its predecessors - obviously part and parcel with the scenario. Substantial portions of the narrative would fit neatly into any big-budget thriller, with flavors of Action, Political, and Sci-Fi at varying points. In these facets and as well in quieter moments of exposition or reflection, major themes emerge which are painfully true and relevant to real life. 'Dominion' explores balance in the natural world; humanity's quarrelsome relationship with nature, and our attempts to coexist with it or bend it to our will; the abuse, destruction, and mismanagement of wildlife; science without ethics; idealism confronted with lack of control, leading to profound regret (something I can readily identify with); extreme, egregious corporate malfeasance and dodging of responsibility; man-made ecological calamity and impending extinction level events; and more. It's very noteworthy and very important that the plot also broaches the topic of GMOs - and not the nonsensically alarmist tripe about genetically modified food being bad for people and animals (news alart: all crops and livestock since the advent of agriculture has been genetically modified), but the real harm of GMOs, which is corporate monopolization of the food supply. These are all notions which have been touched upon in other stories, only in this instance, each and every one has been twisted together with dinosaurs.There's so very much that filmmaker Colin Trevorrow and co-writer Emily Carmichael have tried to let this feature say, be, and do. To their credit, for as towering and arguably bloated as the narrative is, it is cohesive, coherent, and complete; engaging, and satisfying. Every aspect of the screenplay is filled with gratifying intelligence, blending together the inflated genre romp sensibilities of the most highfalutin sci-fi adventure bombast with stark, gnawing themes; fantasy violence with realist human drama (or maybe one should say terrestrial drama); action sequences with garnishes of scientific fact, theory, and jargon; ham-handedness, sincere humor, thrills, and emotional investment with, yes, awe and wonder. Such grand ambition is, ultimately, also the chief weakness of the film. There's so very much that 'Dominion' wants to say, be, and do, and it may well have been to the benefit of the story, and the themes, to split this almost three-hour extravaganza into multiple pictures. The amalgamation as we see it is better than one could have hoped for, and done very well, yet there's unquestionably a sense that everything is jam-packed too tightly, disallowing every component part to receive the treatment it fully deserves. There's not one idea herein that itself couldn't have been expanded into a full-length film.Still, if that's the most significant criticism to lay at the feet of a hulking monstrosity like a sixth Jurassic Something movie, then I'd say it's doing pretty well for itself. Yes, there are instances when the scene writing or dialogue borrows from previous entries, 1993's progenitor especially. (In the spirit of generosity, one might say such moments are an homage.) There are also instances when the intended thrills become so over the top that SyFy might after all be the best point of reference, and the employment herein of Owen's trademark training gesture is 100% gauche. None of this is anything we wouldn't expect from the average blockbuster, however, so one can only take such matters with a grain of salt, or a stiff upper lip, or whatever other colloquialism one prefers. And meanwhile, in every other way, 'Dominion' is just as well made as one would assume of such a major motion picture event. The cast is great, bringing to tremendous life the parts they have with all the skill and sincerity they can muster. Whether animatronics or CGI, all the creatures look outstanding, and so do all the other effects, and the stunt work. The production design and art direction are downright exemplary. I admire Michael Giacchino's score, despite those places where it too blithely imps John Williams' pre-established themes. Lighting, direction, John Schwartzman's cinematography - all exquisite. This is the result of all the accumulated knowledge and experience of how to create a movie of this nature, on this level.At length, I do very much enjoy 'Jurassic World Dominion.' Whatever one's impetus for watching, I think it's well worth it, including simply the silly, baseline popcorn-chomping entertainment and satisfaction of the climax, and even the entirely all too easy resolution the ending represents. Its strengths and its faults are equally clear, I think, but by all means, on the balance this is a highly enjoyable sci-fi adventure flick. In fact, I'd love to say that I like it even more than I do, but the rational part of my brain tells me that the feature's favor of Most Blockbuster Fun over Best Storytelling Judiciousness decrees a measure of reservation. Even at that - though imperfect, I had a fantastic time watching. Second only to 'Jurassic Park,' this is almost certainly the best installment in the franchise. Even at its worst and most self-indulgent there's a lot to love here, and I'd have no qualms about recommending it to just about anyone, but especially those with an especial fondness for the '93 film. What else is there to say? If you have the chance to watch, 'Jurassic World Dominion' is worth three hours of your time.

title: Can this franchise die now?
text: Dominion is everything wrong about the other bad sequels but triple down to make the worst film of the franchise. The writing is pathetic (filled with annoying remember this moments, coincidences and plot holes galore, and not focusing on dinosaurs on earth and instead recycles ideas from the other movies), the character are paper thin (either plot device or fan service), the visuals are absolute garbage, the editing is confusing and all over the place, the action is dull (terribly done and no tension because everyone is invincible), the acting is phoned in, the music is a poor John Williams imitator, the dinosaurs are an afterthought, the movie never addresses the Dino's on earth concept, and the ending is one big middle finger to the fans, Spielberg, and the franchise itself. Don't watch it for any reason. Stay with the first film. Hopefully this can finally make this franchise go extinct.

title: Nostalgic elements made the movie tolerable
text: This movie is everything I expected it to be: loud, dumb, and over the top action packed. I was neutral about this movie, it's so bad that it's almost good. What definitely worked for this movie was bringing back characters from the original films. I enjoyed seeing Neil and Dern along side Dallas and Pratt as well as the newcomers, Wise and Athie. However, a lot didn't work, like the storyline. It's generic and I expected much more. The dinosaurs are almost an after thought in this storyline, placed second to gigantic locusts (yes, silly, I know). Not horrible, but wasted opportunity. I would have preferred the movie expanding on humans living with dinosaurs in a modern world and exploring the moral and ethical debates that go along with it. It briefly touched on that but didn't dive in before creating some bogus plot about a corporation out to disrupt the food chain. Could have had some thought provoking yet terrifying and majestic scenes instead of the over utilized "evil corporation tries to take over the world" plot.

title: This was the most horrible most boring and lengthy Jurassic ride ever
text: Being fan of Jurassic parts series as worth to see such movies on big screen and with audio setup, i was the most disappointed person perhaps on earth with this episode of so called JP dominion. It was the most boring and lengthy jurassic ride ever as many a times it put me on sleep. I was shocked that they have shown that all dinosaurs are blind and that these tiny helpless humans are in just 1-2 feet away in front of them and they cannot see them and so they cannot eat them just beacuse they are main characters. How stupid. Directors and producers did a terrible job, acting was totally an overacting and it was as usual and nothing new there except some pretty faces. 90% was CG so just watch it as you are jurassic park fan otherwise you wont miss anything if you miss to watch it.

title: Easily the best of the JW trilogy and not just because of the original characters coming back, but overall more dynamic.
text: This is the first of the JW trilogy that actually resembles the legendary brilliance of the original JP in certain forms. While it still does suffer from certain clichs and scattered random plot choices, it's definitely the most chaotic and entertaining since the original. The dinosaurs are more fearsome than ever and definitely make the ride that much more intriguing with cgi that is highly precise. The old and new cast blending works fairly well Though can be somewhat forced at times with the comic relief. The original actors definitely add that bit of fan service we all know would come along with them. I still don't think this trilogy was as good as it could've been it does close out in a very solid fashion.

title: Better than the last.
text: Most people commenting haven't even seen the movie and are just trying to give it a bad rating. They're called trolls.I haven't seen the movie yet so I can't give it a review. However there's no debate it's better than Fallen Kingdom that was a disaster.

title: Jurassic World? I'm not a fan.
text:
Speaking of jokes. A ridiculously bad story, peppered with pointless subplots, that drags on for an unbearable 147 minutes. In the end, what we have here is 3 movies thrown together into one. Clone girl story meets killer locust story meets - yes actually dinos and a park. And all that in Fast & Furious style. That's right. You don't know whether to laugh or cry, but the Jurassic finale is
probably the saddest waste and demystification of dinosaurs imaginable.Not even the nostalgia bubbling OGs Neil, Dern and Goldblum could save this sinking ship of a movie, but they at least made it more bearable. Plot convenience and embarrassingly bad dialogue across the board. Chris Pratt delivers the most bored performance of his career. And worst of all, you can't even blame him.Praise is due to the visuals. The dinosaurs look great, the perfect balance of VFX and special effects. There is one action sequence that stands out. Other than that, Jurassic World: Dominion is a soulless conclusion to a trilogy that actually started solidly, but in retrospect we never needed.Respect to director Trevorrow, to be involved in wrecking 2 multi-billion dollar franchises within 3 years - that's a hard act to follow.P. S Lesson for life, some things are better left extinct.

title: same old same old
text: Same old cat and mouse play between our heroes and dinosaurs. Doest matter where exactly, it can be a facility, park, island whatever.If you are a bad guy dinosaurs will attack you and catch right away, but if you are from the main cast group they will circle around you for hours.So story and writing havent been able to develop at all. Same formula.Casting and acting was only for nostalgia. Yes it was nice too see old and young generation together but they didnt have a good story to bound them. So it was just based on nostalgia feeling movie.And of course every jurassic park have to have a trex fight in the end, but this time we couldnt even pick a side because even they didnt have any story to back up with.How did this movie reach almost to a 1B$ beyond me but nowadays just make a movie with name and marketing so mindless audience floods you money anyway. No more creativity just milking the project.

title: It's a very good movie
text: Jurassic World Dominion is better then Fallen Kingdom and better then Jurassic Park 2 and 3, but it's not as good as Jurassic Park or Jurassic World. I loved majority of the movie I had a few problems with it, but mostly it was an enjoyable movie.

title: A similar approach remind me of rise of skywalker..
text: ....After seeing the film, it remind me of episode 9 from star wars who try too much something to recreat nostalgia and iconic scene and moments from previous film to please the fan ..let say..It had a good time but i expect something different i think. The story go sometime a bit too far with a first act i felt a bit long and boring and the good thing come in the second act because i was a bit scare in the 30 first minutes - acting and editing are sometime very bad and cheesy but in somes moments , it shine specialy in the scene with Grant Malcom or Ellie from the first trilogy , you get nice nostalgia moments between them with amazing actions sequence and special effects. I can describe it like the action in Fast and furious. Its epic in some way but very unrealistic in some scenes still enjoyable most of the time if u forget this. Yes!! There is good moments, very good moments . CGI are good i think except for few scenes because let say , designs for new dinosaures are particuliar and make the blend between CGi and reality more difficult to hide. Its not a step up from the last two last films . Im still impress with the first film that still hold up even today. This film bring no real surprise on the story side and the pacing his very fast , i wish we had more time despite being the longest film in the franchise.I hope we get a extended cut to answers some elements and directions the story go because there is a lots of characters, new plots , new dinosaures and sometime it seem i miss the attachements or the emotions form previous entry or simplicity . At the end we can say this is a big mashup for fan service . Not to spoil! If u go see the movie for the utimate ending like i did , u wil be surprise actually that it open many doors to more questions or another films maybe.But if u want to see big action moments with dinos and there is a lots old and news . It delivers ! I think it try too much to please to everyone from the last 5 movies in a complexe story so its a big kraft diner of good and bad thing still a very moving film to watch in Imax.

title: Main focus (coming to an end?)
text: Allegedly this is going to be the last one - well that is probably true ... until the next one comes out. And by that I mean the next trilogy. Maybe this time around they will do a reboot - stop laughing. Although I guess that pun is worth at least a chuckle.Now for those who have not seen a Jurassic Park/World movie ... I am not sure, you want to start with this movie right here to be honest. It does make sense to at least watch the first Park and World movies. Just so you understand why the linger on some shots - or why you should go wow or aw at certain moments.Of course the movie is filled with amazing visual moments. And while I credit this for not being the first movie with slight changes ... it isn't too different from it either. The trailer and the buzz did suggest that this time this would go worldwide. But apart from one action scene outside the Park/World - we again go back mostly to the enclosed space where most of the dinosaurs are being held.We do have the uber-villain once again. Those rich people who can't get enough ... money? But he says it isn't about money ... what is it about then? You better not start with questions is my advice. Whether it is about motive or about logic (characters being superheroes and not feeling pain - though you have that in other movies too) or the story ... just enjoy the madness. And some interesting moments. Most of best ones coming from something Jeff Goldblum delivers - not sure if those were all written in the script or he improvised ... but they do work.That being said, we should not expect much more from this franchise. Now lay them to rest - please.

title: Silly little plot with some entertaining moments
text: There have been better Jurassic movies... And there have been worse. I was hoping 'Dominion' would stop trying to take this whole "dinosaurs in modern society" schtick too seriously. I mean, seriously, this plotline is taken way too seriously. With this silly plotline, at least make it a comedic movie or something. I cringed every time I saw one of the characters in imminent danger of being attacked by a dinosaur simply raise their hand as if magically all dinosaurs will obey that gesture and not eat them.Dinosaurs that hunt and eat people are everywhere, and the film's ending message is that we'll just have to learn to co-exist. Seriously??? That's never going to work when every facet of life is disrupted by dinosaurs that can hunt you down at kill you at any moment without warning. Their impact on the global food chain would not bode well for the planet's well-being either. And the constant threat of flying pterodactyl's on the aviation industry?? Need I go on??...The only realistic ending to save the planet would be to exterminate each and every dinosaur. As Jeff Goldblum's character said in the first JP film, "dinosaurs had their shot already". But hey, killing all the dino's would make for a boring movie. So, insert old JP actors with the new ones for nostalgia, then turn off your brain and watch CGI dinosaurs happily co-exist with humans in the end.

title: What is Tim Apple doing in Jurassic World?
text: Jokes aside, this was a movie that was really curious for me. The idea was fantastic, trying to find an equilibrium with dinosaurs after the genie is out of the bottle. However, the execution was really choppy, each scene was as unbelievable as the next, and that has to be the fault of Colin the director. It makes me miss the first Jurassic World movie, which I thought was the weakest, but he executed it already well there.Maybe its time constraint, or stuff, but I appreciate the effort by everyone involved. Its a good ending, but really could have been a blockbuster, and it probably would in the box office, but not a blockbuster that Jurassic 1 and 2 were, or even Fallen Kingdom.

title: So disappointing on so many levels
text:
For a minute there I thought they are trying to use the force...
Boring story, waaaay to long, no flair. It fell really flat and dinosaurs were only used for the effect they did not really add to the story. They wre trying really hard to squeeze as many species in as possible, which is quite nice to see. The CGI was very nice, as expected. Unforrunately It would have worked with wolves or bears the same way. Normally I LOVE the franchise and watched all the movies more than once, yes Even the third one, but I don't think I would Watch that one again.It's a shame that the franchise shall end that way.

title: "It's not about us..."
text: This short line uttered by Alan Grant presaged that epic alpha v alpha bust up between the Giganotosaurus and the Tyrannosaurus Rex. It came at the climax of this fantastic movie, bookending the Jurassic Park saga that started 30 years ago. What a phenomenal summer blockbuster bonanza this has been for people of my demographic! First, we were brought back to our need for speed, and now, within weeks, we were being brought back to the magic of our love for dinosaurs. Having Sam Neil, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum coming together for this (possible) one last outing was an excellent peach of a decision by the production team. This movie captured exactly the sense of wonder, thrill, excitement and adrenaline rush many of us experienced back in 1993, and it also gave today's audience what they wanted, ie, that big feast of dinosaurs from different historical timelines and geography coming together. It even managed to bring a nod to the original in a crucial scene at the end, where, just like in 1993, the greedy bad guy tried to escape with a container of dinosaur DNA, got stuck, tried to get away, but eventually was confronted and killed by a group of Dilophosaurus. That is the charm of this movie, and I was still trying to catch my breath when the credits were rolling.This is going to be a movie summer many will remember!

title: Quite predictable, huge cast is not always interesting
text: The screen was cropped due to the aspect ratio. (I saw it in PVR India & not IMAX).Well, it starts from where they left in 2018. The dinosaurs are living among the public, throughout the world. Making a place for themselves in the eco system.They have a huge star cast, especially from the Jurassic park franchise.It's one time watch, with a predictable storyline and awful dialogues.You must go with your lil ones(kids) or there is no adventure in it.

title: Do not waste your time.
text: It's another woke movie full of non sense just to tick boxes and make certain people happy (otherwise they gonna cry like babies).Downvote to oblivion and boycott every woke movie/tv show out there.

title: Needed more Chris Pratt
text: Had some of the best dinosaur chase scenes I've ever scene, but why did I leave feeling like Laura Dern's character Ellie drew focus the whole movie? I was literally there to see Chris Pratt who needed more lines in general especially with Bryce Dallas Howard. Storyline definitely needed work and did not meet expectations.

title: I'd love for this to be the end of the Jurassic franchise
text: 'Jurassic World Dominion' is far from perfect, if just about entertaining to watch... kinda.I'm not fully convinced by it but I do think there's enough in there that's worth watching. There are too many characters, even main characters with the original trio and the newer duo both involved equally. With that said, I do like 'em. It's pleasant to see Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum, while Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard are a good pairing.Still, I wouldn't say any one character stands out here. They all make their presence known, though I'm struggling to remember any great moments individually - that's due to the aforementioned surplus. The rest of the cast, fwiw, are all fine - Mamoudou Athie sticks out most in that regard.The run time is overlong, in my opinion. I personally could've done without 30 or so minutes and I wouldn't have felt it was missing anything. The story itself isn't all that fresh, as in I feel like I've seen this sorta thing before (I mean, Biosyn... how creative!), but the barrage of dinosaur-centric action probably just abouts tips it over into a positive rating for yours truly. Could easily be lower, though.I'd love for this to be the end of the Jurassic franchise (is there much more to tell?) but there ain't no way Amblin/Universal are leaving this IP to collect dust, let's be honest.

title: Hmmmm.. maybe I can take up acting myself if this is considered a movie
text: I love, and I mean LOVE Jurassic Park and I knew this film wouldn't be great so I went in with low expectations but wow... this movie is a mess, it doesn't feel like Jurassic Park. The actors seem like they were paid to try and downplay their acting to give the movie a special sense of corn. I was 3 minutes in before I knew this movie was a fail. The best part of this movie is I now know who produced it so I can stay clear of any garbage he tries to come up with next. There is no adventure, no excitement and nothing exciting about this movie. My favorite part is going to be when this garbage heap ends so I can watch anything else other than this.

title: Not as bad as all the big critics are claiming
text: As an avid action flick fan, I really enjoyed Dominion. But I don't understand why so many are dead set on this being the worst one of the franchise. (Come on guys, is it really worse than JP3 or Fallen Kingdom?) Most of the reviews from popular critics like to call out Dominion's length and how it "is a soulless imitation banking on nostalgia." However, of the six Jurassic Park movies, this is not the worst by a long shot.While the length at 2 1/2 hours is a bit of a detriment, "soulless" is not the word I would use. Dominion pays off to many of the themes that have been set up by Jurassic World and Fallen Kingdom. None of the characters are obnoxious to the point of unlikable. The cinematography and especially the sound design are very well done. The plot, though a bit chaotic, can still be followed easily enough.However, the film still has its flaws. Some of the side plots don't get enough attention, and the villain is a little sub-par. The second half follows the humans a lot more than the dinosaurs, and that could be a turn off for fans of the franchise. The aforementioned length does make it difficult for those with short attention spans to sit through. By the 2/3rd point I was staring to notice it hadn't wrapped up yet, but the pacing was well done and at no point was I ever bored.So why are so many big-name critics so willing to throw Dominion under the bus? I have a theory. After so many sequels that failed to capture the magic of the original, encluding Dominion, these critics take their anger of a franchise as a whole and apply it to the latest film. The problem is that the original was truly one-of-a-kind, and very few movies can hold a candle to it. It would take nothing short of a miracle to surpass the original Jurassic Park.The other thing I have noticed it that there has been an increasing disconnect between critics and audiences. Many review websites, YouTube channels, and social media outlets like posting negative reviews because that's what gets the clicks. I get it; it's fun to write and to read slander about something you disagree with, but if you only focus on the bad then that is all you'll ever find.Overall, by no means perfect, it is a decent and effective conclusion to the Jurassic World trilogy.

title: Abomination
text: Imagine having your name attached to this movie. Truly awful. The dialoged was cringe, the SFX were awful, and the plot was so stupid I couldn't believe it. Obviously this is nowhere near the original, that's a given, but this is also so much worse than the previous two Jurassic World movies. It didn't even entertain me accidentally or ironically, I only finished it because I wanted to see if I could withstand it mentally as some sort of confidence building trophy for myself. Kinda like that scene in Planes, Trains, and Automobiles where Steve Martin goes off on Del in the hotel room. "How can you stand it?" "Because I've been with Del Griffith."

title: A little of this, a little of that.
text: Honestly you could of put any title on this movie and it could have been just that. Watch this movie only for entertainment purposes, if that. This movie was a mix of Indiana Jones, Star Wars, Mission Impossible mixed in with dinosaurs. No story at all just different scenes put together and called it Jurassic World. I spent some of the movie feeling frustrated and yelling at the screen at scenes that made no sense. People with guns but instead used other tools to fend of dinos, weird! Scenes will jump to the next without gradual understanding of how character got there and how people surviving in almost an all but fist fight with a dino. The acting is good and they're acting skills is what carried the movie. This Comment will probably make no sense but hey it goes right along with the movie.

title: BORING & Laughably Bad. They Made Jurassic Park 3 Tolerable Compared To This.
text:
"Now eventually you might have dinosaurs in your dinosaur movie now, right?"
Watched the Extended Cut which included scenes involving dinosaurs, all cut theatrically. Including T-Rex drive-in attack.A Jurassic movie about dinosaurs and it's painfully boring. People criticized Lucas for having a lot of walking and talking in the SW prequels, but the prequels are no where near as boring as this one Jurassic World film. If you watched the extended cut, you'll get a few more dinosaurs scenes. Not many, but it's something."There have never been more dinosaurs, than there are in Dominion. Maximum amount" -Bryce Dallas Howard.Was there anything good in this? They finally brought back the Dilophosaurus. That's it. Now, for everything else...Since 1993, I have seen every Jurassic film in theaters. However, because of how bad Fallen Kingdom was and how poorly received Dominion was, this marked this first Jurassic film I skipped seeing in the theater. I have no regrets about this decision. The Jurassic World trilogy goes the same route as the sequel trilogy. Started off decent, but was then followed up with two painfully bad sequels. Almost like there was no roadmap throughout the JW trilogy. However, I actually think they had one planned after the first JW film. If so, they should've hired better writers. Colin was probably one of the worst filmmakers in re-sparking Spielberg and Crichton's Jurassic series. Those who think Colin's Episode 9 "Duel of The Fates" would've been good or better than TROS, look no further than his JW trilogy for that answer.Another big issue with the film. I did not care about anything going on, or for the Jurassic World characters. Colin ran out of ideas and ended up recreating the T-Rex battle from the first JW as the finale, and it's completely pointless just like this film. In the dumbest way possible, they even gave life to the Jurassic logo. Dinosaurs are roaming the earth and it's treated in a "just live with it" approach, I was actually wishing this world would get destroyed from its stupidity. The threat of dinosaurs escaping to the mainland in Michael Crichton's books was a real nightmarish threat that he captured in the most terrifying ways. I have tremendous love and respect for life without a human voice, but Dominion's acceptance of a world with dinosaurs which wasn't the result of nature's intention but instead human/clone girl error is treated similar to the story in a children's pop-up book.The main conflict is about...locus. That's right! Not dinosaurs, but locus and farm crops. What is a plot about locus and the world's food supply doing in the Jurassic film where dinosaurs are physically roaming the earth? The Jurassic series is science fiction, and maybe a central conflict of a company releasing giant locus to threaten the world's food supplies might work in another story. To have a locus conflict this late in the series as the final built-up conflict was tragic. The build-up and cliffhanger in JW2 was dinosaurs are free to roam and terrorize the mainland. This should be the focusing conflict of your trilogy's finale. What were these filmmakers thinking?Lewis Dodgson is the character I always wished would return in the Jurassic sequels. A key sideline villain in Crichton's JP novel, and the main villain in Crichton's The Lost World novel. Dodgson finally returns, only he now looks like the CEO of Apple which is ABSOLUTELY DREADFUL.Was I suppose to picture Skyfall and The Bourne Ultimatum in the action sequences of a Jurassic film? No, but I was because the chase scene in the middle of the film was riddled with James Bond and Jason Bourne material. Remember how Pratt could hold up his hand with the raptors and it would trigger something in them? A move he'd been doing since they were babies. Let's call it, the Force, because now anyone can do it on any random dinosaur and it will hold them off, just like the Force. The film's stupidity has gone interstellar.Riddled with action cliches, excessive contrivances, conflict cliches, predictable outcomes, repeating visuals which no longer dazzle us, a complete lack of tension and terror, zero excitement, call backs to better films which have already been done in the previous Jurassic World films. Nothing is fresh, and what remains is stale. The film even damages its own trilogy by acknowledging characters and events in JP3, while forgetting there is another island called Site B with lots of dinosaurs roaming it.Remember the magic, the wonder, the awe, the thrills, the horrors, the excitement of Jurassic Park? All of this gone. Lost to a bunch of filmmakers who think bigger and more dinosaurs is all that matters rather than script and characters. The Lost World recaptured these elements the best. Even JP3 got some elements right when none of JW sequels did. I actually thought Fallen Kingdom was the lowest these Jurassic World films could go. Unfortunately, I was wrong. Dominion falls on the same level of bad as Fallen Kingdom did, but it might actually be worse. Dominion, just like The Last Jedi and Indy 5, is a franchise killer.

title: I like this!!
text: Felt awesome, sounded awesome.. what else do you need? If I had to criticize a bit, our main characters didn't feel like they were the main and also the movie could have been a bit shorter.I can't wait to own this on 4K. And if I had time I'd definitely like to watch this once again in cinemas..

title: Great Fun!
text: Jurassic World Dominion: Dinosaurs everywhere, yeah they spread out after the escapes in the last film. Of course there's a black market, trading in the creatures. In some places there's a modus vivendi, wonderful to watch brontosauri proceeding stately, respected by loggers. But other outfits illegally trap, breed and export the dinosaurs. Clair Dearing is back combating these trappers, Owen Grady (on horseback) rounds up the animals to be transported to reserves. They both live in a remote cabin in the Sierra Nevada mountains with the cloned Maisie Lockwood. But Maisie is kidnapped along with the baby raptor Beta. A parallel story-line involves Ellie Sattler and Alan Grant trying to solve the riddle of what has caused a plague of giant locusts which is devouring crops and causing famine. They link up with Ian Malcolm. There's also the sinister BioSyn company which runs a dinosaur reserve in a temperate rain forest in the the Dolomite Mountains. The two narratives eventually merge in that valley.Great scenes of battling dinosaurs but also TV News shows about the problems the creatures cause. Small flying dinosaurs devouring doves released at a wedding, a trawler being dragged under by a sea dinosaur. Planes are brought down by flocks of Quetzalcoatlus and a Giganotosaurus combats a T-Rex. The screenplay won't win an Oscar but there are frightening, amusing and thrilling scenes. Also some excellent scenes of raptors pursuing motorbikes and and chasing people across rooftops. My favourite scene was an escooter rider being plucked up and devoured! A chase movie, an action thriller and a conspiracy involving a Bond style villain. Just enjoy it! Directed by Colin Trevorrow, written by Trevorrow and Emily Carmichael. 7/10.

title: Wow, spoiled a decent franchise!
text: Trite, formulaic tosh. It's so bad I've downloaded this app and created an account just so I can review it. I enjoyed the other movies, although none had the magic of the first, but this is almost as though the writers couldn't be bothered . Or all the budget went on getting all the original actors back. Such a waste, and don't get me started on the number of times, a massive predator was able to take to creep up and take the cast by surprise, were they genetically modified to tip toe ?I'm annoyed with this movie I was looking forward to seeing it and basically after the first hour I became so apathetic I decided to spring clean my email accounts while the film dragged on to its end.

title: Maybe...
text: The viewing pleasure of the movie was high, but one of the most important things that should be in most movies was very weak, the music. It would not be wrong if I say that a movie with weak music is doomed to be bad. The action and chase scenes were really weak due to the music, they didn't even need to put music in some scenes, this really upset me. Another issue is the bad character, even though our bad character seems like a cold-blooded person, it was a little weak in my opinion and the ending was a clich. I couldn't see any problems in the visual effects, but the dinosaur fight in the final scene didn't interest me and I couldn't get excited. Again, the happy ending event in the final scene was really boring to me. My rating for the movie is 6/10

title: Everything is marginally good about this film
text: Bringing back the original cast of Jurassic Park works very well in this film and is one of the rare good things about this movie. The action sequences are terrific and the pacing of this movie is perfect. Some things that didn't work out in this film were its obsession with clich raptor 'Blue'. Leave her alone already! And the plot itself which was stupid and pointless to begin with. Overall, it's a good film to watch it at least once or twice.

title: Cash grabbing tripe
text:
The makers of this movie were so preoccupied with whether they could make it that they didn't stop to think if they should.Bloated plot lines, even more bloated cast that they couldn't think what to do with, shameless pandering to the fans of the original by shoehorning in Grant, Sattler and Malcolm and retconning new, pointless characters......
The plot has zero continuity and the acting..... don't get me started on the acting. Not even Sam Neill could inject any life into this pile of pointless garbage.If you are not 8 years old or you are a fan of the original movies you should avoid this at all costs.

title: Hollywood keeps forgetting one thing...
text:
And that is a story.They either have no plot or they have multiple plots that aren't going anywhere.They either have no character developement or they have characters with multiple personalities.I was this film and all the time I was thinking: what kind of a story are they trying to pull off here?I just gave up midway and I was trying to enjoy this film but man, did they make an effort of spoiling that.A villain so awkward to look at that I was actually hoping Ramsay would be the plot twist villain. But nope...
Locusts on fire that looks like a few dozen that escape sufdenly seeming to be in more of a hundreds causing a wildfire. And despite being a huge sanctuary they just happen to land where the heroes are. How inconvenient.Chris Pratt kept looking throughout this entire film like he wanted this film to be over with real soon, like yesterday.And the stars of the film, the dinosaurs. On occasions they looked stunning. Other times I was thinking I was watching the real life Flintstones or an episode of Dinosaurs. I thought Earl Sinclair would make an appaerance. It would've been funny tough.But some dinosaurs looked terrible. In the end shot where the Dilophosaurus are at the Hyperloop and their fan was open, one of them looked like it was a broken umbrella. Not to mention some atrocities at the dinosaur market.Thank God for Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum and Sam Neill to save this movie with their acting. You can see they had a blast together and that is the only Deze In this is worth a 6. If it wasn't for them it was a weak 2.

title: How Embarrassing
text:
I ain't a critic like some ppl on here think they are but I have just watched this so-called film & it's well & truly crap .. predictable,hero saved at second ... bullsh. . the actors mainly were crap..the dinosaurs mostly were crap puppets
& the heroes always managed to escape by the skin of their teeth .. c'mone I mean someone say falls off the edge of a (ie cliff etc) for example &as the hero falls an arm grabs the hero & lifts him up to safety... Well for one thing if it were me saving said here then I just wouldn't be able to catch the hero nevermind yank him up with one hand/arm . . . This happens frequently in this so-called film .. I hate it & I wish I never wasted a few hours of my life watching it .. BTW I didn't even laugh (that's how bad it was) OK I'm back to watching the grass grow ... thanks everyone

title: Better then the last one.
text:
Jurassic park but world part 3...
Forgettable at best. But is is slightly better than the film that came out before this one. The film is good enough to waste time watching. They are just pumping out these movies at a rapid rate, aren't they? But I do believe this one was truly better than the one which did, in fact, come out before this very same movie. But yeah, I hardly remember what happened in this film. But I think it was fun to a point.Is this movie worth watching? Meh.How was the plot? Lame.Was the budget enough? Yes.What is this movie saying about our world? Nothing.What is your emotional response to this movie? Meh.

title: Generic World
text: I went to see the premiere of Jurassic Park as a kid, we received a binder with the logo and a poster. These were simpler times, that binder was a sacred object, at least it became one as I came out of the movie shaken to my core by what I just witnessed. The dino's were so captivating. Skip to a reboot where the vicious velociraptors are turned into trained monkeys making puppy sounds. Where there are more commercials wrapped in a movie than there are menacing or engaging dinos. The second instalment of the reboot was a bit better -though nearly not as good as the imo underrated sequel to the original- but my hopes of a somewhat decent end to the World-trilogy with the return of beloved characters/actors were smashed. Although lulled into boredom would be more accurate a description. A plot wherein giant insects are used to ensure world "dominion", I mean the whole thing has just become convoluted af. And the big budget making the movie pander to audiences all over the world, painfully shaving off any modicum of edge. The whole thing turned out more generic than melted cheese in a can imo. A waste of money, acting talent and what started out as a brilliant franchise. Not once was I thrilled, excited or engaged. Many a times was I annoyed, bored and disillusioned. I'm not mad, just.... disappointed.

title: A big budget summer Blockbuster at its finest
text: What an amazing end to the franchise. Exactly what you expect out of a big budget summer blockbuster. 100 percent popcorn popping entertainment. Not you're saying old Jurassic Park but at the same time paying homage to the original. Loved every minute of it.

title: Nice 3D Animation but otherwise unwatchable.
text: This film is a train wreck. Though it is loaded with a great cast of actors, all the performances seem like rehearsals. Even Chris Pratt seems to be sleepwalking through this. The script is a big mess. The direction is lifeless and aimless. Bryce Howard is dreadful. She always bugs me. Other than having beautiful red hair and being Ron Howard's daughter, it's amazing to me that she has a career. She really cannot play a convincing character. She has the same expression whether being chased by dinosaurs or in romantic scenes with Chris Pratt.Jeff Goldblum is in this for two short scenes, and he's the only convincing actor in this.There is a beautiful 3D animation at the end with two dinosaurs in a lake at sunset. I'm giving 3 stars for the animation.

title: It's not terrible, but it could've been better. Just a little disappointed
text: I think critics are being too hard on this move. I'm a huge Jurassic Park fan, so seeing some of the original cast return was exciting. It's just the the plot is nonexistent and a lot of scenes seemed forced and cringey. Don't get me wrong, it's not unbearable, but I felt they could've done a lot better. It was disappointing that they focused more on the people more than they did the actual dinosaurs. Though I will admit it was cool to see different species on screen, but they didn't get enough screen time unfortunately. While I liked this one better than Fallen Kingdom and was able to enjoy it with the action scenes and nostalgia, a lot of the writing really downgraded it.

title: But I thought cold blooded reptiles would die in the snow
text: So many holes in the script. Has Hollywood run out of ideas? Why do they keep making sequels to mediocre movies? They spent a fortune on this flick and this is the best they could do.... shame.

title: Awful, cheesy... don't bother
text: Don't think there are any good things to say about this pile of *****.I loved the first Jurassic park, even the next two were watchable, the 'World' films started quite decent, 2nd OK, if daft. But this is just an excuse to make money. There's no story, it's just like some execs have just said "Hmmm. We could probably quite easily make a few hundred million without any effort... just throw some dinosaurs on screen, crappy special effects and don't worry about story".The special effects at times are laughable. There's one in the opening sequence, where a dinosaur's is next to a train. Seriously looks like a Dr Who effect from 1985. Really, really bad.So my advise is watch Jurassic Park, even the first Jurassic world, don't bother with this.It's embarrassing.

title: Decent Dino Sequel but with a feeling of being unnecessary
text: Another sequel wasn't really needed and it slightly took a different direction of what we may have expected from the ending of JW2. It feels a bit like JW 2.5. It was almost same formula as always. A dinosaur park getting out of control. Though beside the usual formula, some ideas were interesting though. Especially the coexist part and dinos getting out of hand, which I would have loved to see more of and of a more bigger and threatening scale. The movie took a while to get interesting, as the beginning and it's character acting was weak. It was a bit all over the place too with it's scale and story and took a bit to actually intertwine. But when it finally set together, it was starting to get quite interesting with the usual good dino action. Seeing the old cast was nice and actually made the movie better than it would have been. A nice treat for the old fans. Some plot parts may have been a silly again and the combined generations may feel a little weird too at times. But it still was entertaining, as we got usual jokes and references every now and then. Effects were quite good and the subtle use of the main theme was nice too. I wish the threat on the world scale would have been better, as it was quite interesting to see how things go when dinos taking back the land and go into human territory. Maybe in a possible future movie, who knows. Hollywood tends to do many sequels of old movies after all. While the movie was not that much needed, it was still nice and worth a watch. Be it as a fan or maybe even as a newcomer.

title: Costly even if you watch it for free
text: I generally do not write reviews, but this movie was worst I have seen in recent times.Screenplay was like loose motion.Actors were like randomly called to do shots and go away, no link in what they want to achieve.Seems they just wanted to bring all the character and do birthday celebration.

title: Get Jurassic to the theatre
text: What is with the reviews? Movie was quite good! Dinos were awesome and terrifying! Loved seeing all the main characters come together. Story was insane, but at least better than Fallen Kingdom. Served it's purpose to tie together all of the excellent Dino scenes.Reviews are not fair at all. Movie isn't not a 10, but it's an easy 8 for the excellent Dino scenes!Get Jurassic to the theatre, it's the only way to see this one!

title: Highly Underrated...Pulverized by Critics & Fans...Unfounded Bandwagon Pile-On
text: To be Clear, Not Every Professional Movie-Critic In the World that Holds "Dominion" Over Knee-Jerk Followers, have Trashed this Latest in the Dino-Romp Franchise.There are a lot of Mediocre Dismissals, but the Majority Give "No Quarter" and Rip the Movie to Shreds Like a Hungry T-Rex.Amidst All the Carnage, a Movie-Fan has to Stop and Wonder just what Folks Want to Watch with Their Popcorn and Drink."Are you not entertained"?... Just what is so Bad About this, Granted Low-Brow Sci-Fi-Fantasy-Adventure?There are Thrills, Spills, and Kills. On Screen is a Plethora of "Monsters-On-The-Loose", even some Cute and Cuddly Creatures.A Positive Story that "GreenPeace" Would be Proud,Returning Beloved Characters from the Beginning of it All, and a Long Running Time to Wallow...in the "Dreamland" of Arthur Conan Doyle, Merrian C. Cooper/Willis O'Brien/Ray Harryhausen, and Michael Creighton.This isn't the Stuff of Doctoral Thesis or High-Art.This is an Escape that is Meant to Mesmerize One into a Beta State to Elude the Pain of the Politics and World Standoffs that Plague the People on a Daily Basis.It's "Pop-Art", for Creighton Sake,Take a Deep Breath and Hate Something that is Worth Hating and Give this Innocent and Entertaining Movie a Break from the Vitriol.Despite the Barrage of Bile Foisted on this Very Good Movie, it is Certainly...Worth a Watch.

title: The worst "blockbuster" movie I've ever seen.
text: I'm not going to spend too much time on this movie review because it doesn't deserve it. Over complicated, boring and a complete waste of time. Chris Pratt (who I do like) is awful along with Dallas Howard. Please let the Jurassic franchise fade into extinction.

title: It's Funny...
text: It's funny reading all the 14 year olds having tantrums here because they think it makes them cool and popular to hate everything. You aren't cool and you'll never be popular, and this movie will continue to make hundreds of millions of dollars regardless of your irrelevant rants. You need to get out of your room more and get some exercise and sunlight.

title: another just good enough film.
