text: This film had its moments but it dragged at points and it is not a long film.I suppose that I should have expected the film to be predictable but still I am a bit disappointed.There are a few good action scenes but not enough to make me feel able to very positive about the film.I know films have to make money but we have too many of these fairly brainless films,sequels,super heroes,fantasy.The trailer for Oppenheimer was shown before this film.I look forward to that.

title: How do you screw up dinosaurs??
text: How bad of a script writer/director do you have to be to screw up everyone's favorite creatures of all time - dinosaurs! It's so simple, just show us the dinosaurs, have the dinosaurs battle the humans, have the dinosaurs battle each other for a bit, have the humans overcome their differences and team up to save the day. Boom, blockbuster done.Instead this movie mostly separates the humans from the dinosaurs, gives us a bunch of disparate human-centric plot lines that never seem to meet up or gel with each other played by too many improperly introduced characters with bit parts. Throw in some no-depth characters like the bratty teen girl that doesn't listen to anyone and makes dumb decisions that get her kidnapped, villains that are evil just for the sake of being evil, and a 'rough and tumble' bush pilot that looks like she just spent 6 hours in the salon chair getting her hair and colored contact lenses just right.When we do see dinosaurs it's too often not the big and fearsome ones we want. Instead we get a lot of little baby robo-dinosaurs where I can practically see someone holding a remote off screen to move the head of a marble-eyed, unblinking dino-doll, and then to top it off we get...dino-locusts? Gee, how thrilling.I gave it a 3 for the sake of classy Sam Neil who was about the only person who didn't make me cringe, but versus what this should have been and pretty easily could have been, it's more like a minus three. What a shameful way to end a series that started with one of the greatest action movies of the 1990s.

title: Just Enough to be a Roaring Good Time
text: Viewed at the Cinema in 3D.When Owen & Claire's adopted daughter (the cloned girl from the last film) gets kidnapped by poachers (along with the pup of Blue, the raptor Owen shares a bond with), and Ellie & Alan Grant (from the original film) investigate a budding ecological disaster, both groups go on an adventure that'll lead them to the doorstep of BioSyn (a "totally not shady at all" genetics corporation claiming to be creating a nature reserve for the benefit of the world's now wild dino population).It's not really an adventure film ABOUT dinosaurs as much as it is an adventure film in a world that happens to have (lots of) dinosaurs, which may certainly sound a bit disappointing going in (and I get it), but if you set your expectations right this is still a fun movie. Sure, it seems to be bothered more with callbacks to the original film than it does in really pushing things forward (and doesn't make quite enough sense in some areas, like how a few dozen dinos let loose on the west coast, in the last film, are suddenly endemic the world over after only a few years), but if you're in a few more hours of hectic dino action (which I felt was elevated by the use of 3D) it's still a fun ride.

title: Think of all the best parts from all the movies snipped into this one. Still not good.
text: The best way to sum up the entire movie is basically, that they took all the Jurassic Park movies that have ever been made and snipped all the best parts from them and stuffed it into this one. Now this doesn't mean that taking the best parts is going to make a good movie. Unfortunately, it was sad to see the screen writers had no imagination.We have the original main actors from the first movie with the new actors to attract fans, we have the typical kid that needs to be watched out for, the same genius Dr. Henry Wu that has almost been in every movie, the one baby dinosaur that needs to be saved just like in Jurassic Park 2, a bad corporation wanting to profit (Jurassic Park 2), a plane crash just like in Jurassic Park 3, a scary dinosaur chasing them around, we have the iconic Chris Pratt riding the motorcycle again, the main villain being killed just like Dennis in the first movie, the T. Rex fighting another carnivore dinosaur at the end of the movie with the famous roar once again.There is nothing that was original in the movie.

title: Fun, But It Could Have Been So Much More
text: After hearing the reviews, I wasn't expecting much. I actually enjoyed watching this film.The Jurassic World films could have been so much more. Take Maisie for example, I think it would've been cool if part of her DNA make up had included something that truly terrified dinosaurs or made it so she had influence over some of them.Genetics, however, were never the dominant theme of these movies. It was the dinosaurs themselves. Too bad, they could have taken this franchise into very interesting territory.

title: A mess
text:
10 story arcs. 10 plot hole ladened story arcs. 10 story arcs with continual tropes. The film company said "what stories do we have for a 3rd film?" Every writer responded and the company said "Yes! Let's do them all!"
Bigger stories, with bigger monsters must mean more money to them.A popcorn flick is a simple story, with good action, engaging enough characters to bring you along for the ride one that knows it's not serious. This is not that movie. Flat, no humor, dull, no life, spiritless, soulless, are all words to describe this film.

title: Perfect Ending to a Perfect Franchise
text: I have read the books, played all the games, watched the shows, and just love the movies so much. With all of my knowledge on the lore and everything else, I just got say that the critis are all wrong!This franchise ended with a perfectly wrapped bow! This movie was the best way to end such a richly told story!

title: Energetic and fun for boring evening
text: Greetings from Lithuania."Jurassic World: Dominion" (2022) is not going to win any awards for screenplay, but actors might win for keeping their straight faces during its whole 2 h 15 min runtime. They all did admirable jobs, but its the Laura Dern which proved why she is the Oscar winner - in role of nothing she was in for every scene, silly as they were. Directing was solid for the material, because at its long running time i was entertained and it wasn't boring as previous movie was. And to be honest, i do watch "Jurassic" movies because not of their screenplay of plot - they are all silly escapism movies (including the first one). On that account "Dominion" did its job.

title: tiw jurassic world, domino
text: Today I watched Jurassic park world domination and it was violently terrible.There was a cool chase scene with Bryce Dallas Howard, there were like 2 jokes that made me do a small giggle, maybe 1 or 2 scenes that I thought weren't terrible, and also I guess some of the dinosaurs don't look egregious.Besides that, there's nothing, this movie sucks. This is an unnecessarily long and embarrassing cashgrab with bad set designs, mediocre cgi, bad sound design and editing, bad editing, terrible acting from otherwise good actors, forgettable soundtrack, clunky dialogue, unnecessary exposition, and more plot convenience than I have seen in quite some time.Everyone sucks at acting in this movie holy moly. Chris Pratt sucks, Bryce Dallas Howard is atrocious, the child acting was wooden, all of the original actors for some reason cannot perform to save their lives barring Jeff goldblum who is just playing Jeff goldblum. Laura Dern was particularly bad and that's very peculiar because I haven't seen a bad performance from her yet, but wooo boy did she not try. Campbell Scott was also absolutely awful, but I did find a scene with him kinda funny when it was meant to be funny (good job Trevorrow!)... Everyone feels like they came here for a paycheck and that's it, they all don't careThe sound design was horrendous and choppy, the music was overbearing and forgettable, it doesn't even feel like the same essence of a Jurassic park soundtrack. The sound effects feel so clunky and don't feel like they're in the same realm of the film. It's all just so bad.The writing is messy and disorganized with the structure being like it's own elaborate puzzle to figure out what the heck is going on. They throw in an extremely convenient plot armor on characters and there's not a single bit of tension, everything everybody wants is right there and it takes no real struggle for the characters to do anything.Honestly, I really blame a lot of this on the director. I've seen these actors do well before and Trevorrow has yet to show me a single film that I would even call alright.. This film is horrendous. He wrote it and directed it, there's no reason it should be this sloppy and boring.There is little life in this dead horse they keep trying to poke at, this movie sucks, there's very little to grab onto and I do not recommend in the slightest.Low 3/10.

title: Something Missing
text: We fell in love with the original Jurassic Park primarily for the dinosaurs and action, but also because of the intriguing story it told. Luckily, the sequels continued to maintain a story line that kept us intersted and in a weird way actually made sense... and of course, we still had our beloved dinosaur action. I think it may be time to hang up the Jurassic franchise, because this film missed the mark quite a bit. The dinosaur action is still there, but the story is not only missing but also nonsensical. I watched all the other films in this franchise more than once. In this case, once is enough.

title: It's a movie, with dinosaurs
text: Is it a good movie? No.Is it fun to watch? Not reallyDoes it provide nonstop action with fan service for everyone that watched the OG trilogy as kids and now have kids that love the Jurassic park films? Kind ofIt's a series of action Dino sequence edited together between a thin story that doesn't really matter to anyone that's watching but I asked my kid(9) if he liked it and he said it was awesome so I'll take his word for it and look forward to watching it a few hundred more times with him like we have all the other Jurassic Parks.Turn your brain off and let it assault your senses it's not that bad.

title: Every clich hollywood trope blended together and puked out
text:
I have seen this film about 15 times already... but not literally, I mean I've seen this exact film THROUGH watching other generic Hollywood puke.Movie was was too long for the generic Hollywood safe formula, and regurgitated generic dialogue.A hilarious example IMO without any real spoilers. Chris Pratt teamed up with someone later/midway through the film to get back together with his wife who was separated from him on the Dinosaur island or whatever. They give them a a tracker like it's a video game, "here you can use this to find her location". Chris Pratt basically just nods... other character then goes "you really love her huh?"
what?... I've only heard this line sixty times in various films, however, it didn't really make much sense in the context and scene that it was placed in. It's like they just opened the generic Hollywood play by play handbook, "ah yeah this is a good one, shove this line in there somewhere... you really love her huh?.. brilliant"
...Yeah he loves his wife so he's trying to save her... his love was already established for this woman. It's not a coming of age film where some kid has some undecided or secret feelings for someone that someone else has to notice and point out. It just was dumb generic lazy cliche writing that didn't make any sense.Some of the action scenes were ok but obviously due to the rating of the movie could have been much more intense and satisfying if it were given a mature ratings.If we are going to revamp the series, can we just go a different direction. Can we take a risk? Go full on borderline horror movie, make it rated R. I want to see some gore, All the intense scenes with the dinosaurs could actually have some impact and some bite (pun intended), giving that character's fear some real contextual depth through brutal consequence of getting caught by a predator much more formidable than ourselves. It could almost be reminisce of a movie like Alien or something.Also I didn't have much of an opinion of Chris Prat before this movie, thought he was funny in parks and rec and I realize he lost weight and gained muscle and started taking on more serious roles. I will say for this film, He looked VERY satisfied with himself through his facial expressions in most scenes, It looked unnatural to me the way he was acting was like "yea that was awesome, I looked really concerned there". "oh yea I'm having a heart to heart moment here with my wife or daughter"
I don't know.. I just didn't buy his acting at all. It wasn't terrible, but it was immersion breaking to me, essentially the third wall was knocked down and I saw him as an actor acting in his scenes as opposed to a character responding to things in the film.I Enjoyed the chase scene for what it was, the black market scene was ok, the Ice scene was ok, and some of the raptor and giant dinosaur scenes were decent although I still think they would have been a lot more exciting with a more mature rating.

title: Good entertainment but weak story line
text: My 8 years old son loved the entire movie. He likes the raptors and the dynasours fights.As for me who watched all the previous ones it felt it is just purely commercial addition. They brought the old cast back with no clear role (compared to Spider-Man no way home where it was funny and has a purpose.).Overall still entertaining for new generation.

title: What a hot mess!
text: Huge disappointment! If I could sum this movie up in one word it would be FORCED! Everything was forced, acting, chemistry, dialogues, everything. Truly was a waste of time. Just another movie in a long line of trash coming out of Hollywood as of late.

title: Real Jurassic Park fans will love and appreciate this movie.
text: As a fan of the previous 5 Jurassic movies. You will like this movie. Great action. Great dino effects. Slow start as to having to bring everything together. But I ce you get through that very enjoyable. I gave 8 stars due to the slow start.

title: Perfectly enjoyable, but not groundbreaking
text: The story is simple: a girl is kidnapped, and her parents go to rescue her (no spoilers, it's literally at the beginning of the movie). The rest? It's the Jurassic Park/World roller coaster. Don't expect more. Sure, the plot is recycled. The entire series is recycled. That doesn't mean it's bad. If you enjoy the fun of these actors and the CGI Dino fun, you won't be disappointed in this film.

title: Dear 100 Monkeys That Wrote This Movie,
text: Gave it your best shot didn't you? And that's what really matters in the end. I'm sorry for rating your movie a 3 because, after all, I know you're only 100 monkeys, so what did I expect? The thing is, even for 100 monkeys, I feel the ineptitude on display here is really alarming and I wonder if maybe fewer monkeys, maybe a dozen or so, could have come up with something more cohesive. I'm not even really sure where to start, if I'm honest with you monkeys. For one thing, just the entire framework is insane. In a film that is predicated on the idea that there are dinosaurs all over the place, it seems fairly obvious to me that the film should follow that rather than focus primarily on an entirely tangential evil corporation and their plot to control the food chain that has very little to do with dinosaurs. Indeed, it is as if only a handful of you 100 monkeys were even informed that you were supposed to be writing a Jurassic World movie, so few the dinosaurs are, though perhaps this is a concern best taken up with the 1000 monkeys at Universal. The dinosaurs do appear in infrequent doses, though oddly most of the dinosaurs are still captive dinosaurs that manage to escape captivity rather than the supposedly plentiful free-roaming dinosaurs. Doesn't make much sense now does it monkeys? No matter. The dialogue is awful in equal measure; I would suggest sticking to "Ooh ooh aah ahh," from now on. Now, to change my tune a bit here monkeys, one area I think you might have been able to actually to contribute to would have been in the acting department. You couldn't have done worse than the humans did and you certainly would have been more lively. You probably also would have been better in the director's chair than Colin Trevorrow, though I suppose I don't where you would find 100 director's chairs. All in all monkeys, not your best work. But don't let this one failure stop you from writing more terrible movies. You've got the entire MCU to keep afloat as well, after all. Best of luck.

title: Absolutely Awful
text: Second movie in my life I've ever left early this was a mess and I'm no way enjoyable. I am disappointed this was the last Jurassic Film of the series.

title: Time for this to go extinct
text: Like it was millions of years ago, the time of the dinosaurs is coming to a close. With JURASSIC WORLD DOMINION, we end the Jurassic World trilogy (after having the Jurassic Park trilogy) and it is high time we do so.A retro-film (as I've been calling these nostalgia-flicks that bring back old actors/characters from previously beloved properties), JURARSSIC WORLD DOMINION is entertaining enough - but the creative brains behind this franchise is just running out of clever ways to put the same group of characters in danger of being eaten by a dinosaur.Written by Emily Carmichael based on a story by Derek Connolly and Colin Trevorrow and Directed by Trevorrow (returning to helm this franchise after Directing the first Jurassic World flick, but not the 2nd), JURASSIC WORLD DOMINION follows our favorite bickering couple, Clare (Bryce Dallas Howard) and Owen (Chris Pratt) and their pseudo-pet Velociraptor, Blue as they, once again, go into the Jurassic World fighting a money-grubbing Corporate Billionaire who wants the genetic technology for his own, greedy purposes and not what might be for the good of all - the Earth, the Humans and the Dinosaurs. Along the way good ol' Alan Grant (Sam Neill), Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) and Dr. Ian Malcolm (the always quirky Jeff Goldblum) are, somehow, shoe-horned into this story.And that, ultimately, is the issue with Dominion, the script feels like an amalgam of characters that needed to be serviced and set-pieces that needed to be shown, but the overall story-line and character development (not that there is much here) is shoved to the side, so at the end the emotional connection to this film - and it's characters - is negligible.What little character interest there is here is based solely on the charisma of the actors and they are...good enough. Pratt, of course, is able to carry the center of this flick as Owen Grady - but he doesn't seem to be occupying the center square with the twinkle in his eye that he had in the first Jurassic World film. Bryce Dallas Howard is plucky enough as Clare, but this actress has been gaining traction lately as a "go-to" Director (like her father, Ron Howard) and that is probably a better career trajectory for her. Sam Neill and Laura Dern are "game enough" in what they are asked to do, but they both look just a bit tired of running around in front of green screen dinosaurs. Only Jeff Goldblum shines as Ian Malcolm and that's because Trevorrow, wisely, decides to let Goldblum be Goldblum - odd and quirky.Of the other actors in this film, DeWanda Wise (FATHERHOOD) really shines as a pilot who helps out the gang. On the other hand, Dichen Lachman (SEVERENCE) is completely wasted as a "top-notch" henchman that is pretty inept. However, it was good to see Omar Sy (who was in the first JURASSIC WORLD movie and then became a star thanks to his work on the French TV show LUPINE - which is terrific, by the way) back in the fold as it was good to see Campbell Scott back up on the big screen as the villain of the piece - a role that he brings an interesting twist to but, ultimately, the role leads to nowhere.And that's the issue with this film, the characterizations lead to nowhere, for Trevorrow focuses most of his attention on the battle scenes and the scares - and while not all of them are exciting and unusual, I did find myself jumping in my seat on more than one occasion and there is one scene with Bryce Dallas Howard escaping a dino in a swamp that was pretty intense.Go see JURASSIC WORLD DOMINION if you've seen the other 5 - you've already invested this much time, you might as well complete the series. But, this film really brings nothing new and is, ultimately, less than what one hopes for in this type of film.Letter Grade: B-6 stars (out of 10) and you can take that to the Bank(ofMarquis)

title: Thrilling dinosaurs' action and nothing more
text: The Jurassic World culminates its story with a rather dull note. Especially considering the promise of great momentum that they had worked so hard to build earlier. Basically, it's just a rehash of the franchise's tired formula instead of branching it into something more different and exuberantly daring.The presence of the legacy characters deserved the joyful welcome despite the fact that they didn't really make the necessary splash to excite the story. They graced the screen only for the nostalgia and some fan service.Therefore, Jurassic World Dominion's sole reason to exist apparently is for the audiences to enjoy the thrilling dinosaurs' action.

title: An honest to the heart opinion.
text: This is a soulless cash grab. Old characters coming back for a paycheck and nostalgia sake, very little story with no substance and all effects. I wish i could get back my time and money honestly.

title: Weak story, decent dino chases.
text: Story - Pretty generic.Characters - Shallow but adequate. Was nice to see the original trio, they were at least mildly charismatic (if not also shallow).Dinos - Top tier CGI as usual. Good chases, however nothing particularly new and unique.My Opinion - 6 points for CGI, dinos, original trio. No points for story and little/no depth to the new trio. A good movie to put on when you don't want to pay too close attention, and just look over when things start getting loud.

title: Guns, Love, Teen, DNA Modify, Cliche?? I THOUGHT THIS WAS A DINOSAUR MOVIE
text: Ever since the 4th movie, JP lost it's course and went wild.No sense of what the first movie was anymore.Squeezing in politics and modern day appeal has made this movie into another quick flick to let your time go by.You can't relate to any characters anymore.There is no surprise or excitement when you see dino anymore.Cliche of love story, daddy issue, teen rebelling, I mean isn't this suppose to be about DINOSAUR, not LOVE, TEEN, DNA , GENE modifying?This is a Sci-Fi movie with 10% mix of dinosaur.Huge let down, and a good reminder that Hollywood needs to stop with these stupid sequel.Shame on you all.

title: Ignore negative reviews, don't miss this
text: My family and I have been Jurassic fans a long time and have enjoyed each film in the franchise in different ways, just having a good time with the continuing narrative. It's fun, it's thrilling, it's scary as a franchise, sometimes it's even heartbreaking. We saw this today and were thrilled to have one more good, long adventure as the series comes to a close. Sure, people are going to pick apart every little thing or be sour, but it was a truly fun summer movie and great farewell to the world of Jurassic films. It was worth the 2 and a half hours, my kids loved it, and I thought it was a terrific experience. Plus, we get to see all our beloved main characters all together. Definitely go see it.

title: Its better than I thought
text: If you dont think about it too much and ignore all of the plot holes, its a great movie to go to the cinema to watch. From watching the other 2 Jurassic World films, its just what you expect and also quite funny in places, especially Jeff Goldblum who was brilliant.

title: Sy-fy channel could have done better.
text: I don't know where to start. The graphics were good, the sets exciting, the dinosaurs plentiful. But the good ends there. The actual movie; the dialogue was laughable, it was like they used the first draft and didn't revise or put thought into anything spoken in this movie, the plot was cheap and overly convenient, the sequence of events didn't make any sense.For example, two people are hanging onto a platform while a dinosaur tears and tosses it around and the characters are sliding down and losing grip and just before the dinosaur tears it off along with the characters thankfully there's a cut right then and next you see the characters jumping to the safety of the room conveniently.Another scene when one character lands in a parachute in the jungle and another set of characters land on a lake across the jungle. Literally miles and miles away. And it the next scene the set of characters just happens to walk upon the sight of where the parachute landed. You're telling me that they, not having the slightest idea where this person could have landed, just happened to traverse miles upon miles through a dense and dinosaur filled forest and come across the exact location of their lost friend. How pathetically convenient. This is one of dozens of examples of how ridiculous this entire film was. I'm offended that the production team thinks I am as stupid as that.Other than that I am at a loss for words. What a horrible way to ruin this trilogy. Hopefully the next reboot will be better, but let's let this movie air out for a few years before we try to get back into this universe.

title: Superhit Blockbuster Movie
text: The story and screenplay of the movie is very good. There are no boring scenes. The movie contains only entertaining scenes. In one word, the scenes of a dinosaur in the movie are extraordinary. Everyone's performance in the movie is very good. Family movie. There is no bad scene in the movie. Super hit movie. Everyone should watch this movie. Movie's location, vfx are amazing. Hope the producer and director will make the next movie in this series.

title: I am hoping for dinosaurs eating up the whole team
text: This is a bloated, stupid and unconvincing mess of a movie and it didn't even provides proper animation of the dinosaurs, not mentioning their absurd behavior patterns.Summary: Acting bad, Logic bad, Physics bad, Biology bad, Story bad, CG bad.Bad in an offending way.You want a more realistic Dino-Experience? You will be better off with a Lego Tyrannosaurus Rex for sure.

title: Disappointed
text: I love all the jurassic films with a negative here and there on them but this one i just have more negative views than positive ones, it was nice to see the original cast back, good couple of scary scenes but other than that i didn't enjoy this film.

title: A faster paced and new take on the Jurassic Park/World series.
text: Much better than the previous Jurassic World film. And if you are a fan of an action packed Jurassic World movie than this film is for you. With many easter eggs and hints towards the original Jurassic Park film, this movie ties everything together perfectly.The Acting preformed in this movie was more traditional to the original Jurassic Park films. With a lower focus on witty humor and a higher focus on the task at hand with the occasional hint of humor, each characters personality fits them.Having two different story lines going at once also helps add more action. Especially because at the ending half of the film these two story lines get tied together, which then forces everyone to work together.

title: Second Chances
text: I recall my first watch thinking that it was frankly a massive waste of time. BUT. The second time around, i loved it!This time around I did watch all the others again in a marathon, so I definitely think that Dominion relies on the nostalgia factor and the trust that fans will remember small details from the franchise. It's very worthwhile once you're familiar with the rest. While I agree that it's not 100% perfection, I do think it's very wrong to go into it with sky high expectations - the sixth installment to any franchise is never going to be as groundbreaking as the first. I do think part of its bad reception is that it's formula doesn't give the same 'feel' as it's predecessors. Personally I think it's necessary for the growth of the story that it doesn't remain totally the same.I'm definitely disappointed to see so many negative reviews because fan perception affects chances of sequels. (And I love this franchise far too much to part with it just yet!!)Overall, I don't blame my past self for being so appalled by this movie the first watch. If you feel the same way, don't be afraid to give it the second chance it deserves! Maybe this time have a little marathon, enjoy the films as they're meant to be loved. It makes the world of a difference. Happy watching <3.

title: Predictable
text: If you're a fan of the JP series than this will seem very familiar to you. The story line is predictable and you pretty much know the ending by 30 minutes in, a company with a misguided leader, the Trex scenes, the raptors, etc interwoven with genetic tones, all leads to entertaining film. If you are looking for groundbreaking, serious, realistic action film, this isn't it. Find something else. And a tribute to the original films along with newer ones are woven in. Some of the original cast from the early series are back. The scenery is beautiful with cgi woven in to make for some entertaining what ifs.

title: Disappointed
text: Not only I feel disappointed, I find it cringe and not-well-written story. They clearly used the old characters to bait viewers to watch this movie. Same old usual plot they always like to use. A company that is led by "brilliant" scientists who always love to fail.

title: Above average as I was mind numbed
text: Did Apple fund this movie? The antagonist Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott) either drew his character profile from Tim Cook (of Apple Inc) or the director wanted him to be like Tim. It was off putting and kept my rating at just above average. Some movies you can watch a few times, sadly, this isn't one of them. The actors did a reasonable job with what they had to work with. The writers probably had enough material for at least two movies, told they can do one, and here's the result. I would recommend it though.

title: Well What Did You Expect?
text: I am amazed at all the bad reviews. Complaints about the dinosaurs not looking "real" enough? Um, this is a fantasy series. It was fun to gather characters from throughout the series. It was fun to see the repercussions of the dinosaurs roaming the entire planet in modern times. The first segments had an Indiana Jones feel to it, which was fun too. Complaints about the graphic novel style acting? What would you expect? It was a fun movie to watch even with elements of surprise years long gone. Just who is watching such a movie with standards in mind for non-fantasy films? Please get over yourselves.

title: Would rate lower than 1 star if I could, one of the WORST films I've seen recently
text: I almost fell asleep watching this at home and my mind drifted off many times. The first and second Jurassic World films ranged from the first one being barely tolerable to the second one being plain bad and now with this last film... Two words to describe this closure sequel film in the Jurassic World trilogy: hot garbage! Dominion's film aspects are horrendous and forgettable: plot, script (I was rolling my eyes that they still were trying to train dinosaurs LOL), acting, cinematography, sound design, visual effects; a mix of practical effects and CGI would achieve realism in the dinosaurs presented on screen just like the Jurassic Park trilogy achieved well, which this film and the entire Jurassic World trilogy poorly failed time and time and time again to accomplish. Good riddance to a cash grab trilogy trying to capitalize on nostalgia from the original Jurassic Park (which is overall a better trilogy) while disrespecting it and demeaning the quality of dinosaurs, predictable storyline, and creating one-dimensional characters I don't care about.The three OG characters played by Laura Dern, Sam Neill, and Jeff Goldblum looked so tired and bored in their roles. They probably signed on for this film looking to make a quick paycheck and to contribute to fan service (totally understandable), but by inserting these OG characters and callback scenarios to the original, it's not going to improve anything about this awful film that also is too PC (all bad guys are again white) and is stuffed with Mary Sue characters (Kayla and Maisie) resulting in an insufferable, shoddy ending to an already terrible, dumpster fire trilogy.Not recommended even if you're a die-hard fan or semi-fan of the Jurassic Park trilogy, unless you want to waste 2 hours and 27 minutes of your time like I did. I regret watching this and will vehemently never watch Dominion ever again.

title: Cure for insomnia; SO boring it's still ad free on Prime after a yr.
text: Any movie that bombs is ad FREE on so Prime which refuses to stream ad free generations old films, i.e., first Jurassic Park trilogy, first Star Wars trilogy, Matrix trilogy, bw 12 Angry Men, Sound of Music, Pixar shorts Piper, Rebecca bw, any good Marvel comic film, Markeet Manor, any BBC earth nature series.This disastrous Dominion film still streams ad free continually about 6 months after its theatrical release, not just for holidays. Nothing rings true in zero plot film that drags for over 2 hrs & 40 minutes, Dr Alan Grant, world's leading dinosaur expert is no longer an expert. Instead, the Dino expert is young black female pilot who works for criminals in well-known "underground" dinosaur black market. She nows dino scientific names, behaviors & how to fight them off more than anyone else, & despite being a mercenary, she suddenly does everything for free for complete desperate strangers.MSome scenes are utterly comedic, i.e. Chris Pratt herding huge dinosaurs on horseback and wrangling them with 1 horse & regular rope, like a cow, instead of being rammed or crushed to death. Dr. Henry Wu who throughout the first 5 films consistently states his meticulous DNA innovations is the "foundation of all things jurassic," is now a hapless regretful hippie, and supposedly did nothing, all dino research is credited to the long deceased, Lockwood daughter, who cloned herself while curing an incurable disease in her clone, yet failed to cure herself despite having identical genes.Fallen Kingdom is ridiculous because the clone daughter released all vicious flesh eating dinosaurs into the world after personally escaping death multiple times. She frees all dinos into SF, right after escaping being eaten alive, yet displays no remorse for the certain countless gruesome deaths she inflicts onto N California area, in both ppl & non ppl. Yrs later she stands by her decision as globally all ppl & animals become Dino food.This last Dominion film is much worse than Fallen Kingdom if one can stay awake after 20 minutes. Complete waste of time & humiliating end to what started as one of the greatest film franchises, 1st trilogy still entertains today, esp the 1st film.

title: Painfully mediocre
text: Slaps together some characters without depth and this is what you got, the only pull they got is the old characters returning. Otherwise this fell flat. Meh action, meh storyline, meh plot. At this point the dinosaurs no longer surprising nor terrorizing, they're just there as obstacles to overcome.

title: I liked it..!
text: Obviously nothing is ever going to be as good as the original Jurassic Park , and every film since hasn't been... but they've all been good!! This one is also good! It kept me glued to the screen! Maybe a bit of nostalgia is making me a bit biased but it kept me entertained... isn't that what a films meant to do?

title: Why the hate??
text: I don't see why this movie is getting so much hate. I grew up obsessed with Jurassic Park and this movie really hit home. I enjoyed this addition. With the exception of the giant crickets. I hate crickets.

title: Complete disappointment, utter failure
text: Brilliant actors, but horrible script, directing, screenplay, and storyline. There are some scenes where you can even see on the actors face that they know the film is terrible. The action scenes were horrendous, there's one scene where Chris Pratt is stabbing the largest dinosaur ever discovered with a pocket knife. I wanted to walk out after one hour, what a waste of time and money. I'm a huge Jurassic Park fan, this felt like a complete monstrosity of a film, what a horrible way to end the series.

title: Ridiculous Trash
text: FAILS on so many levels!Science!The COLDER climate conditions, today, would not support FEEDINGall these dinos.In their day the poles were forests and swamps.After THAT I need say nothing.

title: Colin Trevorrow? Really?
text: Dont waste your money...wait for the free stream.Absolutely lifeless! I cant believe Colin Trevorrow directed this.Nearly 30 years has passed and Steven Spielbergs Jurassic Park is still putting Trevorrows 2022 sfx/vfx to shame. As for the story/script, it was just not thought out with subpar acting from nearly the whole cast. Production felt worse than the previous Jurassics.I guess thats one way to burn a franchise to the ground.

title: There's good and bad
text: Jurassic Park may have a very messy plot, lots of plot holes, and no emotion, but the movie still manages to excite you as long as you don't have massive expectations.

title: The best thing about this movie
text: Is that by comparison it reminds you how amazingly good the first movie really was.It really is stunning how far cinema has fallen in the last 20-30 years.

title: "Dominion" brings the old franchise formula and expanding into directions, however its structure has become so repetitive and worn out that perhaps a break would be good
text: The central story of "Jurassic World: Dominion" is not about dinosaurs being on the loose, it is not about focusing a large part of its scenes on the coexistence of humans with these creatures. The film is about showing how humanity has not learned its lesson, and that large corporations are more about profit than the well-being of life on Earth. None of this prevents us from seeing many dinosaur scenes on the movie screen, bringing not only "new" creatures, but also some that stood out in previous films. The fights between animals, the pursuit of humans, the attacks, among other details, are all there. The production features much more exciting action and adventure scenes than in the first two films, leaving the park setting aside and bringing it to more urban areas. The protagonists, Claire and Owen, prove to be great heroes motivated by feelings of affection for dinosaurs, and as Maisie's parents.Anyone who expected Jurassic World: Dominion to be something like "The Planet of the Apes", with the creatures basically dominating the planet and justifying why they didn't coexist with humans, may be disappointed. Although there are some scenes in cities and reports of stories involving the "new world", in the end it actually returns to its origins, with events in an isolated space, with Ellie once again having to restart the company's facilities system, and the infamous clash between dinosaurs. These are left aside by the rescue plot and giant insects, but at least they didn't decide to present dinosaurs that didn't exist, like Domino Rex, although they did give space to unseen specimens like the giganotosaurus (said in the film to be the largest carnivore existing, although there are studies that talk about the spinosaurus), the pyroraptor (which roams Malta after Owen and Claire), the clawed therizinosaurus (despite being herbivorous, it brings a tense scene on the ice), the flying quetzalcoatlus (replacing the pterosaurs) and the friendly dimetrodon. Some of these presented with feathers, in reference to the theory that animals of the time were covered in this way.This difference in approach brings a new breath to the production, which looks at the creatures beyond the threat. Of course, there are still chases and moments of tension, but they are packed with a passionate vision that expands the connection with the Jurassic creatures. Unfortunately, this is not enough to prevent Dominion from falling into the traps of the previous two films. To fit so many elements into the same story, the script is filled with facilitations to the point of deliberately avoiding answering questions that arise throughout the plot. In itself, shortcuts are not a problem, as the franchise itself has already shown this by resolving the climax of the first with a Deus Ex Machina in the form of a T-Rex. The point is that the lack of whimsy is evident when everything is based solely on chance and luck to move the plot forward as quickly as possible. The lack of interest in development affects different parts of the project, from the absolutely ridiculous villains that border on caricatural, to the motivation of central figures. This undermines the viewer's involvement and takes away the flavor of the victories of heroes who have already managed to get through much more challenging things in the past.The film hits the nail on the head in bringing back the "legacy cast", the stars of the original film. Laura Dern, Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum are back as Ellie Sattler, Dr. Alan Grant and Ian Malcolm... and amazingly, they don't just have cameos and are the main protagonists of the plot, alongside Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard. Fans will go crazy seeing the old protagonists meeting the new generation, in an organic way that fits brilliantly into the film's plot. Dern and Neill have the most important narrative arc in the film, exploring the company behind the film's greatest threat and also resolving their relationship that began back in 1993, when they separated because she wanted to have children and he didn't. But with the exception of the "Jurassic Park" trio, who get all the attention to shine in delivering exactly what fans expect, everything else is watched with an almost listless distance. There are several moments in which Colin Trevorrow's uninspired direction wastes genuinely exciting moments to try to force them further with cheesy dialogue. The action is also marred by questionable decisions. The filmmaker bets on closed shots and a shaky handheld camera to cause claustrophobia, but ends up losing his hand because he doesn't know how to measure it. As a result, the tension ends up being reduced into a bewildering cacophony. The biggest proof that this approach doesn't work is in the way the film grows when it is put aside. Some of the most exciting or distressing moments in "Dominion" arise precisely when the plans open up and seek more creative ways to bring urgency and dynamism without becoming unnecessarily confusing.It is clear that throughout the films, especially the new "Jurassic World" saga, the absurdity of the situations only escalated more and more. Even leaving the suspension of disbelief turned on to the maximum, it is difficult to conceive and accept some situations played on the screen just as a script device to move the story from point A to point B or even to invalidate the laws of physics and logic. Here we have, more than ever, dinosaurs that when filmed in a static scene demonstrate weight and physical grandeur in their movement, but when involved in an action scene, they move at an astonishing speed, demonstrating above-normal agility, even the most large and heavy. But that's not even the worst thing, considering that animals would need to be involved in several of the production's action scenes. As an audience, we have to witness other feats that are difficult to swallow, such as characters surviving without a single scratch from a plane crash (which miraculously does not explode), as well as the endless rollover of a car from a cliff without, again, any scratch being noticed. On other characters. Not to mention the countless script facilitations and narrative conveniences to unite the two generations of "Jurassic Park" and "Jurassic World" in the final stretch, in order to create some jokes ("I'm not a fan of Jurassic World" - says an important character at one point). At least, in this final stretch, we have some of the best scenes of the production, when the tone of the narrative returns to flirting with the horror introduced in the previous film in the franchise.To top it all off, we have to have fulfilled the production diversity quota, as most Hollywood films have been imposing in recent years. The character Ramsey Cole, by Mamoudou Athie, is the intelligent and good-hearted black man who discovers the evil plan of the capitalist company led by a white, middle-aged Caucasian CEO, obviously created to be the great villain of the story. There is also the character Kayla Watts, played by DeWanda Wise, who enters the story without any reason strong enough to justify her presence there (just the desire to help the parents in search of their daughter?), but who serves the progressive purposes of the narrative as the black, gay woman - who is also very attracted to redheads, by the way -, empowered and good at fighting, capable of flying a plane like few others - even saving herself and another important passenger from certain death thanks to her dexterity and skill - , facing dinosaurs with his gun looking tough, serving as indispensable support to participate in the chases and joining our protagonists to save the day once again.But perhaps what irritates the most is the "training hand" of Chris Pratt's character. If in the first film in the franchise the use of his hand in training dinosaurs was justified, especially Blue, who we saw had a closer relationship with his trainer, now this resource is used indiscriminately. Before any dinosaur that appears in front of Owen, he raises his hands in a lazy narrative solution to the script, causing the animal to promptly cease the threat and leave Owen and his friends free to move on to the next stage of their adventure. And to make matters worse, in the final third of the film, we see other characters making the same gesture and, you guessed it, it works."Dominion" will divide the public precisely because it takes a risk and brings something different, using the old franchise formula and expanding into directions never explored before, which will bring opportunities for the franchise to reach new heights - after all, since the canceled "Jurassic Park 4 "The producers have the idea of using dinosaurs as a military weapon, and after this film this possibility has never been more possible. Between new and old acquaintances (the Tyrannosaurus Rex always finds a way to appear), scenes of action, escape and redemption - especially that of Henry Wu -, "Jurassic World: Dominion" entertains in its long length. Still, the highest points of "Domain" do not compensate for the fragile structure that surrounds them. Even nostalgia works as a double-edged sword by pleasing fans with nostalgia while revealing that the "Jurassic World" trilogy would hardly reach a satisfying end without resorting to the past. There is a certain dose of irony in this negative observation, since the original Jurassic Park became so great precisely by exploring the past with such creativity. It's a shame that almost 30 years later, its structure has become so repetitive and worn out that perhaps a new period of preservation would do some good. With luck, the next explorer to touch this treasure preserved in amber will be more successful and bring new ideas to this universe.

title: I don't understand all the hate this is getting one bit
text: After reading some of the god awful reviews of this film, I had very low expectations.Jurassic Park like a lot of people is one of my favourite films ever.When jurassic word came out, I liked it but it also lacked something for me.Then fallen Kingdom came out, and for me it was a mess very much like the lost world. Didn't live up to its original.For me this is the second best Jurassic movie after jurassic Park. So nostalgic, and wrapped up a lot of things. The social commentary was amazing and so apt.Please go see this, it was non stop from start to end. Very tense, and quite a few jumps.I don't understand how some reviews are saying it was boring.

title: It's literally unwatchable..
text: I'm not joking, I almost turned it off after the first 3 minutes. It's just that cringy. The CGI isn't even that great.The dialogue, story, everything was just an abomination and disrespectful to the original Jurassic Park.I read all the bad reviews, and thinking how bad can it be. Well, it was worse than I expected.They want us to believe that dinosaurs are just living everywhere, nesting on top of the Empire State Building? What? The whole training of them was already a ridiculous idea in previous Jurassic films, but this was just worse.There are so many annoying plot holes and things that make no sense I could spend hours writing it. But one, why the hell is Grant STILL digging for dinosaur bones when they are everywhere alive. This was simply just added to bring in the original nostalgia so we can see the two original characters where they started, but it made n sense whatsoever.And how many times do we have to see a precocious teen that rebel against their own interest and well-being, and due to the rebellion gets in trouble or captured/kidnapped and has to be rescued? This is like the 500th movie with that exactly premise.It didn't help that they cramped in 24 storylines with 60 characters.BIG TIME SKIP!!

title: Won't be dominating ratings....
text: My expectations for this film were medium to low based on how the last film went. While I was hoping for something big, bold, exciting, and new. I got nothing but a story that felt rehashed with characters that didn't really need a comeback (granted it was nice to see them) with a villain that was just as annoying as the last one.On the surface this film looks spectacular, but that's all it is. Looks. The dinosaurs are stunning, as they meander along their surroundings which have rich detail. The dino battles are spectacular, as well.But for all that this film has no oomph. The characters are bland, new and old, as they go through the motions. Unlike the previous two I didn't feel very emotional by the end. I didn't feel the need to shred a tear as there was no true bond amongst characters. Like I said above. The story just wasn't intriguing enough. Instead of focusing on a few topics. I felt there were multiple focuses they tried to attack that didn't mesh well and they didn't fit in too well into the incredibly long runtime.I don't know where they plan to go next if they even plan to go anywhere, but the ending was so disappointing, it felt like a betrayal to all main characters, new and old, if this was truly the end.Overall, there was much to be desired. While IMAX was cool to see this film in. It felt like a waste. If you're considering seeing this film. Wait for a cheap night if you're theatre offers one.Thank you for reading my review. I hope it helps you make a decision on the film. If it does help. Please consider leaving a like, and giving me a follow if you don't already.Until next time.... Enjoy the show!

title: The Three Stooges meet Jurassic Park
text: I couldn't help but think of The Three Stooges during those Chase scenes of which was the majority of the movie. Imagining Curly going whoop whoop whoop being chased by a variety of dinosaurs. LOLThat's not a knock at all. I loved it! I found it very enjoyable seeing the old cast with the new. Very nostalgic. Characters intermingled well together.The story made sense. It was meant to be over the top. I only waited so long because I read negative reviews early on. That's my own fault. I have to learn not to be swayed by reviews, good or bad, before seeing a movie or deciding to see a movie.

title: Nice Try But Too Long, Repetitive, and Too Crowded with Conceptual Ideas
text: While it was nice to see the three adults albeit older from the original Jurassic Park (1993), this additional sequel had a nice potential and did offer up some engrossing action sequences and a rather convoluted two storylines that somehow manage to entwine themselves in a remarkable bit of scriptwriting. Yet the movie was too long by at least ten minutes becoming too repetitive by the end. There were also a few unbelievable action scenes, especially with the Clare Dearing character that needed drastically edited or written differently. Overall, this was a good effort with maybe too much going on and needed more thoughtful, substantive heft brought to the movie storyline.

title: long
text:
Very long and boring movie, weak story with fewer scenes of dinosaurs (which the movie about)
i left the cinema after 1:30 hour. Very Bad movie compared to the previous parts.

title: It's not saying much, but this is the best of the Jurassic World movies
text: I think it's safe to say that out of these three Jurassic World movies, Dominion is the best one. It is the movie they should have made a long time ago.But they didn't. So much of Dominion is built off of the stupid, awful foundation of those first two Jurassic World movies. They squeeze as much blood out of this rock that they can get, despite Jurassic World and Fallen Kingdom amounting to two hour toy commercials intercut with scenes worshiping a nearly 30 year old movie.Dominion finally breaks the cycle of trying to recapture the magic of the first Jurassic Park and gives us an original story. Not all of the details make sense or follow logic, because again, we're dealing with Jurassic World. Ten dinosaurs escape from a black market deal in the second movie, and somehow that means dozens of species of fully grown adult dinosaurs now exist on every continent on earth in only a few short years time.How useful a black market for dinosaurs might be is never really addressed or answered. There's vague handwaving that they're easily trained or something, but there's not a lot of clear answers as to why dinosaurs are better than say, wolves, or bears, or any existing terrestrial animals. It's just a leftover idea from Jurassic World 2 and we gotta incorporate it somehow, I guess.This movie can be dumb like that. It's also unexpectedly different in tone than any of the other movies to come before it. There's this weird science fantasy vibe to it at times, like a strange blend of Star Wars meets Mission Impossible. It's a far cry from what Jurassic Park was trying to be, but the action is scenes are good, the dialog can be fun, and it's actually weirdly enjoyable to see the original Jurassic Park actors rub up against the Jurassic World cast and kind of poke at each other.Plot-wise, it also ditches the Jurassic Park structure of "best intentions pave the road to hell." This movie is blatantly up front about what's going on and who the real villains are. Again, there's no theme park, it's more about the bigger consequences and fallout of what happened in the previous movies. Some of that is definitely unearned, but it just means this is less about watching an accident spiral out of control and more about trying to deal with a long overdue problem. Those are easy lines to read between, and I dug what it was trying to say.This is a movie that manages to be better than the foundation its built upon. That's faint praise, mind you, but this movie feels like it was a long time coming. Shame it only took them so many bad movies to get here.

title: Just watch the original
text: Bryce Dallas howard is the worst actress alive. Chris pratt deserves better but is probably locked in a contract. Woke. Lame. Cheap. Lazy. Greedy. Cringey. Turned it off after 30 minutes. I was expecting a bad movie but not this bad. Don't ruin the memory of the original with this scam. Don't let them use nostalgia to manipulate you into liking this garbage.

title: Parents Should Know: Characters and Jump Scares
text: Parents should know that Jurassic World Dominion is a fan movie. It really focuses on the characters wrapping up their storylines. And when it's not character driven, it's jump scare driven. While I would say it is not as violent as the previous films there are significantly more jump scare moments. The kid behind us seemed to be about 8 and left the movie crying. If your kids can handle the previous movies on the small screen, they will probably be able to handle this one on the small screen. But also be aware that a jump scare at home is a lot different than a jump scare on a giant theater screen. We really loved it though because of the way it positively represented biological and adoptive family members as well as adoptees. Find our full adoptive parent review on our blog. Down the Hobbit Hole Blog. Besides those points, it was very similar to the rest of the series. The cursing and bloodshed are about on par with the previous movies, possibly less. The movie concludes the entire Jurassic movie series (reportedly) and it was definitely made with the fans in mind.

title: Not bad!
text: Still a good movie and exciting! Maybe for some who is not into dinosaurs they tend to feel it is boring, but it is not, plus the whole family can watch including kids.

title: Cant beleive it . Worst than Jurassic Park 3
text: Back in 2001 i always thought the third installment in the series was the worst. We never had another Jurassic park movie for the next 15 years,,While sitting through this movie, from the very start the of the movie , u can already sense the cheesiness of the plot. With return of the original cast , i expected a more interesting plot. I was disappointed, To add on , some irritating youth and new face characters who look bland with no sense of actingWell this one makes the third watchable.

title: I honestly don't get the bad reviews?
text: It's definitely not among the best in the series, but I thought it was at times really entertaining with some cool dinosaurs in it. To see old characters back like Alan Grant, Ellie Sattler and Jeff Goldblum was honestly the highlight of the movie. The weakest part of the movie was that at times it felt very slow and long-spun. If it was just a little shorter the pacing would feel better!

title: Cinema is doomed
text: The cookie cutters they're using to make current movies are from Dollarama. Not sure how it's sustainable to keep making crap movies, but the trend is not ending.

title: Crowd pleasing final bow out to one of cinema's most successful franchises
text: STAR RATING: ***** Brilliant **** Very Good *** Okay ** Poor * AwfulIn a world where dinosaurs are learning to co-exist among humans, Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and his family live a quiet existence in the cold outback, with adopted daughter Claire (Bryce Dallas Howard) who was created with a DNA strand from a dinosaur embryo, and finds herself kidnapped by people eager to exploit this for their own ends. Meanwhile, Ellie Satler (Laura Dern) tracks down her old partner, Dr. Alan Grant (Sam Neill) for his help in breaking in to BioSyn headquarters to retrieve a sample they stole to develop a new bio engineered chemical. Their paths collide as their respective missions take their course.It's a depressing milestone in your life when you are finally able to remember going to see the original of a group of films that became a franchise, and recall through much more innocent eyes that first sense of magic and wonder that the success it enjoyed made producers want to try and recreate again and again, with far less enchanting results. And so I remember as a child, on holiday in America, seeing the original Jurassic Park, and not appreciating what a cultural moment I was a part of. And it seems at least that the makers of Jurassic World: Dominion are aware of this affection held by many for this original memory, and so in the film that promises to be the last in the series, the original cast are reunited in an all out, hell for leather romp that despite being massively flawed, is still crowd pleasing enough to get by.While the original cast have gained a few years on them, together they still have a magic and chemistry that works well together. The younger cast feel a little clunkier, but at least have lead star Pratt is there to carry things, and projects an effective presence, and is involved with some well staged action sequences, notably one involving a motorcycle coming out a cargo carrier. The plot feels pretty unremarkable, the dialogue feels unnatural and the pace sags at various stages, but all in all, for what it is, it just about hits the spot, and remains an intelligent commentary on the morality of science and our impact on the world.Nothing could ever recapture the magic of the original, or even the first few films after it, but this is a perfectly satisfying ode to bow out on, with enough thrills, chills, spills and sense of wonder to make it an event. ***

title: No more Please
text: Please stop making Jurassic park films, the name is being dragged through the mud. The main ingredient missing in the movie is fear. The first Jurassic park movie held so much fear of these unknown large creatures that could kill us humans in a heartbeat, and there was also the awe factor of how amazing the dinosaurs were. Every character was at risk of dying in the movie and it was heart pounding to will them to live, and not all did.But Now, watching Jurassic World Dominion, I am faced with a movie that has no fear or awe in it. No one is going to die, and we all know it. No matter what situation, all the main characters are going to be safe without a doubt in our mind. The big grand dinosaurs are nothing compared to us smart and witty humans that have no issue surviving them... and on top of it they throw in these mission impossible fighting and running scenes that do not belong in this movie. And to push the viewer one step further the actors always look perfect. Oh did I just fall out of the sky in a plane crash? Well guess what, my makeup is perfect afterwords, not a scratch on me? I'm not shaken by that, why would I be? That is not realistic, it makes the movie feel cheap and phony. The visuals were awesome during the film, but everything else was terrible.

title: This franchise is extinct
text: Ofcourd science fiction needs you to have a open mind. However there is a fine line between down right ridiculousness and science. This movie is so far over that line that it becomes unbearable to watch even with a open mind. Want to see a good jurassic park movie, rent the original!

title: Dinosaurs. People Running. Chaos. What Else Would You Expect?!?!?
text: Slow introduction but when it gets going, it takes off. Lots of callbacks to previous films. I loved it. It ain't Hamlet. It's a big, dumb monster movie. Sir back and enjoy.

title: Bad plot but entertaining
text: Much better than Fallen Kingdom, had fun and I will rewatch this one. There are some really cool scenes with the dinosaurs (oh I love the aquatic scene with Claire), the visual effects are fantastic and some nostalgia also works.Now...it is underwhelming. With the trio coming back and being the film that ends the trilogy, I expected much more. First, the first act of the film is a disaster. The pace is terrible, unfocused and doesn't feel Jurassic Park/World at all. Second, the plot...ffs! What was that? Definitely not what I was looking for on a Dinossaur movie. Such weird editing decisions, at least 20 minutes to cut...At least, it gets much better since Malta, especially after the plane crash (well, including). In short, not as terrible as critics say. It's fun, it's entertaining, but it could and should be much more than what it is.

title: A completely unnecessary movie
text: Good to check this out if you want to know the difference between a talented director (Steven Spielberg) and an ordinary director (Colin Trevorrow). Who will never be able to do more than produce unnecessary films.Lots of action in this movie, but unfortunately no action-reaction for me.

title: Leave it alone
text: It's not as awful as everyone says it is but I think it's truly time to give Jurassic Park a good long solid break. I enjoyed seeing all the old actors but I mean how many curtain calls do you really need? And wow, mixing Chris Pratt with the other old equally mediocre actors who took this movie also.. It really didn't have the nostalgic impact I can tell the movie wanted the viewer to feel. This felt warily similar to The Force Awakens. This didn't really have the "anticipation" and "wonder" the original Jurassic Parks did. I really think neither Star Wars nor the Jurassic needed to hit up the Member Berries so soon, or so hard. The lead up to the ending scene was so anticlimactic and set up so that no matter what they did I was not going to be impressed. I'm 30 years old, a highly desirable market, and just for the love of Pete stop forcing member berries down my throat and make something I'll actually like.

title: Clean your toilet instead.
text: Please put this series to extinction once and for all. It worked they sucked me in and I watched this movie because of the cast. Sam Neil what were you thinking of doing this movie??? You used to be such a credible actor. Now it's just chasing the buck because you're too old and aren't getting roles...this movie is a whole lot of nothing, avoid it like covid. Even the special effects in part one 20yrs ago was way better than in this one. Poor acting, storyline, action, special effects and script. As I said a whole lot of nothing.

title: It's a shame to end the franchise like this
text: But here we are. 2.5hrs and feels much longer. No real interesting story or action sequences to get the film going. And possibly the least on screen dinosaur action out of all 6 films. I'd put it below JP2. 5/10.

title: Not an actual "Epic Conclusion"
text: As a massive Jurassic fan, I was so excited for this film since like 2 years ago when they first announced it. But I felt like the excitement wasn't worth it. Dominion had a great hype with its main tagline, "The Epic Conclusion Of The Jurassic Era" and I'm pretty sure everyone expected to see how humans and dinosaurs are going to coexist after the events of the previous film, Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom. However, the new film, Jurassic World: Dominion, ended up focusing more on the new creatures called 'Locusts' and the clone girl, Maisie, than the dinosaurs. It's like the story took place in a dinosaur living world and because of that, it's a Jurassic movie.I was really looking forward to seeing a big freaking adventure with the domination of dinosaurs, not Locusts. So, this movie isn't really about an epic conclusion of dinosaurs. Also, I felt like it took much time to get into the actual plot but still the action scenes with dinos were pretty good and intense, though the Malta scene felt like Jurassic World had a crossover with Fast & Furious. The fight between the T-Rex and Giganotosaurus felt kinda inappropriate as we've already seen two alpha dinos fighting in the first Jurassic World film and seeing a new dinosaur that had a very short amount of screen time, die at the end was kinda hurtful.Overall, Jurassic World: Dominion is an ok film but probably every single Jurassic fan hoped for an actual Jurassic film as the final installment in the JW trilogy.

title: What a shame
text: "Jurassic Park" in 1993 was ground-breaking as it mesmerized viewers around the world piquing their imagination under the competent direction of Steven Spielberg. Now almost 30 years later, here we have the sixth installment of this franchise, supposedly the conclusion as it brings together all of the legacy characters along with the new ones for the final hurrah. The result is a long big mesh of an uninspired plot, repetitive scenes, cringe-worthy script, and extremely bad editing making the veterans Sam Neill, Jeff Goldblum, and Laura Dern appear unrehearsed and amateurish. Special effects-wise, the dinosaurs look superior compared to their 1993 counterparts but here, you don't feel any ounce of suspense or care if the characters get eaten or not, unlike the porta-potty scene in 1993 that had you biting your nails and your heart pounding. It is just a big shame that this important movie franchise has to end like this.

Jurassic World: Dominion is an amazing action and adventure movie for the entire family. The movie has great movie script writing and special effects as well as great directing by Collin Trevorrow. The CGI is outstanding, and so are the performances. Along with Chris Pratt (Owen Grady) Bryce Dallas Howard (Clair Dearing) and Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon) reprising their roles from the previous film, which is Jurassic World: A Fallen Kingdom, The old cast from the original 1993 Jurassic Park movie returns in this movie. Sam Neil (Dr. Allen Grant) Laura Dern (Ellie Sattler) and Jeff GoldBlum (Ian Malcolm.) The movie has two plot points, the first one revolves around Clair and Owen protecting Maisie from poachers and bad scientists who want to experiment on her and Blue, the Velociraptor's baby. The second plot point which is the one that most movie buffs, amateur online movie critics and movie viewers absolutely hate in this movie, is about the Locus bugs feeding off of the crops and food sources for the humans, and in order to put an end to this huge problem, Allen and Ellie must go to the Biosyn headquarters building in order to get a Bio-Sample of the Locus Bug's DNA inside of a lab. For me the second plot point is very interesting and it helps the pacing of the movie. Putting both of those plot points together, makes for an amazing Jurassic World film. This movie overtakes my original favorite Jurassic Park movie, which was Jurassic Park: The Lost World, when I was a kid. Jurassic World: Dominion is a great wrap up film for the whole franchise. One of the taglines for this movie is: The Epic Conclusion. I do hope it is the conclusion, because if other filmmakers come along and want to continue this franchise, then movie buffs and amateur online movie critics need to letters and make calls to the production companies and studios, telling them that there shouldn't be a seventh film. The style of the movie is fantastic and I couldn't have asked for a better ending to the Jurassic Park franchise. This definitely gets a full 5 stars out of 5 and is a movie that I think should win at least a Golden Globe. Another one of my favorite things about the way that the movie is scripted, is that the dinosaurs come in straight away, so parents, guardians and older siblings and cousins won't have small children asking them when do the dinosaurs come in. This is truly a terrific movie.

title: Mouse Rat
text: It was so so. Decent movie for watching at home but it's not worth going to the theater to watch. Lil Sebastion would be shaking his head in horsey heaven. Plot was stretched out to much.

title: Not a bad wrap-up for the series...
text: I came in will very low expectations, but was satisfied when I left. Yes, there are totally implausible situations which the heroes escape, and overall, the movie is a bit long - but hopefully the bow has now been tied. I liked that several of the original book plotlines were used in this conclusion.Watch it during a bargain night, and get the large popcorn...

title: Flawed, but enjoyable
text: It was great to see some familiar faces that spanned much of the franchise together in one scene. The climactic and expected battle was decent enough, yet it seemed to borrow heavily from other films in the series. The cast did good with what they were given to work with. The Dino action was great, but not as frequent. Some of the dialogue was cringy. There were a lot of cool nods to other iconic moments in the franchise.

title: Worst Jurassic movie ever
text: I am disappointing as much as I love this franchise.The storyline is very predictable and that makes it boring. There is nothing new except a couple of dinosaurs.The only rating I can give is for the cast and few punchlines. But I feel like they should've rejected the movie based on this storyline.

title: Dominion has all the right ingredients but doesn't conclude the franchise satisfactorily
text: Taking on the responsibility of the Jurassic Park franchise is a big weight for any filmmaker to carry and I never considered Colin Trevorrow to be the ideal filmmaker to take it forward however Steven Spielberg seemed to put a lot of faith in him and backed his ideas. This is the third in Trevorrow's trilogy of Jurassic World films taking forward the vision Spielberg created with Jurassic Park (1993) from Michael Crichton's novel. The original introduced the world to the magic of CGI with effects so fluid you could believe that dinosaurs were real and with all the advances in computer technology in the 29 years since Treverrow certainly makes use of it and gives the audience plenty of dinosaurs and impressive visuals to marvel at however the problem for me has always been the scripts and casting which has made his three Jurassic World films the weakest out of the six.Jurassic World Dominion is a nod to what has gone before by bringing back the original cast members of Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum and contains lots of fun references to past movies but offers very little in advancing the overall arch of a bigger story. What we get is another unscrupulous scientist who has a purpose built laboratory and taken genetics too far with plans to control the world's food supply. We are introduced to more characters and there's at least two stories running alongside each other which converge to bring the characters from the original cast with the new on screen together for the first time. I do like Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas-Howard as actors but I never thought their casting in Jurassic World worked. They don't have the chemistry needed and compared to the original actors they seem too one dimensional.Trevorrow and co-writer Emily Carmichael don't think big enough, they just go through the motions of previous Jurassic World adventures hitting all the right notes but this instalment doesn't go anywhere and doesn't provide the big finale fans were looking for. The overall theme is that we ultimately need to co-exist in order to survive as dinosaurs adapt to live side by side with modern day creatures here on Earth. This sentiment is reinforced by a narrator over the closing moments which seem almost tacked on just so we get the message.Dominion has all the right ingredients we've come to expect from a Jurassic movie with plenty of action, thrills, scares, dinosaurs and comedic moments to relieve the tension but we've seen it all before and apart from reuniting with the original cast, with B. D. Wong being the only actor to appear in all 6 movies, I came away feeling it was an unnecessary sequel. It all seems rather forced, clumsy and doesn't flow as well as it should and the continuation of the series would have benefited from having a more visionary director at the helm. I always felt that special effects artist turned director Joe Johnston did a much better job in taking the reins from Spielberg with Jurassic Park III (2001). Spielberg initially kept things simple so the audience knew where they were in the story, here Trevorrow throws in too many things, the main one being the subplot around Maisie Lockwood, without exploring them with any depth and at 2hrs 27mins this has the longest running time in the franchise which is not always put to good use.

title: Eye candy..but not even good candy...
text: When I first saw the trailer I called it. This movie is incomprehensible. Where is the Dr. Hammond Prequel? It's gotten so cartoonish. Seriously, we are supposed to suspend everything we have seen in the first two films (Based on the REAL books) and believe that a Velociraptor, who has it's baby snatched away,goes back and seeks the help of humans to get the baby back? If humans and Dino's actually lived in the same era human's would be extinct in a minute. My head hurts from the fact that all these millions were wasted when we have so many horrible things that need fixing in this country.

title: Just a blast!
text: This was a fun, refreshing movie for me. The director had a truly difficult job trying to incorporate a respectful and satisfying end to such an iconic franchise, and in my opinion he did a fantastic job.It was such a joy to see the original characters we love and adore so much shining alongside the newer cast and to see the value of different ages all working together with varying strengths and expertise.I'm definitely planning to own this one once it's out of theatres.

title: Be full of dinosaurs and less story
text: As a parent-child movie, it's great and very suitable, it was so fantastic in my childhood, but I'm not a big fan of Jurassic World.We have more beautiful movie effect than before, but the story is still normal or even weak, but I'll still expect to watch next sequel with nice change.

title: An Underwhelming Conclusion to the Jurassic World Trilogy
text: Set four years after the events of Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom, Dominion has Owen and Claire raising Maisie alone in a remote area where she will not come into contact with anyone. However, employees from a dinosaur research company known as Biosyn Genetics kidnaps Maisie when she tries to leave as well as Blue's mysterious child. Claire and Owen set out to rescue them both. Meanwhile, Alan Grant and Ellie Sattler go to Biosyn to investigate the seeds that are left uneaten after a locust raid threatens food supply around the world.As someone whose favorite movie is Jurassic Park, I am rather mixed in Jurassic World. It was fine, but it did not have the tension or thrill of the first film. I thought Fallen Kingdom was much better, but I am in the minority there. I thought it did a great job focusing on the fright of the dinosaurs as well as showing how humans can be just monstrous if not more so. I also thought the ending was a nice setup to this film and it made me pretty excited for the ending to this trilogy. Does it end with a bang or a whimper?Let us start with the good. First of all, the cast is great. Seeing Sam Neill as Alan Grant and Lauren Dern as Ellie Sattler was a joy and they have just as smooth chemistry as they did nearly three decades ago. Some things never change with them, especially for Grant. Jeff Goldblum is much older, but he is as smooth and solid as ever as Ian Malcolm.The World cast are no slouches either. Bryce Dallas Howard continues to improve as Claire as she grows from being a rather cowardly Jurassic World employee to a strong person who is not afraid to step into action. They even show how much she has grown from the first by having her go on a dangerous rescue mission in her first scene. Chris Pratt is great as Owen. I always felt that this has always been Pratt's coolest role where he is a bit more serious but he still has a sense of humor for the more insane encounters he and Claire face. Isabella Sermon is solid as the rebellious Maisie her backstory continues to be pretty fascinating. Of the new characters, I liked DeWanda Wise as Kayla Watts.
