She is a fun character to watch as she is skilled and energetic. Wise seems to have a blast in this role. The cast is great overall.The cinematography is great. The shots look stunning as ever with some images that look almost out of a horror flick. The scene where Claire is trying to stay calm when encountering a carnivorous dinosaur showcases the movie's visual style perfectly. The dinosaurs look solid enough, though there are some scenes of questionable CGI. The action scenes are fun to watch overall, with the motorcycle chase standing out. The musical score by Michael Giacchino is fantastic and the sound design for the dinosaurs make them even more threatening. This all makes the movie technically solid. With a great cast, solid action, beautiful cinematography and some memorable new characters, why did I still leave the theater underwhelmed?Jurassic World: Dominion is a movie that I wish that I loved, but I don't. In fact, it is pretty disappointing. First of all, the story is a jumbled mess. There is so much going on that it is hard to keep track with the plot. Even then, it starts off so slow that it gets difficult to invest in the story, but it does pick up a little bit around the beginning of the second act. As much as I love seeing Grand and Sattler again, their role feels more like having them for the sake of having them rather than truly needing them. Blue gets absolutely nothing to do, though if you thought she got too much screen time in the second film, you might appreciate this.The biggest problem I have with the story though is the fact that it does little build upon the setup from the last film. Dinosaurs running around the real world? That sounds insane! There are so many ideas you can create with this premise, but most of the movie is about taking down another evil corporation and destroying the locusts. Locusts? I came to see this movie to see humanity live among dinosaurs. The locusts are unnecessary and they hinder the story more than anything. The one scene taking place underground where we get to see how dinosaurs are used in a club is more interesting than anything to do with locusts. Why could they not just build on that or other areas affected by the spread of the dinosaur population? That would have made for some great world-building.As for the villains, they are disappointing as well. The main human villain, Lewis Dodgson has one threatening scene, but he is not given much to do after that. I thought the human from Fallen Kingdom was better because he was much more detestable and vile. That was the kind of villain that I wanted to punch. Dodgson is pretty evil too, but he feels more generic. As for the Giganotosaurus, it is a massive disappointment. It hardly acts like a threat to the main characters, yet it is treated like a villain. I think they did not give this dinosaur enough screen time. If they focused on this dinosaur more than the locusts, maybe they would have shown how much of threatening predator this beast could have been.Despite my rant about the story and villains, I do not dislike Jurassic World: Dominion. I liked too much stuff in it to call it a bad film. I just wish it was great. It should have been great. That is why I feel so disappointed and underwhelmed with it. However, what does work works really well. If you are looking for a nostalgic experience and/or you want to see some cool dinosaur action, you'll get plenty of that here. Maybe it is time to lay this series to rest and move on before it can get really bad.

title: Meh
text: Firstly I love the world of Jurassic Park and I had high hopes for this film especially after the covid delay but I just thought meh. It's a great action movie with dinosaurs but just seems to be too far removed from the central theme. More action with Dinos instead of a dinosaur movie with action. Great film as a stand alone but falls short of the franchise.

title: As someone who loves the JP/JW franchise, this was a hard watch.
text: This movie is all flash, no substance. The plot is pretty contrived. I was excited to see the former cast members from the original, but their story didn't really feel organic, it just felt off. Honestly, this just felt like a half baked James Bond film, in that the antagonist is like a second rate Bond villain and the plot felt really vague. After a while it felt like a commercial for dinosaurs. "Hey look it's this dinosaur, oooh aaaah", "there's another one we've never seen in these movies, oooh aaahhh". This was a major letdown. I rewatched the whole franchise leading up to this and honestly, it's really hard for me to rate this above Jurassic Park III and Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom. This was mid 00's bad remake/sequel writing, and I thought we grew out of that stuff.

title: Impossible mission: Dinosaurs
text: This movie was kind of impossible mission plot, with too many overwritten scenes and too many absurd things. This is a fictional movie and you expect something fictional to happen, but they went too far with some scenes here. I would have liked more to see the dinosaurs in the city, but we just got pretty much the same we saw in Jurassic World. With that said, I think the movie was entertaining, and the second half was non-stop action. I loved to see so many species and the original characters. The effects were also great. Im not a fan of this story ended, but well.

title: Milking Dinosaurs
text: It's milking the cow time, it's simple as that. Jurassic World Dominion is not a candidate for the worst movie ever award but also nothing really good - it's like watching the same old story but with a slightly change of clothing again and again and again. In short: generic, redundant, a "blockbuster" like a zillion others made in the past decade. The special effect department did solid, that's the best part of the whole affair. Recommended only to the ultra hardcore lover of the empire of dinosaurs.

title: Fast and Furious: Jurassic World
text: They took all the good they did with the first Jurassic World and threw it in the trash. Dominion takes away any of the awe of the dinosaurs and somehow also makes all of the human characters more cringey. Seriously, who wrote the dialog, George Lucas? On top of all of that, the cgi is hit and miss. Sometimes it looks good, and sometimes it looks pretty crappy. Just one big disappointment.

title: Zzzzzzzzzzz
text: Acting was so over done, storyline was boring and really wished I had not watched this now.Seems like an attempt to squeeze some final pennies out of a franchise long dead.Give it 2 stars purely based on nostalgia.

title: Better than expected from the negative reviews..
text: Despite some of the harsh reviews, this is a good movie. It might not be what everyone is expecting, especially from the short teaser-video that dropped before Christmas, but as an adventure movie with dinosaurs, it delivered. Also, it's not a horror film either, it's a family film. With all that in mind, the cast do a fantastic job and the effects are faultless. Sound editing is intense in all the action scenes, score is good too. The old and new cast work well together and have great chemistry. Jeff delivers some awesome lines in his unique style "I didn't know there was a code" and many others.. Bryce is wonderful in every scene, and her character has become super likeable, compared to the first World's film. DeWanda is incredible, a sassy and interesting new character that steals her scenes. Also, it's a movie about the dangers of genetic modification, co-existence and ecology too, a point that seems to be lost on many viewers. Go see it!

title: Lost the plot
text: Film ok but segment in malta totally spoit it for me, made Malta look like a middle Eastern country or Morocco, having lived in Malta I KNOW its nothing like that.

title: Messy but Enjoyed the Ride!
text: Jurassic World Dominion capitalized on nostalgia with many familiar dinosaurs, callbacks, and the old Jurassic Park crew. However, despite the fun and exciting new characters, dinos, and stakes, there is no more room for plot. The movie lacks in an organized story and has the characters stumble into exactly what they need or what they have to do next. Ultimately, it was a thrilling but messy movie with the most interesting parts being the dinosaurs.

title: Nostalgia candy mixed with modern gaming culture
text: If you play any modern video games, there are a few, noticeably "Ark", which is a pretty good survival entry to learning as well as taming dinosaurs. The Therizinosauras otherwise known as "Claw thing" in the game is noticeablly the most dangerous but looks quite passive. They squeezed so many different dinos in this movie that it's actually quite fun. I give the film 4 stars just for that (Bringing popular gaming culture into high budgets are always awesome).The story and writing is sub-par -- equal to Uncharted, though. It's just throw-away plot just to have a popcorn shoved in your mouth movie. I think Jurassic Park 1-3 are definitely more investing with the last 2 being the latter.I love the actors, all of them actually, so they did their part yet short-lived. We have so many timelines happening here. Glad Chris Pratt can still find acting after Hollywood discriminating people of faith.6/10 like the rest of the Jurassic World movies. Fun flick to chill out to and learn about different dinosaurs. The characters still act canon and that's a big thing. Love the attempt but nothing like the first movie.

title: A little bit disappointing.
text: I don't hate this movie, i just think they chould have done more out of the premiss.The movie starts pretty slow, and they should have shown the dinosaures go around free in the city and destroying society.The acting is good. I like that they brought back the old cast. Jeff Goldblum was great as always.I like the ending of the movie. The action was good and i like the fighting scenes.The Jurassic series has always been some of my favourite movies and it was an improvement from the last movie. The movie wasn't as good as it chould have been, but i was entertained enough to say if you are fan of jurassic park you should watch it.

title: Need to raise Michael Crichton from the dead to make this trilogy better
text: As new trilogy go this one was alright. But it'll never be better than the original. They're just getting more and more outlandish. Thankfully this looks to be the last one.

title: Good, not bad at all.
text: It was entertaining and fun seeing the original actors in this film, but some of the lines spoken and acted out by some of these newer characters in this movie were a bit cheesy.... All in all, It was a good movie with a fun storyline, even though it was a tad long.

title: Overall, boring movie
text: People watch Jurassic movies because each movie promises the audience a fun time with dinosaurs. And "Dominion" is highly anticipated by many fans because not only does the movie have dinosaurs, it also explores the idea of dinosaurs and humans coexisting in the same world. It's disappointing to not only see the movie exploring that topic very lightly, but also because there's not enough dinosaurs. This movie has many elements to it-evil corporation, rescue mission, even a commentary on reality. But because it's trying to be too many things all at once, the movie loses its main focus on dinosaurs.The movie does have many cool components. Instead of having CG dinosaurs, are some real puppet ones. And the old trio getting back together is always fun to watch. However, that's it. The rest of the movie is dull and lacking creativity. Most importantly, the tension of dinosaur attacks are nowhere to be found. The T-Rex scene in the first "Jurassic Park" film was so brilliantly shot that the audience felt the fear and tension. Now, it's just dinosaurs being loud in front of the camera. The flat characters and bad dialogues only makes the movie worse.It's really disappointing to see the "Jurassic World" franchise end in such a unremarkable way.

title: My boys enthusiastically told me to rate it a 10!
text: I'm not sure why this movie is being rated so low. It must be the same people that rated Everything Everywhere All At Once so high . I was solidly entertained and my boys loved it! Well worth the $60 for admission + $20 for popcorn and a drink + $5 for gas. And Thank God our friends brought ear plugs. Yes, the end is nigh for the big screen. But, this was still good fun mindless entertainment.

title: You pay for the Dinosaurs and Action Scenes ... and that's about it
text: The action scenes will keep you on your toes as well as seeing the dinosaurs fight/battle.There are a lot of cheesy/uninteresting moments and dialogue within the story which make trying to connect with the characters hard. The music score didn't really help in being a character in the film as it made moments really cheesy.

title: Wait for stream
text: Wasn't the worst movie in the world, but it was pretty underwhelming. There's was only one scene where I was excited. The rest was sub par action and slow moving plot. I couldnt say I was bored at all but I would not recommend going into this expecting a good Dino experience because I was not there. I would not see this again, maybe on tv.

title: It has its moments
text: So where to start, this is definitely not anywhere close to the level of the original jurassic parks, but I dont think any of us were expecting that.The sets of story lines dont particularly work well together or really compliment each other and there is some truly laughable moments, also I think the "new trio" let's call them, have much worse chemistry than the old.However that being said, to keep it short and sweet, this film has some fantastic callbacks to the originals, some interesting action scenes (although it does feel abit fast and furious at times), and I did enjoy the cinematic clips of the dinosaurs interacting with the animals we have today.In conclusion, dont take the film to seriously, don't expect too much. Yes it feels a little lost and confused on what it wants to be, but its not an awful time, not a great one, not a particularly memorable one, but certainly not an awful one.Worth watching for the original cast atleast, to see them one final time in characters we love.

title: Disappointing.
text: Well, the nostalgia set apart, Dominion provides a disappointing treat. A very boring plot and not interesting sequences makes us to doze off. 3D was a huge disaster, in this modern world, they should have provided something to justify this technology.

title: Cross between Skippy the Bush Kangaroo, Mission Impossible and Dr. Dolittle
text: The big disappointment of this movie is Chris's Pratt talking to the raptors as if he was Dr. Dolittle communicating with the 60's kangaroo Skippy. On a plus side there was more of a plot to this movie than the previous last two movies and the action sequences were very good too, similar to a Mission Impossible script. The performance of the actors especially Jeff Goldblum was a positive for the movie too. Still,this,like the other movies in the franchise is not up to the standard of the original. I would recommend this movie to fans of Jurassic Park and similar monster movies. As for others it's still worth a watch.

title: Cor that's a tough watch
text:
I wanted to like it but I'm not even going to bother explaining why it was bad.If you like the first of the new trilogy and found the 2nd ok but not good then don't bother with this one.. because you have the same taste as me...
14.99 home release waste of dosh.

title: Decent - forget negative reviews
text: This movie did have a slow start, granted, but it was a great movie all in. All the main characters (who didn't die on the first) from Jurrasic park meet the main characters from Jurassic world.I think fans / viewers are expecting too much. I went to the cinema to see this without watching any trailers or watching any reviews beforehand, not knowing what to expect, and I left the cinema happy with what I saw.People see a negative review and jump on the bandwagon, because they want to be liked by others, and don't want to stand out from the crowd.Decent movie. Go see it!

title: I liked it
text: As a stand alone film it was good, had decent action. The back stories of the characters was nice, and was nice to see three from the original movie. It also had a decent moral message that says don't mess with nature, and has kind of a slap to genetically modified seeds as well. If you go in expecting a lot, you will be disappointed.

title: Unmitigated mess!
text: I knew this wasn't going to be a masterpiece, but at least, I was hoping it was mindless fun with dino's.Nope, it's just a bloated mess of stuff happening without a real storyline. I found myself drifting and grabbing my phone, that's how boring and how little you care for the "story" and characters.Sam Neil, Laura Dern & Jeff Goldblum must be really regretting, coming back for this husk of a movie.

title: It was fine
text: Had very low expectations for this and in the end it was totally fine. Fun to see the familiar faces from the original all together again and it was decently entertaining enough. Nothing incredible by any means but better than the last one at least.

title: Terrible Movie..
text: No storyline! Wanted to Copy the best parts of the old movies but did it in dumpest way! It's a terrible way to waste your lifetime!If you like the Jurassic Park movies, don't watch this movie!

title: The worst acting so far
text:
Guys what is this
This is so bad
Bad acting from good actors
You can know what they gona do next..........
..........
...............
........................
.......

title: Such a waste of talent
text: It's a shame that talent like Sam Neil, Jeff Goldblum (and the rest) were wasted in this overblown film.Faffing about while getting into tight spots so the dinosaurs can run around causing destruction hardly makes for an entertaining entry in the series.The film makers forgot why we loved the first Jurassic Park. Where's the awe and sense of wonder?Disappointing to say the least. A big budget B movie without the laughs.Let's call it a day and find something new to make!

title: the best closure we will row a saga
text: Although this movie has been a bit bad, since I think it has plenty of moments, since the first 50 minutes of the movie could have been cut, this would have improved it a lot since from then on it is a very enjoyable movie , but something very positive that for me is good, is that I think it has been a good closure for a saga that has been going on for several years. Rating: 8/10.

title: I cannot believe... I got disappointed...
text: Am sad to say that my childhood favourite.. and the movie which I grew up with... finally got ruined ... felt like the main characters from Jurassic park came in this movie for no real reason I can include the dinosaurs itself... action sequences are good of course Hollywood... In the previous movies Jurassic world and JW fallen kingdom the death of Indominus rex and Indoraptor made more sense... rather than this movie climax... overall I cannot believe... I got disappointed...

title: Jurassic will always be what it is.
text: The same story, fun, adventurous and thrills. The way it should end. See you again after 2 decades. I'm sure they will be then be part of the natural wildlife of the world, no more parks.

title: Disappointing finale to a great series. The OGs can't save it.
text: The first Jurassic World was one of the best summer blockbuster movies of all time. As good as the original Jurassic Park. The follow up Fallen Kingdom was not as perfect but it was a decent follow up. I was looking forward to the final instalment. We had a midnight screening for staff at the cinema I work at. I almost fell asleep by the end and it was definitely not staying up late for and being sleep deprived at work the next day. I was just not very moved at all. Despite the fact that we got to see the OGs again. And the story? No idea about that it was lost on me if there was one. There were some really scary moments in it, not for young kids. Definitely appropriately rated at a 12A.

title: Not worth it
text:
The movie is a heartless and soulless movie that is very boring, nothing interesting happens and you
will be very bored,. The action sequences are fine, the dinosaurs are stupid, and there is no point of watching the movie. The best thing about the movie is the graphics., that's it. It is stupid and generic. If it was called dinosaur would be a lot better in my opinion. It is not good. Here's a lot of jumbo. Hibbity hobbity, bibbity bobbity, good god is life food without this movie. Coo coo for Cocoa Puffs coo coo for Cocoa Puffs gosspidossjhdjsjsjsjsjsjsjdjdjsjsjsjjsjsjsjsjsjsjsjsjsjsjsjsjsjsj.

title: Meh
text: Going into this film I had 0 expectations. For my whole life I have adored the Jurassic park franchise (who hasn't) and no matter how dumb the last Jurrasic world was I was always going to watch this. In the end just felt like a nothing film. The franchise is supposed to be about dinosaurs, but this just felt like a film with dinosaurs just there....

title: Sensational special effects in a ho-hum movie
text: For those that cannot get enough of the scenery and special effects thrill of Jurassic fever, this is for you. If you want plot, skip it. The same plot, rehashed to the point of annoyance. Even the special effects are recycled. Zero actual plot and most of the acting is done by stunt doubles as it is nothing more than special effect upon special effect with occasional jibberish dialogue. Enough already. Please stop.

title: a good Thriller plot, a great message of anticaptialism, and love for the franchise
text: So Jurassic World Dominion.Perfect 10/10. Like the first movie the basic plot coulda been done without dinosaurs (in the first movie they could have been done with malfunctioning rides/automated systems/cleaning robots). Its not a thriller per say maybe a heist movie? Its basically Claire and Ellie seeking to infiltrate a corrupt company. The movie has heavy themes of conservation, anti capitalism and preservation of the environment and the villain is basically a Bezos/musk expy whos willing to put millions at risk to make a buck.So while at its core the movie works as a regular good movie about fighting that situation(albiet not groundbreaking), it still has tons of good character interaction, new dinosaurs , and the heroes instead of being victims cleverly avoiding danger through desperation, teamwork and cleverness (giving the raptor scene int he climax of the final movie vibes).And there was a ton of fanservice that lovers of the franchise will enjoy. Just like W1 and 2 there are shoutouts and classic camera shots recreated with different context. And i dont think any of them felt forced (Marvel's :Guy steps into the camera, it zooms in on his face :"Its me Blorbo"). 1 Kinda corney moment with Blue, a certain interaction between two characters made me think there was something cut that showed more about the character.Enjoy!

title: Entertaining, Yet Underwhelming...Like the Other 2
text: Dominion is a decent ending to an OK trilogy. It makes me sad that this trilogy didn't thrill me any more than it did. It just failed to capture the suspense and excitement of the original trilogy. Speaking of that, bringing back the main trio from the original trilogy and making them such a big part of this film was a great idea. It was fun and nostalgic having them back. It was interesting seeing dinosaurs let loose in a modern world. That was the biggest draw for me. We got to leave behind the usual tropical, zoo like setting for various different locations such as the snowy Sierra Mountains and the bustling city of Malta.I enjoyed some of the action sequences but things tended to get too preposterous too often. Unfortunately, the acting isn't great. It's just not the kind of movie that gives the cast much to work with. That's not to say the acting is all bad, there's just plenty of moments where it's distractingly unconvincing. It's a long movie, and I finished it, so that's saying something. But there's no desire to watch this again.

title: 8 different plots, none followed through; cgi from 15 years ago, and same tech and green screen as 10 years ago.
text: This seemed like it was a complete cash grab on the backs of previous titles.Writing, script was horrible made the actors look bad even though they were fine in previous films.It seemed like there were 8 plot lines and none followed through with a proper storyline. They just took the easy way out with each plot line. The storyline was all over the place and nothing tied together properly. Tried to incorporate all the previous world famous scenes from the original Jurassic Park instead of creating a decent story. It seemed like they must of had 8 amateur writers, have them work separately and then jam it into one movie with out fleshing out a decent story.The cgi was horrible and the green screen and animatronics were worse than they were 10 years ago. It was like watching a film that was made 20 years ago, even the horse riding was cgi and bad.Such a poor film haven't seen one this bad in many, many years.

title: Nothing New - same old
text:
It was pretty boring.Dinosaur don't look that real as well.They brought in Jeep which looked cheap as well
I know for sure there will be another sequel coming up soon.Too many setup up of different scenarios with different characters (tried to show different dinosaurs do different things)- and all of them actors meeting at the same time at some point.Only thing I liked about in the film is the forest.

title: Coexist With Dinosaurs? Nope!
text: The third installment of the new Jurassic series is trying to bring back the original Jurassic casts. It's better than Jurassic World, in my opinion. But still missing something though. And the ending is kinda absurd. They're thinking about dinosaurs to coexist with the rest of the present day habitat?! That's impossible! Nevertheless, it's still not a complete mess. And the action sequences ain't so bad. I enjoyed it, kinda.

title: Meh! It's okay
text: Most things seemed logical from start to end. It was an alumni get together evening with more dinosaurs, new and old, in the background making loud thunderous scream.Lots of face-to-face closeups with pre-historical predators. Gee, their breathe was enough to kill. It was a re-assembled cast with one new additon: Kayla. She was a pilot, and she flied the main cast in and out was all. Who was Kayla? The pilot. As usual, several of the key action squences were out in the trailers, so nothing was exciting there.It must be a tongue-and-cheek jab at Apple spaceship when the control center the same look : round donut. Lewis Dodgson, the bad business man, a la Tim Cook. It has to be an insider joke. Perhaps? Maybe I am over-analyzing.And we got it, lots of iconic shots repeated here.Overall, it's an entertaining movie if the Jurassic franchise is your thing.

title: One of the many scenes in this movie that doesn't make sense.
text: In the first scene,we see of Chris Pratt, he is chasing a dinosaur. Now it would be fine if he had help trying to take it down,but he takes it down single-handedly. He uses his body weight and a tree stump still in the ground. In the second Jurassic park film it took three full grown men to take one of them down,which it still managed to lift one of the men in the air for a brief moment; I understand it's a fictional film but could we at least get some consistency.

title: Bad movie with a few thrills.
text: Saw with my kids. Was barely tolerable. A far cry from JP1 or 2. Bad acting, no engaging plot or characters. More Disposable entertainment. Why does it look like CGI has barely progressed since 1993?

title: Beyond great!
text: Everything about this movie is amazing! The cast, the storyline, the dinosaurs (of course, lol), everything is just done right. It flows perfectly well. Seeing cast, old and new, all onscreen together was amazing. You will not be disappointed!

title: The poor writing disappointingly outweighs the stellar dinosaurs and the stars among the cast
text: The dinosaurs in "Jurassic World Dominion" (the 5th sequel to 1993's "Jurassic Park") are as stunning as ever, thanks to director Colin Trevorrow (back for a second franchise entry after skipping the last) but his co-writing (with Emily Carmichael) is dreadfully dumb, dull & flawed, having the old crew(s) implausibly battling Campbell Scott's evil DNA-mutating corp as dino's roam the world among us. The cast is good tho (except Bryce Dallas Howard & Isabella Sermon) esp Jeff Goldblum (terrific), Chris Pratt, Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Mamoudou Athie & the fine DeWanda Wise. For all it's stars & mega-beasts tho, with writing so poor it ultimately disappoints.

title: Redefined the meaning "Killer"
text: First and most, what's app with the background musoc? It is a real killer. Second, whats hp with the Velociraptors, blue and her pack has stopped eating humans.This movie is a killer! It jas killed the Jurassic Park franchise!It is not just a waste of time and childhood memories, it is also a waste of urine: yeah when you left your cinema seat, do not go to the toilet.

title: Not enough dinosaurs.
text: I read the Jurassic Park books and like all the films, to me this installment leaned more towards feeling like a lite tv pilot to set up a Jurassic live action tv series, or something straight to streaming. There was just something missing. Not enough dinosaurs. Too many characters doing unrealistic things. Side characters that just vanish from the plot and are never addressed again. Iconic signature legacy characters simply trying to deliver their best most familiar recap of their character. The action and carnage was weaker this time around. Navigation of the plot is all over the place. The writing has its corny rushed moments. This film nearly crumbles under the weight of its previous films loose ends and baggage. It tries to be its own thing but staggers through a muddy forced espionage story. Dinosaurs are swept away to the sidelines as background details and decorations who pop up once in a while to say 'boo'. Our human characters aren't interesting nor developed enough while juggling numerous groups of them as characters. This feels like damage control from Fallen Kingdom tanking half this movie. All we see here is a few more of the same familiar thrills and chills, but less epic, and with less to tell. Everything is so rushed with so many sprawling story beats, there's no moment to really soak in the suspense, dread, or beauty of a dinosaur. The writing and excuse to gather the gangs of characters together feels contrived. More of the same. Fun to watch, but underwhelming. I can just say I'm relieved the second trilogy is over. I only hope the next one finds a way.

title: Bad story, but it is not soulless
text: I expected a primitive and very heartless movie, and I got a primitive, but nice one.The script is garbage, and everything just happens. So that's that.But I cannot be angry for this movie, because I felt that the cast cared about this movie, and tried to give us some moments.They just literally can not write nowadays. I dont know why.

title: Really loud, really stupid, and...really stupid
text: Finally watched it for "free" on Prime Video. I mean we deserve this movie. It made a billion dollars, no duh they keep pumping them out. Read the reviews first and stop paying to watch garbage in the cinema or renting at full price on demand if you want to be treated with respect.Pros: The movie has the usual polish and directing flair, some actually fun action sequences, and if you have surround sound it sounds awesome. The actors were trying.Cons: pretty much everything else. The story/script is hot garbage. It's actually borderline offensive how bad the dialogue is and the situations are. Just the concept itself is absurd. I found myself saying...What!? Why!? How!? So many times I lost track.

title: Nostalgy.
text: A film with a lot of scenaristic inconcistencies which wants to play with people's nostalgy. The iconic tensions from the Jurassic Park given by the dinos of the franchise is not present. Still entertaining and graphically okay.

title: Underwhelming
text: The script for this is what really killed it for me. A lot of the dialogue was just off. It's not enough to have popular actors and cgi, the story needs to be interesting or it's just an expensive snorefest.

title: Prehistoric and Modern Worlds Collide.
text: 8/10Cool concept of the Prehistoric and modern world as one.The action scenes had me on the edge of my seat wondering what the end result would be as there were a few unique situations I did not anticipate.Obviously there were far-fetched situations. But then this is a movie about dinosaurs. So no surprise here.Overall a good watch, very well done character portrayal and cool dinosaur moments, peppered with some humour!

title: Predictable, Stale and absolutely ridiculous.
text:
Im really confused how a franchise about Dinosaurs has turned into a movie about BS science with Dinosaurs on the side only for the sake of progressing the movie...
A little bit of plot, run away from Dinosaurs, a little bit more plot, run away from Dinosaurs and repeat, and repeat, and repeat. It got so stale so fast I wanted to turn the film off, and lets not forget some of the escape situations are so farfetched I don't understand how the writters expected you to sit through it all.Jurassic World: Dominion is nothing more then another Hollywood budget film rehashing old characters from past and present films in the franchise with extremely lazy writing. Do not recommend this one.

title: Amazing, but lacks expectations
text: Jurassic world dominion is the ultimate "finale" of the JP franchise, but is it worth it? Well yes but acually no. Its an amazing addition to the franchise but the reason why i say this is because it lacked lots of expectations as well as the Giganotosarus being an antagonist, but was underused and was treated like an acual animal the problem is that i like how it was treated like an acual animal especially when he faught the rex over a depressed deer and the fight was more realistic than people think. The OG trio was fantastic. Overall rating: 9.5/10.

title: Ultimately unsatisfying
text: As a culmination of nearly 30 years of storytelling on the big screen, this will leave you frankly disappointed.At the end of Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom (the previous movie), the post-credit scenes tease us with a world inhabited by dinosaurs leading us to assume that the next and ultimate step will be a world overrun by dinosaurs, a world where potentially humanity is struggling to survive. Whilst Jurassic World Dominion does present a world where dinosaurs and humanity co-exist on the planet, this presentation doesn't necessarily give us a movie about that.What we actually get is yet another movie half set within a secure compound where for a variety of reasons its integrity begins to break down and the obvious predictable problems and set pieces occurs and half a semi Indiana Jones style globetrotting adventure. This is set alongside a story of the dangers and potential evolution of genetic modifications that will either kill or save the planet/humanity.The effects and visuals are mostly incredible, which is what you would expect from a massive blockbuster. And it does feel like a blockbuster in terms of size and scale of pretty much everything that you see. The run time is the best part of 2 and half hours and whilst the first third is rather slow it does lend itself to what you presume they were trying to achieve; an epic final chapter, even if they fall short of the mark on that.There are a lot of odd things that you can overlook merely on the grounds of it being a Hollywood movie, such as Chris Pratt's character having the strength to be able to lasso and restrain a dinosaur five to ten times the size of himself that had been running most likely over 70mph, but one of things i felt was most odd was Dr Wu. It's essentially a completely different character in Jurassic World Dominion and whilst i can appreciate a character can have different motivations from one movie to the next (or turn over a new leaf so the speak) it's almost as if they gave the guy a sedative before filming.I got to the end and i was expecting something else to happen before the credits and I think that's the best way to sum up this movie. Ultimately unsatisfying and not fitting as a final instalment and i suspect the filmmakers will look back at this in the future and feel they let Michael Crichton, everyone who then created such a classic movie back in 1993 down and the fans. Such a missed opportunity.

title: Extremely disappointing
text: Two stars was me being generous and it was due to the fact I like Chris Pratt and the old school original actors who came back. Come on....that was terrible and all the actors know it. The effects were appalling, the biggest predator type t-rex is portrayed almost as blind and with the moving speed of a snail who seems to be relying on smell alone. The movement and supposedly intense scenes weren't intense at all, it just made you sigh with absolute frustration and annoyance at how much they butchered this Jurassic Park movie and how much it wastes the viewers time. I'm quite surprised the calibre of actors who were in the film accepted to act it in to be honest it's definitely a career damaging move for them. I'm sorry if I come across as rude but wow I'm so frustrated at the film and I want my 2 hours of life back.

title: Maby.... After the first this is the best
text:
When I think of Jurassic Park film, I remember the cinematography
masterpiece of the first part that starts especially in the middle of the movie. Which was the accepted effect of a movie in the 2 previous years . (though not the impression that remains in imitation). In the Jurassic Park 1993, none of the dinosaurs change into form, but the behavior that the characters emit in front of it creates an image of them in the mind. Maybe that's why we hardly feel such a void. . The most powerful sequence of jurassic world 2022 is when one of the dinosaurs looks at the surface of the water,like the most powerful sequence of jurassic park 1993 when looks at the car. Here too, none of the dinosaurs transform into a form. The brilliance of Spielbergto definition the narrative covers the Plot's flaws in Jurassic Park. Of course, I think that after some time, Spielberg himself came to the conclusion to use the sense of humor, but this sense of humor or caricature or darkness or the softness aspect should be done in the form of dinosaurs. Not to make dinosaurs that look too natural and serious while deflecting a sense of humor in a different angle.The action senses related to the Clare are perfect ; the rest
are istereotype. 3/75/5.

title: Hope this isn't the end
text: Jurassic Park was a phenomenon when it came out. Even for people who weren't into dinosaurs. After first generation of actors got old but audience was infused with young, they fortunately found Chris Pratt. But then came Marvel\DC and all the superhero movies. What seemed like amazing visual effects in 90s in Jurassic Park Movies now were almost nothing.The Jurassic Park films held on because of storytelling and character chemistry. But in this they tried to do too much. There were way too many people in it. Nobody had enough time, even though movie is 2h15m.The main threat in the movie is still very novel and correct. But even pursuing fixing that threat had to put on the back burner because otherwise big dinosaurs won't have time in addition to actors.Perhaps they will learn the lesson and have better focus next time unless this one has killed franchise.Should have been 5 but 6 just because they didn't copy paste background music that has become so ubiquitous in superhero\creature\fantasy movies that you would skip a movie just by that criteria alone in trailer.

title: Sharknado has a more coherent plot
text: I am still watching Dominion as I write this. I have thought of signing up to IMDB to review bad movies many times. Many, many times. This is the one that has tipped me over the edge.It is really bad. Bad acting, bad editing and above and beyond all, a terrible, terrible plot.It feels like we are watching a Scary Movie version of Jurassic Park.I spent twenty minutes trying to accept a scenario where some Raptors could track their prey by scent, once it was targeted with a laser pointer. Really. Really?We are currently in a cave that feels like Sam Neil and Laura Dern have taken acid and stumbled into an amusement park. We, the audience, can see how ridiculous it looks, but they are totally terrified.The fact that they have had several years to come up with the story and this is the result, is mind blowing. Soulless, sprawling, disjointed, with the dinosaurs as an afterthought.I want to extinct myself after watching it.

title: Worst jurassic movie
text: Bad acting. Bad script. Bad everything. Even the editing was bad. One scene chris pratt was doing his stupid hand up thing that he keeps doing and it cuts for one second when it comes back his hand is down and has a different facial expression. Save yourself the time and don't bother watch.

First let me say don't hate me or bully me for MY opinion on this movie.Ok if I'm being honest I like this movie, now it's not the best and I don't think this was the best way to end the Jurassic franchise.Like many people have said it was predictable and I agree and I also found it cheesy at some parts. Also it seemed like they focused more on the characters and not the dinosaurs.I've seen a lot of reviews about people saying that the dinosaurs are not accurate and the movie was trash. 1. It's a Hollywood movie, none of the dinosaurs are accurate (nothing in Hollywood movies are accurate) and the things they are doing are not accurate either. 2. This movie started filming during covid so they had some complications.Being a big Jurassic fan it hurts me to see people talking trash about this movie, but I can agree with some of the things they are pointing out. I would definitely watch it more than once but not as much as I do the other movies .

title: Cash grab from a franchise that has overstayed its welcome
text: Formulaic, middling action and acting, predictable, remarkably dull for a movie with so much action. Even the plot looks like that of a half-baked B-MovieI spent most of the movie hoping the dinosaurs caught the "heroes" so the movie could end.Still, I think I might have caught up a little on sleep.

title: Terrible first half but great second half !
text: Jurassic world Doninion is the 6th entry in the Jurassic park franchise. The concept of the movie is that since the last movie dinosaurs have escaped around the world and are invading all life on planet earth . So I'm a a really big fan of these movies and I like most of them Though this one I didn't like that much. The first hour was dull and boring and had nothing special to it it was just another Jurassic park film adding nothing to the table . It was in my opinion extremely boring . When it comes to the second hour I enjoyed it way more because of the biosyn corporate stuff. I usually really enjoy this type of corporate secret bad guy stuff in movies and I very well enjoyed it with this . That was definitely the highlight of the film for me. The 6th and final movie of the Jurassic park franchise is in my opinion Not such a great conclusion to the long and beloved franchise . Even though the movie has its moments , Jurassic world dominion falls to be the weakest entry in the franchise . I give it a 6/10 (Mediocre)

title: JP6
text: Fallen Kingdom has the advantage of being underwhelming, but forgettable. Dominion? Dominion was notably bad. In a desperate bid to bring weight and legitimacy to a bungling franchise reboot it proceeds to trip all over itself and ends up as little more than a dull disaster. In a reach for originality, we are presented with an evil, vaguely Jobs-like CEO who seems to be either flirting with mental health issues or is just very badly acted. The fact that I can't be sure does imply the latter though. Fortunately though, 30 years and 6 films later, we finally have the ultimate creation of the Jurassic project. Bugs. Lord knows, when I turn on a Jurassic Park movie, I want to see our heroes contending with an insect infestation and some absurd corporate plot. This feels like someone pitched a movie to the studio, didn't have the juice to get it approved on their own and some producer team somewhere decided to warp it into a Jurassic Park movie and it isn't a good fit.

title: Nostalgic
text: For me it was a brilliant movie, grew up watching Jurassic park over and over. So many throwbacks to the original movies. I thought it was beautifully made. Colin Trevorrow has done so well with these trilogy's. For me I'm proud.

title: Such a waste
text: I've watched all the previous movies. Each one had either enthralling action, good storyline or both going for them. This one has neither. That evil businessman looking for profits above else plot line has been used since eternity. And the Dino scenes were just sprinkled here and there just for the sake of it. Waste of time and money.

title: Just another Jurassic movie with more dinosaurs.
text: The latest Jurassic world has nothing new to offer other than showcasing a couple of new varieties of dinosaurs.Story was flat, some cool actions from Chris Prat and that's the only high point of the movie.It's not worth watching in the movie theaters. Hope this is the last Jurassic movie because of inability of script writers to come up with a new story.

title: What Are You Expecting?
text: The writing on the wall is pretty clear these days. The few remaining "Hollywood" movie studios are clutching desperately to their intellectual properties, gorging a weak script with hundreds of millions of dollars and relying heavily on their audience's nostalgia for happier times. All in order to get a billion dollar payout at the box office. Are you expecting something different when siting down to watch Jurassic World: Dominion?The answer is, or rather should be, no.The difference this time. Dino fights. See the matinee, so your 2+ hours of escapist fun doesn't cost more than it should and enjoy the show like I did and move on with your life. Pretty simple.

title: Shockingly bad!
text: Bad plot (done a million of times), replay or the same Jurrasic park tropes and a screaming girl. Seriously ...? The plot is unhinged and considering the actors involv d, would've expected more. The direction is also terrible, as welk as the acting is way below par.And then there's just stupidity.Honestly, after so many Jurrasic Park movies your would have thought they would be able to come up with a good closure, but this tops the previous one as being silly and predictable. Time to close this chapter and move on to a new premise, because they don't seem to be able to write anything original for this one.Not worth the time.

title: Jurassic World 3 - A very, very average sequel that plays it safe
text: "Jurassic World Dominion" is the third and (hopefully) the last entry in the Jurassic World trilogy. It's safe to say the franchise has run out of steam at this point and arguably, it's been the case with all Jurassic Park/Jurassic World sequels since "The Lost World." At the very least, I anticipated that "Dominion" would surpass the mediocrity of "Fallen Kingdom" but somehow, "Dominion" wound up being even more convoluted and messy than Fallen Kingdom.To sum it up, Dominion many problems including a rushed script, too many subplots, disposable characters and a very bland, forgettable villain. One of the movie's biggest draws was returning characters from the first "Jurassic Park", Alan Grant, Ellie Sattler and Ian Malcolm, but even the reunion of the original cast members doesn't save "Dominion" from being an incredibly bland entry in the JW franchise, although admittedly I was happy to see Jeff Goldblum receive more screentime where he gets to deliver some genuinely funny lines. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said about the rest of the characters who feel underdeveloped and underused throughout the film despite a few moments where the character dynamic between the old and new characters was actually decent. If only the script was better then "Dominion" could've done a better job of bridging together the two franchises, Jurassic Park and Jurassic World" and its characters and brought a satisfying close to the series.Overall, "Jurassic Park Dominion" is a sequel that plays it safe by relying on fan service and even toning down the violence in an effort to make the film more family-friendly than its predecessors as there's hardly much blood spilled in the movie. Granted, Jurassic Park/World has always been a PG-13 franchise that doesn't rely heavily on gore although the franchise still didn't shy away from depicting gruesome dinosaur kills. In spite of the above, Dominion, which features dinosaurs roaming around on a global scale, somehow manages to be even more tame than the previous JP/JW films where it contains fewer dinosaur kills and violence. All of the above contribute to "Dominion" being a very average, by-the-numbers sequel and a good indicator that the dino franchise has completely run out of steam at this point and probably should remain extinct.

title: Very eh...
text: + Some new dinosaurs which are more realistic.+ That one creepy-esque scene with one of the new dinosaurs.

title: Rent as a B movie and you won't be disappointed
text: As a sci fi B movie with a special effects budget the size of a Giganotosaurus it is pretty cool. I enjoyed the crazy dino motorbike chase scenes they are technically quite brilliant. We cheered on the feathery dinos although this all seems so ridiculous in the cold climate depicted. The lack of direction of the cast is laugh out load funny but the real pain is the absence of any credible storyline. How can a movie franchise with a budget of this size end up with writing as empty as this? We deserve better. But it still enjoyable if you love your Jurassic scaly craziness. Crack open a beer and have fun with it as it must surely be the last one.

title: "Dumbing" down the franchise to make it kid friendly was a major disservice.
text: Watched JWD last night and I did not enjoy it. The dinosaurs are so humanized it does not seem real. If I wanted to watch a movie about a girl being kidnapped I would have watched Taken or something similar. Too many main characters in this movie and it is all about them and a bunch of bugs...the dinosaurs just happen to be there. Bring back the animatronics and bring back the fear. The scenes in the original and 2nd movie gave you chills and had you on the edge of your seat. Very very disappointed in the last 3 movies.

title: Loved it
text: I see a lot of bad reviews but if you loved the Jurassic park movies you will love this. There is a lot of nostalgia in this movie. I thought it was great how they worked the original cast into the new movie. Also, there was a lot of cameos from previous cast members. Was it my favorite Jurassic park movie? No, I like both originals (Jurassic world and Jurassic Park) the best. But, I thought this was much better than Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom. Don't go by the bad reviews if you like the Jurassic movies you will love this.

title: Decent enough for a one time watch
text: I went in hoping dearly for a perfect conclusion to the Jurassic franchise. The original Jurassic Park is one of my absolute favorite movies that I have seen so many times that I have it pretty much memorized. It was so far ahead of its time and still lives up to today. It is such an amazing classic. And this 'finale' didn't do it justice.But it wasn't horrible either. It was decent enough to still have me waiting to see what comes next. There were plenty of moment that were cringe. The story wasn't written very well. A lot of it was predictable. And too much reliance on nostalgia. Although I loved seeing Dr. Grant and my dear Dr. Sattler welcomed back to the Jurassic franchise, their roles in this movie didn't do their characters justice either. Still there were a few parts I did enjoy and I didn't necessarily hate anything. It just isn't very rewatchable and a lot of parts were unnecessary.Also I was mainly excited to see Blue and her baby but there just wasn't enough of them which left me disappointed. I did like that they explored Maisie's character a bit more but she honestly got pretty annoying at times. It mostly felt like they were trying too hard to do fan service and stuffed too much of it into the movie that they neglected creating a compelling story overall.I love my dinos though so I was still happy to see them again and some of the visuals were beautiful. So I am glad I saw it on the big screen instead of waiting for it to be released like some people I know plan to do. I just wish they had put more effort into the storyline. I guess like the first trilogy where I pretend the sequels don't exist, I'll have to do the same here and pretend Fallen Kingdom and Dominion don't exist so I can continue to enjoy Jurassic World which I do like even if it it doesn't match the perfection of the original Jurassic Park.

title: CONFUSING
text: The CGI, SFX and VFX are all good. Trust me, its all amazing. I love the cinematic, that was awesome. But not for the storyline who is 'weird' and confusing.

title: Just like the dinosaurs, these movies should go extinct.
text: Even if I wanted to, I could not spoil the plot of this movie.Because it doesn't seem to have any.The motivations of the "vilain" are extremely unclear. What EXACTLY does he want-no idea, why does he want it-no idea.And this puts the protagonists of the movie in a very reactionary state. They are not doing things because they want to, they are simply reacting to the situation in order to get through the scene.But the worst part is that they somehow managed to make the dinosaurs boring and unengaging. They are more like a moving prop than an important part of the story.

title: Average and too long
text: I managed to see all of the jurassic movies at the cinema and had my favourites. First Spielberg film was favourite and then the third one followed by the second. I found jurassic world part 1 enjoyable enough. Didn't really stretch the story but it was fine. Second was ok but lost its way around the midpoint and to the end. This new one I credit with attempting to find a new variant to the story but in the end, where can it really go? But back to the same tried and tested formula of the other five. After all, it is a dinosaur movie! The action was routine, story pretty basic and too many holes where you know it doesn't make sense that governments etc would not be aware etc. Effects were great but in the end this is a by the numbers plot and the cast are wasted with standard dialogue. I got bored at about the half way point and that stayed with me until the end. Not awful but not great either. Great effects wasted on an uninspired script.

title: Declining francize ...
text: This movie reminds you that the original Jurassic Park is such a classic in _every_ aspect! All the subsequent movies in this francize are of much lesser quality in a declining matter. They lack story and (believable) suspense. Sure the CGI is incredible. It seems that the effects, the constant running/racing/chasing around and screaming has to compensate for the lack of everything else. But that goes for more Hollywoord movies nowadays ... Story is totally predictable. This movie doesn't bring anything new on the table, it all has been done before in the previous movies in this francize. Everything in this movie is predictable if you now the format of current days Hollywoord action movies. You know when the action starts and stops. How it goes. Who wins or loses. Etc.Acting is mediocre and lacks believable emotion for the most part. Despite they brought back the original cast for parts of the movie. To be honest that was the only thing that convinced me to watch this movie. Hope that it would bring something back of that original movie. But it didn't ...If you really want to enjoy yourself watching a great movie, go watch Jurassic Park. The original.

title: Awful Movie
text: I would not waste my time watching this movie. Poor Acting, Lack of any dinosaurs, poor storyline and puts you into a mental state of ' when does this film end, I have better things to do ', ironically.I would certainly classify this movie as a B Movie. It is not worth paying a ticket for this abysmal, poor excuse for a movie, movie. Trust me, you will be wasting your time.The reason this movie is so bad is, I suspect, economics was the main basis for the production of such rubbish. If the movie was actually based on dinosaurs, then this movie shows the smallest amount of time showing them. It was mostly closeup shots of the actors than anything else.The acting is robotic, poor and very amarteurist. It is a shame Jurassic Park movies have ended (based on this poor performance) the way it has with this pile of s***.

title: Fan service conclusion
text: A lot of action, Easter eggs, nostalgia characters and a epic conclusion to one of the most memoriable movies of the history.It's a great blockbuster.

title: Waste off time
text: I wouldn't pay a buck to see this. Bad bad bad. Not a movie just spot and nostalgia. They had a peice from the original movie to make it all make sense the Barbosal shaving cream can. But they used that as a peice of Nostalgia as well or maybe for the next bad movie in this franchise.

title: Oh SO predictable
text: It's a big screen movie - but only for the special effects. There were so many times when a scene left me thinking that they had just resurrected yet another scene from a previous movie. Glad it's the last in the franchise.

title: Chris Pratt reprises his role as a stop sign with a knife
text: If you like recalling your knowledge of dinosaur names with characters on the big screen then this movie is for you.This movie has more dinosaurs than Taylor Swift has songs about ex-boyfriends. Also, the amount of dinosaur character development was off the charts. It's about time we get to know why the T-Rex is so angry.There is dinosaur violence. There are old dinosaur grudges that end in epic dinosaurs battles...(#GodzillaVibes). There are promises kept to dinosaurs and moments of sweet dinosaur gratitude. And...I'm pretty sure that gigantosaurus represented toxic masculinity.Overall, I think this is a very dinosaur-positive movie. I personally would have loved to see more screen time with dinosaurs covered in feathers but you can't always get what you want. 7/10.

title: Same old dinosaurs and actors!
text: Ok, but not much new! Same old evil genius madman trying to take over the world! Good cinematography and decent acting but probably the last movie for this franchise ..... no need to go on!

title: It's not terrible
text: After reading the reviews I really didn't want to spend to go to the cinema, but we had promised my daughter, so off we went. It really isn't that bad. It was watchable and was a decent way to spend a Sunday afternoon. I do think that it's good there won't be any more and perhaps they pushed their luck a tad too far, but if you want something that's not boring and will pass the time. Have a look.

title: So preoccupied with wether or not they could, they didn't stop to think if they should.
text:
Out of all the films that have came out this year so far, this is by far the worst. It doesn't have anything to it, it's just so surface level and hollow that you can't help but not care about what's happening, hell I even started getting sleepy watching it.The Good:
Not much unfortunately which is a real shame as they had such a great concept of dinosaurs in the real world and did absolutely nothing with it. However I will say that the CGI and practical effects are really good and so are lots of the dinosaurs designs.The Bad:
There is a lot wrong with the script. For me one of the biggest things is that the movie doesn't seem to care about dinosaurs in the slightest. The film is so incredible unfocused and bland that you just don't care. The returning OG's aren't interesting and don't really feel like the same characters with the exception of Ian Malcom. Hollywood is so saturated with nostalgia bait and it's rarely actually good. Not to mention in previous Jurassic films they have a clear indication of who the big bad final boss dinosaurs is but in this one who have barely any clue until it appears for the final fight. Not to mention the final fight lasts about a minute and nothing happens in it, there is no stakes or intensity amplified by the fact that you don't care. And also lots of the cool new dinosaurs are in the film for about a minute before they disappear and we never see them again.This film is not one I would recommend and is definitely not worth your time, money or attention. Anything this film does, any other Jurassic film does better.

title: I am so happy. Thankyou!
text: I've loved this ranch use for 30 years, and it's something I share with my son.Just watched it and it was everything I wanted and more. Can't wait to take my son now!

title: It didn't impress but it didn't disappoint
text: I liked the previous two episodes. I didn't have any expectations for them and I wasn't thrilled with them either, but they didn't disappoint either. The same is true for me with Jurassic World Dominion where the film neither surprised nor disappointed me. It was such a surefire good movie for me. Story-wise, fine, but nothing great. Of course, the action scenes pulled it off, which is a given for this franchise. On the one hand, it was nice to see old Jurassic Park characters return. Nothing epic or breathtaking for me. It was just good, like the whole movie. I enjoyed the final battle, although I thought it could have been a bit longer. But maybe there would have been too much action. Either way, a good movie for me. What the fans of the franchise think of it I don't know, but a friend of mine who is a fan had the same opinion, saying that it is a good movie and nothing more, and even as a non-fan I feel the same way. A good movie that I can recommend. It didn't impress but it didn't disappoint.

title: Decent effects and nice to see the gang back together but....
text: Can we please get some better writing here. Sorry, but this is a 4 outta 10 "turn your brain off monster / adventure flick". I didn't hate it, but I also won't remember it or re-watch it. It's..."fine".

title: Great action but preachy
text: Great action, good acting but preachy. Preachy in the beginning, then in the middle and finally in the ending. In fact the ending / epilogue comes across as edited in to make sure the preaching sinks in. Too bad. Without its sermonizing I would give a 9 rather than 6.

title: A fun but somewhat rushed end to the story
text: Chris Pratt does Jedi mind tricks on dinosaurs, Jeff Goldblum is quirky, eccentric dino park director is evil and nostalgia is one powerful tool.That's essentially the plot and it sort of works.This movie is for the fans, clearly.The amount of nods, hat tips and straight up re-shoots of events from previous films is astonishing and for the fan of the series it's scratches an itch I didn't know I had.The story is fairly straightforward, but some plot lines are seemingly just thrown in there to solve a problem on the spot with no further explanation.But, we didn't see this movie for the plot, luckily.All in all it's a fun film, albeit somewhat confusing like, I would've liked to know more about the Maisie Lockwood story.We quickly get a couple of lines in there explaining the outline, not too many details and then we're off to the races.I just wished the film took it's time.It's a movie for Jurassic Park and Jurassic World fans that's also enjoyable if you just want to see dinos running after people who look scared.

title: Doesn't feel like a JP film at all...
text: I felt like this film used the James Bond/Indiana Jones style for the story line. Throw some dinosaurs in late in the film and it still didn't feel like the JP movies we grew to love. I know you can't keep flogging a dead horse but this was a tad disappointing.

title: It was bad
text: After the lead that they gave on fallen kingdom i was super excited for this one but after watching it, it was total disappointment, the lead was pointless, the story is same as the last 2 parts, same genetic varient thing, the whole movie felt like watching the last 2 parts, jurassic world and fallen kingdom both were ok and enjoyable but this one is like the worst of them, they tried so many things but everything was a failure like introducing the old characters, the story and action scenes were completely predictable and it doesnt felt like watching a dinosaur movie, overall its one of the worst jurassic universe. Hollywood is going downhill at this point.

title: Chris Pratt has ruined the franchise for me.
text: Chris Pratt has really ruined the Jurassic Park franchise for me. I just can't watch his character anymore. I am so rooting for the dinosaurs to eat him in his scenes.

title: Great Movie!
text: I was afraid to go watch it due to the bad reviews, but I am glad I did! There was definitely a plot, lots of intense scenes, and great humor by Ian Malcolm! If you are on the fence, go watch it! I am glad I did! Great night out!

title: Oh dear
text: Oh dear. The reviews are right. Too long by at least 30mins, this is an overblown mess from start to finish. The old crew are shoehorned in, while Pratt and BDH reliably perform their usual schtick. Has one of the best action sequences in the entire franchise, and copious 1993 Easter Eggs. Some good moments, and interesting ideas, but very loud. It's quiet time now. 6/10.

title: Kept Falling Asleep...
text: I was looking forward to seeing what they said would be the final Jurassic series movie ever. Luckily, I waited to watch this at home. I kept falling asleep. During a Jurassic Park giant dinosaur movie. I would wake myself up, run it back to where I thought I had seen it and then...zzz... again, and again. Fianlly I would up to see Sam Neil and Ellie kissing. I thought that was cute and then..zzz... No more tries.

title: Entertaining but gave me too much existential dread
text: Enjoyed the movie and was entertained throughout. However it did make me contemplate my place in the world and my existence a little too much for a mediocre movie. Also Jurassic world 2 bad.

title: Not the best of the Franchise.
text: Didn't feel like a conclusion at all. Probably we'll be seeing more of it in the future but in my opinion this should be the end of the road for this franchise and it has been a quite underwhelming one for sure. Though it was much much better than the previous instalment but it still fell short of expectations.I wanted more screen time of the OG cast but felt like they were forced into this movie.I wish Steven Spielberg provided us with an epic conclusion to the Jurassic era but it wasn't to be. Colin trevorrow isn't a bad director but the scriptwriting has let it down !

title: Just as bad as Fallen Kingdom.
text: I do praise Dominion for utilising the different species of dinosaurs to present the characters with unique threats. It kept the action diverse enough to not grow tiresome.Also, with a cast this stacked, it goes without saying that the performers all give it their all and give some charisma that this script does not deserve.This is where my positives end, because this has an incredibly dumb, contrived screenplay, much like other big films I've seen in recent blockbuster memory.This third film does not feel like the conclusion to a trilogy, let alone a franchise. It exist just so that there can actually BE a trilogy. There is no attempt to provide payoff to anything that was established in previous films, or even in this film.The opening sequence gives us a newscaster voiceover giving us a bunch of information we already knew, then we are subjected to over two hours of people running around either performing Macguffin fetch quests or fleeing from dinosaurs. Finally, we get another news voiceover at the end of the movie that wraps up all the conflict and loose ends with a nice pretty bow.I feel sick for these actors, knowing that their talent was wasted on such thankless roles. None of them actually develop in any substantial way or even contribute to the plot. In fact, most of them don't even need to be in the movie.Half the cast is only here for nostalgia porn, and the entire cast just plays the same role of "person who runs around and occasionally spouts expository dialogue." It's embarrassing. Even the villain is just "evil Steve Jobs," another uninspired addition.Lastly, this movie promoted itself on the concept of "DINOSAURS ARE ON THE MAINLAND NOW!!!" This was such a false advertising gimmick and I feel insulted.We really never see any sort of consequences of dinosaurs being integrated into the world. 90% of the movie takes place on a corporate compound, and it's even more boring than the mansion in the last movie.This is a movie that is a product; it banks on the popularity of its brand name and doesn't actually have any character, ideas, themes, or even set pieces that feel unique or even add up to make a story.The more I think about it, the more I hate it.Shameless.

title: A Bad Movie
text: I'm just going to say this. I don't think this movie is as bad as some people say it is.Let's get to the good things first, which are few in between. 1) The movie has good and, at times, rather creative action that really utilizes the objects and even dinosaurs in their surroundings. 2) It has great visuals. Out of all the Jurassic movies, this one is undoubtedly the most impressive in terms of visuals. 3) Gives you a plethora of different dinosaurs, and while I do think some of them are unnecessarily put into this movie, if you could ignore that then the variety of dinosaurs would certainly be something you enjoy.That's where the good things end. Everything else about this movie is horrible.The plot is predictable, stupid, and inconsistent. The returning characters provide nothing interesting to the table besides being nostalgia bait. When it's not about action, the movie is a bore to watch. A certain character in the movie gets redeemed in the movie just because he feels guilty for what he did. The resolution at the end is especially strange because for the entire length of the movie, there was nothing that could have possibly made that ending.The characters could use the Force because Chris Pratt's character could use the hand thing on literally any dinosaur and somehow stop it for a moment, not to mention how he seems to even be physically stronger than some of the dinosaurs here - on second thought, that's actually quite funny.It does provide an interesting question about identity with the clone girl from the previous movie, if you even remember her, but the execution makes it wasted potential.Overall, while I don't think it's as bad as I've seen some people describe it, it's certainly nothing good either.

title: May Be the Worst in the Series
text: I watched this movie expecting it to be bad, but at least better than the fallen kingdom. I was wrong. This is even worse. It relies too much on nostalgia and callbacks to the original Jurassic Park, but it just fails. The storyline is a mess, the villain is wayyy boring, and the dinosaurs are just there because it's a Jurassic movie, nothing else. Kids may love it, but anyone expecting something more will be disappointed.

title: Amazing for what it is
text: This is the first real Jurassic Park (World) movie in ages. Far superior to Jurassic Park 3 in every way, and completely better than anything the Jurassic World franchise has produced yet. Not only does it bring back the original crew, but this movie is clever, fun, scary and exciting. If I had to choose one thing to dislike about this movie, it would only be that it's a hyper simplistic plot. But that's not the point of the film. The purpose of this movie is to wrap up the Jurassic World and Park franchise, and it does it perfectly. Yes, the story itself isn't anything too impressive, but it's about as simplistic and complex as the original Jurassic Park, which is what you want in a dinosaur movie. It's not about some evil hybrid serial killer dinosaur, or some weird special agent hybrid dinosaur; it's a bit like a heist film with plenty of dinosaurs all throughout. The CGI is amazing, the acting is great, and the variety of creature is immense. But the best two things about this movie are the themes and stunning cinematography. The action scenes are jam packed with motion and power, without being overwhelming, and the dinosaurs are stunning and beautiful. Most scenes incorporating them are immaculate, visual, artistic, and inspiring. Best of all this movie has humor and horror. The funny bits are not the stupid slap stick childish jokes of the last three movies. These little humourous cues are organic and fun, mostly made by Ian Malcolm, which fits his character. No more mind numbing half winded jokes that are just randomly placed in the movie for a cheap laugh. That being said, the horror aspect of the movie was intense. Plenty of scary scenes to keep you on your toes; big vicious frightening dinosaurs, and gruesome death scenes akin to the first and second Park (Not World) movies. Just enough violence, just enough horror, and just enough joy. There are also plenty of call backs to the earlier films, and some retconning which helps bring certain character development points together. All in all, it was an amazing movie and worthy of it's title. GO SEE IT.

title: Delivers the prehistoric mayhem and dinosaur action as expected.
text: Ludicrous plot aside, I had a good time with this sequel being touted as the 'epic finale' for the now 29 year old movie franchise. Though I can see them doing more since it will probably make a lot of money.It's cool seeing the original cast team up with the younger crew. Pratt and Howard are decent but newcomer DeWanda Wise comes close to stealing the show as a badass pilot. She's tough and charming in a cocksure fashion that lead star Chris Pratt has nailed down to a tee. Campbell Scott is pretty bad as an evil tech CEO though.It's heartwarming to see Sam Neill and Laura Dern reprise their roles again as Alan Grant and Ellie Sattler. Although Jeff Goldblum is more fun to watch as Ian Malcolm again and he has the best one-liners.Compared to the first two JW movies, one thing I appreciate about DOMINION is that it embraces its absurdness with gusto. For better or worse. There's a subplot with mutant locusts that's pretty stupid and it feels like it belongs in a different movie. The bulk of the story is essentially a rescue mission which feels more in the vein of earlier movies, particularly The Lost World or Jurassic Park 3.Of course any of the stuff that involved dinosaurs directly was cool as hell. Seeing a black market where evil mercenaries sell dinos instead of drugs or guns was pretty cool. The raptor motorcycle chase is an awesome action scene. There's an early chase scene involving triceratops that's neat as well.In terms of technical prowess, this installment has the best looking dinosaurs out of the Jurassic World trilogy. There are some shots where the CGI for the primeval beasts looks phenomenal. And you can see there's a concentrated effort to rely more on practical effects and animatronic models.The finale takes place in a park full of escaped dinosaurs once more but there's more variety to the prehistoric wildlife this time. There's feathered raptors that can swim, a giant dino with massive claws named Therizinosaurus, the classic T-Rex, an aggressive rival named the Giganotosaurus, and plus a lot of angry pterosaurs the size of airplanes.At being number six in the franchise, there are some new ideas that lend themselves for cool action scenes and dangerous predicaments. As for the science fiction elements, it's practically a cartoon at this point. Giant bugs and human cloning, oh my. But it's hard not to enjoy seeing a plane taken out by a giant pterosaur or watching a mosasaur sink a fishing boat.

title: Jurassic World: Dumbminion
text: So disappointed it's not even funny. I don't see how they can fail this hard. It's like they tried to write a bad movie. So so sad. Only getting two stars because the dinosaurs looked pretty good.

title: Not as bad as the critics say ...
text: My review of "Jurassic World: Dominion." It was ... okay. Not as bad as the critics say, but not a masterpiece, either. It was fun. Unlike last year's "Ghostbusters" where the originals got about 10 minutes of screen time. The three original JP characters were a major part of this storyline. Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum are still "hot" for 70-somethings, but Laura Dern has injected so much plastic into her face that she is absolutely unrecognizable! And while 10 or 15 years ago I would have rolled my eyes at the "easy villain" being Big Bio, we all know that's absolutely TRUE now. It was a nice wrap-up with a nice homage to its beginnings. But I'd either see it on your movie theatre's cheap day, like I did, or wait for it to be available for home viewing. Not sure it's worth FULL price admission.

title: Fun, but flawed thrills
text:
Ladies and gentlemen, it's here.The finale of the entire Jurassic series has finally arrived in theatres.Jurassic World: Dominion is a fun, thrilling action adventure story with dinosaurs. This film is filled with the typical dinosaur action sequences, a couple of which can feel indicative of Jason Bourne and Indiana Jones action scenes.Bringing back the original three was a stroke of genius and I appreciated how they fit them into the plot without them feeling shoehorned in.Where this movie fails for me was the flimsy plot.If you start to think, there are lots of coincidences and inconsistencies that push the plot forward.This film is not smartly written like some blockbusters today. It is nowhere near as smart as the original film.This film promised a story about dinosaurs in the real world, but instead it uses that as a catalyst for a story that has nothing to do with them being out in the real world. I feel as though this story could have been told if the cliffhanger from Fallen Kingdom never even happened.Beyond that, if this film was trying to produce a satisfying conclusion to each trilogy's story it horrendously failed. If it was simply trying to get me to smile really quick at seeing the original cast again, it succeeded spectacularly.In conclusion, this film is a one-watch scenario for me. It delivers the thrills of dinosaur action sequences and the joy of seeing my childhood heroes back on the screen. However, it did not fully deliver on the promise of a plot based around dinosaurs in the wild and it did not deliver the proper conclusion for the characters we've been following.The cast ranking
Laura Dern
Sam Neill
Jeff Goldblum
DeWanda Wise
Campbell Scott
Bryce Dallas Howard
Chris Pratt
Isabella SermonChris Pratt is my favorite actor, but I was so disappointed with how little the script gave him to work with.If you're expecting a ton of dino action sequences, this is the film for you.
