If you're expecting a smartly written, Endgame-level conclusion to decades of story, just rewatch Endgame.

title: The fall of a great franchise
text: Went to see it last night. Walked out after 20-25min. Yes. Waisted my money but just couldn't get into it. What a shame, it was such a great franchise. I must say, the CGI was horrible! I just can't stomach another "global warming" plot, how boring.

title: Gotta update the plot
text:
They need to rethink the plot. It's so underwhelming and convoluted all at once. The whole essence of the franchise it's not up to date to the Dinosaur facts in 2022. Please update the velociraptor name to Deinonychus, Dimetrodon was not a dinosaur and was still featured (at least they should've talked about it), Therizinosaurus stabbing the Giganotosaurus was a long reach, very unrealistic....also, most Dinos should've got updated to their original feathered versions...
The hand thing is tired. Cut it out for once.

title: Slow and boring
text: Wow what a disappointment this film was. The most boring, long, slow and plotless story. I was counting minutes for it to be done. No comedy, no dino actions, too much talking. Pointless plot. Don't waste your money!!!

title: Best of the World Trilogy
text: Two genetics story, one real (a agri-genetics company creating pest only they can prevent) one fake (dinosaurs). Couple with team Park investigating the malfeasances joining team World attempting to rejoin their family.This one has little love. People tend to rate it as the worst Jurassic film. I'd argue this one actually has a more characterization than most, and is attempting to tell a story that's more than just dinosaurs chasing and eating people.Honestly, with these that's all I'm expecting. Dinosaurs chasing people. Perhaps a trite love interests and message about working as a group leads to success. If that's all I get from Jurassic Park, it's expected.Likewise, teams of Disney paid critics tend to trash anything that's not owned by Disney. So criticisms from critics responding to a medium nearly dead by streamers not only makes me roll my eyes, but also extend a message to New Yorker, Times, Chicago Tribune critics that they're cool with remakes of Toy Story from 1995 to resent, 20 remakes of Iron Man, and sequel trilogy that copied the original to the point it lost its fans. (This paragraph is to discredit critics)Dominion is the best of the Jurassic World movies. The first was a remake of Jurassic Park but bigger, Fallen Kingdom went all sci network original movie. Compare to the Park trilogy 1-2 are great, but 3 has Pterodactyls so... lolJust finished watching it on Peacock. Loved it. Had a lot of fun.

title: Don't bother
text: The end of fallen kingdom offered an interesting premise to the concluding chapter of the new Jurassic Park trilogy ( an unnecessary trilogy in my opinion) but I thought the direction offered some hope. Sadly not.It was like they forgot the ending of fallen kingdom and instead opted for a complete rehash of Jurassic Park 1 and 2. The plot was meh, the scripting was dire, the wokeness cribgeworthy.In the 1st Jurassic Park movies (chiefly 1 and 2) they were more like psychological horror movies with dinosaurs. The dinosaurs were genuinely petrifying, the T really and velociraptors gave me nightmares. They were pure killers devoid of emotion. They did not have human traits attached to them and the SFX brought a real sense of realism to the movie.In the new trilogy we see too much of the dinosaurs, they've been given a friendly persona and had humanistic qualities attached to them, and instead of we need to get put of here and leave them alone, we now have this sense of hippy we must protect them at all costs compassion for them. It's ruined the whole ethos of lore of the originals.To sum it up it was aterrovle movie, I just wanted to get up and walk out and would of had I not paid a lot of money to see it in IMAX, don't allow yourself to get ripped of as I did. Stay well away.

title: Use Your Brain; Don't Trust These Reviewers
text: Even if you don't love this movie giving it 1-3/10 is just a joke. The movie easily tops the rest of the movies besides the first and even then sometimes surpassed it. If you like dinosaurs, intense action, funny moments, and a great cast you'll definitely enjoy this.

title: Spares no expense at dinosaur action, but falls short of its own premise
text: Jurassic World Dominion, the third entry in the Jurassic World series and sixth film in the overall franchise, unites the current and original cast together for a big symphonic finish.In the words of John Hammond, the film spares no expense at delivering spectacle and thrills. Unfortunately, Dominion buckles under its own weight from too many characters and the story ultimately falls under the law of diminishing returns from having nothing new to say.At the end of Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom, dinosaurs have been let loose and are free roaming across the Earth, living alongside humans. I was expecting Dominion to explore this fresh untapped narrative.Unfortunately, that's not the story we get. Dominion is another story of corporate greed about genetically-bred locusts that's endangering the world's food supply. Maisie Lockwood, the clone daughter of Sir Benjamin Lockwood from the previous film, may hold the key to saving the world.Imagine buying a ticket to see dinosaurs. You see the movie and you're like, "Hey man, where are my dinosaurs?" The movie goes, "Look! Locusts!"It is disappointing on some level. From the trailers, I was imagining the old and current cast teaming up, saving both humans and dinosaurs from each other across the globe, ensuring peace between the two like X-men, but with dinosaurs. "D-men", if you will. The script practically writes itself.Do not fret though. There are plenty of dinosaurs in Dominion despite not being the narrative focus. The dinosaurs are obstacles that the characters have to survive through in the film's numerous set pieces.The action is well done. The standout sequence is a Mission Impossible-like motorcycle chase with raptors through the streets of Malta. New dinosaurs also provide some nail-biting suspenseful moments.There are too many characters; that is 6 lead characters, and 5 supporting characters all fighting for screentime. The two characters that I cared about, and wished the film focused more on, were Sam Neil and Laura Dern's characters. One of the biggest disappointments in Jurassic Park 3 was learning that Alan Grant and Ellie Satler split up. Dominion attempts to mend that with a love story that it doesn't devote enough time towards.Dr. Ian Malcolm's part was disappointing. Even though he had an active role, Jeff Goldblum had nothing to react to or anything clever to say. His performance felt off as it seemed like he took an extra beat than needed.The Jurassic World films are in a repetitive story loop that the Fox's X-men franchise was once in. Similar to Magneto, Dr. Henry Wu, the true villain of the franchise, is always conveniently let go to keep the story going and for the same conflict to repeat. Dr. Wu should be branded as a known international criminal and jailed in a psychiatric ward by now for the havok he was brought in the last 3 films.Jurassic World Dominion was advertised as the end of the new trilogy. There just wasn't any finality to any of it. You'll remember the action scenes but ultimately forget what happened story-wise.

title: Really needed a sense of scale
text: I expected a bit of a generic action movie but this was pretty bland. Even worse was the directing. The other movies at least took advantage of the dinosaurs. There was very little sense of tension and immersion. The old Jurassic movies were great at this. There was also no sense of scale. King Kong and Pacific Rim perfected this. In Dominion it felt like I was watching the dinosaurs from afar, through a camera, instead of feeling like I was in the presence of massive incredible creatures. The team behind this one really played it safe, to a fault. I would say it's worth watching but go in with low expectations.

title: Hilarious
text: This movie was so far gone it was actually hysterical once we got over the "oh they don't know what they're doing with this movie" hump. I haven't giggled this much in a movie in a very long time. What were they thinking? There is so much going on and none of it makes any logical sense. Pair it with random meaningless dinosaurs for the first 40 minutes and it's just a cluster on screen. And that's when it gets really funny. Do not go into this expecting Jurassic Park, more expect a parody complete with terrible CGI for the first hour or so. My wife and I needed the laugh, did not expect it to come from this movie. Thanks, I guess?

title: Got bored halfway through
text: I usually love Jurassic World but I've only just finished the film and have already forgotten what happened. It's a forgettable film which is disappointing considering the past films.

title: Lackluster
text: Total lackluster film. It's pretty boring in parts and honestly not a lot of action. I thought there would be more Carnage with a name like Dominion in the title.

title: The Best Comedy of 2022
text: Now you may see the 3/10 rating and assume I didn't enjoy Jurassic Park 6: The Rise of Allen Grant, but I loved it. It was big, stupid and silly and it as hilarious. There is one scene where Jeff Goldblum picks up a flaming stick and thrusts it down a massive dino's mouth, only for the dinosaur to start breathing fire. Now if you think I'm lying, go see the movie yourself. It's without a doubt so bad it's good and gets a recommendation from me. The one complaint I have is the length. Two and a half hours is long for any movie, especially a terrible one. But if you've got three hours to kill and enjoy stupid schlock, then you'll enjoy yourself.

title: Hoe to destroy jurassic park.
text: Finally we reached the end , the worst ending to a best 1st movie in the history of dinos. This movie is defenitly the worst, the story is a disaster. The idea that life finds a way and containg the dinos is manipulated in this movie. This saga desetbes a better ending .

title: Mildly entertaining
text: The only saving grave for this movie is the cast, which do a terrific job.The script is predictable, and mixes too many genres in a confusing way. Sadly, it is also very predictable.Plenty of easter eggs, most of them far from sutil.It passed the time. I don't regret watching it. But it is not rewatch material.

title: Awful
text: It was extremely boring, very predictable. The acting was so bad. It's nothing like the past movies I would avoid this film at all costs. If you are bored and want to be even more bored then this movie is for you. Best part about the film was the end credits.

title: Ice Age: Return of the Jedi
text: I can't be the only one wondering the significance of the Chris 'Prattented' extended arm stance that almost all cast rely on to hypnotize these animals into submission. In the first movie it was somewhat believable within the context of behavioral conditioning during animal training, but now it's almost a 'thing' that every single animal regardless of specie will fall for, to give our protagonists a chance of escape.Silly moments like these are scattered throughout the film, but it's nothing new to this series. It seems like each release is more tangent from the original concept of Jurassic Park, to the point that dinosaurs have become akin to a deus-ex machina to move the plot along.Weirdly enough, i actually enjoyed this movie. The visuals were great on a big screen, and the multi generational cast interactions were somewhat refreshing from the ordinary.Definitely watch it if you're a fan of the series. Just be advised. Chris Pratt gets on a motorcycle with dinosaurs in this one too.

title: Totally awesome, yet not quite understandable storytelling.
text: The film is a bit of a mess really. The most part is the intense and scary action sequences involving the dinos, but besides that, it's not got a good villain nor a well put together storyline. I only enjoyed the action scenes of the movie, but other than that...nothing.For the JW fans that will be seeing it on opening weekend, enjoy it while you can. Because this isn't the best sequel to round off the Jurassic era.

title: Is something wrong with me?
text: I watched this movie with my family, and they liked it a lot. Me on the other hand, I slept like 2/4 of the movie, and the parts I saw were so generic, unfunny, predictable, and cheesy. So I'm actually wondering... Is something wrong with me? Why can't I enjoy the movies everyone else do.

title: A blast to watch, and a fitting series conclusion
text: Not sure why the significant amount of negative reviews for this film. Having saw every Jurassic Park/ World movies in theaters, have to disagree with the criticism completely here. Dominion was a thousand times better and more entertaining a film than Fallen Kingdom ever was (and lets not even get into JPlll). Felt like they threw everything and everyone they could at this production to go out with a bang. You have great edge-of-your-seat suspense along with epic chase scenes and a story that wraps up all the different elements of the entire series nicely. No, its not Jurassic Park, and no, not they or anyone else will ever duplicate the magic of the original. If you base every sequel to that original on the standard it set, you are doing a complete disservice to the great filmmaking and story telling a movie like Dominion is doing on its own. And yes, there are scenes that do feel reminiscent of previous installments. But when you have a series based around the same basic components, theres only so much you honestly can do. And thats where I really give the writers here credit for trying to make this as interesting and as encapsulating a picture as they managed to do. The actors were all great in their roles, and the graphics were as sharp and tight as you could ever expect. With all the negative reviews, was expecting another mess of a film like Fallen Kingdom. Some rambling nonsense like that had been that would have ended the series on a sour note. But I truly felt this film did the series the justice I only could have hoped it would. Jurassic World: Dominion was everything you could want to wrap up what has been one of the great franchises in movie history. Highly reccomend.

title: it's like watching dinosaurs eat your childhood away.
text:
I remember watching Jurassic park original. The sense of Wonder and thrill, slight horror and just overall the movie has stood the test of time. Sequels like the lost world I had a special connection too overtime and always loved, JP3 although being that movie I grew up with as a kid I knew was terrible but I did enjoy it as a kid. Growing up seeing Jurassic world come into play, it was a solid movie with a sequel following it not being such the best movie either... but when they announced they were going to release a conclusion to this new trilogy bringing back the old cast I was excited. And here it is. Jurassic World Dominion... and this movie is probably the worst Jurassic park installment ever madeJurassic park 3 was better, this movie is Terrible in a lot of directions. Not even the old cast can hold the movie, it's nice to see them in the flesh, it gave me that nostalgia feel but the purpose and story surrounding it goes nowhere. Everything that leads up to terms just happens, there's a slight twist in the movie that was nice, but just doesn't feel earned. Everything in the movie doesn't feel earned and I think that's the main problem with it. The movie just feels like it's trying to be any other bland action block buster but throwing dinosaurs in the mix... I hate to compare this to the original, but what made the original so amazing was it combined the horrors of a disaster going wrong within the action.:. The sequels have been doing it ever since as well... even the bad sequels have been using the disaster method... part 2 with dinosaurs being brought to the USA, then 3 being stuck on an island, then the remake taking things from part 1... etc etc, I understand there's only so much you can do to leach off the same storyline... and for this new one I do appreciate the new direction... but this idea that dinosaurs are just a 2nd thought of danger throughout the movie just makes me not as thrilled as I should be... the dinosaurs in the movie just feel like an afterthought or product placement for the action itself, there's no tension, there's a couple of moments that I do feel the tension but overall it's just not there....and if you're gonna sit here and say "they're dinosaurs you're not supposed to take this seriously" A good example of a movie trilogy that makes you feel the stakes at hand was Matt Reeves planet of the apes trilogy you have this planet being controlled by apes, you feel the intensity arising, you feel it all, from the tone of the film and all now sure, these are dinosaurs compared to cgi apes who are like humans, but this idea of the franchise just going full cheese is just way too pathetic, it goes overboard in this movie... I feel like I'm watching a Jurassic park fan made movie, a bunch of characters don't care about the stakes and drop terrible one liners here and there, and a lot of characters are underutilized, There's maybe about 1 or 2 moments from certain characters and it's not they they are doing a bad job, the acting is fine, but the plot and story around the entire movie just feels like a entire drag, I didn't have my sense of urgency.... one thing for sure this movie highlights that I took away from was how much power the palm of your hand can do... I mean it just does so much in this film, stops characters from dying from predators that, let's be realistic here, would kill them... but I'll take it, Owen was a trainer of raptors and I guess the technique works, not just with him but kids and newcomers alike! So power to the hand! ... action is fine I guess... but again, It just goes back to my point that it just doesn't feel earned, not even the slightest... none of it does, the entire story of a missing Dino and child just feels totally not earned. When the scene came to play into motion I was thinking to myself "this is really where this movie is headed?" I guess I just could care less about this plot narrative.The original characters also feel like a forced collision, it just feels like parts and components spread apart with characters meshed together and it's forced to work because the movie says it has to... it just doesn't lead up to anything that feels like it was meant to be earned. And then the characters from the OG surprisingly just feel way out of place in this movie, there's not enough to nibble on with grant and Sadler, they have their moments but that's just because their acting is amazing but the writing is horrendous not enough meat and potatoes for them, they have a very awkward moment towards then end that TOTALLY goes unearned in this movie. Ian Malcom tries his best to save the movie, which is what he is good at, but even he can't when the director allows almost every line he says to be almost 4th wall breaking it becomes annoying. It's almost like he's winking at the Audience 24/7 WE GET IT!!!Best way to compare this movie... it's like eating breakfast mixed with dinner... not bad on paper, and might actually be good... but when you begin to eat it you realize it's not only a odd combination of foods but the food is stale, expired and terrible all together, some burnt others undercooked... things are just awful... oh but you have a nice cup of orange juice action... and on the side with a nostalgia action figure toy that comes included...The EXECUTION of this movie leads to EXTINCTION of this franchise as we know it.I hope nobody wastes money on this, only way you can actually enjoy this movie is if you're just on your phone and notice action is about to start so you put it down and watch away... and maybe a few scenes with characters you remember based on nostalgia other than that the sum of its parts is so bland and unoriginal. I feel you can genuinely make a better direction of plot... the events leading up to them finally meeting each other isn't even earned.Pros: Action, Actors, nostalgia, effects, (I also appreciate the use of animatronics they were nice) music was okay I guess especially when they used some from the original,Cons: too long, plot, story structure, script, execution,P. S I enjoyed Jurassic world, didn't hate fallen kingdom, I did believed it was a slight step down though... but this one?!!! This is going down a step even further.JURRASIC WORLD UNIVERSE RATINGSJurassic Park 9/10
Jurassic Park: The Lost World 7.5/10
Jurassic Park 3 4.5/10
Jurassic World 6/10
Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom 5/10
Jurassic World: Dominion 3.5/10Franchise as a whole: 6/10.I rate this movie aJurASSic World: "UGH"minion / 10.

title: Repetitive Formula
text: This movie is such a nostalgic movie for us who followed this franchise since its first movie. I love the OG characters appeared here.The CGI was ok, scoring ok, tone ok, the formula? It's repetitive. Kinda predictable and boring.The star of Pratt's version is Blue. But blue has a very short screen time. The adventures in the jungle are repetitive also, met great dinosaurs, hold a breath, hiding, and screaming, but then reunited with the team, saved by T-Rex, and watch its battle. And yup, a happy ending story.Since this is their last movie of the franchise, I could say no more. But, after all, this is a good movie.

title: Incoherent legacy sequel falters
text: Where to begin? Was this sixth installment a let down on all fronts? Yes. The plot is so nonsensical and complicated that it makes the original seem like high art. The dialogue is stilted and off-putting. And you can't escape the fact the actors seem to be sleep walking their way through the movie, and who could blame them? There is not one single awe inspiring visual or moment. Just a cash grab wrapped in nostalgia and served at a dismil level. At this point, there seems absolutely no where for this series to go, except extinction.

title: Scooby-Doo with dinosaurs
text: Inconsistencies everywhere, dumb decisions being made everywhere, sequences so outrageous they must've been made for the memes. So much fan service that almost recreates the first movie shot-by-shot.Hilarously bad, to the point it actually turned out a great comedy.This franchise went extinct, got brought back, now it's time to let it rest. Please...

title: Disappointed
text: I love Chris Pratt, Jurassic parck and I've appreciated Jurassic work 1 and 2 but this movie is a joke ! No scenario, bad acting, fan service and nothing match with my expectations...Don't go watch it you will have more pleasure watching other movie from this saga even Jurassic park 3 !

title: Magic is long gone
text: The first Jurassic Park was a magical experience that benefitted from have been made at a time prior to our over exposure to CGI. When viewers saw the first movie there was a collective gasp at the sight of the dinosaurs. That magic has long gone. With the dinosaurs having become nearly cartoon in the CGI world, there is no longer an interesting story. This last movie is just an assault on the senses by noise and action, and too many scenes which have been regurgitated from of the history of the franchise.

title: A well acted but boring and uneventful piece of pointless nostalgia.
text: "Jurassic World: Dominion" is directed by "Colin Trevorrow.It stars Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Sam Niell, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum and DeWanda Wise.The final film in the Jurassic franchise finds "Owen" and "Claire" looking after "Maisie" from the dinosaurs roaming the world. Meanwhile "Alan Grant" and "Ellie Sattler" infiltrate a secure facility that holds dinosaurs to uncover its dark secrets.I love the first two "Jurassic Park" films. After that though these films go downhill. "Fallen Kingdom" left a sour taste in my mouth and It lowered my expectations for this film. It's no surprise this film was really bad.The positivesAll the acting is great. All the main actors have great chemistry and I love how the original cast bounce off each-other. When the two casts meet its funny and charming and it's when the movie starts to improve. The CGI on the dinosaurs look great and I appreciate that more animatronics were used. There was some good cinematography sometimes and the music was great as it is in all of these films.The negativesThe plot and characters are atrocious in this film. There's 3 different plots going on and one isn't in the film for over an hour. The main plot is stupid and it doesn't focus on dinosaurs or human extinction. The characters get no development apart from two of them and even then Its not well developed. The dinosaur scenes are shoved in just to make a scene cool. The big dinosaur isn't introduced until the last 30 minutes and it just shows up out of nowhere. Some dinos are in the film for a minute and just leave without a trace. The editing is awful especially in the action scenes. It does the terrible "shakey cam" and quick cuts and it hurts your brain just watching them. The horror was non existent as I wasn't scared one bit in the film. There's pointless nostalgia just like the first two films that adds nothing to the story. Finally the green screen in the film is awful. You can see the outlines of actors when they're placed in from of them and it takes you out of the movie.ConclusionWhile I don't think "Jurassic World: Dominion" is the worst film in the franchise. It's still awful. It has great acting, good CGI and animatronics, nice cinematography and great music. But it's unfocused and messy plot, poor editing, useless dinosaurs, pointless nostalgia and atrocious green screen make this a terrible end to an extinct franchise.I'm going to give "Jurassic World: Dominion" a:3/10.

title: What Walts Watching
text: This could have been Universals Jurassic answer to Marvels Endgame, but it's not!Sure all the characters who survived the original movies are back for this 6th instalment and that's a good thing, which could have been even better if they'd shared more screen time together.It was great to see Sam Neil, Lauren Dern and Jeff Goldblum back in action alongside Chris Pratt & Bryce Dallas Howard on the Big Screen with amazing sound.Campbell Scott's head of Biosyn, "Lewis Dodgson" seems to be modelled on Apples Founder Steve Jobs."Archive 81's" Mamoudou Athie is great as Ramsay Cole as is DeWanda Wise as the mercenary pilot, "Kayla Watts".However one of this movies major issues is the amount of time it takes to spin out this hopefully final yarn from Director Colin Treverrow.Its runtime is at least 30 minutes too long.Fun Fact: there are more animatronics than any previous Jurassic or Lost World film in this very successful franchise.It doesn't always work though because in the subterranean cave scene it plays out like the popular arcade game "Whack A Mole" it's that clunky and mechanical.In fact, it looks like 1960's animation and I'm expecting Raquel Welch to jump out in a bear skin.Don't get me wrong there are some cool creatures created for this movie that we've never seen before including something from a Thanks Giving Day Nightmare and the CGI is flawless and genuinely terrifying.You will believe Dinosaurs exist.But why are movie characters so dumb?One moment they are saying "don't move" then they are racing around like ants, or another character creates a diversion while others look on instead of escaping.None of them deserved to live through this fiasco and fly away safe in the Corporate Chopper.Plus it feels like quite a few scenes we have seen before in this series...including trapped in upturned vehicles, seeking refuge in old outposts, another high tech centre for illegal DNA testing (think Isla Nublar etc), tourism options and much more. It becomes very formulaic.There are some fun references for fans who've watched every movie that will make you cheer though.This movie could have blown our minds with the set up from the previous release with closing Easter eggs of dinosaurs hunting surfers, but it barely touched on the real world problems of Dino's unleashed in the modern world.Apart from the plot line of giant insects destroying crops and all that entails with end of the world philosophy.Unfortunately insects are rarely as sexy as anything ending in saurs...they even admit that in their own dialogue.If we are actually only 3 meals away from anarchy then maybe this was one movie too many that didn't deliver on the promise and I was so looking forward to that movie they teased us with in the trailers.The ending is just downright laughable and corny.Instead we get a Disney version of life finding a way thanks to Amblin and Universal.

title: Spielberg should be ashamed his name is on this!
text: Just saw Jurrasic World  Dominian. I can put up with average acting but I cannot put up with TERRIBLE ideas and an atrocious script. Coming out of the last movie lthey had a ready made set up with Dinosaurs out in the real World and they completely stuffed up an amazing opportunity. Hopeless. Oh and they threw in enough 'woke' moments to keep those people happy and the rest of us shaking our heads.

title: Could be better but does what it needs to do
text: I have personally never been a huge fan of Jurassic park but I've followed the series the whole way. I've never thought of them as thought provoking in any way and just as a thriller that will occupy my time for two hours. This movie achieved that goal. I don't see anything to really hate about this movie. The cgi is good, the suspense is good, the choreography is well done (although never very original.) I do have some problems with this movie although none are too bad. The movie is filled with contrivances. Things will constantly happen just to happen. All of the characters are shallow and forgettable. The length is also a problem. I wouldn't have a problem with it was it not for so many unnecessary events happening. The last main issue I have is the entire set up from the last movie with the dinosaurs being released into the world was barely used. That could be entirely written out of the movie and nothing would have changed. Although there are issues Jurassic World: Dominion is an entertaining watch. If you're a fan of the franchise I'd recommend a watch, but don't expect anything groundbreaking. Just turn your brain off for 2 1/2 hours and watch people get eaten by dinosaurs.

title: I want a refund!
text: Terrible movie and lost plot. Just terrible and makes no real connection with the dinosaur theory. I would like a refund for watching this movie, that's how bad I thought the movie was.

title: Fast paced action/adventure movie
text: The end of the Jurassic Saga, or at least until the evil company Universal ressurects it again for profit.In all seriousness, this movie in unrelenting, a very fast paced octane feature wich gives no rest to the viewer, a lot of that due to the Plot been very small. So yeah, there is that, the plot is thin, non the less, it doesnt need a big Plot, the history of the charachters really goes a long way, a concept that in this movie works really well. This movie did a great job with the action scenes and the dinamics in the film are so fast that truly evoques the golden times of adventure movies.This movie has beautiful cinematography too, really good sound mixing and thankfully in this entry they didnt try to over do the music like in past films so it made for some good atmosphere through the movie.Acting was spot on by the cast of JP, Neil, Goldblum and Dern will live as some really good actors while the new charachters of Dallas, Pratt and the girl did a solid job, this movie did not relly on them and that is a good thing cause they can play to their strenghts in the actions sequences.Still there is a couple of lows in the movie, it capitalizes on nostalgia big time, something sometimes feels a bit out of place; it moves a couple of charachters out of the way since they are not important to the plot and there was a big premise delivered through the pomotional material that did not live up to the hype.However i feel like this movie is truly better than the past two, this one been far better paced and far faster than the other two, a lot like Mad Max in that sense, at the end is unrelenting start to finish with a thin plot, beat that.

title: . . . what did everyone expect?
text: Not sure why so many are so incredibly unhappy with this movie . . .It was a total fantasy-trip of a dinosaur movie, with some original cast members, & new - and it contained all the requisite suspense stuff, lots of dinosaurs, lots of crazy people complicent in dinosaur-manipulation-insanity. It was entertaining, and pretty much worth a Redbox movie night, but possibly not a $30 theater experience unless you like this sort of thing on the big screen with big sound.I was never a big fan of any sort of monster movie, going back to Godzilla, King Kong, or Jurassic Park.What I AM a fan of - is an entertaining movie and this one pretty much fits that bill, In spite of the fact that I know there's going to be several dozen levels of suspensful moments involving staring at dinosaurs approaching, and dinosaur roars & breath being crammed down my throat. It's ok. That's the genre.My one (slight) disappointment was that Jeff seems to have lost a lot of his quirkiness.The only other thing that truly irks me is the trivia page for this movie. ENDLESS, repetitive, over long trivia - more than half commenting on the Twitter feeds of the actors, their interviews, all about how insanely hyped they were to do the movie, be with original cast members, the schedule, dealing with covid, blah, blah, blah. As well as too many repetitive, over-long trivia items about how the director wanted the dinosaurs to be portrayed the same as all wild animals that exist.I think the trivia for this movie is probably in the top 5 for one of the longest trivia pages for any movie, and it definitely broke a record for meaningless, redundancy, and I dare say, it's an awful lot of trivia for such an unpopular movie. Noting here that most long trivia pages are found with highly popular movies, and there the trivia is much more interesting.Meanwhile I give this a 6 for a movie night of fair-to-middlin', totally expected content, worth the popcorn & coke.

title: Yet Another Dumpster Fire!
text: I've come to judge films on the first 30 minutes, if they haven't grabbed you by then, we're all in trouble & this first 30 minutes is so boring I don't how it got released in this form?!The 'kid' storyline is so unengaging & an eye-roller, with a brat that anyone would just want to palm off to the adoption services.The storylines are all over the place, but are supposed to be full of intrigue & subterfuge, when really they're just irritating & juvenile.The editing is parlous.The return of original characters returning, yawn, enjoy your cheque. I'm so embarrassed for Goldblum.Shockingly much of the dino CGI seemed cheap & poorly done, I kept thinking I must be wrong, but I just kept seeing bad stuff all over the place.To top it off there's woke casting & all that 2020 jazz, hooray, oh & they can't act!!Hollywood - please die.

title: Needs more science, but good easter eggs
text: Sadly the science team behind the move is non existent. Absolutely no basic knowledge of dinasours, or ecosystems. Seeing them living in snow, those cold blooded, is painful. And seeing a tropical rainforest in the mountains of Italy, is also disturbing.HOWEVER, has great easter eggs, and respect for the first 2 movies. Also i appreciate a lot the fact that not one cigarette was smoked during the whole movie.

title: Recycled material, with added locusts.
text:
If you didn't watch any other Jurassic movies before, then maybe you can enjoy it. I could not.Overall this movie feels like they cut previous Jurassic movies apart, added big locusts, and glued it together again.Also dinosaurs sometimes at lightning speed, and other times they move almost in slowmotion. Feels
extremely inconsistent and without any sense of realism.Why humanity couldn't deal with the dinosaurs that got released into the wild 30 years earlier, before this movie takes place, is baffling. Only the smaller species could potentially go under the radar and survive if we decided to annihilate them.

title: Not good
text: I haven't watched any Jurassic movie til now but I wasn't expecting that bad. Besides, the movie is so long. I watched it for two days that much bored, I get through this.

title: not so bad...
text: Considering an already carnivoured subject,and a bunch of old dinos on the starspangled silverscreenheaven.A lousy script,not a sharp edged editing,ad far too many dinosaurs flaws a rather actionfilled,technical booster of rama drama craetious pleasures,a film that hooked the grumpy old man at moments,its not the worst of the conseptual genre,but hopefully this will be THE end.what iritates most is choice of musical score...orchestral manouvers in the dark feels like dork stuff,some hard core synth hard rock style music would EPO'ed the visuals far more than philharmonic dinosaurical orchestral music of the past...just a thought.a small recommend anyway.

title: SHOULD'VE BEEN CALLED JURASSIC KRAP.
text: This has definitely killed the franchise. How do they go from the first work of genius to this utter rubbish, under the Jurassic name?Terrible dialogue. Shockingly poor acting & worse acting.A thank you to Geoff Goldblum for being the only thing worth watching or associated with this trash film.I would've walked out but was hoping forba grand finale which sadly didn't materialise.2/10.

title: Welcome to Jurassic World. It's epic and thrilling.
text: I've seen Jurassic Park in 1993 and that's what started the whole franchise. Then I've seen The Lost World: Jurassic Park. Then Jurassic Park 3. In 2015, I've seen Jurassic World. Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom in 2018. Now Jurassic World: Dominion.Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard still have great chemistry together. Their characters were definitely the parental type for Maisie. It was great to see Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum reuniting for this final installment of the entire franchise. The action is great as what the fans have seen throughout the years. I've noticed that some people are tired of seeing the same plot in every film that they've watched. It's always the screaming and running. It's just like watching Lex and Tim run and scream all over again. In the previous films that I've seen, there are bad guys and villains. I get it that people are tired of it and I know that I'm sort of getting tired of the same plot but it's great this film is the final installment of the entire franchise, so I don't think they won't make another film. Saying that I'm tired of watching the same plot in the previous films doesn't make me hate the entire franchise. No, I've enjoyed all five films including this sixth and final installment.I've noticed that the film had tone it down a bit because the violent carnage or anything that we've seen. The film has funny lines especially with Jeff Goldblum's character, Ian Malcolm. The action and CGI are definitely to watch for. In conclusion, this film is great to watch for the action and thrills.

title: fine movie
text: The story and plot were not so bad, the graphics and the motion picture are amazing, I liked the way the events are connected and how characters engage in it. But th movie was long and some scenes was not important, and they didin't connect this part from the before in a good way. I think they made this part just to put an end to the story and make money out of it.

title: This easily could've been a better movie
text: It's hard to describe the plot of this movie as there are two different stories in this movie and I will say that one is interesting and works while the other doesn't. The story that in my opinion works is the one with Owen and Claire and I wish the entire movie was spent on this story. While the other story really didn't need to be included and only existed to have the original trio back for this movie. I feel like the original trio still could've been included in this movie but just in a different way than what we got. I feel like due to these two different stories taking place is where the pacing for this movie takes a hit. I can safely say that I felt all 2 hours and twenty minutes of this movie because this movie moved at both a snail's pace and a fast one. One story moved at such a fast pace that it was hard to keep track of what exactly was going on while the other moved at such a snail's pace with barely anything interesting happening that I was hoping for a dinosaur to get loose so something would happen. Now I probably wouldn't have noticed this issue if the acting for this movie was good and well you can tell everybody was trying their best. Everybody in this movie you can tell is really trying to give it their all, especially the original trio, but it just came out flat. The only real standouts for me were the original trio consisting of Laura Dern, who plays Ellie Sattler, Sam Neill, who plays Alan Grant, and Jeff Goldblum, who plays Ian Malcolm. Honestly, the only good thing in this movie is the special effects. In the end, this was a very underwhelming finale for this already underwhelming series.

title: Enjoyable Enough
text: I don't see where the hate is coming from, it's really no different than all the other ones (with an exception of the first installment). I found it to be a fun ride and liked the fact that they brought the originals together. It would have been nice to introduce new extinct species perhaps and a more intricate plot, but Hey..? It's Jurassic Park...

title: Predictable
text: Jurassic World Dominion is the last movie of the franchise that felt more like a reunion between the first trilogy and the second. The storyline was predictable and quick with a messy script that was all over the place. This last one takes place four years after the original island is lost to a volcanic eruptions and most of the dinosaurs that perished from the lava. The protagonist ended up being Campbell Scott who runs a pharmaceutical company to control the world's food supply by man made locusts. The original cast consisting of Laura Dern and Sam Neil are brought together for one last adventure. The acting was subpar, but the editing was superb especially with the special effects of the dinosaurs. The movie was a hit and miss, I neither loved it or hated it.

title: Boring Chris Pratt
text: He keeps sticking his hand in front of the dinosaurs, and if Spielberg had any guts, the whole arm would have come off.Unfortunately, these kiddie movies have no gore. Just CGI dinosaurs. Basically a cartoon.

title: This is the new world order playbook!
text: Here we have a film series that has been highjacked by New World Order activists following their silly Playbook!Initially, 20 years ago, it was kinda fun to 'see' dinosaurs again, but evil, greedy men stepped in to mess everything up so that instead of a "Theme Park" we always ended up with a mess -- corrected by our "Heros".This time, we are to accept dinosaurs among humans as common, accepted fact-of life! Can you not see the connection to Today? In this ridiculous dialog, they try to justify their half-baked nonsense by questioning whether Man has any more rights than dinosaurs to inhabit our Planet!Nowhere did I see, in the 40 minutes I could stomach this miserable excuse for a film, did I see our Military trying to eradicate these creatures from a bygone age! ((Can we say Dinosaurs == 'Migrants'?))Perhaps PITA has a problem with hurting fake animals! Who knows?It's not the actors, or the Producers at fault here -- it is the miserable, phony, fetid, disgusting SCRIPT that is at fault. I've also lost ALL respect for the actors, many of whom are from previous "Jurassic Park" films, who agreed to babble their lines for this tripe!People are entitled to their sincere Political beliefs -- whatever they are. This film is extremely blatant in its message of "Humans are disposable, and can be replaced" theme. Where are our 'Leaders' in this film? Nowhhere to be found; while of course the Elites continue to hide in their protected caves -- as they always will -- or as long as there are idiots dumb enough to accept scraps of compensation to protect them.Go ahead, get some popcorn and watch this film -- you have been warned -- it is simply more brainwashing; so do so at your own risk. Try not to puke up that expensive popcorn you bought -- thinking you were going to be entertained!One other reviewer writes that this film is "spiritless"; another writes "lifeless". Well of COURSE it is! These NWO people have no belief in God -- just in themselves and their money! This film is a darn-near CRIMINAL waste of anyone's attention!

title: How they managed to...
text: How they managed to make a movie about dinosaurs so boring ?They could have done this so much interested if the dinosaurs just destroyed the city the formula could be more simple and they make it complicated for no reason.

title: Great end to the saga but does not live up to everyone's expectations
text: The movie starts with a promising premise & then slowly turns into a slow burn with some great effects. I loved the movie, it's a lot better than fallen kingdom but still is not what a lot of people was expecting. The original trio back in action is easily the best part of the movie & in the end it's great to see them all get the ending they each deserve. Go watch it for yourself it's definitely worth it, just not for everyone.

title: Fun but Repetitive
text: Disney makes a messy yet entertaining attempt at closing the Jurassic world trilogy. JW1 was pretty good enjoyed it over all besides it being a carbon copy of JP1. JW2 we don't need to talk about. JW3 even with all the hate it seems to be getting was surprisingly entertaining for me. I had low hopes for this movie. Disney has become complacent with their ability to regurgitate films and ideas while painting it with cameos and Easter eggs, LOOKING AT YOU STAR WARS. However, the entire ensemble really made the movie enjoyable! From introducing new characters that had spine and seemed real, unlike JW2, the additions of Dewanda Wise and Mamoudou Athie were solid (loved Ms. Wise in this), Goldblum did his thing but the additions of Dr. Grant and Dr. Sattler we're merely for fan service and Disney's addiction to cameos/nostalgia. (Not detracting from the performances given). The story while what you have come to expect from the current Disney model was surprisingly improved not as many tropes and unrelenting call backs that actually allowed the movie to feel slightly fresh. At the end of the day if you haven't seen top gun see that instead but if you enjoy dinosaurs and a good cast this wasn't a bad way to spend an evening getting away from reality. Solid 6/10 for me.

title: Save dinosaurs to kill humans
text: Save dinosaurs to kill humans... This is the main idea of the film.I watched exactly 4 minutes then I left the cinema... This movie takes the stupidity to a whole new level.

title: Fan service and homage
text: How many T. Rex getting hurt does it take to stop this franchise?The conclusion to the Jurassic World trilogy. The movie itself is not really about the plot. Instead, it's an amalgamation of references to past movies and fan-service moments, and I had a fun time.If you rewatch the previous 5 movies leading up to this one, the callbacks would be so in-the-face. Multiple quotes, objects, and characters made me do that Leonardo DiCaprio pointing meme. They were littered everywhere throughout the runtime. Even the ways some of the characters died in this movie were copies from previous ones. Not gonna lie it's pretty satisfying recognizing those references.Even though Dominion doesn't offer fan-service to the level of Endgame or No Way Home, there were still a lot. Not all of them worked though, as some felt kinda cringe.However, this doesn't discredit the solid sequences of actions in the movie. Once they forced the setup of the plot, the movie turned into constant chasing and dinosaur attacks. The sequences were handled well and created high levels of intensity. The jump scares didn't feel cheap or predictable, heightening the intensity furthermore.I have mentioned many of the problems of this movie. The plot was basic to the bone. It's just there so we can have a proper movie. The villain character was the typical forgettable evil villain. The dialogues were corny, and sadly even the veteran cast members could not save those lines.Overall, if you come in expecting a thrilling adventure with lots of service and homage, you will have a blast. 7-7.5/10.

title: Single handedly the worst movie I have ever seen
text: There is so much wrong with this movie. I'll just write a better script right now instead. They meet up with the CIA guy in the beginning, the CIA guy has a flight they can catch with an insider that will take them to where the meet up with Dr. Grant, they can skip literally everything that happens in between, because absolutely nothing happens with them. Nothing. Them being on camera had nothing to do with the plot. The story could function without their entire subplot. Just get rid of it. Why was that nonsense in the film? Seriously? Chris pratt and his Bryce Howard and their new pilot sidekick did nothing of substance the whole film. Just have them fly to the base just like Dr. Grant. Some would say this is a manner of to many cooks in the kitchen but some of these cooks are not even cooking anything. Their ingredients do not provide any substance to the film. It's all just dead film space at most points where nothing and I mean absolutely nothing happens of substance. Why, would you reject Bryce Howard out of your plane if in the end you were just going to end up in the same place to begin with? Just so you could circle back and get her anyway. Why was that necessary. Just keep her in the plane with you. So you all end up in the same place to begin with. Honestly, they serve no purpose because the "legacy characters", do all the heavy lifting and keep the plot moving forward and end the end it's what they do that affect anything in the end anyway. I hate this movie so much. Its probably the worst film I've seen period.

title: Underwhelming
text: That's the word for it.They tried to pack a lot into the movie. It was disappointing. I was super excited for it, and you'd think with the OG cast coming back it would be amazing.Nah....

title: Jurassic World Damnation
text: It's by far the worst of the 3 "worlds".So predictable and boring, that I wanted to stop it at the middle. The story line was empty and the acting was weak. Even the old faces brought in were unconvincing, I didn't saw any sign of their old passion. They acted like "aah what the heck, okay, I'll do it for the money". None of them was convincing. As well as all the other younger actors - they're lacking talent, charisma and emotions. Even Chris Pratt wasn't looking any enthusiastic, just a boring facial expressions like they dragged him by force to play in this.The whole idea of "living together with dinosaurs" was lame. Those "hand-signals" were also very lame already, now everyone were doing them like everyone trained these creatures. The giant locusts that doesn't eat specific crops, was also very lame addition.The CGI was very weak. How it's possible with all the technical and digital advantages nowadays, the dinos to look worse than the ones in the original Jurassic Park 30 years ago? Most scenes were happening at dark, so they can probably mask their CGI failure?Editing was also very bad, as well as the soundtrack. The music ruined every action scene. There wasn't enough scary scenes, only a couple moments when you could feel the fear in those people. They were acting as they face kittens. As of dinos are harmless creatures and humans can control them by eyes and hands. Gimme a break...In general - this whole movie was weak and bad, and it doesn't worth the 2 and a half hours. I won't recommend it to anyone.My rating: 2/10.

title: Ok
text: It was certainly a movie. That i enjoyed, a lot. I do have problems with the locust plot being the main focus, as i thought that was unnecassary. I also hate bugs, a lot. But the giga was cool and i love the theri. No spinosaurus tho.

title: Same story, same characters blah blah blah!
text: They should just quit. Every movie is almost the same. The only difference is each one gets more ridiculous than the last. The special effects are even starting to appear like a 3rd grade student made them.Oh, look at the dinosaurs. Oh know, the dinosaurs are after us. Lets make some stupid, grand stand, and completely unrealistic escape. The end.Next...JUST STOP!!!

title: Was i watching a different move to the rest
text: I enjoyed the movie had its small flaws but its not as bad as everyone makes out. It not perfect but still a good film if you loved the old ones and found it a good way to end the whole thing. Seeing the old and new cast there was good to see. Could it have been better? Yes but it could have been a whole lot worse.

title: This movies suc but still epic
text:
This movies is so suck almost every action is in the trailer
Boring story and the logic in this movie is suck but there's a good thing in this movie like the ending the rest are suck but if you're the type of people that can be boring so fast don't watch this movie i am nor like this movie.

title: Catastrophic movie
text: As the title suggests, this movie is absolutely awful.The main plot follows human-modified locusts, it hardly has anything to do with Jurassic Park or World, it's just an excuse to bring back the previous cast and it's not even a good excuse. They're hardly the most logical people for the job, it's a joke.The rest of the movie tries to focus on dinosaurs living with humans for like 10 minutes, then it's back to "running away from big bads" and nothing makes sense, dinos are not scary, no one is in danger, the previous movies are entirely forgotten, everyone's motivation is either absurd or fake, the characters don't evolve one bit throughout the movie and the kid clone is an afterthought at best.Overall it can be considered gorgeous but it barely evolved in 30 years forcing us to wonder if it was really worth it to do an entire trilogy for... this? Spoiler: it wasn't.I expected nothing from this movie and that's basically what I got; nothing. Old cast, random dino names and giant locusts, wonderful. What a waste of time.

title: Not bad
text: Overall I really enjoyed this film, had some great call backs to the original jurassic park movie. I didn't go in with very high expectations going off of previous reviews so this probably helped as it turned out nowhere near as bad as I was expecting.

title: Wasted Opportunity
text: I personally enjoyed "Jurassic World" as well as "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom", therefore I had rather high hopes for the last film of the trilogy. I walked in with an open mind and was thoroughly disappointed by each and every scene. Everything fell short of a good film, the acting, the CGI, even the the story itself felt like a mash between three or four plots. To try and point out every mistake this film made would be impossible, seeing that every scene had something wrong with it. A very predictable film, which lead to very predictable outcomes; certainly one of the weaker installments in the franchise.

title: Didnt Dodson die in the first one?
text: Saw this today in the theater and I kept thinking "didn't Dodgson die in the first one?" Wasnt he the attorney eaten by the trex after hiding in a toilet stall? Seems like a pretty big plot hole to me but none of the reviews I checked out said anything about it. Guess I have to go back and re-watch it. I definitely remember the character from the book, but I dont remember what happened to him in the book.

title: It's very, very boring
text: It's not the worst film i've ever seenBut oh my is it boring and just really clichAvoid at all costs, it's not what the trailers portrayed it to be at all.

title: Waaaaay tooo loooong....
text: Reasonably entertaining , which is normal , considering the budget etc...everything is kinda ok , but nothing really works ... very boring ... not a very good entry in franchise ...

title: Great fun
text: Its the 6th film in a series of films all basically about the same thing - a bad guy trying to take advantage of a technology that was used irresponsibly in the first place, to make lots of money.Yes its not a new idea anymore.Yes we've seen the dinosaurs now.Yes we've seen the FX.Where else can we go? Bring all the favourite characters together for one last hurrah. Thats what happens.Go with it - its fun.

title: I don't want to believe this is the ending culmination of the Jurassic Franchise.
text:
1. Too many plot conveniences
2. Lazy Writing beyond description
3. Messy ScriptFallen Kingdom also suffered from the same issues and they literally carry on some of the weakest plot points of the last one and I firmly believe in that the movie could have utilize a longer runtime. Again this shouldn't have been the end of the saga. Utterly huge letdown.1993 Jurassic Park,directed by Spielberg is still uniquely unbeatable.

title: Plain, good dino fun
text: I have been a fan of the first Jurassic Park since I first saw it as a kid. Jurassic World was, from the get-go, a much more bombastic and action-oriented series which paid homage to the original while not losing focus of the fact that they were just supposed to be plain, good action films... with dinosaurs. Dominion brings the concept to a satisfying close, with the right amount of fan-service, great visuals (even by today's high standards) and dino battles. If you watch the movie expecting originality, narrative prowess and realism in its actions scenes, you are bound to be disappointed. If you want a good action film with impressive CGI and a nice touch of humanity and growth in its characters, you might just be surprised and have a lot of fun. A big source of this fun is Jeff Goldblum's Ian Malcom, who is a gem here, while all other returning characters from the original film render on-point performances which grant credence to their respective character arcs.Dominion is no masterpiece, but it might be the strongest entry of the Jurassic World trilogy, effectively closing the loop for this decades-old Jeep Wrangler. Suspend your disbelief, settle in, ignore the reviews, and make your own judgment. I definitely enjoyed it and would recommend it; keep your arms and legs inside the vehicle at all times.

title: I love this movie yet I'm also disappointed by it.
text: Ok, so most of that is from the dinosaurs here, who are so beautiful and there are so many of them! Don't worry, no spoilers.The plot isn't new or very interesting, but at least they tried to make it different than what we were expecting. Not a very good antagonist; he was just the typical greedy tech CEO that we know from EVERY movie these days, and the twist villain was predictable enough for me to say "Finally!" when it happens. Plus, the old cast didn't bring much to the film.I'm just such a geek about Dino's and the effort put into those is amazing. I might be praising the movie a bit to much, but the amount of shivers that came from the Dino's onscreen was monumental.I love this movie for its actors and dinosaurs, not much else.So 7/10 overall to Jurassic World Dominion, a must see in my books.

title: Jurassic Joke
text: Easily the worst movie in the series. Even for a Jurassic movie there is nothing that even remotely makes sense. The movie is absolutely for 9 year olds. It's extremely disappointing.

title: A Few Haiku Reviews
text: Slam the OG for Unoriginality Then hate the new endOrGodzilla film with Indiana, Jason Borne and Jeffrey BezosOrExplores genetics Adds legacy characters Kept me entertained~jodawa.

title: Yikes!
text:
The movie's story feels like a bed time talk between 2 year olds Jon and Bob before they go to sleep. Let me tell you how this movie shaped in the last couple years of its production.1st Night of the script writing of Jon and Bob 2 year olds:
Jon and Bob drink their warm milk and eat their cookies. Right before they sleep they start mind-storming. At the same time Director Colin Tremorrow is taking notes for his next blockbuster movie called Jurassic World DoMinions.Jon calls to Bob "Bob look look. There is a huge Ice Pool it is really cold." The other kid "Yeah but it is tropical below that right?!" Jon: "Yeah, yeah and a huge plane crashes and it won't sink. Oh but the people on it can sink its like 1 inch thick they can drown." The other kid again "But yeah and there is a big dinosaur like a huge chicken but it can swim beneath the ice pond like a dolphin!"Colin smiles and he is happy. He chuckles and leaves the room.2nd Night of the script writing of Jon and Bob 2 year olds (Colin as always taking notes):Jon: "An evil man lives in a building shaped like Apple's space craft building. Oh yeah and the evil man's name is Tim CooKie. He is greedy, he loves money!" Bob:"Yeah yeah and all dinosaurs are living happy in the forest around Tim CooKie's building. But if there is anything booboo happens All dinosaurs will walk inside and eat each other!" Jon: "Bugs let's have bugs they are hugeee!" Bob: "Lets put em on fire! They are stored in a basement but when they are burned they can fly outside because there is a wide ventilation tube right above them!" Jon: "Burn the forest burn the forest!"Colin is amazed! He can't stop giggling and imagining how he will be winning the Oscar so easy in 2023.3rd Night:Jon:"Horses!" Bob: "Dinos" Jon: "Tom cruise riding bike! Bourne music yeah right!" Jon: "A huge dinosaur but its bigger than T-Rex" Bob "Let's fight them! And big Ostrich like Wolverine. Yeah they team up! Yeah fight the bigger dino!" Jon: "Lets have Raptors!" Bob: "Wait wait also there is a woman she can reproduce with mitosis she like Mother Marry!" Jon "Yeaah yeaahh she gives birth to she Jesus Christ. She so important. She is also clone but also mitosis. She can reproduce with mitosis too." Bob: "Yeah yeah and she is perfect in every way. So important. So important!" "There is also another Mother Marry Raptor! Jesus Blue Christ so important' Sooo important!" "All the other dinos can reproduce since 1993 Jurassic Aprk with mitosis but nooo Blue the Christ is so impvtanttt!""Chines man. So Geniusss. He is evil but he is kind!""Yeah yeah so impovtanttt""Tree houses in the forest. Tim CooKie being bad!""Dark tunnels! Dinos everywhere!""There were like 20-30 dinos top. In the Jurassic World 2 escaping. But now in 1 year there are billions of them!! Yet they are so rare they are being hunted! Yeaah so impovtantttt!"Colin TreMorrow is so hyped so thrilled he is having his best days of his life. He definitely will get the Oscar! He imagines its big yellow man shaped statue every night after taking notes and he prepares for this great night!

title: Comedy w/a Side Order of Dinosaurs.
text: I liked it. Does it beat the original? No way. The plot was more or less the same and it was great that they brought the original cast together. I wish there were more dinosaur scenes and I watched the extended version. Main big bad was obvious from the get go and rather weird considering he couldn't form a clear sentence and spoke almost staccato and his demise was rather lackluster. Side big bads had very easy ends as well; arrested or eaten. Action was good, comedy was good too, CGI in these is always on point. The puns from the original characters and interaction was nice to see. It's a fun movie if you want a fun movie; but don't expect award winning screenwriting here. Basically one to just turn your brain off and watch.

title: Definitely Enjoyed It and will Rewatch
text: This is another example where I don't understand the flames. I honestly believe most of the negative reviewers didn't even watch it, or maybe just watched a trailer or two and then decided to throw some shade.Outside of the original Jurassic Park, this one of the most original stories in the franchise and it worked well in tying the old to the new for wrapping everything up in a fun way. Maybe the story seemed convoluted to some people. It's fast paced, but it worked as far as I'm concerned. And let's face it, the story in this series is the literal macguffin to seeing a bunch of dinosaurs run around on screen anyway. The original JP was trashed much the same way when it originally came out.If I have to criticize something, Kayla's character was a very rushed add on and was not properly developed. Her addition felt more like a plot device crowbarred into the end of the second act, but the character ended up working out and was otherwise a good add.Visually, this movie is a stunner. The action sequences are bananas, and the direction was excellent. The dinosaurs were the best yet; the shear variety of what they've brought to life is indeed impressive - finally got the iguanodon in there! A return of the humor from the original ensemble was great and an unexpected treat. I personally would rank this second best in the series; JP1, JWD, JW, JPLW, JP3, JWFK.

title: When Dinosaurs Ruled The Earth.......NOPE!
text: Jurassic Wold Dominion felt very lackluster despite it being the last movie of the Jurassic World trilogy. From my watching of the movie the dinosaurs, which the movie was supposed to be the main focus, took more of a backseat this go round. They were more of a obstacle much like a wall than an adversary to the cast and were just kind of present. This was supposed to be the finale in which the phrase from Jurassic Parks banner "When Dinosaurs Ruled The Earth" was supposed to come full circle and it fell HEAVILY on its face. Though more entertaining than its predecessor, Fallen Kingdom, I think it was because it was the return of the orginal cast members that lightened the mood. Though some of the jokes were extremely forced by Jeff Goldblum's Dr. Ian Malcom, it was B. D. Wong's Dr. Wu that I loathed the most out this entire movie. How do you go from being a the villian who can see no wrong of two movies, to weak and humble on the last one.

title: HOLLYWOOD GONE LIFELESS!!!
text: It occurred to me when watching "The Offer" TV series, the making of "The Godfather" that it was as from the 80's when Hollywood went totally in the direction of money making movies mainly and neglecting real creative storytelling. Where as creating a simple minded audience by watching trash just to fill up film theaters and counting the numbers at the end of the day. Imagine all the movies with sequels, you can only pick a handful that can live up to their names. Jurassic Park and world is one of them unfortunately. I'm sorry to offend anyone and excuse me for saying this, but intellectualism in Hollywood has died and the addle-brained have taken over!!!

title: Redeeming
text: Some great new Dinosaurs to awe over (and they at least act like animals in this as opposed to the brain dead set pieces they were in FK), some great tidying up of mistakes from FK and it's great to see the original cast together.Some of the character building/dynamics are off but it has its heart in the right place. I enjoyed this movie for what it is.It redeemed the franchise for me but the next movie needs to be in a park/safari/sanctiary type setting - the open world just doesn't work as well.Jurassic Kingdom perhaps?

title: What did I watch?
text: Jurassic Park Dominion left me perplexed and disheartened. As a devoted fan of the original Jurassic Park films, I eagerly anticipated this continuation of the dinosaur saga. However, what unfolded on screen was a confusing concoction of prehistoric creatures, grasshoppers, and an inexplicable inclusion of gangster elements.One of the most glaring issues with Jurassic Park Dominion was the lack of clarity regarding its central plot. Rather than focusing on the awe-inspiring wonder of resurrected dinosaurs or the ethical dilemmas of genetic engineering, the film seemed to wander aimlessly between disparate storylines. The addition of grasshoppers, while perhaps intended to introduce a novel threat, only served to further convolute an already muddled narrative.Despite boasting a cast of talented actors, including veterans of the franchise such as Sam Neill and Laura Dern, the film suffered from remarkably poor acting. Characters felt one-dimensional and lacked the depth and nuance that fans have come to expect from the Jurassic Park series. It was disappointing to see such esteemed performers deliver uninspired performances in roles that failed to resonate with the audience.One of the most disheartening aspects of Jurassic Park Dominion was its failure to capture the nostalgic charm of the original films. While previous installments effortlessly transported viewers back to the awe-inspiring world of Isla Nublar, this film felt disconnected and disjointed. There were few moments that evoked the sense of wonder and excitement that defined the early entries in the franchise, leaving fans longing for the magic of Jurassic Park's heyday.As the credits rolled and the lights came up in the theater, I couldn't help but feel a sense of disappointment and regret. Jurassic Park Dominion was a film that could have easily been omitted from the franchise without any loss. Its illogical plot, nonsensical character decisions, and lackluster execution left me wishing I could reclaim the two hours of my life spent watching it.In conclusion, Jurassic Park Dominion failed to live up to the legacy of its predecessors. With its bewildering storyline, poor acting, and lack of nostalgic appeal, it stands as a forgettable entry in the beloved franchise. Fans of Jurassic Park would be better served revisiting the original films rather than subjecting themselves to the disappointment of this lackluster sequel."

title: The Jurassic Park protagonists come together in Marvel's Savage Land, minus Ka-Zar
text: As dinosaurs freely roam the Earth, Owen & Claire (Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard) seek to find their kidnapped adopted daughter (Isabella Sermon), which takes them to Malta and then a remote dinosaur preserve in the Dolomite Mountains of northeastern Italy. Meanwhile Ellie Sattler and Alan Grant (Laura Dern and Sam Neill) have serious concerns about the remote facility wherein they reunite with Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum)."Jurassic World: Dominion" (2022) isn't great like the previous "Fallen Kingdom" (2018) and is arguably the least of the second trilogy. There are some Indiana Jones elements in the Malta segment and James Bond bits at the technologically advanced lair in the mountains, both of which I appreciate.Yet I strangely never bought the characters as real people. They always struck me as actors performing according to a contrived script, which tries too hard to check the diversity boxes. Still, there's certainly enough here to entertain if you're interested in a dinosaur-oriented sci-fi adventure.The film runs 2 hours, 27 minutes, with the Extended Version running just over 12 minutes longer (I viewed the latter). The primary shooting locations include British Columbia, Malta, Hawaii and the UK (Pinewood Studios).GRADE: B-/C+

title: a not so epic ending
text: The potenial was there but this movie didn't make any sense, poor plot, wooden characters, no depth. Left the cinema wondering what I just watched. Doesn't even have good dinosaur battles. Poor film. Please save your money and go to top gun: maverick if you want to see a good movie this summer.

title: End of an era
text: The end of an era.Jurassic Park is one of my favorite franchises and i have always loved these movies, so it's a little bit sad that the latest installment in the franchise is the last one. It's the end of an era.The Jurassic World movies hasn't been the greatest movies. The first one i liked, that was a pretty good movie. But the second one not so much. So i didn't really know what to excpected from this movie other than that i thought the premise was interesting, this is the Jurassic park movie i wanted since the first time i saw "The Lost World" so what did i think about it?Jurassic World: Domino is a decent and solid adventure movie, and i enjoyed parts of it (especially those involving the OG trio) but for the most parts it was kinda boring, the story wasn't very good, the script was bad and the lack of emotions is what's dragging this movie down. I didn't feel a connection to any of the characters in this movie besides maybe the OG ones, and i didn't really care for any of them. So the best part of this movies Is maybe the last hour when the action kicks in and the movie has settled.But if you like me love the Jurassic park movie i definitely recommend you to see this on the big screen.

title: It's bad
text: So bad that I wish I'd stopped watching it. Bad acting. Obvious references from other movies. Bad writing. Huge plot holes. No love from the original JP. Thank god I pirated it!

title: Ignore the Negative Reviews
text: Solid 8 stars. Story was good and kept my attention from start to finish. Well worth your box office dollars. Ignore the Negative Reviews. Solid 8 stars.

title: A 12-year old would write a better movie. I mean it.
text: Not joking here. However, the writing of this movie is the real joke. Scenes just going on, one after another, without real connection. Cheap fanservice. Lame dialogues. The best way to conclude this awful Jurassic World trilogy.

title: Why is everyone moaning?
text: The storyline is a bit all over the place and its the same sorta stuff from characters like using hands to stop a dinosaur from attacking lol but i thought it was worth watching....i 100% believe its better than Jurassic World 2 and maybe even the first Jurassic World.ConsI read reviews before watching and was concerned but after watching it literally a few hours ago i don't see why people are moaning so much, there is only so much you can do to a dinosaur movie after 5 other movies so of course its going to be same stuff.

title: As bad as expected
text: The only thing good about this movie was the feeling of nostalgia and the return of Jeff Goldblum, Sam Neill and Laura Dern.Hence the 3 star rating.

title: It could be better.
text: I found the idea of a dinosaur apoclypse happening really interesting but i believe despite the long length of this episode, it wasnt portrayed as well.The choice of destroying, evolving or even taming these creatures was all shown as usual but at the end of the day its just another Dino-Family movie.Some of the characters reuniting must be the peak of the story but the rest seems the same as the whole frenchies.I'd just call it "Amusing".

title: Garbage
text: Worst movie in the franchise. Three strikes, you're out. Stop making these please. Wish I had as many chances as Colin Trevorrow has had. Makes you wonder if a minority director would have had as many. There are better, hungrier talent out there just waiting to showcase what they can do. Trevorrow just hasn't proven himself capable of taking the reigns of a big budget feature film.

title: Enjoyable Popcorn Movie with Some Corny Plot Points
text: The first 20-30 minutes of this movie is hard to believe, and I'd love for the main 'Dinosaurs-accepted-as-living-alongside-people' subplot really should have been left on the cutting room floor, full stop & completely. It's totally absurd, in no world would people just deal with it and look the other way, literally no one would tolerate raptors on the loose... and in this movie, everyday people don't run and scream in horror for some reason, they hang about until they get eaten, seemingly with little knowledge of their two giant carnivores in broad daylight, or breaking out of a cage in the background... Dumb.That craziness aside, the movie picks up soon after, with more fun dinos and much better CG some of the new species (another issue with the early parts of the movie.) All of the current and past characters enjoy some good suspense or action. Dinos are best in dark, confined areas, with their threat taken seriously... which luckily the rest of the movie provides.All-in-all it's a worthy film. I went in with the assumption that I wouldn't be getting some perfect conclusion, and there are probably too many characters in play, but it was enjoyable.

title: Terrible on a colossal scale
text: Not even sure where to begin. There are just so many things wrong with this mess.Not sure how, but they managed to make the dinosaurs by far the most believable thing in this movie. Everything else are coincidences/situations that are beyond ridiculous.Adding the original actors simply added to the confusion. Too many people running around in too many directions.But it's made so much money, the producers won't be able to stop themselves from making another. They can't resist making $600 million even if these films are way past their best before dates.In the next one cheer for the dinosaurs. The humans in these movies don't deserve to exist. Cheer when they become extinct.

title: Good tie in
text: Well, it was great to see all the actors together in this, and I did like the film, but I do have some critcisms. The acting, for all the great actors and actresses in it was a bit subpar for the people involved. What I mean is, in the first movie, you felt like you were there, and everyone in it put up such great performances, it was like it was really happening. The fear was believable, and you could've easily believed this was actually happening to them. In this movie it just seemed a bit like they were just phoning in their performances. Ian Malcolm is trying to think of a combination to help Ellie and Alan and company escape a dinosaur who's hot on their tail and he's just casually going thru a mental checklist of what the combination could be, for example- lol. Also the plot was a bit far fetched but still fun. Overall, I liked it fine, tho. But it wasn't as good as the first one, but then they never are, are they?

title: this sucks !!!!!!!!!!!!!
text: What you have here is lazy made movie with all the players cashing in on a great franchise with as little effort as possible, all in the name off making a quick buck. The situations the cast get into is laughable and the way they escape them is proposturous. FX are great and at times entertaining but definately not worth the small fortune i spent at the cinema.

title: What on earth is this
text: Obviously the pandemic made filming this more problematic but there's no excuse for releasing this.It's bad.The dinosaurs look bad.The villain is the worst villain I've ever seen, who's he meant to be, a bland Tim Cook impersonator?The final third looks like they just edited pieces together so they could release something.Shocking how you can spend a quarter of a billion and produce this but they obviously wanted the money and knew that if you throw in a few old faces that people would want to see it.The locusts were an odd angle to take but I've no problem with that really, if you execute it right you can pull off things off but the execution was awful.

title: The worse Jurassic sequel so far
