text: Overall, I am disappointed with this sequel. The movie is too crowed with too many stars/characters. There is a lack of peaceful interaction between the good dinosaurs and humans. The director or screenwriters only want to bombard the audience with screens of fighting and dinosaur aggressiveness. And most of the scenes are dark. Really really disappointed. I will forget this one and hoping for a better one next.

title: Why are dinosaurs the enemy?
text: A lifeless and predictable movie that continues to rise the coatails of its original, that unfortunately draws crowds simply because of its title.Run. Appear trapped and frightened. Escape. Repeat . A formula that unfortunately gets tiresome very quickly.

title: Bad. Just bad.
text: Save the 2.5 hours. The originals were great. This felt like the Fast and the Furious 12 meets dinosaurs. Would not have been surprised to see Vin Diesel show up.

title: "Jurassic Park" had better animations
text: I am not going to review the bad script. Groan.I am a keen observer of animals, since childhood. And so it's the CGI dinosaurs that struck me as very odd. When you see a crocodile lurching over land, when you see a monkey climbing - you always notice that the vertebral column is not a rigid thing. The animal's back can bend, the *entire* animal is rather elastic.In this film, it was most pronounced when the animals were moving slowly, especially the large four-legged ones. The computer models assumed the vertebrae to be completely rigid.It's puzzling how the 1993 film, with its very limited computing power behind the CGI, did a better job.But: Bonus points for using so many special aircraft. They even borrowed the weird Boeing 747 from "Casino Royale".

title: Going out with a BANG!
text: Really enjoyed this film. Full of nostalgia and action which me my son loved. Seen other reviews slagging off the story and saying it was predictable, but apart from the first Jurassic Park film all the other Jurassic Park films have not had great stories.The actions scenes are great, especially the lengthy one in Malta, loved it. Also the addition of some other different dinosaurs was great to see. I personally thought it was a great movie and can't wait to watch it again.

title: A new low
text: I have just witnessed what may be a new low for the Hollywood blockbuster. If it wasn't for the perfection that was Top Gun Maverick a week earlier, I may have lost complete faith in the corporate film industry of today.If you're like me, you may think: how bad can it be? After all, there's the reunion of the original cast and cool dinosaurs and stuff... Oh, it can be bad... Unbelievably bad... Somehow, with a budget the size of a gigantosaurus and visual effects unparalleled in any of the predecessors, they've managed to make a film with zero thrills, zero wonder, zero fun and zero sense, not to mention not even an 8th grade grasp of science.I would try to pinpoint where it all went wrong, but literally every aspect is so painstakingly stupid I can only conclude it was written by somebody intoxicated, an artistically illiterate CEO, or maybe some new AI that Universal is trialling as part of a cost cutting initiative.If you're thinking you've seen the first two and need to see how this trilogy resolves, don't even expect a conclusion. The plot has nothing to do with the dinosaurs - I kid you not. The dinosaurs roaming the earth are merely a part of the background and nothing changes by the end. Again, just huh!?I gave one extra star for the visual effects and the original cast taking the time to appear, though they looked more lost than the pteranodons nesting on the World Trade Center. Avoid this film like the plague!

title: Not an iconic movie but fun to watch
text: My expectations were very low after reading all the negative reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. Of course it's not as good as the original but it's still an entertaining roller coaster ride. The original cast gets plenty of screentime and they are a real asset to the experience. Yes, there are some scenes that are just plain copies of iconic scenes from the original but they are well executed and still work for me. I liked it.

title: Count the Homages
text:
Okay, let's all say it, this one doesn't live up to the original. There, that's out of the way. Now, on to reviewing 'Dominion.'The clear intent of this wrap up was just that, to wrap it up, and that task has been accomplished. Several screen moments harkened back to the original, fitting because of all the returning stars. There was even an oblique Indiana Jones reference that many in the audience laughed at, and the laughter could be heard over the ear-splitting IMAX sound.The sets, the special effects, all the nuts and bolts get a ten out of ten. As
far as originality goes, I don't think that was ever the point.Dominion succeeds as a final chapter, does so with nostalgia and good humor, and let's hope those who make movies understand that this story is over.

title: Not so many dinosaurs..
text: Still a great movie, not as good as the first JW, but still really good. The only thing that was disappointing was that this movie didn't seem to focus as much on the dinosaurs and more the humans.Since I've heard this was the last movie, would have loved to see Tim and Lex return. Oh well, still thoroughly enjoyable and action packed.

title: Potentially great reunion but forgot about why we love Jurassic
text:
I'll keep it short. Here are my main reasons why this installment didn't quite work:
1. Too much dialogue - Jurassic Park thrilogy was all about being new, fresh, and exploration. World trilogo was about reliving that experience, and even extending it. This one gave us a glimpse of that - but wanted to create too much overlapping stories. At times, I felt like shouting to the screen, "we get it. Let's cut to the next scene already"
2. Overacting - the main man of the original series returned with some of the OG cast - but his lines felt too forced and cheesy. The long stares, the macho moves and dramatic pauses before saying the lines made it feel awkward and too staged.3. Dinosaurs had lower importance - It felt like for a movie about dinosaurs, they certainly made their importance in this installment less significant.Now, I do want to point out that overall, the movie's still enjoyable. I think seeing both the cute and the scary dinos still never gets old!!! But story-wise, it was a let-down.

title: Old faces, but weak plot!
text: I saw the film last week and was disappointed. It had the feel of a "B" dinosaur movie! A lot of disconnected violence between dinosaurs. Nothing new here in this movie. I hope this is not the demise of the series!

title: Holy coincidence dinoman
text: This movie is literally infuriating. Not in the colloquial definition of literally, it is literally inferiorating in the most defined definition of the word. The original Jurassic Park came out when I was 6 years old and it was revolutionary, I can still remember seeing it in theaters and it is one of my favorite memories. This movie is just milking the decaying nipples of one of my favorite movie's dead and rotting corpse that was murdered for movies ago. I thought that storytelling in this universe reached its absolute bottom with the talking dinosaur in the helicopter. And the only thing I could think while suffering through this movie was "now that is one big pile of..."

title: Much better than Fallen Kingdom
text: Wow. Great adventure. Much better than the last, Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom. I have been great fan of Jurassic films. You can't the original. That's the best film by far out of all Jurassic films. I did enjoy Jurassic Park III for the Spinosaurus and did like Jurassic World 2015 too. The latest film isn't pathbreaking, because after three Jurassic films, it could never be path breaking but the plot is much better than the lame last film which was the worst in the series. Return of Dr. Alan Grant and Ian Malcolm is great, what else you can ask for.

title: Dinosaur good story bad
text: I enjoy the Jurassic Park films for the action and the dinosaurs who I thought were better actors than the people. First of all the clone girl story is boring and the villain is one of the lamest in cinema history. Also the film is too dark, it reminded me of that GOT episode when it's too dark. If you over analyse the plot holes and the previous films you will not enjoy it but to be honest I just watch for the dinosaurs.

title: The plot thickens-?
text: We've all seen the Jurassic films and while this one might be the final film in the franchise, I really doubt we'll see an end to one dimensional tropes and overly noisy dinosaurs who never seem to catch their prey...The scenes are very tired like the cast, there's nothing new to see here, and even when one hopes to see something cool and fun, we are quickly reminded that the narrative follows what seems to be a very strict formula; human barely escapes from evil dinosaur.I'm more concerned with the code entry scene as to why Brundle Fly didn't try to enter 1138 as a code, or that being the code that worked. I mean, ANY Speilberg fan knows that 1138 is a requirement in his films. Anyway, it's a great one to watch with kids and for them its all new but honestly, it's a pretty good snore fest for a seasoned viewer.I'll give it three stars because 1 or 2 wouldn't leave room for complete trash films and Jurassic had money, good effects and known actors so a star for each. Otherwise, a useless film that is obsessed with it's former selves.So it's pronounced Jiggah-no-toe-sore-as not Gigah. It's also not the biggest carnivore, that's the blue whale. Plankton is still meat. Giga is also not the biggest dino either, not even the biggest carnivore. I was shocked that they got this wrong and I think it's because of Ark Survival the video game these mistakes were made. The largest carnivore in the dinosaurs is the Spinosaur, almost doubling the mass of a T-Rex.

title: Absolutely terrible
text: Even though I'd bought this movie from the Korean Google Play Store, I had to double check that it wasn't an Asylum cash grab rip-off. The plot is so contrived. The characters seem to wait around for the story to move and animate them. The CGI is only slightly better than The Amazing Bulk. Save your money, people. Maybe The Asylum's rip-off may be a better alternative this time around.

title: Everything I was hoping for and more...
text: My whole family went last night and all three generations loved it so much for different reasons. It was a beautifully shot movie with a very intricate and powerful story that perfectly combined both sets of cast members. I'm at a loss when reading the bad reviews as I feel like everyone in the theater agreed with us and was cheering along. Who are these haters?? Give it a chance, you won't be disappointed and go with friends and family, it's even more fun!

title: Horrifying in all the wrong ways
text: Horrible. Stupid. Bad. Almost funny, it is so poorly written and acted. I have to guess that the Director is responsible for the poor acting because most of the actors are usually quite talented. The script is horrible which most likely made the movie impossible to direct properly. So I am going to suggest that if you plan to sit through this piece of junk, have lots of snacks, and stay hydrated. I actually suggest watching with the volume down because visually it is not horrible.

title: So disappointed
text: Omg. Im so sad. Im a huge fan of these movies but this last was something else. No storyline for me, the script was bad, acting was average because of the script.The dinos looked different, they even moved weird at times if you pay attention.Idk, it was truly bad :((((

title: Alright Film
text: I completely understand what the crew were thinking and trying to do when they were creating this film but it did not exactly fully work. It was nice to see the original team back together and working with the new team. There was some room of improvement but it was still watchable. The storyline of this film was alright and original. The cast selection was great. They deeply committed and connected to the storyline and to their respective characters. The chemistry that was displayed throughout this film between the cast members was alright but could have been a lot better and stronger. This is an alright film for everyone to watch.

title: Not upto the mark
text: As a Jurassic World fan you expect more. The movie feels like its made for the sake of any formality or so. The special effects and cinematography could have been better. Storyline was good but lacked execution through the performances. The 3d visual effects were good though. All in all a one time watch.

title: NO ONE WATCH JURASSICPARK OR JURASSIC WORLD JUST FOR THE PLOT!!!
text: Enjoyed the CGI/VFX & obviously the DINOSAURS! For those who rate 1/10 and demand for a brilliant PLOT... Really?!!?!? The original Jurassic Park will always be NO.1. You watch Jurassic Park/World because you love the dinosaur vibes and action scenes. For those who demand plot, why bother watching in the first place. LOL! THERE ARE TONS OF MOVIE THAT PROVIDES YOU WITH BETTER PLOT MATE! Watch that instead yo.

title: Nothing but chaos
text: I finally was able to stream this movie and I was hoping the bad reviews were all exaggerating. They were not. I'm a huge fan of the Jurassic Parks. The Jurassic Worlds were never quite as good, but this one is a joke. It's nothing but chaos the entire time. The entire movie is dinosaurs chasing people in cars through cities and just all over. They introduced a lot of new dinos but only for a few minutes of screen time each. They were more focused on the prehistoric locusts for the storyline. There is a lack of the fun, excitement and any suspense that all the other movies have. How can there be any enjoyable suspense when it's just constant chaos and action scenes the entire time? What's sad is that the best part of this movie was Grant & Ellie still having love for each other. This movie is just bad.

title: A very pleasant surprise!
text: I saw the first Jurassic Park film at the cinema and have enjoyed subsequent Jurassic Park films to varying degrees over the years. Despite reading many negative reviews for this film beforehand, myself and my friend went to see this film with an open mind. Well, both of us couldn't be more pleased with this Jurassic film, in fact, for me, it was on par with the original in this franchise. The film touched on topics such as agri-business, illegal wildlife trade, unethical global corporations and power hungry billionaires, irresponsible use of bioengineering, corporation control of food production and access, and animal welfare and protection. I loved the humor, homages to previous Jurassic films (including Jeff Goldblum's propensity to baring his chest at inappropriate times in the first film) the heart-racing chase sequences and the exciting variety of dinosaurs, both familiar and those that had never appeared in this franchise before. I thoroughly enjoyed the dynamic between the principal cast members of the original and later Jurassic films, and found this a very satisfying conclusion to the Jurassic franchise. Well done!

title: Second disapoitmet this year
text: That about was story?!Texts was so bad.To much dinosors everthere. And winter?!Flaying bird under water?I now this is fantastic movie, but this to much.I was siting with my friend, waching, and both leave mad.

title: One Scene Embodies The Whole Film
text: You need to watch only one scene to understand how horrible this film is:A group of heavily armed men is facing down a group of dinosaurs who are all the same size as the men. Not one of them fires their gun to defend their own lives. Not one. They just stand there pointing their guns at each dinosaur, until each of the men gets predictably eaten. And the worst part is: You won't care. You're so done with this tedious, mind-numbingly stupid scene that you're wanting them all to be finished off as quickly as possible, so you can move on to the next scene in hopes that the plot will finally go somewhere and matter.And, of course, you get Owen Grady doing the "dinosaur whisperer" thing. Yet, after 3 movies, Owen is still not yet confident that his "trained" raptor won't eat him or his family at any given moment. And sadly, you wish that would happen, so you don't have to watch a dead-eyed Chris Pratt do that insufferable hand thing.

title: Giving 3 stars just because jurassic parks made my.childhood; but this movie is, unfortunately, another disaster
text: Hello to all Jurassic Park faks,Honestly, if your childhood is also "marked" with first 3 movies, that means that you have some affinity towards that "Dino stories", so as we all watched everything before, you should as I have, see this movie...but need to say: it is, once more, disappointing script and with all the budget really disappointing movie.It's nice to see all sortes of dinosaurus, but with some logic and concrete story behind, throughout movie...Love Chris Pratt and whole old cast, eventhough cannot say bad words about some new faces, but all in all: I'm sad that there's no really great scenario of Jurassic Park in this many years and that there is money but no really great movie like this...All in all, who loves Dino themes, will watch this as I had..what can we do

title: Another Jurassic hit!
text: This was better than the 2nd, on par with the first. Why the low reviews? The CGI was top notch as expected. The DNA plot line was a little confusing here as it was in the second one but they recapped it nicely. I love the addition of the older cast from the JP series. This had a very satisfying end to the series. What's next? A reboot?

title: Nostalgia factor doesn't make up for its shortcomings
text: You know those ideas that sound better than they actually are? 'Jurassic World: Dominion' falls into that category. I mean, what could be better than reuniting the two casts from the two trilogies in one of the most storied blockbuster franchises in cinematic history?While it's great to see Alan Grant (Sam Neil), Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) and Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) back together, it's fair to say it was at the expense of the plot of 'Dominion.' There's too much going on here, and when you consider the extended version, it's clear that a lot of the filler should have been left on the cutting room floor. Sure, Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard have more chemistry than the average onscreen duo, but many of the scenes featuring them could have been streamlined to have a more efficient story (e.g., the whole Malta situation). Same goes for the Tim Cook-esque Biosyn CEO, Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott).The CGI was great, as was the soundtrack. But 'Jurassic World: Dominion' was just too overproduced and over orchestrated, even if it was a likely end to the massive dino-centered series.

title: Movie Studio creates dinosaur franchise. Move studio destroys dinosaur franchise
text: The change to portraying the dinosaurs as monsters rather than animals is the biggest transgression of the sequels as it fundamentally changes the audience's point of view. In JP1 & 2 you're not privy to anything the characters aren't; you're going through the experience WITH them. That's a deliberate, important creative decision by Spielberg. From JP3 onwards you're on the side of the "puppeteers", to use a timely comparison. You're now (as a viewer) more omniscient, instead of sympathetic, it's criminal reallyAdditionally, Dominion was never going to be dinosaurs battling humans in New York City. It was something that, would honour Crichton's work a little bit more. I don't think he ever wrote a fantasy book.I think the he challenge for Trevorrow was getting to a place where the dinosaurs will be in this somewhat confined space, and obviously, still making sure all hell broke loose.For me, it's the second half of the movie when they started to converge in that environment. It may have been just because I did grow up on "Jurassic Park," but each of these films rely on the humans not being able to just call an Uber and get out of there.They have to be trapped in a confined space in order for the kind of sequences that these movies thrive on to exist. I also felt like we've been taken the on a journey that has a lot of new stuff in it in the first half. It's a lot of new ideas and new sequences. I felt, as we got toward the end of this meal that we'd been served, it was important to bring out some comfort dishes, and make sure that, as the characters collided with the "Jurassic Park" characters, it really felt like "Jurassic Park."

title: Awful, Just Awful
text: Not much for me to say honestly, this movie was a slick, templated film with very superficial everything from the acting, to the editing to the dinosaur fights. This movie has no substance and is more like a 3 hour music video, without the music though.Chris Pratt appears to always be in "velociraptor crouched trainer stance" like in every single scene. Not sure how that's even possible honestly but there's no acting effort on his part. Bryce Dallas Howard is decent but also, you can tell it's a dialed-in performance.There's tons of easter eggs and homages to the original but at some point, you start to get the impression every homage is just a lack of creativity on the part of the current director / writers. Like all the scenes are basically a reboot of part 1 with these characters.Avoid it like the plague. Go watch Guardians of the Galaxy or Terminal List instead.

title: Dominion is a satisfying conclusion to the series that goes out with a bang.
text: 5 out of 5 stars.Jurassic World Dominion is an awesome science fiction action film that ends the series in a high note. And takes the Jurassic Park film which it never has been there before. Feeling different from the previous films. Which some may enjoy or some will miss the nostalgia of being back in the island with dinosaurs.The plot follows with people trying to coexist with dinosaurs. Some are amazed by the creatures living among them. While others are breeding and using them for an evil agenda. The plot follows Owen (Chris Pratt) and Claire (Bryce Dallas Howard) who are living in hiding and trying to keep Maise (Isabella Sermon) safe. After the previous film and discovering her secret. While Ellie (Laura Dern) discovers prehistoric locusts that are destroying the farm fields and can be leading to our extinction. Which she enlists Alan (Sam Neill) and Ian (Jeff Goldblum) to help out and find out who is behind that. Which are the same people that Owen and Claire are looking for after they kidnap The raptor Blues baby.The plot has a couple of storylines that intercept and feels different than previous films. Which makes it feel like a globe trotting action thriller as Claire and Owen come across hybrid mixed raptors that are weaponized to attack certain people. Leading to a motorcycle chase scene in Malta.The action sequences are awesome. The visual effects are great. The cast ensemble is great. Its nice to see the original trio Sam Neill, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum back in action. I also love they brought one original character from the first movie back into the mix as a villain in this film. If your a fan of the series when the name is popped up. You will easily recognize. The film music score is also great.For a long running time with the movie. It does feel fast moving and short with the movie running into one action set piece to another. Overall, the film is one fun big blockbuster thats best to see on the big screen.

title: Disappointed
text: Once a gem, now a tragedy. The story is empty, baseless and pointless. The script is all over the show. I felt like a pinball ball while watching this movie. Good actors and I'm still wondering who talked them into getting involved with work so poorly constructed. Sad.

title: Wow. Just wow.
text: This was so awful. Same formula as every other Jurassic Park/World movie, just everything smashed into one. Along with a cloned person. I have never been to a movie where multiple groups of people walked out AND it was booed in the end by the remaining survivors ( not teenagers, either-- grown people) until now. Way to go Jurassic World.

title: Suuuuch a Missed Opportunity
text: One quick note before content review if you are thinking of going to see it in theaters. This movie is LOUD! Sound seemed to almost double once trailers ended and the movie started. At first, I thought it was because I hadn't been to theaters in a while but, everyone was saying the same thing as we were leaving. It felt like we just left an artillery range. They spent so much money on the earth trembles they want you to feel that they just crank the sound effects. YIKES!Now for content. Man, this was really disappointing. I didn't care for Fallen Kingdom but, I thought the premise that it set up for this movie seemed intriguing. It ended up really surprising me.....just not in a good way.I thought this had such potential to be the most unique sequel yet. Dinosaur roaming the earth? I figured they would lean in to Jeff Goldblum's "Life...has way" tag line (which they so heavily feature in trailers) to make it so dinosaurs started reproducing. Would we see an end of days scenario? Co-Existence? Not so much.They leaned HEAVILY into nostalgia. Which was kind of cool but, definitely can feel like the same story when....ya know....everything is the same.I don't consider this a spoiler since if is highly mentioned and reviewed but, man. The big bad threat being cross-engineered locusts instead of dinosaurs is legit the biggest let-down.I still like Pratt and it was cool seeing the original cast but, essentially everything outside of that felt like a major miss.

title: The OG Jurassic Park characters made it watchable
text: The plot of this one was pretty bad, but it was far from the worst movie of this trilogy. Like Jeff Goldblum was the main enjoyment of this movie. I did enjoy the callbacks to Jurassic Park, like this movie was all fanservice low substance.

title: Breataking
text: Twenty-nine years ago, when "Jurassic Park" was released, computer-generated and digitally composited effects were still relatively new, but director Steven Spielberg's team raised them to a new level of credibility by deploying them sparingly, often in nighttime and rainy scenes, and mixing them with old-fashioned practical FX work (mainly puppets and large-scale models). The result conjured primal wonder and terror in the minds of viewers. The T-Rex attack in particular was so brilliantly constructed and unrelentingly frightening that it put this writer sideways in his seat, one arm raised in front of his face as if to defend against a dinosaur attack. When there was a break in the mayhem, Spielberg cut to a very quiet scene, letting everyone hear how many people in the audience had been screaming in fright, which of course led to raucous laughter and a release of tension (a foolproof showman's trick). A small girl sitting near this writer regarded his still-terror-contorted body and asked, "Mister, are you all right?"There's nothing in "Jurassic World: Dominion" that comes close to that first "Jurassic Park" T-Rex attack, or any other scene in it. Or for that matter, any of the scenes in the Spielberg-directed sequel "The Lost World," which made the best of an inevitable cash-grab scenario by treating the film as an excuse to stage a series of dazzling large-scale action sequences, and giving Jeff Goldblum's chaos theorist Dr. Ian Malcolm the action hero job. Goldblum, who reprises his role in "Dominion" alongside fellow original cast members Sam Neill and Laura Dern, turned his "Lost World" performance into a wry-yet-cranky meta-commentary on corporate capitalism. For that matter, there's nothing in this new film as good as the best parts of "Jurassic Park III," "Jurassic World," and "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom," the latter which suffered from diminishing-returns syndrome, yet still managed to stage a crackerjack action scene or dino attack here and there. J. A. Bayona's mixed-bag "Fallen Kingdom," which provides literal as well as figurative DNA to the plot of "Dominion," had the most surprising pivots since the original, conjuring Spielbergian images of wonder (think of that mournful shot of the brachiosaur left behind on the dock) and mixing gothic horror and haunted house-movie elements into its second half. "Jurassic Park" creator Michael Crichton's original inspiration, Mary Shelley's Frankenstein, was referenced through the character of Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon), a clone created by John Hammond's business partner to replace the daughter that he lost.

title: Gone too far
text: I really liked the Jurassic Park trilogy, from then it's been downhill, and I hope this is the last we will see of these types of movies. People on foot being chased by velociraptors, really? At least have some integrity in a fiction story. Bike chases, overproduced cinematography and music.

title: Jurassic World Dominion? Not a fan.
text: Ever since dinosaur whisperer Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) first put out his hand to keep a vicious velociraptor at bay, the Jurassic Park/World franchise has been getting progressively worse. Pratt does a lot of the hand thing this time around, and it's as stupid as ever, but even if he kept his mitts firmly in his pockets, Dominion would still blow harder than that volcano in the last movie.This one has a plot that is so ridiculous that it feels like a parody at times: Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott), ruthless owner of genetics company Biosyn, has created prehistoric swarms of giant locusts designed to destroy all crops except for those grown from Biosyn seeds. Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) discovers what is happening and convinces Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) to help expose the plan; she, in turn, enlists the help of Alan Grant (Sam Neill). Yes, this one is so desperate it wheels in the three stars of the original Jurassic Park, who seem only too happy to cash a paycheck no matter how lousy the plot.Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard are also back, trying to find their adoptive daughter Maisie (Isabella Sermon), the dumb child who released dinosaurs to roam freely on Earth; she has been kidnapped by BioSyn, her special DNA required for further genetic experiments.I approached this film determined to not let a lack of logic prevent me from having fun, but that idea soon went the way of the dinosaurs: the film is so bad that no amount of giant lizard action could make it enjoyable. Stroppy kid Maisie is ultra-annoying, the giant locust plot is dumb, there's a really out-of-place action sequence involving laser-guided raptors, a feathered dinosaur flies underwater, and too much of the film is played for giggles. And then there's that scene where Owen puts his hand out to prevent a dinosaur from attacking, with both Maisie and Alan following suit: all three of them using the power of the hand was just too much for me.I pray that the franchise is now over, but I suspect that someone will dig it up in the future and bring it back to life.

title: 2:27 Too Long
text: Hard to describe just how bad this thing is. Its a franchise killer. The dialogue is truly awful, it lacks anything like a coherent story and you could drive a herd of dinos through the plot holes. Example: A C-119 Flying Boxcar cruising at 200 mph is attacked in the air by flying dinos which rip the airplane apart. Other than a diving peregrine, nothing in nature flies that fast. There is one ejection seat in the airplane and its not for the pilot. Huh? This type of airplane never had any ejection seats. Poor Claire is ejected out over snow covered mountains and lands in a tropical jungle. Its all beyond silly and unforgiveable.This whole film seems more concerned with diversity of characters (badass Asian woman, badass African American woman, etc) than it does with story and dialogue. The lines these poor women are expected to delivery are so corny that that they almost choke when trying to deliver them.The whole thing is sprinkled with lame self referential lines and scenes that splat on the floor like bad jokes. The writers and producers forgot what the films were truly about and defaulted to Indiana Jones rip off scenes and ludicrously evil, moustache twirling cartoon characters.Nothing about this film works and the creators and backers should be ashamed of themselves. Yuck.

title: Disappointing
text: Instead of choosing to focus on the amazing set up from the last film and answer some of the questions it raised as well, it just moved on to something different, raised all new questions and didn't even answer all of those either. Very disappointed.

title: A fitting conclusion to a streched franchise
text:
Friends, if you want to see a good movie with action, suspense, Sci-fi Jurassic World is a movie that deserves and must be seen!Chris Pratt one of my favorite actors plays Owen does a very good job in the movie!Bryce Dallas Howard a very good and beautiful actress, and a very important thing can run on heels;)
I don't know how to say but I swear that at some stages I was like I was there and when Indominus-Rex was around I was standing still, and I realized this only after the movie was over :)
The scene when Indominus-Rex fights Tyrannosaurus (T-Rex) and teams up with raptors (Blue) to defeat Indominus-Rex!I'm really sorry about the Raptor Pack
I really liked Blue, Echo, Delta and Charlie they really seemed to have their own personality!And the scene when they find out the plain with the dead Apatosaurus really saddened me :(
I won't say more just that the movie is great and you have to watch it whether you are a fan of dinosaurs or not!

title: Jaded and rehashed.
text: This is two hours and twenty seven minutes you won't get back in your life. The actors must have cringed just reading the screen play but obviously needed the dollars to go ahead with acting in this jaded and rehashed tripe. This franchise has been sliding down a steep slope after the original Jurassic Park movie. The plot holes are many and vast. The acting laughable. The action set pieces unoriginal and tedious. Sat down to watch this during Father's Day lunch and the only saving grace was that we all had a laugh at the ludicrity of it all. Hopefully, this is the end of this franchise. They have milked all they could have from this particular cowasaurus.

title: Bad, bad, bad, bad!
text: This is bad, so bad I'm writing this review instead of watching the rest of it. It has bad acting, bad story, bad continuity, bad characters and even bad cgi/models. I love the Jurassic franchise but this is bad! Very bad! Very very bad! I will say it entertaining in some sort of way... it made me think of different way I could blind myself so I didn't have to watch it anymore. I have decided the best way would be to use mine and my wife's straws and just stab them hard and fast straight into them!

title: A thoroughly enjoyable conclusion to the Jurassic saga.
text: Jurassic World Dominion might not be THE best of the franchise, but it is what it intends to be: a good follow-up and conclusion to the original story. The film has a lot of excellent action sequences, especially the one involving a bike. The pacing is also good, even though the tempo infrequently drops a bit. Seeing it in 3D was another plus, as the film features gorgeous locales and eye-popping visual effects. It intends to be a fun popcorn action movie for the family this summer, and succeeds in being so. Take your kids and friends along for this ultimate dinosaur action entertainer and the film will keep you thoroughly entertained just like the previous ones.

title: So thin on plot I can't even call this a movie.
text: It's hard to put into words just how bad this "film" is. So I'll try to summarize it in bullet points...There are only 2 reasons to watch this movie... 1, if you like badly animated CGI dinosaurs. Or 2, if you have a crush on one of the cast. That said, reason 2 seems unlikely given the level of mediocrity involved in this project.Not even bringing back the original "Jurassic Park" cast could save this one. The question is no longer if the dinosaurs should be left to die... it's now firmly that the franchise should be left to die.

title: These filmmakers were so preoccupied with whether or not they could make this movie that they didn't stop to think if they should.
text: Jurassic World Dominion is the empty husk left from this once great franchise that I grew up absolutely loving. The opening sequence feels like it was thrown together by the film studio at the last possible minute and really sets the tone for just how bad this movie is overall. The first Jurassic trilogy had so much heart, and Spielberg was masterful in the way he immersed the audience in the adventure, thrills, & terror that his characters endured on Islas Nublar & Sorna. His stories were believable because they tried to stay grounded in reality. His dinosaurs were nuanced in the sense that they weren't just some psychotic monsters hell-bent on killing everything in sight. They were living creatures full of curiosity & instinct that had their own wants and needs. Jurassic World & Fallen Kingdom really lowered the bar for that experience with the Indominus Rex & Indoraptor - a pair of psychotic movie monsters hell-bent on killing everything in sight. That leads us to Dominion where Trevorrow gives us the Atrociraptors - psychotic movie monsters hell-bent on destroying half of Malta to...you guessed it...kill everything in sight. That whole second act felt so unnecessary to advance the plot (though it's possible that global Covid restrictions may have been a factor). And that's only one small scene from this movie. Jurassic World Dominion is such a chaotic mess that throws the audience from one insane situation to another without ever really tying it all together into a cohesive story that could be remotely believable. The movie feels like it was trying to be more of a Marvel flick than a Jurassic Park movie. Honestly I can't remember the last time I've seen a film that was edited so poorly. What's frustrating is that underneath all of the absurdity, there is a good movie in there somewhere. The scenes that were cut and shared online as promotional material are proof of that. It was just jumbled together in such a haphazard way that the immersion is completely lost because the story is completely rushed from start to finish and crammed full of unnecessary characters. Characters come and go in the blink of an eye and are never seen again. Everyone's motivations feel so hollow & superficial because this story has heroes & villains rather than nuanced characters. The OG cast felt completely out-of-place throughout the movie (with the possible exception of Ellie). I still have no idea what Allen Grant & Ian Malcolm were even doing there. How does one go from paleontology one day to corporate espionage the next? Honestly, the original cast felt like they were just shoehorned into this movie for the trailers - which spoiled 90% of the film btw. That's no exaggeration. There were no surprises whatsoever, and every scene was predictable from start to finish. This is in such stark contrast to the theatrical trailers I grew up seeing for Jurassic Park in 1993. The only glimpse audiences ever got of that Tyrannosaurus Rex was a foot in the mud. And for good reason. That scene WOWED audiences like no movie had ever done before or since. There's a reason why 30 years later, JP is still considered one of the greatest films ever made. The thought of Universal spoiling that scene is unimaginable. When did Hollywood become this incompetent? Even Blue felt shoehorned into this movie for nostalgic purposes, and the Jurassic World trilogy has anthropomorphized that raptor to the point that she's barely a dinosaur anymore. To be fair I think Colin Trevorrow really tried to make a decent movie, and it shows during the third act which was the only redeeming portion of the film. But somewhere along the line, I think the studio got ahold of his movie and whittled it down to the soulless husk of generic Hollywood blockbuster that it is today. It feels like this movie was written by a committee of teenagers. I pray there is a director's cut out there that can one day redeem this film. Otherwise, JW Dominion was the final straw that convinced me that it's probably time for the Jurassic franchise to go extinct. I can't believe I said it.

title: Y'all need to chill. It's a fab Dino movie!
text: All these reviews are expecting what? Something more not so make believe?? What did you expect?? It's a freaking dinosaur movie lol if you didn't like the other Jurassic movies then don't bother with this one. But if you felt entertained and had a good time watching fake Dinos do their thing then go see it! It was predictable of course but come on!!!! It was super cool seeing all the original characters and meet the new ones. And they tied up all the lose ends really well. I enjoyed it a lot. So fun.

title: This movie is made for children.
text: I am sure kids that think dinosaurs are cool will love it. Watching as an adult its just cringe, hollywood copypaste scenes, awful writing and filled with plotholes. End this move-series for good now please.

title: Everything about this movie is beyond dumb
text: I don't get it. When you go watch a movie like this you want to see dinosaurs, that's the whole charm about them, yet the "main villains" are humans and insects?Why in the living hell would I want to see humans run around shooting at each other in a world where there are T. Rexes?The animation of the dinosaurs is also awfully bad, way worse than in the first Jurassic World and faaaaaar worse than the original Jurassic Park.I just don't understand how a movie like this fails to provide good scenes with dinosaurs, that's literally the bare minimum of what you want.This movie has absolutely nothing going for it. Bad plot, cheap milking of old actors, poor CGI, barely acceptable acting, just everything about this movie screams low quality.

title: Absolute nonsense

text: I have been watching all the recent movies but this one is just bad. Coincidence after coincidence. Terrible dialogue. Crappy jokes. Too much... I will not return (at least paying) for a new movie.

Story isn't to bad, Chris Pratt, and Brice Dallas Howard are awesome yet again but what was amazing was seeing Sam Neil, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum together again.

Just when ya think its safe to watch another Jurassic movie....
This was a cash run pure and simple. I hope it flops. The story was weak and boring. I turned it off halfway through and forced myself to finish it the next day. Goldblum, Dern and Neil were great but there was no saving this disaster of a movie. Terribly disappointing.

title: So poorly written it made it unwatchable

The CGI was garbage the 1st one from 30 years ago looks more realistic. So cringy, Felt like we were watching a B movie. Shut it off after 30/40 minutes... could not continue. Waiting for my email from Amazon so I can request a refund lol. Everyone that had anything to do with making this movie should be ashamed of themselves.

title: Script? What script?
text: Really, how this movie got approved?You could have give me that money. I'd had put it to a better end (spoiler, it might be beer)And that's all. Don't watch it sober. Or do it, at your own risk.

title: Good Fun

title: Bad Bad Bad Oh So Very Bad
text: Everything is bad! The Acting is Bad! The Effects are Bad! The Storyline is bad! The directing is bad! The Makeup and Costume is bad! The plot is just bad! The Script is bad! The Lighting is bad! The Everything is bad! Bad! Bad! Bad! title: The Ultimate disapointment
text: I won't go into details, this movie was incredibely underwhelming and the plot is terrible. There are some good cinematic shots and the old jp crew is back, this is all I can say positively. Every part of the movie is just a huge miss and zero satisfaction. I won't spoil it but let's just say the Giga scenes are terrible, literally acts like it's blind or just doesn't know what he wants to do.

title: I'd hoped for dumb fun but I just got the dumb part with no fun.
text: I didn't enjoy Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom and it was a sign that this franchise had run it's course. Dominion is the final nail in the coffin in what I'd hoped would be a fun film with plenty of dinosaur action, a sense of danger and adventure and a few callbacks to the first film seeing as the original cast were brought back.Well the film delivers on very little of that, the plot is not only ridiculous but it's also very boring and never takes off. I'm just expecting a film on par with Jurassic Park here, it's never going to happen but in an attempt to try and bring something new to the franchise Dominion has lost all sense of why I've enjoyed most of the sequels.It reminds me a bit of Star Wars The Last Jedi, a film that wanted to be so radically different from any other Star Wars film that it lost sight of what I enjoy about these films. Also same with Shane Black's The Predator from 2018, stop trying to drastically change the formula so much to the point where we're paying to see a film that's not how it's been marketed as at all.When you watch a Jurassic film you want a sense of dread and danger as we wonder who will meet a cruel fate next to one of the dinosaurs and who will survive and escape. I don't want boring subplots about a kidnapped girl who is a clone of some character that we see for the first time in this film. It's a waste of time in a film that's already overlong and overstuffed with filler. Without sounding old and cynical I miss the days of the briskly paced Lost World and Jurassic Park 3. Heck Dominion doesn't even feel like a conclusive chapter or has any sense of finality to the 6 films.I'd say don't waste your time and money, if you want to watch a Jurassic film you're better off just watching any of the other films (except maybe Fallen Kingdom) or watching Prehistoric Planet if you want a dinosaur fix. Dominion is a dull, soulless cash-grab of a sequel that fails to conclude these films in a satisfying way and as a standalone film it lacks the fun and thrills of previous sequels in the franchise.

title: The worst dino film with literally no dinos!
text: This one is very very late but with all the travelling in the last two weeks, I didn't find the time. But there is a reason why I had to write about Dominion. Because it is a disaster of Jurassic proportions!Jurassic World: Dominion is set a few years after the events of Fallen Kingdom. The dinosaurs are living among humans now. Some are at peace but there are many who have been subjected to cruelty. Biosyn, a tech company provides a home in the mountains for the rehabilitated dinos but they do not seem to have the best interests in mind (read locusts).Jurassic Park (the original, the one and only) was one of a kind. Despite being made in the 90s, the film is a marvel even today. None of the movies that came after could beat that. It has a lot to do with the novelty factor that the animals hold. You see it once and you are in awe (like Ellie Satler and Alan Grant were in the original). You watch it 5 more times and you are basically suffering from dino fatigue. Dominion makes it even worse by reducing the number of dinos onscreen in the finale.The return of the legacy characters is a relief given the odd chemistry Bryce Dallas Howard and Chris Pratt share. Sam Neill and Laura Dern are the only redeeming factors of this sequel (apart from that perfectly choreographed bike chase scene in Malta). Even Jeff Goldblum seems to be lost. DeWanda Wise, Mamoudou Athie, BD WONG, Omar Sy & Isabella Sermon co-star.In a year filled with sequels, Jurassic World: Dominion is extremely disappointing. I went in with zero expectations and came out realising that I should have gone in with lower.

title: As expected BS
text: Well, as expected, this was not just bad, it was really really bad. They brought all the original cast ( not sure how they could have agreed to this ) just to attract some audience. It was enough for me to watch the first 20 minutes, to confirm my expectation was right, stupid silly story, even the action scenes we're just bad, poor cast performance, even from the original cast. End in the end I managed to watch half of the movie when I had to switch off. This can be added to the list of worst movies of 2022, plus list of worst movies of all time. And pls Hollywood, get something original, it's been a while.

title: Made with no soul or understanding.
text:
So, let's do another Jurassic movie. Let's make the creatures bigger, let's have more of them. Let's do away with any sense of reality at all. Story? Plot? Doesn't matter. All we need is dinosaurs various running riot, eating and trampling everyone in their wake. Anything else is superfluous.And there you have it - Jurassic World: Dominion.From the opening scene you don't buy into the creatures, the characters or any of the situations they get themselves into. In short it's a near two and a half hour bore-athon. The real shame is that actors who created characters the audience cared about signed up for this over-bloated nonsense.Dear moviemakers:
The story is the star of the show NOT the CGI. Please learn.

title: Fun Friday evening flick
text: Too many wanna-be film critics on here expecting every movie to be the next shawshank redemption. Take it for what it is - fun, predictable adventure movie with dinosaurs. It's not trying to take you on an emotional roller-coaster or keep you in constant suspense. I enjoyed it, and if you will go into it expecting it to be similar to the first 2 instalments of Jurassic World - you won't be disappointed.

title: Horrible!!!
text: Horrible movie to end the series and just a bad movie in general. Don't waste your time on this one as it's the same plot as always amd even less for that matter.Mind numbingly boring.

title: "Jurassic World? Not a fan."
text: They don't care. They really just don't care, about anything. Not about you, not about the franchise, they don't even care about their own film. Jurassic World: Dominion is regurgitated spam, a big ole' bloated helping of upchucked talking points, character beats, and faces from nearly thirty years ago. The direction is weak, the script is laughable, and the CGI is well below mediocre for a tentpole film as big as this.Dominion represents a new creative low for the franchise, impressive considering the entire trilogy has been overseen by Colin Trevorrow, a useless hack who will soon be seeking to ruin some other poor franchise which should've been put out of its misery a long, long time ago. No, I did not like the film.The film follows the familiar cast of characters as they journey to another goddamn island to be chased by more goddamn dinosaurs. There's another goddamn tech billionaire who's keeping the goddamn things thriving for his own purposes. In the end we all learn a lesson or two about family, togetherness, and swallowing that tasty, tasty corporate sludge so no one asks why gas is five dollars a gallon right now. There's also a swarm of mutant locusts.It should be noted that while the film's general laziness and indifference aren't anything out of the ordinary for this new corporate Hollywood, they also aren't quite out of line for the Jurassic Park franchise. The first film is an undisputed modern classic, a watershed film for the art and appliance of computer-generated effects and a masterclass in how to properly integrate them into a grounded yet thrilling story. Every sequel is middling at best, though its interesting to observe and analyze just how these new films are terrible.It's ironic that the new trilogy is so ungrounded (every character impossibly strong, fast, and knowledgeable) because the first film is close to reality. It's a rather small story, with charmingly mild character growth and a subtle message on human arrogance as it pertains to our place in the natural order. These qualities are subdued and nearly overwhelmed in the original sequels, but they manage to hang by a thread. The most embarrassing moment in the original trilogy is not the talking dinosaur; it's a moment in The Lost World, when a small child saves the day with the power of gymnastics. It's an outlier in the original trilogy, a quick lapse of judgement and a momentary release on the material.The Jurassic World trilogy, the latter two films especially, use this embarrassing outlier as their genetic code. They're poorly thought out, shockingly ungrounded, and tonally at odds with the danger presented. The new trilogy is an endless loop of that dinosaur being kicked out of a window, only here it's the audience being pushed out, and not by a little girl, but by an empty-headed hack who must've gained all of his film writing knowledge from masterclasses like Star Trek Discovery and Picard. More on him in just a moment.It's difficult to pinpoint exactly where Dominion first stumbles, and why it's so easy to hate. The whole thing is just so dumb. Few characters act with sufficient motivation, but they do possess the uncanny ability to escape every situation unscratched. Hiding from dinosaurs while awed by their presence makes sense.Fighting with dinosaurs toe to toe, or running from them on their own terms, makes far less sense and requires a fun-killing level of suspension of disbelief. Dominion, of course, usually opts for the latter. The best sequences in the film involve characters knowing their outmatched and simply hiding and praying for their lives. It's refreshing to see the film gets back to basics, but these sequences are few and far between.Aside from ludicrous yet lackluster action, Dominion skirts dangerously close to Transformers territory in its commitment to bland, impersonable characters. It was already difficult to care about Chris Pratt's Owen and Bryce Dallas Howard's Claire when they were new and fresh. Now they're old and purposeless, so it's impossible to muster up any sort of connection.To be fair, none of the new characters foster any sort of connection either; even old newcomers Sam Neill and Laura Dern feel like little more than set decoration. The only performer who sparks some quasi-joy is Jeff Goldblum, and even he looks disinterested in the surrounding events. There's just no sense of personality, professionalism, or agency. Even the original Jurassic Park isn't character-driven, but the audience is at least invested in whether or not Grant and Sattler are eaten alive by dinosaurs. Not so here.As mentioned, there is no directorial grasp on the material. Colin Trevorrow, back in the director's chair, can't skate by this time on the novelty of the franchise's revival or the creation of yet another big-bad to fight our friend the T. Rex. Admittedly, the Indominus Rex was cool, the babysitter's death was funny, and, hell, I even liked those big glass balls. But there's no novelty in Dominion. Trevorrow must try to direct while holding our gaze and fails miserably.His film oscillates between James Wan people-tiptoeing-around-to-hide-from-things-that-are-only-a-foot-away-from-them style boredom and Roland Emmerich nonsensical-mayhem-our-protagonists-dive-through-unharmed-even-though-we-don't-care-if-they-live-or-die-in-the-first-place style indifference. I longed for J. A. Bayona, who was at least kind enough to stylize the stupidity of Fallen Kingdom. Trevorrow brings no tension, no stakes, no passion, and no awe. Under his guidance, Dominion finally manages to make dinosaurs feel downright mundane. Congrats, Trevor.Is there anything to like? Well...there are two cool shots involving a new dinosaur baddie and one of the early chase sequences seems like it would've been fun on paper, though the execution screws the pooch. Goldblum is kinda' fun and there's a myriad of great-looking animatronics, especially those built to be menacing and not cutesy. So, to summarize: two cool shots, a theoretically cool chase, Goldblum, and some sparingly used but neat animatronics. That's what your ticket is paying for.Jurassic World: Dominion may be the final film in the Jurassic Park franchise. Good riddance. Absolutely nothing, in five full films, has given credence to the idea of expanding the original book or film. On the other hand, the film has already made good money after only two weeks in theaters, so audiences may be treated to yet another rehash of long-stale themes, characters, and dinosaur roars. Whatever the case, no matter which direction the franchise takes, or how long the initial impact of the first film remains in the minds of those who love it, one thing certainly remains clear: movies suck now.

title: It's a hodgepodge of nonsense
text: I can't believe people actually liked this movie. It has so many plot holes. Writers (people in general also) have lost all their imagination. This movie used a generic template/format, and then they came up with nonsensical ideas to fill the gaps. It's a terrible terrible movie. The only thing that's decently done is the cgi.I feel like they're insulting their viewers' intelligence. The first 5 minutes is so stupid and ridiculous, it hard to watch.

title: Can the plot be any more stupid.
text: Dinasoeurs in the cold, where is their food source and Dumb plot if you can get past all the stupidity then i guess movie okay? How is this a 5.7 reviewed on average?

title: If you have watched the older Jurassic park movie...then you will get it
text: I think this was very entertaining, actions packed film. There was some Jason Bourne moments in there too. Also this movie honor the legacy jurassic park movies. The movie was well balanced...well directed...the new & OG actors did a good  job.

title: So bad i had a fight with my wife
text: It was so bad that my wife came out of the theater in a really bad mood and we had a fight because of the bad tension. Two hours full of action but still superficial and empty.

title: Please Let This Franchise Go The Way Of The Dinosaurs
text: I have to admit that I did not finish the film. 40 minutes in I decided that I'd prefer to spend the remaining time doing anything else but watching this disaster.Why?...and on and on and on.While I did not expect much from this film (I read other reviews), I was surprised at how bad it was. If you are an "older" fan of the franchise (like myself) I suggest you save yourself the disappointment and take a pass - its not worth your time. The film was made by "children" for children. Much like most of the big-budget films these days, this movie is basically a collection of mindless action scenes bridged by slower scenes where dumb ideas are expressed via thoughtless, predictable, unintelligent dialogue. Some of the writing and/or acting sequences that do not involve dinosaurs are so ridiculous and implausible that they dismantle any hope of retaining the suspension of disbelief necessary to enjoy this type of film - and that is saying something given the overall subject of the franchise.I gave it three stars because the dinosaurs look good.

title: Avoid it at all costs.
text: Chris "Marlboro-man" doing the same jedi-like gesture every 5 minutes.Constant beyond-absurd dialogues and situations, so much and so many that I was feeling violent (either the plot is written by idiots or they pretend the viewer is one).It is so bad that makes Jurassic Park 3 look good.Disney did not learn the "bigger doesn't mean better" after the last SW trilogy, but they keep using the same strategy again and again... Another saga destroyed by the mouse/rat, not that it is going to surprise anyone at this point, but still sad.I had more than enough of this studio, I have given them too many opportunities already. Don't count with my money for future SW, Marvel, Indiana Jones, Jurassic Park/World, ... "movies"

title: Shame......
text: Its a shame it has come to this, back to 1993 I for one, couldn't wait to get to the cinema to witness the moment of seeing any dinosaurs let alone the fabulous T rex, it was magical. Fast forward 29 years & we arrive with this absolute junk. Bad plot story acting everything, I give up. I don't know how they managed to fill 180 minutes worth of dribble into a film, I knew the reviews going into it weren't great but thought we had to finish it, thankfully all the cast were together so that should be it now. In my opinion they should of stopped at Lost World, & left it with the credibility it deserves.

title: It's rare i feel the need to write a review
text: But omg this has to be the worst movie that has come out so far in 2022! Baring the CGI which was pretty good (and the only reason its not 1 star), everything was off. The story was bland, the bad guy was so generic with no motive apart from "control" it was laughable, the acting was wooden, the plot holes were massive... i could go on but theres no point. Give it a miss and let the franchise die its already far too slow and painful death. They should have left it at Jurassic World as a 1 off callback then called it a day.

title: Pray for extinction of this franchise!
text: When a movie franchise starts to rehash pretty much everything from its past movies and can't decide if it's a Dinosaur thriller or a lame version of James Bond film, you know it's time to give it a rest.The opening scene which features a voiceover recapping previous storylines sets up (or down) what's ahead. It's signalling just how bad this is going to be. This movie is so unbelievably boring, despite having probably the most stunning special effects of all the series. It could have been so good with that budget but halfway through gets hijacked by an absurd sub-plot about a bunch of baddies engaging in illegal animal trading. The sub-plot then takes over and it morphs into a by-the-numbers shoot 'em up gangster tale. The acting is hilarious, especially by the bleach blonde head gangster. She almost single handedly sinks the film on first appearance. She looked like she'd just popped in from the next-door studio set of Interview with a Vampire, minus the teeth. Come to think of it, adding a vampire twist could have been fun!I'm not sure how many writers were involved in this disaster (oh yes...there's also another sub-plot about Climate Change) but it appears they herded a bunch of them who were all working on different movie scripts into a room and instructed them to meld them all together to create 'Dominion'. Unfortunately they didn't unleash the dinosaurs into that room.The absolute mess this film turns out to be could possibly have been slightly bearable if it wasn't so excruciatingly boring. That's the kiss of death for any movie.What's next in this franchise? Sending them all into Space? Hopefully Elon Musk will go with them and we'll never hear from any of them again.

title: Just no
text: The plot was poorly written and the acting was terrible. It was also slow and just dumb. It became boring and as it dragged on, the plot just didnt make any sense, nor did it get any better when you combine previous characters with new. Just not worth it!

title: Don't look at others reviews, decide for yourself
text: I thought this movie was very well done. They did a terrific job paying homage to the original Jurassic Park and their cast as well as the new movies of Jurassic Park. While some of the scenes were not believable you have to let that go because we're watching a movie about dinosaurs so everything is on the table with this type of movie. I don't believe other peoples reviews, make your own opinions. This movie did a very good job of sending off the old cast and paving the way for the new. The visual effects are absolutely breathtaking, the plot and there is a plot was rather well done. The movie was rather enjoyable for myself and my family and who doesn't love dinosaurs? I hope you enjoy the movie.

title: Disappointing
text: Watchable but it felt like they had ideas, threw them at a canvas and said "that will do".Was so looking forward to this but I walked away wondering why they bothered making it.A movie for the sake of a movie.

title: PREHISTORIC KFC FEAST
text: I watched it today on IMAX. Rollicking good fun. Very much tongue in cheek. You can see that the cast had a ball with barely suppressed laughter and twinkles in their eyes throughoutTreat it like a KFC fast food feast and not a corden bleu meal you won't be sorry. Definitely not to be treated as serious faire!Certainly a lot more fun than Top Gun.

title: Bad graphics
text: Dinosours in older movies look more real. Baby blue looks %100 digital. This movie shows more human scenes than Dinosaurs. Honestly I do not like the raptors can understand humans and be controlled by them as well.

title: High on budget, low of delivery
text: It's a pointless attempt at a money grab.It's just hundreds of mediocre scenes cobbled together to make a film.You have animatronics that look out of place alongside the CGI.You have actors delivering lines meant to be funny but they are like your mate making small talk before grabbing a mini sausage roll, at a cocktail party, and going "uh huh" as if he's listening but he's not really.You have action scenes that you have seen a thousand times before. There is nothing original in this.You have animals behaving in very peculiar ways.You have moral messages littered throughout with a final sign off at the end that was so crap that one has to think, right do you know what I want to do after watching this film is co-exist with a lion. No they will kill you.All this is is a fulfilment of a contract. No one looks like they care or are bothered and they want to make this thing, get paid and move on.At least Sam Neil (and the old gang) are trying.He's the best thing in it but then it's like feeling sorry for a diamond stuck in a pile of turd. You want to pull it out, give it a clean and put it in a wonderful set of jewellery but you can't cos it's a film on telly and it's not real (and it was his fault for accepting to do it - but you know why not, money's good).If all you want to do is completely switch off your brain and go on your phone, this may be a passable waste of time when stuck on in the background.Other than that, it's just watching money being spent really badly.The script is dire. It's a joke that lacks a punchline.So yes, do watch.

title: GIANT disappointment
text: I bought this ticket coming off the high from Top Gun. Where they nailed nestslgia, Jurassic failed miserably. I'm ashamed I spent my money on it and I recommend you don't. And it was so freaking loud and unnecessarily violent. Bottom line is they knew they could make a good trailer and make all their money regardless of what the movie turned out to be. I'm almost without words. It was actually terrible. Might even be a 2. Trust everyone on here, don't see it.

title: Loud and Stupid
text: Super loud action scenes mixed with idiotic script. Worst of the series by far. My review is too short, or Amazon thinks you are too stupid to understand something simple like, this movie sucks.Still too short. It rained today. Got a delivery, but don't know who sent it. It's candy so who really cares?Anyone else watch Korean shows on Netflix? It's all they recommend now, which is dumb.Been reading books on my tablet since Covid. Now I hardly ever go to the library. I love the adjustable print size.Cake is good. Taxes are bad. Cake tax is the worst.Watching the Super Bowl or just the commercials? I haven't watched in years and don't miss it.YEAH! 800 characters! Do I win something?

title: SPIRITLESS CASH GRAB!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
text: Jurassic World Dominion is the equivalent to the Roland Emmerich film Moonfall. Its big, loud and dumb and has plot I guess.... but it don't matter cuz look at the shiny new visual!! But it still takes some brains to make that kind of blockbuster, Dominion however is overly long, made up of contrivances and coincidences, repeats the same old story which has been done to death and by the end leaves you with little to no recollection of what happened and did it even matter??So Dominion picks up after the events of Fallen Kingdom, four years to be precise.. after the destruction of Isla Nublar, dinosaurs have been freed and now live and hunt alongside humans all over the world. Now humans and dinosaurs live together in this big blue planet. If anyone remembers.. the clone daughter Maisie Lockwood from the previous one is now living with Chris Pratt and Dallas Howard's character. But she isn't allowed to go outside because she is a clone and some people might just have sinister interests with her and her genetics.Sam Neil and Laura Dern return as their iconic characters from the first one. Jeff Goldblum is present too so the original die hard fans will have something to look at.The plot as is the norm with these blockbusters these days is needlessly convoluted, Maisie gets kidnapped so Pratt goes on a globe trotting rescue mission to save her, meanwhile dangerous genetically modified locusts are destroying all harvests and crops of the planet and Ellie Sattler is here to investigate and drags Alan Grant along.Campbell Scott who played Peter Parker's dad in The Amazing Spiderman films plays a brilliant scientist who does some genetic research on the modification of genes to cure cancer and stuff. Yep pretty much the same character from those films. He heads Biosyn another evil corporation who has control over the dinosaurs and their living and everything. And if you are wondering what about the free roaming dinosaurs on our planet? Well don't worry because there isn't anything going on.Yep they did it in the previous one but didn't have the creativity to back it up so once again there are dinosaurs running around mostly in closed environments and humans are running and so on and so forth. There is one good chase sequence in a bazaar that keeps you entertained .A huge chunk of this film is dedicated to having the Maisie Lockwood plot running all over, but they fail to really ever give her any personality or character traits with which we can connect with you know like everyone did with the characters of the first one?Speaking of legacy characters Sam Neil as Alan Grant and Laura Dern as Ellie Sattler are having fun and Jeff Goldblum seems to be having a great time. Easily the most fun you can have is with him. The rest of the cast are decent and Chris Pratt carries the film some way but even he cannot take on the messy plot coincidences, overused CGI, boring characters and a stale, done to death storyline of Jurassic Park.The movie has been assembled pretty well with some decent sequences here and there, but its runtime is way too long. The biggest problem is that there is hardly anything to grasp at in this overkilled franchised that should have been extinct after the second part itself. Nothing new, crazy or even half memorable in this new installment. Just pretty stuff to look at, eat your popcorn, clap and consume and move on. The seemingly bland cinematography and a generic bland score doesn't help the cause at all.There isn't much to say well because Dominion doesn't give you anything to say!, Its your dumb blockbuster to which everyone is already numb too, following tropes and beats all too familiar this is well and truly what you call forgettable trash!

title: Very disappointed...this film is almost a parody of itself
text: I'm a huge Jurassic park fan. I have watched the original movie over 400 times. I also liked lost world and Jurassic world. The rest were average at best.Dominion is near the bottom of that list unfortunately. The plot is downright idiotic and all the main characters have plot armour. The fights between the dinosaurs were among the worst I've ever seen. Seriously, who decided that ending fight should play out that way? I was shaking my head in disbelief.The only good thing about the movie was seeing the original cast together again. But the plot doesn't do them any favours.Every scene fumbles onto the next with dinosaurs doing exactly what's required for plot convenience even when it makes absolutely no sense.This is a popcorn movie through and through. Leave your brain at the door and you might be entertained. Keep your expectations low.

title: Love it!
text: I don't know what's everyone's problem, but I love it. It felt like 1993 again and I enjoy every minute of it. Absolutely love that they use some old references, and scenes. It was fun, and dinamic. Besides old and new gang who was excellent, pilot woman was great too.

title: Fails to Amaze Again w/ goofy story and dialogue
text: The trailer promised dinosaurs interacting with the human world and exploring those problems, but most of the film takes place in a jungle by itself once again. The trailer clearly showed a scene with a T-Rex in a drive in & that was all I wanted to see... the scene isn't in the film. Somehow the film both tries too hard (with an overly complicated story) and doesn't try hard enough (failing to give any mystery to any of the dinosaurs, failing to be a horror movie once again like the original). The first few moment of the film just throws a huge sea dinosaur at your in a wide shot, nothing like the sense of fear or wonder Spielberg created, no tension or anticipation... just a big dinosaur thrown at you. Boring mood, boring camera coverage, characters are merely inconvenienced by their danger not in constant awe at how amazing the situation is. Characters regularly put themselves in danger, acting like superhero's instead of just people who get in sticky situations... which is what we come to see. Few characters do anything clever to escape their situation, mostly just end up accidentally getting out without much effort. Lots of the film is sidelined by a Bourne Identity rip off feel, having characters needlessly jumping on fancy roofs instead of just setting it in everyday settings. The bad guy is another rip off of Steve Jobs. All the bad guys are super cartoonish super villains for some reason. All the actors are trying & most succeed in holding their own, but it just doesn't have any spirit, sense of wonder, horror or well coordinated scenarios. I'm done with this franchise. I'll always love the original, but I'm embarrassed for all involved with this film taking down the name and classic status of the original. I wish Spielberg had taken care of his legacy here instead of letting others rip it apart. Jurassic World had some good ideas, many from him, but it totally fell apart.

title: Long, and boring
text: This moves like 3 hours long with previews. And it's mind-numbingly dumb action and plots. And never really stops or slows down but it's just stupid things that never really keep my interest. It's literally 3 hours of... Oh hey we have to turn on the radar so we can fly away from the dinosaurs... Oh for the next 30 minutes we have to find the key that opens the door to the room where we can turn it on... Oh the key is left in the building that's at the end of a river. And then in between each of these is a little dinosaur incident. Very long and stupid and boring. And I'm not one to not like a good action movie.

title: About 30 minutes into it .. ugh .. more narcissistic woketardism
text: Will there ever again be movies that aren't infested with self important narcissistic characters and woketard scripts? The only thing missing were gender fluid dinosaurs .. ugh i left the theater as i couldnt bear watching it ...

title: An amazing ending to the franchise
text: I love it woth all my heart. Actually, it was clear to me that everyone involved in this project put their heart on it. One of the most respectful things screenwriters and director did was to reunite the old cast and the new one, and I mean really get them all together at some point so that all of them were in this same adventure. That's what to do when you bring an old classic into life. I find it respectful to the fans. And the dinos are great!!! So many amazing sequences I can't pick one as a favourte. The T-Rex cameo appearance in a reference to the old logo was great! I love every line, every reference (full pack fan service) and all the characters - from both trilogies. I'll be forever thankful to Spielberg for guiding this project and have this team to make it real.

title: Thank God for beer @ the movies
text: This was quite possibly the biggest money grab since Caddyshack 2. Just when you thought Jurassic Park Lost World was the biggest pile of stegosaurus dung ever created, the franchise said "wait, hold my beer". Seriously the best part of this movie was the slime that ran down the T-Rexs neck after eating a deer. The not so subtle nods to the original were cool but came off stronger than a frat boy with a bottle of Jack Daniels at a college kegger. Like I said thank God they served beer or otherwise I'd have given it a 1 star. RIP Jurassic Park.

title: Left the cinema 30min. before the end
text: Read the 1 to 3 stars reviews and believe everything that has been written.This movie is an all around disaster and left us with the feeling that someone really offended out intelligence.

title: Every thing that's wrong with modern movies
text: Weak storyline, horrible dialogue, action that's beyond unrealistic, lacking in cohesion, I could go on. Paleontologists and dino trainers who are also skilled action stars, dinosaurs who aren't trained but obey hand signals, what was the point?

title: This film stole approximately 2 hours from my lifespan.
text: This movie is one of the typical hollywood bulls#it we usually see in the cinemas today. Bad storytelling, empty and meaningless characters with jumbled character developments. Sorry but I have had enough of teenage girls being the solution to the problem. And why did they think that replacing the scientist with a good and handsome boi with motorcycle will be good? Jurassic films was not about dinosaurs. OK, they are in it as the fear factor, but in my humble opinion they were the wonders of nature still. The other important message in the old movies was the role of science and scientist in discovering and trying to understand these marvels (dinos in this case). These two things made the Spielberg films that good. In these films we get the opposite of these values. Dinosaurs are monsters and science is bad.All in all this was ridiculous compared to the old movies. Dull.

title: 5.7???!!! What are y'all thinking? What more could we have asked more from this awesome movie?!
text: Bring back all of our favorite characters from the series and have them work together, bring back all of our favorite dinosaurs from the series and mash them up, bring back that patented Jurassic Park exciting action, and bring back those chilling dinosaur terror scenes! Yay, they brought it all back for a great ending to this 30-year-old franchise! :-)

title: GARBAGE!!!
text: What a load of garbage!!!! Massively disappointed bringing back the original cast from Jurassic park did nothing to help the storyline. What a waste of a franchise.

title: Recycling every cliche and original cast reunions: the terminal Hollywood obsessions
text: With their imagination bone dry, the writers dismantled the 93 Jurassic Park Script and put it back together chaotically. And characters too. They even had a Nerdy for a minute. And of course, physics and logic had no sense. A few hundred meters apart you have a solidly frozen lake and a tropical jungle.
