Or when the power is cut with a hammer (!!?) the swarming locusts stop moving too like they were some remotely activated drones. Speaking of the hammer and the power main passing openly in the middle of the lab, why not do it Spielberg style and whenever a character needs something, just make it available handy like in children's cartoons. And in the end, I.m very curious, about the giant locust what were they eating?

title: Less than the sum of its parts
text: "Dominion" has a lot of good scenes, but the sum of its parts doesn't make a good movie because it's far too incoherent. Someone must have had a list to tick off. Raptors in snow? Check. Dinosaurs sold on black market? Check. Child abduction? Check. Stars of the old trilogy meet stars of the new trilogy? Check. Motorbike chase? Check. Locust invasion? Check. Claire hides from dinosaur in the jungle? Check. Lab on fire? Check.A lot of pieces which are fun (when they stand alone in a three minute clip) don't make a good movie when they all come together because they don't have a story to tell, it's just a random collection of all ideas someone wanted to throw in. The whole movie isn't entertaining, because the confused audience is trying to sort out this mess and doesn't succeed.

title: Uncreative, cliche-bursting nonsense
text: As many say 'one of the worst movies ever.' It seems that the three original cats are the only talented people that worked in this cliche-bursting nonsense.Dominion is a classic example of wasting millions of dollars whilst the planet's warming, rainforests disappearing and illegal wildlife trade thrives.Absolutely not worth watching. Plot is pointless, lines are cringing, scenes are uncreative and the puppetry is worse than in cheap 80' film. Trevorrow is highly untalented and should stand down from the movie industry.

title: Is Hollywood is the next extinction?
text:
Where do you start with this predicable load of jellyvision rubbish..
Bin job.. Its a cash grab by marketing with watered down plot, acting reversed roll dominant engineering to market at the current climate of political correctness ... Could have been.. should have been watchable.. it's not.

title: I wanted it to be longer......
text: I've adored the Jurassic movies from the very beginning. Remember seeing Jurassic Park as a young child and the feeling it gave me. Jurassic Park 2 was acceptable, the third it's best not to mention.But then came the Jurassic World era. I was cautious going in to watch Jurassic World Dominion today as I made the mistake of reading some reviews. But I told myself I'll make my own mind up. I've just come out of the cinema with the biggest smile on my face. There was none stop action, a great story and quite frankly I believe my favourite of the Jurassic World movies! I just didn't want it to end. Yes, the run time is over 2 hours, but it sucked me in so perfectly I wanted more! I'm sad that this is the end of the Jurassic franchise. I just can't wait for Dominion to be released digitally so I can enjoy it again from the comfort of my home.

title: Awful
text: Terrible script, awful and boring movie. What a mess and a waste of time and money. Super spies, aliens and god knows what else might appear in the deleted scenes. It's that ridiculous.

title: Honestly no..
text: This was a joke right? When is the real movie going to be released?Waste of time, no script, nothing makes sense, everything is all-over the place, people can 'magically' know stuff .. it's absurdIf the rating system had -5 stars, still wouldn't be enough.Money Grab movie and a wasted opportunity to fix the last 4 movies and ended the JP "saga" high.

title: Watching as I write this, and I hope everyone dies...
text: This movie sucks so bad. They are pushing so many different agendas in this it's so exhausting! Climate change, animal rights, Monsanto, Greta Thunberg, Women strong, lmao.Like right now... Just now, the black chick pulls Chris Pratt out from under the ice with one arm lmao... SHE WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO DO THAT! So sick of this type of BS in movies. I'm a woman. I want a realistic film. I don't need to be stronger than all the men and to save everyone in every single movie, lol.Also, Chris Pratt is SO OVERRATED!! And why the hell is he so tan while living in the cold ass snow filled mountains?!  Don't even get me started on less talented Jessica Chastain over here with her ridiculous facial expressions. Don't purchase this movie. You will regret it. Trust me, it sucks!

title: Boring Hot Mess
text: Please don't waste your time and money! This is nothing compared to the previous movies. Falls short in almost all areas. Simply, too many things going on in the movie and it is all over the place.A concise 2 hour film would have made it much more interesting. At least the popcorn at the theater was enjoyable!

title: SciFi Roots & Dino Madness
text: Dominion is a solid film. Albeit it doesn't feel like an "Epic Conclusion" as Universals marketing team quipped, it manages to tell a complete story from beginning to end, with everything you love about Jurassic movies but with a twist. The main plot driving the OG cast's return is clearly inspired by Jurassic's SciFi roots (very Crichton-esque). The main plot driving the JW cast is solid and helps bring these two "Era's" together. 30 years of dinosaur and film magic comes down to this. Don't critique the film for what you think it should be, critique it for its individuality from the rest. Dominion is a great adventure ride (as to be expected from a Jurassic film) and easily can be rewatched. Be on the lookout for a *rumored* extended cut once the film releases on Blu Ray and Digital. If you are a fan of the franchise and if you appreciate the extended lore, you'll enjoy this film!

title: Quite the poor finale to an an awesome story
text: Mess of a movie. Too many plots. Too many holes. Too many dinosaurs. Too many people. Not enough of us on the dinosaurs. Wait to watch it at home. And keep your expectations low.

title: I mean if you needed money that bad you could've just asked
text: Nothing from the previous 2 movies were resolved. This movie takes a weird pivot into some none dinosaur material and just kind of ends. 6 actors in this movie with an established franchise history and they are so wooden, you could've replaced any one of them with no effect to the story.

title: Hilarious and completely unplausable.
text: I guess everyone needs money, or at least that's the only thing I can guesstimate, as to how they got all of those high caliber actors to work in such a poor film.The reason the original Jurassic Park was amazing, is that it was imaginatively plausible. This film did not even attempt to touch on any aspect of reality. They should have marketed this one as a comedy, due to its absurdity.All the aspects of the film are a failed attempt at recreating the magic of the original, and the characters that have evolved over the movie series, while pumping it up to make it a little more "All American" feeling.

title: Jurassic Park expansion pack
text: Such a lazy story. Even a lot of time the situations and the pictures are basic Jurassic Park. There for everyone to see. And the worst is that it comes with woke politics attached. Women know everything. Men are tools except racial diverse men. What a waste of time.

title: Disappointing
text: 47/2022. Cinema. One jump scare and two and a half hours of your life gone are all you'll get from this disappointing conclusion to a once awe-inspiring franchise.Beyond the CGI nothing feels right. The dialogue, the performances, the predictable action sequences, the editing and pacing are all sub-par. The score that once evokes awe now feels limp and half-hearted.As a long-time franchise fan I'm glad I didn't go to a midnight screening on release day last week.

title: Worst Film I have seen in a long long time!
text: Was so looking forward to seeing this film as I absolutely love the original 1993 Jurassic Park movie, and actually thought the last two films with Pratt and Dallas Howard were very enjoyable.However after just 10 minutes of watching this movie, I knew I was NOT going to enjoy it!! I honestly cannot tell you what happened in this movie despite enduring the whole thing, as I didn't understand half the time what was going on! The whole vibe was somewhat futuristic and dystopian. I found it hard to like or warm to any of the characters, there was literally zero chemistry between any of them. The plot was terrible and utterly confusing plot AND there was only a handful of Dinosaurs to boot!Whilst there is a bunch of well known and good actors in this movie, most were completely under utilized and therefore looked half asleep throughout. Whilst I think Sam Neal actually looked better in this movie than he did in the original (love the beard) they kept making his character out to be almost like Indiana Jones - fedora included! Also I think the worst thing about the supposed "baddie" was his bad acting, and just who the hell was the "Woman In White" supposed to be??? - yes yer one with the laser pointer wearing the silky white gilet!So in conclusion, I suggest you watch the original 1993 Jurassic Park film instead of this one! Utter nonsense!I give this movie a generous 1 out of 10... purely for Jeff Goldblum's one liners, and Sam Neill's beard!!!

title: Dino Downer
text: Jurassic World: Dominion bites off far more than it can chew. Blending the old characters with the new doesn't work as well as in other franchises and it takes far too long for certain characters to meet. 2 and a half hours is a slog for any movie and this doesn't warrant it. There are some nice set pieces but it is weighed down by some clunky dialogue and Jurassic World 3 is ultimately a disappointment. Chris Pratt said this was Jurassic Park's Endgame...he couldn't have been further off the mark on that one.

title: They said, they delivered. THE EPIC CONCLUSION!
text: TBH, I wasn't expecting much from this movie as movies these days don't hold any potential but I extremely loved how they made connections with previous movies of the franchise and gave us this masterpiece.All the actors and crew did and excellent job along with special effect team. Effects were amazing and no doubt this was best film in the whole franchise. Loved the scenes with THE BIGS ONCE, the tension and fear built for them in that particular scene was >>>>.Must watch. Thank You.

title: Massively disappointed
text: I feel they could of saved millions on the budget my employing B grade actors to take part in this B grade movie.The story line in garbage just lots of dinosaurs walking about.We loved Jurassic park, it's was exciting and edge of the sofa entertainment, this has none.

title: Simply bad
text: 2+ Hours of digital dinosaurs. No room for plot, vaguely credible characters, or cohesion. Suspected was aimed at a tween audience, but comes with an M rating.

title: WORST OF THE WORST II
text:
Reptiles are smaller than Girraffes, look bigger than elephants & they can be lassoed on horse back then tied to a small tree stump
Then that it,it's tame as!They all have lost their hunting instincts they all want to 1st look at the prey, wait for the pray to speak a few lines before they start chase.And they will always lose their prey over a stupid thing, I mean these small reptiles understand well that there are cameras filming the entire thing for children.After the movie you wonder, was this a dinosaur movie or a Genetically modified child or a reunion.I went in there thinking 2022, ill probably see how CGI can finally show us how gigantic a dinosaur can be. & I only saw autistic horses with long necks.

title: I'm writing this while sitting in the theatre before I walk out
text: I've been sitting here for an hour and 20 minutes. There's no plot, I've looked at my phone every few minutes and all this movie has been so far is flash, dinosaurs in random places where they shouldn't be, no character development, poor pacing, just a constant string of random action scenes one after the other just for the sake of having things on the screen. I really regret watching this. Just a terrible movie. Shame on whoever made this for just making money off the franchise, off the name of previous actors and throwing in a bunch of dinosaurs. At least respect your audience. This is a slap in the face. Just a terrible movie. Now, I'm going to walk out.

title: Brilliant Ride
text: Yes it's choppy to keep the pacing but we really enjoyed it from start to finish. Wonderful nods to previous films. Lots of content and dinosaurs. "Dodson, we've got Dodson here!"

title: Extremely disappointing can't believe this was just released in 2022
text: I saw this in my Netflix queue and noticed it was half watched. I was 99% sure I was not the one who would have watched it because I thought for sure I would not walk away from a Jurassic Park movie. So I started watching it again. And about 20 minutes in I realized why I left the first time. It is so terrible unbelievably so I mean if you're an adult, anyway. If you're a child or even a teenager you might find a lot of tension here with the dozens of dinosaurs who sound like tigers and run like dogs chasing people at high speeds but never catching them for some reason. Lol. The makeup on the actresses is almost comical it's so airbrushed. However I found all the original cast to look very nice considering their age. Can never go wrong with, darn it I forgot his name- he was in Independence Day as well. Nice looking guy with the dark hair. Anyway I found the reviews here much more entertaining than the film. I really have to give high fives to the guy who discussed cake and taxes to get to his 600 characters. It is a little bit unfortunate in my opinion that we can't just come here and say I wanted to sentence opinion about a film anymore. But this one is just all pure action and CGI, and is very disappointing considering it's from 2022. I mean dinosaurs really sounded like tigers and run like dogs? I guess it could happen but when I was in high school learning about dinosaurs we learned that they are a little bit less spry. I was particularly turned off by this Cliffhanger about she's my daughter but she's not my daughter and of course she's a rebellious teen who won't follow rules to save her own life. Oh my goodness can we ever get away from this crap. Someone needs to start disciplining our children. The other reason I was surprised it was from 2022 is because some of the PC issues introduced in the film seem a little yesterday to me. I agree with people who say that the script did not have much thought put into it. Or maybe it's been sitting on a shelf for 10 years. To reiterate, if you're a teenager or a child who's allowed to watch scary stuff you might enjoy this film. If you're an adult you might endure this film if there are children or teenagers in your house.

title: Mediocre cash-grab that relies on nostalgia
text:
Other reviewers went into great detail about everything wrong with this film, so I'll just keep it short. This film is uninspired and just retreads everything we've seen in previous Jurassic movies, without having any of the interesting elements that made the original what it was. There are two main flaws:
1) The main villain is incredibly boring and one dimensionally evil.2) we were promised that this movie would show us a world where Dinos have essentially integrated into the modern world. Although the opening montage showcases some of this, after the main character intros are done the plot brings us back to another secluded Dino zone so we can relive all the scenes from Jurassic Park. However, none of the tension or suspense is there, except for one scene . I think only one named character actually gets killed by Dinos (which we don't actually see) making it far less scary than the original, where named characters are picked off one by one.I would only recommend this to parents of kids who want to see big dinosaurs on the big screen and don't care if the human characters are interesting. But for all other movie goers, save your money.

title: So looking forward to this
text: Cannot even put it into words awful just awful , at times it was like watching the old starwars or even the muppets , as for the new bas guy head of biotech worst actor of all time.

title: Dross
text: The final nail in the coffin of Jurassic Park..... a film no one wanted made woke, with chracters no one liked (ok maybe apart Ian Malcolm)...... the Jurassic franchise is now dead.

title: Hot take, this film is the second best Jurassic film
text: Especially the extended version! It's not nearly as rushed as the first two World movies and the starting plot makes more sense than both the 2nd and 3rd Park movie.This movie deals with themes like human obligation to nature, GMOs, corporate greed and espionage, and even found family. Those themes are similar to the first, but in a different way and built upon.Personally, I think if it were not cool to dunk on nostalgia bait, this film would be wildly popular.It's a very enjoyable and relevant film. It's not even a "junk food" film. I would recommend all of you who hate it take a second look without the CinemaSins goggles and take the film for what it is.

title: A Nonsense world where humans co exist with Dinosaurs
text: Looks like film scripted by Peta. Total nonsense story. Ruined all my past experience of horrifying dinosaur world. Hollywood now becoming mad and nonsense due to injection of their liberal propaganda like gay, lesbian, evil justification, mulim appeasement etc.

title: Awful
text: One of the worst movies I've seen. Lazy writing. Lazy acting. It's like Chris Pratt must have signed up to a 3 movie deal and got stuck making this. Hollywood is dead. The era of TV series's has began. At total cringe fest from start to finish. I've seen B movies that were better than this rubbish. The need for one sided diversity has destroyed the movie industry. Awful writing, awful acting, awful directing, awful production. They actually re use half of the original plot lines again and again. A painful watch. The CGI isnt great either. The only good thing is the story line of the big company creating a disaster for control. Overall..... Terrible.

title: Quite possibly one of the worst
text: This is quite possibly one of the worst movies I have seen in some time.It is "Jurassic Park" in name only, because it only has dinosaurs.Evil businessman, sure, completely believable. Wanting to control the works and ultimate power, sure, I can see that. The rest is just lame.A dull and confused movie that seems to have little bearing on the wonderful movies that came before it.I am not sure what this is about, but it's clearly not a movie that true to the name.-Stop reading here, seriouslyI need 600 characters? Here are more because I have nothing left to add and don't want to dilute what is said. I guess I could ramble on and on, but that's unfunny and insipid. Lalalalalalalalalalalalalalala.

title: I created an account on purpose to negatively criticize this movie
text: Jurassic World turned into Fast and Furious type. Utterly nonsense through all the movie. I can't point a positive thing about this movie. For people who are passionate about Jurassic Park and don't want this film to affect your connection to the 1993 classic, don't watch it.

title: Best one yet
text: This is the best movie out of the new trilogy.It has great dinosaur content, amazing story.It does have a weakness of having a lot of convenience driving the plot at times but it doesn't matter because it's so fun to watch.

title: Wasted opportunity
text: Just watched this movie and honestly I can't even remember the plot, because there isn't one. Just another movie with a billionaire white man who surprise surprise turns out to be evil, then the movie goes from scenes with the new starts to scenes with the original stars. It just didn't make any sense.

title: Boring
text: I enjoyed the previous Jurassic movies, but this was terrible, some of the cgi on the dinosaurs looked 20 years out of date, I've seen better cgi on budget tv series!The plot was pretty boring and the acting wasn't the best. I usually like low budget movies and movies that most people don't usually enjoy so it really takes a lot for me to say a movie was bad.If you're thinking of watching this movie, I really wouldn't rush. You're not missing out on anything special.

title: Everyone left the theater as soon as possible
text: The whole movie could be done without the dinosaurs anyways, the whole plot unfolds around this famine and rescue thing. In the trailer it talks about how human is going to co-live with the dinosaurs but in the end the movie ended abruptly. I don't enjoy at at all, before half of the movie I realized it's not going to be good and turns out I'm right......

title: Truly awful
text: Dear Hollywood, never let this writer/director near a studio again. Generic, nonsensical, bad dialogue, dumb premise. Made me disinterested in Dinosaurs forever.-Everyone.

title: Really don't understand the bad reviews
text: I actually REALLY enjoyed this movie.. I really dont underatand all the hate.. I was hesitant to watch it because all of the review bombing but I found it to be really enjoyable. Love the fact that we got to see both casts actually meet eachother.. and loved the tid bits of nostalgia throughout the movie paying homage to some of the parts of the original.. its not a complete masterpiece but its definitely not as bad as everyone is saying it is.. Jeff Goldblum is probably my favorite out of the bunch as he added a lot of the comedy but the rest of the cast does a surprisingly good job connecting with one another.

title: I want my money back!!!!
text: I have been a fan of the Jurassic Park franchise since the 1990's. This final story is a huge disappointment. You would think with this cast, the story would explode and you would leave the theater satisfied. I left disappointed and ashamed for the scriptwriters and actors. The story was disjointed and most of the actors were just there. Jeff Goldblum had his occasional dry humor that shined through but that's about all that shined. Chris Pratt lacked any of the charm he displayed in Jurassic World. All-in-all...giving this movie a 3 rating was kind. Save your money and wait for it to come to Netflix where you can watch it at no additional cost.

title: a surplus of stupidity and quite a few truly CRINGEY scenes
text: I've never been a big fan of the series. I'm not even sure how many I have seen, so I won't complain about a "big letdown". But when a woman is chased by a raptor, and every time they cut away & then back again, she has gained distance on the raptor, we have to say "Enough, already". To make it worse, a few minutes later, the raptors chase a truck and a motorcycle and they do a better job keeping up with those than with the woman.Now, add the sad reality that many of the "scares" were B-grade horror-house scares. Even with all that, I thought "well, it is entertaining enough that I will finish it." Then, I realized it was going to go on and on and nothing about the ending would surprise me, so I just turned it off.

title: Boring Stupid
text:
First 1 hour was boring, 2nd part was stupid...waste of time ..waste of money
Rubbish movie...no dominions @ all.Got nothin 2do with the Jurassic park series...just edited scenes from here & there...clueless film.

title: I mean...
text: that hand... that damn hand

title: Nostalgic
text: Silly plot but movie is alot of fun. Loads of dinosaurs every few minutes, throwbacks to the first film. It's ok to enjoy this film while appreciating how blessed we were to have the very first Jurassic Park movie in 1993.

title: Straight up Hollywood trash
text: What a disaster this movie is from start to finish. So many plot holes and many things have you questioning how in the hell??? I asked myself when leaving why do I keep giving this franchise another chance. Like the dinosaurs these movies need to become extinct.

title: Just signed up to stay this sucks and thanks for ruining what could have been epic.
text: Action scenes are pretty brilliant but dam, the writing and script is so bad. The acting in the first 40 mins is like something straight out of a hallmark movie. It could have been so much more. Sad times. Off to watching Jurassic Park 1 again so.

title: Meh
text: This movie was great,, except for the weak plot, bad acting, bad dialogue, boring action, and lack of overall dinosaurs.The sounds editing was pretty much the only decent part of this movie.

title: Money grab
text: No substance, no real story or character development. Movie brings back old characters just for the sake of the fans ... it doesn't make sense that dr. Alan Grant is still digging fossils with actual dinos roaming the Earth. Story makes no sense ... editing is made so that you cannot see the actual action. Image looks fake, dinosaur models -apart from the deynonychus - are cartoonish like ... there is a clear intent to be aetistically aimilar to the ones in Jurassic Park but they lack emotions. I think this movie is intended for smaller kids ... the story is not for adults ... it's way too boring for a family film. Characters and acting seems out of place, sometimes actors are left hanging while the frame is still holding. Absolute money grab.

title: Fair to middling
text: I was a bit unsure about this because looking at the reviews of the previous two movies or so, a lot of the reviews weren't too kind which surprised me because I thought they were tolerable. Jurassic world dominion isn't very logical, it's hard to imagine most of the scenarios, there's people constantly outrunning trained assassin dinosaurs, so much of the plot line is dependent on coincidences that realistically speaking aren't supposed to be in the "good guys" favor, happens once... that's alright, but the movie is littered with them. We have people who've never met and literally have no real connection somehow suddenly willing to risk their lives and everything else to help each other, they lack character depth but from the little we know don't really seem like the type. The movie tries to subtly be humorous but the only scene that made me chuckle was the 'pullover the plane to the side' otherwise most of the jokes don't land as hard as they're intended. The dinosaurs behavior was way out of character, especially when they were mingling with the rest of modern wildlife, just hard to believe. You see, a lot of the movie is unbelievable and you could keep on rambling about it; if you over analyze it you'll realize there's so many aspects of it that are way off and could be better and you end up not enjoying it... but it's a dinosaur movie, I think you should just look at as just that; entertainment not a piece of art. I acknowledge it isn't a great movie, but I enjoyed it and it's worth a watch. It's also a decent family movie.I watched a recap of the entire franchise and I must say it has really come from far and the recent releases have adapted the story with the times to make it more modern which ended up with fatuous plotlines like breeding animals for military use and all that, like if that made sense they'd have tried conscripting rhinos first. But none of it is as silly as fast and furious for example. If you're going to watch this with a keen eye and all you really won't enjoy it.My only major complaint is they tried to give it a heartfelt send off at the end with the emotional happy ending, sigh of relief, everybody coming together, it's all love music and it really wasn't giving man, I didn't care of the characters for that scene to deliver what the writers or directors thought it was giving. The movie had to be better than it actually was for that ending to mean something and that annoyed me. It's not an epic conclusion as advertised.It is a long movie as well, I don't think it had to be that long and if it was paced better could have shortened the runtime and made it more thrilling as the action was subpar. If I'm not mistaken, this is intended to be the last release in the franchise, and for that I'm a little upset because there was a huge time leap, about thirty years since dinosaurs were released and I'm sure amazing stories could have come from that, while this movie followed a more generic and more imaginative story.Anyway, I don't think it's an absolute catastrophe but if you head into this with expectations, you'll be disappointed. I didn't have any and thought it was bearable.

title: Worth Seeing
text: Honestly, this movie is great. It had more story line than any of the other Jurassic movies, so I'm not sure what all of this disappointment is about.It's a nostalgic, action movie about dinosaurs. I'm convinced those who didn't like it aren't able to watch movies for what they are... movies.

title: Cringeworthy fake garbage
text: Nothing in this movie feels real. Dinosaurs have feelings and live among people peacefully. The settings, seems like its all done in a studio with green screen. Even forests feels fake. Characters are lame soap opera clichs. And of coarse some woke elements. The trusty black man and the black man worship in the form of a painting inside the white family cabin. Its as if the movie was compiled from recent years of Hollywood woke recipes, mixed together into a pile of movie trash.

title: Words can hardly describe the disappointment
text: The whole crew should be sacked. How can someone direct a movie with such a plot? This movie is truly a waste of money and time. Total nonsense with cheesy dialogues. No logic and boring. Fragments evrywhere. Gosh please go watch it if you wish to ruin your day.

title: Dino Disaster
text: The conclusion to the Jurassic era is pulverized into a bloated disaster. Jurassic World Dominion is an overstuffed mess that manages to diminish its own characters and even the dinosaurs.

title: Incredible Movie - Absolutely worth the watch
text: The movie was great, fantastic way to introduce young people to the legacy characters, the movie, while long, was incredibly interesting the whole way through.I can see some reviews citing the length as boring or the plot as bad, but I'd hasten to say a lot of them missed the point of what was happening.The action scenes with dinosaurs were, as always, a favourite. A lot of the longer scenes do a fantastic job building up the plot and delving into the lore of the franchise, the two new heroes introduced in this movie were great, Chris Pratt was superb and all the legacy characters were so much fun.Don't be wavered by any negative reviews you see, go and watch the film for yourself, I highly, highly, recommend it.

title: Waste of time
text: I love the Jurassic Movies. But this was such a waste of time. Terrible plot which they tried to compensate with an over saturation of different dinosaur action scenes. There were times that I think it could not get any worse, and I was proven wrong. I hope this was the last one for a while.

title: Same old same old
text: Nothing in this movie Evolved,; neither the dinosaurs nor the characters. Another example of special effects can't make up for a weak script. Extinction of the franchise is eminant.

title: For kids and people who don't know any better
text: Ughhh! A big sigh is what could sum up not just this movie but the entire franchise. And the fact they keep putting Chris Pratt back into movies is an irritatingly brainless choice.

title: Welcome to the new Era!!!
text: I have just experienced one of the best Jurassic Park movie ever made!!! I loved every single minute of it! I'm not gonna say anything about it, but I'll tell you one thing. This movie brings the best for last. Jurassic Park meets Jurassic World all together! Love the legacy characters coming back and main characters from previous Jurassic World movies. Jurassic World Dominion is one of the best Jurassic Park movies of all time. I totally recommend watching this movie 100%No Spoilers everybody! I recommend watching this movie.10/10.

title: Nothing Can Save Whatever This Is
text: Okay, i'm not really a fan of Jurassic Series, (Especially after JW Fallen Kingdom) but this is so much worse. I came to the theatre with low expectation (since the review are not really good) so i thought i could enjoy some dinosaur fight. Well, guess what? Nothing happen. The story was dull, even the conversation between characters feels corny. Bad acting (especially the one who play as maisie). And the funny thing is, everytime one of the character do something, they just start hugging and high five. The villain have no motivation and emotionless. There's two action scene that i thought it was decent, but it just hold for 8 minutes. So you guys must see the another 139 minutes pointless story to get there, plus unfunny moment everywhere with bad scoring.Epic conclusion of Jurassic era? I don't think so, even after the credit start rolling, the audience cant get the conclusion of what ever happened in the movie. But actually the movie could work if they have better story, like how humans and dinosaur live together and they can make the movie two parts, rather than execute this stupid story of how another bad company try to rule the world (again) and forced everything to collide because every character try to finished their own task just to meet at the end to say Hi. But hey, this is just my opinion, you can agree or disagree but this just felt really wrong. But this is the worst movie i've ever seen.The only good thing about this movie, well of course the animation, and Jeff Goldblum as Jeff Goldblum (Chris Pratt acting was decent but he seems doesn't want to be in the movie).Goofy Ah Movie. And just like another franchise, the studio will start a spin off or maybe do another useless reboot.Personal Rating: 1/10.

title: Bad bad bad
text: Generic money grab for the franchise. Plot made no sense and was hard to watch. I was ready for it to end half way through. There's not much good I can say about it other then when it was eventually over.

title: Incomprehensible mess
text: The plot was both nonexistent and a huge mess. There were zero stakes the entire film since every character was equipped with plot armor that made them invincible. The dialogue was horrible and the writing as a whole was a mess. The most egregious offense was that the dinosaurs took a backseat in this film and were not the focus at all. Terrible way to end a nearly 30 year legacy.

title: Amazing!
text: This movie is better than i was expecting. It had great visual effects, a story that had a sense and a fantastic chemistry between the cast old and new. The script is better than Jurassic world and jurassic world fallen kingdom. The thing that i loved a lot are the variety of places: Malta, unite states and italy. The dinosaurs are beautiful. The cinematography is amazing and great with some shot that are going to be mentioned for years. I know what critica are saying but this is a great ending for the saga that started in 1993 by Steven Spielbierg.

title: Milking it out too far
text: After JP3 it was all downhill. Training dinosaurs like dogs was campy and stupid. When writers run out of ideas they go overboard and the last JPs were way too overboard. The special effects were incredible but the storyline was a joke.

title: Terrible
text: They lost focus on the movie.. not long enough dinosaur scene... the movie focus on the characters, instead dinosaurs.. it doesn't focus on dinosaur in the world but focus on the clone kid , The characters and. Biosion ... lot of useless plots like locus , corrupt company, James Bond kids, love and relationships,, they. Should Of focus on the dinosaurs .... awful the ending was underwhelming ... it's sad and I love this franchise.

title: A truly painful experience
text: I can't believe how much I hated this movie. I considered leaving within the first 5 minutes, but stopped thinking it might get better. It didn't...it just got worse and worse. It was boring, dumbed-down, clunky, and had a muddled storyline. What really shocked me was how awful the dinosaurs looked. They looked about as good as the low-budget dinosaurs on a show my children watch. What made the movie painful was that it was so long on top of the awful script. I kept looking at the time to see how much longer until the torture would be over. Not even the original Jurassic World trio could save this movie.

title: Awful, simply awful.
text: I literally would undergo a second vasectomy with no local anaesthetic than watch that garbage ever again. If it was possible to give minus stars, I would.

title: It's a Dinosaur Monster Movie - Relax
text: I read all these terrible reviews and almost didn't go. Thank God my wife and kids came up with the idea if taking me to see Jurassic World: Dominion in 4DX. What a RIDE! Perfect move for the interactive seats and 3D glasses. It's more fun than a roller coaster. And it made the (pretty good) movie that much better. I highly recommended it.

title: Mindless movie for the lowest IQ "zombies"
text: The "trilogy" is complete!Corporate greed, the lowest quality writting/directing & lack of respect for the original material has utterly destroyed my 3 favorite franchises (and whatever future they might have had); Star Trek, Star Wars and Jurassic Park.The level of "storytelling" in JW3 is astoundingly low. This is written and directed by the lowest intelligence denominator FOR the lowest intelligence audience out there.If this absolute mindless entertainment is what you want from the movie industry... go get some therapy; for the sake of us who are ABLE to think and don't appreciate being taken for idiots.

title: Repetition but bad
text: Very sad and soulless film made primarily to fill bank accounts. CGI is bad, story is weak, the movie is boring and that is not because of good dialogues, because there were none. The actors also play on automatic pilot. A shame and a waste of the franchise.

title: Absolute rubbish.
text: If you are trying to waste your money then this is the movie for you, nothing about this movie feels like Jurassic Park in any measurable sense. Not even the old cast could save this dumpster fire; the writing is terrible, the characters are bland, most of it is nonstop action sequences which go on forever and the dialogue seems as if it was written by a zoomer with the attention span and memory of a golfball.This is a terrible rehash of what we've seen before, there's nothing of interest in this movie unless you are catered towards stupid mindless films. There's literally a scene where a dinosaur breathes fire, that should tell you how bad this movie really is. I walked out halfway through the movie, don't waste your money on this.

title: Gives you what you'd expect
text: I really enjoyed this film. It gives you exactly what you'd want from a Jurassic Park sequel. Yes parts were slow and the editing felt a little strange in my opinion but overall I found this very enjoyable. Bryce Dallas Howard in particular was particularly impressive - she's a fantastic actor and elevated the scenes. It was great to have the original cast too. Worth watching!

title: Garbage served on a silver platter!
text: Don't waste your time on this trash. Not one jump scare, no suspense, and WTF does locusts plagues have to do with prehistoric dinosaurs. Congrats to the director/writers/producers on destroying a franchise!

title: Woeful.
text: The worst in the JP series. Complete dross, very predictable and as close to woke as you can get. Let's hope they don't make any more. And if Chris Pratt has any more interaction with Blue, they'll end up getting married.

title: A series of dinosaur sketches loosely glued together
text: The main story arc, if you could call it that, is merely a vehicle to glue a series of "dino-skits" together. These skits are of varying quality, a function of the actors, the dinosaurs and the context. The Dern, Neil and Goldblum skits are pretty good, it's nice to see the characters, nice to reminisce, homages to past movies, their class as actors shows through. The Pratt skits are just Chis Pratt, I don't mind the guy, he can be hunky, funny, whatever. Howard really overdoes the pathetic damsel in distress in this one, almost unwatchable. The young girl is so un-likeable I didn't even Google the actor's name. In general, the skits seemed to flow into something vaguely cogent, although there were a few occasions where characters and skit intersections defied all reason or logic but had to happen to keep the story flowing.Special mention to the editing which is horrific; so bad I had to check my internet hadn't glitched on a few occasions. I'm still not convinced it hadn't.The old guard added two stars, without them this was pretty terrible.

title: The nostalgia and closure are both so satisfying
text: I loved every minute of the cheese and all the nods to the original Jurassic Park. The movie did a great job of keeping viewers entertained with action and dinosaurs!! And it wrapped up so many loose ends and provided closure across the board. Nothing will ever be the original but this was a great feel-good, action-packed way to close out the entire story. I loved it so so much.

title: Absolute Liberal Garbage
text: I was so excited to see the fusion of the Jurassic Park & Jurassic World brought together to bring the entire series to a grand finale!! What a liberal, idealistic, unrealistic piece of garbage! First off, the entire premise of the movie stinks. I was willing to let that go and escape into someone else's creativity. Then I got about 20 minutes in. Every little thing was a statement (either implied or otherwise) in liberal politics. I really wanted an escape, not a lecture. One of the three worst movies I've ever seen . . .When the film began building upon the previous movie, the idea of humans attempting to share the planet with dinosaurs seemed like a logical storyline. Then the garbage began. I'm not going to even attempt to go into detail, but every form of globalist, elitist form of the liberal agenda is presented in the most absurd manner possible! I thought Rowdy Roddy Piper in "Hell Comes To Frogtown" was ridiculous . . . An absolute joke! .

title: Who signed off on this garbage script?
text: They should be ashamed of themselves. Who read this piece of trash and thought it was a good idea? I couldn't tell if I was watching a mixture of Dan Browns Inferno, Jason Bourne, national treasure, and Indiana Jones sprinkled with some weird environmental message and... oh yeah.. dinosaurs thrown in too.What really boils my blood, is that I've been waiting to see the original legacy characters all back together in a Jurassic Park movie for over 25 years!The "action" sequences were so unbelievably overblown and high-octane, that it felt like I was watching a McG, Michael Bay, and Quentin Tarantino backyard "what if" film after a total meltdown from a sugar high. So many big explosions and stupid cliche action movie fist-fights until my eyes couldn't roll anymore. Seriously?The pitch meeting was "Hey, you know how cool Tom Cruise looks in the mission impossible movies when he's punching people and blowing crap up? Let's do that! With Dinosaurs!"Totally lame. Watch Steven Spielbergs original and save two and a half hours of your life.

title: First time rating a movie because I'm angry.
text: First time rating a movie because I'm angry. I'd rather donate money to a good cause than to a movie like this. I apologize for not providing an argument as to why it is bad. That's just how he is.

title: I'm Done With Reviews Forever - Great Movie, Go See It!
text: Stop reading this and go see the movie. No more reviews ever for me. People said it was so bad, said it wasn't about dinosaurs, said it was just a character reunion, too long. Nope, quite the opposite. It was action packed, had a great story, characters were awesome, had great visuals and it was not too long. I don't want to sit there and pick a film completely apart when I want to be there to enjoy myself. I didn't even sit in a DBox seat solely because I didn't want that distraction, although I might go back and experience it. This film started with action and ended with it. It had a good pace and there was no dead space like some movies.I wish we'd seen more of Chris Pratt like in previous films, but he shared screen time with quite the cast. It had plenty of dinosaurs, emotions for them and the characters. I almost didn't go see this $5 Tuesday special because of so many bad reviews. I'm glad I pushed myself to go see it, and by myself at that. I am totally done with reading and writing reviews because I might have missed this jewel due to those misleading opinions. So many reviews aren't reviews anyway; they are just people acting like writers giving you the same synopsis that you already know about. I might not watch this film 8 times like I did for Jurassic Park, but it is worth a few viewings and I would not have been disappointed had I paid full price to see it. I also see no reason to close the door on this franchise. The movie has a definite conclusion, but seems open to me if they wanted to make another film since the characters are there. I gave 9/10 to only a few films; TG Maverick being the most recent with 10/10 going only to The Wizard of Oz due to the fact that it will be watched when it is 100 years old. I doubt Jurassic and Maverick will be able to boast that. This really is my last review, so stop reading them and just go to the theater and have a great time. Enjoy the experience, even if the film is not the best you ever saw. Reviews made me look for trouble where it did not exist and made me think this could be a failure, but it wasn't. I will never again allow reviews to sway my opinion of a film I haven't even seen. A 20 year old rusted barn find junk car is more reliable than any of these reviews. Farewell.

title: Holy hell was this a bad movie.
text: Yipes! It was terrible... like Mystery Science Theater 3000 terrible. Needs to be riffed and parodied. Just don't try to think about it afterwards. It will hurt your brain. Did not even feel like a JP movie... (or a JW movie for that matter)... felt like a weird 1950's monster movie with James Bond-like undertones. Fun only if you are in the mood for something fun but terrible at the same time.

title: Astonishingly bad, long and boring
text: Bad script, bad acting, stupid story, a new dinosaur every 5 minutes, too long, no suspense, Chris Pratt doing the hand thing, $160 million dollar budget for this, so many pointless dinosaur fights AND you took 2 and a half hours to tell me this garbage story.Frankly embarrassing to everyone involved. This movie attempts to exploit the nostalgia of the original characters and it fails miserably at every level. The action, the editing, the direction, it's all terrible. The movie has no focus, too many characters that have nothing to do and nothing to do with each other. The only positive thing I can say about this movie is they did use plenty of "real" props for some of the dinosaurs, so it's not like the actors are always looking at a green screen. However, everyone just feels kind of disconnected from the movie.

title: Mercy kill the franchise. Save what dignity it has left.
text: Whoever told Chris Pratt to hold his hand up 503 times at random dinosaurs, needs to change their career path.Plus you'll turn schizo trying to remember all the antagonists in this dumpster fire.

title: Worst movie I've ever seen
text: I loved the original Jurassic Park, and haven't seen another since. I could not have been more bored or disappointed in this movie. I have never written a movie review in my life. This movie was dumb af.There was a lack of a cohesive story, and there were no real antagonists. The theme of the movie was focused on some bugs, but the threat was not really portrayed. The dinosaurs barely played a role, and when they did, it felt like the dinos were planted there just to make it feel like a Jurassic Park movie.Don't waste your time or money with this flick. Keep to the originals or watch a documentary.

title: Great aesthetics and cinematography
text: I'm so glad that this was a well put together film. It was beautifully shot, decently paced, and had a good balance of story, character focus, and, of course, action. It felt like Jurassic Park meets Bourne Identity, with a twist of Indiana Jones and even a bit Star Warsy at times. Like a Star Wars level of world immersion, where they took us away and we experienced a new world where dinosaurs were now integrated into some parts of society. The scene in Malta was totally comparable to a Star Wars Cantina scene.The aesthetic and cinematography of Dominion made me more nostalgic than seeing the original cast. The shots were a little more hard lit and gritty than what we're used to, versus the overly HDR hyperreal, super clean visuals we expect to see in most blockbuster movies. Dominion felt a lot more grounded and classically cinematic. Back and side lighting for the win.I enjoyed the focus and interactions between the large cast of characters, both old, older and new. It didn't feel like anyone overly dominated the screen, with everyone sharing a place, a purpose and a voice before finally uniting for a fun and exciting climax. The dinosaurs also didn't overtake the story, allowing the human elements to breath, with their appearances serving as well timed spectacles that complimented the overall world and story. Visually this is the best we've seen, and I wasn't sure at times if they brought back the animatronics, or the CGI has improved a lot more for this film. I think it may have been a mix of both.I really think that they went through the previous films in the series, saw what work and what didn't work, and put their efforts into not making the the same old mistakes. While simultaneously brainstorming a bucket list of new things they wanted to bring to life and create on screen. Like of course, if you have to compete with a baby Yoda it makes sense to create a baby Blue. Overall for me this was the strongest of the sequel trilogy, and a strong contender for the second best in the saga. I wouldn't be surprised if we hear another TV series announced some time soon based on this Jurassic World.

title: A Shaky Final Entry Into the Jurassic Canon
text: While fans of the original may enjoy the reunion of the original trio, the film is unsurprisingly mediocre. It never really climbs out of the hole that it's terribly flat villain and clunky dialogue dug for it. And while the dinosaurs are (for the most part) beautiful and the amount of animatronic pieces are impressive, the main villain dinosaur is not shown very much at all, and depressingly harmless and rather useless when it is. Although most of the film struggles to find its voice, the chase through (CENSORED) was thrilling, enjoyable, and truly Jurassic in the amount of action and fun it has. Technically impressive but with a poor script, Dominion has enough fun callbacks to recommend a viewing in theaters.

title: Too long
text: This is the most boring film that I have ever watched this year. At one point it didn't even feel like a Jurassic World movie (Gun fight scene). It felt like a Taken movie with some dinosaurs and locusts in it. Too many characters that didn't really do much. Awkward lines. My favorite part was the ending.

title: There was 30 minutes with no dinosaurs
text: Just think about that...there were 30 minutes with no dinosaurs IN A JURASSIC PARK MOVIE. This movie makes jurassic Park 3 look Oscar worthy, and may just be the worst movie in the entire JP franchise.

title: What a stinker
text: Instead of a movie about dinosaurs, they made a movie about people running around and saying things. Absolutely no chemistry among the characters. A story that makes no sense. An ending that is not an ending - resolution by voice-over. Ugh.

title: TIME TO MOVE ONTO THE CRETACEOUS ERA!!!!
text: I have been a Jurassic fan since the beginning. Initially, just to see the dinosaurs in an almost lifelike environment and the animals themselves was unbelievable in a pleasant and welcome surprise. Although the stories have changed with the movies the basic core of Jurassic World is what lives on with the actors cementing the films. Jurassic World Dominion is the best of the bunch!! Replete with the original actors and introducing new top-notch talent just enhances the already blockbuster.saga. A Fantastic storyline with some twists and turns that you will keep you sitting on the edge of your seat. I recommend this movie to the entire family it is up to you how young you can take your children because there is some violence. After all this time, Jurassic World Dominion is the best movie of the bunch!

title: So disappointed
text: Wonderful special effects, but, I have never seen a big budget film throw up on itself like this. Don't let the story get in the way of the plot. What a wasted opportunity of a wonderfully assembled cast. It's hard not to eye roll at every turn. Why can't Spielberg direct the final chapter? We had to bleed through this whole thing to wind up with this? Movies used to be a wonderful thing in my life but this just fails on every level for a good story. Bryce Dallas Howard escaping raptors on foot and Chris Pratt having to outrun the same on a motorcycle at 70 mph is just silly. Some continuity would be welcomed but it is nowhere to be found.

title: Oof
text: This was a hard watch. I'm a big fan of this franchise. The only entertaining parts are about the last 20-30 minutes or so. The action is sub par even then. Save your money and watch it at home.

title: Utter Rubbish, made by stupid Americans for Stupid Americans.
text: After witnessing the first Jurassic Park all those years ago in a Cinema, amazing! We have been served a mixed bag of sequels and this has to the worst, the studio needs to get rid of the Pratt, move on and re develop the storyline.Utter Utter garbage.

title: What am I seeing?
text: I genuinely think there's a culture now where it's cool to hate things, especially established things and by proxy try and make it seem that everything from this generation is superior, we see constantly awful new tv and movies scoop awards whilst they're a chore to watch, yet great movie franchises get panned, top gun seems to be the exception.This movie isn't bad at all, I read through reviews, people hating on the strangest of things, saying there was no plot, yet there's a clear plot, multi layered and from different angles. That dinosaurs didn't feauture more, there were plenty that were used right, the fact you wanted more shows you think they were good. So many other nonsensical "opinions" copy and pasted by those just jumping on the badwagon of being cool to hate.The only negative for me was the main villain, not enough of a presence and not the best acting, other than that I didn't see anything wrong with it, no one I spoke to had anything negative to say and conversations I heard after were all positive.I'll give you one task, find any of these negative reviews that offer any form of coherent improvements or arguments that would've improved the film, I'm not talking about making it shorter, adding more dinosaurs in, I mean the plot and execution. I read many a pompous self gratifying reviewer talking utter rubbish with no justification.I read 50 negative reviews and found not one offered anything but childish logic either from someone who's either not seen it, or saw it and liked it but saw it's more trendy to hate it so made up a bad review.The effects are brilliant, plot made sense and everything to me was great, the only mistake for me was not making it over two parts, as dinosaurs in the real world was always what I wanted to see, so splitting it into two films, adding some more set pieces or landmarks with the dinosaurs interacting would've been awesome but think that's just me wanting to see more cool moments and visuals because I enjoyed a great movie.Ignore the hate, have your OWN opinions for a change, stop being sheep.

title: Polished pile of dinosaur dump
text: It is so polished looking that it almost makes sense that the CEO of Biosyn - typo of Biosin, I guess - looks so much like Tim Cook of Apple. The movie is long and feels long and it seems that they made it that long in order to be able to show all kinds of dinosaurs. Less is more, I would say. The acting is a mixed bag, I would say, with Chris Pratt being the weakest link. But it doesn't beat the bad quality of the script. While the original Jurassic Park based on the book by Michael Crichton was science with some fiction, this movie is just fiction in so many aspects - starting with dinosaurs being comfortable in winter or having spread to other continents supposedly.

title: Jurassic World Dominion
text: The Jurassic World trilogy is wrapped up. The story is about an bland but evil corporate head of BioSyn Dr Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott) who breeds genetically modified prehistoric locusts to wipeout food crops apart from genetically engineered ones.So no one suspects that if BioSyn crops survive that BioSyn might be doing something nasty.The original Jurassic Park team of Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) and Alan Grant (Sam Neill) and Dr Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) go to investigate BioSyn.Right on their heels are Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard) and Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) who are there to rescue Maisie the cloned girl and the offspring of the raptor, Blue.In the almost 30 years since Jurassic Park, the CGI has improved immeasurably. This is shown on the CGI dinosaurs which are much better than the animatronic ones.The story is limp as it tries to duplicate too many beats from previous movies. This lengthy film repeats the same tension over and over as someone is stalked or chased by a dinosaur.Jurassic World Dominion wants the audience to contemplate a world where humans, animal life and dinosaurs coexist. The opening montage makes that a non starter.

title: Boring and Bad Acting
text: This acting was so thrown together and the action scenes were corny and the plot was going in to many directions and they all just ended up in the same place every time like a maze. Also Boring I had to sit there and keep trying to watch it without shutting it off. I do feel like I wasted 2 hours watching this.

title: Amazing
text: I don't know why this movie is receiving a bunch of negative ratings. In my opinion this movie is spectacular and amazing! Best cgi by far in the franchise. Amazing action and I absolutely loved the dinosaurs!

title: Terrible, should've stopped at the last movie or even earlier!!
text: This movie is so bad my kids wanted to leave the cinema before it finished cos they were so bored... Tried to bring in too many past characters and stories while trying to also create a new story that was apparently some big back story.. 2.5hrs is way too long for it too... Not to mention the corny scene remake attempts. Seems like more of an attempted action film with random dinosaurs thrown in, but then that whole storyline just disappears before it finally resembles something like a Jurassic Park movie in the last 10mins.... Sorry guys, should've stopped at the last one... If not sooner!!

title: Just No
text: Peril after peril after peril...this film is exhausting without being either entertaining or thrilling. One minute a person is outrunning a dinosaur on foot, the next they're faster than a motorbike. It almost got going with the introduction of the original cast but that didn't last long and it went back to CGI nonsense.Don't even get me started on the flaming locusts. We've come so far, technically, since JP92 but we've forgotten how to create characters and tell stories.

title: My God, what a jaded and ungrateful audience!
text: I'm legitimately baffled by how much hate this film has received. 5.7 stars makes about as much sense as liver ice cream!This was an awesome film! Good...Lord!This is coming from someone who is an extremely critical cinephile, mind you. But, good grief, I at least know how to keep it in the pocket.To lambast the actors and writers...I'm just-all I can think to suggest is maybe ya'll should just to stop going to see movies.Any reviewer who claims that this cast of actors performed poorly should be immediately disregarded. We're talking about Christ Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Jeff Goldblum, Sam Neill, and Laura Dern. If these people haven't proven their abilities as actors by now to audiences, that's on the audience.This film had all the makings of a great Jurassic film. I was delighted to see the original cast mix with the new. Loved the new adventures and action, the dinosaurs, the characters, the heart. It had everything I wanted in a final installment.It's a franchise. There's a reason for that. It is the continuation of an umbrella plot line. If you're tired of it, don't watch the movie. Simple.Those of us who still enjoy the new developments of a continued story, the nostalgia, the new dino designs and adventures, had a great time.What I find hilarious is people blasting this film for doing what they laud in the original film. If you maxed out at the first film, watch the first film then! It is available for purchase to watch repeatedly at your heart's content. Leave the new films to those of us who can appreciate new approaches to a continued storyline.I get varying opinions. I consider this film to be a delightful 9/10 personally. But I can understand someone giving it an 8, 7, even 6. I disagree but a positive, if not more critical rating, I can understand. No film is perfect and no film reaches various people the same way.But calling this film trash, giving it a 1 star, calling it boring...sorry, but I'm looking at you and wondering what's wrong with you! Boo, who made you so angry?? 'Cause that makes literally zero sense.If you found THIS boring, you made the wrong choice for yourself from the jump. Check your pulse maybe? Idk!This was a great & thrilling film. Great performances, stunts, action, graphics, & nostalgia.It's a movie about humans and dinosaurs existing together...*blink *blink...it's SCIENCE...FICTION...suspend some derned belief for crying out loud.MY.... GOODNESS... Phew!It's a good thing actors get paid well, ya'll would kill the industry with these over-the-top, unjustly harsh criticisms. I used to be able to trust user reviews of movies and ignored the critics. But now it just looks like everybody's angry and bitter and jaded and taking it out on films by writing seriously ridiculous reviews. So much so, I'm literally starting to interpret 5 stars as a 7, and so on.I missed out on quite a few good films trusting user ratings in the last few years and have learned they can't be trusted anymore. Glad I didn't pay any attention to reviews for this movie. Gaaahlee!Lighten up ya'll. It's entertainment.

title: Worth giving a miss
text: It's among the first from the sequel that I started getting bored and wanted it to be over. It has all the characters but not the soul needed. Not impressed.

title: Dominion is every bit a science fiction thriller that plays out like an action adventure film!
text: Giving legacy characters the time to shine alongside their modern counterparts, the film steps on the gas right out of the gate and becomes one dinosaur nightmare after another. Weaving each legacy character tightly into the new story line like they were meant to be there all along. This movie takes you to fun and exciting places. You really feel like Trevarrow set out to make an epic conclusion to a franchise that's had its ups and downs.Relying on a lot of in camera effects, more so than other Jurassic World installments, made the film feel like classic Hollywood from the 90's. You may remember the time where entertainment was just that. The cinematography was big and bold. The dialogue made you laugh and feel good. Effects left you in wonderment. All without pushing a narrative that takes away from being entertained. Dominion's mixture of puppetry and CGI made the world feel tangible. It's a thrill ride that's full of the same dinosaur magic that made the original film feel so alive. The heartfelt moments are earned. Malcolm's witty personality is on full display. The legacy characters have closure. This film is tense, it's smart, and it's fun for the whole family!Don't listen to the critics! This film is exactly what the original film set out to do in 1993... entertain you! It's classic Hollywood at its finest, and I loved it! This is the Jurassic movie you didn't know you wanted, but now can't live without.

title: It's mostly bad, but hard to rate overall.
text: I saw this with my nephew yesterday. The CGI, sound design, and camera were all topnotch as you would expect from a Jurassic Park film. Even the few shots of practical effects were quality. This was very expensive to make for sure.But everything else was flat and mindlessly, needlessly complicated. The first big problem I had with it was that it's WAY too long by at least an hour. The runtime became almost torture. It's like they kept inventing problems for the characters to solve for the sake of a longer duration.The next thing was that there was too much going on. There were multiple plots within the plot so it felt disjointed. And some of them were pointless. You've got a human clone with a story about her mother and the clone's search for her identity, a locust plague, a conspiracy, some more stuff, and then the dinosaurs. It was cluttered.With any Jurassic Park movie, I think less is more. The original adaptation did it best and I don't believe its magic will ever be recreated: A mysterious park with cloned dinosaurs who escape. The characters then try to survive the chaos. Throw in unbelievable filmmaking craftsmanship with lovable characters and we had a winner. That's it. That's all we needed.I will say that it was better than Fallen Kingdom. I can't declare that I outright hated Dominion but I wouldn't bother with it again and found it forgettable. Having the original cast back was nice to see but it didn't do anything to help beyond the warm nostalgic factor.This certainly wasn't a fitting end to the franchise.

title: It could have been random scenes of dinosaur action and be. better than this.
text: The plot was incredibly vague and spiritless, and the acting performance of the little girl was horrendous. Don't bother watching if you are a JP fan since the only good thing about it is a part of the old cast and the CGI.

title: Dull and boring compared to previous JP movies
text:
Boring boring boring.I have watched all the previous Jurassic park films and I think that this is the most dull of all...
The scenario license inspiration I think, and it revolves around the characters that have previously played in the series. There is no real action or thrilled with dinosaurs ..
In comparison to other Jurassic park movies I think that I have lost my time watching this.

title: Bad and no worthy of Jurassic Saga
text: It fulfilled its function of entertaining, but I expected more regarding the "end" of the Jurassic saga. I loved seeing Dinosaurs that I always wanted to see on the big screen, but I felt that it was not made for me but for today's children and for the general public, as it is what sells the most... I went with the intention of getting excited like that in 2015, but it only entertained me. They did not know how to take advantage of the mythical characters of the saga, and the focus was diverted towards these so-called lobsters. They sold us a marketing of Dinosaurs in the world, be it in the previous installment, the short film, the prologue, the website and the very title of this new film, but hey, it was entertaining.

title: They sure love their diversity!
text: Bad cgi, bad story, bad acting, but they sure let you know in every scene that they hired a diverse group of actors. It was so forced that I played a game and called out correctly the ethnicity of every new actor before they were introduced over 50% of the time. Rooting for the bad cgi dinosaurs here, hopefully they eat everyone. Let this franchise die already.

title: Not a fan
text: Movie sucked, it was about the people not the dinosaurs. The tribute to 1993 JP original was obvious. The acting was cheap and weak. The story line was ridiculous and the over the top irrelevant british accent of Maisie Lockwood was a horrible choice. She is a beautiful girl and probably talented actress, but her irrelevant accent took away from the story line. It was not necessary and plenty standard actress are available.Please - do better or stop or making movies that are irrelevant.

title: Okay....Many silly moments, but I still have to give it a 10 :D
text: I mean... there is no need to talk about silly stuff here. What I loved is the original cast. Just for them and all the Easter eggs this gets a 10 from me. :DDinosaurs being cute and living side by side with modern day animals is a big lol. That cuddle between blue and her kid is cuteness overload, no matter how silly it might look. X]I mean, all and all... I had fun.

title: Let it die like the dinosaurs
text: I watched fallen kingdom before this just to refresh my memory, that was a snoozefest, this is even worse.Honestly so poor it's unbelievable that they allowed it to go in the direction it did, making promises to dinosaurs., please.I lasted maybe a hour and a half before I was questioning everything happening, bringing back old characters to try and get old audience onboard was just a fat no for me, they offered nothing to a poor written story, with so many holes in it you wonder if a dinosaur has taken a bite out of it.It's the same storyline as ever, someone promises to do good with the dinosaurs but doesn't, someone's kidnapped or taken hostage, which leads to a boring long winded film that I personally couldn't wait for it to end.The dinosaurs themselves also looked really poorly done at times, which made it even worse.These 3 films as a trilogy have been a insult to the originals.

title: Please enough is enough
text: No more please. Another puerile movie that has gaps in the storyline you could drive a bus through. Some really bad special effects, an absolutely ridiculous story, coupled with enough wooden acting make this cringe worthy. If you love the franchise do yourself a favour and pretend this sequel doesn't exist.

title: Genuinely bad
text: It felt like the goal was to tear down the franchise. Terrible effects. Completely changed the legacy characters. The whole movie was corny. As a JP fan, I wish I wouldn't have watched.

title: In a world of dinosaurs, locusts are the biggest threat?
text: I was 8 when the first JP came out so obviously I'm a big fan of the original. I was also a big fan of JW when it came out, I've played both the JWE games too.So to finish the series with a very mediocre film is just downright disheartening.JW2 was a let down but it ended with such promise it was merely a stepping stone to get to THIS, THE SHOWDOWN, MAN VS DINOSAUR.And it just didn't happen, if anything this was worse than JW2.Now seeing the original cast back was cool, but it didn't solve the plethora of problems with the film. CGI was great and the actors put in good performances but I don't think anything could save this from the terrible story.Now the film does pickup A LOT in the last 40 mins or so, but the ending is terrible, no solution, no answers, no....ending tbh. It was almost like they were leaving it open for another sequel, but by making 2 bad films in a row I really think the box office would be WAY down for another one.It's not a terrible film and it's not a good film, IT'S NOT WHAT WE WANTED I cant tell you that!!!!It's probably above JP3 and below JW2 but an average film that squandered the opportunity to be absolutely epic makes me feels like I've been ripped off, money wise and hype/waiting wise.This could have been the best in the series and I'm gutted that,it wasn't.

title: When is enough enough?
text: Since Pratt took over as the main protagonists, the franchise spiraled down to a new level of moronic directions and decisions. And this last installment even doubles down on it. I had problems getting into the plots what was all over the place because the writing looked like something someone came up with on a buddy party after to much alcohol. And locus? Why bloody locus? Let this franchise die. The only honor it has to show for is the first movie. Going to re-watch that now. Been years since the last time.

title: Bad
text:
I love all jurassic world movies .. buT.. this...
poorly written, bad acting almost like force acting, bad CGI.. I love the cast really do but.. it was horrible! I have never given movie review star as one but right now I really did..

title: Jurassic World Dominion
text: Dominion: The Control or exercise of Control, as defined by the dictionary, this movie had no control and they damn sure didn't exercise control, the Dinosaurs were running wild, people were running, some being eaten and some just taking up space.This movie had no rhyme or reason, the only thing it accomplished was a huge money haul at the box office, and even though they announced this as the last movie in this franchise, something tells me, there will be others, they left to many questions unanswered.The Producers brought back everybody they could find available or who needed a pay check, for the final movie, except Nick Robinson and that Ty kid, who's no kid anymore, surely they would have brought back fan favorites, Two Hours and Twenty-Seven Minutes of sheer unadulterated boredom.You won't find any social redeeming values in this movie, the studio should have paid for people to watch this time killer. If you haven't watched it yet, it's really not worth it.This movie was made on name recognition only. I'm sure movie goers are wishing they had gone to watch something else, any thing else. Well, good luck with this one.

title: Dinosaurs
text: Love the old cast back and love the movie. The cool dinosaurs make up for the sometimes poor plotchoices and storytelling. More dinosaurs would have been even better . Worthy ending of the saga.

title: Not lived up to expectations!
text: Storyline should have been more realistic! BLINKING LASER & dinosaurs will follow looked too gullible even for children. Movies claimed to be in 3D, but you can watch this 3D movie without glasses, just tell you how great 3D it has! Controlling dinosaurs with chip, giant locust invasion, human clone point us to shoddy patch work so as to keep on story going for 2:30 hrs. Will be successful on just hype of the franchisee!

title: Quite boring.....
text: Almost slept 3 times..... horrible storyline...... Just dinos and mixed with the new & old characters.... filmed the Easter Eggs and just for the Easter eggs......

title: My eyes rolled 360 degrees
text: Be amazed and wonder at the spectacle! Because it's all there is.. with decent CGI (and puppets?), action scenes straight out of an early Mission Impossible film and no actual story.This movie is noticeable fabricated to make you cringe, especially those with investment in the originals.The problems are many.. not only with the lack of plot, but the unnecessary callbacks and self-inflicted gratification.. to even background actors and main cast "acting" like there are no LOOSE KILLER DINOSAURS in the room. Not even the CGI Deer!It is a "dumb monster movie" and nothing else. Which takes every little chance to put humans against a different one of them.With all the stories they could have told (following the previous silly installment), someone decided to make more problems instead of focusing on the ones it has! Because on top of Dinosaurs roaming free, now you have Food-chain and agricultural problems.At this point.. I just couldn't care less! Dear old Michael Crichton would be ashamed.

title: Pitiful
text: I just hope Spielberg doesn't see this; for his health ... It's been 30 years since the first movie and none comes even close to the first. But this last one is horrifying. Luckily I didn't go to the cinema.

title: JURASSIC ROARS
text:
The new Jurrasic World Dominion is a great summer popcorn movie with more action than the previous films. It also has more dinosaurs than the other films. If you want to be entertained and thrilled then this is the film for you
Don't listen to the naysayers because they are the same ones that hate every movie that comes out. I doubt most if them have even seen the movie!

title: Worst movie I've seen in 2022
text: I can't remember the last time I walked out of a movie theater during a movie. I couldn't handle more than 30 minutes of this movie. I won't even watch it again if it is free.

title: Amazingly badly written story
text: I have loved all the Jurassic movies thill this one, which I left somewhere down the line.Had just seen the Attack of the Monster Crabs when I tried this and that old turkey was better!As far as this new movie went (before I turned it off) it was mainly a poor copy of a 50th's horror movie, with gigant locusts attacking, not crabs, and the animation was not much better. Dallas Howard and Pratt were definitely not really performing at their best (they are very good in the early World flics), or the direction was crap (for sure the screenwriter should try something else, say husbandry?).

title: Achieved the impossible
text: A step by step guide to making a movie about dinosaurs as boring as possible.Performances were phoned in, even from the greats like Goldblum and Neill. They were clearly just picking up a pay check.Pratt and Howard - sorry dull as dish water.Even the dinosaurs look bored.My children were laughing at the ridiculousness of it all and I had to harken back to when I watched the original in the cinemas and was astounded and captivated.For the love of all that's holy, stop flogging dead horses and get an original concept or at least put a modicum of effort into decent screenplay and characters.

title: Heart stopping action.
text: This movie did not disappoint! It sated my nostalgic side and brought the new trilogy to a close. Loved all the jump-scares, close-calls and nods to the OG Jurassic Park.

title: Tijuana bathtub candy
text: It looks like delicious candy, but I'm turns out it's the kind of candy made in a Tijuana bathtub. It's soul poison. I can't believe what's happened to this franchise. I went to see top gun a second time and it was sold out so I saw this. Wow what a wasted afternoon.

title: Time to put a fork in all things Jurassic
text: What a snooze! This franchise is done. Driven into the ground by an outdated 1980s franchise model boomers refuse to let go of. Spielberg used to put out good movies, now all his movies are like mega-budget B-movies like Roger Corman. The only people buying tickets were the ones who couldn't get tickets to Top Gun.

title: Chaos theory
text: Jurassic world meets Mission Impossible.The story is so extremely poor and thin.It's almost insulting. Nothing new, nothing original, the most crazy stunts and plots.I hope these movies are extinct now.An extra star for getting the cast together.Review from Holland.

title: It is a MUST see movie for the summer!
text: There are so many action scenes, and the characters are really likable so I would highly recommend this movie. Also, the special effects are really good, and it is a major improvement from Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (I still liked it, but this is better).

title: Worst Jurassic World movie
