text: This movie disappoints on every level, the trailer gave away all the action scenes and it doesn't feel like a sequel to the previous films. There are no memorable moments to speak of and even the dinosaurs when they are on screen which is barely ever do nothing special. Such a disappointment.

title: Is T Rex a vegetarian?
text: What's with T Rex? Is he a guest professor at this place, trying to fumble through English but it all coming out as roaring? Buddy, they're standing right there! Just pick one of them and eat! This was the worst scene I've ever seen in any movie, and I sat through all of Mission to Mars (2000), so that's saying something.The fights between the dinosaurs were even worse. They just stand around roaring at each other. They could have put sensors on cockfighting roosters, and used that data to make some incredible fight scenes; instead the audience is served fight scenes of total banality.And the plot makes no sense. What does getting DNA samples of an insect at a sanctuary prove? This place literally captures and researches genetically resurrected organisms - it'd be strange if they *didn't* have samples of the insects.And lastly, why are characters where they are in the scenes they are? Why did you not leave when everyone else left? Are you that dumb, or was something important keeping you there?The movie started out with such promise; in the first couple of scenes, I thought it would be an epic commentary on the environment and genetic engineering, coronavirus, etc, and it slowly devolved from there.

title: All this movie has going for are the legacy characters.
text: JURASSIC WORLD: DOMINION had one job. Show off how living with dinosaurs would effect the lives of the people. It was promised by the trailers/marketing and the ending of FALLEN KINGDOM. It hardly touches on that.It's about locusts...LOCUSTS...I just scratched my head not once, not twice, but like three or four times. It's mind boggling to me that anyone involved in the film would think that would be the best focal plot point as opposed to dinosaurs out and about. I'm looking at Colin Trevorrow, Emily Carmichael and Derek Connelly who were directly involved with story and script.Plot involving Pratt and Howard's characters involve the cloned granddaughter from the previous film being kidnapped by Biosyn who is owned and operated by Lewis Dodgson. Dodgson some how failed upwards as a John Hammond 2.0 and comes off as a paper-thin character/villain. Pratt and Howard are really just pawns to be moved throughout the story really. They've never been compelling characters in all honesty so there's nothing new there. Also the JURASSIC WORLD's mascot raptor Blue has hardly anything to do here. She has a baby raptor that gets kidnapped along with the cloned granddaughter and nothing comes of it.In conjunction with what Pratt and Howard are going through, the original trio Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum have meaty roles, but their part in the story involves the unnecessary locusts. It's only till the end both sides meet up and find their way out of Biosyn HQ. Biosyn was only there to once again put the dinosaurs in a controlled environment.I'm been very vocal on how I'm not a fan of the JURASSIC WORLD films, and the only reason why I had any interest in seeing this film was simply because Grant, Sattler and Malcolm returned on the promise that they would have roles more significant than a cameo. At the very least the movie delivers on that. The legacy characters are treated with respect and have something to do as opposed to just being in the film for the sake of being in the film. The unfortunate part is again, they mingled with locusts more than they mingled with dinosaurs.DeWanda Wise as smuggler pilot Kayla Watts I found to be kinda cool. She had more charisma and personality than Pratt or Howard had in all three films combined.It's baffling to me how FALLEN KINGDOM destroyed the island, and how Universal and the filmmakers were too afraid to show us actual coexistence with dinosaurs in real life situations. Just unacceptable.All this film has going for is that the legacy characters are handled properly despite a terrible plot thread, and aside from that, some good dinosaur scenes, that's really all there is to it. Six JURASSIC films in and only one good one. Even if this is billed as the "culmination" of the films, pretty sure they'll make more if it prints money at the box office. Either way for me at least, the franchise has ran its course.5/10.

title: More like a midday anniversary movie special
text: I can see clearly why critics have described this instalment in the franchise as a mash up. Key characters from previous movies thrown together into reminiscent past iconic scenes to loosely follow the very basic park plot. The characters are cardboard play pieces with mundane dialogue that goes nowhere. Not only was the monster dinosaurs recycled, but also some familiar dinosaurs from two decades ago (still filmed as obvious mechanical puppets). In conclusion, I struggle to avoid falling asleep watching a midday Jurassic Park reunion anniversary style movie special. Hopefully in future instalments they might actually create a decent interesting thrilling mature script around the existence of dinosaurs roaming in the human world. Previous two movies in recent years are brilliant. And the original three movies were magical. This movie was a boring letdown.

title: Absolute Money Grab
text: I am appalled at my decision to spend my hard earned cash and see this at the cinema. I am thoroughly surprised at the legacy character actors decision to take on this movie. They would have balked at the ridiculousness and blandness of the script, yet the money clearly swayed their decision to take it on. I swear, watching Chris Pratt try to tame the dinosaurs with his repetitive'talk to the hand' motion, I felt like I was going to vomit. Please avoid this like the plague. The studios don't deserve to make money off us with this one. PS- I absolutely couldn't stand the young girl: the character and her ridiculous plot line, and the two dimensional actor.

title: Didn't fail to deliver the same story line even in this Nth movie
text: Dinosaurs get loose. Eats some people. Some survives. The end.I've been watching this movie since childhood lol please hire a story writer next time.

title: Boring!
text: This movie was trying so hard to give graceful endings to some characters, trying to refresh older characters, trying to make some characters relevant again.The plot was so incredibly boring I had to break the movie up into watchable parts just so I could eventually finish it. There was no way I could watch it all at once. Thank goodness I didn't see it in a theater, I would've been hard pressed not to pathetically eat my way through 10 buckets of popcorn.I would say not to waste your time watching it but if you're a fan of the series then you might as well check it off your list. This movie is a forced labor of love for somebody but us fans have all forced ourselves to watch it.

title: Very Disappointing
text: I was excited for this movie, but after seeing it, it feels like I just rewatched the whole series compacted into 2 hours.The plot is very weak, and at times feels like they just stopped caring about the story.It jumps around from place to place with no regard for time, of how they got there.Just rehashed all the old tropes from the previous films.Felt like it was just a sad attempt at a money grab using original cast to bring in original fans.

title: Great movie!
text: Highly recommend this movie , Great CGI Great Animatronics. The 1st half was a bit slow paced but IT REALLY DID PICK UP IN THE 2ND HALF! Best movie of the JW trilogy 100%

title: Was this written by an 8 year old?
text: So bad, if you look at the first Jurassic Park it worked because you didn't know what would happen to the characters, it was built on suspense and brilliant film making.This just bounces from one scene to the next with all the main characters having an almost superhero invincibility whilst it seems the writers say "what now? I know, what about an even bigger and badder dinosaur with bigger teeth".One of the worst cinematic experiences since Kingdom of the Crystal Skull.

title: Are Critics bought off ?
text: What is the standard of films these days? Simple mindless entertainment is over saturated. I think having a fun, silly, mindless blockbuster is fine. But Jurassic Park dealt with complex ethical issues. Just because you can should you? EtcAnyways it was exciting to see the legacy cast back. Some of the sequences were fun and exciting. But Films like these used to have a bit of grit back in 1990's. In this, everyone looks perfect in every scene. Alan and Elie look like they just go out of hair and makeup. Perfectly staged. No imperfections. Everything just feels superficial. Every bit of dialogue feels safe. Every character is almost superhero invincible.Meh.

title: How to kill a franchise
text: This was such rubbish.A kid with existential crisis. Wrangling multi-ton beasts with bare hands.by a puny human. I think it only made money because it was riding the success of the previous entries.This is just ranting. But people should beat the universal directors to within an inch of their life and then hung and put on display for greenlighting the project and burn Universal to the ground.. (I don't advocate violence, just was.so disappointed, walked out of the movie just after half an hour)I have never commented on a movie before. This just destroyed my childhood memories.How the hell did you get 6/10, you paid someone? This doesn't even deserve 1/10. Just for not having a clear plot and being written all over the place.For all I care Universal can go ... themselves. But for heaven sake don't drag good actors down with you.

title: 2.5 hours of Metal grinding ear pain !!
text: Worst movie ever, with horrible sounds, this franchise should go extinct like the dinosaurs. They should have remastered or remade the first 3 movies. No one can beat the first movie.

title: stop please
text: This was like watching fast and the furious with dinosaurs, but the cgi was very bad and the acting in this was terrible. Not sure why but this was a disaster from begining to end. Chris pratt doing same boring chris pratt stuff. Predictable and overdone.

title: Please stop making Jurassic Movies
text: Too many characters I don't care. Too many chases I've seen before. Too many dinosaurs roarings only make me yarn. Too damn predictable and lengthy. Why do they keep producing this kind of garbage? Because people are getting dumber and dumber.

title: Disastersaurus vex
text: Do you want to sit through a film and just pick out new flaws every couple of minutes? Do you want to see screenwriting that leaves you asking, "but why?" Do you want to see a plot that a 5 year old conjured up on a napkin just after they ate a kilogram of sugar? Then look no more because you've found the ultimate heap of excrement that incorporates all of that.What a disaster. I hope the franchise goes extinct because this was the worst thing to happen to dinosaurs since the meteorite.

title: Awful
text:
I don't know how this film is rated above 1.I could have added more reasons...
1) Boring storyline - killer locusts 
2) The story flits chaotically between countries, places and characters so you end up not caring what happens.3) Boring dialogue.4) The same types of dinosaur scare scenes we've already seen in the other films.5) Nothing new or interesting... I love Jurassic Park, Jurassic world this film however was very disappointing.

title: Worst movie of the year so far
text:
Pros: there were some dinosaurs
Cons: no plot, in general bad acting, too long, forgettable action, poor dialoguesI do not recommend it, it was the worst movie I've seen this year.

title: False marketing!
text: This movie sold is on the concept that dinosaurs where living among us! This is what the trailers and marketing promised us! Instead we get nothing like that...We get a locust plotline to bring back the original cast and a clone girl/indoraptor plotline for the "World characters!" There is nothing new in this movie! Just revisiting stuff we have already seen.Best part is to see the original cast, but that only works the first time. If i wanna see the original cast i would watch the original Jurrassic park movie.

title: Dull, lifeless, very poor execution and writing
text: I love movies. I am dedicating my entire life to the wonderful craft of filmmaking that saved me from the darkness. Engrossing audiences in a compelling story with relatable characters and all the components that make up MOVIES.This is not a movie.This is a spectacle. A very bad, stupid spectacle. In recent years, I have come to realize that most big Hollywood movies are so hollow, generic and overall not compelling. I still have a mild amount of respect for the Marvel movies despite their flaws. They are most definitely not meant to be anything more than entertainment that appeals to the masses and families of the world but you can tell that they care about not being plain stupid and have that wonderful sense of fun.This isn't. WAY TOO MUCH exposition, poorly executed "action" scenes, very stupid dialogue and it only relies on showing you scenes from the previous movies of the franchise (even JP3, believe it or not). I wouldn't even recommend this movie to general families, they'll probably be bored and leave the theater frustrated.Please do not support this. You deserve better entertainment that will respect your intelligence. You deserve better.

title: So bad
text: Writing this review while sitting in theatre with this garbage on the screen. I tried to sleep for the first part. After this review I'm going back to playing candy crush. Just bad. Too many things wrong with it to discuss.

title: Why, just why
text: I've been trying to wrap my head around how Colin Trevorrow went from Safety Not Guaranteed, a passable indie movie - but nothing special, to being given the keys to two of the biggest franchises in movie history, those being Jurassic Park/World, and Star Wars. He must have some serious dirt on the producers of said franchises, because there is no way he is experienced, or talented, enough to take on those movies, as shown in this frankly appalling "trilogy finale". It's awful, truly awful. We can only be thankful he was taken off of Star Wars, the damage done to that IP was bad enough with what we got, I can't imagine the horrors he would have unleashed on the SW fanbase. Please keep him away from important franchises, and back in the indie world where he might make another passable picture. Maybe.

title: Disappointing End to the Jurassic Series
text: There's a lot going on and no real solution in the end. The story with Maisie was interesting enough and Claire with Zia and Franklin at the beginning. After that it tends to fall.Owen survives a plane crash without a seatbelt and falls into ice water without any damage. He holds out his hands to many dinosaurs and most of the time the dinos stop. He is definitely a Marty Stu.Alan Grant and Ellie Sattler seem just tired and have barely any enthusiasm from their first film characters. They also have a forced love relationship which doesn't feel at all earned.Ian Malcom barely does anything.Lewis Dodgson is the most evil character in the book. Attempts to murder Sarah Harding and breaks a dinosaurs leg with no remorse. Well here, he has no relation to the character other than name sake. He is what I perceived a jab at Tim Cook from Apple. Even the complex is trying to replicate Apple Park.Henry Wu does a 180 and is a good guy without having earned it.There's many cringe scenes but the fact they even cameoed the logo of the film with the T Rex was just too much.I would have them do a 4th film just to fix this mess of a story they created. Nothing has changed from the end of Fallen Kingdom.

title: Not cinemascope
text: Movie review..."Jurassic World Dominion" 9 out of 10. (-1 because it is not in full width cinemascope). Very realistic, sensational visuals, great music and sound-track.

title: It felt forced..
text: The supposed "problem" of the film was not the highlight of the film, it was treated as an after thought. As much as I love Dr. Grant & Ian Malcolm, the jokes which referenced the past films felt flat. To the film's credit, there were some thrilling moments especially with Bryce Dallas Howard. It's an ok movie, was honestly expecting more.

title: Almost fell asleep
text: Total garbage! All actors seem to be dream walking as well. Trashy script, trashy directing, trashy performance. The only thing popular in this movie is woke + diversity + liberal left ideologies. Strong woman, smart black saves poor white, black Pilot non stereotypical - perfect, all manually arranged and in perfect quota balance and shoveled into your eyes. The only thing they forgot is to make a real movie, like, you know, Top Gun Maveric!

title: Pure Cheddar
text: This felt like it was written by a 15 year old kid. The cheesiest tropes, and dialogue that is cringy and unrealistic. And science from the imagination of an uneducated preteen. And THEN you have a cast that was careful to include all the current woke requirements. Most of the cast were definitely NOT brought in on their merits, but to satisfy Hollywood's deep, hypocritical need to virtue signal. And the characters, oh my... Combine clichs, cheese, and desperate wokeness, and this is what you get.I don't nit-pick about science or plot in action films, normally, but this thing is just so bad it almost makes me angry. Even the physics of motion with the visual effects was silly and cartoonish.I'm sorry, I just can't recommend this to anyone but the hardest-core Jurassic fans. It's just lame and silly.

title: Eat a bag of Richards... 13/10
text: Go see Jurassic World: Dominion.Go see it on the biggest screen you can find. It's epic in scope and scale. They took the feedback from the second movie and used so many more practical effects and animatronic dinosaurs. I clapped, I laughed, I choked up, I sat on the edge of my seat, I will see this again and again.The first and second Jurassic Park movies were disaster/survival movies... Then they went dumb for three movies and made monster movies because they thought people would be tired of "plain" dinosaurs. Finally they realized no one has ever seen a dinosaur so how the hell are you going to be tired of them?! This is a great disaster/survival movie and I REALLY hope they make more.For starters, we could use a high budget limited series about how they got Jurassic Park back under control for Jurassic World. Then you could just use Jurassic World as a back drop for any genre of movie :)

title: Literally, why?
text: Horrible story with some cool scenes. Maybe we should let some franchises die. Jurasssic Park should've been a one off movie, every sequal is worse than the previous.

title: A perfect example of inept storytelling
text: Forking shoot this was a bad movie...The writing is terrible; it's lazy, convenient, uninspired and puerile; it lacks creativity and soul. Everything about this movie is either bad or dumb; the plot, the storyline, the characters, they are all senseless wooden cliches.This is movie "fast food" at its worst, an insipid corporate byproduct made for people with "room temperature IQs". I get the appeal of milking this franchise but, at least, put some effort in it. End of day, it's another IP ruined by these "modern creatives".DO NOT waste your precious time on Earth watching this imagination dumpster fire.

title: Time for Extinction For This Movie Series
text: The original was a classic and the ones that followed varied from passable to good, unfortunately this movie would have been better never having been made. Not even the great Sam Neil and Jeff Goldblum could save it from medeocrity.

title: Amazing movie
text: It was a movie with everything. I know that a number of people will enjoy it. First of all it has the old cast,Sam Neill,Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum which is amazing. Secondly Chris Pratt,in my opinion one of the most influential celebrities in the world,"the best man alive". To sum up I believe if you like dinosaurs or jurassic park franchise you must go see the movie,It is a absolutely amazing experience.

title: Rinse..repeat..a tired franchise..
text: ..time to put a lid on it forever. Honestly I don't know where the makers are going with this. Same old dino reveal shots etc. It's time Spielberg calls it quits on this franchise..or maybe start a TV series..I don't know.

title: Truly disappointing
text: Wow I waited months and months for this movie to come to theatres, I absolutely loved the first two Jurassic World movies. Where do I even start, this movie is confusing as heck. One minute you're in Texas, then Utah, then Nevada, then Italy, there's no real story to tie everything together, waaaaaaay too much dialogue and too many new characters. After an hour and 20 minutes I was wondering when the action was going to start and when it did, it wasn't all that great. This one in my opinion, was a flop.

title: They completely destroyed the trilogy...
text: I honestly think they could have done better. They relied too much on fan service and not enough on story. I was bored throughout the film as well as my two friends. Short if you like dinosaurs you will be served but for the scary style action, save your money. Have a Day :)

title: I'm gonna miss Jurassic World so much
text: I absolutely loved this movie, the plot, sparks of comedy, characters, and the thrills, just everything about this movie was wonderful. I am gonna miss jurassic world so much, and I'll definitely find myself going on a movie marathon with this sequel.

title: Dinosaur soap opera
text:
I wanted to like this however.....
They managed to make a dinosaur movie boring. That's the best thing I can say, I struggled to get through this movie, with how flat the plot was and soap opera like acting... I don't know how to explain it but the script and they way they delivered it was very bizarre. Even the action scenes were extremely boring and un-exciting Honestly giving it a 3 because the dinosaur cgi was good at times (like the opening scene) but not much else to praise here. I found myself not caring about any of the main characters it was just so forgettable overall, it could be skipped and you wouldn't be missing out on much.

title: No more please
text: This is a prime example of when to stop before you ruin an entire franchise. This was so corny that several tums were needed. What a terrible shame really because you had all the OG's there to make a great sign off. This should have been edgier and just better written. It's really sad to be honest because you hear the original tune and it brings wonderful feeling back of great movies. Not one single actor could have made it better because they all played along with the horrible corn dog writing and the dramatic stances. Just boo. The special effects and the beautiful shots were the best part. Would I say absolutely no ever to another one....ask me n a few years.

title: Totally disconnected.
text: This was definitely the worst Jurassic Park yet, and, one of the top 10 worst movies I've seen in years. The first third of the movie is barely watchable with terrible acting and horrible Direction. The second two thirds of the movie was watchable at best. It had a few glimmering scenes that were decent, but overall everything was horribly disconnected and very random. The soundtrack unfitting for parts of the movie, the audio was terrible. I only gave it three stars out of 10 instead of one simply because of the throwback to the old movies that it did. The Retro feeling in certain parts and nods to the other aspects of the series we're appreciated. But the rest of the movie was pretty terrible.

title: I need to cleanse my pallets
text: Chefs cleanse their pallets in between dishes, I need to cleanse my pallet after watching this movie with the original Jurassic Park from Steven Spielberg.I mean how can you make dinosaurs make look more fake in 2022 than someone in 1993.And the story and acting is so bad, Chris super powers is raising his hands and controlling dinosaurs now. It's so fake, dull and stupid, I hope this will be the last movie they make.

title: Nostalgic fun
text: Dominion is not better than the original, it does not have a fancy story. But its a fantastic thank you to the fans.With tons of nods to the original, a great collection of dinosaurs, beautiful well made animatronics, great music, great acting and fun action.Dominion is a love letter to the OG of the series. The returning characters are a nice touch and the new returning cast does a fantastic job with some hearthfelth moments.Objectivly speaking this would be more of a 6/10 - 7/10.But with the added fan service, solid acting and dinosaurs. It raises its score for me. If you like jurassic park, you will enjoy this !

title: Why?
text: What a disappointing ending to years worth of memories for so many. To have such an amazing cast and throw them into a carp story line with no meaning or gasto for the so called last one. Director should be embarrassed.

title: Pratt should go back to comedy
text: I probably should not even review this as I was lost for the most part, especially early on. I gather I missed at least one of these things since whatever the last one I saw was as I quickly forget about these eye-candy films pretty quickly. I had no idea why these animals were wandering around the earth in our daily lives nor why Pratt was raising a British child who is a clone?! There are some action scenes that tense, but mostly this is just a bad & very stupid movie. I was watching a Parks and Rec episode the other day and I had forgotten how much fun Pratt was at one time. His last few films have been awful and he has been a bore. He doesn't even act like he wants to be in this particular film. Regurgitating Dern, O"Neill and Goldblum reeks of a script concept that has run out of ideas. The special effects are impeccable, but who notices anymore?! It's kind of sad that so much of special effects these days are no longer really special.

title: Just don't make more.
text: It is not even a movie, it is more like that someone just want to waste your time for no reason. The acting is bearable but the plot and effects are so mediocre that you can't even stand the acting and sceneries.

title: Awesome Movie
text: I loved watching the movie, it was fun seeing the Original Trio back together again and them teaming up with the Jurassic World Characters and The Giganotosaurus was best non Hybrid Monster in the movie and the Malta scene was really awesome, This movie is the best action pack Jurassic Film in all of the Jurassic films.

title: Flaming pile of garbage
text: I can't believe what this franchise has become!? Did a 13 year-old write this script?! The CGI was terrible! Is Chris Pratt a jedi with the raptors, could have saved some people in the first Jurassic park. The only good parts were just rehashed nostalgia from the original with the old cast. So sad they keep adding trash movies to an amazing franchise to make a quick buck. Michael Crichton must be rolling in his grave to make a mockery of such an amazing book.

title: Jurassic World Dominion
text: After a slew of underwhelming sequels, the Jurassic Park franchise "finally" concludes with a film that somewhat fails to stick the landing. Being a longtime fan of the franchise as a whole, one of the most enjoyable aspects of this film was the unison of old and new characters. The portrayals of the characters were charismatic, and the eventual dynamic between these actors will undoubtedly bring a smile to any viewer's face. The visuals are also well done, with a notable combination of practical and computer effects. However, with all the flashy callbacks to previous films, visuals, and characters, the plot is what truly butchers the overall experience. Damage control from the sins of the previous film was at full capacity, desperately trying to justify the idiotic choices and twists that made the previous so infuriating. The plot is convoluted, trying too hard to give each of its large cast a piece of screen time and untimely forgetting to incorporate the true stars of the film, the dinosaurs. The film constantly focuses on useless subplots that bore and confuse rather than entertain. The villain of the film feels forced and contrived, copying and pasting from previous films and making no logical sense in the development of the overall series of films. The premise the film advertises is barely touched upon and deprives the audience of the most interesting aspect of the film. The logic is comparable to that of a Saturday morning cartoon, begging the audience to suspend disbelief for the stupidity that occurs. Overall, despite the aspects of the film that were done admirably, the baggage that came along in order to make it possible was eye-rolling and a definitive reason as to why this franchise should be laid to rest.

title: THIS MOVIE SHOULD BE EXTINCT!!
text: Seems they took a page out of the last Fast movie but with out dinosaurs going into space!The whole thing is a mess from start to finish with way to many unnecessary characters and sub-plots that make no sense.

title: The Beautiful End of a Story
text: Genuinely a great movie. The plot was extremely realistic with our world and how it really would react. They brought in new and older characters in naturally and connected each character together again beautifully. The film and everything was just amazing. The quality, the acting, all of it just 10/10. Great ending to a evolutionary storyline.

title: Beyond crap
text: Hollywood's habit of creating movies by formula has reached a new low, this thing is just horrible, and I was expecting it to be bad. The plot is so awful and the directing is so boring I started drifting away after a few minutes and couldn't care less about it. There's no doubt in my mind that this movie was written, produced and directed by idiots, which tells me there are way too many of them in position to burn millions of dollars in atrocities like this. I'm not going to go into the woke identity politics garbage in the movie as it's quite irrelevant given how terrible everything else is, even though I do believe it might be the main cause for the disastrous failure of JWD. As many others have mentioned, that's the end of the Jurassic franchise, may it rest in peace.

title: Tragedy
text: One of the worst big budget movies I've ever seen. The official death of a franchise. I can't believe we have gone this far down the rabbit hole since I first watched the original Jurassic Park in theaters as a kid. If this is the best Hollywood can come up with, save us all from the lackluster future of cinema.

title: When the vfx is worse than the original from nearly 30 years ago, you have problems.
text: This movie is horribly written and horribly directed. The franchise has been heading down hill for a while, but this chapter just jumped off the cliff. I would be embarrassed if I were a part of this film, I would remove it from my portfolio.The story is so cringy that I couldn't watch it all in one sitting, it took three. They threw science out the window as well as the vfx.The directing feels so amateur that even the experienced actors seem like garbage b-movie first time actors. The action scenes are definitely rushed and rely way too much on CGI.I really hope that the next rendition will throw this timeline out of the window and start fresh. This movie is depressingly bad.

title: great ending
text: This was a really fun movie way better then fallen kindom and jurrasic world it had more action more humor and it was so nice to see the old cast come back even thou i wish we could have seen jeff goldblum more.It was faced paced intense.I wish we saw more of blue and her son but that would be to picky.Now before seeing this i was reading how some people called this boring cliche and stupid but i bet those people didn't like the last to movies either just like the fast movie why watch this if you your going to hate it anyway let the true fans enjoy it and stop bringing it down.

title: one star for Pratts sexy ass and beard
text: The single most ridiculous story line and sci-fi inappropriate movie of the year. An acid reflux vomit of bad ideas and poor story telling. Dinosaurs just appeared and lived next to humans. Crock pot of sh#t.

title: Will never be Jurassic Park
text: It's a nice movie worth watching, but unfortunately a lot of the dinos seem more mechanical than they did back in 1993, 1997 and 2001... which kind of spoils the movie... and then all that DNA genetic engineering kills a bit the very essence of the film.I miss the originality of the Jurassic Park movies... there is too much predictability in the Jurassic World movies, especially this one.I personally think that there are too many things that are seen a little too easily through the fingers.JWD is worth watching, there should be no doubt about that, but it is not the greatest WAUW experience I am sitting with, after spending 2 hours and 40 minutes on it.

title: So much potential...
text: This movie had too many plots in one movie. They had the old cast and still failed to amaze me. Left the theater earlier in boredom. Likely because I was not into the movies but I've seen them all. The dinosaurs were the best part of the movie and kept me watching until almost the end. (I left in the last 15 minutes) Old fans will love this film. It's a ok 5/10.

title: Watched it empty theatre yes just me only in all rows.
text: Had a nice sleep in the beginning. Nothing makes sense. There is no connection of this one with past. Out of blue everywhere is mess. I am not going to get my 18$ back.

title: A fitting conclusion to the franchise
text: Its a really good and fun movie and it does bring closure to a lot of elements from the past. Now, if you thought that (spoilers) by the end of the movie all the dinosaurs would be contained then you need to get a reality check. I specially liked all the references to the first Jurassic Park movie and the closure to the first 3 og characters from that first movie plus the asian dude. And to conclude, her appearance might have been short.

title: Awful
text: Despite banding together some of the original cast with the new, this was the worst possible ending to a fantastic legacy. The script was barely tolerable and the whole film was incredibly random, not enough follow through and lack of detail in what could have been great scenes. As a long time fan, I'm devastated.

title: Bland and everything I hate about modern movies.
text: This is the first time I've been bored in a Jurassic Park movie.Everything in it feels so flat and bland. I know that when watching blockbuster movies that there's plenty of room for the unbelievable and you have to take certain things with a pinch of a salt. Normally I can switch off to things like that and let my brain cells melt away. That's part of the fun, and sometimes I seek that. But with very little redeeming things about it, the dumbness and implausible scenarios stand out. Too many cliches and too many predictable scenarios and plot points. Plus it doesn't really feel about dinosaurs anymore either.I didn't even care about any of the characters and part of me was egging on the dinos to devour every last one of them.It's a shame that the movie that collides the classic characters and the newer characters is this one. This is beyond mediocre and a boring mess of a film.

title: It's just bad
text: Don't waste your time with this garbage. This movie is full of nostalgia and no story. The writing and story is terrible. Just watch Jurassic Park instead.

title: What the hell happened ???
text: Really really disappointed and a big injustice to the characters of Jurassic park, it seemed liked it was all about Chris pratt's character, with no storyline whatsoever and no direction at all. Really ruined my childhood.

title: The best Jurassic Movie Since The Lost World 1997.
text: Ejoyed this movie a lot, don't understand why so many people hate it. It was genuinely a good movie. I enjoyed the actions scenes, they were intense and thrilling. The characters were great, and All the references to past movies and Camp Cretaceous were just amazing.

title: Why
text: I have recently played a 16 bit video game, total pixel art little sprites, where I was upset if anything happened to the cast of the game. After watching this film, I literally wouldn't have cared less if any of the characters had been killed at any point.It was boring. No plot, poor script, poor acting, bad everything. I think one jump scare nearly made me twitch and that was my biggest excitement of the whole film. Everything felt out of place, unreal and even little details, like the super rich, dinosaur kingdom owner planning to take over the world wearing a 2 pair of home bargains reading glasses. I actually nearly nodded off in an action part it was that thrilling.I guess as I am forced to give one star, then I will credit that one star. The effects for the dinosaurs was a very high quality bass rumble that really went through your body.Props to the sound man. Other than that, I want my two hours back.

title: What a mess
text: How is it possible that to create a travesty like this? The story doesn't make sense at all. Why didn't anyone intervene? I'm chocked. What a waste of resources and time

title: Lacks any sort of magic
text: After a drop in quality with the last installment, I was hoping JW would right the ship with the trilogy capper. Unfortunately, the franchise continues to sink with this lumbering and honestly pretty pointless entry.The story feels inconsequential and not much really happens. Coupled with loads of repeated dino scares we've seen before, and done better, there's really not much of substance here. There is some occasional lighthearted adventure, but it gets too often buried in attempts at drama. Thankfully Goldblum is here otherwise there would be essentially no humor in this film.

title: Entertaining but...
text: Entertaining but there's no point to this sequel. Certain plots are convenient just so two characters meet.One returning character seemed pointless. Just there for the sake of it.

title: My childhood is coming together!
text: No matter what peoples have said about these Jurassic World films, i have enjoyed these so much.These brought piece of my childhood back.I just love dinosaurs.This was great ending to trilogy.This brought back old and new.I really liked how this film started with multiple storylines about different things.And how they connected one by one so nicely.More about ethics of prehistoric species in our modern world.Some really good science fiction stuff.Good action.Great visual effects.Overall well made film.But most importantly so many different dinosaurs.And this one had so many new species.I was impressed that i'm still able to recognize so many of them.And of course there is my childhood's favorite one, Giganotosaurus!I really felt like i was child again while watching this film.And of course old faces from Jurassic Park meet new characters.This was just great.Lot of fun moments.So entertaining.

title: A comedic dumpster fire
text: There's a problem in Hollywood, and that problem is us. The viewers. We have made it abundantly clear with our wallets that we don't want innovation, we don't want creativity, we don't want artistry and we're not interested in any kind of cinema that takes risks."Well, shut up. That's not true", you may be thinking. "I have taste and a measure of sophistication and I do appreciate creative films". Well let me ask you this then: where do our dollars truly go? To sequels or to indie films? To multi-hundred million dollar superhero CGI fests or to films that tell great stories? To cars jumping out of exploding planes or to moving scripts with well developed characters?Hollywood is dumb. And it's not its fault. They just follow the money. The onus of demanding quality filmmaking is on us. And the only way to make that happen is with our wallets. We need to stop showing up at the box office for dumb "blockbuster" movies and start supporting real creators, so that we may never be subjected again to a movie like Jurassic World Dominion.

title: Awful
text: Unfortunately, Jurassic (Park III or) World Dominion is reduced to a comical... comic, picking up a few years after the end of the previous film in the series, where people are now used to living with dinosaurs, but with such a generic script that makes this movie such a tedious experience with the unbelievable irritating score. I also do not understand why Chris Pratt, Sam Neill and Laura Dern accepted those roles in this movie where even Jeff Goldblum struggles to get past the dull one-liners. The movie is too long, but the main issue is that 'Dominion' fails to deliver engaging action scenes. The film, in general, lacks tension, being a colossal disappointment on every level.

title: Ruin everything
text: Omg..This episode really ruin the entire franchise..Lack of story, lack of the beauty of Jurassic park movie, lack of character emotion..Ofcourse there is no doubt in the special effect but all they want just to make movie with dinosaurs chasing humans..Very disappointed with this one..You ruin Jurassic park movie we knew..

title: Rubbish End Of An Era!
text: Loved theses movies, can't wait for them to be released, was excited for this one to come out! It was overhyped and boring! This movie has ruined what should have been an epic end to one of the best franchises I have watched.

title: Good movie with nostalgic references
text: Not sure why this is getting horrible reviews but I enjoyed it. It had references from the original movies, witty banter between the old school characters and the new ones. Action packed scenes and a plot that was enjoyable overall. Of course nothing will compare to the original but I don't think this movie deserved the horrible ratings I kept reading about.

title: If you're looking for a movie about dinosaurs, you're looking in the wrong place.
text: I was really looking forward to this movie. It was so disappointing. If you care to watch a drama about the characters then you may enjoy this. But dinosaurs are NOT the theme here. It sucks they had such a great premise to work with and chose to go that way with it. Hopefully someone else comes along and makes a movie that's actually about humans coexisting with dinosaurs someday. That'd be effing awesome. I wouldn't pay to watch this, I wish I didn't waste my money.I don't know maybe kids would be able to enjoy this? Even then it seems like way too much fluff and dialogue and not enough action with dinosaurs.

title: I didn't finish this movie
text: I was just 2/4 in the movie and already felt like I was watching four different ones. I lost complete interest by the half of it. The plot was not interesting, the characters seemed all from a soap-opera, the actors seemed like they were just doing a job and, overall, an awful writting/directing. I wasn't surprised though,they did exactly the same with the Star Wars saga.Lets be honest here. The Jurassic World franchise is bad. It's just another product made by studio executives that don't really know (or care) about cinema. These days there's just a few people in Hollywood that really understand what films are truly about. That's why streaming services are today's best option, sadly.I'm not writting this review out of nostalgia or disappoinment, it's kinda fun to watch this industry digging its own grave, because you know, cinema doesn't belong to them.

title: Life never found a way for this film...
text: I haven't walked out of many movies in my lifetime but I did on this one...the story was so poorly written; it all just felt thrown together and not interesting at all....very disappointed....

title: Unsatisfying ending for an unsatisfying story
text: The pacing in this movie is plain boring and nonetheless horrible. It consists of the characters standing, seeing a dinosaur, running away from it, and the cycle repeats itself. So many unnecessary characters are there, many of which don't even get a development, and at the end of the movie, they're already forgotten. I would not recommend this to people that enjoy smart movies.

title: A lot of fun!
text: I went in expecting it to be terrible thanks to the reviews but honestly, What's not to enjoy? It had a lot of dinosaurs, lots of exciting action scenes, plenty of throwbacks to the original... so fun to the original cast!Maybe the villain or plot wasn't too elaborate but it still was a good dinosaur movie with lessons to learn.

title: Don't even "try" to watch this nightmare
text: This movie was free on Amazon Prime and I feel like I was robbed of my time. I am so disappointed in this blasphemy to the great Jurassic Park 1 I can't explain in words. Do not watch this atrocity of a movie. It will not entertain you whatsoever and it will simply get you angry about the entire series if you are a Jurassic Park fan whatsoever. It's just so sad how movie makers can spend hundreds of millions of dollars on something that is so bad. There seems to be no shame in Popcornflix anymore. I recommend the next time that you see Jurassic World Dominion come across your screen you don't give into the same temptation that I did and why actually watch it..

title: Great fun to watch!
text: I wanted to watch another Jurassic movie to see all the cool dinosaurs. I was not disappointed. To someone born in the fifties, who learned to program computers with key punch cards (ask an old person) I am absolutely entranced with the animatronics. Everytime I see a dinosaur (in the movie) I think about all the work and creativity involved. If the giant ants in Them (1954) were frightening, then these super monsters are terrifying. Kudos to all who brought modern technology to science fiction today.I am also appreciative of the great cast. It was good to see actors and actresses from earlier Jurassic movies. I took a moment to mourn the absence of Sir Richard Attenborough; he added so much to the movies he was in. While watching The Green Planet series narrated by Sir Attenborough, I kept expecting a dinosaur to lurch through the jungle or desert.

title: Jurassic Abomination more like....
text: Think of all the reasons you loved the first one, the idea of it, journey of the characters as overall storyline.Now just delete all of that from your mind and think of an opening sequence where Pterodactyls are nesting on top of the One World Trade Centre and you know for a fact you are in for one absolute shocker of a film.Just to add more attractiveness to it, they made the film 150 minutes long just so that we could enjoy lots more scenes of epic proportions. This is however better than Battlefield Earth in the fact that it is more realistic, so that is without a doubt a massive bonus for the viewer.

title: Spy movie with dinosaurs
text: I thought seeing the old characters would be this amazing thing, but they inserted them in, gave them bad dialog and plotline, it was not great, the last maybe 20 minutes redeemed it a little but not by much. Let the franchise go extinct and maybe dig it up in 25 years.

title: Wow, were we disappointed. I want my money back
text: It is very disappointing that this is the last film in the Jurassic Park franchise. The first film, and many of its sequels, were huge hits that had fans flocking to theaters every time a new installment of this franchise hit theaters. But with that, it's just a cheap ploy to get more money into this franchise before it goes away.It was a movie that was just a failure.Even the title - Dominion - makes you think of the destruction of the world and that one species, man, is disappearing. And an old species with new DNA and structure emerges. Even though this was a movie that just didn't have content like 1 2 3, not even 4, also for some reason the dinosaurs are small and he's weak, there's a scene where he holds, a dinosaur, with a rope when he's in a previous movie you needed chains so they don't break.

title: Below Expectations
text: I didnt expect it to be that low level of a story, after all the movie problem was just the genetically modified locust, wow.And all the dinos ate fine and living happily together LoL.The combitation af all thesr actors could have made something much more better.Disappointed.

title: Very good recommend watching it
text: I honestly didn't think I was gonna like this movie but even as a non Jurassic park fan I absolutely loved it had cgi is very good very heart warming moments action and yeah.

title: Bad all over, even the dinosaurs!
text: Two stars solely because I liked the original Jurassic Park. This one is a B-movie and the worst of the series. Acting is reminiscent of my high school plays, it's so painful to watch actors obviously waiting for their cue to talk or move.Even more painful is realizing every action is a rip-off of from the previous JP movies.It's also unintentionally hilarious - dinosaurs doing a tag-team on a bully dino, predators getting emotional.I could write more, but all of it is bad.

title: One great scene does not make a good movie.
text: Yet more dinosaurs in a specially designed area get loose and cause havoc for the humans, but this time, there's a dual plot approach about averting ecological disaster. The chase scene was great if a bit silly and the dinosaurs looked good as did the variety of settings they were in, but the whole film was a jumble of illogical action, terrible writing and bad dialogue. The re-introduction of old characters was a waste, the final escape was a bit of a farce and although there were some really good moments in there, it never matched the magic of the original.

title: If you love dinosaurs, it's great!
text: I've been reading a lot of negative reviews and I can understand that the overall plot may have not been the best but what other movie brings dinosaurs to life with this much quality? It's an adventure that will not only satisfy your dinosaurs fantasy's but it also gives you some enjoyment seeing the old cast come together and work with the new cast. We live in a world where people only look for negatives instead of highlighting the positives. It's worth the watch if you're a true Dinosaur/Jurassic Park fan! Enjoy!

title: 5 because I love Jurassic Park
text: So this movie is just plain terrible. But I am such a fan I can't give it a 1. Especially with the original characters coming back. But that is all they had going for them. The director tried really hard to recreate scenes that worked for him in Jurassic world but the rest fell flat. When I saw Owen on a horse I was out. This movie sucked balls. And I own multiple Jurassic park shirts.

title: Worst Ever in the Series!
text: I generally do not write any movie reviews, but i had to for this one!Expected something new out of this one, but i was so wrong!Its like they have picked best scenes from each movies and tried to make a historic one, which they totally failed!

title: Bad reunion
text: This was like, let's get the band back together and no one can play music anymore. Way way way too long. Average plot, very average opening scenes. All round trash.

title: Don't get all the hate
text: I've watched all the previous ones w/my boys. They brought me to this for Father's Day and we all liked it. Liked how they brought the original cast in w/the new cast. Jeff Goldum was his regular witty selfWorth seeing in the theater for sure.

title: Not worth the time nor the money.
text: This movie was a valiant attempt to remake something that had the potential to be amazing. However, the leaders of this film absolutely destroyed it.It is boring. It lacks crucial actors. The owner of the lab was the weirdest person in a movie I have ever seen. The writing was absolutely terrible. The CG and coordination was horrendous.The only thing that gives this movie 3 instead of a 0 or a 1 are the A-list of actors from the previous movies. But even then, Malcom was very bad in this. He just isn't a good actor and the writing didn't do him any favors.The plot was the worst of any movie I have ever seen. I'm horrible disappointed in this film and franchise. RIP the long-beloved series that we all grew up loving.

title: Awful!
text: The acting is wooden. The original stars look bored, and just there for a paycheck.Far too many characters who have absolutely nothing to do.Too may screenwriters who have created too many subplots that go nowhere.Read the Critical Drinker's review. It's right on the money!

title: Old things. No storyline.
text: Its not we expected. Some cgi is bad. No storyline. If you watch 2D version, you Will sleep. Acting was good, but dialogue was so so. Worst Jurassic chapter ever.

title: Absolute trash
text: Its disappointing and totally ruined the sequel. With such actors and a huge budget they could have done a lot better. That's all i would not like to add anything else to it.

title: No one fears about dinosaurs after watching this movie
text: Worst Jurassic movie.no meaning for making if you can't scare audiance with dinosaurs.velociraptor comes and complaints to hero about her cub kidnapped.took away all the respect and scars we have towards dinosaurs.dinosours became common and no one scares even for t-rex in the movie.

title: Beautifully done! Stop comparing to the original... This stands alone!
text: This movie is very well done and is more about the dinosaurs at times than the humans. This film really makes you think how much suffering we bring to life in general with GREED. I loved this movie and I would see it again! Really good story and connection to the original movie.

title: Summary of the movie
text:
40% of a boring LONG buildup,
Dinosaur chase and growls, Good people win, bad people eaten, Everyone just lives happily ever after
(with dinosaurs now roaming around the world destroying the ecosystem & economy)

title: CGI killed this franchise.
text: I could go on about how practical effects are superior but this movie is a testament to that fact. Basically every scene is shot Infront of a green screen and it's blatantly obvious. There's a reason why if you pop in the first two movies by Spielberg that they are still exhilarating.The first Jurassic World was okay but it didn't deserve two sequels. As others have said this movie is a soulless entry Into the franchise. I feel like most of the actors are acting if this movie is beneath them and it is.They didn't bother to do anything new with this movie. It's the same message in the last few movies about how corporations are evil, and can't be trusted. Honestly not everyone that runs a hedge fund or major corporation is trying to take over the world or has evil motivations.This movie forgets that it was Hammond's naivety that lead to the downfall of Jurassic Park. He really thought what he was doing was for the good of humanity. In was in the name of exploration. In every film since then all the main villains have had some stupid evil motive.Ultimately this movie is very predictable and I hope it is the last one in the franchise for a long time.

title: Terrible from start to finish.
text: This is not only the worst jurassic film in the franchise, but truly one of the biggest disappointments I've witnessed.Only reason I gave this two stars is for the nostalgic moments and the reunion of the original cast. It's not a spoiler to say this film is not about dinosaurs!I am not being dramatic, seriously, it is not about dinosaurs. The plot makes sense sure, but it's like watching a James Bond movie to find out it's about his tax return journey and discovering the trials and tribulations of such a perilous quest.The script/dialogue/writing is just poor, at some points it is just puzzling how it got a pass, at first it was funny, but soon got annoying. Going to avoid this director without prior research from no on in.

title: Movie is a solid entry to the franchise
text: The movie has some grand and poetic visualization which is apt for the setting up of the next phase in the Jurassic world Universe.Watching this one after four movies and almost two decades,the story line is although predictable but it poses one unavoidable question of why we really need the dinosaurs and how they will disrupt the food chain keeping the single principle of life on Earth- 'survival of the fittest'.Things will be changed now and it's very exciting story to take forward with a fresh angle in the Jusrassic Universe.Chris Pratt is very good actor and a star who rocks the movie with his talent. You will start living him more.But there is someone else who will steal the show keeping the future alive.A good movie to watch which excited me for the future additions in the series.

title: Disappointed - JP Fan
text: This was the lowest rating I've ever given a Jurassic Park/World Movie, I have been a collector of memorabilia and a fan since the original release on VHS back in the day. Unfortunately this film felt like a bad wrap up for the trilogy for a number of reasons;The forced scenes, like the T-Rex lining up with the circle towards the end to make the logo  and the shaving cream scene just to name a couple.You then had the undertone of the movie, I don't know if it was just me, but the whole film felt more of political movie, about racism, togetherness, climate change and big corporations. It was no longer a focus on the dinosaurs and the story but more of a political piece.There is many hints towards this, such as big pharma manufacturing these locusts, to control the food market, then the coexisting and living together forced messages throughout the film and at the end, then talking about climate change, the pre movie at the theater was literally a raptor at a UN conference talking to people about climate change I felt this could of been so much more, even the short cross over from Jurassic Park: The Lost World had a enjoyable mix of city and dinosaurs.This story also focused alot on the clone of a person, I don't care about people cloning... this is Jurassic World its about dinosaurs not cloning people or making weird people hybrids.I was just left underwhelmed and disappointed, after Fallen World it seemed so promising but they just ruined the direction, I was so excited with bringing back original members from the series but they didn't do much for the story you had the dream situation here and the opportunity to have a major classic but it missed the mark.Hopefully when they revamp the series again they take more consideration into keeping it within there target audience saying that I'll probably be dead if they wait another 10-20 years for a revamp It was nice to watch over all, but all the points above just didn't leave me wanting to watch it again.

title: Worst blockbuster movie of the decenie
text: Compilation of clichs, no constistency in the story. It felt like a bad parody. Anti-climax of the last blockbusters released those last years, it seems to witness how much some of the last big movie productions are going down in every aspect. I was expecting a lot from the visual effects and, despite some extremely good shots, they weren't as interesting and well made as they could have been. Jurassic Park had one story to offer and it has certainly been told in the first movie, all of the following and especially this one are not more than a pale copy. Where those production used to be a wonderful playground for experimentation, technical breakthroughs, offering wonderful experiences to the audience inspiring a new generation of filmmakers, they now become flat and boring, lost in the shadow of their predecessors.

title: Expect less and you won't be disappointed
text: I must say that it's the least exciting in the whole Jurassic franchisee. Nothing much to write about. You can just watch it once to kill your expectations. Story line could have been better. They could have given some more life to the story and the characters. It was almost like the whole movie is predictable. You just don't have the excitement that you had in the Jurassic park -1. There is a absolutely no wow factor whatsoever. Names of the creatures keep getting bigger, definitely a tongue twister I must say. The only thing which won't bore you of the movie is the same old cast. Though acting is good, poor story just fails to give life to the movie.

title: These writers need to do some fact checking...
text: Some of the running speeds of these dinosaurs are not historically correct. I know they're obviously CGI... But still, it needs to make sense if you want viewers to take the movie seriously...

title: Emotional and excited
text: I was looking forward to this ending,everything was perfect! People that hated this are not true fans of the series. Nr 1 in box office around the word. I loved every minute of it.!

title: Still trying to understand
text: Nothing makes sense in this movie. Really bad plot and everything is so fake. People should have died all the time. People are making stupid reasons for money. We miss the old days.

title: Weak in almost every category
text: Special effects were WORSE than the original. I'm not exaggerating at all. The dinosaurs were as unrealistic and forgettable as this entire cash grab. Chris Pratt is a cool guy but he should be more picky and decline movies like this. He literally wrangled green screen fake looking dinosaurs with his bare hands lol. There's so many holes to the plot and the entire movie seemed unrewarding and purposeless. The original Jurassic Park blows this away in every single metric. I really do want to love movies again!

title: Incredible job on this movie
text: Wow what an incredible movie you guys put together so proud of the director for making this movie love to possible cuz we cool to see it on the theater screen him again incredible job on this one's my favorite one ever I've ever seen out of the Jurassic Park Jurassic World Series congrats.

title: Waste of time
text: Im amazed at how we got here, one of the worst movies i ve ever seen, bad acting, too much dinasaurs, unecessary action, pointless story, bad characters.I cant believe they spent a big budget on this trash.

title: A disgrace for the fans of the original series
text: You'll enjoy this movie if you like cringey reunions, kisses, explosions and fire and globe trotting for no reason and of course no plot. For fans of the original: just go watch it to see some Dino's and original cast again just to see how their arcs end. Besides that, this movie is soulless.

title: Not a Jurassic Park movie
text: Seems like what happened here is someone wrote a bad Bond film on the basis of the Taken franchise. And when the script was rejected they replaced a few "bad guys" with dinosaurs and this is what you get. A tedious blockbuster that for some reason has Tim Cook as the bad guy? Art department did a pretty good job but otherwise a disaster.

title: Real fun movie.
text: Don't listen to the weenies here that pick pic pic. This was a fun movie. Better than any superhero movie I've seen in 20 years. It had action, adventure, it made you feel like you were really there. What these little frozen fruits want you to think is that something is wrong with this movie. There's nothing that's wrong with this movie that's not wrong with most all other movies. I was there with five people and everybody had fun and talked about it afterwards. It's as good as anything out there. Go have fun and don't listen to the little children but think they are critics. Because they don't know a thing. Enjoy.

title: Dinosaurs would catch them if they didn't stop and go "ROOAAR!!"
text: Another installment of Transformers with dinosaurs... paper-thin characters imperiled by CGI monsters. The movie merges two disjointed plots, papering over the whole "dominion" footnote, as an excuse for a JP family reunion bottled up in yet another jungly dinosaur sanctuary.In no particular order, I'm supposed to believe:(Spoilers below)Chris Pratt's magic hand inoculates him from all danger.No matter how fast the dinosaur, it never gains when chasing main characters.Malta is apparently like Dagobah; if you just go there, you end up right where you need to be.The evil megacorp Biosyn is run by morons, even by supervillain standards. Prominent bio-engineering critic Ian Malcolm has had a lectureship there for six weeks, and for some reason he has all access to the lab? They store a bunch of mutant bugs just... in the room... so that they can swarm with the slightest provocation? And then there's a button that sets them on fire, but just a plain old glass window they can break through? And again, with practically no clearances, you can SHUT OFF POWER to the complex?? Isn't this a lesson they learned from the first movie?A few burning bugs take five minutes to set a swampy jungle ablaze.I just don't get the laser pointer that sics a dinosaur on somebody. This is a holdover from the last film I know... but you know what else points a laser at people? A rifle.Finally, in one of the laziest sequences of the film, let's just put some dinos down there in the tunnel. No explanation as to how they got in... but we need to off the main villain... so what'll it be....? Oh, how about.... Dilophosaurus. They killed Newman... so that's poetic, right?Is it fun? Eh, maybe. I know nobody expects this movie to be good, in say, a "Mystic River" sense. But I have to wonder, is a movie the like first JP even *possible* today? Can Hollywood still make an engrossing story with believable characters in real peril? I guess they figure it's not worth the effort.

title: Great action, that's it.
text: A lot of random scenes of characters being in peril by dinosaurs, one scene after another, and it got tiring very quickly. Storyline could've been better, it was just a rescue mission, and that's it, no other depths or levels, but the girl has one emotion that got annoying, wide eyed and surprised. The movie went way too long, could've been wrapped up in 90 minutes, I got bored.

title: Forgettable Movie. Wait and see it at home.
text: Is there no such thing as an editing department anymore? This movie was just trying to do way too much. It felt like, to save time, they cut out parts of the story, rather than cutting out some of the big effects scenes that all seem to be competing against themselves for attention. For a theater movie, this is a one star movie. If I would've just watched it at home, it would probably be a 4 star movie. Just not worth the theater price.

title: I wanted the Dinosaurs to win a hour in.
text: There was a action part then a boring part a action part then a zzzzz. You see where I going. Sam Neil and Laura Dern should never play opposite of each other again. And I like them as actors but ugh! Chris Pratt better stop playing the hero type, in this one he played it like a stereotypical hero with no character. . Don't get me started on the villain, he acted like a mumbling fool that wasn't scary. Bad movie!

title: Massacre of a classic
text: WoW what a flop. Could not believe the dinosaurs looked better back in 1994. Such a fan but this is another example of where there is simply no ideal or goal except the money the release of another movie might bring.

title: Jeff and the dinos make it bearable
text: Three of the four stars are for Jeff and the dinos.I only watched this in the cinema because a movie group chose to but after the last two, i was not at all interested in seeing this movie.This movie was so......"White" all the supporting cast actors were BIPOC but the story focuses on some of the whitest white actors out there and while this wouldn't bother me so much, its a 30-year-old franchise and they are still so......WHITE!If anything, it's fun to see Jeff Goldblum be Jeff Goldblum and the dino scenes are a good time. Just download it.

title: Makes no sense
text: Another jurassic franchise rubbish movie. Wanna be good Action scenes. Cuts where there are not supposed to be cuts. Character development is nearly non existent. The story is boring and extremely generic. Boring stunts. Some cgi parts are just plain bad.One has to ask the question: why bother with this franchise?The quick answer is: the hopes of watching a good movie.What this movie has done well or better then the last installments is the accuracy in which dinosaurs are depicted. You now have feathers and hair where previously there was none.This movie is not worth your time and money.

title: One for fans
text: So many horrid reviews. I went in with low expectations but was pleasantly surprised.This was a love letter to true fans. Original cast coming back and heaps of new dinosaurs. Action packed, comedy plus and a lovely storyline.I think fans of the series are torn. Half love this and half hated it.I loved it. Each to their own.It was so much fun to watch. I really enjoyed seeing the "Parkies" meet the "worldies".I loved the little nods to the original like BD Wong and the shaving cream.The dinosaurs were epic. The detail was amazing. I love that the cgi still looked like animatronic. Beautiful.

title: Stupid, just stupid
text: I could write a long review... but seriously, the movie does not deserve it. It is a ABSOLUTE NONSENSE story. Barely an excuse to put dinosaurs on the screen and take the money.Just an insult to anyone with a 3% of intelligence.

title: A Real Letdown
text: Jurassic Park is one of my favorite movies of all time. It was one of the first movies I ever got on DVD, and I've seen it over 100 times. The rest of the franchise has been enjoyable for the most part. I loved Jurassic Park 2 & 3 as a child, but looking back, they are a bit silly. I also enjoyed Jurassic World; it was fun and new. As a 10-year-old, I thought it was one of the best movies I had ever seen. I was disappointed but non the less entertained by Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom. The most excited I had ever been for this franchise was when they announced the original cast would return to supporting roles. I thought there was no possible way to screw this up. I have to say there's no level to measure my disappointment.You have three award-winning Hollywood legends, and they feel so poorly written. We watched these same characters struggle through and grow during Jurassic Park. Speaking of poorly written, Owen and Claire have fallen off so hard as the films have gone on. They went from fun, intriguing characters to just meh. The uninteresting characters aren't even the worst part of the film. The worst part of the film has to be the locust plot. What's better than a Jurassic World film? A film that goes less on the Dinos and more on the Bugs said nobody ever. It was fun to see Doctor Wu featured in another role in this franchise, but why does it have to be bugs. I love the scenes with the Dinosaurs; there are a couple new ones, and I wish they spent more time on Dinos and less on the damn bugs. I almost included this on my list of worst films of the year. What kept me from that, you might ask, is Nostalgia. As much as I disliked it, I'll admit seeing the original cast back together for one last ride is what I always wished for. I just wished they had done it in a better way.5/10 A great franchise that has finally run its course.

title: This movie is an insult to the intelligence and time of the audience.
text: A very silly and pointless movie with a predictable and disgusting story.This movie is suitable for minors and has no attraction at all.Repetitive scenes and as usual nothing bad happens to the movie hero! Not even blood comes from his nose.As usual, dinosaurs only roar and don't attack when dealing with the masked heroes of the movie.Chris Pratt has played very repetitively.In general, this movie is an insult to the intelligence and time of the audience.

title: Its time for another Ice age
text: I really like the Jurassic Park/World films( Yes even the bad ones) I find them endlessly entertaining.This was the first time in one of these films that left me feeling overall disappointed on the same level thet Rise Of Skywalker left ( But not nearly as bad as said film).The film does have its own entertainment value the effects are really good and I like some of the new characters introduced, I just wish the old characters had more time to shine( Epsecallly Doctor Grant Played by Sam Neil)If you like the series like me you may also leave feeling a bit disappointed but still entertained non the less.

title: I feel cheated
text: I watched this for free on my IPTV so I didn't even go to the pictures and I still feel cheated.I thought it was just me being grumpy but my views were reinforced by reading many other reviews..It's basically just not very good..

title: Boring, not jurassic park worthy
text: It happens to too many movies, squeezing the series too much. The entire feeling of the jurassic park movies is gone, if you would name this movie fast and the furious 10 it would fit that series more. Terrible.

title: Worse jurassic movie ever
text: I have seldom seen such bad acting and filming. I do not like the work of this director. A movie not worthwhile watching. You can spend your time better. It does not have any suspense. In comparison to the other jurassic movies this is total crap! Sorry to say that.

title: Heartbroken Fan!
text: Been a big fan of this Franchise but this movie was so terrible that it made me cry as a fan. Had high hopes as it was supposed to be a comeback for the OG Jurrasic park cast but omg what a mess have they created in this movie. They have tried to do way too much and because of that the movie is all over the place. Legends like Laura Dern and Sam Neill are completely wasted. You never empathize with the characters in this movie. It feels more like a montage of multiple Dinosaur encounter videos trying to include every dinosaur ever lived. The previous few installments did have flaws but u could still empathize with the characters but this one is a miss.

title: meh
text: The plot was weak, the storyline seemed silly, the young girl is just off-putting.I felt they could have done so much more. The characters seemed quite flat, the originals were a nice addition, but when they all met up for the first time it just felt empty.The dinosaurs should be the focus.

title: Sorry it was bad.
text: I thought I would never write this review about such movie with good reputation, They need to stop making more Jurassic park movies. They go bad bad and baddest. This movie had a very bad script. Good actors, it was smart and great to have the old ones back from the first movie. That could have saves and made this movie great! The script was the problem and story. Sorry but this one was boring and bad.

title: not nostalgic nursing homes
text: Watching this movie is like returning to the nursing home where you worked after a long time. You can see many, many familiar old people, but there are also very few that can't be seen. However, the staff (dinosaurs) have changed several batches and only a handful of old staff are still around. The dean (the film director) has also changed a few times... Speaking of which, it's a little nostalgic to the point of warmth, right? Sadly, people want to see novelty movies, not nostalgic nursing homes.

title: I gave it three stars only because of the actors...
text:
The movie score was perhaps worse than the movie itself.I enjoyed the first 2 movies - the second not as much as the first, but I was excited when this one came out...
It was short lived.The story was total trash and they should have called it 'Jurassic Locusts'
The movie wasn't even really about dinosaurs...Acting was trash, because there wasn't really a script to get behind.There was a bunch of chase scenes - they made up most of the "action" sequences.They were dull and uninteresting.All in all it was a woke movie without any real tangible storyline.I hated it.My advice, don't waste your time.

title: GIG-a-NOT-a-SAUR-us
text:
(Movie Trailer Voice)
In a World where one man's reckless ambition to build a supersized petting zoo has spawned countless hours of Animatronic and CGI snacking on human victims, mankind is forced to live side by side with deadly monsters...and I don't just mean drunk rednecks with guns (but there are those, too).So it's the 6th and (supposedly) final installment of the Jurassic Park feature film series. Probably the biggest challenge was finding new and interesting ways for these beasts to tear up unfortunate humans. Maybe that's why they didn't do that. Instead, we're treated to what amounts to a "greatest hits" recap of the previous 5 movies' wide selection of painful ways to become dino dental floss.The plot is completely implausible, totally predictable, and yet still manages to at least mildly entertain, largely because of some great performances by some new supporting characters. It's also helped along by a nice reunion of the original protagonists. There is one dud, though. Jeff Goldblum is back as the twitchy Dr. Malcolm, but his role has been relegated to spouting philosophical cliches, and he's been turned from the thoughtful conscience of the saga into the annoying kid in the back of the car who tells you you're speeding every 5 minutes.Once we spend the first hour of the film just getting the band back together, we briefly tour a planet where somehow dinosaurs have crossed oceans, taken over the skies, and multiplied to the point of being as common as cattle in the span of a single generation. That's a reproductive pace that would make even the US Supreme Court jealous.Every JP movie needs a villain, of course, and post-Spielberg's masterful first film we're not content anymore with it just being the biggest meat-eater. So the plot provides the obligatory mad-genius billionaire bent on using cataclysm to his own benefit, complete with a remote compound filled with other mad-genius cronies and the worst security since John Candy at Wally World."Sorry, folks, evil hideout's closed. T-Rex out front should have told you."
The mix of superfluous bad-guy tech, random Dino insertions and convenient push-button solutions makes the last half hour of the film feel like it was done completely on the fly.When even Starlord and the Grand Master can't save your movie, you know you've laid an egg.No doubt die-hard Jurassic fans will thoroughly enjoy it. It definitely delivers on the big scary lizard front, but anyone looking for more than just close-ups of gnashing teeth and probing reptilian eyes will likely feel a lot like Dr. Malcolm: "Ooh, ahh, yeah, that's how it always starts; Then later there's the running and the screaming...but you stopped caring after the 1st act."
Final thought: Yeah, we get it. Every actor in the film clearly spent hours learning how to pronounce Giganotosaurus. Well, congratulations.

title: Dismally boring
text: Why was this even made...pathetic excuse for entertainment . I can't imagine anyone finding this even enjoyable or entertaining for 10 minutes. Bland, boring storyline with lame acting and no direction. Just horrible.

title: They should've stopped after the last movie.
text: I had very little hope of this movie being remotely good but man it was bad.I think its time they should realise that its time to stop making another sequel. There is no point continuing the story- if there is any story.

title: The Jurassic Era is over & I'm saddened...
