text: The final Jurassic Park movie series & I enjoyed it!! Now it does not stray from the storyline so so expect to see the same dino & human interactions, but it also cleans up and corrals! While many will disagree my rating is only one point seven stars higher than the average rating. Cheers to those who green-lighted this project as it deserved an honorable conclusion. As I'm a JP SUPER-FANATIC I won't say anything negative-I've seen the Live "Walking with the Dinosaurs" and was amazed more than my 9 year old godson-so it goes to say for me there is no such thing as a bad dinosaur movie. The actors played their parts well, were very diverse and the new or younger ones will make new movies-they are that good! JP:Dominion completes a story which took almost 30 years to tell! Thank you for doing just that - allowing the Jurassic Park movies to line up and gracefully bow as the curtain closes.

title: A failed third part of the trilogy.
text: The third installment of the trilogy offers nothing new to the fans except some nice animatronics and CGI created dinosaurs. The story is completely out of point, predictable and uninteresting. Even Chris Pratt seems not enjoying his character anymore. The whole concept of the new Jurassic world shema is already been told in the first two parts and repeats itself in this one, but focusing on things that we all have been already seen.As soon as the movie starts you will know that this is going to be a 3 hour long clich ride of boringness.

title: Dino movie for dumb people
text: I couldn't imagine why people were complaining about this movie. Trailer and graphics looked amazing. Well it turns out it's a dinosaur movie for dumb people. Really. Dumb. People.

title: Worst part of JP franchise of all time.
text: Very disappointing. 2 star 1 for showing some new dinosaurs and other for showing Hyper loop. Worst acting, pointless direction... ..........................................................................just bad!! VERY VERY BAD!!!

title: Disappointment
text:
Dinosaur should eat anyone,
not like the "Pokmon",
They are dinosaur !We don't fear anymore. It's become boring and boring.The screenwriter is forget why are those dinosaur become our classic.

title: I really enjoyed the movie.
text: Makes me sad that so many people are not into it. I absolutely love the cinematographer, the chase scenes, new dinos, the introduction between old school and new, and all the wonderful easter eggs.

title: Predictable, and feels so disconnected from the previous movies
text: The franchise was going downhill, but this is a massive let down and was a terrible movie.There are no character arcs or development, and the movie feels like nothing but a cash grab buy exploiting what you loved with the old characters and themes, but with a very poor script, performance, and cinematography.

title: Boring plot, Amazing dinosaurs
text: Worst movie of franchise. Boring, stupid and predictable plot. Corny and cringe moments. Stupid acts. Well that sums up the movie.Don't waste your money on this. Wait and watch it on some streaming platform.

title: Perfect ending for Jurassc Series
text: I dont understand bad reviews. For me this was perfect ending for Jurassic Park/ World series...All actors together. Love the ending. Its like I hoped too be. Very entertaining movie like others was....

title: Almost walked out
text:
Long tedious rambling between cute dinosaurs and terrifying monsters
No story line just noisy special effects falling under more is always better
I can't believe Steven Spielberg and the original crew agreed to this remake ruining the beautiful original story in the process
Maybe the money temptation was just too great to refuse this awful sequel to a great movie.

title: Disappointing
text: I've enjoyed all the Jurassic movies, but this one by far the least. Though it was fun to see the classic characters and a couple good new ones, it was just strange storytelling that didn't work at all. I was bored even when the intense action scenes came along, partly because of the bad storytelling, but also because the action scenes themselves had a strange removed quality to them with endless ridiculous and extreme occurrences with no stakes or sense of peril to the main characters. The whole movie felt like a big mess. Reminded me of the feelings I had watching Rise of Skywalker as far as weird, lifeless storytelling trying to close out an epic blockbuster franchise.

title: Amazing conclusion
text:
I'd give it an 8.5
Its got flaws of course, but the film is amazing. Beautiful landscapes and sceneries, very good use of CGI and animatronics.Original even, even if many didn't appreciate the new plot and ideas, I did very much. It's more in line with what Michael Crichton wrote in the first few pages of his novel, Jurassic Park.

title: It's monumentally silly, but it's still entertaining (if you turn your brain off)
text: I was initially going to give it a higher review, but as I sat down to write this, I thought how utterly stupid this film is, so I went down a few notches. Really, it's just an excuse for some very excellent special effects all tied together with a story line so flimsy that it barely deserves to be called a plot. In fact, there doesn't seem to be one story line but about five different strands, none of which is satisfactorily explained, and which all together make for a confusing mess. As far as I could tell, it was something like: genetic modification, dinosaurs, evil company aiming for world domination, dinosaurs, some old characters from previous movies, dinosaurs, people running and being chased through forests, buildings, everywhere really, by dinosaurs, lucky escape at the end because two dinosaurs get distracted and fight each other. Did I mention dinosaurs? Them too!It's very lazy film-making. You'd have thought that by now film-makers would realize that special effects, no matter how good, aren't enough to carry a film. You need a good strong plot to hang the effects on. However, this lesson appears not to have been learned.However, I am happy to watch a film with my brain comfortably in neutral, and I did enjoy it for the silliness of it. But fans of the series (of which I used to be one) deserve better than this. My film-going companion fell asleep during the film, and decided firmly that it should be worth zero stars.The feel-good Disney-ish ending, which seemed to be lifted in spirit and style from the beginning of The Lion King, was so saccharine as to be almost nauseous.Basically, if you have a choice between this film and any other, choose the other.

title: Sad to close such a potent franchise with such a poorly original movie
text: I had to go to see this movie, there was not a chance to don't wacht the end of a franchise that started when I was 13. I new that the movie wouldn't be great, but I also expected a good story.The plot is like a bad joke, to literaly connected to what is going on nowdays with the food supply chain and big corporations.The characters are really silly sometimes, even the main antagonist seem like a bad copy of Dr. No mixed with Steve Jobs. The tokens of the movie are answering too an obvious check list to fulfull politically correct regulations.It's such a pity that Speilberg legacy go down the toilet so easily...

title: Jurassic World: Dominion
text: Apparently bringing the 'World' trilogy to an end there are 2 main interweaving stories here. Firstly, Laura Dern and Sam Neill are looking to expose the Biosyn Corporation who are trying to take over world food production and secondly a part of this evil goal is the kidnap by Biosyn of young Maisie Lockwood, who has a unique genetic makeup needed by the bad guys She is being cared for by Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard who go in pursuit.A rather strange and to a large degree unsatisfying conclusion to the trilogy. It comes across for the most part as a sub standard James Bond type plot ie there's a Bond baddie with henchman and a plot for world control, a car chase, a plane crash and, albeit very professionally carried out, action sequences that just don't stop coming - ever. The only difference is, every scene features scary dinosaurs. The story is rather leaden with a ghastly script laying on the eco message with a trowel.On the plus side it's nice to see the original Jurassic Park cast, the action is well done as are the beasties, there are nods to Jurassic Park and the last 35 minutes are actually pretty exciting. Disappointing then but anyone whose seen the others will not want to miss this and will still probably enjoy most of it.

title: Disney or Universal promo
text: It's stupid. One chase after another. Each scene seems to be constructed as if it were a theme-park ride.A new monster at every turn.None of the freshness or charm of the original. Don't bother, next stop Orlando!

title: Second best Jurassic film in the franchise
text: Why all the hate? I kept waiting for it to suck based on previous reviews. It didn't.There was plenty of action, intensity and OG Dinos and cast.I liked it second only to the first film. Definitely entertaining and I jumped as much as 13 year-old me in the original.

title: What a waste
text:
Was waiting for something similar to the movies we know
But this was so disappointing
The story was bad
And specially the main thing ( dinosaurs) was just something on the side not that important in the movie , which is the biggest mistake.

title: Overlong and gets boring ...
text: Despite the studios bringing together all the cast from both the Jurassic Park and the most recent Jurassic World movies, nothing could save this dire third, or sixth if you include the Park, movie.Complicated story, overlong, unbelievable in parts (I know you can't believe in dinosaurs coming back to life ) but the vision of the first film where they altered DNA of a dinosaur found in amber just seem to have been lost.The actors do so as though they are looking at a green screen and their age shows when it comes to the simplest of stunts that they shouldn't be expected to do in the first place.The kids will love it, but again, will their attention span last as long as this dull attempt? I doubt it.

title: We just want to make money
text: I'm not going to spoil a bunch of things for you. The movie will do that all by itself, it's spoiled. What a waste of time, film, money, and talent. There's no doubt there's very talented actors in this movie. Unfortunately this movie is not a vehicle for any of them. It's Just a way for the accountants to take advantage of everybody that loves this franchise. Doesn't mean the actors didn't work hard, but the film just don't do the job. What should be asked, is why? Why all the hard work? They've created one disaster of a movie that meanders, and meanders. Kind of like I'm doing right now. You'll probably watch this movie if you're a fan of the series no matter how bad it is. It's just highly unfortunate that for the last movie in the series they couldn't have spent all this money to do something spectacular, something new. Creativity is having a hard way finding life.

title: Too much of everything
text: What do you get when you combine Indy and all the previous juriasics with a bit of bond, with a small piece of very wrong adventure movies..And oh yeah, the music is also over the top...

title: People are being too harsh for no reason
text: I liked it, wasn't the best movie ever but it was exciting to watch and I loved the variety of scenes with the dinosaurs in.I've put 10/10 instead of 7/10 because people are rating far too lowSome scenes felt a bit forced but overall worth watching once.

title: Repetitive and highly predictable
text: They're basically telling the same story in a different setting over and over again. There's nothing surprising in this movie, even the action sequences are pretty much the same...

title: Absolutely Awful
text: This franchise has forgotten why Jurassic Park was so loved, this film was just rehashed, done before action, with scenes that seemed to be stolen straight from Jason Bourne & Mission Impossible.

title: Omg so awful!!
text: I'm not going to praise the good parts of this movie because there isn't any. The dinosaurs are fake looking and every scene seems like the director wanted to get all of the cast into every scene for promotional sake. Where did they go wrong with this after enjoying the first 2 Jurassic world movies so much I just hated this?! Now I do believe that the Jurassic world dinosaurs are extinct. Such a shame as I am the biggest fan of these movies. This just killed it for me. Sad!!

title: Don't believe the negative reviews
text: This was a lot of fun to watch. It is a thrilling adventure from start to finish. It was great to see both casts from Jurassic World and Jurassic Park together. The acting was a amazing.

title: OMG, this is the end of Jurassic all over again
text: Even my 5 yo son that I never had would write a better and credible story than this.Please skip this one. Save a few bucks, some time or some internet band.

title: Just in case all the other comments haven't scared you away... it was bad
text: Waste of money, waste of talent. Should just hire the writers for guardians of galaxy or Thor. If you're going to have pointless action scenes constantly you better at least have one laugh, or cry, or something.

title: A bridge to far....
text:
Long... To long..
They should have stopped after the fourth movie....
Some things are to far fetched..
The reunion of the old cast seemed to work in the beginning.... But they could not pull it trough until the end of the movie.

title: A lot of action going no where, slowly.
text: Disappointing, just dragged on and on without much plot. Lots of chase scenes, but no one ever got tired or hurt. No suspense. Cheesy relationships. The dinosaurs could have been replaced with monster trucks and no one would have noticed.

title: Best of the World Trilogy! Not a match for JP!
text: I have watched all the movies of the World trilogy and have watched camp Cretaceous Netflix series. But this movie ( except it's ending) is easily the best content we ever got from Jurassic world! I am not saying it's even worth a toenail in front of Jurassic park but it's a good movie if you are a dinosaur fan! Just don't look at the inaccuracies and stuff. They handled the original cast very respectfully! The plot is silly but enjoyable unlike fallen kingdom! The characters have an actual sense! Except Crisp Rat and blue ... Ending fight is mid. The mid part of the movie is breathtaking! Vfx is easily better than fallen kingdom! I enjoyed this movie as a fun summer blockbuster dino movie haha. Don't think too deep and you will have a good time!

title: Storyline?
text: I love the Jurassic park / World Series. I did not have high expectations coming into this movie having read reviews but didn't realise how bad it actually was going to be . Children will love this movie because there are scenes where dinosaurs are fighting each other and well being dinosaurs which kids love but unfortunately the storyline simply just sucks. It feels like a fast and furious movie where they have strayed away from what people love . The main storyline is not even about dinosaurs no more .

title: Did not think it was going to be that bad!
text: Fan of this franchise since the first and its sad to say it but this movie was horrible. Dumb plot for some reason good actors seemed like they weren't even trying or it was just shot and directed so badly that it seemed like the actors were doing a bad job. Disappointed.

title: Bad storyline and very corny
text: The only reason it got 5 stars was the CGI was incredible as always and that it was the first of the 6 films to include a LGBT character. Acting was very average and comedy was extremely dry.

title: Kids loved it!! I loved it!
text: This was a great movie! Great job meshing all the characters story lines from originals with new. It makes sense. Great action. Some jump scares. Romance. Comedy. Surprises with new and old characters. Twists in storyline from previous movie storylines. Revealing back info. Plot was interesting and evolved from the originals. New and old dinosaurs! The dinosaurs are in, what could be considered, real current world controversial animal scenarios. Great ending. Felt like winning! Hoping for another movie! The kids absolutely loved it! I loved it.

title: I Thought it was Impossible to be worse than Fallen Kingdom But...
text: Jurassic Park is my favourite and Jurassic world is my 2nd, Fallen Kingdom was the worst for me, absolute Dissapointment. Dominion is more character focused & delivers nostalgia. Compared to the other movies it has very less action. 1 good action sequence pre interval thats it, The climax Dino fight is very Disappointing, The CGI is a major Plus point for the movie, other than that good characters & Dialogues, Barely any jokes, But it had Many homage/tribute/reference whatever, to Jurassic Park. But Mediocre story and poor action sequences. Defintely not an epic conclusion to the Jurassic Saga.Tyrannosaurus Rex > Spinosaurus > Indominous Rex > Indoraptor > Giganotosaurus.

title: Essentially a worse No Way Home
text: Jurassic World Dominion is certainly a movie that exists. It was by far the worst of the series, and I stand by my opinion that the series is fine if you end it at Jurassic World. This movie was fan service at its worst. It had virtually no story, and there was no vision; it only existed to get butts in seats, and movies like that are always awful. Save yourself the time, and watch No Way Home if you want fan service. At least that was enjoyable.

title: Boring and forgettable
text:
This movie lacks any kind of coherent story and completely misunderstood why we liked the original movie. All of the action scenes are forgettable and one of the climax action sequences is straight-up copied from one of the previous movies.Somehow the CGI took a severe hit from the previous one and now every dinosaur just looks like cheap animatronics, almost like they spent all of the budget on Pratt and the actors from the original trilogy, who are only there for nostalgia bait and fan service.This movie is all over the place, and somehow completely generic
The story is dumb and their evil plan is so thoroughly "Hollywood" it's laughable, zero imagination when writing the script.

title: Dull, long and not engaging
text: You can tell following the modern Hollywood social rule book was the primary focus in this film. Writing an interesting, cohesive story was second. A total waste of resources. I felt obligated to see the conclusion of this trilogy but since my expectations were already low, I left feeling I had finished a job more than finished a movie.

title: One Jurassic too far
text: As a massive fan of the Jurassic films I'm disappointed to say this was one film too far.I've given it 5 stars for the cast, the nods to the classics and the special effects.The plot however was underdeveloped, not enough action and too much dialogue. I was a bit bored to be honest. No heart stopping, edge of your seat moments like in all of the other films.Could almost forget what film I was watching in parts, I got X files movie (1998) vibes at points!Although the cast are all fantastic, there are too many main characters that it dissolves all their storylines and character development.

title: Lovely and very steadily paced
text: This movie had a very steady pace overall from scene to scene. CGI was better than expected, and overall the characters had very good acting and fit in with the plot perfectly! Some scenes were very emotional and heartwarming for me and the rest of the audience in the theater.

title: Don't waste your money!
text: Many other reviews have listed what is wrong with this movie. I will just add that I ended up giving it 3 stars because of the dinosaurs. CGI was often crappy but the dinosaurs were still the best actors.

title: A Waste
text: I've enjoyed all of the Jurassic Park and Jurassic World movies to date for various reasons. For sure some are better than others but they all provide suspense, creativity and a storyline.Jurassic World Dominion however is not just a poor cousin to the above but one of the worst films I've ever seen.There's no real story line or development of characters, just a meaningless timeline of action moments, poor dialogue and increasingly bad effects. It's not suspenseful, interesting or even bearable at times.With the budget and cast this could have been an incredible movie. It would have taken someone to take responsibility and say "THIS IS A BAD FILM" to the executives and re write or amend the production. That's what fans, investors and everyone who put their time and effort into making the franchise a success over the years deserved.

title: Children movie.
text: Written by a child. Absolutely boring and generic movie. Two and a half hours and I couldn't wait till it ends. Some movie scenes look pretty. Super unrealistic, couldn't take it seriously. Full of fake drama. It's a chick flick if you're a child that likes dinosaurs.

title: It is over.
text: The story and shock moments are on very poor state in this sequel. If you want some fresh then u are here wrong, for a movie night with handy out is this film okay. You can easily skip through parts without missing something.The old cast with the new combination is not working well out.I would like a new jurrasic park that is more like the new batman darker and no so soft.

title: Love love love
text: I loved this film as I loved all of the other ones. Is the end of an era and it ended well in my opinion. Can't wait to watch it again and again. The reunin of the old characters made it even better and not extremely cheesy film.

title: Is this a joke?
text: This movie is prime example that just because we're bringing back old characters for the sake of nostalgia and casting popular actors, doesn't mean that it will automatically be a great movie. In some parts, the acting even felt so terrible that it just felt like a gag. The dialogue was awful, the interaction between characters were worse, and it just felt like every other cliche script. Speaking of characters, we have our generic heroes, an awkward antagonist, a pointless middleman and a chracter who, for some reason, just walks around like she's a badass (who's incredibly strong by the way as you'll see in one scene) and acting cool as everything burns around her. Where is your sense of panic? But I don't blame her. There is no sense of danger in the entire movie. Remember that scene in Jurassic Park where the T. Rex first escapes the fence? That was 10 minutes of pure tension as we watched our vunerable characters struggle to find a way to hide from the beast. In this movie? There's a different type of dinosaur introduced every 5 minutes but the characters "narrowly" escape just as quickly. Its as if they wanted to fit as many dinosaurs as they can in the space of 2 hours. The writing was so abysmal it just felt like we were just following old characters doing one task to another without any great risks and Chris Pratt doing the hand thing. Also, spoiler alert, it obviously ends with a showdown with the poster boy and the apex predator, because it wouldn't be a Jurassic film without our main guy, T. Rex.

title: Practically clickbait
text: Poor scripting, poor acting, poor logic, poor CGI, poor originality. What's left to comment about in a dinosaur action film? Nothing I guess. The film is basically a medley of older Jurassic Park franchise scenes and lines, relying only on the franchise name and the actors (badly) reprising their roles, as a "clickbait". It is really sad and disappointing the way film studios treat films just as a means of income and completely don't care about quality.

title: Reveal/chomp/run/repeat.
text: How can they keep getting the balance so wrong? I had to watch the final instalment, despite the ongoing 'World' disappointments. I hoped Trevorrow would finally watch the original JP and pick apart what made it so thrilling and emotionally engaging. But, nope. It just gets worse.Having sat through Dominion, it is clear that Trevorrow's only take on a Jurassic Park movie is to throw as many dino scenes at the screen as possible with barely room to breathel. Narrative, dialogue, character development, sense and subtlety an afterthought. Like a 5 year old tipping a bucket of plastic dinosaurs on the floor and randomly, repeatedly smashing each one in your face while making up some loose story as to why it's happening. It's fun and interesting to start with, but all too quickly you could not be more sick of the seemingly endless whateversaurus reveal/chomp-chomp/runaway. 2 hours of the same scene / different dino repeated over and over and over with barely a sliver of story building.I find it incredulous to think how a big summer, big budget blockbuster about rampaging dinosaurs could be this long and boring. The last hour was painful and my brain was fully tuned out long before the finale, let alone all that extra padding stuffed on the end. Long after they'd pummelled our over-stuffed faces with endless servings of dinosaur, they served up a dessert of... dinosaur. Just one more spoonful. And another. And another. And another. Even when the awfully desperate dual storylines wrapped, the credits just wouldn't roll. "We have MORE DINOSAURS!!". The film wasn't even about dinosaurs in the first place! Not that there was even much of a story, but not one single dinosaur had any connection to the main narrative. Just a tissue paper thin story off the back of a director's need to rinse and repeat the same 'thrilling' scene over and over, and believe me this guy doesn't know how to craft a thrilling scene either. You see everything coming. Loud and noisy. Colin Trevorrow jumping on a couch shouting "And you get a dinosaur, and you get a dinosaur, and you get a dinosaur".I've not even mentioned the stupid caricatured baddies striding away from danger in dark glasses, or the way main characters repeatedly find or bump into each other over a 100 mile radius. And that painfully stupid velociraptor vs hand thing again and again. "Hey... here's that stupid hand thing again". How we all long for Blue to finally rip Chris Pratt's face off.I think after this rant, my phone is going to autocorrect every word to 'dinosaur' for a few weeks. I'm truly glad to think this is a last in the series, yet utterly disappointed that this is where we ended up.

title: IGNORE THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS
text: I've scrolled through so many negative reviews, and they are such BS. People are complaining about things that don't even make sense. Things that every Jurrassic Park movie has always done.Like having coincidences like the characters being in the right place at the right time. I remember being in the theater for Jurrassic park 2 with someone who laughed about that happening.Or one person complained about there being too many new dinosaurs and dinosaur attacks....well if you don't want to see new dinosaurs and more dinosaur attacks, why are you watching another Jurrassic park movie?Then there's the complaint that certain little details aren't realistic. Are you freaking kidding me...it's a sci fi/fantasy film about dinosaurs existing alongside humans....including one GMO dinosaur....and you are going to focus in on little details that aren't realistic? If you want to watch a realistic movie, you have chosen the wrong genre entirely.And then there's the complaint that the story isn't good. Um, what movie were you watching? Because there's very little wrong with the story. It builds upon all of the previous movies just like a good story should. It deals with modern issues and is more relevant to our real world than any of the others have been. It has so many good plot points and story elements. It has a lot of throwbacks to the first one, as well as some very new additions. And it is obvious to me that the people complaining about this story don't know anything about writing and story telling. And it's really just that they don't like the movie.But there's really little wrong with the film making either. Again, nothing that hasn't been wrong with some of the other films. They put a lot of work into making this movie. It looks fantastic. And I think the main reason people are complaining so much is not because of things that are wrong with the film. But because they already stopped being fans of the franchise and at this point it can't do anything right.Because there have been Jurrassic Park films before this that were not very good. And it has been a long time, and it does seem that these people leaving negative reviews are just disgrunted ex fans who are sick of it. And so if you are watching a movie that is over 2 hours long and you are really just sick of the franchise and watching it because you are bored and have nothing else to do (and probably have a bad attitude because of that), that would explain the negative reviews.But it also seems to me that with all the throwbacks to the first film, that anyone who loved the first one should also love this one. So maybe a lot of these people just don't like the genre or this type of movie.However if you are looking for a movie about dinosaurs living alongside humans, and are looking to have fun and don't want something that is serious and based in reality, but is just good cinematic entertainment, and you enjoyed the first film, there's a good chance you will like this one. Don't expect it to fix a bad attitude or anything. If you are the type of person who needs to complain about every little thing, well maybe instead of sitting around judging other peoples work you should get off your ass and try making a movie yourself so you can see how much work it actually is and gain a better appreciation of the art of film and how much actually goes into them. Because as a videographer myself, I tend to appreciate film a lot more because I have an understanding of these things that most people don't. And I find it ridiculous when I hear people complaining like this, in ways that make no sense and show that they don't know jack about film and are probably just a negative and pathetic excuse for a human being who entertains themselves by watching movies they aren't really into and then complaining about them.In my honest opinion, this film is the second best in the series next to the first one. There was so much about it that I loved. So much that they did right that I thought was absolute pure gold. So many amazing movie moments that made me want to just applaud them. It's a travesty that all of these internet trolls who probably couldn't even properly frame a shot aren't being fair to it. But I guess thats just how people are these days.

title: Jurassic Porn
text:
Once again, the owners of the Jurassic Park property have returned to the trough to feed off of the public's undying love of dinosaurs. Unfortunately, all that they have for us is a reheated stew of everything from the previous films, minus any kind of intelligent or interesting plot.I used "porn" very deliberately in the title of this review, as the film reminds me of the days when x-rated movies thought that they needed to have some kind of "plot" as connective tissue between the action scenes that people were coming (err, sorry) for, but only put the minimum of thought and effort into them.The structure of this movie is much the same, stretches of boring "plot" with awkward coincidences and improbable events driving the action forward when the writers are too lazy to come up with something plausible, followed by the same old obligatory "action"... main characters gazing in wonder at dinosaurs. Dinosaurs causing havoc. Main characters stalked and threatened by dinosaurs, but always managing to escape, however improbably. Main characters in vehicles dangling on the edge of a deadly plunge, being threatened by dinosaurs. Bad guys and random extras getting eaten by dinosaurs. Jeff Goldblum there to cynically comment on it all and say "I told you so". Yawn.(OK, I still enjoyed the Jeff Goldblum stuff, we all have our kinks...). And really, you're going to (repeatedly?!?) bring back Chris Pratt controlling dinosaurs with only an upraised palm? (facepalm)
I guess they thought that by making it bigger, longer, and louder, they were making it better, but all they did was give us more time to contemplate how pointless the whole exercise was.

title: not worth watching at all
text: Boring, corny, predictable movie that offers absolutely nothing. Boring, corny, predictable movie that offers absolutely nothing. Boring, corny, predictable movie that offers absolutely nothing. Boring, corny, predictable movie that offers absolutely nothing.

title: Formulaic
text: The Jurassic Park franchise has become heavily ruined by production companies looking to make a quick buck. This film does not build anything unique beyond its predecessors. The "villain" isn't at all compelling. It's the same wash and rinse cycle of using dinosaurs for our own gains and then deciding "maybe we shouldn't do that".It's nice to see the old crowd of characters back together but a bit of a travesty they had to come together in this film. It's incredibly derivative and lacking any originality. Never the less, if you're new to the franchise and want a bit of CGI and action, the visuals are impressive enough to keep watching.

title: Escapism, Dinosaurs, Heroes, Chases......whats not to like
text: We loved it. We were so looking forward to its cinema release and we were not disappointed. Next day on our wild walk, it was interesting to discuss the film & amazing how a group of people can all watch the same film and see and understand scenes differently. The cast were brilliant, nail biting bits brilliant, Dinosaurs put on a good show. We can't wait to see it again (this time on a normal cinema screen) & then to watch it in a marathon with the other 5 films. I recommend it, escapism with bite!

title: Week story
text: There is no relation betwein this part and the old ones Just they tried to make more no related seans to the story. Like the fight of the to denos in the end of the movie.

title: It is fine
text: I went in to this movie not expecting it to be groundbreaking or even really good. I had fun watching it but obviously there are issues. At one point in the movie the audience is meant to be tracking four different subplots. It's very messy and overall is kind of a rehash on previous entries to the franchise. It's full of over the top action, strange convinces, and some sketchy acting.However, I got exactly what I paid for. A silly action movie with dinosaurs in it. It was fine.

title: Another Franchise Finale Overflowing With Callbacks
text: There seems to be a resurgence in recent years of bringing back old characters from previous films in order to draw more interest into their current projects. It's proved extremely difficult for the filmmakers to replicate the magic of those original characters, as seen with Ghostbusters: Afterlife, Scream, etc. Jurassic World Dominion is no different as it clearly had its hands full trying to tie in the original trilogy characters with the storyline of Owen and Claire. The computer generated dinosaurs were nonetheless pretty incredibly animated, and the constant action kept the movie moving at a decent pace. But the acting was bland from both the legacy characters as well as the newcomers, and the constant callbacks grew tedious. Maybe instead of constructing one overlong, convoluted final chapter in the Jurassic Park franchise, it would've functioned better as a two part conclusion.

title: Syfy movie
text: Wow. Shocked at how bad this was. Surprised it's not a Syfy channel movie. On a par with a Sharknado movie. The actors studio be embarrassed to cash their cheques. To his must be the last of the Jurassic Park franchise.

title: Jurassic world dominion
text: About the movie: Jurassic world dominionIn short: 'Don't bother to watch it'.Really bad acting from the known and unknown actors. As well the story overall: To predictable.

title: Very disappointing
text: Not enough of the original dinosaurs. There is one big difference between the first two originals and that is Steven Spielberg that is why they were rated the highest. Good old Spielberg.

title: More like fast and furious
text: The film is rushed from start to finish, the overhaul of actors seriously out weight a poor storyline.The velocity also effected the feeling you get when something is about to happen - the tension was too quickly answered and the effect lost.Disappointing.

title: Absolutely Soulless
text: You will not care if any of the characters live or die, so there can be no suspense. There is no "wonder". The movie has no soul and tries to regurgitate the "best bits" of all of the previous movies. It fails miserably because they don't get what made the first film great. Guess what - it wasn't massive Dino-fights. Honestly don't bother - it's an absolute bore-fest.

title: Maybe not the best but definitely worth more than 5.9 attributed at this moment
text: This is an 8 movie for me even though not he best Jurassic World movie but it succeed in giving me nostalgic feelings and amazed by some good moments. It's definitely not more than 8 because of the seen chasing a dinosaur on a horse and catching it and attaching him to the tree.Ah by the way people talking about dinosaurs in different climates while warm blooded it's because they're not the dinosaurs of before, not intact DNA.Also people disliking dinosaur fights, this is not a documentary, it's fiction. It's supposed to show other stuff than real-life state of things.You know what, I'm giving it 10.

title: Goes out with a whimper
text: Very disappointing final Jurassic film of the series goes out with a whimper with a nonsensical plot that does not keep the promise made by the ending of the last film (Falling Kingdom) and just spins its wheels with two separate storylines that has nothing to do with dinosaurs. Of the two storylines, only the one with the legacy characters has any momentum to it and that's because the legacy characters are ten times more interesting than the "Jurassic World" characters. Jeff Goldblum, Sam Neill and Laura Dern bring their A game to a barely B movie subplot that did not deserve their efforts. While Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard look bored with the sad James Bond rip off storyline they had to work with. Only DeWanda Wise manages to bring her A game to this silly espionage storyline and she does more with her small role than ether Pratt or Howard. The special effects are a bit too CGI for its own good and the climax manages to rip off the climax of the first "Jurassic World" movie.While I don't consider this the worst Jurassic film of the series (That distinction still belongs to the cinematic black hole called "Jurassic Park 3" in my opinion) it's the most disappointing.

title: Bad and Boring
text: Why did they make this movie out, really bad and boring. Mediocre acting, stupid actions and terrible plot. This should be the last of the Jurassic franchise, or maybe it just has killed it.

title: The Worst
text: The worst movie in the saga, the dinosaurs were left aside for "family" matters as well as a heroine that nobody asked for. The first 20 minutes too boring, lousy script and the protagonists went into the background to make way for "inclusion".Pd: Chris Prat don't deserve this.

title: Blockbuster Fun!
text: It's finally summer and it's that time of the year where you just want to be entertained. Who cares if it's not critically acclaimed when it jumps you out of your seat (a handful of times actually)! It was nostalgia all over again to see the original cast (and a couple of good additions) - so good. 'Watched it on IMAX 3D and it was a total blast!

title: Not bad. Dinosaurs look great. The story not so much
text: I was so hyped to take my young son to see this as I remember seeing the original Jurassic park in the cinema. Boy was I disappointed this film completely lost its spark from the original. Even bringing back old characters can't save this movie.Plot is all over the place and it's hard to keep track of what's happening.One positive my boy gave it 8/10My score 9 for the dinosaurs 5 for the story.

title: Please, please, stop making these!
text: Over two hours that I will never get back. I was hoping that they would all be eaten, but alas!It was just a shameless nod to the first film, even including one of the original props and using the same scenes but done with less skill that in the first movie.

title: Copy/paste, next scene, copy/paste
text: If you like dino wrestling and have a mind of three year old then go ahead.. have a good time.Its pure clich over and over again... with the same stupid ending.

title: Please stop.
text: Yet another swing yet another miss. They badly fail to execute the attempt to play on nostalgic scenes, characters and imagery, even to the point of endangering the legacy of the original films main stars. Some of these scenes and dialogue are painful to watch they're so forced, predictable and so poorly acted it borders on slapstick. Add in all the attempted "smouldering" looks from Chris pratt (at one point even punching the largest dinosaur ever in the face!?) and the terrible over acting from Bryce Howard doing that wide eyed simpleton thing? The first scene with her in the first 5 mins sets the standard for lame acting and cheesy dialogue. Awful, I was hoping shed be eaten by ever dinosaur she came across.. There are some saving graces, decent chase scenes, suspense and visuals, Jeff Goldblum brings some charm, there are some nice throwbacks and nods to the original.. But lazy story and execution, overall I wish they would stop stop stop. They should never have made another movie after the first one. These rubbish reboots won't spoil the original classic masterpiece but it's not worth the risk!

title: Ignore "critics". If you are Jurrasic world fan you'll love this.
text: What an entertaining movie for those who love the franchise. Yes, to an extent the critics were truthful in what they wrote, however it WAS STILL A GOOD movie.Entertaining, nostalgic, exciting, humorous. Jeff Goldblum is perfect as always. Bryce Dallas Howard is gorgeous, Chris Pratt is ok. He's so much better as Peter Quill. When his humor is allowed to run free he shines, here he as just an action guy of little substance.Watch it for its intended purpose, entertainment and you too will enjoy it.

title: Poor acting/poor effects
text: Poor acting. Especially from female characters. I expected a poor acting, but the effects are poor as well. It's on the edge of waste of time. Obvious dolls for dinosaurs, and fast raptors in snow? I thought they are cold blooded.. cannot stop thinking about "everything wrong with.." YT channel. If there ia absolutely nothing else to watch, sure, hit this one.

title: Ends with the great CGI
text: Unfortunately this is the worst JW movie, and obviously among the entire JP franchise.I have a been a dinosaurs fan since the first movie came out in 1993 ( I was 13) and immediately started reading and buying books about dinosaurs ever since. I am constantly following a,most every series and documentary, blogs, FB pages etc.However, it seems like the creators of this movie in particular, and the entire JW series in general, don't bother following and updating about dinosaurs research. It becomes even worse when they insert into the movie things that are completely unrelated and are definitely not the scientific consensus, like "compassionate conservation", which has good intentions, but terrible outcome such as mass extinction of wildlife due to the spread of invasive species.Add to it the regular JP franchise criticism about human behavior, corruption and greed, and you'll get a 140 minutes propaganda which has nothing to do with dinosaurs except for good CGI.

title: Too bad there's no story
text:
As pleasant as it is to see popular characters again, they need something more than endless Dino chases to create a story. The plot where fragments exist involve yet another maniacal business person who is willing to destroy the world to rule it aided by an odd band of thugs including a blond Asian woman with focus
on fashion sense and appearing evil. In fact I kept expecting to hear Dr Evil's mwahaahaa from her mouth whenever she appeared. This role will not help her career. Fortunately Bryce Dallas Howard has proven herself a credible director as her scenes involve a lot of resigned fear and scenery chewing. The utter moral reversal of BD Wong's character stinks of retconning.It feels like it was written and directed by Michael Bay and there is no compliment in that.It's passably ok although long and tiresome as a time waster but I do hope that we've reached the end of this series. With decent writing and an actual story it could have been better.

title: Bad, very bad
text: This is nothing like Jurassic Park or Jurassic World, it feels more like a cheesy espionage movie. Incredibly corny, I'd like my time back. The only appeal is the reuniting of all characters, and an epic fight with everyone's favorite antihero, the T-Rex. Beyond that... ugh, bad screen writing.

title: It's supposed to entertain!
text: Listen, this is a generational movie meant to entertain everyone that has seen all the movies. My husband and my kids were excited to see it. When we went to the movies, we saw grandparents, parents and kids all together. It's a fun movie for the Dino lovers to see dinosaurs in action. My 12 year old still loves dinosaurs. This movie is an opportunity to get the whole family together and enjoy a movie filled with action, some funny scenes and some scary scenes. Trust me, as a Mom and movie junkie.... This movie will be worth your money, time, the drink and popcorn!

title: How Dissapointing
text:
From the word go, this movie was one big nostalgic cringe with poor dialogue and a sub par plot.Honestly, with such a large budget, cult following and unique 'world', it's almost harder to make a bad movie, yet, here we are.Co Written by the person who was involved in writing The Rise of Skywalker, seemed of the same standard..
You'll watch it if you're a Jurassic Park fan, but lower your expectations, then a bit more, before pressing play.

title: The end of dinosaurs
text: Another great series ends with a failure, the last movie was watchable but after this one I won't even consider checking the next movie that comes out.

title: Ooooof....
text: Another overlong 2 1/2 Hour Movie for People with the Attention Span of a TikTok-Clip. Convoluted Story about a Company that uses genetically modified locusts to gain control of worldwide supply of Grain....or something like that.One star each for Der, Neill and Goldblum.

title: It's not the originals - it's not supposed to be!
text: I loved it. I went into the movie knowing it's not going to be the first Jurassic Park or the first Jurassic World. If you want to watch a movie that's just like the originals, then I'd suggest watching the originals again. This is a new movie that furthers the plot from the prior movies, and marries this current trilogy to the original trilogy. I does a great job - great acting, great script, great action scenes, great pacing. The movie provides compelling reasons for each of the characters to want to be involved. I loved the new additions to the cast. I have absolutely no complaints - great job, everyone.

title: So Disappointed!!!
text: This movie has my entire childhood ..and whats was shown was a massacre...so many good actors i love nd respect...could not process how it could be this bad...the choreography with the animals the thrills the love hate relationship with carnivores ..the sentiments ..i mean disaster...i am not being mean to the movie...i am just feeling really bad...studios need to be stop becoming money making machines and let the creativity take its time..dont make it just for making money we can wait but please please make it good...even my 70 year old mom said this is like a repeat of old movie scenes...just not done.

title: Jurassic world disaster
text: The latest and last film in the series includes some bad acting an the multiple plot lines do not work. The multiple plot lines make the overall story confusing and hard to follow. Finally the writing was awful and could have been a lot better.

title: Now eventually you will have dinosaurs on your dinosaur tour yes?
text:
Of all the Jurassic Park and Jurassic World movies this has to be the oddest Movie of them all. I don't know if it was the whole Covid thing that messed this up but it seems the writing has a lot to do with the problem. Lack of writing is probably a better way to put it. Filming stopped for a while if I'm not mistaken. It seems that would have been a great time to rework what you think won't work. They had ample time to do so but for some reason they felt like what they had was working.Oversized locusts? What is that all about? Why are they on fire and still able to fly around long enough to burn everything down?It was nice to see the original tyrannosaurus sort of take back it's reign as the biggest and baddest dinosaur. Unfortunately she couldn't do so without the help of a giant big bird looking dino with Freddy Kruger looking fingers.This movie is just weird with the locusts, the Freddy Kruger, the ice fishing raptor and the worst ever antagonist to top it all off. And now after five films Dr Wu suddenly gets the madness and has a change of heart? Cheesy, all of it.Last but not least. Where are all the dinosaurs in this movie? They barely have any screen time. This is a movie about dinosaurs so again I'll quote Ian from the first movie "eventually you will have dinosaurs on your dinosaur tour?"
Apparently they answered that with a big "nope!"

title: Do me a favor! Watch it in 4DX+3D!
text: Plz watch the movie in 4DX + 3D, you will thank me later. It gives you a full 2.5 hrs universal studio ride experience. (Without 2-hr queue for a 10 mins ride, yes I'm talking about Shriek 4D) Everyone seemed to enjoy the movie coz the whole audience applauded at the end of the movie. I can see why ppl think it's not as good when watching it in a regular 2D theater, this movie is designed for you to watch it in 4DX+ 3D. The thrills when you feel you were actually in it with the casts while running, escaping..etc, the whole experience was so vivid and so worth it. Highly highly recommended!

title: No spoilers
text: Watched this movie a couple of weeks ago. I'm having a really hard time remembering what it was about. Thats how bad it was. I can only remember dinosaurs and some well known faces from an expensive cast. I would not be able to spoil this even if I wanted to.

title: What happend here?
text: All i could say after the movie was...wow.Is this really how it all ends?maybe i had my expectations to high i guess.Yeah ok there was a lot of action but not enough including the dinosaurs.And the worst part for me was the T-rex had no final roar...a little one after the fight that was all.It should have ended like the first Jurrasic world with her big roar.People watch this for the dino's i tought, well at least i did.Shame could have ended way better then this.Was cool to see the old actors again tho and scenes that where familiar. And the music as Beautiful as always. But that's about it.

title: Awesome movie
text: Ignore the negative reviews..... this is a fast paced, excellent continuation/ conclusion to a good franchise. It is great to see the original cast along side the rebooted guys. Great special effects , and fun. Maybe a little scary for little ones though.

title: When your trend analysts tell you that your audience is prepubescent crowd...
text: ...you make movies like this; any Peppa Pig episode is wrote better than this magna opus of greed.Sincerely sad for the cinema industry.You can literally see the guilt in the face of the actors involved, be it contract obligations or that fat premium check they got for not saying "no, i'll skip this trash"Don't get me wrong, this movie is perfectly suitable for any bored family who wants to turn off the brain for couple hours, to rest... perfect choice; you won't regret falling asleep and the small goblins you call kids will rejoice watching their favorite dinosaur wrestle like it's WWE.Definitely a skippable movie.

title: Boring
text: This is the type of movie that'll have you on your phone, there is nothing to think about or fathom stroy-wise. Things just happen just to happen. People complaining about diversity and although it is definitely there is the least of it's worries. Its just bland, lazy, un-inspired. Probably just a cash grab. The bad CGI Dinosaurs didn't do anything for me. And the action or fight sequences are easily the most lame in the whole series. MCU might one big cash grab but they still manage to make it watchable without wanting to grab your phone at least. This movie exists just to exists.

title: In a world where elephants the size of a building roam free ..
text:
Are we to believe that
If you believe such nonsense then this movie is for you. It's one big epic cluster-fok of idiotic ideas and situations. This movie wants u to believe that in a couple of years, the public has become so accustomed to dinosaurs that compy's now live in city-parks, next do ducks and u can feed them like you would a duck. Colin Trevorrow single-handedly killed the awesomness of dinosaurs.

title: Good mix of nostalgia and new
text: Loved this movie. I've followed this franchise from the beginning and this movie mixed the old with the new perfectly! It was a great way to bring the series to an end. I will go back and see it again!

title: Shocking levels of dinosaur abuse
text: As a proud PETA member, I found the abuse of dinosaurs disturbing. Dinosaurs were whipped, shocked, shot, punched, caged, chained, and set on fire. I felt sick to my stomach walking out of the movie theater today.

title: No. Just NO.
text: I have been primed for this movie a long time. Only to see... this. I don't even know what 'this' is. Please just take it away.I seriously cannot name a single aspect of the film that I actually did like. So I suppose zero stars would have been more appropriate, but unfortunately I don't have that choice.I feel for the cast because this could have been epic, instead of just another epic fail. I mean, what happened?!It was an action movie with no soul, no story. That pretty much sums it up.I could say more but do I really want to? I guess not. I guess time could be better spent.Don't watch this film if you want to get use out of your time and money. That's the message here.

title: "You made a promise? to a dinosaur?"
text:
This is going to be an informal review as I do not care enough for this film. Also I haven't slept in over 10 hours so let's make this quick.This is the worst film in the Jurassic franchise, it is trash, it is garbage, it is a dumpster fire. Terrible writing, terrible dialogue that will leave you shaking your head. No one, and I mean no one could've saved this film it was doomed from conception. I love Michael Giacchino but holy crap was this score horrible it did nothing to elevate what was happening on screen but then you don't care enough anyway so how can it. This film is two hours, and twenty six minutes long, and I felt every minute. It's also two hours, and twenty six minutes too long.This film is also wrongly titled "Jurassic World Dominion" "Dominion" implies these dinosaurs would be occupying the Earth almost similar to Planet of the Apes. Yet instead of dinosaurs ruling the Earth we are treated to a dull, boring story about the environment, and how we are destroying the environment. Typical of Hollywood to peddle this liberal trash! Not only does this film suffer from a bad title but also it's tone, it's all over the place. This film doesn't know what it wants to be.There's no redeeming factors here, the original characters add nothing except to fuel ticket sales. Also for the return of Dodgson well Wayne Knight said it best in Jurassic Park "Dodgson we got Dogson here" and nobody cares. Apparently all the main characters have a super power that stops dinosaur attacks by just rasing their hand, like what the hell kind of plot armor bull is that. This film is The Rise of Skywalker to the Jurassic franchise, the only good here is that it's finally over. Ever since the original Jurassic Park this franchise has gone down hill.I expected trash yet somehow they've still managed to disappoint. With this film they've done the impossible I'd rather watch Fallen Kingdom. Normally I would always encourage others to watch, and judge for yourself but I can't do that. Save yourself, save your money, and save your time. Instead watch Top Gun: Maverick in theaters or literally anything else.IMDb: 1/10
Letterboxd: 1/5Watched in Theaters.

title: An incredible ending to the saga!
text: I absolutely loved this film! It was absolutely riddled with Easter eggs from all the old films and the dynamic between the OG cast and the new was so fun to see! It had all the action and suspense I have come to expect from the Jurassic franchise and it tied up the story line perfectly! I already want to watch it again to pick up all the little things I missed the first time!

title: The Jurassic series ends with a whimper not a bang
text: As a child of the 90's, there's an undeniable joy in returning to the world of roaming dinosaurs that happens to include human inhabitants in the form of Jurassic Park stars Laura Dern, Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum but sadly despite a strong sense of nostalgia and joy seeing the veterans return to the property that made such a splash back in 90's, the finale to the Jurassic brand Dominion is a paint by numbers blockbuster that ends up being an experience more akin to the divisive Lost World and the often ridiculed third entry that many fans would choose to forget exists.Overseen by returning director Colin Trevorrow, who takes over directing duties once more after setting up this new era with 2015's Jurassic World and skipping out of 2018's Fallen Kingdom which was helmed by J. A. Bayona, Dominion is a big film in more ways than one and has the tricky task of balancing numerous plot lines with an abundance of characters that have to intermingle the old with the new and its a balancing act Trevorrow never comes to grips with as the film he produces weaves in and out of various states, ranging from the boring, the ridiculous and the entertaining.Moving away from the island setting that has been a staple of the series across previous entries, allowing the whole globe to play a part in this dino-lead chaos opens up a lot of potential doors in a narrative sense but for the most part Dominion unfortunately gives out short straws for its prehistoric critters with the tiresome humans and even bizarrely gigantic locusts hogging far too much of the screen-time, even if the mostly brief and well staged dinosaur moments showcase where the film could've become far more memorable overall if it had chosen to shy away from trying to create too many emotional/witty interactions with its humans.In amongst this loud, brash and totally bonkers film, that see's our team of do-gooders head to Italy to stop some nefarious genetic experiments while battling an as to be expected dinosaur outbreak in a remote facility is a loaded cast of series staples but while the appearance of Neill, Goldblum and Dern is enjoyable there's a feeling that Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard walk away with the best moments in the film, even if Pratt feels more as though his going through the motions here, far removed from his energetic first turn as Owen Grady way back in 2015.At days end its hard to exactly know how long-term fans of the Jurassic series are going to feel about this expensive and instantly forgettable outing, on one hand it gives them another chance to see those they know and loved in action once more but you can't help escape the feeling that there was a far better way to utilise their presence than what is done here and after this next generation of Jurassic action was started out solidly in 2015, in 2022 we culminate this period with a whimper not a bang, making this a rather sorry finale to a property with more downs than ups.Final Say -Not a complete dumpster fire but not the fitting return of past characters or finale one might've hoped for, Jurassic World Dominion does a few things right but with too much time dedicated to its humans not its creatures and an overall sense of mundanity, this blockbuster is unlikely to create much of a stir now or into the future.2 1/2 coathangered dinosaurs out of 5For more reviews check out Jordan and Eddie (The Movie Guys)

title: The Collapsing of a once Mighty Empire
text: Ah, Jurassic Park ... I was twelve when Spielberg's 1993 original came in theaters, and obviously it was one of the most phenomenal things I had seen until then. Since, I've seen the original landmark numerous times, but also the immediate sequels and the revival films are repeatedly watched favorites. I never reviewed an installment in the "Jurassic Park/World" series because they are mainstream movies, and everything that can be written about them - either positive or negative -has already been written. Straight after watching the last (and hopefully final) entry in the franchise, I did feel the urge to write off some frustration, as this was a disappointment I won't easily recover from.Personally, I think it would have been perfectly fine if the saga ended with the climax of "Fallen Kingdom". The dinosaurs have been set free, unleashed upon the world, and humans and dinosaurs as well as regular animals are forced coexist. Period. Whatever happens after that should have been left to the imagination.But of course, they didn't stop! Co-writer/director Colin Treverrow absolutely wanted to complete his own trilogy, and by doing so comes up with one of the most preposterous, clich-packed, and tiresome scenarios of the 21st century thus far. Evidently there's yet another multinational corporation (BioSyn, I believe it's called this time) running amok and kidnapping both the cloned girl and the super-intelligent Raptor for their unique DNAs, but this company also created a humongous and ravenous species of prehistoric locusts for some reason. This sub plot brings back Laura Dern and Sam Neill, but it's too ridiculous for words, and unfit for the franchise.Absolutely nothing in "Jurassic World: Dominion" looks or feels authentic, passionate, plausible, or even entertaining. Admittedly, it started out promisingly, with the typically human abusive behavior and desire to exploit whatever Mother Nature has created. There's illegal breeding (and crossbreeding) between different species of dinosaurs for commercial purposes, underground fighting/gambling activities, etc. As soon as the locusts pop up, however, the whole thing turns into a lousy B-movie. The stars of the previous two films, Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard, are pretty much downgraded to the supportive cast (particularly Bryce), and the original stars, Laura Dern and Sam Neill, do not seem the least bit interested in anything except for their paycheck. What a sad, sad conclusion...

title: Don't listen to these people
text: You guys are pathetic. Review bombing is just stupid. This was a great movie. I'm definitely going to see it a few more times. You guys aren't seeing the bigger picture here.Edit: it's a good movie. Just so people know. GO SEE IT!

title: How to ruin popular franchise
text: This movie is perfect example of How to ruin popular franchise. Movie without soul and wafer thin story line. They worked hard on VFX sacrificing everything else.Movie will earn good money but it is bad movie.

title: Oof... would have been better as a silent film...
text: Most reviews hit it on the head. Its totally generic work with childish dialog and plot. Every scene turned cringy the second someone opened their mouth or when they did anything. It wasnt the acting. Actually the acting was down right average but nothing was going to save the plot or scenes which were poorly thought through, assuming anyone thought about them at all... im sort of wondering if the movie was written by some sort of early stage neanderthal level algorithm.On the upside, the movie looks great. The dinos are good and the jungle island was cool. If they just stopped talking it might have actually been ok... Actually I think the movie would have been 100x better if they put talking collars on the dinosaurs and just had them speak instead. Kind of like that cartoon with Dug the dog.

title: Really Enjoyed It
text: The best of the Jurassic World era and best since the original. Great to see the original cast back. The additional the three original cast members really adds something to the movie.Some have said it comes off a but like an Indiana Jones movie and I have to agree, which is great as far as I am concerned.

title: How far the franchise has strayed from the original Jurassic Park...
text: I consider myself a very big Jurassic Park fan, but I'm also a very critical one. I love the original movie for its atmosphere, the fascinating dinosaurs, the scary scenes and the immersive story. After a few so-so sequels, Jurassic World did a great job of capturing what made JP so wonderful for me.I guess I'm liking the wrong things about the Jurassic franchise, because the newer movies focus on totally different things. Compared to JP and JW, Jurassic World Dominion feels more like an action movie that happens to have dinosaurs and recurring characters in it.It goes from dino attack to dino chase, to dino battle, to dino attack, etc. Hardly ever does the movie build up tension, let the characters grow friendships, or take the time to tell a nice story.If you like seeing lots of different dinosaurs in different action scenes, you'll probably love this movie. If you were hoping for something with that Jurassic Park vibe, this might not be it. And no, not even the original cast and some Easter eggs can do the trick.

title: Woke bs
text: I wasn't expecting much but what I got was even worse than rock bottom. It's just a woke joke with no connection to any Jurassic park story aside of the dinosaurs. Avoid this one and let become extinct.

title: Terrible terrible movie
text: Why? Why would anyone make a movie like this?It's absolutely horrendous.The story is not good. Not good at all. It makes no sense.Way too many coincidences. They always happen to be exactly at the right spot at the right time. Meet the right people across the globe just at the right moment.I think they need to stop making these films.The first one was epic. The second was less. But after that they should've quit.And what's with the constant hand thing. I know it worked on the trained ones but now all dinosaurs seem to "listen" to his hand.This is two and a half hours wasted. Too bad they massacred this.

title: Amazing
text: I know it will get a lot of criticism. It feels like whatever the franchise does from now on , people will complain . But honestly ? This movie is a masterpiece , I loved every bit of it , even the unrealistic scenes , after all , it's a a science fiction movie anyway , I highly recommend this wonderful movie.

title: Apparently, your accent is genetic
text: This movie was so dumb... from the girl that has an Australian accent who never lived in Australia, to the horrible dialogues, plot holes left and right, lame fan service and attempts to be both a James Bond and Indiana Jones film...I hope Chris Pratt got paid a lot, because this will be seen as a low point if his acting career.

title: Some fun to be had, but ultimately disappointing
text: In being a very loud, sometimes mindlessly entertaining, but ultimately kind of empty third part of a trilogy, Jurassic World Dominion feels a bit like Star Wars Episode 9: Rise of Skywalker. Dominion may be a little better, but not by much, and I was a little disappointed in the end.I know a lot of more serious film fans weren't really hopeful for this, but I was cautiously optimistic it was going to be good. The last instalment ended with a good set-up for a sequel (dinosaurs roaming free in the human world) and it was good to hear that the first movie's trio of main characters were returning. Also, Jurassic World (2015) I remember being fun, and Dominion has the same director, so things were shaping up decently.The film doesn't come close to achieving its full potential, but I don't think it completely squanders it either. I think there are fun scenes and some good ideas that aren't fully realised. Unsurprisingly, it's at its best when it makes use of the whole dinosaurs running free in the real world. All the action at the halfway point was so stupid but also really entertaining- car chases, parkour, gunfights, and hand-to-hand fights, all including dinosaurs. It kind of felt like The Bourne Identity but with dinosaurs for a bit there, and if it had more stupid and entertaining stuff like that, I would've been happy.But the whole finale ends up taking place in yet another closed off facility, and mostly in the dark, so they can hide some of the imperfect special effects in the shadows (and felt like the effects here were weirdly inconsistent). There's fun to be had with Neill, Dern, and Goldblum returning. They're not squandered or just there as cameos, but like the other good things here, they're not used as well as they could have been.I can't deny most of the dinosaur scenes were fun. There was some silly action and goofy set pieces that were entertaining. It wasn't a boring movie, but it was a messy one, with three or four different storylines all jammed into one movie, and just not enough done with the premise of dinosaurs and humans having to co-exist. It's overall disappointing, but if you have a soft spot for dinosaurs or big monster movies like me, it's not a completely irredeemable disaster.

title: Five different stories wrapped up into one movie

title: Take The Highway To The Danger Zone Not The Dino Zone
text: Save yourself the time, take a dump on your living room floor, settle in and get comfortable and stare at it for 2hrs and 26mins because that's the exact same experience you will have watching this film. It stinks and it's nasty. The dinosaurs don't need to be brought back to life, but good cinema sure does. I genuinely felt embarrassment watching the movie. To think they are handed millions of dollars to make a blockbuster and this is what they came up with? I should have just gone and seen Maverick again and left the dinosaurs dead and buried. Hollywood preyed on our nostalgia and click baited us with high hopes with the old cast returning. Some things are best left in the past.

title: Best dinosaur movie in 20 years
text: Jurassic World Dominion, unlike many other sequels in this saga, accomplishes what it set out to do. For casual viewers it has enough action, moments of wonder -that seemed to be missing in this franchise for the longest time- and enough plain fun. For the fans of the Jurassic movies it's a nostalgic joyride from start to finish.Pros:+ It's 6th movie in a franchise that manages not to feel dull and dumb.+ Gone are the stupid moments of dinosaurs swallowing ringing cell phones, escape from dinosaur on high heels or dinosaurs smiling.+ The plot, unlike in many of it's predecessors, actually makes more sense from scientific standpoint. It's still an action sci-fi horror monster movie, but it is consistent to the saga's mythos and characters.+ Features more dinosaurs than all of the other movies combined, and the new ones are different and exciting.+ The different locations of this movie from the previous tropical islands makes it stand out visually.+ Fixes some of the plot holes of the saga, explains some character motivations and quickly resolves idiotic plotlines from the previous movie.+ The script is very tight, I was amazed how they managed to fit everything into the runtime. Ending is not overdone like in the previous four movies and it is more impactful.+ Stupid dialogue is pretty much gone, caricatures of human beings are not present. Some characters are fixed to be much better this time around. Some dialogue is surprisingly great. Fun jokes.+ Some brilliant camerawork throughout, great effects, brilliant visuals.+ The story weaves it's many protagonists through the plot and puts them all together for the grand finale in a believable way.+ Great star power, the original cast elevates this movie and it's just a mystery to me why it took 29 years to put them in a movie together again.+ Brains and fan moments throughout the movie that many of the sequels lacked.Cons:I don't think anybody expected a genre defying experience like Jurassic Park brought in 1993. It definitely shows though that some of the ideas from the original are brought up here: Cloning, impact on humanity, mixing of species. While every other sequel after that mainly served to be a fun summer blockbuster, this movie surprised me in delving slightly back into these ideas from the original. Since then, there always was some dumb moment in each of the sequels that made me cringe: The entire San Diego sequence from the second movie, the terrible second half of the third movie, the stupidity of the fourth movie that among other things suggested dinosaurs have human-like IQ and the entire fifth movie, that seems mostly like a parody. Jurassic World Dominion is fun, almost entirely absent of these moments and has enough for you to enjoy it, especially if you are a fan of the original. 8/10.

title: Missed opportunity
text:
Jurassic World: Dominion misses its opportunity. The story is needlessly convoluted, sidelining the dinosaurs (and their release) for a mediocre corporate scheme. There are multiple narratives that don't intertwine until the third act. Jokes misfire, plot points are convenient, and motivations are flimsy. Action sequences are messy and unrealistic, defusing their suspense. There are cheesy one-liners, lame fan service attempts, and inept villains. Still, the biggest issue is the missing protagonist or theme. Dominion is overstuffed, with no primary message. Plus, the actors are dull, especially Pratt. Only Goldblum is any fun. Overall, Dominion is emotionally draining and cluttered.Technically, Dominion is inconsistent. There are abundant animatronics, but the CGI is occasionally goofy. Reuniting the original cast is impressive, but less charming when they're past their primes. The cinematography uses decent lighting, angles, and extended shots. However, the sound coasts off of the originals without adding anything new. There is generic music, impersonal production design, and scattered direction. Tonally, Dominion attempts everything and lands very little. Lastly, the editing is bloated, boring, and unfocused. The film never gains momentum and feels like a chore. Whether it's excessive exposition, contrived drama, or numbing action, Dominion isn't engaging.Writing: 2/10
Direction: 3/10
Cinematography: 6/10
Acting: 4/10
Editing: 3/10
Sound: 6/10
Score/Soundtrack: 5/10
Production Design: 5/10
Casting: 7/10
Effects: 8/10Overall Score: 4.9/10.

title: Jurassic World Dominion
text: Eh, it's all right. I just switched off my brain and just had fun with friends and then, and only then, was this movie a solid action movie. But if I switched on my brain and I would've thought a little about the story, ouch, it would've hurt so much. If you really care about this franchise and you want to appreciate the legacy of the first Jurassic Park, it's a painful experience, and that's completely sad to think about it when we are forced to treat blockbusters like this. But when you turn off your brain, it's fine. This movie isn't garbage, it has some beautiful scenery and one scene with water is awesome, but overall, it's bland as hell. I played a game while watching this movie. This game is about this: you watch some scenes and you are thinking about how much better you would film certain moments. So much fun. So I was entertained all throughout the movie, yet it should've been shorter, 147 minutes is a lot to take in when the movie is this mediocre.
