title: Michael Crichton would've cried...and not out of joy
text: Most positive reviews of the movie seem to focus on the action, dinosaurs, and jump scares. I won't deny that the movie has them. The only thing missing was a connecting thread.Fans of the series who were amazed by the storytelling of the first movie will be severely disappointed. There seems to be no cohesive storyline and the scenes felt like they were all thrown into a hat and pulled out randomly.Some scenes were totally ridiculous, especially with the Tyrannosaurus, Giganotosaurus, and Therizinosaurus (yes, that's what it's called). Some were great like the herding with horses scene. But the movie failed to deliver despite having a treasure trove of opportunity to do so.

title: Utterly disappointing
text: This movie was utterly disappointing. It attempts to exploit the nostalgia of the original characters and it fails miserably at every level. The action, the editing, the direction, it's all terrible. The movie has no focus, too many characters that have nothing to do and nothing to do with each other. The only positive thing I can say about this movie is they did use plenty of "real" props for some of the dinosaurs, so it's not like the actors are always looking at a green screen. However, everyone just feels kind of disconnected from the movie. Like everyone involved knew the script was trash and the movie would just be a cash grab.Overall, it was the worst installment in Jurassic Park/ World franchise.

title: Jurassic World: Dominion
text: I really enjoyed how Jurassic World: Dominion tied both Park and World together and how they wrapped up the story-lines introduced in the first two World movies. I must add you don'thave to have seen all theses films in the cannon ;Jurassic World: Dominion stands on it own with tremendous Creature Feature effects . The movie's visual effects and other technical elements are high-quality, with excellent sound design and another on-point soundtrack that incorporates John Williams' original theme.Four years after the destruction of Isla Nublar, dinosaurs now live and hunt alongside humans all over the world. This fragile balance will reshape the future and determine, once and for all, whether human beings are to remain the apex predators on a planet they now share with history's most fearsome creatures.It was an extremely fun summer Block Buster 165 million dollar budget with very high production value leading edge CGI FX with top notch animatronics (thank you Jaws and E. T. for pioneering !). The dinosaurs/prehistoric creatures/flying reptiles were the stars . Dominion has some great creature feature moments. The story unites Owen (Chris Pratt) and Claire (Bryce Dallas Howard) from the newer films with scientists Dr. Sattler (Laura Dern), Dr. Grant (Sam Neill), and Dr. Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) from the original movies. Together they must fight the villainous CEO of an international genetics/agricultural corporation who's lying about how the company uses dinosaur DNA. Expect plenty of jump scares, human-eating dinosaurs, and epic predator-on-predator fights with generous nostalgic nods all over the place. The original trio of actors who made the original Jurassic Park memorable, Dern, Neill, and Goldblum add much gravitas to Jurassic World Dominion, portraying characters who are committed to saving the world with generous nostalgic nods all over the place. This is a fun and exciting finale to the JP franchise. I can not wait to own this one on Blu-ray.

title: So bad
text: Watched it in 3D on a huge screen with 3D sound banging with my 8/6 years old kids and it failed to even impress them. She was talking about the he original Jurassic Park that was made wayyyyyy before she was born with so (comparatively) rudimentary technology. Point being, it is not the huge screen, the thumping sound, the state of the art CGI that make a movie, it is the story. Being a dinosaur movie, it should have been about the dinosaurs but this one was about, actually, nobody. It was just a pile of scenes strung together. Very bad movie.

title: I just love it!

One can't help but think maybe these hyper-realist faux movie "critics" should take a chill pill and enjoy this fantasy movie.I loved every second of this movie because it brought the original beloved characters and meshed their story pretty well with the new characters. And I thought it brought a wild, fantastic end to this storyline.Did I learn how to complete brain surgery or build a rocket from this film? Well, no. Did I have a thoroughly enjoyable time with some favorite characters in amazing settings with awesome dinosaurs?? Hell yeah I did!!!

title: Very bad -- hopefully this is the last one

Glad Jeff Goldblum has some hilarious one-liners at least, he saved the movie from being 1/10.JP producers -- please, no more!

title: Jurassic Park Dumb-minion
text: Wow. Boring till 1 hour in. Then just dumb. Lame story. Way too long. Actors should feel dirty for doing this. Even the fight scenes are lame. Special effects ok. At least everyone got a paycheck for this gig. That's the only good part.

title: I cried after watching this movie
text: I am a 32 year old guy, and Jurassic Park series was a favorite of mine for a long time of my childhood. I was emotionally attached to the first series and as well loved the new ones, i.e. Jurassic world which was fabulous & JW: fallen kingdom was 7/10 i'd say. So when this movie ended, I got really emotional as this was probably the last time we'd get to see the old cast together and tbh they really tried their best to save this movie. I had tears in my eyes and I felt sad even more because this movie was so bad. I never expected this to be this bad, i thought of it to be at least be better than fallen kingdom. I felt a lot of scenes were cut (very easy to observe because of poor editing)and that's the main reason we didn't get to experience the entire thing. Audiences near me were clapping and cheering at each and every moment of the last 15 minutes, but i was sitting quiet and in disbelief on how this movie was given a go with such poor editing and a bad story. This was totally unacceptable and I felt so bad. I really hope that they will release an extended version or a director cut later on. I felt good about the fact that at least 60% of the regular audience in my theatre happened to enjoy this one, they didn't seem to be a fan of the series or something, but they loved watching dinosaurs and they cheered on all the good scenes( which in my eyes weren't that good because they made the dinosaurs look dumb and slow in this movie), so I'm happy that at least not everyone was in the same boat as me. This movie deserved so much more!! I wish I could've been on the happy side. :(

title: Disappointing
text: More issues than I care to list. It felt more like a transformers movie than a Jurassic movie. There's a ton of inconsistencies, physics issues, and overly convenient plot devices. My biggest problem is that it isn't about dinosaurs, it's about grasshoppers and a girl.

title: Dont listen to these clown....

title: Disaster made me write 1st ever review
text: I used to come here only to read the reviews, but this movie made me write one on my own. Simply saying, it was really bad. title: Jurassic Blank - Janketty Jank
text: This is not a good film.Hardly anything dinosaur in the long, boring build up. Then just senseless, plot-less stupid action.I don't know how anyone could make a worse film if they tried.Putting directors / producers on notice, if you make a trash film, you will get trashed.

title: Jurassic World: Dumbinion
text: Jurassic World: Dominion feels like the most expensive fan-made film ever put to cinema. There's an overdose of nostalgia and good visuals to be had and many fun nods to to the original. Sam Neill and Laura Dern also make their long awaited (and welcome) return to the franchise and the chemistry they share is nice, it's as if no time has passed at all since Jurassic Park.However, their return serves only to remind us why this sixth instalment has absolutely nothing on the original Spielberg classic. Simply put, the chemistry shared between Neill, Dern and Jeff Goldblum is not nearly enough to distract from Dominion's awfully dumb story, truly naff dialogue ("I promise I'm gonna get her back!") and the noticeably bored performances of Pratt and Dallas Howard.In fact, unlike the original Jurassic Park, this is a lot more bore than awe. The action totally jumps the raptor, too, with the lowest stakes possible. You just know Owen Toretto and the gang are going to survive each and every dinosaur encounter which totally devours any tension. There's no horror, barely any excitement of any kind.I really wanted to like this but as a legacy sequel, Top Gun: Maverick this is not. Couple all of the above with a runtime as long as the Cretaceous period itself and you get a rather disappointing end to the World trilogy and the Jurassic franchise as a whole.

title: Can't give lower
text:
Story was horrible. CGI terrible, plot holes gallore..
No speed, no sense,.I can't spoiler if I wanted to because it's a complete awful reboot with new nor good elements.

title: This Franchise needs to go Extinct.
text: Where was Steven Spielberg? Did he agree to this story? Did he review the script? Was he ever there during filming? Did he oversee the editing? WHERE WAS SPIELBERG???? There's dinosaur's in this movie that are controlled by laser pointers, WTF? This movie is the worst in the franchise. title: Terrible story, terrible acting, long and boring movie.
text: If you want to see some dinosaurs eat people, you've come to the right place. But don't expect anything else exciting here and don't expect and new cool dinosaurs to play a big part either. This movie has some of the stiffest dialogue ever, cuts between scenes to get characters out of danger (Where did they get the lab coats? Did she get the DNA sample or not? How did they escape the sub levels? We'll never know because all of that happened in between scenes), and feels extremely unbelievable all throughout a long, LONG 2.5 hours. They couldn't pay me enough money to sit through this one again... 1/10, please save yourself the trouble and just watch Jurassic Park or Prehistoric Planet instead.

title: The End Of The "Jurassic" Era (??)
text: It began in 1990 as a speculative science fiction novel by Michael Crichton about genetically engineered dinosaurs on an isolated island off the coast of Central America. And then in 1993, director Steven Spielberg turned it into a genuinely great and scary sci-fi/suspense thriller. Thus was born JURASSIC PARK. Two sequels-1997's THE LOST WORLD: JURASSIC PARK (directed by Spielberg), and 2001's JURASSIC PARK 3 (directed by Joe Johnston)-came about, followed by a fourteen-year break. Then in 2015, with Spielberg serving as executive producer but not directing, there came JURASSIC WORLD, directed by Colin Treverrow, followed in 2018 by JURASSIC WORLD: FALLEN KINGDOM (directed by J. A. Bayona) in 2018. And in 2022, we have come to what is likely the conclusion of this mega-successful dinosaur franchise, in the form of JURASSIC WORLD: DOMINION, with Trevorrow back in the director's chair.At the end of JURASSIC WORLD: FALLEN KINGDOM, a combination of an exploding volcano on Isla Nublar and the usual corporate avarice had allowed the dinosaurs and all manner of genetically engineered prehistoric creatures to break free. As JURASSIC WORLD: DOMINION stars, therefore, humans and dinosaurs (and their offspring, needless to say) are co-existing together, with extremely chaotic results, including a plague of what are basically dino-locusts wiping out the world's grain supply. Dern and Neill return as the intrepid pair of paleontologists Ellie Sattler and Alan Grant to find out that those locusts are being fueled via a genetically-modified seed invented by the Biosyn corporation, run by one Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott), who seems very much a Steve Jobs type, but with megalomaniacal ambitions that could spell humanity's downfall. Pratt (as Owen Grady) and Howard (as Claire Dearing) are back to join in the race to stop Scott dead in his tracks; and they have a secret weapon of sorts in their adapted daughter (Sermon), who, in an interesting twist of a back story, is the granddaughter of John Hammond, the man responsible for this unleashing of genetic dinosaurs in the first place, and who also has a few dino genes inside her DNA as well. All of them converge at Biosyn's isolated mountain facility in northern Italy where, along with famous chaos theorist Ian Malcolm (Goldblum), whom Scott has basically bribed up to this point, confront Scott and his off-the-wall ambitions; and what ensues is, of course, hair-raising dinosaur terror on an industrial, if not indeed downright apocalyptic scale.With a length of close to two and a half hours, JURASSIC WORLD: DOMINION is obviously the longest of the entire six-film franchise, and, without too much doubt, in many places the most off-the-wall entry as well, mostly due to Scott's kidnapping plot involving Sermon, which contains chases on motorbikes, vans, and planes that wouldn't be out of place in any James Bond film, but arguably are here. As with the previous three films of the Jurassic Park/Jurassic World franchise, Spielberg functions as an executive producer only (having gotten himself in two major directorial undertakings of his own, WEST SIDE STORY and THE FABELMANS), so it is up to Trevorrow to come up with something huge. And this is indeed what happens in JURASSIC WORLD: DOMINION. The dinosaurs, particularly the locusts, are more ferocious than they have ever been before, ensuring that the franchise end (if indeed it does end here) on an almost end-of-the-world scale. But to Trevorrow's credit, probably with Spielberg's encouragement, he had the good sense to bring Dern, Neill, and Goldblum back from the original 1993 classic, and combine them with Pratt and Howard, who are (thankfully) no longer a bickering couple as they were in the first two JURASSIC WORLD films, but responsible dinosaur behavioral experts also looking out for Sermon's welfare amidst all the violent, screaming dinosaur terror.Trevorrow is obviously not the subtlest of directors to begin with (sometimes, even Spielberg isn't either {witness "1941"]), but when it comes to JURASSIC WORLD: DOMINION, he delivers the goods without turning towards the way-over-the-top implausibilities of a Michael Bay (the infernal "Transformers" series) or Roland Emmerich (his admittedly good 2009 end-of-the-world opus "2012"); and the six principal actors of the franchise keep much of everything else on an even keel.If this is indeed the end of this dinosaur franchise, it is one hell of a way to go out on. And this is why I'm giving JURASSIC WORLD: DOMINION an '8' rating.

title: By far the worst of the franscice!
text: This movie is overly long and you really feel the runtime as it drags on and on. What used to be dinosaur fun has turned into a boring rescue mission that has a bigger focus on the boring characters instead of the dinosaurs. The writing is lazy and convoluted and the performances are bland and boring. Chris Pratt's usual charm is next to gone, and his charisma just doesn't land like it has done before in previous projects, which might be a consequence of the writing or the performance.Going into the movie I thought it would be about how humans had to adapt to living among dinosaurs, but nope. It completely throws that out the window, instead focusing on a rescue mission and DNA separation in humans. It ultimately feels like two separate movies put together and it still doesn't manage to make an impression with so much material at hand.The dialogue is pretty lackluster and the only real redeeming thing is when the dinosaurs and the returning characters from the original. I must admit though, Jeff Goldblum did put a smile on my face each time he was on screen. He always had a quirky line, fun punk or joke and they landed pretty well.This is the end to the saga, which is definitely for the better as the formula and magic of the park movies has sadly run out, where every entry becomes worse and feels more like a cash grab than trying to create a good blockbuster.3/10.

title: Don't waste your time
text: Nothing like it's predecessors, lacks story, it's predictable and throwing in old characters felt clich. People even walked out of the cinema half way through a testament to how bad it is.

title: Boring and Unwanted Sequel
text: Honestly, this is the public opinion on these movies. They should have stopped at Jurassic park 1 and called it a day. Ruining its legacy with FIVE unwanted sequels is so sad to see. I used to love the original as a kid and watching it become a bland action movie is unbearable. The movie itself isn't offensive in any way, it's doing its job, pleasing 8 year olds with more dinosaur action. No characters except Jeff goldbloom's were exciting to watch and no story beats or plot lines were fun enough to get a single cheer or laugh out of me. Don't watch this movie and give them a reason to reboot it yet again.

title: So disappointingly terrible
text: How could they get this so wrong? How could this be the worst movie out of 6 in the Jurassic park universe? I'm not even sure there is an explanation for how bad this movie is. Maybe it's the terribly corny acting, maybe it's the B movie graphics or maybe it's the totally unbelievable story arc. I say it hit all 3 of those points head on, thus my 3 star rating. What a let down for a long time Jurassic fan....

text: I hadn't enjoyed such a good JURASSIC movie in a long time. Screen time is given to both new and old characters. It was a great decision to bring the original cast. 2 and a half hours that pass in the blink of an eye, enjoyable from start to end. It is an excellent closure coming from previous installments that were not very good (although if they want they can exploit the saga more).

title: Didn't last past the first 30 minutes
text: The first Jurassic Park movie is one of my favorite movies. They got progressively worse after that but even the second and third installments weren't that bad. The first Chris Pratt/Bryce Dallas Howard movies was ok too, not great because after all, Daniella Pineda was in it, how good could it be? But it was ok. Fallen Kingdom was bad, really bad, with plot holes big enough to heard a dinosaur through and an absurd plot. But I watched then entire movie.This piece of drek is beyond bad, and I'm just going by the first 30 minutes because that's all I could stomach before I bailed on it. Judging by others reviews and the opinions of those friends and family who actually sat through it I made the right call.This franchise died some time ago, put it to rest.

text: (no spoilers) movie had very, very few and small flaws but in all seriousness, an amazing ending to the jurassic era and very good acting, sure its not better than the original JP but it is near, definitely better than Fallen Kingdom, JPIII, Lost World and better than JP.

title: Unbelievably bad
text: As a huge fan of the Jurassic films I couldn't wait to see this. Unbelievably bad - poor acting, poor special effects. Laughable at times how the characters are just meandering along somehow avoiding being obliterated by dinosaurs without even running away! Don't even waste your money watching this! If this is the last Jurassic film to be made all I can say is it has ruined the Jurassic legacy of awesomeness! Amazed that the normally top rate actors that are in this agreed to do it. All I can think is they did it just for the money ........ ridiculous storyline, no real plot, bad special effects, poor acting, just bad all round. Deserves to be rated by Rotten Tomatoes.

title: The worst in the franchise
text: I am a fan of the Jurassic Park movies, but this one was a let down. For me this one was the worst of the lot. No real story, predictable and repeated scenes, same old dialogues, and 1 hour too long.It may have done better without the first 60 minutes of nothing. A couple of chase sequences were done really well, gripping stuff, but that's all the good I can say about this as the rest of the movie was boring rehash and uninspiring.Also, in 2022 the special effects were a let down as most dinosaurs looked clayish and lifeless. Something wrong with the texture detailing, the eyes and muscular controls. I hope this dud does not kill the series.

title: Absolute dumpster fire
text: I didn't expect much going into it, yet even with these low expectations I was honestly unable to finish it. Don't bother unless you want to see dinosaurs for dinosaurs sake (and even, maybe don't) The scriptwriting is atrocious, direction is rubbish, so many stupid choices I wouldn't know where to start.

title: What a shame
text: So where to start, it's terrible.I know that actors can do better so I'm not going to blame them as such but they do hold some responsibility for allowing their names to be attached to such utter garbage.Storyline was poor, directing was poor, the script was poor.It was full of inconsistencies and generally speaking it feels like a giant expensive parody of the other films.Then we have the irony of the film.Which is essentially a well meaning liberal trying to save the world and in so doing screws it up that little bit more, that is actually fairly representative of reality.We also have the irony that the story pretends that the human race is going to go extinct if don't change our ways and so we must suffer to make things better, but then goes on to explain that human ingenuity saves the world. Well which is it, do we need to suffer or will you let humans do what humans do and that is to adapt their progress.Then we have the DEI nonsense that was layed on so think you would be hard pressed to know it wasn't an advert for the US military.Here's a news flash, you don't need to emasculate men to have strong female roles, it comes across as farcical and cringe.Overall I just found the film annoying, far to long and boring, offensive to both life and the original storyline and sums up just about everything that is wrong with the movie industry.How pleased am I that I didn't actually have to pay for this film other than the time I will sadly never get back.

title: This is how you end it?
text: This movie could have been so much more, but instead we get a boring and uninspired movie with big crickets and Jeff Goldblum. Outside of a few scenes, It doesn't even try to show us the impact of dinosaurs living with humans. It's trying to be way to clever that it needs to be, overall a disappointing, but not terrible movie. There is some fun to be had, but thats far and in between.

title: So Bad in So Many Ways
text: This movie was so bad I feel it's necessary I warn as many people as possible. Do NOT waste your time or money. You'd get more entertainment and joy out of licking a sand lollipop.As everyone else has said, it's got too much of nothing going on. It's the only movie I've seen in the theatre that made me want to ask for a refund.No chemistry, no imagination, poorly conceived plot, horrible selection of music placement. And attempting to give everyone a participation "medal" to appease and please varying demographics was so artificial!! Ahhhhhharghh!! It's so bad.

title: All the negative reviews are missing a crucial bit
text: Yes, the story is spam in a can, yes, the screenplay is a random succession of derivative garbage .And yes, it's not an adventure movie, which the franchise is kown for and did well , or anything else really .The direction , the editing, it's all over the place, at no point creating a coherent picture .But what really pushes this thing over the edge, it's the little girl .Not just is her character annoying and poorly implemented, and the acting of the girl actress subpar - she has the most annoying, the most pretentious British accent to ever soil the screen .And I happen to really like British accents - not this one .But yes, in general the movie is pretty bad , too .

title: Very mediocre action with massive plot holes and forced morals
text: Duration: Too long.Characters: Bland. Characters' actions make absolutely no sense, not only the movie fails to explain the motives behind some major decisions but also makes them do things that are contradictory to what we already know about them.Script: Horrible. HORRIBLE. At one point a male character literally decided ALL BY himself to throw his wife out of the plane with a parachute into the area infested with all kinds of flying and running dangerous dinosaurs. You know what he said when he did that? "You are a mum." I would have rather stayed on the about to crush plane. And either ways, it was her call to make. Not his.The key take away: Dinosaurs are fast, dangerous unstoppable beasts that can be used as targeted weapons. Dinosaurs kill people and other animals like foxes and deers and threaten to wipe out modern ecosystem. But also, they are gentle living things, they have deep feelings and understand English and the expression of gratitude. The must be protected because the main characters decide that it's a morally right thing to do and therefore we must support it.The concepts of forced philosophy of coexisting (Rainbow and butterflies and castle emojis here) is absolutely insane. Its mind numbingly stupid and naive.

title: The collapse of Jurassic World Dominion
text: Starting with Jurassic Park and then the Jurassic World series, this film series was created. With the technology of the day, Jurassic Park's dinosaurs and background design were done with minimal computer use and the dinosaurs were physically designed. But by the time Jurassic World came around, the films had been created in 3D and highly realistic using full computer technology. But Jurassic World Dominion has failed to create realistically with the high use of technology as expected by the audience. It was created in the same mine that previously created Jurassic Park. Accordingly, the realism of the dinosaurs was very low and there were many inconsistencies (many contradictory, illogical premises in there) in the plot. Watched because of the love of the series, it can be considered as a fail movie when taken as a separate movie.

title: Don't watch this. Even once.
