title: Just going through the motions....
text: Seemed exceptionally predictable.... as if they merely re-wrote the original Jurassic Park film and tweaked it.Performances were good for the most part, and CGI was, of course, great.It was an okay film for the family, the younger the audience the more it may be appreciated. But if you recall the original film, well, you'll know the outline of the story well.... and the... ermm.. the not-so-subtle political messages were kind of annoying. I dislike being "preached" at. The only way they could have made their hidden agenda clearer would be to use "Monsanto" as opposed to "Biosyn." Not that I disagree with the overall message.. but the film becomes propaganda more than entertainment.No one simply writes good ENTERTAINMENT any more. Seems every film or television series being made today MUST have some sort of political or social message they want to impart to audiences. Where have all the good stories gone???

title: Disappointing
text: I Love ALL of the previous movies, so was really looking forward to this, but i was really disappointed.It didn't have the same feel as the other movies. Some scenes were really bad, like the Giga scene. The characters just stood there, walking around a car instead of running away. Then the Giga didn't really do much else. The end scene - i was expecting an epic battle. But, no, it lasted seconds and again, the characters were just stood around watching.The way Fallen Kingdom ended, i assumed this movie would be set in human populated areas, and have to either round up all of the dinosaurs or find a way to live among them. No.It felt like it was made just to squeeze as many different dinosaurs into it as possible.Plus, they need to stop with the silly raptor story line. It was really unnecessary. Risking their lives for a plastic looking baby dinosaur, because he made a promise....... to a DINOSAUR.The CGI was amazing. I hate giving negative reviews but this was such a disappointing ending to a trilogy and franchise .5/10.

title: Disaster
text: Been into dinosaurs since I was baby was totally obsessed with all Jurassic park/world but the final movie was a disgrace . Full of nostalgia and rubbish story line. Hardly showed any dinosaurs, no iconic scene to remember . In this day of age we have best technology but the worse movies . Old days was the best!!

title: Even Better the Third Time Around--Upgraded rating
text: THIS IS AN EDITED UPDATED REVIEWI criticize critics who judge movies based on the one viewing of a film, and understandably, the first impression is probably the most honest. On the other hand, many a movie that have been dissed over the years have gained favor from repeat viewers.I watched this movie again on video and actually liked it a lot better the third time around. Reading the reviews here, clearly there was great disappointment. But a scene in I believe the first Jurassic World could be applied to this series and particularly this movie. In that film, the need to create new dinosaurs is because people felt what was already out there was no more exciting than going to a standard zoo.The question is: What would you have had the movie been about that would repress the criticism of "same old thing"? I have been a big Jurassic fan since the beginning and I cannot imagine a story line that hasn't been done that would create new excitement unless you enter the realm of the absurd. In other words, there is a limit to how creative these movies can be given the subject.Certainly dinosaurs integrating with the general animal and human populations could have been explore further, but how much can you keep doing with that?So the second viewing I appreciated the subtle differences in the story line and interactions of the characters. For those who claim there is no plot, there certainly is one if these folks actually watched the movie (which I often doubt).I don't know if there will be yet another movie, but the wrap-up of the characters was nice.I suppose we have gotten used to the CGI generated dinosaurs but one must be in awe of the genius that was able to create something so lifelike and believable, especially the new ones introduced in this installmentIn my previous review, I said this movie may not be my favorite but certainly I enjoyed it better than Jurassic Park III. But actually it has risen in the ranks of Jurassic movies, not sure where but I actually do like it.

title: As Dumb as Jurassic Park 3 but Thinks It's as Smart as the First Movie
text: Jurassic World Dominion is the last film of the Jurassic World Trilogy. Hopefully this will be the last Jurassic Park movie ever, but that's highly doubtful. This franchise is pretty much just like the Transformers movies at this point. They get longer and dumber with each installment, and yet still make tons of money. Now, I haven't liked any of the previous Jurassic World movies. The first one was a dumbed down version of the original film. Fallen Kingdom was a braindead version of the Lost World. FallenKingdom was just awful, the worst Jurassic Park movie yet. I can see people enjoying the first Jurassic World on a mindless Sci-Fi action movie level, but I cannot see hardly any appeal in Fallen Kingdom other than some good effects. I didn't even bother to see that one in the theater.It's sad to see this franchise fall so far, because the original Jurassic Park is one of my all-time favorite movies. The Lost World, in my opinion, is a criminally underrated sequel. Jurassic Park 3 is admittedly a guilty pleasure. It's not a good movie, but I can enjoy it as a fun B-movie. I wanted to enjoy these Jurassic World films on that same level, but they're just so pretentious, and their priorities are really out-of-whack.Despite all of that, I was moderately excited for this move. Part of it was the return of the original cast. Another reason was that this movie was finally doing something I've wanted to see in a Jurassic Park movie since the Lost World, which is dinosaurs interacting with the modern world. Lost World had teased that in its final act, but this movie was seemingly going all the way with it finally. Dominion I will say is probably my favorite of these movies due to the novelty of seeing the original cast back together and interacting with the new cast. The effects are easily the best out of these JW films. Plus, the final climax is fun in a dumb popcorn movie way. With that said, this is still not that good. Objectively speaking, I'd say this is on par with JP 3 though I enjoy the latter more.The reason for that being that JP 3 knew how stupid it was and ran with it. It was short, to the point, and it knew what fans wanted to see and that's dinosaur action. These Jurassic World movies, this one in particular, does not seem to grasp that. It tries to tackle the same themes the first two movies did, "man tampering with nature" and animal rights. However, those themes were already explored and one right in those films. Those storylines are played out. They also focus too much on the human characters that, outside of the original cast, just aren't that interesting or even fun aside from maybe Chris Pratt. The main conflict of Dominion that our characters are trying to combat has really nothing to do with dinosaurs. This film promised us dinosaurs in the modern world, and we get that, sort of. The first fifteen minutes of the film gives that, and there is a fun dinosaur chase in a city in the middle. However, most of the movie, once again, takes place in one isolated location. The film is too long as well. The other JW films were two hours while this is two and a half, and it isn't needed at all.Overall, if you want to see the main cast reunited in a JP movie with some decent dinosaur action then by all mean check this out. If you liked the previous JW films, you should enjoy this okay. Unfortunately, this JW trilogy for me has been a letdown. In a lot of ways this feels like the Star Wars sequel trilogy. The first two installments are lesser versions of the original JP and the Lost World. This movie, while is doing something different for once, is still overly long, relies too heavily on nostalgia, and doesn't quite understand what fans want from Jurassic Park.With that being said, at least these movies don't kill off the original cast in stupid ways and have them never be on screen together. In fact, this film actually fixes a mistake made in Jurassic Park 3 regarding Grant and Sattler's characters, and I appreciate that. Because of that, these JW are as offensive to me as the sequel trilogy is or something like Independence Day Resurgence was. I just feel these JW movies could have been so much better than they were. If the focused on the dinosaur action more and didn't try to act smarter than they really are, then these could have been really fun times a t the movies, and that's all I really want at this point.

title: Was expecting something more.
text: Felt like two movies in one and so many clichs all over the place. Almost nothing made sense as to why and how. It's like every third sequel of a franchise who fells flat on its face.

title: Do I dare say I liked this movie?
text: Not a huge Jurassic Park fan, at least not legacy wise. This was an entertaining film! Maybe I am biased to the dinosaurs but holy, everyone just loves to pump the reviews full of negativity. If you like action movies, go see it!

title: Original ideas are extinct.
text: This film is nothing more than a lazy combination of Jurassic Park and Jurassic World. It seems as though they were relying heavily on having some familiar faces back on the big screen to keep the audience engaged. A few nostalgic moments were not enough to save this lackluster jumble of fire and loud noises.

title: Tried to be gooss but it was tiring watching this film
text: Very weak script writing.. Lacking authenticity. The dialogues were average. Performance average. Never really picked up.. Too much of making it for the fans. Ian malcoms character was ruined for me.overall poor. Too much fluff. Plotlines so disconnected. The actions were to convinient. There were good moments. Its nice to have some nostalgic feelings but it just didnt do it. The score is just wrong. Why cant they just stick it out with John Williams. The ending was dumb.. A threesome! Come on!Lessons: steven spielberg should have just made a come back just as Grant, sadler n malco fid. No scare at all.

title: Mind-numbingly awful
text: When the original came out in 1993, it was a beautiful and awe-inspiring to see cgi dinosaurs interacting with people. The story was somewhat believable too, albeit far-fetched, but based on Michael Crichton's solid novel. Skip almost 30 years later to this utter drivel on display. A truly nonsensical plot that is not even entertaining. Just throws a bunch of actors from the original with the latest "diverse" cast and have dinos running amok in urban settings. It is a movie that only kids under 10 might like and that is for the cgi alone. Hopefully this is the last chapter of this once decent franchise.

title: Fantastic movie dinosaurs love
text: Best Movie just love it .. full entertainment amazing mind blowing. Watch 4 times and gone watch again n again. We want more Jurassic world dinosaurs movies keep making every year . One of my favorite movie series..

title: Awful on so many levels
text: Where do you start . Not e enough adding the original cast can save this. The cgi has gone backwards the story if there is one is so twisted. I liked many of the films bar the second but this is painful beyond the 600 words I have to describe it. The dinosaurs died out and so should this franchise now it has been done to death and I yearn for Ray Harryhausen because at least he had integrity and an honour to his films. Weak characterisation on so many levels and villains that belong in scoovy doo not a grown up film. If you can see it free of charge you will still feel short changed and out of pocket.

title: Ian Malcolm was right, yet again.
text: After Fallen Kingdom my hopes for Dominion were at an all-time low. Can you blame me? The people behind the Jurassic World franchise (that includes you as well mister Spielberg) showcase a continued and epic misunderstanding of Jurassic Park's strengths. After Fallen Kingdom focused on the dumbest plotpoint of Jurassic World, Dominion makes the same mistake and smears the stupidest plotpoint of Fallen Kingdom over an entire film. Oh and it ads locusts... Yes, locusts.The best parts of this film are the moments without dialogue reminding you there's an insulting plot you don't care about. The dinosaurs look fantastic and are the true strengths of this film. Scenes of terror and wonder elevate the flick above detestable. Yet the film does its best to make us forget about the creatures we showed up for! It instead throws in yet another bioengineering company with at its head a character who was called irrelevant in the first film! "Dodgson! We got Dodgson here! See, nobody cares." Well said Nedry and 29 years later, we still don't care.Even if you're a fan of this new lane of Jurassic films, the film shows little respect for its audience. Blue is barely in the film. Don't get me started on Rexy. Hell, even the newly hyped up Apex predator has zero to no relevance to the core of the plot! Say what you will but the Spinosaurus in JP3 was at least essential to the plot! Remember when Jurassic films were about dinosaurs? Well screw you because now they're about locusts and human clones... Enjoy.Jurassic World Dominion is Ian Malcolm's iconic rant personified. It should'nt excist and has forgotten its genius predecessors on who's shoulders it's standing on. An admittedly fantastic ending can't save this massive locust plague sized disappointment. Please, as a fan of this franchise... Stop making these films. You've murdered any and all magic or wonder it had left.

title: Just wow!
text: This movie is so amazing I loved every second off it. I thought the story was really fun and entertaining and it felt like it was like something straight from Michael Chritons novels and it does really feel like it's the conclusion for these characters. The characters where also very good. They executed the original trio very well and I just loved seeing them on the big screen again, the jurassic world characters didn't change to much but you do see more of that family dynamic in this which was nice to see and the new characters where all amazing especially Mamoudou Athie's character and Campbell Scott's Lewis Dodgson was just a terrific villain I really loved him in the story and Campbell Scott's performance. Also the dinosaurs were just so awesome in this they were genuinely scary at time's and they also look really good and their cgi was fenomenal. And the action scenes in this movie are just really great I was in the edge of my seat the whole time. I just had the most amazing experience watching this in the movie theater, it truly feels like the EPIC conclusion to the jurassic era. But it also sets up other stories that can be told now. But for the Jurassic park and world characters this does feel like it's the end of their story and it's a great one at that.

title: Such a disappointment
text: I wasn't a huge fan of the previous Jurassic World movies, but when I saw the trailer I was actually really excited to see the original cast again, and I decided to go see this with an open mind. Yes it was great to see the original cast get back together and there were some laughs here and there, but this definitely fell flat of my expectations. I could see where they were trying to go with how advanced the science and genetics had become, but for a final chapter, such a disappointment. I wouldn't recommend spending the money to see it in theaters, and seeing it in 3D didn't add anything special.

title: Funny & Ironic
text: When you feel no attachment to characters.No angst about man v nature.And it was boring.With a group of talent in Hollywood.that could do better & should do better now is the time subvert expectations. A new story. A new angle.Predictably it ends up where they have wanted to be. Dinosaurs roaming the earth.Funny.Ironic that this group is trying to send a message about nature when their story doesn't make you feel a thing.I miss old Spielberg (yes he didn't direct but his hand was in it )

title: Jurassic concept
text: Totally unnecessary dry movie, weak storyline with weak dinosaurs on Covid booster shots, very predictable, ala, Ghostbusters meet James Bond vibe. Clearly, very high value production set and a huge salary cost budget to feed. On a positive note, glad this movie did well and made all involved some good spare change after a pandemic hiatus. And please, no more sequels. With the real world now on free fall, it's time to focus on preventing our own fossil demise.

title: MUST-WATCH SUMMER BLOCKBUSTER
text: Jurassic World Dominion is fun, energetic, and most importantly compelling. Colin Trevorrow is able to deliver on all the promises made in Fallen Kingdom. The visuals are STUNNING, the action sequences are intense, and theres some really suspenful moments that take you back to the original Jurassic Park. This is without a doubt the best written movie since the original, with great dialogue throughout. Claire, Maise, Owen, and Dr. Grant are all at their best in this movie. Dominion takes a good look a humanity, and poses the question "what would we do with unlimited genetic capabilities?" While it does take a little bit of time to get to the action, once it gets going, the movie is amazing. Definately the best Jurassic movie since 1993, and the definition of a summer blockbuster.

title: Waste of Time
text: I agree it is the worst movie in the series. Not much of a plot. It took too long to develope the story line. It was very predictable. I think the writers could have ohined in the story. As good as Jurasic Park was this was just as bad

title: An insult to the franchise
text: If you want to watch a dinosaur film where the carnivorous dinosaurs are deaf, dumb, blind, and too slow to catch a human then this is the film for you. More than once the characters were in positions where escape was impossible if the dino had simply made a move but instead it either stands and roars while they get away or either moves as fast as molasses.One thing that bothers me is they copied a scene from the original Jurassic World where a character either has an article of clothing or a cable attached to them and a large carnivore manages to grab it and start pulling them toward their jaws. By some miracle all it takes is a human or two to overpower the pulling strength of a 10 ton animal.

title: Please don't make another one.
text: The concept is tired and as far as I'm concerned the magic died after the first movie all those 30 years ago.I remember the excitement when Jurassic Park hit the big screen and what idiots I thought the parents were for taking their little kids. Oh the trauma.Now I'm experiencing adult trauma, not from marauding Dinos but from all the bad acting. I don't think anybody did a good job in this save Jeff and there certainly were no Oscar performances in this one. Bad acting of the day goes to Laura Dern. I like her but sorry Laura.I think I'm now ready for some personified Pixar dinos with a few laughs thrown in for good measure.I can't believe I wasted more than two hours of my life on this crap. I think I'm done with action movies for awhile. Let's get some popcorn and a good mystery.

title: This is not a Jurassic Park movie
text: The whole feeling you have with the jurassic park franchise is lacking. Even the iconic jurassic park sound/music is hardly there.Yes, the actors were there, but that's about it. Furthermore, the locust, really?! That's not a dinosaurus.Even the special effecten were bad. It was so obvoius it was in front of a green screen.Really, what happemed, it was all to much rushed, bad story, not even about dinosaurs, bad special effects. And in the beginning I thought it was a James Bond movie.What a shame, the worst movie from the Franchise... this can't be the last one... you can't end like this....

title: The best out of all JW movies!
text: There are obviously some errors in the script (story), I don't doubt that, but we have a lot going on with the dinosaurs and that's what's the most important thing at the end of the day. The fact that the old characters came back isn't all that innovative, but it's a good concoction in the trilogy. The movie does keep you gripped in certain scenes, so it's definitely a good movie.It might be a bit too predictable at times, but is that really all that important? I think this is a very very good addition to the trilogy that raises the bar! I can therefore recommend it for all dinosaur fans out there.

title: Wait for the bargain bucket
text: As predictable as an episode of undercover boss.Far to long, and quite frankly anyone involved should hang there head in shame and publicity apologise.

title: Surprisingly, hardly any dinosaurs?
text: Jurassic World: Dominion (2022) follows humanity as it lives and fights alongside the dinosaurs, however a new and unexpected threat is at large. This film really felt as if it didn't need to exist, and honestly it's hard to remember much that happened even though I only watched it a few days ago!The visuals and CGI were by far the best part of the film. The CG was as good as it needed to be and was very clean. I thought the cinematography was mainly dull, but there were a few great shots scattered about, with some decent colour palettes.The acting was decent, but no performance stood out. Unfortunately, Isabella Sermon was underwhelming as Maisie, and her acting was fairly poor to the point where it was hard to have sympathy for her character. Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howards's characters were bland and the dialogue was lacklustre too. It was nice to see the original trilogy back, but it felt so forced and completely unnecessary to the plot.The score was alright, but nowhere near as iconic as the original Jurassic Park scores. It worked well in the scenes it was used for, but wasn't memorable in any way. Also, the sound design was pretty effective! It helped to create tension and intrigue.Lastly, my main issue comes with the plot and pacing. The plot itself surprisingly isn't centred around dinosaurs, and the dinos are somewhat of a subplot which was incredibly disappointing. The plot didn't make much sense, and there were supposed to be some shocking reveals, but they didn't pack a punch and I was just bored by them. The movie was paced very messily too, with no real structure.

title: nothing interesting here
text: What a pile of crop! I think this was the very first movie that made me almost fell asleep. The plot is a joke like it was written by 10 - year - olds yet somehow they thought if they crammed all the faces of the different movies together, it would make a good movie. Well they were mistaken. Badly. Typical milk cow Hollywood movie, do yourselves a favour and don't pay for this. Wait until it comes out! No, even then, don't watch it!

title: Terrible
text:
The movie had to much potential but did not deliver
It was great to see the old characters back but the storyline was not it and dragged on for an unnecessary amount of time.Also absolutely devastating that the original Jurassic park score was not played??

title: Jurassic Park #6!
text: This was such a great way to end the 6 movie epic of Jurassic Park. So many cool dinosaurs and a pretty good story that ties it all together. Lots of emotional moments for those who have followed the series.

title: Turned it off.
text: This was terrible. Boring. I had to turn it off. Felt like a daytime made for tv movie. And what was with all the Apple references? I mean the evil CEO a dead look alike for Tim Cook?! All the way down to the white hair and glasses. Did they think "naw, this won't be obvious or anything. The underground super secure and super secretive research. The ultra high tech, zen garden elite campus. Free coffee bar and everything. Screenwriters visited Cupertino and said "yep we'll just model this exactly." Did this movie really need more dino chases and Chris Pratt doing the hand thing? It was kind of cool seeing the original cast but the plot sucked. Another money grab and it shows.

title: Loved it!!
text: Basically Mission Impossible with dinosaurs, and so much heart thanks to the reappearance of favorite actors/characters! Epic storytelling, creative portrayal of a modern world with dinosaurs, and cool visuals. Thoroughly enjoyable!

title: First, lower your expectations
text: Then lower them some more.By the time you hit rock bottom in expectations, this movie will surprise you in how much lower it can go, this was a crap version of the original Jurassic Park, with too many cast members, hairline thin script, and heavy leaning on the nostalgia machine (which just like McD's icecream machine, was broken).The plot was nearly identical to the only good Jurassic Park movie (the original one), which is a masterpiece, a magnum opus, Even Lost World and JP3 look good in comparison to this dumpster fire.There is nothing else to be said other than, avoid it, you have been warned.

title: This movie Suckssss
text:
Imagine picking one classic movies of all time and turn him into a stupid fast furious but way worse.The dialogues are horrendous,they bring the old characters(literally the only good thing in the movie) and just throw they away in a horrendous adventure about locust??
The cgi is amazing, but some animatronics look too robotic it's strange.Overall:This movie is worst than the meteorite that kill the dinosaurs(3/10)

title: Worst movie I've seen in years
text: Worst movie I've seen in years. Went to see it with friends and we ended up texting each other throughout the whole film. Literally dumbest story ever, the characters were immortal because of the plot armor. I wanted to just leave about 7 times during the movie. I was so happy when it finally came to and end.

title: JURASSIC FOREVER
text: Now I have seen the final chapter of the Jurassic saga and I have just a three letter word to say ~ WOW... just WOW. Totally gonna re-watch this one movie at least 8 more times like I did with the previous two movies. This is absolutely no doubt the best movie of all time and I'm totally giving this a full ten star rating.

title: I want my money back!
text: Once I saw this movie was available to purchase, I immediately jumped on it. I expected for creatures to be all over the world and for it to be MUCH BETTER! Alas, this bloody movie SUCKED-possibly even more than the last one! Universal Studios, you just got to do better for yourselves; otherwise, you will be at WBD-level or worse! These Jurassic World movies could've been so much better! To the directors and other members of the films' teams of "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom" and "Jurassic World Dominion," do better! Do so much better!

title: Meh
text: Wasted money on Gold Class tickets to see this at the cinema.Do yourself a favour and just wait for it to come out on Digital or a streaming service.

title: Man on horseback can lasso big dinos?!
text: Seriously! I mean I don't expect realism from these movies but some of these scenes take the micky. I love the franchise but this is the worst to date. Poor considering they brought back the original cast too. Sadly even nostalgia cannot save this long drawn out snooze fest. Terrible script, not great acting. Even worse storyline! People saying this is the best are clearly just major fans of the actors. I like Chris Pratt, Sam Neil etc but bless em they just cannot salvage this movie with what they were given to work with. Personally I would have stopped at the first jurassic world. The 5 stars is purely for the dinosaur effects. Oh and where was the jurassic Park anthem we all know and love?!

title: What a waste of time...
text: They screwed up in this last one... Sometimes i don't know if i was watching The Expendables or, 007 or Tomb Rider, for shure wasn't something related with Jurassic Park/World.120m plus, hard to watch all at once, some CGI was really weak, the cast is weak and you can see they first bet on diversity instead on good actors.All predictable, no real storyline that links to anything really, sometimes (very often) the movie was real boring, the kind of that you wish for a break to do something else!!!It's a real shame that this is probably the last of all movies from Jurassic franchise, they could and SHOULD do better.

title: Gave everything that was needed
text: Following the poor directions the last movie took, this one is definitely an improvement. Obviously, the story has some faults, but this movie has a lot of what people are coming to see, dinosaurs. The re-introduction of the legacy characters was also done greatly. If you like dinosaurs and action, go see this movie and enjoy it. Don't get carried away in the critical reviews because at the end of the day, it's just a movie about 65 million year old extinct animals.

title: Weak
text: Weak story, jokes and acting. The characters get in a jam and another character miraculously appears out of nowhere to save the day. The first part of the trilogy (2015) is still the best.

title: Jurassic World: Dominion - Spoiler free review.
text: Most of us who grew up with the original JP were captivated by the film in many different ways. Some people loved the grandeur of such creatures, some loved the thrill of a summer blockbuster done right and the rest loved both those aspects.That movie has been loved by us for decades now, so I'm not going to compare the latest installment to it. That's unfair given the nature of the present day audience, who are kids just like we were but with way more pretentious ideologies and social media influenced interests.(I myself avoided such a fate, given that social media in general started shaping the younger generation right after I took on more adult responsibilities in life)Now, let's get into it.Jurassic World: Dominion is by no means a bad movie.Given what we went through in the last one(which isn't the directors fault, he did his job right), you would think that this doesn't deserve the hate it's getting.However, the strangest thing about this movie is that whatever makes it worth watching is also the stuff that quickly ruins it.If you're going to make a dinosaur movie, then make a dinosaur movie.Instead what we get is an erratic attempt at merging this concept with those from the fast and furious/mission impossible movies and trying to force the same old pandering we've seen one too many times.And like I mentioned, that's pretty much what makes this entertaining enough to sit through but also leaves you dissatisfied at the end of it.We're here to watch Jurassic World, not the Avengers.I will say that the film starts off very strong, and does make me care about the little girl from the last movie. Her storyline was surprisingly inspiring, and could have paved the way for a much better plot overall.Past the halfway mark however, it quickly becomes a mess of rushed plot lines all trying to close off the story as a whole and you are left with a feeling of emptiness when the credits roll.Another glaring issue was that whatever the trailer was advertising as the plot, is almost non existent in this movie. Even the scene of the T-rex "attacking" a movie theatre is simply for the online marketing.There is hardly any real threat faced by the human race, which does make sense to be honest but it's not in keeping with what the last movie did right by setting up.I was ready to hate this movie just for its diversion from the source material and the original trilogy. I instead dislike it for trying too hard to match up to said material, but without any sense of purpose or care.The lines are cheesy, the acting is semi decent but not inspired, the dinosaurs are almost forgotten in a movie called Jurassic World that took two movies to setup, but are also pushed into every minute of screen-time.It feels like a poorly constructed ride with characters that are written even worse and have the most clich motivations.All in all, I would suggest watching this movie at-least once on a big screen with a nice bag of popcorn to go with it. It will not be what you want, but is a good enough experience that you will not want to leave halfway.The old cast appearing in the film didn't seem forced in my book, just a huge coincidence that they would all be together as the film went on.There is no real way that they should meet(old and new cast), but they do!That's just bad editing, which there seems to be a lot of during it's 2 hour 30 minute runtime. There was no reason for it to be this long, but it is.I rate it 5/10.If they ever make a new series of movies, I would like them to be their own thing, and an extension of the original trilogy as opposed to this weird attempt at showcasing the dangers of genetic power.

title: GARBAGE
text: This was one of the WORST movies I've ever seen; the original Jurassic park was the second movie I ever saw in theaters and it's what made me fall in love with film; it's awful to see this is what it's gotten to now.STOP letting Colin Trevorrow direct; HE SUCKS so bad! & stop focusing on graphics and pay more attention to STORY!The ONLY good thing & I do me ONLY good thing about this movie was the dilophosaurus death scene. Otherwise, complete GARBAGE!

title: Terrible plot and direction
text: I'm so disappointed with how the plot was. And what's up with the bad acting. Those actor are good usually.I was lost and confused with the storyline and with how it was trying to engage the viewer.The jokes were so cheesy.It reminded me of the stupidity of the last fast and furious movie.

title: Action and nostalgia but in essence soulless.
text: The movie has many nice shots and good cgi. Lots of action, sadly the action is rather dull and unoriginal, no scare potentiale. A good cast, but very weak and mangleded story.In essence I felt that it was mostly soulless.

title: one big pile of dinosaur droppings
text: Well, where should I start? How could the magic of the original jurassic park movie turn into something as pointless and endless as this film? How could intelligent people spend so much money, get competent actors involved, and end up with such a gloomy, noisy, incomprehensible mess? First, too many characters and no character development. You wish the dinosaurs would just eat these people and get it over with. Here, have some ketchup. Next, too many dinosaurs attacking way too often. I mean, everybody likes candy, but eat too much and it makes you sick. There needs to be a balance between character development and action in a film, and this film is so off balance it makes you dizzy. You can get up and make a sandwich in the middle of this, and not even care that you're missing anything. Yes, the dinosaurs look great. But this movie is no fun. There is just no fun in watching this. I'd rather see ray harryhausen's animation with good acting and a great story, like the beast from 20,000 fathoms. Those films had class. This movie is dark, gloomy, noisy, full of mannequin actors trying relentlessly hard to look tough and cool, and one dinosaur attack on a loop, repeated endlessly. My brother and I are watching this right now, and he just yawned. Yup, you got it. That's the right reaction. Oh well. At least we have the other jurrassic park movies to watch. We won't be watching this one again.

title: Boring and forced cliche monster movie.
text: Trash, whole movie is just bad. They should of stopped making these movies after the Jurassic park 2, and even that wasn't as good as the first. Every one they've released since gets worse and worse, until now we are at the point of it just being another low effort cheesy monster movie with too much CGI. The dialog is just terrible, everything seems forced. The acting isn't too bad, also not great, but cant blame the actors for a bad script, they done what they could with it I guess. I would probably put this above the first Jurassic World maybe, it close but this is probably a hair better. Saying that, it really just not good, forced is best way I can describe this movie, and boring, oh god is it boring. When I'm getting bored during climax action scenes, something is wrong.Jurassic Park 1, is one of my favorite movies of all time, I really hate that the series went this way.

title: Just so out of sequence
text: This movie really was all nostalgia based. Bringing back the heroes from the original trilogy to ultimately tarnish their reputation a bit with this movie. I'm not going to give a long description I'm just going to keep it brief and simple. No dialogue, awful acting and an even worse storyline. Some decent CGI scenes with dinosaurs we haven't seen before. But ultimately not a very good production.

title: It was really a Fun and enjoyable movie
text: I seriously don't understand why the critics and reviews are just so bad about the movie for me this movie was a great one ,it had action, adventure,suspense and left me emotional at the end because it was the end of a really great series. I watched the movie last night and we all enjoyed it it was not a boring one, even my mom who don't have any interest in Hollywood movies enjoyed it .i recommend you to go and watch it and i will never ever suggest you to focus more on review or critics if you like watching these kind of movies and do like the series, just go and watch it.

title: Wait for the digital release.
text: This movie is so bad that you'll still be disappointed even if you minimize your expectation to the lowest. Don't waste your money on theater. If you're a die-hard fan of Jurassic World, wait for the digital release.

title: They could not made it much worse if they tried!
text: This was utter garbarrrrrge!Bad plot, bad writing all over, poor preformances even from leads.. (no wonder with that plot..)Effects is a MAJOR downgrade from previous films.Just bad!Not even worth the time....

title: Yawnsome Climate Change Lecture
text:
I almost wanted to go back and watch the first movie to remind myself what made this franchise so special, after enduring 2.5 hours of this. Around the third/fourth act admittedly there are one or two nice dino-fights, but overall:>> Constant mentions of climate change and 'working together'
>> Great diverse cast, but they forgot to write a good plot in the meantime
>> 'In house Philosopher'?!?! Jeff Goldblum's ridiculous job title
>> Saccharin visual and musical 'call backs' to the first movie throughout
>> Apple Boss lookalike as BioSyn's CEO - oooo bad corrupt old men, that's a new conceitI would like escapism when I take the trouble to go to the cinema (a not too often event these days), not to be lectured to or have 'subtle' political messages woven into the story.Come on movie makers, remember escapism?

title: Fallen Kingdom
text: Jurassic World Dominion is the worst movie in the franchise that started from Jurassic Park in 1993. Film fails to deliver on Direction and Screenplay. I had good expectations from this legacy franchise especially Jurassic World 1 was so much entertaining. Film focuses more on humans and locusts than Dinosaurs. There is little continuity in the film, script is clueless. First 45 minutes are terribly wrong with no tense moments. Iconic Jurassic music theme plays only once in the entire movie when the legacy character makes entry in the film. The great T-Rex has very little screen time.Having said, Jurassic models and special effects are good and it feels real. Acting is good. Return of main characters from the original film is soothing. I wish they had done justice to the dinasours and audience by not writing so poor script. I give film 5 stars for failing the expectations from great Jurassic Kingdom.

title: As a huge fan of the franchise, I thought this was a very good ending.
text: I loved it. The film is exactly what you want. I know in this day and age a film has to be 'absolutely perfect', but they don't have to. I know a lot of people might not want to hear this, but you 'can still enjoy a film' . Admittedly the second in the franchise wasn't great, but this I enjoyed. I loved it. The film is exactly what you want. I know in this day and age a film has to be 'absolutely perfect', but they don't have to. I know a lot of people might not want to hear this, but you 'can still enjoy a film' . Admittedly the second in the franchise wasn't great, but this I enjoyed......

title: Just wonky direction.
text: As a film this final installment in the 'Jurassic Park' franchise suffers from many ailments but as a conclusion to a fan favourite it manages to deliver a small sliver of fun and fulfilment.The narrative is oddly and clunkingly constructed, the direction is staggeringly flat and undramatic, the cast is left with hardly any meat on the bones of their characters, the editing is ferociously vicious whilst the films score is bland and unmemorable. Costumes and sets are drab thought the special effects and makeup artists have done reasonable work. Fair but not exceptional.The first half of the narrative is plainly bad and contrived nonsense and whilst this interminable imbecility continues to the end the second half of the film does build some fun and adventure as it settles into the familiar structure of stranded humans suffering dinosaur attentions in a disintegrating dinosaur facility whilst trying to save a token item.As a fan film the re-emergence of the original cast as the principle players is welcome as a replacement to the wafer thin newer cast and the jarringly constructed conceit of another dinosaurs park going belly up allows for familiar survival routines.This can not obscure thought the sad situation that the whole thing is a mess: very small ideas blown beyond any proportions to a protracted runtime and un-involving action scenarios.Overall I had the almost constant sense that 'Jurassic World Dominion ' has been savaged in post production editing to bring a sprawling tale down to a 2 and a half hour runtime. This has unfortunately increased the sense of muddled structure in the narrative and in individual scenes.The effects are of inconsistent quality: some highly effective and some much less so. The sound design and cinematography are solidly unremarkable however some audio design for the dinosaurs are powerful.There is no attempt at believable violence or kinetic action: it is very bloodless and off camera in its kills and the action is frankly awfully developed.There is however a clear attempt to build on the human versus technological exploitation of life but it's muddled and unconvincing for me in how these themes are implemented in this story.I rate a 3/10 as a feature film but 4/10 as a franchise instalment and give a compound score of 3.5/10.I recommend only to confirmed fans due to the resurgence of the more interesting and engaging original cast and actors. I do not consider this film to be very good but it is not a complete failure at drawing the Jurassic Park world into broader sci-fi tropes whilst rounding off the tale of the current characters.If this franchise is to return then the young adulthood of Maisie Lockwood a few years hence from the current continuity looks likely to be the viable starting point.

title: Way to make a dino movie about locusts
text: I don't know what happened here. The last two installments, which were not flawless, were all in good fun. They had a lot of dinos, a plot, and a charming cast.This strayed from the path. Trying to please the fans, they brought back a lot of JP cast. Terrible move, because most of them couldn't act their way out of a cardboard box.The plot was mostly about some locust plague, and I could not care less. This was however the first 4DX movie I saw in the theater and if you have to go see this film, see it like that. It's the future of cinema if you don't have a back problem.

title: A Jumbled Mess of a Plot Ruins Actor Reunion
text: I really wanted to like JW Dominion because all of the franchise actors are finally on film together for the first time. And they did the best they could with what they were given to act. But the poor screenplay to this movie absolutely ruins the experience and left me hugely disappointed.I am not going to provide any spoilers-frankly there is nothing to spoil. Simply said this movie drifts miles from the original premise of Jurassic Park and the wonder of dinosaurs and turns into a jumbled mess of failed plotting and logic. As much as l liked some of the lines between Jeff Goldblum and Chris Pratt, there is absolutely no reason to see this movie-either in theaters or even at home. Epic fail!

title: excellent movie
text:
I think it's the best sequel so far because it sums up and combines all the adventures of this series so well.The movie is both nostalgic and modern.The story is a little simple, but it is conveyed well, so you don't get bored while watching it.Since it is a fictional movie, I didn't look at it scientifically much, I just think it's a good movie to have fun, if you're someone who gets hung up on small details, you might be annoyed But overall it's a nice and funny movie at the same time nostalgic so I liked it.10/10
Because there is a lot of effort and I see people who give 5 out of 10 and I think it's unfair because it's definitely not a terrible movie.

title: Wow don't they know Woke catchphrases are done?
text: Yup. Stupid movie. They are hiring writers from CNN and (if you are from Canada) CBC. Woke experts. And just plain useless. Don't pay to see this, please download it and then delete it immediately. These people live in their own imaginary world, they think people actually like what they write. Agreed, let Hollywood die. Now.

title: Wish I could give zero stars...
text: What happened and who approved this film? I STRUGGLED through it. I'm a huge fan of a JP movies, but this one was honestly one of the worst movies I have ever seen in my life. The acting was so off, I'm not sure what was going on with the directing. We're talking about good actors, and they were in and out of character horribly the entire time. And maybe a plot line could have been decided, preferably about dinosaurs and not about science lab crop eating bugs. So, so, so disappointed with this film. I cried out of excitement when I watched the trailer during the Super Bowl. I wanted to cry watching the film because it was so painful to sit through.

title: Jurassic World Dominion - Dark Fate
text: Acting, Directing & Casting - Acting felt awkward and uninspired and the long cuts before changing camera angles didn't help. Legacy actors seems more like superstars doing cameos (forever) and unable to convincingly resurrect their original character's essence, humility and synergy. The collaboration of the various legacy actors of the old and new did not seem to gel well. Main 'villain' too styled to Tim Cook of Apple look, poorly casted, background poorly established and more of a villain idiot than villain evil genius to be reckoned with. New lead lady characters too chic like a James Bond fashionistas that can do it all. The lack of focused established leads and generic usage of many legacy characters made me feel lost in direction.Cinematography & Editing - Bland framing and long cuts make it like a made for TV production with lazy camera movements and composition. 2:1 aspect ratio okay to capture size of dinosaurs, but framing too zoomed in on actors giving a lack of feel of their environment and mostly see the actors. Also, actors look like giants, should have zoomed out a little to consider for big screen, not a TV. That height zoom more useful in anamorphic aspect ratio where the environment is covered on the left and right spaces.Dinosaurs & CGI - Mostly good CGI and details, but some looked too cartoony and behaved too human like ala Disney and such. While some had good predatory animation and somewhat natural animal movements and mannerism, some had awkward and stiff control of their bodies as if a human had possessed the dinosaurs and figuring out how to use its limbs. The interactions of the alpha dinosaurs were awkwardly lost and poorly choreographed. The film trailers with outdoor cinemas and "documentary" wildlife feature are purely promotional (i.e. Misleading)Story - The redux on Blue and Maisie as a material part of "purpose" and their revelations and throwbacks are uninspiring. The "evil corp" doing woke detriment to the world is also so bland. Nothing intelligent. The "oooo" something behind the scenes is going on that is slowly unraveled to the audience is so poorly filmed and revealed that it was almost like little children playing make believe. Everything seems poorly established and shot (again with lazy cinematography, cuts/editing, dull framing and timing like a daytime drama). There was an essence of espionage and its relevant rush action, but I felt it out of place and too "copy and paste".Conclusion - This film lacks direction, ideation and inspiration, full of stale recycled formulae poorly executed. To the die hard fans, just watch it to scratch that dodgy itch, see some eye candy and be able to say you did it, but expect to be disappointed to a point of disgust. Did you watch Terminator Dark Fate? Its the same WTH vibe.

title: RIP cinema
text: The writers made young actors say soulless smart alec lines, so we don't grow attached to them, and they made experienced actors (Neill, Dern, Goldblum) say climate change propaganda so we become disillusioned with them.Dinosaurs attack non stop, for no reason, so you lose the shock. They attack from the start of the film for 30 minutes straight - this says nothing to the viewer except "become desensitised to gore or walk out".Everyline is a cliche. Every actors pose is cliche. Every camera angle is cliche. Every cut is cliche.

title: They're all wrong
text:
The bad faith critics and the surly churlish "fans" are all completely wrong. They're all acting out of spite or cinematic illiteracy or both. Or maybe they think it's cool being cynical...but cynicism requires evidence in order to be effective, and the vast majority of reviews rating this film very low present no evidence other than emotional puerile dummy spits: "not what I expected", "my least favourite in the franchise"...blah blah!No movie exists to meet preconceptions and expectations: expectations based on what? What a dishonest way to approach movies or indeed any form of art. See the jolly thing. Pay attention. Then by all means dislike it if you will but give reasons based on the movie's own terms not your prejudices.J W Dominion is a delight. It's an ode to the original and to the first sequel, a homage, a respectful love song. The number of scenes that are set up to echo now classic scenes in those two films are plentiful, especially in the third act, and they are done expertly, sensitively, with huge attention to camera work and the cinematic language of the original films. And yet they feel fresh. They're hugely enjoyable and we watch them with a knowing smile and recognition.I doubt everyone involved thought they were making an original. But they have made an authentic and not cynical attempt to tie together the threads of the franchise:
1. Having the oldies meet the newbies and working together is a superb statement on generational cooperation for the good of all; it's not a cynical money grabbing thing, but casting that works to meet the film's themes. Not that a bit of nostalgia is necessarily a bad thing, anyway.2. John Hammond's quest for redemption actually comes about with BD Wong's character (Henry) finally using genetic technology for good: the locusts are destroyed and there's the promise of using such tech to cure human diseases; the surviving animals are finally left to their own devices in a protected "park".3. T Rex rules in the end, as we had hoped. And it's the bad guys who meet their just desserts here. The dilophosaurus scene in the hyper loop is brilliant. Dodgson had it coming since the first movie! Yes! I've still not forgiven Mr Spielberg for killing Eddie in the second film.4. The movie is also a master class in the current obsession with DEI...Even in the first movie, Samuel Jackson and BD Wing had crucial roles but their "diversity" was not shoved in our faces. They were people with the requisite skills doing a job. Their diversity was NOT the issue. Same here: huge amount of sex, race, age etc diversity, and none of it is done for its own sake.I could go on but enough. Will I watch the film again? You bet! Far far more rewatchable than the previous two in this part of the franchise.Well done, Mr Trevorrow and all cast and crew. This one is gonna become a cult classic in time. Just loved it.

title: Wow. What a giant, bad, bad pile of dinosaur crap.
text: Bottom line: AVOID THIS MOVIE.Chris, Bryce, Jeff, Laura, and Sam...what were you thinking? You can't undo it once it's on film!Unless it's as the latest installment on Mystery Science Theater 3000, even SyFy would be embarrassed to show this, and that's a low low. No story, no directing, barely even a discernible, predictably-preachy agenda, an obvious regurgitation of the same story, and certainly nothing that can pass as acting.Even the CGI is getting tiresome. Probably could've enjoyed it a little if I'd slept through it. What a waste. We can only hope this is finally the end of the Jurassic Park franchise. Please!

title: Absurdly over the top action sequences
text: A lot of money went into this movie, and it shows... too much. Rather than allowing you to form an emotional connection with any character (or dinosaur), it's never-ending action sequences and predictable characters and interactions. It honestly felt more like Fast and the Furious or Mission Impossible than Jurassic Park or Jurassic World. I would even suggest that the dinosaurs added very little to the movie. It would have been a better movie without them.My 7-year old daughter, who loved Jurassic Park, Lost World, and Jurassic World, along with the Jurassic World Camp Cretaceous TV show, asked us halfway through the movie if we could leave, which she has never done before, and leave we did.

title: I wish I could give it more than 10
text: If your a true fan you would have enjoyed this, if not then move along. Action packed all the way through, I know it's not real but it did get me on the edge of my seat a few times. Loads of shout outs to the original films. Loved all the cast together. For the reviews saying there was no storyline I suggest you watch it again. It was a roarsome cornfest. We can't take these films to seriously if you did then shame on you go watch David Attenborough instead. Loved rexys special appearance can't have a Jurrasic Park/world without rexy. If you don't like it go buy yourself a personality or just simply don't watch it.

title: Probably the worst sequel
text: I'm sorry, but this movie was bad. Worse than the other sequels even. In fact, it was so bad I grew in appreciation for the other sequels which are by comparison quite competent. The set up for the movie is a great one, dinosaurs living in our world... unfortunately about 10 minutes into the movie it takes a sharp right turn and becomes a story about locusts instead. The dinosaurs in our world stuff gets pushed aside, and once our heroes board a plane to the Biosyn headquarters we're basically on yet another metaphorical island. The dinosaur action is good, but basically plot irrelevant and most scenes are too short. The final fight is totally unnecessary and in a way quite mean-spirited. The pacing is brisk and choppy, jumping to and fro between two separate stories. Some of the editing in action sequences is particularly obnoxious. The musical choices are also intermittently irritating, especially when the JP theme gets played loudly over dialogue for no reason other than nostalgia. The acting is good, but that only serves to make this movie more painful to watch, as the performances of legacy actors are squandered on this wasted potential. Finally the ending of this movie comes out of nowhere and is completely disconnected from the rest of the film. This makes Godzilla: King of the Monsters look decent.

title: A totally lifeless ending to a classic
text: This is a lifeless and boring final sequel to one of the most popular franchises in the history of Hollywood, the actors and the cgi are not to bad, but they totally wasted by a boring lifeless and idiotic script, poor dialogue and dull action sequences, there's not one single good thing about this one, I agree with critics and audiences, the series has ran its course and its a mess, and a big disappointment in every single wayI gave the film a D.

title: Impressive
text: Honestly impressed how they were able to make such a terrible movie. Terrible acting, terrible plot, too much set up, and not enough dinosaurs. The first two Jurassic worlds weren't great but they felt like the originals. Worlds can't even explain how awful this was. Boring and just too long. Also, many political undertones, I want to forget this movie, unfortunately I can't.

title: An excellent conclusion
text: One of the best films I've watched in recent memory. Absolutely fantastic! Loved it. The Dino and JP fan inside me is so happy right now! End of an era!Nice call backs and Easter eggs, legacy characters didn't feel forced, nice plot that runs throughout that had some actual weight, couple of nice side plots. A very smart FK retcon. Excellent.

title: Complete Disappointment
text: Jurassic Series is all about Dinosaur and in this part there is complete distraction by diverting all attention to some kinda Insects.Very Poor Story & very disappointing climax..All the excitement went in vain.No use of watching in 3D. Complete Wastage of Time and Money.If CX Score matters anyways then here CX Score will be less than 0...

title: Thanks for destroying the nostalgia
text: Stupid script. No logic in most scenes. Bad acting. Unnecessary political correctness in casting and plot.It was really odd watching the (biggest dinosaur ever) chasing them while they are hiding behind a car but actually they are at the front of his eyes, yet it act like it didn't see them.Repeated scene of two dinosaurs from different species attacking a bigger one together. That happens only in WWE.This is the worst one ever in the series.Thanks for destroying the nostalgia we all have since 1993.Two stars only for the sake of the favorite old cast. Who lost a lot by appearing in this movie.

title: Incoherent
text: A somewhat incoherent script designed solely to gather together (painfully slowly) everyone who has ever been in a Jurassic movie for a action scene selfie. Would no doubt have included Richard Attenborough if they could! A highly disappointing view.

title: It's Fun!
text: It's a movie about dinosaurs and people crazy enough to do things that make no sense and things that are ultimately stupid...but it's FUN! Welcome to life!Seriously had a great time just watching a popcorn flick without an expectation of Citizen Kane!Love Jurassic Park and Jurassic World movies! It was great in IMAX as well. If you go in with that enjoyment, you'll be happy and have fun.

text: First movie I've ever walked out on halfway... horrible story, beyond awful cinematography. Doubt there will be another!!! Blah.... No one should ever hire Colin Trevorrow ever again!! Period...

title: Boring
text: One of the most boring and ridiculous movies I've seen in a while. Impossible to care about any of the characters. Some lengthy scenes absolutely unnecessary. Visuals and sound are messy and annoying to say the least.

title: A strong conclusion to the Jurassic Park / World-Series
text: Last night I went to see "Jurassic World 3 - A New Age" at the cinema. Here's my personal impression of the movie.Briefly to the starting position of the story (minimal spoilers)The plot begins three years after the events of Jurassic World 2. Dinos have conquered the black market and have spread around the world in this way. This has turned life around the world upside down and both humans and animals must now live in coexistence with the new "neighbor", whether they like it or not. Of course, this again calls both poachers, hunters and conservationists on the plan, but of course also corporations who want to make their profit from it or who take advantage of the dinos to make medical advances with the help of their DNA. But as always, there is of course more to a large corporation than meets the eye. This then also calls Dr. Ellie Sattler on the scene, who analyzes a new life-threatening plague: gigantic locusts, which were obviously created artificially and are spreading further and further and eating up all the food. She enlists the help of Dr. Alan Grant and Ian Malcolm to uncover a mystery. Meanwhile, Owen Grady, Claire Dearing along with Maisie Lockwood live in a deserted area in a forest cabin to hide and protect Maisie because she is still wanted. Some dangerous people are after her. So much for the beginning and the starting point of the movie. (End of spoilers)The story is of course both trashy and rather flat, the characters remain quite pale, but that's what the series is known for. So I don't blame the film for that at all. I watch such movies because they are supposed to entertain and not because of their profundity, complexity or heaviness.Actors / CharactersOwen Grady (Chris Pratt) is as likable as ever. I like his character and I like his manner. Pratt plays his role solidly as always. Pratt may be an actor who mostly plays himself and he's not as changeable now as a Leonardo DiCaprio, but he doesn't have to be. We also loved Arnie or Willis not because of their acting talent, but because of their style and their very own character. It's the same with Tom Cruise or Dwayne Johnson. And so it is with Chris Pratt. Owen Grady may be a flat and one-dimensional character, but such characters are also allowed (even must exist) in such trashy movies. Grady is simply the savior of the need, the helper who is always there when he is needed most.Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard) is also as likable as ever. She is the animal/dinosaur protector par excellence and wants to prevent injustice to them at all costs. I buy this one. Otherwise, her character remains pale and superficial as well.Then there is Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon), the artificially created "clone" of Charlotte Lockwood. She is quite possibly the most complex character in the film and you learn more and more about her and her creation as the plot progresses. This is interesting and exciting and adds to my interest in the plot. The fact that there are then dangerous people after her raises even more questions than it provides answers. Isabelle Sermon plays this role wonderfully believably and I really like this character. If more films are made at some point, I think she should take the lead role.Dr. Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) is still the old and level-headed woman who questions many things and who takes a central role in the plot. Laura Dern still plays her character confidently and believably.Dr. Alan Grant (Sam Neill) assists Dr. Sattler in her investigation and is still the stubborn maverick. He and Sattler have great chemistry and you can tell they got along well on set as well. Sam Neill also still plays his character very believably and I always enjoy seeing him as an actor.Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) is of course also back in the cast and is once again allowed to utter wonderfully wacky, profound and philosophical phrases. He's still a great character with his wacky manner and charisma. I like him. And his scenes are always great and contrast with the serious situation.Seeing all three of the old characters together again, and even as leads, is really pure nostalgia and was also sensibly integrated into the plot.The antagonists are again just pull-off characters, but that's only half bad, because they serve their purpose to advance the plot and give the protagonists a task.Then there's a new addition: Kayla Watts (DeWanda Wise). She is a pilot and smuggler/mercenary. Her character is quite pale, but also sympathetic. She's a bit like the female Han Solo in Jurassic World.Also nice to have Omar Sy alias Barry Sembne back, who now works for the CIA.Dinos / CGI Animations / Action ScenesDinos are common in this finale and and appear in a wide variety of species.The CGI animations are very well done in my eyes and the dinos mostly look very believable and move really great. The integration into the moving image is very well done, so that only rarely the feeling of a "foreign body" arises.Really great class is the much higher creepiness and thrill factor in this finale of the trilogy. In the second half of the film, the characters come up against dangerous and deadly dinosaurs time and again and have to hide from them, sneak past them, run away or face them. This makes for an enormous amount of thrills and suspense.The first half of the film, on the other hand, is more dialogue-heavy, serving more to build the plot and show the new world. But to lighten things up, there are one or two fast-paced action scenes here as well. There is also a motorcycle chase with raptors through a city. I especially liked that one because it was so well edited, staged and filmed, and it's also just exciting and entertaining.I also love how the new world where humans and dinos coexist was depicted and staged. Playing children being harassed by Compsognathus dinosaurs, sauropods interfering with agriculture or other dinos showing up everywhere or even attacking and eating humans at times. I really liked this depiction of the new coexistence.Camera / Scenery / EditingAs briefly mentioned, I really like the camera work and there are a lot of great shots and takes. There isn't constant shaky cam, but the scenes were captured well and you always keep a good view of what is happening. Creepy moments were also captured great. I also liked the editing. Not too many hard and fast cuts, but often quite long cuts at a stretch.MusicAs always, the music consists of both old and new pieces. However, I was so captivated by the film that I didn't notice the music that much. I would therefore not classify it as particularly positive or negative at the moment after my first viewing.ConclusionJurassic World - A New Age is in my eyes a successful finale, which offers a lot of variety. The big appearance of the old guard from JP1 is a feast for nostalgics, especially since all three of them have a supporting role in the film and are present throughout from beginning to end. But Owen Grady and Claire Dearing also continue to be the likable characters I've known and taken to heart since JW1. Maisie Lockwood is the most exciting character and offers potential for a new lead in future films, if there will be any. The action scenes are classy and variedly staged and it never gets boring. There are a lot of dinosaur species in the film, and there are also a lot of thrills and plenty of scary and thrilling moments that took my breath away. Suspense is guaranteed here, especially in the second half of the film. The CGI effects are great and the dinos look very good.Overall, I am highly satisfied with the conclusion of the series and was able to leave with a satisfied grin. Even after a night of sleep I am still very convinced of the film and look forward to the second viewing.9/10 points - High rewatch value.

title: They should had leave it at 1 movie
text: The first Jurassic park will always be the best. And the Jurassic World was the best after. The others ones are not as good. This one is just there to entertain people and probably mostly for money. I was very disappointed.

title: CGI is really bad.
text: Finally, the day arrived, and Sarah went to the theater with her friends to watch the movie. As the movie began, Sarah was excited to see the dinosaurs come to life on the big screen. However, as the movie progressed, she couldn't help but notice how bad the CGI was.The dinosaurs looked fake and cartoonish, and it was difficult for Sarah to immerse herself in the movie. She was disappointed and couldn't believe how poorly the special effects had been done. It was as if the filmmakers had rushed the post-production process, leaving the CGI unfinished and unpolished.Sarah's friends tried to convince her that the CGI wasn't that bad, but she couldn't shake the feeling of disappointment. She had been looking forward to this movie for so long, and it was a letdown.

title: How did this film get made?
text: Hi there! I'm a corporate media behemoth - and I'm here to tell you how a film as spectacularly bad as Jurassic World Dominion gets made.You might be wondering how a film like this can be so unbelievably shoddy, when the original was such an incredible cinematic feat. Well you see, A Corporate media behemoth, like me, is the foundation for building such a terrible thing. It starts with an endless pursuit of more money and a desire to exploit people's desperate desire for nostalgic reminders of simpler times before everything in the world became too much, often satisfied by the feeling they found in old cinematic masterpieces. And sometimes, films that came out many years ago, sometimes about dinosaurs, left their copyright for us to exploit. We just had to know where to look! Around about 30 years ago, there were film companies, just like today. And just like today, they fed on the attention of animals,. Even humans! Sometimes, after spewin' out a movie, the media company would land on something that audiences enjoyed - something that had well rounded characters, with clear rationale desires, real emotions and relationships, and concepts that catapulted audiences imaginations and transported them to new worlds - Even ones with dinosaurs. The media company would make the successful film, make tonnes of money, but then, like a prehistoric mosquito, they'd get stuck in the sap of success. After a long time, media executives at the company realise that they are sitting on this old fossil that made them lots of money and think, by cloning it, they could make just as much money as the first time if they just made the film again. They know they'll never capture the true form of the original, the magic that audiences felt; but they think that, by taking the same actors, the same basic ideas (eg "dinosaurs are back!") and throw it together on screen under a similar title to the original, people will pay money to see it, out of some desperation to re experience the excitement of the first film. Media behemoth executives use something we call "money" to persuade original cast members to sign up to remake this movie, and base the direction of the movie on what focus groups and "data" tell them what audiences supposedly want. This will inevitably be contradictory and miss the real elements that made the original so good; but they will ignore important cinematic principles like good scriptwriting, dramatic tension, good character arks or sensible direction or acting, and... bingo! You have a money making, but truly terrible, soulless clone - or "sequel" - that misses everything that gave the original merit; something that is soulless and ultimately tarnishes the Magic of the original.

title: Enjoyable conclusion to TWO dinosaur trilogies
text: Ignore some of the snooty, all-knowing critics! This movie is fun and meant to be seen on the big screen. The dinosaurs are amazing and the story does a great job in joining together the actors across the 5 prior movies (mostly #1 and #4) in a way that is satisfying and exciting. And loud! If you want an overly intellectual plot, go watch a Jane Eyre flic; if you want popcorn pounding fun...it's here!

title: Boring Jurassic mash up.
text: Maybe I was spoiled with Top gun Maverick but as this movie kept me on the edge of the seat this one got boring after some time.There just was no chemistry on the set, actors/actresses were acting the same as usual but it simple did not feel good.Looked like all previous movies were edited into one bad mash-up, missing a lot of magic??

title: Spielberg please retire
text: This movie is a disgrace to Hollywood. Spielberg keeps making terrible movies. This one killed this franchise. People were walking out of the movie. The ones who stayed laughed and booed and hissed. That part was fun, the audience communally reacting to how primal and bad this movie is. Please retire Spielberg. Please.

title: STOP AT TWO
text: Why does Hollywood keep failing? First one with Pratt was good. Second just OK. This one.....just sad. I am very surprised the actors agreed to this poor writing.They must have been paid a crazy amount.So much they didn't care how much weight Ms Howard gained.So many silly coincidences it makes it a comedy. So bad you start guessing what the next ridiculous move the writers have made.I feel sure they will make a fourth one with a couple of no name actors or a few has beens.Now while we are waiting for the end of this bad excuse for entertainment, we can do some laundry. That will be more exciting.

title: No masterpiece, but still a great and underrated movie
text: After seeing the pitiful reviews and absolutely awful critic reviews, I doubted that this movie would be enjoyable in the least, but after seeing it, it was much more enjoyable, at least in my own opinion, than the reviews make it out to me. As someone who isn't completely obsessed with the Jurassic Park series, I was not paying too much attention for what it could have done after the expansion of opportunities, which it missed in Fallen Kingdom with the world of dinosaurs, but what the movie offered on its own. I think the plot line was fantastic, even if seemingly overused, it was done correctly. The direction at the beginning of the movie seemed confusing, but it made those connections more understandable by the end of the movie. The return of characters from JP1 was done quite fantastically, with all actors having the same feel and personality as in JP1. Jeff Goldblum was especially great in his return as Dr. Ian Malcolm, with his role in the plot making sense and with some great ad libs. The audio design was fantastic, with the surrounding environment being perfectly balanced, making you feel more interested and on your toes in scenes. John Williams did a fantastic job with the music, with new music making scenes more thrilling, as well as imputing the original theme correctly and in tone with the scenes. But the movie was not perfect on all fronts. The villain of Dr. Lewis Dodgson felt undeveloped and just cruel at times, even with the development in Fallen Kingdom. There are some areas that feel skipped over and other that feel overdone, such as the lack of comedy for most of the film, and too much comedy in certain parts. Some scenes were made too serious and others not serious enough. The film lacked balance at some points, but the movie did not disappoint as much as I feel the reviews might say. Its not perfect, but it is worth a rewatch or two once it releases on streaming services.

title: Stop using big franchises as personal interests!
text: This film has a single message, gender identity. As they are doing in Star Wars, they used this film to show that dinosaurs, animals and humans can live together.As if humans weren't responsible for the extinction of various animals such as rhinos and as if dinosaurs wouldn't shake the entire wild food chain if they were alive as shown in the movie.Watching the classic actors together again was amazing, but as planned was to convey the message of gender identity, they made a weak, pointless and bland plot.I repeat, they did the same thing with Star Wars, they put together everything that the creators (George Lucas and Steven Spielberg) built at the time and that was already validated by the desire of the fans and mixed it with personal matters without worrying about the essence of these franchises that are works of art in their originality.

title: Not worth it!!
text:
After one hour I felt so bored , no storyline , no chemistry between actors , no dialogue !! I felt like watching godzilla movie with all action and killing, the funny part that blue now is smart and acting like a pet ..thanking them for bribing her child !! So silly
Enough sequel !

title: Terrible
text: I've been watching Jurassic Park my whole life and never in my life have I ever watched such terrible acting. If you want to see Dr. Fauci in action this movie is it. Between this movies Covid relevancies (Locusts instead of Bats) and terrible acting it makes me feel like I am waking up from a nightmare only to realize it's sadly closer to reality. title: Wow bad
text:

On one-in-a-hundred occasions, a sequel can out-do the original.Not here tho'

Too bad, He's a good actor.There is nothing new here, and the theme becomes rather nauseating rather quickly.Wow, Bad.

title: Another great movie ruined by "inclusion "
text: When are they gonna learn adding a bunch of minorities just because of their race won't make the movie any more popular. Demands? What did they decide they needed a comic book looking,out of place,just so happens to dress like a youtube influencer everyday,cartoon in the film? Worse extra casting choices in a blockbuster since Little Mermaid. She can't act,her emotional responses were all over the map,and the whole "tuff black woman" in cut off sleeves and crop top deal is as old and tired as her whole act. It's good to inform people about the climate we're facing but preaching it all thru a movie about dinosaurs is a bit much,and the ending "can't we all just get along" speech was hilarious. Let's look at the writing.1)Woman being chased by raptor jumps in the back of a vehicle . DeWando jumps in the cab,slides over to the driver's seat and says "hold on". Woman in the back knows she going to floor it to out run the dinosaur? No. She says "wait what"? What did she think was going to happen next,driver was gonna honk the horn and make it go away?2) Two women fighting. Woman One has a knife swinging at the face of Woman Two. Woman Two has a tazer wand and shocks woman one. Woman One says " those aren't made for humans " lol like saying "hey that's not fair".3) plane crashes into frozen lake. Ice blocks are 1' thick and plane is stuck on top of ice half in water. Two people get out onto the ice,but know it's cracking under their feet as if it's 4" thick. One even falls thru. What is the ice around the plane magically thicker and colder than it is 4' away? Soooo many sloppy writing choices to go thru. All they had to do was ad alot of stereotypical millennials,over the top minorities, climate preaching,and inclusion speeches and idiots seem to buy it up like it's Dem speech on how electric cars will save the world.
