title: This movie stunk bad
text: This movie was an extremely long, predictable cliche. It had the all too common in Hollywood evil pharmaceutical/agro-biotech corporation with a weird Steve jobs type running it. The realism/believability was C level effort at best. Smashing a cargo plane nose first into a frozen lake and just walking away unscathed?? Seriously? Dinosaurs running amok all over the world but we're supposed to feel sorry for them like they are innocent creatures that will get along fine if we just leave them alone. Velociraptors making promises with humans and nodding in respect? Dumb. And we're supposed to believe that the main intellectual characters of the original movie just part ways and never even speak to each other for years thereafter despite experiencing something as life changing as Jurassic Park together? I could go on and on. Worst movie I've seen in some time.

title: Not as great as the original "Jurassic Park" but ...
text: ... then it's very difficult to be as ground breaking as that was. The film does have a bit more predictability than I would have liked. It also doesn't have as much of an "on the edge of your seat" feel. However, it was heartening for me to see all the major characters involved with the various other "Jurassic Park" and "Jurassic World" films united under one film. I thought the storyline brought a satisfying conclusion to the explosive results unleashed in the first of the films. Also, a very interesting history for Maisie was revealed. The film's special effects were outstanding as all prior iterations had been. The musical score for me wasn't as majestic as in most of the others. The acting was uniformly good. In short, yes, not as good as the original but for me very satisfying.

title: No Jurassic Spark
text: People who've been following the Jurassic movies since childhood would find the script a blunder which was garnished with poor direction... Same old chasing scenes and dino encounters repeated. Ends the same way as previous ones.. Dino fights dino and the humans rush to their plane. Missed creative vision.

title: I love these movies... Up until this one!
text: I love these movies... Up until this one!You literally could have had the same plot and removed all dinosaurs and it would still be the same movie... Did you all just try and make an awesome looking trailer and forget to make an actual dinosaur movie... I've never sat through an entire movie trying to not actively despise what I was watching. The whole story line felt like an x files with the dinos as a costar rather than the main purpose. Fitting these characters stories together was also odd and just seemed forced. I don't even know if a directors cut could save me and many others from wanting to own or purchase this movie once available.

title: Anti climactic
text: So, like most i was really excited for this, the ideas of dinosaurs being out and in the public, from the trailers i was expecting an almost post apocalyptic type world ... but the reality is like so many trailers, the film wasnt what i expected.It turned out to be the usual CGI laden film that tries to build on past successes by bringing back old characters, and it doesent work well .. ill not say too much about the plot since i actually fell asleep half way through and woke up 30 mins before the end , however the ending left me uninterested to the go back and see what id missed and i came away thinking it resembled the first jurassic park.I literally came away feeling that this was just a step and there was another movie to come that would finish it all, for thier parts , sam neil and Laura dern played them well but ultimately it feels like they were unnecessary.This review is a little muddles (id ont write them often) but in conclusion if you want a movie to just relax with or to put on as background youll be fine, but dont come into it thinking youre going to see a groundbreaking end to a great series, honestly the first jurassic world was better.

title: Where history meets today...
text: Jurassic World: Dominion unites the story lines of Jurassic Park and Jurassic World and brings back many of the most beloved characters. Dinosaurs and humans in this fictional world are learning to live side by side among each other, while some big bio-tech firm BioSyn uses the gen-tech and the access to long extinct species for their own financial gain.As an advisor, no other than Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) gets involved with BioSyn. He, with the support of Ramsey Cole (Mamoudou Athie) create a plan to gather more information on BioSyn with the support of Malcom's companions from the original Jurassic Park adventure, Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) and Alan Grant (Sam Neill).In the meanwhile, we find Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon) living with Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard) in a very remote location, hiding her and her big secret from the world. Nearby lives also Blue, the rescued and incredible smart Velociraptor which escaped Jurrasic World and was originally trained by Owen. When Blue's baby and Maisie get kidnapped, the adventure for Owen and Claire really kicks off, with a wild hunt which leads them to the BioSyn location where Ellie and Allan are gathering more insights on BioSyn's doings. Goldblum occasionally revives his famous indignant moralizing from the original film, especially in a heated showdown with BioSyn executive Jeffrey Dodgson (Campbell Scott, in an icy performance).Colin Treverrow builds bridges and fun insights from the original Jurassic Park with some Jurassic World happenings and thereby creates another impressive Dinosaur adventure with Jurassic World: Dominion. The movie is paced just perfectly right, the 2.5 hours fly by much too quickly, it just never feels long at all. Recommended for everyone who likes stories with Dinosaurs, for fans of the very first Jurassic Park as much as for newbies.

title: Nothing New
text: After Laura Dern was a large player in the murder of star wars, i can't watch her on screen. She destroys what she touches and that was unforgivable.The movie is using its name to make money. No real development but does have the right racial mix for modern audience lol. None of the last should be a surprise at this point.Note to writers. Make a movie with good character development on your own. Everything you are using today was created from previous masters.Bring on a new character by writing story around them hell you have some great actors and you could make a hit with Chris Pratt alone. Make each character have weaknesses and strengths.The movie should be a build up. Like a slow song that increases throughoutout. You don't need so make stupid jokes after killing people and the diversity is forced. It feels insulting from most people's perspective. Add more reqlisim and grit. Less you and Hollywood.The one thing I did learn from this is whenever faced with a dangerous animal or dinosaurs just put your hand up and it's all good. They become tame and just stop what they are doing.This is a good movie if board on a Sunday and nothing better to do. You can get up do laundry miss 15 minutes and it ready does not matter. title: Literally why was this made??
text: I don't even know where to begin... such a disappointment. If you truly love the original, don't waste your time with this one.So many forced plot lines, nothing too compelling. title: JURASSIC FAIL
text: I have prity much enjoyed all of the Jurassic movies, some have been in my top ten movies of all time, really enjoy sitting down to watch these movies and with the kids.Unfortunately world domination is a 1 out of 10 compared to the original, wish I has watched the first one again instead.Poor story, Poor CGI, poor acting real disappointment from such a fantastic movie francaise..Its like they have just churned this movie out on the back of the success from previous movies, the least 2 releases were both enjoyable, no idea who wrote and agreed to rease this movie but I'm sure they won't be making many more ..

title: Worst movie ever (It belongs in that Category)
text: This movie should not even have 1 star. It is so lousy in story and acting performance that 0 star would be correct.Lousy story - lousy acting.What a shame to end Spielbergs Jurassic Park franchise from 1990 with this.

title: Just don't waste your time
text: Just bad, just bad. It's like a cross between a low quality Marvel film, and a terrible Bourne film. Anyone and everyone associated with the original Jurassic Park should be ashamed of themselves. This story epitomises modern blockbusters... bringing back a few old faces and hopes that that is enough to placate the masses. Add in some awful "humour" too...I could go on and on, It's a cruel and very short-lived trick when the story could have been written on the back of a Cigarette packet. Insulting to anyone like me who was 9 when I saw Steven Spielberg's original, that film had genuine magic in it. These awful sequels should have been put to bed years ago, no magic left now just blatant money making, riding on the back of a franchise with sadly no sense of magic at all anymore. Another blurred mess with crap writing.

title: The beast soup is not working : boring
text: A dinosaur movie is first and foremost about its animals. Here, the bestiary is varied and diverse, but also perfect, thanks to CGI porn, animatronics and other techniques. Then it's time to evaluate its story, which here is already seen many times over and is boring: it's always the same story with the secret laboratory, the mad scientist, the genetically manipulated beasts... How is it possible to come up with the same nonsense over and over again? For young audiences perhaps. No matter. He then assesses the script, which is highly predictable, clocking in twists and turns with bugs every seven minutes, based on two dramatic arcs: that of the characters from the Jurassic World franchise (Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard as mechanical and bland as ever) and that of the Jurassic Park franchise (Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum). It's nice to see the trio from the first franchise again, but it feels mechanical and forced. The scenes between Howard and Pratt don't work: they're too conspicuously declaiming their lines, and we just don't buy it.As far as the cast is concerned, we feel that Steven Spielberg and Joe Johnston have a science of directing, unless it's the actors themselves who don't have the ability: this may well be the case, because if we compare them, it's glaringly obvious on screen that we don't have the same performance... It's true that we're not talking about experienced, seasoned actors for Jurassic World.The villain, Campbell Scott, is the most interesting character in the end, and the one we found best written, though full of clich and hardly believable.The music is occasionally annoying. Many of the sequences are phoned in: the dialogue scenes between characters are heavy-handed. On the other hand, the dinosaur action sequences (CGI porn or digital-mechanical dolls) are technically perfect, but again boring. Proof that there was talent behind the Jurrasic Park franchise.All in all, as far as the beast soup is concerned, although indigestible, the film is a success; as for the rest, it's boring.

title: RIP Dinosaurs
text: Firstly, I just want to say that the original Jurassic Park should have won an Oscar for best picture etc. For its time it was outstanding, and even today hold its own without much difficulty.Jurassic World: Dominion is a poor culmination of the JW franchise that initially seemed like a good addition with the first two films.Dominion is such a poorly written movie with a confused plot that sadly put dinosaurs back into the ground. I am honestly shocked and saddened that Spielberg approved off this script. The story was a convoluted mess, and I left the cinema an hour ago with a sunken heart. Forced reunions, poor effects, rushed scenes, and stupid lines that almost made it feel like a really poor Bond film mixed with the most recent Fast and Furious movie.The director should be tried at the Hague for crimes against humanity, for crushing the soul of Jurassic Park with what I can only describe as the worst film in the complete franchise.In a world in which we have some of the greatest minds, I just can't understand why a better script wasn't written. Like the latest Rambo and Terminator, Dominion is the tombstone beneath which lies our beloved dinosaurs.

title: Jurassic World: Disappointment Park
text: Jurassic World: Dominion picks up four years later. But instead of an epic clash for territory, this trilogy-closer chooses to retread the greatest hits and use its prehistoric animals mostly as props and turning them into a sub-plot. A really convoluted plot that didn't make sense. Choppy direction and horrible use of the legacy characters. The CGI seemed to be downgraded in this film somehow when compared to the previous instalment. Though some set pieces and animatronics were mesmerising to see. Overall a dumb boring movie that had the potential to be great. The producers were too pre occupied on wether or not they could make a movie and not wether or not they should.Acting: 5/10 (nothing stood out in this film. Besides Chris Pratt's Charisma and the on screen presence of the legacy actors, it was basic acting who could have been replaced by anyone.Action: 6/10 (All you want from a jurassic movie is Dinosaurs running amoc and killing people. When there was dino action it was great but so little of it and quickly finished left you wishing there was more. The whole malta sequence was perfectly executed. Though it had great animatronics, some CGI scenes of the Dinos was so bad it took you away from what was happening on screen and asking yourself what on earth happened here? Clearly they forgot the famous quote of the first film "spare no expense")Sound: 8/10 (I had the luxury to see this in a Dolby Atmos theatre. Sound design was amazing. Not as good as Topgun Maverick or Michael Bay's Ambulance but good enough to make you appreciate the surround sound. The Dilophosaurus scene is where it really accentuates the Dolby Atmos technology.Story: 1/10 (Convoluted plot and over all boring. Dinosaurs became a sub-plot to the story arc. Poor character development. Most notably the poor use of the legacy characters. Biggest disappointment was the character of Dr Allan Grant. Sam Niel did amazing for what he was given but writing and arc of his character in this film was abysmal.Feels/Nostalgia: 5/10 (There could have been great Nostalgia but poorly executed and barely used in my opinion. There were some cute emotional scenes between Humans and Dinos but the boring plot over shadowed those moments.Over all score 5/10.

title: Hear me out... Haha
text: I completely understand where the lower ratings are coming from. I think they all make great points. However, I had a ton of fun watching this movie and really enjoyed the action, the actors, and the effects. It was an intense popcorn movie, which is what I expected and it delivered. I definitely do think that some elements of the story could have been improved, but it didn't really hinder my experience THAT much.Maybe because I didn't see the original Jurassic Park until very recently, so it doesn't have the same effect on me as others who have been following this storyline from the 90s. Nevertheless, I respect that opinion.

title: Put this franchise out of its misery and call it a day.
text: While not as bad as some of the other entries in this series ( Jurassic Park 3, Fallen Kingdom), "Dominion" does prove that the series is way pass it expiration date. Outside of the returning legacy actors who deserved better than what they had to work with (Sam Nell, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum, who gives the movie its only good moments). The movie is a huge stinkaroo that should not have never been made. The special effects are barely even passable and the story is a mess. Chris Pratt even looks bored to be in it and that should tell you something and there is really nothing let to say.Put this franchise out of its misery and call it a day.

title: I thought there was no way this could be awful, I was wrong
text: I'm amazed, I've liked the other films and was expecting something slightly far fetched but this blew my mind in how awful it was. Ludicrous in most places and just laughable in how so much money could have been spent on something so woeful. Such a shame.

title: Better than the last but still a disappointment
text: It was a decent film but not a good finale to the Jurrasic Park franchise, the movie had a bit of an underwhelming plot. The dinosaurs were pretty cool though but the dinosaur fights weren't great.

title: Disrespectful
text: This movie seems to have so little thought behind the script it saddens me they would rap up a great franchise with this garbage just to collect some money. Jurassic Park deserves so much more.

title: Mission Impossible...with dinosaurs
text: This is completely different to every Jurassic sequel before it, and in this case that's a good thing - it's a movie for adults this time around.The action and set pieces come thick and fast - there's not a whole lot of time to focus on the characters, but since we know them mostly anyway it doesn't matter.This is the first sequel to dispense with the childish silliness that has plagued the series since The Lost World, and delivered a world that has truly changed since the original Jurassic Park. Now the Park is the whole world.Sure, it's a little too long and there's some plot points that are a little messy (your hand is not some sort of magic "calm dinosaur" technique Owen!), but overall it's a great conclusion to what has been a mediocre trilogy.

title: please stop letting 4 year olds decide the dialogue
text: Other than the (completely over-the-top) action scenes this movie was on par with a root canal treatment without the pain killers as the plot and dialogue between characters was SO UNREALISTIC and FORCED. Even my 12 year old daughter was rolling her eyes and gasping at the PATHETICNESS of the script and the unimaginable PLOTHOLES which would only be acceptable if you had the IQ of a US junior high drop out in Texas. I want my time and money back avoid like the Monkey Pox at all cost!

title: Where is the story
text: I think they forgot the story. It was so horrible and cheesy I could not wait to end to go home. Mixing old cast with new cast is great and all but no story whatsoever ever . So boring and confusing it felt good for 5 years old that's it.

title: A clunky finale to an iconic franchise! [+43%]
text: JWD offers a little too much dino mayhem with minimal emotional pull to keep us invested for 2.5 hours. By now, while the scale of the set-pieces have gone global, the impact unfortunately feels lessened. The plot simply moves from point A to point B to point C in a perfunctory way, and when some iconic characters pop up from the past, it simply comes across as mild relief. Alan Grant and Ellie Sattler still have chemistry and Ian Malcolm hasn't missed a funny beat in all these years, but the franchise's newer characters struggle to hold up in comparison. For the zillionth time, we come across humans hiding or running away from dinosaurs and the fear is no longer palpable. There's frankly no more gas left in this franchise's tank. It just needs to dissolve away into oblivion and the next generation should stick to studying (and dissecting) Spielberg's flicks and not Treverrow's sequels.

title: Ramp things up to conclude its franchise
text: Ramp things up with more enticing action scenes and a wide variety of dinosaurs. Trevorrow divided its characters into different sets of conflicts and still kept us on edge of our seats. Old and new cast paid homage and teamed up for social impact.

title: I want my money back.
text: Poorly written garbage. Such a waste of all these talented actors. I almost fell asleep during the first half of the movie. The second part was a little better, but overall a very disappointing movie. I left the movie wondering what happened to this series. If it wasn't dead before, this movie finished it off.

title: Its a monster movie! And it delivers
text: Jurassic Park/World has always been about being fun monster movies and this is no different. Its nice to see they took the franchise into a different path rather than the same old.I really enjoyed this and the nods to the past were great and unforced.

title: My brain still...
text: ...hurts after watching this "movie". Almost ruined the whole franchise. An I was a fan. Not anymore. Avoid. You have been warned.....................

title: Like a cash in greatest hits compilation
text: I know you have to leave reality at the door when you see these films but at least the first one, made from a great book which helps, made you feel like it maybe could happen. This film is just so ridiculous in places that they have lost any even sniff of believability a long way behind.With this film they seemed to have tried to cram in as many dinosaurs, scary moments and old characters as they can, then tried to find a weak story to fit it all together.Not the greatest wat to end the franchise.

title: Feels like it was written by AI
text: Automatic one star for checking the woke boxes. They created certain characters and scenes for the sole purpose of virtue signaling. The movie feels like auto generated AI trash. It's watchable, but even my kids were calling out stuff that just doesn't make any sense. These distractions actively prevent you from immersing yourself in the story. The effects, cgi, and cinematography are decent, too bad the effort was lost to low effort writing. Many of the scenes were clear ripoffs from other movies. This movie is far and away the worst of the collection. Time is better spent pulling nose hair...

title: Surprisingly, I Didn't Hate It
text: Hearing about how bad this movie was and cringing at the idea of a "Spiderman: Homecoming" style nostalgia bomb, I really resisted seeing this movie. Jurassic Park is one of my favourite films of all time, I actually really like the sequel (super underrated, in my opinion), and heck, I can have fun with most of them.Dominion disappointed a lot of people, it seems, because it felt like a paint-by-numbers sci fi action flick that just so happened to have dinosaurs. Amazingly, I liked that about it. I liked that the film explored the implications of the "cloning" technology that is so prevalent throughout the series, realistically highlighting that if this technology existed, dinos roaming around Malta would be the least of our worries.This is a Jurassic Park movie with clones, killer locusts, evil corporations, feathered dinosaurs, Chris Pratt...I'm going to be honest, I had fun. Maybe it was because my expectations were so low, I genuinely enjoyed myself throughout this movie. It's truly bonkers and laughably campy at times, but honestly, anyone expecting high art at this point should get their head checked.Now, just because this movie swings for the fences doesn't mean it always hits. The main villain of the film: a CEO who bears such a resemblance to Apple CEO Tim Cook that my brother and I just started calling him that (and it made the experience so much funnier), essentially wants to use cloned prehistoric locusts to ravage American farmland and sell his company's own crops (which, naturally, the locusts have been "engineered" to be averse to), essentially giving one company control of the American agricultural industry.It's such a dastardly, evil, and unbelievably stupid plan (as if corporations couldn't just buy out millions of acres of disowned and dilapidated American countryside already), that the minute anyone - and I mean ANYONE - hears of it, they immediately turn on Tim Cook. Heck, even Tim Cook bails on the plan out of nowhere, seemingly realizing how stupid and over-the-top the plan is.The acting is pretty poor in some spots (I really dislike the little girl in the movie, I'm sorry), and like so many of these nostalgia bomb films, it elevates characters who really didn't matter in the original films to such a level of importance, it's eye rolling (looking at you, Henry Wu). Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard seem a bit tired and none of the new characters leave an impact. The old trio is actually pretty nice to see, but it's hard not to feel their inclusion is a bit contrived. Why is Dr. Sadler now a "general scientist" and not just a palaeontologist?This movie is also surprisingly light on the dinosaurs, but there are so legitimately awesome moments: the whole sequence in Malta is not only unintentionally hilarious, but a good little action set piece as well.I don't know, I didn't hate it. I thought I would, but I didn't. It's a fun time, as long as you keep your expectations very low.

title: messed up my childhood memories
text: Jurrasic park was amazing, original, as real as possible and great acting. This sequel is so messed up that i will not even let my kids watch it. Total waste of time.

title: So disappointed
text: The teasers, the trailers, the returning characters... The hype.This film had it all, except a decent storyline.Basically a generic story of a billionaire seeking world domination, with a few dinosaurs chucked in for gimmick effect.Only positive was seeing the legendary Dilophasaurus return. Should have really watched Top Gun Maverick again.

title: Exactly what is said on the tin
text: Really enjoyed this movie can't see why there is so much hate. People forget this is a family movie with jump scares and dinos. Why do people expect Oscar winning performances from these movies. It has awesome effects and action scenes. Which is what you want from a Jurassic movie. It is certainly better than Jurassic world Lost kingdom.

title: Great as a Comedy
text: I really loved the original Jurassic Park and will never forget how awesome I found everything about the film. The scenery was gorgeous and the animals were so realistic that I was astounded. I praised it to anyone who would listen and I saw it multiple times to see their reaction and to see how it related to my own.SO, I had heard how bad this one was and couldn't believe all the terrible things I heard because how could you NOT like a film about these amazing-looking beasts! I ended up enjoyed this as a comedy for too many reasons to list. First and foremost, the script was ludicrous. From the first scene, I knew what was going to happen and how it was going to end. The most notably hilarious to me personally? First, DeWana's hair and makeup throughout were perfect, even with all the dirt and hysteria, including falling through the ice into frigid water and coming out dry and not shivering at all. Second, Campbell Scott's "menacing" character was as villainous as my great grandmother when someone didn't enjoy her pasta. And finally, the dinosaurs themselves were seen too infrequently and they looked ugly and unreal, unlike in the first installment of the franchise. The first scenes were actually comical instead of menacing.Avoid this disaster at all costs. Don't waste your money. The only thing I can say in a positive way is that it finally cured my insomnia!!

title: Laughable but not funny.
text: What did they do here? Is it a movie about dinosaurs? A movie about politics? A movie about absolutely nothing? I have no idea what it was about or why I wasted my time on it, but honestly, don't waste your money on this one. I'll seriously never watch this again and I'll be telling everyone I know to stay away from this hot piece of garbage.

title: Boring, predictable, non-sensical...
text: I loved Jurassic Park.I loved The Lost World.I really liked JP III.I really liked Jurassic World.I didn't like Fallen Kingdom.I felt absolutely nothing for Dominion. Well, I actually did feel a bit sad, bored and annoyed because this movie is boring, generic, predictable, forgettable and non-sensical.

title: Beautiful movie.
text: Beautiful movie! Lot of different and great scenerys. Big variety of dinosaurs that cause lot and lot of action throughout the movie (more than the rest). Excellent effects and cgi.Lot of important and iconic characters, and surprisingly everyone is included and developed nicely while having important roles.Even as sci-fi, there is allways a lot to learn from this movie and fantastic saga.

title: Main Plot Not Even About Dinosaurs. Baffling Writing Decisions For The Final Film
text: Here's a plot you may expect for this final film given dinosaurs have been let loose all over the world: the new & old gang must now go on a globe-trotting adventure rounding up loose dinosaurs & shutting down black markets and/or rich people who are still buying/capturing dinosaurs for their own nefarious intentions. There are actually elements of this pitch in the movie, but the core plot doesn't have anything to do with dinosaurs themselves. The dinos are just sort of there for the most part & function as obstacles, rather than being the focus or point of the movie.Characters are given non-dinosaur related things to do. There are no character archs or growth. I really didn't care about anyone, even the returning cast, and at no time did I fear anything bad would happen to anybody who isn't clearly a bad guy. Characters that I somewhat liked from the previous movie show up, but then are forgotten about, while new characters are introduced that I didn't care about at all.There were way too many homages & recreated scenes from the first movie, and yet this movie lacked even what little spirit the previous two movies had. There are themes of irrevocable change due to tampering with genetics & resurrecting creatures that aren't even dinosaurs & yet everything wraps up nicely for no good reason at the end.I give 1 star for the CGI dinos when they are on screen, another for a few of the action scenes, and a final star for the sounds design because it is still top notch. But that's it. I could only recommend watchingthis if it gets added to a streaming service you already pay for or a free one with ads.

title: Not the ending the franchise deserved
text: 2hrs and 20 mins was way too long and somehow still not long enough to coherently fit in all the crazy storylines that they tried to pull off. Notably these weren't focused on dinosaurs and the writers chose not to pick up on the story line (involving dinosaurs) that was teased at the end the previous film and in the marketing material. I gave up on the story and started watching it scene for scene.So many characters (old and new), so many storylines but not a whole deal of action and very few memorable moments. An underwhelming conclusion to the saga. Some of the dinosaurs looked cool though!

title: Fell asleep
text: Fell asleep for the 1st half of the movie. 2nd half is so so. My expectations were low but this is beyond that... would recommend this movies if you're have sleeping disorder.

title: Not Perfect but Definitely Worth Watching!
text: Dang these scores are so low! People are way too hyper critical these days. Thankfully due to the low scores I went in with low expectations and came out really liking the movie as did my son. I mainly went bc of the original cast and they did not disappoint! Their chemistry was amazing and while the story line was a bit cheesy in some beginning parts (the poachers reminded me of Jumanji movie bad guys) it still created the nostalgia it aimed for with great CGI. Is it perfect? No. Is it still great? Yes! Nothing will compare with the original but they do a good job blending the old with the new and you'll leave happy.

title: A dinosaur film.. with minimal Dino action
text: More about the the people than the dinosaurs! What happened? So disappointing this film, and the dialogue and story line is so bad. I spent most of the film cringing.

title: Boring
text: The first hour was boring and then comes along Geoff Goldblum who takes the movie to another level of boredom before it turns into watching the original movie again. Really didn't bother to make something different here but just use the same actors and plots. Laura Dern was so over acting too it was yucky to watch.

title: The same, once more
text: High budget action, dinosaurs in the dark, roaring, constantly attacking people and other dinosaurs, over and over again. I really hoped for more up-to-date scientifically renderings of dinosaurs, but everything were just like before. Fun for the kids though.

title: Dinosaurs
text: Was the plot line flawed? Of course. However, it had big dinosaurs and if you like dinosaurs, you will like this movie. Did it cater to fans? Absolutely. I loved that they did that. The cast was amazing, the call backs to previous movies were amazing, and it had really cool dinosaurs.My biggest complaint is that one particular recurring character should have gotten eaten.

title: I think you can enjoy the movie.... but
text: I think you can enjoy the movie....... but for me... I left the cinema felt disappointed. Watching the trailer even the short film Battle at Big Rock... I was hoping finally we gonna see the actual Jurrasic World where an environmental ecological and geopolitical issues arise when humans and dinosaurs cannot coexist ala Planet of The Apes.Instead what we got is the same old thing... a corporate intervention and manipulation on dinosaurs in an Island... yet again!The 3rd act eventhough have some actions... it's a repeat to every Jurassic Park movies... it's so familiar it become a snooze fest to me... in fact... I just go out from the cinema hall and take a leak... which I never did that in so many years... went back in and did not feel I missed anything.Feeling disappointed... 4.5/10.

title: When will writers learn to write?
text: I will never understand how writers write such pure garbage and some lame exec says, Wow great, ship it. The director has no real vision of a good product. When the scenes keep slapping you in the face with such absurdities, how does any competent EP say 'Great Job' and sign off on it? There isn't any continuity in any of this. Hell, there isn't any story.I hope the actors gor paid a lot of money. I actually felt bad for all of them. Even the cheesy, evil Tim Cook gag. That went on far too long.The one good thing is the movie did what Disney Star Wars never did.bring the 3 originals together. It still doesn't make it worth watching.

title: New Dinosaurs, Immersive from Start till End
text: I read a lot of the 4 and 6 star reviews before going to see this film, fully expecting it to be a disaster of a film.It's better than the Jurassic Worlds so far, but very different to the Jurassic Parks. Key word being 'different'. It's an action thriller more than an otherworldly jaw dropper, as we've already seen dinosaurs and I think people are expecting to revisit the charm of the very first film in the franchise for some reason.I agree, the premise of GM locusts modified to an accidental extreme by yet another bioengineering company was not particularly interesting as a plot device and I would've loved to sea some more ocean activity with the mosasaurus and other sea creatures, but I was absolutely enraptured by the new species of dinosaur we got to see, especially the ones present in the game Ark: Survival Evolved - Deinonychus, Giganotosaurus, Therizinosaurus, and more! There's a very entertaining giant dinosaur fight as well.Overall, very entertaining, immersive film, not groundbreaking, but it has romance, action to the extent of Fast and Furious stunts with black market traders and raptor chases, new dinosaurs, a backstory for Maisy, old characters revisited, and science! You can't have it all.

title: Much the same as before
text: The third instalment of the JURASSIC WORLD trilogy. They bring in a little new excitement here by the addition of three characters from the first movie (and thankfully the return of Neill, Dern and Goldblum) but of course their roles are much lesser than you'd expect or hope for. Sadly, Pratt and Howard are back too, once more running around and shoehorning themselves into a story which doesn't really fit them. This film has a novel concept, in which dinosaurs exist in the wild globally, but then ignores it in favour of a stock "save the world from killer locusts" storyline. The FX are okay and there's plenty of diverting action, but I would hope that this one's the last.

title: Bryce Dallas Howard a dreadful actress
text: Sad to be leaving a negative review, but this film so awful I walked out after 40 minutes. It had zero humour in it, took itself way too seriously, the CGI poor, and Bryce Dallas Howard frankly irritating. Her acting skills zero, spent more time focusing on looking pretty, than actually convincing the audience of anything. Apart from that... now home with the cat, who is far more entertaining.

title: This was Perfect Of Balance Of Old And New and The Franchise went out in Style.
text: Watched Jurassic World:Dominion Starring Chris Pratt(Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol.2) as Owen Grady, Bryce Dallas Howard(The Mandalorian) as Claire Dearing, DeWanda Wise(The Harder They Fall) as Kayla Watts, Justice Smith(Detective Pikachu)as Franklin Hobbs, Danielle Pineda (Newlyweds) as Zia Rodriguez, Campbell Scott(The Amazing Spider-Man) as Dr. Lewis Dodgson, Dichen Lachman(Altered Carbon) as Soyona Santos ,B. D. Wong(Jurassic Park) as Dr. Henry Wu, Oscar Winner Laura Dern(Star Wars,Marriage Story)as Ellie Sattler , Sam Neil(Hunt For The Wilder People) as Alan Grant, and Jeff Goldblum(,The Lost World:Jurassic Park) as Ian Malcom.End of an era for the Jurassic Park Franchise and it went out in style. From the second the score starts to the T. Rex standing behind the iconic circle. Perfect balance of old meets new. Great to see the cast reunited with chemistry and visual effects on point I can understand if some had issue with the Franchise of being drawn if you guys want more stuff to fill in the "Plot Holes" I recommend Camp Cretaceous on Netflix The only things that disappointed me in terms of the franchise was lack LGBTQIA+ Representation they had Zia Rodriguez right there who is queer also The Classic Herbivore Carnivore Matchup The Classic Stegosaurus V T-Rex or Triceratops Vs T-Rex also if Rexy went out that I wouldn't of mind but she continue to lives since she is The Mascot of The Franchise I was disappointed with Yes the 1993 Film with Never Topped but This was Perfect Of Balance Of Old And New and The Franchise went out in Style.Decent Direction from Colin Trevorrow (Jurassic World) ,Amazing Score from Michael Giacchino(Spider-Man:Far From Home)This was Perfect Of Balance Of Old And New and The Franchise went out in Style. 9/10.

title: Biggest disappointment of the year
text: As a Jurassic fan, i enjoyed the first Jurassic World. There were some great ideas, interesting park design, some suspense, with a quite good final battle. It has its own mistakes, but as a new beginning it was a promising restart for the franchise.Unfortunately the sequel, Fallen Kingdom comes with stupid scenario, extreme silly dialogs and situations, irritating characters, and exploded Nublar island. Almost everyone thought it had gotten a lot worse than the first JW, and most of the mistakes came obviously from the bad scenario.And now we have the 'epic conclusion', which is... i can hardly believe this, but Dominion is worse than Fallen Kingdom. Due to an extreme bad and stupid scenario, the dinosaurs are just supporting actors, the characters (even the classic ones) are weightless, and suspense can't be find except one of two jumpscares. The new villains are completely insignificant in all areas, on both men and dinosaur line.This final movie is a shame on this budget with this actors, and the reason is the extreme weak storyline again.Mr. Trevorrow and Ms. Emily Carmichael, you buried this beloved franchise with your stupid mess, and we are not happy.

title: Everybody Was Back For An Epic Adventure Story That Just Didn't Happen!
text: It was good to see old faces all together and great to see the dinosaurs once again! The not so good part to the film was a drab story line and, a script that did not challenge the cast. Thus the film was a complete non starter and you are left thinking at the end of it, "Why did they bother making this weak and lackluster 6th outing?"I have given it a 5 star mark purely for the beautiful creatures and the always perfect CGI. Unfortunately though, it did not bring back those exciting and scarily terrifying feelings from the first 2 films. If they cannot come up with something to equal/outdo the original Jurassic Park, then they should let the Jurassic films end; before they ruin them!

title: Nostalgia gone wrong
text: All I can say is that the plot felt like a highschool group project where the writers didn't share any notes before the big presentation. Instread of a little fear and excitement all I felt was frustrated and annoyed. I wanted it to end but it just kept going and going and going...... Very sad because I was genuinely excited to see this movie. Talk about a classic cash grab based on nostalgia.

title: Fun to see the original cast,...
text: Wish that it just would have been about them. But that is where the good ends. For example, I got really irritated at that the CGI person had obviously never seen even a snowflake. The plane crashes into the dam and we can see that the icesheet are at least 20 cm thick. We can also see that the ice is transparant, which tells me that it's congelation ice. You can drive a car on that, but hey, the characters perhaps weigh a couple of tons?They also try to fill out the movie with fights, not with any kind of story. Maybe it's time for the Jurassic Park franchise to become extinct itself?Please, please, please, don't make anymore.

title: A true ending to a brilliant film collection
text: Absolutely brilliant film, after 20+ years since Jurassic park was released and this film was made for true fans of the Jurassic Park/World era. It had lots of nostalgic scenes which made it truly special.The story line was light hearted and was a beautiful way to bring back the original cast with the newer cast.

title: Pointless and Dull
text: Why did I feel like that this movie was like a Mission Impossible? Bad guys kidnapped a girl and a baby raptor. Everyone meets at a secret sanctuary base. Weapons are guided by lasers. Story and acting were pretty dull. They have too much characters to focus on. Location keeps changing constantly. Their was no focus besides the dinosaurs, locust, and a few characters that you liked.Nothing changed between dinosaurs and humans. Avoid this movie. However if you are a insomniac, maybe this movie will help you sleep.
