title: Good Final for a Great Story... Isn't it?
text: Jurassic Park is already 30 years old, and what a great way to celebrate its anniversary than by seeing the final movie of a cult-considered saga; because everything in this film is nostalgia for the first films.I'm not saying it because they have been able to contact the actors of the original saga almost 30 years later, that's because every Jurassic Movie that comes out new in theaters makes you feel nostalgic and hype in equal measure.Obviously one must never forget what actors such as Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard brought to this new Jurassic trilogy. These last two actors that I have mentioned give a lot of sense to what is the cherry on top of 3 decades of work.

title: This movie is an embarrassment to the franchise
text:
"Dodgson! We've got Dodgson here! See nobody cares"Literally should be the tag line for this stink festNothing makes sense
Lame Inserted dinosaur scenes that are pointless jump scares or low threat action scenes
Hybrid locusts that's the plot point eveyone wanted to go for ?Dragged the original cast back again , they all appeared to want the easy pay day and I don't blame them. But man they either had nothing to do or just so they could make you feel nostalgic for a much better and still holds up Jurassic park1Skip this stinker , unless you like being bored or need something on in the back ground well you clean the housePlease please don't pay for this movie
Watch it free on Amazon prime.

title: The worst movie that i saw in my life
text: Only special effects, nothing about the story, horrible film, i can't belive this stupid movie. Is the dead of cinema, a movie without actor, story, only dinosaurs.

title: bad
text: It's horrible what has become of Jurassic Park. Convinced still part 1-3, part 4 is only 6/10 and part 5 is 4/10.But this one knocks the bottom out of the barrel. Who came up with this soulless poop?For more than 2 hours you are fired up with tons of dinosaurs but then you forget to put it all into an exciting and meaningful story.The cameos are nice, but since Star Wars it's been getting on my nerves too.It's more and more reminiscent of the senseless Transformers films, the content of which was as deep as northern Germany.

title: Theme park ride trailer, not for dinosaur or original Jurassic Park lovers, but for self glorifying postmodernists
text: Good effort from the visual effects team, but the set pieces lack gravity. To be thrilled by this one you need to be the jumpiest person alive. Nostalgia baiting isn't done in a manner that would trigger emotions as well. Too long and riddled with lazy writing with the woke messages: "White guy is a villain, Asian dude is still too intelligent for the greater good, black man is the moral hero, women rule, specially badass if they are not straight. And look there are dinosaurs too !! " you get the picture.

title: Will no longer watch Jurassic world after what I saw in this movie.
text: I went to IMAX with large family to see this movie. Besides movie being such a disappointment, I noticed this movie was pushing communist agenda by showing an inflated map of China. Such a shameful kissa** attitude of the writers, directors for movie that should be not involved in such controversy. The scene where they show command center shows China's map that grabs other countries boundaries. Shame on you UNIVERSAL, shame on you JURASSIC World. You are dead to me!!!!

title: Boring movie
text: The story line is pretty predictable, no innovation or creativity whatsoever. The ending is quiet the same as first Jurassic world. Nothing special, the dinosaurs look very fake, like no life in it.

title: Where to start? That's right! They never should have!
text: Where do I begin? I'll make this short:Remember that feeling you had when you watched the first Jurassic Park? The fear, the enchantment, the wonder, the plausibility?And then you were substituted by a cartoon parody that stole all of that to make a buck. To literally suck the marrow out of the bone in order to validate it's own significance.That's this. That's your nostalgic tale. And we just spent $25 on it.

title: Sufferage!
text: You will suffer greatly watching this movie if you have to pee because you will do everything in your power to remain in your seat! All the scenes you loved & memorized in the other films are all wrapped up in a pretty package for you to open scene by scene to make a complete Jurassic gift for you! And when it's over, you'll want to open it again!! This is a keeper!

title: Woke Environmentalist propaganda
text: The CGI dinosaur action is good fun, but the extremely heavy-handed environmentalist propaganda is waaaaay too much. The very first scene even goes so far as to depict some young folks committing eco-terrorism and they are made out to be the good guys. Avoid.

title: Super boring
text: One dimensional characters. Boring dinosaurs. Typical Cliched action. Save your time and money.One dimensional characters. Boring dinosaurs. Typical Cliched action. Save your time and money.One dimensional characters. Boring dinosaurs. Typical Cliched action. Save your time and money.

title: Minusaurus
text: Minus 1 star for bringing back old characters and putting them in cheesy situations, minus 1 star for some annoying new actors who did nothing for this movie, minus 5 stars for a crap storyline, and 3 stars for Laura Dern and her bad, bad acting.They should have stopped with the first movie and let it be a "classic". Instead Hollywood kept punching out half-hearted storylines that culminates into the most ridiculous swan song that tried to highlight all problems in society, to include Laura Dern and her need to preach. My God, has this woman ever been in a movie where she didn't come off as a smug, self-important Hollywood activist? I just feel bad for Chris Pratt and Sam Neill who have to be associated with this as part of their legacy. So here I go trying to get another 200 characters so I can post this review. Not saying anything else. You pretty much know how I feel about the franchise by now. It only took 29 years for this franchise to go extinct when it should have been only one!

title: Loved the callbacks
text: I think it was the perfect movie to wrap up the Jurassic world/park series. The call backs to characters brought in by the Jurassic park series and relationships that got explored was amazing.

title: This was not a good movie at all
text: This wasn't even a dinosaur movie and there were so many unnecessary characters and I'm disappointed in this movie. I thought it would be one of this year's best movie and it didn't stand out to me and the people that watched it with me.

title: AWFUL
text: Not sure why, but we watch all of these, every time there's a new one. We keep hoping they get better and they get worse. The acting in this is so terribly bad- even from veteran actors. Jeff Goldblum? I will never understand the appeal (other than The Fly, which I wished that we'd watched instead of this). Great CGI here- I'll give it that. But the story was noticeably absent and just kept going and going and going. If your movie doesn't have a story, it doesn't help to beat the audience over the head with CGI. You can read the synopsis of the film all over this site, so no need to rehash it. If you like a good story, and you like good acting... RENT SOMETHING ELSE!

title: YA'LL PERHAPS MISSING THE POINT?
text: As of this writing (2022) it's been 29 years since Steven Spielberg and his crack team released the first "Jurassic Park" in 1993. Many of the computer-generated, digitally composited effects were new, and the effects were startling, sparingly scary, and most certainly unforgettable. This new Jurassic film is quite different from its 5 predecessors. The FX in "Jurassic World Dominion" are unrelenting and intense. Frightening might even be a better description. And this is what defines this latest (and word has it) final chapter in the world's most epic and beloved dinosaur film franchise. I would imagine the producers, writers, and director, were thinking: "If this is really the end of the Jurassic legacy, then let's go out with a BIG OL' BANG!"Having read some of the recent IMDb reviews of Jurassic World Dominion, I was a bit disappointed. It appears that JWD is being maligned for the one ingredient film fans unanimously agree must be present in any worthy movie: "A film must be entertaining." It doesn't need to be real, nor does it require a great plot or acting (though these elements would be helpful).I'm not going to waste anyone's "reading time" discussing the plot line (it has already been done 500+ times on IMDb and elsewhere). I will say that JWD feels both like a warmly embraceable cast reunion of sorts, which also includes the return of some of my favorite dinosaurs. There are also a number of enticing "Easter Eggs" scattered throughout the film. I caught a few of them - obvious nods to previous Jurassic films.JWD doesn't appear to have any illusions of becoming the next "Gone With the Wind," "Aliens," or "Avatar." Audiences are already in the process of deciding this film's destiny, and no matter how much we choose to praise or criticize it, at the end of the day, JWD is nothing more or less than 2 hours and 20 minutes of complete and unapologetic entertainment. And perhaps, given these particularly rough and tumble times, being thoroughly entertained isn't such a bad thing.So why are some of us beating up on this film? Perhaps we've forgotten how to simply enjoy being entertained?Not that long ago, at some point in time, we were all kids (and if you're reading this and you're still a kid, that's perfectly cool too!). Being a kid is mainly a fun occupation, but ultimately, for the exception of Peter Pan and his rough little band of Lost Boys, all kids eventually grow up. It happens quickly, and in that precise moment when children make that nascent transition, many beautiful childhood fantasies disappear forever. Innocent imagination gives way to other more urgent "adult" matters such as work, money, marriage, divorce, love, taxes, life and death. It is a seemingly endless list of troublesome "grown up issues" that children should never have to inherit. Yet they all do. Nevertheless, the maturation process is very survivable. Perhaps we can try to resurrect that " inner child" so that we can relearn how to enjoy the simple mechanics of entertainment?To be memorable, a movie should, at the very least, aspire to be entertaining. Being entertained is why dedicated movie goers of all ages voluntarily "suspend their belief" as they watch a film. They rarely question what they see or hear, choosing instead to focus their rapt attention on "how the film makes them feel." Does anyone really believe that Indiana Jones could realistically avoid the hundreds of spears, darts, bullets and boulders (not to mention poisonous snakes) hurled at our favorite archeologist? I don't think so.Perhaps JWD is a reflection of art finding its own way into the realm of block buster films because it will soon reach (and likely surpass) worldwide sales of $900 million. Not too shabby for a film where many reviewers are intent on preventing this picture from earning more than six stars. Yet, the sum of these well conceived parts has conspired to produce a beautifully executed film, one that I think will someday earn its rightful place in the Jurassic canon of films.No spoilers here as usual, but I will reveal that when Jeff Goldblum found out he was appearing with his two co-stars (Laura Dern and Sam Neill) from the the original film, he posted on Instagram: "You did it! You s** of a b*****s did it!"

title: Go see Maverick again instead
text: Probably the worst of all 6 Jurassic movies. Boring, liberal-leaning wokeness all throughout. This movie should have been called the Lost World. It Lost by number 6.

title: CGI can't save a horrible plot
text: Honestly disappointed. I went in with low expectations, but this movie didn't even meet them. Yes, the dinosaurs were pretty cool and had great animation. It is not good enough to save the atrocious plot of this movie. I was ready for the movie to be over an hour in and felt bored most of the movie. All of the tension was forced and it was so predictable! To the point where I could count down from three to my wife to predict a larger dinosaur would pop out. I'm thankful that this movie brought my wife and I closer over our shared laughter at the ridiculous plot. I won't see these movies in theater any longer, I'm so glad it was free.

title: Narration, repeat of tropes, and a convoluted boring mess
text: Sadly this is probably the best of the latest three Jurassic movies, which is not saying much. This movie take great use of Narration and dragged out explanation so at times I think the entire movie is narrated like a documentary. We also get the usual environment propaganda how we should live in peace and harmony with nature - and this narration is told while Chris Pratt releases a deadly predator into the wild where it can murder more humans... yea, that happen...And perhaps that is the least believable with these movies. We all know the military would have killed everything, even nuked that island if need be. But they don't because the plot need to happen.The rest of the movie is okayish. The CGi is pretty great, the acting great, music and sets great. The problem with this is that we have seen it all before. This movie is basically a copy paste of all previous movies, sprinkled with some narration. The writing, and dialogue is horrible and often cringe. The storytelling is just a convoluted mess.I assume if you liked the previous ones you might like this too, it is perhaps even better than the last one just more boring since we seen it all already.I give this a very generous 4/10. The reason for that high score is that everything cinematography and the acting is at the very top. But don't kid yourself, this is a really bad movie.

title: Thrilling Dino-Film! The Monster of All Monster Movies!
text: This film alone justifies the entire existence of cinema. Magical.One of the Best Movies ever made. One great scene after the next great scene. Masterpiece and the best Jurassic World Movie LOveee !!

title: It wasn't good. It was Mediocre.
text: Firstly, There was some absolutely Great Dinosaur Action on screen. That scene with Bryce underwater was such a Beautiful Shot.But..........It's a Mediocre 5 out of 10 Blockbuster. Unfortunately that's not good enough for a Major Summer Blockbuster.Lower Tier Movies have a Baseline of 5, 6 and 7 out of 10. Not Blockbusters Which have the Capacity for a 9 and 10 out of 10 Cinematic Experience.Here's the Gripes -1. There is a lot going on in this movie but that isn't really the problem.2. The problem is the Writing and the lack of tieing things together properly and the performances from the Villain and of some of the other characters. They don't sell it well enough.3. The Villains performance was Terrible. When you have a bad villain, your movie is in trouble.That Being Said, I actually enjoyed it for what it was.Good Parts -1. The Malta Section of the Movie was Really Good.2. The Thin Ice Scene was Good.3. The Scene With Bryce holding her breath underwater to escape was Absolutely Excellent. What A Cinematic Shot That Was.4. The scene when the huge Dinosaur wraps his Jaw around the ladder when the little girl is climbing was a Great Visual Scene.5. The Locations were Beautiful to see on Screen.6. There were multiple different shots and scenes with such good Dinosaur Action.Overall, A one time Watch.

title: Even the syfy channel would be embarrassed with this dud
text: Lackluster finale to a trilogy that failed dismally to replicate the excitement and entertainment of the original Jurassic Park trilogy, even the dissapointing Jurassic Park sequels are far better movies than the Jurassic World trilogy.The opening 5 minutes of Dominion kills this movie outright, the poorly constructed news report scene is reminiscent of the cheap tactic played out in endless syfy channel romps, a cheap amateurish tactic that sets up the movie as there is no real attempt to tell a well constructed story because there is no story to tell.A well known theory tells us that if the Dinosaurs hadn't been wiped out by a devastating meteorological disaster the Dinosaurs would be the dominant species not man, Dominion should have utilised that theory and shown mankind in decline and struggling to survive in the new dinosaur reality yet writers Trevorrow and Connolly decide to use a story more fitting to their Lego Jurassic World endeavours.JPDominions cgi and story elements at times are so ridiculous and poor that producers of movies made for TV would be embarrassed to put their name to it.One would hope this is now the proverbial "nail in the coffin" for cash grab movies but I don't think pigs can actually fly just yet.

title: What a disappointing mess.
text: I love JP and JW films. I rate this #5 of the six. Only JP III was worse. It is a disappointing mess of a film. Too many story lines, character collisions and implausible scenes.

title: Can't believe people didn't enjoy this
text: I thought this had well balanced action and story, was on the edge of my seat trying not to have a heart attack the whole movie. I'm a massive fan of dinosaurs and recognises most from playing the ark survival evolved game and swing the diverse range of dinos in the film was awesome!

title: Why Chris Pratt?
text: It's become a terrible investment of a one trick poney actor. Wanna see that parks and rec guy that can't act, but in a movie? Oh yea he's like a serious dinosaur whisperer smart guy in this series, and it doesn't work at all. He doesn't even change how he looks it's still the jewish perm with a thin beard so all I'm seeing is...wait I'm sorry he wasn't even funny to me in parks so no trick poney. I'm not even mad, I'm furious, fast and the furious, acting. Peace.

title: Boring, I wasted an afternoon
text: A terrible let down. Too long by at least 30 minutes, the director seemed to try bundling several plots that were just filler.You definitely need to suspend any concept of time and space considering characters seem to travel from one place to another in no time at all.Last bone of contention: we saw the 3-d version, everyone around us had issue with the classes not helping at all. I wound up watching without them.

title: horrible, as expected
text: Sad, convoluted, childish, ridiculous, cheap and sooo boring - no story but a dozend storylines, no characters but a dozend character arcs and every cheap franchise cliches on top. JP has destroyed it's once captivating premise - as expected.

title: They still got the hang of it!
text: I would say this is my favorite Jurassic World movie. Mostly because it had so much potential in terms of visual effects. Those are awesome in this movie.The acting is great. Also, I loved the return of the old cast. The only thing they could've done better is the plot line. Somehow, it's not very eventful.

title: Lazy and boring. Please let this franchise go extinct
text: This movie was nothing more than an incoherent string of "spooky dino set pieces".The plot and writing suffers immensely from "and then"-syndrome. Nothing leads into the next and the story just goes wherever it needs to shove spooky dinos into the characters face. It actually get's laughable after the 1 hour mark when the movie have been nothing but this ever since the 10min mark, and it keeps this pace and stupidity up for the entire 2 hour long runtime.No new character serve any importance to the plot and is swiftly killed off by a dino after 5min of screen time or just disappear off screen for no discernable reason never to retur to the movie.Please Universial I know this franchise prints you money without you putting any effort in as a studie, but i beg of you please for the love of god let this franchise go extinct. 5 sequels to a movie that never needed any is 5 too much.

title: Everything's wrong the finale.
text:
The film company's plotting brief:
1. I want them all back and fight together to save the world.2. I want it to look like 007 let's go shoot the movie in Europe.3. I want all dinosaurs...never mind nobody can remember their names.4. I want add another species to scare the audience.5. I want bad people get punished as they always do. Let the uncredited ones die
6. I don't care how you guys do it, just do it.The director and writers:
........

title: Jurassic WORLD
text:
People here forget that they go to the movie "Jurassic World" and not Jurassic Park, The movie was the best ending that a trilogy can hope for, You can see all the work they put in the tiny details through all the movie I mean they even put the damn shaving foam beside that you can see how they work so hard on the realistic dinosaurs and the shots was literally the beautiful thing I've ever seen
Really amazing movie, amazing closure and the most brilliant trilogy off all times .Thank you for reading.

title: I dont get it!
text: This is a mess! I really dont understand this movie.Special effects,story,acting...what is going on?What went wrong?This is the worst jurassic park movie ever.

title: Dross
text: Dreadful lines, dreadful acting, dreadful plot, dreadful idea. I can't believe this got past conception. I'm surprised the actors committed to it. It doesn't even know what type of film it wants to be, sometimes James Bond, sometimes Bigfoot and the Henderson's

title: Absolutely absurd premise.
text:
The CGI dinosaurs are excellent. And it's fun to see Sam Neill and Laura Dern, and even Jeff Goldblum:)
However, they didn't have nearly enough to do. But, fun nonetheless.But, the plot is absolutely gawdawful.The idea that people would tolerate dangerous dinosaurs running loose is beyond absurd.It would be a hunting free for all.I like Chris Pratt, but he sucks in these movies.I dislike having to write so much, this movie doesn't warrant anything in-depth. If you liked the last couple, you may like this one. But, all were bad in my mind, this is the worst yet. Action scenes have their moments, but give a bunch of good ole boys some serious weapons and it's game over dinosaurs:)

title: Another Covid-era wasted opportunity
text: "Jurassic World Dominion" (theatres, 2.5 hrs) should've been an awesome adventure-drama and it had the outstanding VFX to get there but the director and writers just whiffed on this. Totally implausible get aways from situations and dino-attax just took all the suspense/realism from this. Our protags were never, ever in any danger when their threats are simply written to be cartoonishly impotent. I mean a plane crash at 200-mph into snow/ice and our protags have no broken bones, no concussions, no scrapes or scratches even! Totally written by and for 10 year olds. And the ridiculous amount of close-ups on Bryce D H, is the director in love with her or what?! Jeebus. Anyway, such a disappointingly wasted opportunity.

title: Ian freeze! Don't go and see this dumpster fire.
text: I can't believe Steven Spielberg signed off on this. I won't believe he had this envisioned when he directed the first two films. And Michael Crichton is surely spinning in his grave. It just goes to show you that nowadays, if movies don't have source material for their backbone, it's better to just walk away and NOT MAKE THE FILM. I'm gutted that after nearly 30 years we're left with this as our adieu to Hammond's dream. Thanks Colin Trevorrow, you bum.

title: Don't pay to watch it on the big screen
text: I was so looking forward to seeing this film, it started ok, I was expecting ramp up, but just got silly and confusing, and quite ridiculous. Wasn't a Jurassic park film. Was a pointless story about mutated locust, while trying to happily bring in all the old characters from last films, bring them in somehow no matter what.

title: Ugh
text: I know I'm in trouble when I'm looking at my watch 20 minutes in. Every clich in the book - bad dialogue, overly dramatic music, too many plot "coincidences" to mention. My 9 year old grandson enjoyed most of it, but at 2 hrs 20 minutes even he got restless. And 2 hrs and 20 minutes I'll never get back.

title: A tense, enjoyable and beautiful film
text: If this movie gets one thing right, that's action. The sheer amount of action sequences is astonishing, but more importantly, everything in them is a setup and payoff. And even though you know that the good guys are always going to come out unscathed, the director still manages to find creative ways to get them out of difficult situations. This way you're constantly following the characters, trying to figure out their best option, which makes for a tense and fun watching experience.That being said, the numerous character arcs and stories aren't quite given enough screen time. There's just so many people going through so many things, and then we're jumping from one company to the other, so that everything ends up feeling a bit messy. It's quite rewarding though seeing everyone meet up towards the end of the movie, and it certainly helps with the pacing, as the film doesn't just wrap up too abruptly.

title: Trailer was deceiving
text: I have enjoyed all the jurassics before this one, went in with high hopes and left extremely disappointed! This movies failed on every single level! The cgi was way off, there were too many stories that was just too hard to keep up with and were very vague, the story line was just all over the place, come on Hollywood you guys can do wayyyyy better than that!

title: Rubbish
text: How are these Directors, Writers, Actors given such amazing privileges only to come up with tripe.Maybe it's my age, growing up with original Star Wars, Raiders, Jurassic Park now having to sit through this - heartbreaking..

title: Writers turned their brains off
text: Most cliche and nonsensical film I've seen in a long time. If you told me an 8 year old write it, I would believe you. They weren't going for anything original, just dumbing down the plot and making the same movie they've made 4 times.

title: Dumb dino action, and I'm all for it!
text: People who expected a philosophical cinematic thriller like Jurassic park are stuck in the 90's. This franchise has been just about fun dinosaur action since JP2, and Colin has nailed it in that regard. This movie is quite similar to the last installment but exceeds it in every way. The characters aren't all dreadful but I actually liked most of them in this movie. The dinosaurs look way better too, party because of the use of animatronics. And the terror of the dinosaurs hasn't been this good since JP ( dinosaurs are scary again!) .sure the end battle was cheesy and stupid like in the last few movies and the plot was pretty weird and not really interesting but it's still the best JW film in my opinion.People watch JW/JP for the dinosaurs and dinosaurs it gave us.

title: Too Locust Focused
text: Absolute dog water plot. There was far too many locusts in the movie. In fact the plot was about locusts. Why does a dinosaur movie focus on locust more than dinosaurs? Too much locust focust. Too much focus on the locus. That being said, the moments where there were actual dinosaurs at the center of the scenes were fantastic and honestly pretty intense. But where were they? I could recall probably five scenes where dinosaurs were actually a pivotal part of this stupid insect movie. And they brought back the fellas from the original too?? Great! But why did they have to be so cringe? Jeff Goldblum was great. But he always is great because he's always just Jeff Goldblum in any movie he's in. 2 stars for the two minutes of dinosaurs. And for Jeff Goldblum's enjoyable as always lack of emotion!

title: I wanted to like this movie
text: I wanted to like this movie; I really did. But I could not. It is overlong, overstuffed with ridiculous plot lines that made watching it a chore. Of course, the whole concept of bringing dinosaurs back to life from the original onward is ridiculous, but "Jurassic Park" was so brilliantly executed and suspenseful that one could forget the implausibility of the whole thing. The series has gone downhill from then onward. And this movie represents the nadir of the series. Come on now, Chris Pratt is the dinosaur "whisperer" making promises to a raptor, please! And Laura Dern, Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum are brought back for no apparent reason other than nostalgia. Why are Laura Dern and Sam Neill invited to the villain's lair? Who knows? And why is Jeff Goldblum invited as well when all he is does in criticize the main villain's company? I found Campbell Scott's character reminiscent of an evil Tim Cook (not Steve Jobs as some have said). At least his performance was quietly creepy to me. The rest of the performances were passable at best - Laura Dern, Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum appear to be embarrassed to be in the movie. The action scenes are poorly directed and not suspenseful. Therefore, I can only recommend the movie for Jurassic type completists like me - I just had to go even though I predicted it would be bad but hoped I was wrong. I was not. 5/10.

title: slow and long
text: This movie couldve definitely been a big hit. There could've been a lot of potential but it was really long also very slow. I wish there were more action.

title: Great wrap up
text: I don't know what else people wanted. Great fab service oriented wrap up bringing the casts together and just action end of end. By owning the premise from the last one that dinosaurs live in our world it at least felt unique from some of the 'no really let's go back to the island' chapters. It's a summer popcorn it knows what it is movie but it's easily in the top 3 of the JP/JW movies for me.

title: Very very boring
text: Even small children will get bored watching this. It's like a children's movie with a dinosaur in it. Nothing special and very boring. I'm wasting my time just watching toy dinosaurs with the addition of silly couple drama.

title: Worst of the new Trilogy
text: Too bad this wasn't better! It had all the right elements - it almost worked - it came full circle in lots of ways; however, it just didn't work. It was ambitious, it had some good ideas - but in the end, it was really just a mess. It didn't work! It's definitely the worst of the new trilogy.Just too much going on. It just wasn't tight, it was a sloppy mess. Even with the original cast - it just became a convoluted mess. A bit too much. Too messy - too much story - it just didn't work. It was still mildly fun - but this was one of the worst Jurassic Park movies!And now for a few more random words to hit 600 characters!

title: Unnecessary movie
text: So I read the reviews before I watched it but still had to see for myself, and sadly for the most part the reviews were right. This movie bought nothing new to the table, they bought back some old faces but as far as Jurassic movies go this was probably one of the most unnecessary ones that they made so far. A lot of it was just rehashed and the stakes overall were really low as far as the characters go. Tbh I'm being generous with my rating.

title: Movie felt forced and only worth to watch If you have nothing to do
text: The movie doesn't feel like it deserved its existence. The old characters from jurassic Park are there just for nostalgic factor and don't feel like they belong in the story. Dialouges were cringeworthy. Most of the action scenes were fun but dumb. Seeing two dinosaurs fight each other is always exciting but they don't feel like a spontaneous force of nature but rather forced. The movie will be perfect for something in the background but don't deserve your full attention.

title: Star Wars/ Indiana Jones Villains w/ a few Dino's.
text: Totally missed the mark. Dinosaurs in 21st century America is interesting enough. Where are you taking me? It feels like a YouTube compilation video.This movie makes absolute no sense. It's hard to follow, uninteresting, and too much filler was a waste of our time invested.Sadly I will never watch it again which is not the case with the other films.Someone or everyone dropped the ball period.

title: I had watched the first one with my parents
text: I am 38 years old and I remember watching the first JP in the movies with my parents when it came out. It was such a great and special experience for me. Since then, every movie that comes out is worse than the previous one. But this movie is like in a category of bad movies of its own.The script is blunt, the characters are weak, the directing and thus the acting are mediocre... but that's not the worse. The worse part was the dialogues. They were completely random with poor vocabulary and lack of continuity.Thumbs up for the vfx, the photography and the sets.

title: They seriously misjudged what people want.
text: Wow, where do I start. Having been a huge fan of Jurassic Park, The Lost World and to an extent Jurassic World, it actually pained me to sit through this. What were the writers thinking and more scarily the fact that other scripts would have been rejected in favour of this one. People go to see Jurassic Park/World films to see dinosaurs, a fact seemingly lost for a lot of this film. They don't want to see modified locusts, crime syndicates (taken on by action hero Chris Pratt) or human clones. That's not what we signed up for. They seem to have thought bringing back former characters would be enough, they got it massively wrong. My hopes weren't hugely high considering the last effort but I thought they might be able to go out with a bang. It's a shame they become so preoccupied with where they wanted to take the storyline without actually thinking whether it would appeal to audiences, particularly children who just want to see their favourite dinosaur. I hope in the future they go back to the story with a prequel so we can get a sense of where it all started and can then forget this mess of a movie.

title: brimful of dinosaur action
text: I dare say if you're looking for reasons to dislike this film, as many did even with the superb original Jurassic Park, you'll find them but if you love seeing "real" dinosaurs, loads of action, first class effects plus Laura, Sam and Jeff together again, you'll have a blast. Granted it's not perfect, maybe a little too much going on at some points, not enough of the old characters and I must admit I'm not a huge fan of Bryce Dallas Howard but all in all the loyal dino loving public love it...the critics?...who cares! Of course it's over the top, it's fiction but it's fun for heavens sake! In my opinion, this instalment is a worthy finale to the "world" trilogy, although I reckon/hope there will be more!

title: I didn't believe it was this bad
text: It's pretty bad, horrible plot..all over the place. I'm a big Pratt fan, his presence seems to be limited while they are busy introducing new woke (lqbtq) characters. I got an hour in and turned it off.

title: Painful
text: Storyline/Script: Concept was alright but there are too many loopholes in the story... Claire (act by Bryce) outran Atrociraptors? The one liners were alright. Suspense? Too predictable.Acting: Best was Kayla (DeWanda). Refreshing! Worst was Owen (Chris), Claire (Bryce), Ellie (Laura) and Alan (Sam) in no sequence. They are such a pain to watch. Disappointment is an understatement.CGI: Acceptable. Not fantastic.Pace: Too slow. Felt like there is a limitations on how fast they can articulate words in their universe.Will I recommend it?: No. Skip it unless you have to watch this to finish the trilogy.

title: Where are the dinosaurs??
text: I expected more, we waited so long for this movie and it was not what I expected.Crickets took the whole movie.Well Iove dinosaurs and I love jurassic Park and world... But not this movie.

title: You'll Need The Whole Afternoon/Evening
text: Much, much too long! I wanted a bit of grip and torture, but this film went on and on and on and on and became torture in its own right. The storyline extensions were unnecessary. The points were made. The dinosaurs were not as threatening as in the earlier movies as they now live side by side with other species.

title: Mediocrity will find a way
text: This latest installment in the franchise stays true to the message of the original movie. The message is that life on earth that occurred naturally was awesome, just like the original movie. Subsequent efforts to replicate that accidental greatness in a test-tube is fated to fail catastrophically, just like this recent installment. The other part of the original message was that no matter how much money you throw at it, it will still fail.This movie has practically zero plot development and absolutely zero character development. As far as narrative structure goes, this movie's screenplay is ridiculously bad.There is no logical flow and so suspenseful situations seem obviously forced, predictable, and totally unsatisfactory.Watch it on streaming later on. Ideally, when you have company and need to run a movie as background noise to your social interaction.

title: A Disappointing Addition to an Overextended Franchise
text: Jurassic World Dominion fails to impress as a dinosaur movie, as the plot seems to be a poor choice. The dinosaurs are present but not the main focus, giving the impression that they are only there to extend the franchise. Even the inclusion of Alan Grant seems to be more for nostalgic purposes than contributing to the story. Chris Pratt's character also appears to be underutilized and serves more as a prop rather than a leading character.The camera work in the movie is particularly shoddy, with cuts from one angle to another creating confusion, especially in fast-paced scenes like the one in Malta. The depiction of Malta in the movie is also disappointing, with the country portrayed as a dirty, third-world Arabic nation covered in desert sand, which is not an accurate representation of the country. The use of Arabic style music in the background also seems out of place and unnecessary.Overall, Jurassic World Dominion seems to be a movie that was made to extend the franchise rather than being a well-planned and executed story. It is disappointing that a franchise that should have stopped by the third installment continues to churn out mediocre movies. Although the movie is not a complete disaster, it falls short of being an enjoyable watch.Additionally, the length of the movie seems to be excessive, and the dragging plot does not help in holding the audience's attention. The story's predictability adds to the monotony, leaving little to surprise or engage the viewers.As if to acknowledge the franchise's overreliance on gimmicks and sequels, Ian Malcolm's line, "Jurassic World? Not a fan," serves as a meta-commentary on the movie itself. It is a nod to the fans who have been disappointed by the franchise's recent offerings, and unfortunately, Jurassic World Dominion does little to change that sentiment.

title: When all else fails, film in the dark.
text: Awful. They tried to use a little Star Wars, a little Indiana Jones, and a couple of dinosaurs every 5 minutes to make a movie. The story is trash, the acting is mediocre, and it's all filmed in the dark. It's an insult to the rest.

title: Calm down, it's fine
text: Obviously there are plot holes but this it a good fun action movie. Lots of scenes of people getting chased by dinosaurs, lots of screaming, and nice set pieces. A fun enjoyable movie.

title: Shallow, Clich, Boring
text: I found it to be shallow, clich, and boring. Chris Pratt's character felt tired and uninterested. Sam Neill's character was nothing more than a bumbling old man.

title: What a Jurassic Disappointment.
text: I am writing this as a HUGE fan of the Jurassic Park and Jurassic World trilogies, and when I heard this was to be the last one, I was devastated. However, that was before I watched it.After the crushing disappointment of the film itself, I tend to agree that this should be the last one. The ideas appear to have dried up and it is the bits and bobs they had left over from the other films that were coddled together to make this dull and lifeless finale.The dinosaurs seemed superfluous to the actual story. In fact, it seemed like another installment of "Taken" with dinosaurs added to spice it up.It was also a nice idea to bring the cast of J. Park and J. World together, but again, it seemed just for effect. At the end of the day, there was no real reason for doing this.To conclude, while I have watched the other Jurassic films at least 3 times each, I won't be giving this one another look. I choose to remember, instead, the 5 good ones and the enjoyment I got out of watching those.

title: More Dinosaurs.
text: I personally liked this one. It's not the first of course but still holds up. I think people are to harsh these days. Give it a chance and don't judge before hand. I was a fun date night with my wife!

title: What in the hell is this muddled heap of confusion
text:
Remember how Fast and Furious used to be about cars and now it's about everything else. Well here you go.... think Taken movies, any spy movie and the amount of characters from the expendables movies ...oh and some dinosaurs.and.... Jurassic World Dominion..is created..
they try and incorporate every character in the francise...it's 2 or maybe 3 movies combined into one. It's hard to figure out what story to be interested in... i guess they put the original stars in 1 story for the old generation and the new stars in the other story for the new generation and then try and mesh it all together.

title: Super bad
text:
Worst Jurassic movie.. It is unbelievably bad. Acting is bad, direction is even worse and CGI is terrible..
Stupid token full of cringe characters making every second hard to watch. So the director thought he's gonna get 2000 ppl to act in his stupid jurassic cocktail movie, get a bunch of cartoon lookin dinosaurs, add some cheesy dialogues and everythin will work just fine. Only thing worth watching - Chris Pratt, Redhead and her beautiful Turquoise eyes.. Apart from that, it is unwatchable..This movie is for lib tards, made by a lib tard..
So sick n tired of nonsense movies..

title: Dry but fun Conclusion to the Jurassic storyline.
text: Fun action scenes and enjoyable dinosaur scenes, but that got boring too. Movie lacks a good story and it feels so dry sometimes I found myself bored a lot at the theatres while watching this insane mess. Their lack of real story makes revisiting old characters and scenes forced and dryI enjoyed it but I would rather dip my head acid then rewatch 5.5/10.

title: Fan service well done
text: If you are expecting a deep plot, you'll be disappointed. Feels a bit like Bond meets Jurassic Park, but it is gorgeous and well acted, with a LOT of nostalgia, and a good villain, so overall enjoyable, just turn your brain off.

title: Money, honey
text: In case you were wondering why this lumbering mess of a movie was made, look no further than the world-wide gross - $ 1,001,978,080 as of this writing, against an estimated budget of $165,000,000. The movie is entirely too long, with incredulous science and a "see dinosaur, run from dinosaur" script. I don't blame the actors, as actors like to work. I do blame the writers and greedy producers.Perhaps, it is time to stop milking the venerable franchise any more. It is notable that not even Steven Spielberg managed to recreate the magic of the original 1993 film in the sequel. Dinosaurs are fun to watch but not when we are being bombarded with these movies every couple of years.

title: Waste of time
text: I didn't get it why every 5 minutes new dinosaur, in addition to that the lack of suspension and the reaction to the killing creatures is like catching a cold in a bad weather. No actual plan nor script. Too bad that so many brilliant actors is in it. Weak reaction, I felt like I'm watching a children movie with a bit real scenes. You don't know where the actions begins to finish with. It's a shame so much money in waste, I couldn't feel the dangerous in addition to that the death is too close but somehow they manage to escape it easily with no actions to mentions. H. Don't watch it. Thank you.

title: A little disappointed
text: I was 4 when I watched my first ever movie in theatre, JP which has since been a childhood favourite to date and I've always made it a point to watch JP and the sequels every 1-2yrs. I had such high expectations for the epic conclusion, but left the cinema feeling disappointed. The plot was too stretched out unnecessarily with so much focus on the locusts instead of the Dino. No real battle between the Dino and humans. 80% of scenes are taken from all the previous 5 movies and put together for the conclusion. No original thoughts, lack of thrill and excitement except for the last 30mins of the movie which happens to be a remake of JP.The only saving grace was the OG casts, it was nostalgic to see them together 30yrs later. The cinematography and visuals were excellent as we would expect, but that's that. I really wished they had taken a different approach considering how the prequel ended at the Lockwood estate.Go watch it for the effects and if you're a fan. But don't have high expectations. I came home and decided to watch JP 1 & 2 to make me feel better.

title: The cure for insomnia has now been found
text: Boring rehashed terrible storyline. A very bad film. A few dinosaurs that are all blind apparently; I spent the whole film wishing it to finish.This film I believe is now the last of the franchise, Goodbye Jurassic Park. You gave me some fond memories.

title: Realistic CGI, unbelievable concept
text: Raptor car chase in Malta puts everyone on the edge. Everything about this movie, the labs, the environment, the dinos all look realistic. Unfortunately you cant sell a story where dangerous pre-historic creatures are allowed to comingle with humans. Not possible. Otherwise the movie gets a full 10/10.

title: Worst in the series
text: Don't waste your time on this. It's absolutely awful. Worst jurassic park . No story . This is hands down the worst movie I have seen in a long time.Spend your time watching the originals. I am shocked at how bad this is.

title: More Bugs Than Dinosaurs
text: If your exited to see this movie because of the dinosaurs... I feel bad for you. I went into this movie with extremely low expectations because the last movie in the Jurassic franchise absolutely ruined the name. And this one does too.The reason a lot of people were exited to see this movie was because we would get to see dinosaurs ruling the world. Yes, we do get to see that... only for about 5 minutes. Instead of Dino's ruling the world, we get to see them in a compound. Yes, a compound. Where the dinosaurs are just put into they're natural environment with invisible fences.And the last problem I have with this movie is that these locusts have more screen time than there dinosaurs do. In a movie about dinosaurs, you added insects? That is my review.I'm giving 5 stars so I can respect the name of Jurassic Park.

title: Technology wasted ...
text: All this 21st technology and you cant make better movie ?? Im very disappointed, story is very nave and acting follows it.90's trilogy can be beaten thanks to great Mr. Spielberg.

title: Like two movies in one
text: I loved this movie. To me, this movie was like two movies - first part like a James Bond with dinos and the second part more like traditional Jurassic Park. Casting was brilliant all the way around. Loved the tie in back to Dodson. For me perfect way to wrap up the trilogies and keep in spirit with Crichton's original vision and message.The only knock I have is the real3d version got a little blurry for me at times but overall the cinematography was beautifully done like all the movies in this series.

title: There's No End To Those Large Evil Global Corporations
text: I viewed this alleged end to the franchise tonight and found it mediocre to the extreme. Sure, it feeds into what dinosaur hungry audiences are expecting, but it offers nothing new and is a tiring retread of prehistory running amok in these modern times.I admit I felt bored at the beginning when scenes jumped all over the world with Jurassic World characters and Jurassic Park veterans getting introduced into the story to create a thread of what's going on. It was nice to see that combo happening, but things don't perk up until halfway through the flick.This time the evil corp. Is called 'Biosyn Genetics' which tampers with nature in more ways than one and predictably causes self destruction in the process. There's, of course, a ruthless CEO of that company who tries to profiteer from this age of large reptiles. Needless to say, that backfires just like other hungry investments before it.There's indeed a large adventure here though where escaping vicious dinosaurs is the major element, but without any intention of killing off any of them. I almost expected the ending credits to say, "No dinosaurs were harmed during the making of this film".I found the scenes with Owen Grady and Claire Dearing the major highlights of this movie. They have the best action scenes while the veterans from Jurassic Park are in more tamed down dilemmas. I guess it's due to their ages.Yeah, there's eventually destruction everywhere and a new genetically modified dinosaur thrown in for good measure. Those evil corporations never seem to learn. I'm surprised the global economy hasn't gotten bankrupt with those humungous investments into dinosaur modifications and creating gigantic sanctuaries for those beasts.I admit I'm a fan of the Jurassic franchise, but after 30 years of dinosaurs on the loose, it's pretty well worn itself out. I have no doubt a new reboot to the series will eventually happen. People don't easily get tired of dinosaurs.

title: Is this a Dinosaur movie or locust movie.?
text: I am from Chennai and a big fan of Tamil cinema (Kollywood industry). They just ended the series of events (2000 movies) with the agriculture concept against corporate and unlucky to see Hollywood starting the same cliche concept now...There was no good continuity within the series. I hoped a battle between humans and dinosaurs to coexist where there will be a lot of small events and experience from several characters but the output is totally different.It was atleast starting well and moves inside a lab and island with no special meal for the core Jurassic audience. There was no special to bring back all the old characters and it ended cliche again.It's a full collapse and definitely a bad ending to the Jurassic Series. I m frustrated finally.

title: Not a Grand Finale in Any Way
text: While I, like the majority of film lovers, absolutely love the original Jurassic Park, I've basically felt like I've given the majority of the franchise pass, rather than genuinely believing they're great films. The only other film I genuinely think is a solid entry is the first Jurassic World (which in itself isn't original at all). I've felt that the sense of awe and wonder has been missing since the original film and with the release of the "final" installment with Jurassic World Dominion, I was eager to see how they would put a bow on the franchise at least. Sadly, I have to be honest and say this is probably my least favourite of the entire franchise. Let's dive into why I think fans should still see this movie, but with incredibly lowered expectations.Picking up about four years after the events of Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom, dinosaurs are now free in our world and living amongst humans and other species. From here, there are multiple storylines that pick up that are not explored in the marketing for this film, so I'll keep it brief. Maisie Lockwood, the young girl from the previous film has been living with Owen and Claire in protective custody, but she is kidnapped and a rescue mission for her begins. Not only that, but the offspring of Owen's companion Blue is also with her. We then meet the original cast, who are on their own mission. Eventually, these two missions collide, but overall, I think this entire film was a missed opportunity.I felt as though this film spent next to zero time explaining what happened in between the events of the previous film and this final installment. This isn't even me getting my hopes up, because we've already seen dinosaurs on land before, so I truly believe a portion of this film should've been dedicated to people trying to survive or figuring out how to. With that said, there are still many unique ideas presented here that I thought were clever story developments, but I also found that the film failed to deliver on them, especially since they didn't work for a Jurassic Park film. That's also one of my biggest pet peeves when it comes to massive franchises. When you present cool ideas, but they don't actually work in the context of the franchise, that just feels wildly disappointing.On a more positive note, I'm a fan of Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Laura Dern, Sam Neill, and Jeff Goldblum, so seeing them, all come together here was a lot of fun and some of their banter got some genuine laughs out of me. With that said, I actually believe newcomer DeWanda Wise as Kayla was the biggest standout here. Her witty dialogue and back and forth with Pratt throughout a lot of the film was terrific and I will gladly watch her performances in the future. It's always nice to have a new character added to a franchise that surprises you. If for nothing else, this was a great cast of characters to see together.Now for the dinosaurs, which were severely lacking in this film. This franchise, even in its weaker installments, has never had a shortage of Dinosaur action. Yes, this film has plenty of action involving Dinosaurs, some of which are genuinely fun, but I have to admit that the core story of this film really came out of left field for me, and not in a good way. I'm not about to dive into the details, because these details aren't even explored in the marketing, but I'll say that the main storyline focuses very little on Dinosaurs. For the end of a Dinosaur franchise, this rubbed me the wrong way. I couldn't comprehend why this story element was even being explored. It was basically what made me dislike this film overall, even though I enjoyed moments of it.In the end, Jurassic World Dominion isn't going to gain any new fans for the franchise, but at least the entire cast is here, having a good time, and it shows. I was excited to see Colin Trevorrow returning to direct, after working on the first Jurassic World, but even his touch didn't work here. The score didn't stand out to me either and the climax was very forgettable, especially being the "finale" of a franchise. I wish I had more positive things to say about a franchise that I have enjoyed until this point, but I honestly don't. Jurrasic Park fans will absolutely get a kick out of certain scenes so I recommend that fans still see it, but as a movie on its own, it's just not good.
