title: Jurrassic World: Deplorable
text: Ridiculous piece of tosh that would insult the intelligence of an amoeba. A mish-mash of all the worst, corniest bits of all the other movies, plus some extra ham, vomit-inducing love trieste, and a side-order of completely unbelievable "science".

title: These type of movies are supposed to be at least entertaining!
text: Here I will talk about the whole franchise started from 2015.The first and second one (with their story issues) are at least entertaining, and the story of them are similar to each other.The third one has a similar story for the third time!!! It failed to do the basic thing for these type of movies which is to be entertaining (Unless some action moments)!!! The story here is the worst in the franchise and the movie is too long.

title: Entertaining
text: Nice movie. A lot of action and funny moments. Great to see some actors from the first movies. Jeff is amazing in this role. The references to the original franchise are a nice touch.

title: Chris Pratt $#!+
text: These Jurassic world films are really disgraceful cash grabs. Sure the dinosaurs look great in 4k rendered CGI, but this was not Spielbergs vision at all. They should have stopped after JP3. So many things annoy me about the JW films... number one being Chris Pratt: who died and made him dinosaur Jesus?! I wish blue would rip him a new one. Now that would be top notch cinema. The other characters are just uninteresting & uninspiring to say the least.It was nostalgic seeing Sam Neill , Laura Dern, & Jeff Goldblum back in action. Unfortunately the writing for this dominion film was an abomination. Giant CGI locusts taking over the world. Come on. I watched it for the old cast but they really need to stop and give this worn out franchise a break. Just like Star Wars, stop ruining a good thing!!!

title: The Jurassic era
text: I love the first Jurassic Park (1993), and I thought Jurassic Park: The Lost World (1997) and Jurassic Park 3 (2001) both were just ok.I thought Jurassic World (2015) was dumb fun and I thought Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018) was the worst one in the Jurassic Park/World movie series.Jurassic World: Dominion (2022) was the of the Jurassic Park/World movie series, and it is....I thought Jurassic World: Dominion (2022) was better than Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018). Jurassic World: Dominion (2022) has plot issues, it does not have a clear connection with the last movie, but it has fun and entertaining scenes.I will not give any spoilers. The main plot is not what we thought it could have been and what we from this movie with the dinosaurs are in some action scenes, but not in the whole movie.Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard are both good in the movie and cool seeing them in action or suspenseful scenes. The original cast from Jurassic Park (1993) return and its great seeing them Interact with the Jurassic World cast.I loved the return of Sam Neill as Alan Grant, Laura Seen as Ellie Sattler, and Jeff Goldblum as Ian Malcolm. They were all good and I liked seeing them and the Jurassic World cast work together in the 3rd act against the main villain dinosaur.The action scenes are fun to watch and there are suspenseful scenes involving some dinosaurs. The dinosaurs look good and have nice effects, I also saw some interesting looking dinosaurs with unique designs that look cool.The big problem of the movie is the main plot and how it changes a certain story that was in the past film. I thought the beginning of the movie was slow, but it starts to pick up once it starts to go through the 2nd act and the 3rd act.The movie has references to the first Jurassic Park (1993), and the 3rd act was fun to watch. The 3rd act was suspenseful and cool seeing all the main characters from Jurassic Park and Jurassic World interacting and working together to stop the main dinosaur threat.The ending of the movie was confusing, and I did not know how we were led to it. Jurassic World: Dominion (2022) has an ok ending the movie series and was better than the last movie, but I think this could have been better if they gave us more of what we wanted and did not have a side plot in the way.

title: Lasted 20mins
text: Went to the movie theatre with zero expectations, somehow the beginning was worse than the already low bar. Following unlikeable characters, seemingly having the audience root for the dinosaurs and/or have sympathy for 'something' which is unclear. Spends too much time trying to make cgi dinosaurs likeable when we have no reason to care. Honestly glad I didn't spend money to see the movie, the trailers before the film were more engaging than this.

title: Full circle and new characters
text: Full of entertainment and action. Despite the negative reviews or Pratt and his hand, hubby and I enjoyed it. New characters, old characters in a world where humans/dinos need to live together. I am surprised that Neill, Dern and Goldblum came back. I thought that part was left behind because they "started" the park and it ended in diaster and Jurassic World is the next step with new characters. I hoped they would come back. Pratt and his hand did not bother me one bit because that is what one does when meeting a dog or cat. The animal sniffs the hand to recognize the smell of a person. The movie was enjoyable.

title: A Physically Paining Movie.
text: The Jurassic Park/World saga is based on the novel "Jurassic Park" by Michael Crichton. Crichton's novel is science fiction with the nuance of being able to discern what is possible with science and science what is not. The previous Jurassic Park/World's all have this movie, the only one that does not is Dominion. Dominion instead lacks the nuance that helped differentiate Jurassic Park, instead they made a fantasy movie that makes little sense. The only reason this movie doesn't have a lower rating is due to how stunning the cgi and visuals are (and there were a few jokes from Pratt and the pilot that made me laugh). Overall, pretty mediocre, I'm not going to tell you what to do, but I would not pay 30 dollars to watch this movie in a movie theater.

title: T Rex vs Terminator vs Alien
text: ... would have been a better plot for this movie. Instead we have the cast of Our Heroes, who spend the movie being Care Bears and running away from dinosaurs. Of course, we know that none of them will get eaten. That's reserved for the bad guys, like the Tim Cook lookalike running his evil empire. The dinosaurs are the most inept predators that ever evolved, as they signal they're stalking you by rumbling and gurgling. Then, before they bite, they always pause for a roar, allowing Our Heroes to escape. I kept falling asleep during this epic yawnfest.In a desperate attempt to salvage this dino dump, they had to add in some giant grasshoppers. But, that failed to fix it.The problem is, there's just nothing interesting happening. Wander around aimlessly, get stalked by dinos, run, dinos give chase, dinos corner them, dinos stop to roar, let heroes escape. Repeat again and again and again...

title: Stop it
text: Stop making these movies.Chris Pratt and Bryce Howard, how are they still in this franchise?Just stop it, reboot, fire the writers, start all over again.

title: Movie 3/5
text:
-Why wasn't the prologue added to complete the starting story of Jurassic world Dominion.-Post Prologue the Trex theatre scene isn't added and made the story incomplete.-Why wasn't the last fight bought those 2 other Trex
to merge with rexy to kill the Giga..-Animation in this movie is Awesome..

title: Let down...
text: The 10 minutes of combined action scenes that were actually riveting were not worth the long, corny, and plotless rest of the movie. Wasn't this supposed to be a darker, more moody dinosaur movie? The only mood was boredom.

title: Laughable
text: This was a fun movie, and I do not regret seeing it in theaters. That's about the only good thing to say about Jurassic World.The the story is pretty bad, the characters feel inauthentic, and the dialogue is poorly written at times. Seriously, we were laughing out loud in the theater at times. As far as characters go, Chris Pratt does well with a subpar script. The entire movie would be better off is Maisie was left out. Her character was written to have absolutely no personality at all.There were missed opportunities to showcase the different dinosaurs as well. These movie leans pretty hard on nostalgia, and missed some low hanging fruit to show nods towards the dinosaur traits we saw in Jurassic Park.

title: Bad script with a few Dino's
text: Tried to get cute by bringing back the original characters ( who are also dinosaurs). Storyline was too predictable and too much screen time for sentimental stuff and not enough screen time for the dinosaurs. Why do the end scenes always include a T Rex fight? Can't the writers come up with anything different?Seems like it's time to put the whole Jurassic franchise to bed!

title: In My Eyes a very Satisfying Conclusion to the Jurassic Park Franchise
text: The Jurassic World Franchise has stayed steady with both the 1st and Fallen Kingdom being great. With Jurassic World Dominon it follows the same suit its really interesting to see how Dinosaurs are like in the Real World "coexisting" with Humans and how that has affected the World. Now although I will say there are moments where seeing Dinosaurs is lacking but it goes all out in the conclusion with the Dinosaurs with a great climax with all the beloved characters we've come to know come together. And the new and Returning characters we met also are a great addition to the story so while some are saying this movie isn't good i give this movie the approval to go see in Theaters.

title: Beating a dead dinosaur...
text: This feels like some B sharknado movie, only with a bigger budget. Completely ridiculous and stupid.Copy of the first movie, just longer and worse.I have a bad feeling this series will walk in Fast and Furious's footsteps.

title: was ok, not my favorite film from the franchise
text: I've loved all the jurrasic movies from the get go, this movie was a bit of let down. I felt they tried to take a little bit of the last 5 movies and throw it in one film.The story line is what let it down to me, I feel there is some good elements in the story line but it just didn't work for me, didnt have the same feel for the last films. The ending feels rushed.Love the return on the original characters from jurrasic park and characters from jurrasic world feel they made it worth watching in all honesty.All in all if your a jurrasic fan still worth watching I guess the films been worked up so much as the ending to the franchise its missed the boat a bit.

title: Too short but overall good
text: I wish they kept more things that were cut from the original piece. People forgot that this isnt the og trilogy. If you go to see this movie thinking its a jp film you're failing it without trying. You have to realize the original is over. We're in a new era. Without spoilers I wish they kept a large amount of cut scenes. Not only do I want to see more dinosaurs they cut some cool ones. Only big complaints is beta looks a bit stiff in some scenes and while I understand the story is about locusts I feel they got a bit too much screen time.

title: Nostalgia can fix this trash, right? Right??
text: You know the movie will be bad when you see so much "nostalgia" elements from the original movie placed together - the main original cast is kinda main here, some quotes and almost quotes from the original, even the spitting scene recreation... Well even with these, the movie is just bad and boring... The original movie was a huge hit, unique movie in concept (ok, based on book), ridiculously good VFX and pretty good script. I'm not saying the rest are bad because of my nostalgia ( i love the 3rd one because it was probably my first movie in the theaters) , but they stopped putting real efford in each next movie.So to go back to this.... thing. Lets start with the ONLY good thing. It has superb sound design. DTS:X pops up amazingly in here, tho if i have to be nitpicking, it can be even better esp during the locust flying scenes.And.. that's about it. The script is plain stupid. You turn to watch dinosaurs, and half the story is about cloned person and grasshoppers' problems. Dialogues are very stupid at some points, esp the Dodgeson's ones. And i bet the actor is not bad , it is the scipt that makes him look meh.VFX are not impressive. Definitely not cheap CGI, but you don't expect them to be cheap and bad... Yet you wont be wowed at all, compared even to the 2015 movie. 7 years later... which is a long time, yet the visuals are kinda the same (tad better but not much).Scenario is meh. No Character arch, no development, just nostalgic sentences and clich after clich .It would have beeen much better movie if it wasn't sooooo long. I still don't get it why they keep making movies with 2:20h+ ... it's good if you have amazing story , but if you don't it's tiresome and boring. 2 hours and a half is like 40 mins longer than it should have been with such story and script. I'd give it probably 5 if it was 1:50. Tho 4 is too much i think, i'd say my rating woud be 3.5/10 for this, mostly because of the very good sound.Definitely the worst one in the franchaise, tho i bet they will continue making these because the cow has a lot of milk to give.

title: Better off watching A Bug's Life....
text: Rather than get to see dinosaurs in communities across the world or impacting the very fabric of our lives, we get to learn a whole lot about insects. It is a misguided misdirect as we don't really see how the world has been changed all that much by the prehistoric creatures as the film gets narrower and narrower in focus the more it goes on. All the potential awe and terror of dinosaurs taking over the planet is lost in the shuffle, making for a massively missed opportunity. It is utterly misguided from the outset, doomed by its own inexplicable unwillingness to embrace its potential as it all descends into a dawdling disaster. Life couldn't find a way out of this mess.

title: Disappointing
text: Just got round to seeing Jurrasic Park 6. I was liking the movie when I thought it was doing a good job of following up the terrible last movie, and trying to remind everyone of the original by actually having a plot. But it falls apart in the second half after a dumb twist.There's a cool raptor motorbike chase and the effects overall are great. With some practical effects sneaking their way in there. But as it goes on it focuses too much on a "locust" plot, and forgets that bringing the original cast back is pointless. If you don't put them up against the original dinosaurs.There are some nostalgic moments that I loved. But the finale I hoped for is ruined by random dinosaurs turning up when all fans really wanted was a rematch or showdown.

title: One Of The Good Films Of The Year
text: Jurassic World Dominion is a good with a quite a problematic final chapter to a second trilogy of Jurassic World/Park franchise with an obvious helps from the three original cast though they not did used them perfectly but it's not horribly either, an unconvincing early topic and performance from new and main characters but as the time goes it works just fine, a great and satisfying enough CGI action especially the final battle, it is very nice to see Alan, Ellie, and Malcolm back on it again and it will be pretty much make the fans happy enough like me, as of Owen and Claire they did just as fine as the previous one (not a big fan of them in the first Jurassic World), so overall Jurassic World Dominion is quite a nice theater experience, it's the longest in the franchise and enjoy it thoroughly, and as the movie itself, it's good.

title: Boring, tedious, played out.
text: This movie didn't make any sense whatsoever. Characters would often forget that they had guns and just run away from raptors (and somehow outrun them). The plot was asinine from the start. The leads aren't even trying anymore. God this movie was awful.

title: No plot roller coaster ride
text: This movie is so bad, it's almost tolerable. It doesn't even pretend to have a plot, it's completely incoherent and the direction is absurd to the point that at some point you stop remarking on the nonsensical scenes - like someone emerging from an icy lake bone dry and completely warm - and just accept that it's basically, literally a roller coaster ride taking you from one contrived scene to another. No stars die, all the minorities are virtuous, the laws of physics literally don't apply (you can crash a plane and emerge unscathed), dinosaurs don't act like animals but like WWF performers fighting for our amusement, you get the point. This movie was cranked out simply to get your money. So lower your expectations way, way down because this is probably the worst movie of this franchise -and that's quite a low bar.

title: So unfortunate for such an iconic franchise.
text: People slate the second film in the franchise have obviously never seen this one. Bought the collectors 4K/UHD boxset special edition so looking forward to the final instalment in the franchise only to be let down. Some great ideas not executed with any flare. "Bad guys and girls" with the backbone of a jellyfish. Not sure how the world managed to be plagued by dinosaurs that can't swim the Atlantic the Pacific or Indian ocean.It would have made a very interesting 007 movie. I can actually see a James Bond V the dinosaurs but the 007 franchise has never jumped the shark? *cough" Moonraker...

title: Nothing new or innovative....
text: The two-minute first trailer of the movie is much better and much more enjoyable as compared to the two-hour movie.Nothing new..even the reactions of dinosaurs are imitated, repeated and repetitive.I watched the trailer many times..but I can't watch the movie twice.The two-minute first trailer of the movie is much better and much more enjoyable as compared to the two-hour movie.Nothing new..even the reactions of dinosaurs are imitated, repeated and repetitive.I watched the trailer many times..but I can't watch the movie twice.The two-minute first trailer of the movie is much better and much more enjoyable as compared to the two-hour movie.Nothing new..even the reactions of dinosaurs are imitated, repeated and repetitive.I watched the trailer many times..but I can't watch the movie twice.The two-minute first trailer of the movie is much better and much more enjoyable as compared to the two-hour movie.Nothing new..even the reactions of dinosaurs are imitated, repeated and repetitive.I watched the trailer many times..but I can't watch the movie twice.................................................................................................................................................................................................................

title: Dino disappointment
text: Movie needs to be redone. The story line was bad. The enemies were random. Bad CGI. The dinosaurs weren't even a thing. There were some good scenes but not enough to out weigh the bad scenes. Movie jumped around a lot and felt hurried and half assed.

title: Embarrasingly bad
text: Having enjoyed the previous Jurassic Park movies we had high hopes for this one but - we left 30 minutes into the movie. Bad acting, sloppy one liners, disastrously bad effects. Not worth the trip to the cinema.

title: Lost of identity
text: A classic example of writers struggling to find a movie's identity, it is so inconsistent and it feels that several genres where mashed up inside a 2 hour film.I can't say that I am a major fan of the saga, of course the first one (the original Jurassic Park) is a major classic within Hollywood and it was a pioneer specially on the special effects department, holding pretty good still for today's standards, but even back then the plot was nothing special, something I noticed after re-watching the entire saga.The subsequent sequels are very average and the revival with Jurassic World, is all right I guess, it's mostly an eye candy due to the special effects achievements but it continues the trend of a reusable plot: how can a catastrophe like what happens after the first movie, doesn't get properly addressed by the world organizations and people somehow continue to mess up and getting people killed over the same mistakes while dealing with the dinosaurs?For me that's what bothers me the most and makes the sequels kind of pointless, Jurassic World: Last Kingdom takes this ridiculous plots to a whole new level which bring us to the pinnacle of distortion of the Jurassic saga; the third installment, Dominion is the one that feels less like a Jurassic Park movie, put simply it disregards the dinosaurs and tries to depict a world where they now roam free and we Humans need to adapt to this reality.It is ridiculous that they exploited the saga to this point, but even worse, most scenes don't even bring much to the table about the supposedly discussed topic, they are filled with a mix of generic traffic villains that in a matter of a couple of years develop fantastic technologies that allow them, to transport dinosaurs and create a criminal underworld around this, yet another super advanced technical company that is trying to make the world better with a dinosaur sanctuary (sounds familiar?) while making terrible mistakes, bringing the original actors for a soulless film doesn't save anything.Some sagas and movies are better left alone, no sequels, no remakes, no spin offs, I am not saying that this doesn't work anytime, because it does but if you don't have a good story leave it as it is.

title: Really good movie
text: I like the story. Of course there was a lot of fan service and eastereggs, but I thought it was okay. It's nice that the old characters were so involved. The effects were great, many cool but creepy new dinos.I really liked it.

title: Life finds a way... jurassic world no...
text: This maybe is one of a few times i write a review but i feel the duty to do it because of the disappointment i got by this movie.Totally predictable and empty. When you kill realism you kill your movie.Has some good times but when they achieve them they ruin them.If i was alan or one of the old actors that made Jurassic park such a success i wont even think of participating in this movie.Definitely not deserve to spend money on a theater for this. Only at your home and even there not at Saturday or Sunday night. I'd say only for the shake of the actors to see it on a typical Monday to Friday night.Again i was a big fan of Jurassic series but this is a waste of time.

title: Greatest hits... and misses
text: Let's face it, if you're here for the dinosaurs you'll have a nice time. There's plenty of them in the movie and as the title suggests, they are poised to rule the world. Other than that though, this is a mediocre plot at best.After a good setup in the previous films, the writers missed an opportunity to ask the big questions that were fascinating about the Spielberg original. Instead they go to familiar terrority and we are again put in some park with some evil scientist billionaire, treading worn out paths and scenes we've seen before, with too many coincidences and bad plot twists. A lot of misses are seen between this greatest hits show, most notably the bigger questions on genetics. And nostalgia is not enough to save it.Let's spare the actors because they had to work with this script and did their best, and of course the special effects team because, hey, dinosaurs right?So if you're here for those dinosaurs, they're good. But be prepared, and in the vain of chaos theorist Ian Malcolm (Goldblum): you'll probably root for them instead of humanity after this bit.

title: This was a perfect ending!
text: This was certainly a good ending to the amazing series! I loved every minute of it and although the begin was just a tad bit slow, I'd say it was more of a calm before the storm situation, which I loved. I also enjoyed how they brought together the original Jurassic Park cast and Jurassic World cast and no one felt out of place. This is definitely a must see, but make sure to catch up on the entire series before seeing the new one.

title: About What I Expected...
text: Okay but the need to top other JP movies results in an over the top movie with over the top story lines and over the top special effects. Way too busy, way too loud way too many moments of shaky cam shots. Shaky cam us a cheap substitute for action. Combined it might be good if you love the series but if you're looking for a well told story and you're not a big fan of the series I'd recommend you not waste your time.

title: 99% Marketing 1% filmmaking
text: Went to movies to watch this...after 30 minutes I heard one kid crying and telling his parents that he is bored and wants to go home..Need I say more?

title: Poor
text:
A few days after seeing this and honestly cannot remember it, sadly its very forgettable and brings nothing new to franchise, even III is better!Such a shame as been waiting months to see it
I actually nearly left  way through.

title: A Fitting Finale to the Franchise!
text: After reading so many negative reviews, I felt I must speak up. I've seen every film in the theater, and have enjoyed them all! After "Fallen Kingdom," this was exactly the type of ending I was expecting. It was awesome seeing characters from the originals and the newer ones working together to survive; it was great seeing some new characters introduced, who held their own with the stars; and it was nostalgic seeing some of the original dinosaurs from the first trilogy, along with newer species. I think the story made sense, the jerky villain got what he deserved, there were incredible dinosaur fights, and our beloved characters got as happy an ending as was possible.

title: Dino-bore
text: When I watch a film in the Jurassic series I want to see tense encounters between humans and dinosaurs. What I don't want to see is story about a clone child and genetically engineered locusts. Sadly, that's what we get with Jurassic World Dominion. Quite why those involved in the development thought this was the direction to take is anybodies guess but unsurprisingly, it doesn't work. I could live with this is the plot served as nothing more than a means to take us from dino encounter to another but it doesn't. Instead the dinosaurs feel almost like they are an afterthought.When the dino action arrives it generally is pretty good but there just isn't enough of it to elevate the film above its dull plot. And some of the thrill of the chase is lost. In the past films there was always that element of tension as you knew that the protagonists probably hadn't shaken off the threat of the T-Rex, Velociraptor or Spinosaurus. None of that exists here though as in an attempt to just cram in as many different dinosaurs as possible, almost every different action sequence involves a different dinosaur. For me this removed all tension. Even the films supposed big bad, the Giganotosaurus, is given an underwhelming amount of screen-time.I'm probably being a bit generous giving this a 4 but as a dino nerd and a JP fan, there is still a bit of a thrill seeing dinosaurs in action, even if the overall quality of the film is poor.

title: Top 3 worst movie ever
text: Writing. Acting. Editing. Even the music. This is as pointless a movie as you will EVER see. And I really like the other Jurassic movies. This feels like a really expensive B movie.Random example - there's a scene where Jeff Goldblum's character runs and jumps on a ladder, he is up about 2 feet then slips. Alan Grant grabs his hand when he's falling and delivers an ultra dramatic "I got you." Got you from what? Slipping 23" down a ladder? They way they cut the scene makes it look like Goldblum is up near the top of the ladder. If that's true, he should be in the NBA because he could easily dunk on like a 14ft hoop.If lifetime movie network made a film for $185 million, this is it!

title: Not that bad actually
text: Just saw it and it's definitely good. A good movie to see to start off the summer. Whether this is the end of the franchise or not it was still very entertaining. A well written and has good action scenes. Just wanted to give my honest opinion and say that I actually liked it.

Otherwise, the plot surrounding it is poor, dull scenes and conversations, humor doesn't hit, predictable story with tons of tropes.Basically, watch this in theaters to see some impressive CGI dinosaurs tear stuff up, because thats where I felt like I was enjoying the movie, and theres plenty of that thankfully. title: Uninspired story. Outdated. Waste of money and resources.
text:
I don't recall how high or low I rated the entire franchise. But this is easily the worst of the bunch.Some scenes are reminiscent of other movies.So after all the previous movies you would expect the characters to grow on you. But that isn't the case. So while in the first one you would be scared of something happening to a person. Well at this point you all have seen it before and are not that involved anymore.That was the main strength of the first one. And other movies with animal predators. But it soon becomes we have seen this before.....
The script is put together with tape and nuts and bolts. It doesn't have a clear view... it is only there to show of the advance of special effects ...
Nothing wrong with that but nothing really special to be seen there.What the writers thought as funny. Let pigeons get caught by a dinosaur instead of getting hit by a truck at a wedding.. only adds to the feeling that you all have seen it before..
While the first time it is funny..the second time it isn't...In short I find it disrespectful towards the viewer to add zero originality to a movie which setting offers limitless possibilities. Instead they decided to play peek-a-boo with a baby like grannies do... The granny should understand that the baby who has never seen dinosaurs grows up and now needs more.

title: Survival movie
text: Story is based on one thing mostly - how to survive if a bloodthirsty predator lures around you. But it's OK actually, scenes are thrilling, dinosaurs are vivid and look real. Nice to see known characters again and follow the path how dinosaurs and people will coexist on Earth.Best escape award: Bryce Dallas Howard vs the Therizinosaurus (long-clawed dino).

title: Childhood Friends Visiting You in College
text: As a fan of the Jurassic films and anything starring Chris Pratt, Jurassic World: Dominion was a celebratory reunion. Seeing Pratt's Owen and Sam Neill's Dr. Grant on the same screen was exciting. Though at times it felt like when your childhood friends visit you in college; fun at first, but things could go stale quickly.The action sequences were well choreographed, and the dinosaurs looked remarkable. The core plot was straightforward and easy to follow, though some of the side stories were irrelevant. I left the theater grateful for one specific actor, as he was the most entertaining and charismatic performer on screen: Jeff Goldblum. Every scene with Goldblum's Ian Malcolm was witty and engaging.Jurassic World: Dominion has everything you look for in a big summer blockbuster: great actors, big special effects, and a bit of nostalgia. Unfortunately, this movie was too bloated and overstuffed to keep my interest. The subplots were nonsensical and kept dragging out. I believe there were more scenes in this movie than any other film in recent memory, and that's not a good thing. The movie should have been 20-30 minutes shorter.The acting was poor, especially from the one Oscar winner in the bunch. There were character moments that could have been chill-inducing (i.e., Spider-Man: No Way Home) but those scenes fell flat. Even the score was unsatisfying, only using elements of John Williams' masterpiece a handful of times. Ultimately, the sloppy editing, uninspiring villain and lackluster performances left me disengaged and disappointed.The Jurassic films hold a special place in cinema history. Watching the park as it's being created (Jurassic Park) and then seeing it operational (Jurassic World) are some of my favorite cinematic memories. The charm that is present in those specific films is because of the awe-inspiring dinosaurs paired with calamity. Sadly, Jurassic World: Dominion falls prey to a tired concept and a well run dry. Is it the worst film in the franchise? No, I don't think so. That place is reserved for The Lost World: Jurassic Park.

title: Failed to live up to high standards
text: I'll start by saying I absolutely love this franchise and I've watched the previous films countless times but unfortunately I can't see me watching this one again. The plot being fairly simple in that another evil corporation looks to exploit dinosaurs that now live along side humans for ultimate power. They require the offspring of the Raptor "Blue" and Maisie who's backstory was she was cloned in the previous film. The only positive was seeing Laura Dern, Jeff Golblum and Sam Neill reprising their roles from the original films. The story itself just lacks any imagination or magic that we've come to expect and really feels like a very lazy screenplay. If lesser actors were involved my opinion of this film would be much lower. Overall it's such a disappointment and an absolute shame that these actors were involved in project that is so flat. Sorry but I'd give this a miss if you love the previous films.

title: Ruined the Franchise
text: I had high hopes for this movie. The first three Jurassic Park movies were good. The first Jurassic World was good. This last one was the absolute worst. It looked like a takeoff of Jurassic Park movies.I thought having the three main characters from the first movie, along with B. D. Wong along with the two main characters from Jurassic World would be great to see. Neither group had any chemistry with the other group. It was clear that Chris Pratt was out of his league. And while I really like Bryce Dallas Howard, she was not given nearly enough to do. The whole idea of dinosaurs taking over the world just seems hokey to me.Don't waste your time.

title: An epic and dignified end to Steven Spielberg's jurassic saga
text: After almost 30 years, the saga created by Steven Spielberg comes to an end in this latest adventure. The duo of Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard are accompanied by the great return of Sam Neil, Laura Lern and Jeff Goldblum after many years. With exciting action sequences and special effects that do not disappoint at all. Dinosaurs are still the biggest entertainment and can even be seen in action in the human population. I think this was a worthy end to the saga, since I seriously think it gave it the ending it deserved and bringing together the protagonists of these 2 trilogies was a good way to conclude this Jurassic saga. The truth considered that it is worth seeing the end of this saga that has been with us since the 90s and will forever remain one of the best sagas in the world of cinema. My final rating for this movie is 10/10.

title: For those complaining about the locusts...
text: ...you may not have understood what Fallen Kingdom was trying to say. Ian clearly calls out genetic power and what we're to happen if it circled the globe. Cataclysmic change like death and while most feel it was a metaphor for climate change, it was actually a warning of the locusts. The technology learned from dinos being applied to something seemingly without worry turning Into a global disaster. I'm sure you can read other things Into it if you want but looking at it from a pure plot written standpoint, it was a fitting storyline to add.As for the rest of the film , solid acting, directing and action. I think the idea of keeping the prologue separate from the film turned out to be a bad one as it would have played out better as the start of the movie. The beginning is a bit off because of it but what comes after is fantastic. I hope Universal provides a directors cut or whatever the original vision was because it would make a difference. Solid 8 out of 10 and I plan to see it again as It's easily worth the price of admission!*Update* After watching the film 3 times in the theater and multiple times on digital, I've updated it to a 10 out of 10. For it's time frame, the film moves briskly and the second viewing corrected whatever the issues I had originally with the beginning. The action sequences, especially the motorcycle chase, are phenomenal and bringing the two casts together was done so well, I get a kick out of seeing the OG players every time. Especially Sam Neill.As for the Owen/Claire saga, it was concluded very well and ties up every theme presented in the two films before. Im excited to see the extended cut because I want even MORE!! Can;t get enough of Dominion!

title: Predictable and dull

This film doesn't even come close.It's hard to know which is worse, the poor plot or the tired acting. JG looks totally bored which is a real shame as his character was just perfect in JP. SN and LD go through the motions, CP and BDH just add to the mediocrity. The CGI is no longer jaw dropping, we've just seen these dinosaurs too many times now. I'm just glad I didn't waste my money on a cinema ticket. My advice is to avoid this film it's just not worth your time.

title: The dangers of genetic engineering
text: What a great film. This will one day seem like a documentary on the dangers of genetic engineering and the horrors wrought upon us by companies like Monsanto.Nightmares await for all of humankind, from living terrors that will destroy our ecosystems-and by extension, us-to greed-fueled monopolies with control of our government and our entire food supply.I would encourage everyone to do some reading on Monsanto. It is incredible that so few people know about the company, considering it now owns almost the entire agricultural industry in the United States. They destroy families and bankrupt independent farmers over "copyrighted seeds," which is an absurd concept on its face. Learn, and stand up against corporate tyranny.

title: Poor editing, poor acting, poor writing, poor film
text: This movie has no passion, had no heart, no magic or inspiration. At no point did I have any emotional connection to the film or its characters. There were times I covered my face in embarrassment with lines like Laura derns "he slid in my DMs." Jokes fell flat, plot points made little sense, and there were even times where the special effects were laughable. Jeff goldblum was the only actor skilled enough to inject any life into the story, but even with Neil, Dean, and himself everything about this movie fell flat. I had heard Michael Crichtons inspiration for Jurassic Park was Frankenstein, I'm just glad Michael isn't around to see what they did with his monster.Hollywood leave this franchise alone, you've done enough damage already.

title: Felt like a lame reunion as opposed to a film with much in the way of point or purpose
text: I'll admit that I didn't realise that there was a film in between this one and Jurassic World which at least explains why I found some elements of this film puzzling. Once I've seen Fallen Kingdom I may revisit this review once I'm able to piece things together better...Having said that I still maintain that even films that are part of a franchise should still carry enough wait to work as standalone films (after all not everybody is going to watch all the films and may not watch them in the correct order as I erroneously did).No matter how you approach Dominion it is very long and in all honesty pretty dull. I really enjoyed Jurassic World and liked the earlier films (except Jurassic Park 3 which was far too stupid to be enjoyable). As well as being way too long and containing far too little action the actual product that is presented here is messy and convoluted; here we find ourselves travelling all across the globe and we get fragments of several stories which never really materialise in to an interesting completed article.Whilst it's great to see the likes of Jeff Goldblum, Sam Neill and Laura Dern back here a dynamic and energy that once existed seems to be lacking in this film (this is most noticeable in Sam Neill, whom, as with Jurassic Park 3) looks like he wants to be anywhere but in this film. I believe Jeff Goldblum was in the previous film, but even so bringing these 3 characters back felt like a forced attempt at nostalgia. A quirky dynamic existed between Pratt and Howard in Jurassic World which is totally absent in this film (it has to be said that this film is also a lot more pompous and serious than Jurassic World which is another huge negative).I give the film some credit for throwing in some interesting ideas; such as dinosaurs that hunt, track and kill humans once a laser is locked on to a subject's scent. Also the scientist using a swarm of locusts as a bio weapon to destroy humanity. Unfortunately in a film like Dominion these intriguing concepts are not given the focus or the development to really make the film worthy of an investment of 150 minutes of your time.As I said I may revisit this review when I've watched Fallen Kingdom, but for now this is pretty much how I saw things with Dominion and I can't say that I was very impressed tbh.

title: The modern audience is too negative
text: Just finished watching the film after reading so so many negative reviews about it over the past week. I went into this already feeling disappointed. But I've learnt a valuable lesson today - the audiences in this day and age are so hard to please, even if the original Jurassic park were to come out today people would probably give that negative reviews too.Don't believe what you read from the masses. I thought this film was excellent and was a great send off for the "world" trilogy. It gave me goosebumps, it made me feel wonder, sadness, surprise and fear. Sound familiar?? Another film does that too. It's called Jurassic Park.I'm by no means saying this film is as good as the original. But it is MILES better than Fallen Kingdom and I actually think this film merged the original cast with the recent very well. Both groups were integral to the plot and actually contributed. They used their nightmare experience from the first film and used it to survive.I could go on and write another 1000 words to this review challenging people who say "there wasn't enough dinosaurs. Too much focus on people" and to that I say - if that's what you want then go watch the walking with dinosaurs movie.. this isn't a Dino documentary. It's a science fiction film which involved HUMANS creating dinosaurs from DNA. People and their selfish motivations are kind of important to how the entire series has worked thus far.If you're reading this review and haven't seen the film because you've been put off by all the negativity - then please, go and see the film and judge for yourself. Don't be the negativesaurus that so many seem to be these days.And yes, I did just say Negativesaurus. I'm using it now.

title: A zombie of a film; Hollywood lifelessness epitomized
text: The Jurassic Park franchise goes out with a wet fart in Jurassic World: Dominion -- an absolute zombie of a film that encapsulates a great deal of what's gone wrong with Hollywood. To quote Metaplex writer Brendan Hodges, regarding the less than stellar RT scores of the most recent Jurassic films: "In retrospect, it's nuts how many times people have f-cked up the surefire premise of dinosaur chomp-chomp human".In a last-ditch effort to breathe any sort of life back into the series, Universal (well aware of how little we care about the Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard characters) has brought back the actors that were there from the start -- Sam Neill, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum -- to bait our nostalgia. And yet, this somehow makes the movie seem all the more piteous. These particular Member Berries turned to raisins a long time ago; we're only reminded how old and tired this all is. (I won't call them "dinosaurs", though. That's too mean and too obvious.)This doesn't feel like "a look back at everything we've been through",  la last year's Spider-Man: No Way Home. It's more akin to snatching Indiana Jones from the nursing home for a final adventure or having James Earle Jones record just a few more Darth Vader or Mufasa lines from his death bed.The plot... Well, what can I say? It's largely the same old spiel with the obligatory new touch -- of which each sequel needs to have at least one (e.g. The park actually being open in Jurassic World). The "twist" or whatever this time around is that the dinosaurs have actually started fully co-existing with humans (going on hunts with us and various other stuff that's "supposed" to be silly, u guize), while the real threat is a type of locust that has begun eradicating the Earth's food supply.Even so, the formula is largely unaltered. The dinosaurs still have a remote location all their own, albeit with human allies close by, and are only unleashed once the template permits it. Another mandatory detail is the human villain. This time around it's the greedy CEO of Biosyn Inc., who orchestrated the creation of the locusts to destroy the supplies of rival companies (these particular grasshoppers have been engineered to avoid whichever crops are property of Biosyn). I dunno, man. I can't even laugh at this stuff anymore.The only real joy I felt during this picture -- however "ironic" it may really have been -- was during the first few minutes where Goldblum was at his most Goldblum. Other than that, there is no reason for you to pick this film over this other movie that came out this weekend, crafted by the VFX supervisor on the first-ever Jurassic Park, Phil Tippett, over the course of 30 years. It's called Mad God and reportedly rivals even the new Cronenberg joint in terms of nastiness. I understand if that doesn't sound too attractive but I'd rather see something that makes me feel sick than something that makes me feel numb.Hell, even if you really, really feel that you need to see CG dinosaurs doing CG dinosaur things, Jon Favreau's Prehistoric Planet (putting his 2019 Lion King technology to more appropriate use) is a far better pick than this (not only because watching it doesn't require you to leave your sofa). We've come an incomprehensibly long way since 1925's The Lost World and even D. W. Griffith's 1914 short film Brute Force. There are ways to celebrate this that don't involve sitting through boring character moments, sloppily made scenes (with some truly maddening blocking as well as editing), or a Chris Pratt performance.Long story short: Yes, despite Colin Trevorrow's promises that the latest big new dinosaur -- unironically called a "Giga" -- would be like a dinosaur version of The Joker, Dominion still turned out to be a pretty cringe movie. I know, I'm shocked too.

title: A tale of three movies. 70% horrific, 25% nostalgia and 5% decent film.
text: Another baffling entry in the Jurassic Park sequel franchise. A big point of consternation with the movie, is the fact that the writing as well as the production seem to be done by committee. There are a couple of scenes that are absolutely breathtaking and poignant while some scenes, the majority, seem to be have written and shot for the CW or a weirdo app like Pluto or something.It is really quite bad. I spent a lot of time wondering what went wrong, until I looked at the end credits and there it was, screenplay by Emily Carmichael (No relation). Emily is a writer, the likes of which, I refer to as The Destroyer of Worlds. These are writers who weasel onto a sequel project and completely upend what made earlier entries in a property or franchise work.The truth is, the people who made the movie clearly have no idea what they are doing. It's almost as if the filmmakers and crew were winging it.Unfortunately when you look further into the credits, that seems to be the case.This is a hundred million dollar student film, basically. There are dinosaurs I guess, and nobody is running up a mountain in high heels, there's actually a plot point where they zoom in on Claire's feet to show that indeed she is not wearing high heels this time.

title: This is not a perfect movie, but it is a great Dinosaur movie
text: Speaking for myself. I have been a dinosaur fan all my life, and the Jurassic Park franchise is just as important to me as any work of fiction would be. There is something interesting about Dinosaurs and cinema, in that they have been in the movies since the 1920's, and even back when dinosaurs were just stop motion puppets before going all CGI, people were still captivated by just the imagine of a dinosaur, and thinking of how wonderful it would be if we could live in a world beside them. This movie, like every other sequel in the franchise is not a perfect film. But the first Jurassic Park movie i ever saw in theatres was Jurassic Park 3, and even then that film was panned by critics and fans, and to this day is consider a bad movie, however i loved it as a kid and even though i do see the glaring flaws with these sequels and these movies when compared to the original, i think to myself "there is no way to capture lightning in a bottle twice" the first was a cinematic marvel when it first came out, and even the same people couldn't exactly replicate the magic again when doing more sequels. But that still doesn't mean these movies aren't entertaining. After all, the Jurassic Park sequels are filled with wild, weird, and wonderful ideas, and these are the very same elements that keep us entertained. This movie is corny, there are a lot of plot holes that do start to add up towards the end. However, i won't concede to someone elses negative review. Because for all the bad parts in this movie, i say to myself, "i do not care". Dinosaurs really speak to us, kids like me growing up all have there fascination and love for these creatures, and so do the children of today, and future generations to come. Because in the grand scheme of thing Dinosaurs were the most successful lifeforms on this planet, and humans will still have the shortest chapter in the history of life. And what's great about this movie, is fulfills a desire i had as a kids, and that was seeing dinosaurs co-existing alongside modern animals in the wild. I actually cried in the theatre when i saw those scenes, since it brought some really wonderful nostalgic memories. So don't go into this film thinking you'll get a piece of art, or award winning material, simply go in and except to have fun and be entertained by a film you know is going to worth rewatching over and over again.

title: a festival of screaming dinosaurs
text: If my count is correct, 'Jurassic World Dominion' (2022 - directed by Colin Trevorrow) is the sixth major studio film to develop the world and characters invented byMichael Crichton and first brought to the screen in 1993 by Steven Spielberg. Spielberg is one of the producers of this film and I believe he was involved as a producer in most if not all of the films in the series. However, his artistic guidance seems to be absent in this episode. If this is the final in the series, it is one devoid of glory. If others will follow, we can hope that it is only one of the weakest episodes and that a recovery will follow. Anyway, 'Jurassic World Dominion' disappointed me.Crichton's book and the first film were a cautionary parable about the dangers of science out of control. It's the theme of 'Frankenstein' only the monsters are not human but dinosaurs reborn through the wonders of genetic engineering. When he decided to make the first 'sequel', the main theme became the coexistence of humanity with the world of dinosaurs on our fragile planet. The latest series and this last one in particular add new themes related to the control of large corporations over advanced technologies and the ethical implications of genetic manipulations when they are carried out not 'only' on dinosaurs but also on human beings. These are interesting and important topics. The treatment reserved to each of them is the real problem with this film.The opening scenes and several episodes throughout the action contain a few promises, unfortunately unfulfilled. The biology of dinosaurs imagined by the authors of the film and special effects experts is one of the most diverse, which allows not only playing with sizes (from pet dinosaurs to the biggest carnivorous giants in the history of the planet) but also with the roles that they can play in people's lives. The chases in the prairie where the dinosaurs run alongside the wild horses, the bar populated by various characters, which quotes 'Star Wars', the circus arena where one of the violent confrontations takes place are each beautiful ideas that unfortunately are not supported even in terms of time screen nor as an action item. Instead, we are dealing with endless scenes - let's call them action - in which the soundtrack is dominated by the most diverse roars and which probably intent to be scary, but in reality become a little ridiculous through repetition. The head of a large global corporation that plays with the magic wand of genetic engineering without caring about the risks is the lead Bad Guy, presented as a kind of clone of Steve Jobs, another slightly questionable idea and in any case already seen before. There are many other good ideas in the script, unfortunately most of them are abandoned before they can make a consistent impact.'Jurassic World Dominion' introduces viewers to three generations of characters and actors. The younger appear here for the first time and will perhaps represent central characters in the following films, if the confrontations or coexistence of humanity with the world of dinosaurs continue on the screen. The middle generation is the one introduced by the first 'Jurassic World' together with the theme of human cloning, superficially addressed here, which also deserved a more careful and deeper treatment. Finally, the three main characters of the 1993 film, played by Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum, reappear here. Time has not forgiven them much and their impact is mediocre, especially since they are made to repeat roughly what they had done 29 calendar (and maybe also cinematic) years ago. I generally have a reluctance about sequels that rehash characters with decades of their distant past success. The scriptwriters of these films should really ask themselves what the viewers want: the originals with the risks of degradation caused by the passage of time, or new actors to creatively continue the ideas and conflict lines? About the same as the concert reunion of rock idols from half a century ago, forgive me for the comparison. If it is not refreshed, the Jurassic series risks remaining frozen in history.

title: A Not-so-epic Conclusion

title: A franchise 65 million years in falling
text: "Jurassic World Dominion" is a bright example of how the crew puts its efforts in everything except the movie's story. The creators did little to nothing to make the story exciting and spectacular, even though all needed is here: famous actors, impressive visual effects, nostalgic 90s notes, set by Steven Spielberg himself, and, finally, audience missing theatrical experience that, luckily, is alive again. If we talk about money, the movie is a profitable mosquito with a piece of the 1993 original's DNA, bringing $1 billion in Universal's pocket. But what about experience? In this case we got a loud unimaginative fly, struggling in air in front of audience's eyes, while potentially interesting ideas are flushed away.The movie was promoted as "the epic conclusion of Jurassic era", and it turned out that the franchise has nothing more to offer except ruined ideas, Perhaps, in 14 years Universal will try to bring dinosaurs to life again, as it happened with the first "Jurassic World" entry. Though it's only the matter of time when we find out what "Jurassic World Dominion" was: a mosquito stuck in amber and containing the piece of DNA of an adventure as spectacular as dinosaurs themselves, or a big locust destroying the Universal's farm that brings huge profit to the studio and pleasure to people. A locust created during the failed experiment with the use of genes of a worthy blockbuster, Spielberg's motives and 90s nostalgia.

title: Derivative copy of a better classic.
text: With each & every new installment in the franchise which (with no sense of self awareness) acts as a cautionary tale as to what can happen if people nonchalantly try & resurrect old relics of the past, I feel myself increasingly more frustrated that the creators responsible for these awful films don't listen to their own goddamn messaging."Jurassic World: The Fallen Kingdom" (despite also being terrible fan-fiction) at least had the decency to set up an interesting evolution in the series' development (letting dinosaurs loose to roam the earth & violently retake their land from humanity - transforming future sequels in to a cynical post-apocalyptic tale of survival, now we'd be caging ourselves for safety & predators stalk the streets, free from theirs) so I've no idea why writer & director Colin Treverrow thought it wise to renege on that creative promise (when it actually had potential to revivify the brand, adding an interesting twist on the concept) & instead regurgitated the exact same formula as before for "Dominion".... But this time, in ANOTHER park. Wow. Truly, fascinating.Plus, as a casual viewer, the relentless nostalgia bait did absolutely nothing for me so the desperate attempts to pander to die-hard fans were wasted on me.The movie was dull. It shouldn't have been dull. But it was dull. Tediously dull. Very, very dull. I found it dull. Big, monotonous & dull.

title: Action-Packed Film Filled With Great Comedy And Strong Actor Performances.
text: Bigger and scarier dinosaurs, heart-pounding sound effects, and plot twists mixed with plenty of adventures are just what you can expect from Jurassic World Dominion! From the beginning to the end of the movie, there are tons of action-packed scenes to keep you literally jumping for more. Fans of the Jurassic Park franchise will not be disappointed.Jurassic World Dominion centers around two different storylines. On one hand, Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon), a teenager, who happens to be a clone of her biological mother, is kidnapped and taken to a company called Biosyn to become a science experiment so scientists can learn how her biological mother created her. On the other hand, her parents, Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard) and Owen Grady (Chris Pratt), set out on an adventure to rescue her. Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) is suspicious of the works of Biosyn and its animal experiments, as well as its attempt to take over the food chain. She brings in Alan Grant (Sam Neill) to help her stop Biosyn from taking over. The two storylines eventually combine for one suspenseful adventure that happens to take place all while dinosaurs are threatening the characters' existence.The main characters in this film are Maisie, Claire, Owen, Alan, Ellie, and Dr. Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum). There are references and character appearances from other movies in the Jurassic Park franchise. I enjoyed seeing how characters from different parts of the film join together to save Maisie and end up trying to save each other and become a family while working together. There are some funny scenes throughout the film, and I loved seeing the characters communicating with the dinosaurs and even making them promises. The movie takes you on an emotional rollercoaster as you root for the good guys to not only survive but to win.This film touches on family and whether or not dinosaurs and humans can co-exist. You'll have to watch the movie to find out. While I highly enjoyed Jurassic World Dominion, this film may not be suitable for people who have certain fears/anxieties or even suffer from PTSD. Parents should look out for scenes with extreme violence, gory deaths, and loads of jump scares.I give Jurassic World Dominion 4 out of 5 stars and recommend it for kids ages 12 to 18, plus adults. This film roars into theaters on June 10, 2022. By Tiana S., KIDS FIRST!

I would say the series needs a reboot, but maybe what it really needs is a break.

title: See It At the Discount Theater or Stream It.
text: Unless you have kids that love dinosaurs and would love to see them on the big screen you can wait to see this on your TV. The special effects are great, so there's that.But overall the new Jurassic World Dominion movie is a bomb. As in not a good one. Dumb plot, ridiculous premises and same ol' same ol' stuff. The idea that these creatures and people would live together in cities is off the charts. One scene shows kids at the park with ducks and little dino's running around. What do they think dinosaurs eat? Another scene has the Pyro Raptor living in a frozen cold climate. Not a place a cold blooded reptile would be.In the end there's not enough Chris Pratt and Jeff Goldblum and too much Sam Neill and Laura Dern. All chasing after a cute (Isabella Sermon) but unlikable girl who was kidnapped for some other ridiculously 'out there' reason. Truthfully I fell asleep in the middle. Keep your money in your pocket.

title: So disappointed
text: Was really looking for to this movie and what a disappointment. The acting was really good but the story line was Just not there. Also was expecting the animation to be better.

title: Jurassic Park part six
text: I loved the first "Jurassic Park" movie released in 1993 directed by Steven Spielberg, which won three Academy Awards and was, for a time, the biggest box office hit of all time.This new film, "Jurassic World Dominion" is the most entertaining and enjoyable film in the series since the first one.Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard are back along with a very good Isabella Sermon as their adopted daughter. Also you have Laura Dern, Sam Neill, and Jeff Goldblum from the first film.The cinematography and music score are both excellent. All of the acting is great and the visual effects are amazing. A great movie to see in a movie theater. I recommend this film, especially to fans of the first film. You will have a good time. Go see it!

title: I hope this was the last one
text: Watching this movie, made me sad. Predictable, not remotely funny, always in the nick of time clichs and although the CGI is great, it doesn't get me excited.

title: Pretty bad writing
text: The writing in this movie is pretty bad, it mostly feeds off of the park cast and the nostalgia of them.It is all over the place, one time were here and then we're in a completely unrelated place with the other cast in a situation that just does not need to be there. It makes the movie hard to follow. I get it, it's hard to merge 3 separated groups to one but this was just jumpy and felt wrong.Like the other world movies the cgi is fantastic and the dinosaurs look more real than ever (except the acid spitting ones, there never was a dinosaur that spat venom or acid) also there was a mf TICKLE CHICKEN. Best part of the movie.

title: Nostalgic
text: I don't care about all the bad reviews I loved it!I have very fond memories of going to see the 1st film in the cinema and have loved it ever since - it will of course still be the best one. I loved the original characters coming back and the references to the first film - it made this film all the more special. Awesome cinematography as always and action packed. Can't believe there will be no more :(

title: I'm bored
text: In literally sitting here at the theater watching this and contemplating whether to leave or stay. For the supposed last movie on this franchise I'm so underwhelmed. There's hardly any dinosaur action.

title: Terrible
text: The world movie I have EVER watched. Absolutely no imagination in the script, it's the laziest effort of a movie and the audience is just expected to swallow it.

title: A big change in jurassic
text: It was very brave. It definatly the best it could have been with a few major decisions needing to be made. Although it was not the best it is still worth a watch and probably doesnt deserve this much hate. It would be much better if it were a longer movie as everything felt squeezed. Still a worth wrap up for this era in the franchise.

title: Studio too preoccupied wether they could make this film rather than if they should
text: This film is a watch once, forget it and regret it film. It's already been torn to pieces by critics but I want to join in too on this bismal film. I'm gonna start with the unengaging and frankly boring plot. There is just so little substance and what you're left with is a generic storyline which has been done countless times before and even done within the film franchise itself. The villain lacks any clear motive and Scott's performance is pretty weak in the role. The rest of the performances from the original Jurassic park films and returning cast from Jurassic world are also weak and wooden lacking any depth to them. It felt like there was just no chemistry between them on screen. This made it a grueling task to have to soldier on through the boring scenes which sadly is most of the film. Items very apparent this film was made to cash in on the Jurassic Park nostalgia aspect seeing old characters come back to the big screen. This film just doesn't know what it wants to be, the humour falls flat and the thrilling scenes which are supposed to be tense never had me anxious as I didn't care for the characters at all. To conclude I don't think you should watch this film just watch Spielberg's classic Jurassic Park which is 10x better.

title: Humanity deserve better
text: Charles Barkley would call this turrible. It is so poorly written and cheesy that it feels like a B movie made to make you laugh at its short-comings. There are a few callbacks to the original, but that's where the positives stop. The acting is bad, the plot is all over the place, the dialogue is suspect...how do movies like this keep making profit?? Are we that far gone as a species!?

title: What even was that!
text: Wow this could have been so good! Looks like the entire budget was spent on getting the OG cast back which should have been epic! Alas it was so far removed from the Jurassic park we all know and love. Even Goldblum couldn't save it!!!I'm sad to say I didn't finish it.Should have gone all the way and bought back Spielberg or stopped at the last movie and end on a high.

title: Y'ALL ARE CRAZY
text: This movie was INTENSE from start to finish. I was paralyzed and my eyes were completely glued to the screen. I was curious as to how they were gonna wrap up the series, but they did it! They left so much more to the imagination without leaving too many unanswered questions. Well done.

title: An utter nonsense
text: What a complete and senseless circus this movie is.Seriously, it's a mashup of snippets of Mad Max, which meets Star Wars, which meets who knows what.The only Jurassic thing about this movie is a title. Forget the dinosaurs, nowadays it's about peoples feelings, convictions, government and global conspiracies. And we thought the last few installments of this franchise were lame. In comparison to this one (and one before..) those were actually, somewhat, worth spending time watching. Sometimes one has to wonder, is Hollywood running out of ideas or just hiring ppl to make a movie for loud noises, chases and special effects to get the audience to fill the seats.

title: Way too boringly predictable
text: So boring and so not interesting. Way too coincidences when suddenly everybody meet each other in middle of nowhere for no good reason and suddenly A-team of 7 people stick to gether to save the world in a weird ways. And there ar way too much illogical situations they resolve in a directors way... It looks like the actors are so tired that they don't want even to act this story anymore.. P. S. And was I the only one who noticed that at the beginning of movie that bridge in the forest... Was it the same bridge from a movie a Quiet place? (palmface)

title: Bad, Bad, Bad.
text: Ick, gag, chunder, makings of a headache. To even give it a rating of 1 is being generous. Acting - poor, dialog - poor, special effects - below standard compared to previous Jurassic movies. This was supposed to be the ultimate possible ending to the story that started with the first Jurassic World movie. What the hell happened? Was the lure of the mighty greenback the only incentive? Movies make money, I get that. Why not have the powers that be actually sit and watch the faces of movies goers when they watch a movie and see their wonderment. If this escapes the powers that be's understanding check out some of the YouTube clips that have actual reactions to movie goers when they watch a movie, for example, Avengers End Game. If this still escapes your understanding then you're in the wrong business.

title: Best since the first
text: Best jurrasic Park movie since the first one.I don't say it lightly. I still remember watching the original in the theater. All movies in between have been a meh.I really don't get why it get so much hate.

title: Unbearably bad
text: I don't often write movie reviews but this was so bad I felt compelled to leave my two cents. First off, The acting was atrocious. There was Overacting by some, and a laxk of acting by others. The CGI was putrid, it was like watching a sci fi channel movie. The pacing was entirely wrong and made the action unbalanced. And even the opening scene, a faux news intro, was unnecessary and lazy exposition - it showed just how poorly the writers put the script together. The sets looked like they could've come from a sitcom. The original soundtrack from the movies was replaced by an endless supply of generic video game music. Just everything about this movie sucked, from beginning to end.

title: Bland
text: Expect nothing but the grey paste that has ben the low standard of Hollywood productions. Almost feel like a B production. Acting is subpar, the dialog is clich in the worst ways. Lack of creativity, except for two scenes, that was decent. Left the cinema 3/4 in, after I had to go to the bathroom, and realized it wasn't worth it to go back in...

title: Classic "And Then" storytelling right here
text: Nothing leads to a "because" or "therefore", its all "and then" this happens. Screenwriting 101...A complete mess of a movie with no actual story and the only enjoyable parts are when there's actually DINOSAURS which is about 15 minutes of the run time. Complete disaster of a movie.

title: Jurassic Park...29 years later.
text:
This film did a great job with merging the original cast with the reboot cast. For a movie that changed the film game over 30 years ago, to still come back with a storyline that matters and has relevance today is incredible in itself.Was it predictable? Yes
Did I enjoy it? YesThank you cast & crew for doing a great job ending a saga from my childhood.Rating B.

title: Turn your brain off
text: Exactly the title, turn your brain off and you'll love the coming together of all the old and new cast and crew.It is what it is with these films, dinosaurs eating people and people trying to survive.If you love CGI and you aren't much of a thinker, go nuts with this, however, if on the other hand you want your brain stimulated, stay away from this film.Had it on in the background whilst working and didn't miss a single thing, that's how brainless this film is.Hopefully they're done with it now, because like the Fast and the Furious films, they've squeezed about as much as they can out of it.

title: Jurassic World Dominion is a massive disappointment on virtually every level.
text: If you enjoy reading my Spoiler-Free thoughts, please follow my blog to read my full review :)"Jurassic World Dominion is a massive disappointment on virtually every level. With an incredibly captivating premise, Colin Trevorrow ignores the fascinating years of mankind trying to deal with the chaos of dinosaurs repopulating Earth, opting instead to write a generic, formulaic, surprisingly tedious screenplay.In addition to the lousy character treatment, the cast is divided into two storylines focused on nonsensical, bland rescue and espionage missions, placing dinosaurs on the back burner during the excessively long runtime.Action sequences reach drastically low entertainment levels, sometimes imperceptible due to erratic camera work and choppy editing.The cast, visuals, and score might save this from being a complete trainwreck, but not from miserably failing to deliver an epic conclusion to a saga that deserved nothing less than that."Rating: D.

title: Sorry
text: It is trash from very beginning. Dot. Chris seriously? It was slap in my face... I thought it will be more believable who ever was scripting this have to be fired asap. Even mushrooms will help really. I am shocked.

title: Fast action enjoyment
text: Having seen all the Jurassic Park and Jurassic World movies, this last one, number 6, is as good as the very first one made in 1993. In a way it made me think of another movie, nothing to do with dinosaurs, but offering thrilling continuous action to keep viewers glued to their seats. How many movies dealing with the same subject over and over again can match the dinosaur saga for so long? It is the suggested interaction of dinosaurs and humans which never happened in history, having lived many millions of years apart, long before people roamed the Earth. It's the fantasy that draws the young and old together in this imaginary world.

title: Hilarious!
text: The movie tries to be serious but it's rather a comedy with all that is going on. You just have to laugh at the stupidity of it.I mean, the same Dino is almost keeping pace with a car and 5 minutes earlier that Dino wasn't able to outrun a human being. Is this stupid or what?The only good thing was seeing the original Jurassic Park crew again.But there's no classic Dino story. Like they say: Too many cooks spoil the broth. This is a classic example of that. Too much is happening at the same time with all sorts of Dinos, locusts and normal gun and fist fights between humans. It's like preparing a dish and putting everything in it without having any idea what will work, which blows it out of proportion.At least let's be realistic. A motorcycle jump on to a moving plane half in the sky makes just no sense at all.

title: Waste of money
text: Honestly I am a fan of the Jurassic Park series but this movie is completely smothered in bad CGI and lazy writing. The plot is sub-par the scenes with dinosaurs were mid at best. The dinosaurs look home made and was very disappointing. They really tried to revive the movie with nostalgia by bringing back some of the original cast and adding Easter eggs referring back to the previous films. I never had high hopes for this movie and hopefully they end the Jurassic world series.

title: The dumbing down continues....
text: JWD is typical of modern blockbusters. Clichd writing, a lack of good storytelling and narrative, glaring plot and continuity errors. In short modern films are made for an American population with low IQs and short attention spans. How exactly does the Dolomites have frozen lakes and sun-tropical forest at the same time? Sometimes a blockbuster can get past all of the glaring problems because it's just a great ride and a lot of fun. JWD is frankly boring from about 10 minutes in. I am a big fan of Sam Neill and Chris Pratt but they can't save this bland dumbfest of a movie.

title: So many people putting this movie down its sad :(
text: I enjoyed the movie the only problem I had with the movie was during the night scenes. I get it its night time but hey I'm paying to see the characters and the dinosaurs in action.Its my only gripe about the movie they same as Thor Love & Thunder what's up trying to hide all the flaws in the dark or what?Get it right Hollywood we pay your salaries you know without us peons you all would just be another peon on this planet trudging through your day like the rest of us.

title: So very disappointing
text: The first 30 minutes dragged on and on, introducing us the the new and the old characters. The first half seemed to have no direction...what was going on and why should we even care? It was just a jumbled mess of ideas that didn't necessarily go together effectively. The action scenes were okay, but it was as if they took old scripts from previous movies and reshot them for this one. Like many other reviewers, I found myself on my phone several times throughout. It just never connected with me and I just kept wondering how much longer I had to endure. And hell, I rented the extended version, so I had an extra 17 minutes to suffer through.It is easily the weakest Jurassic film. Too bad...I had hoped for so much more.

title: Just like Star Wars, it's all downhill after the first three
text: The first three JP movies were so good, yes even the third I liked. The last three not so much. I was just mildly entertained with this 2022 installment There was just too much distraction and clutter in this movie. Is it a movie about dinosaurs or about glamorous models with too-prolonged headshots (beauty shots)? Are we supposed to feel sorry for these creatures? When not being eaten, or running from them, or killing them, they are expressing sympathy about their rights. It was just kind of a mess I thought.

title: Dinosaurs!
text: Alright... we get it.Enough with the dinosaurs.Sheesh... Not sure how many different situations we can see people and dinosaurs entangled in anymore. What's next... Jurassic Park: Mission to Mars?I mean.... come on guys. Enough is enough.

title: Do NOT listen to the haters!
text: I just finished watching this movie through Amazon Prime. My husband and I weren't sure if we should spend the extra $10 to own it so with such low reviews we decided to just rent it. Well now we'll have to buy it on DVD when it's released because this movie was EXCELLENT! I think people are either just hating it b/c Chris Pratt is in it OR there's 1 thing that happens in it that is complete sci-fi / fairytale stuff that could make the ultra conservatives give it bad reviews. Either way IMO I think bad reviews are coming from extremist on either side or cinema snobs that usually don't enjoy entertaining movies like Jurassic Park/World or POTC so IMO if you enjoy movies for entertainment, then give this one a try, especially if you are a fan of the Jurassic Park/World movies. I thought this movie was much better than part 2 and I may have enjoyed it better than the first JW and more than JP pt 3. It did what none of the sequels of Star Wars movies did, so I'm very impressed w/ the writing and directing of this movie so for all of these reasons I gave it 9 stars.

title: Bro movie was solid
text: This film deserves an award for making me using my phone throughout the whole film. It was boring as hell! One of the worst Dinosaur film ever made.Do try to avoid this disaster!

title: Jurassic World: Dominion - Old Meets the New in this Mediocre Conclusion
text: Jurassic World: Dominion is a frustrating film. On paper, every element in this bloated, nostalgia-bait ridden film should have tricked my lizard brain (pun intended) into clapping, cheering, and laughing as intended.
