The problem is that none of these elements blended together to create a product worth being excited about.I grew up in the late 90's and Jurassic Park was always in the rotation of movies to watch on Friday night. The scene of the T-Rex escaping its paddock and threatening our heroes in the first act of that film still gives me goosebumps to this day and inspired a life-long hobby in me as a film enthusiast.Jurassic World: Dominion forces my childhood heroes into a narrative that doesn't honor the legacy of the franchise or need them at all. This film felt frustrating in that it actively splits our attention between caring about two narratives that are happening simultaneously but don't converge until the third act in the least satisfying way.It could be construed as a bit needless to attack the writing in the dinosaur movie, but Michael Crichton, David Koepp, and Steven Spielberg demonstrated 29 years ago that it's possible to inspire feelings of wonderment, fear, and the call to adventure in a blend of genres that was nearly universally accepted and beloved. Jurassic World: Dominion would have done well to learn from its predecessor. The main characters are indestructible, the story devoid of the moral theming that inspired the series, and the plot unnecessary. The characters learn nothing by the end of the two hour and twenty six minute run time, and the world unchanged in the end by the plot of the film."You stood on the shoulders of geniuses to accomplish something as fast as you could, and before you even knew what you had, you patented it and packaged it, and slapped it on a plastic lunchbox, and now you wanna sell it." - Dr. Ian Malcolm, Jurassic Park (1993)On a final note, I do want to mention some positives. The visual effects are well executed for the most part. The dinosaurs look good and feel like real, tangible threats to our characters. For the most part, the acting is fine despite the lackluster writing supporting the performers. The film is also shot well, with a variety of settings for our characters to travel through. It's a shame that these positives fall victim to the meteoric calamity that is this film's plot.4/10.

title: Missing my Jurassic Park!
text: While we know good things must come to an end, this flick was more like too many cheifs and not enough dinasaurs. I was super excited to see this flick the first week, but I could've waited to stream on my 'Fire Stick'. There wasn't much excitment, the monsterous dinasaurs were sweet as pie! I'm not certain how this flick got such high ratings from most in my age group....

title: Made for TV Movie
text: This was a badly written made for TV movie at best. It's shot and edited like a TV movie. It's fun to see the old and new cast intermingle, ignoring the bad plastic surgery and make up, for one last hurrah just wish it was a better movie. The effort to create emotional attachment to the dinosaurs felt forced at times and manipulative. The woke ecological message mingled I didn't help things. I get the intention it was the execution that failed. Hokey trite script with a rehash of the other films that made no sense at times didn't help either. No matter bad you want it to no one can save this mangled mess. Glad I didn't pay to see this in the movie theater.

title: This was the best movie of the series
text: This was by far the best in the Jurassic park movie in the series since the very first one! If you didn't like it, it's because you have no appreciation for the original actors and story line coming together. If you grew up with Jurassic park you will like it!

title: Just nope.
text: Half of it is nonsense people's personal drama and half of it is nonsense dinosaur actions.I got bored of watching Chris Pratt hold his hand into the air and watching velociraptors being the villain like they are the only dinosaurs specie. There is no action diversity even after 6 movies.Since the 5th movie it got stupid too much. The whole world can't deal with a few dinosaurs is too idiotic because no one even try to hurt any dinosaurs. They are too busy with #DinasourLifeMatters woke BS LOL.The series' only decent movie is the 4th and rest is basically a trash. Though 5th and 6th is better than original trilogy because at least something happens and there is story LOL.

title: When money and greed ruled the earth...
text: ...but also prostitute actors and actresses... Yes, I'm speaking of 3 of my '97 movie heroes - Neill, Dern and Goldblum. Lost my respect for them altogether them signing on to this embarrassing pile of trash. Hollywood is so desperate to lure pop i***t sheep to the cinemas, they'll do anything earning a quick buck, no matter if a movie has no substance and storytelling script whatsoever, this flick is no exception. Furthermore, hiring that buffoon Pratt in any movie production just shows the lack of brains responsible for the production. Always despised that p***k and him joining the next generation JP universe destroyed this franchise from day one.For us who genuinely loves paleontology, zoology and dinosaur history - long live the original film, second and third not very memorable but sure I'll include them for the sake of it. The rest however, total and utter stool water material that deserves to be eaten and eradicated by a flock of Compsognathuses.

title: Looks like it wasn't very well planned.
text: The Jurassic Park saga has had many ups and downs, but this time was no exception, it promised too much, and gave us so little.The action is somewhat predictable, the new characters appear and disappear from the scene without saying anything else, the new character that stays until the end is too annoying (at least for me).References and some characters from the first installment are appreciated, but this just seems like an excuse to bring back Sam Neil, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum, who didn't have very memorable scenes.The reappearance of the original protagonists could have been better, but it seems that they did not know what to do with them.

title: Plot holes but totally enjoyable
text: Yes, we watched bad acting, dinosaurs that only kill when they are hungry- and they were not that hungry in this movie, i kinda have a problem with the timeline and the years that have passed since the last jurrasic .Still... i was action packed and enjoyable. It's dinosaurs, ppl!!!How can u watch the movie, and then start running in the house like a bad*** dino? :P.

title: Played out story adventure type of movie with dinosaurs in the background
text: Played out story adventure type of movie with dinosaurs in the background this movie took elements from Indiana Jones and a couple of other action movies and it called itself a Jurassic World movie which in my opinion sucks the scenes were a bit quick and choppy It lacked what everyone came to see dinosaurs? Bits and pieces of dinosaur action nothing like the original Jurassic Park the actors were a bit played out and it was a bit cartoonish to me the Director should be fired and should be not able to make another movie like this again they need Steven Spielberg to really direct a new movie it's a redo the series The series is highly trash in my opinion the actors did the best they could but overall the director's fault and the story writers.

title: A lifeless train wreck that has no emotional impact and is far too heavy on the action whilst skimping on an already dull plot
text: I wish I'd never watched this film, it's too long for it's own good is made up of about 75% action scenes (with no peril as we know none of the characters will die) and the first two thirds are almost like two films put into one with our original 1993 cast - which were admittedly nice to see - and the reboot starring Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard.The special effects were good, although a bit shaky in places especially near the start I thought the CGI looked a bit cheap but overall they were fine. Acting wise I want to say it excelled in but alas, it really didn't. Which is a huge shame as I'm usually a fan of the actors and actresses who were involved.The plot was ridiculous and difficult to follow with many plot holes and unbelievability. Apart from perhaps Dichen Lachman's character all of the villains were entirely unthreatening and huge pushovers, there was no competent opposition to our heroes which does not make for an enjoyable watch. On the plus side up and coming actress Isabella Sermon did a competent job with the script she had. As I'd previously mentioned the acting did not excel or live up to what it should be with the usually high standard of the cast but it wasn't disastrous, Sam Neil, Mamoudou Athie, and especially Jeff Goldblum were probably the best of the lot but they couldn't in any way save the film with the awful plot and writing it had.3/10: The filmmakers obviously thought that style and good special effects alone could carry the film - to make a long story short they categorically could not.

title: Better than the first
text: While JP was fantastic, it was mainly because it was groundbreaking. Dominion builds on it and improves on it in many ways. I read a lot of negativity, but this is a thrilling experience, miss at your peril!

title: Same old Hollywood trash, completely soulless.
text:
Honestly I am not surprised this turned out to be a bad movie, I come to expect it in this day and age, basically every big Hollywood blockbuster film is made for one reason only and of course that's money.There is no soul in this film, it's a generic dinosaur action flick where the actual dinosaurs (ie the main attraction point) take a back seat to silly
and highly predictable storylines and action sequences. On top of that you have incredibly cheesy and cringey one liners, poor acting and woke propaganda.The only reason I can give it 2 stars is because some of the CGI and shots looks well done (not all however) and this is to be expected with such a large budget. Basically another soulless husk of a film made and produced with zero love or passion.Skip at all costs.

title: Don't waste your time
text: Completely waste of time and money. Please don't see even for free. Too talkative and unnecessary action with relating/copying from/to part 1.It seems they bring old characters with no stories and plot.

title: Covid was a bigger threat than this
text:
This is just plain stupid. How could anything at that scale be a threat, with the weapons we have today?The old Jurassic parks films, had an element of "it could happen" to it. Especially the first one. It was new and fresh. This one seems well, Jurassic...
I didn't finish it.This is just plain stupid. How could anything at that scale be a threat, with the weapons we have today?The old Jurassic parks films, had an element of "it could happen" to it. Especially the first one. It was new and fresh. This one seems well, Jurassic...
I didn't finish it.This is just plain stupid. How could anything at that scale be a threat, with the weapons we have today?The old Jurassic parks films, had an element of "it could happen" to it. Especially the first one. It was new and fresh. This one seems well, Jurassic...
I didn't finish it.

title: Chris Pratt does it again...
text: ..ruins a movie.How this talentless and highly unliked person continues to get cast in stuff is beyond me. It's like he touches it...and it turns to crap.Having said that, this movie would have been beyond saving anyway as it's pure and utter garbage - all the way from plot to acting.Pass on it. You'll be happier that way.

title: Ignore the pretentious reviews and have fun
text: I'm not sure if anything pleases people anymore. I had a blast at this movie. Great cast, and some dynamic action scenes. What's not to like? Okay it's a bit long, big deal. We need the distraction. Our country is in the toilet, and I for one welcome anything that takes my mind off of that. I think this was the best of the trilogy. I seriously am baffled at the low score on here. I give up.

title: Abysmal
text: Movie was so boring can't even remember what I just watched.Had some good stunt scenes but the plot and editing was all over the place and nonsensical. Terrible movie I hope it's the last one.It gets 2 stars for the guy on the scooter though that was hilarious.

title: Boring!
text: Despite of all this cast - boring! Stamps, banal plot, protracted. We've seen it all before! Its a bullsheet and waste of time. Characters are annoying. Its 2 time worst than previous part in 2015. I dont recommend it. And I think that children will also be bored.After all, situations and plot twists are so dumb that it's just insane....

title: One word, Disappointing
text: Very weak screenwriting and character development. I love Chris Pratt but he's in the movie but he's not. Good to see the gang united but some things are better left as is.

title: Superb finale
text: I was very sceptical about another Jurassic Park film but excited at the same time.... After a slow start to the movie the story line really begins to take shape. With the reuniting of original Jurassic Park characters and new Jurassic World characters, it is the perfect blend.There is excitement and suspense from the start, it really will not disappoint!!! A perfect end to a phenomenal movie franchise!

title: Awful for Spielberg standards.
text: Since when did Raptors become like puppies. Talk about jumping the dinosaur for a cash grab. Where's Fozie when ya need him? This is a boring mess that has no resemblance of great past memories.

title: Unfortunately not great
text: Swing and a miss. I was definitely excited about this movie and I was not impressed. Pass on the theaters for this one. They did a really good job of making a dinosaur movie completely unbelievable. Love all the people in the movie, this one just totally missed.

title: Mediocre
text: So this is a mediocre end to a mediocre trilogy. Dominion is not as aggressively bad as Fallen Kingdom but its somehow overstuffed and boring at the same time.

title: A review basically written for Practice
text: I enjoy reviewing movies but could not get in to see this movie until just yesterday because it was constantly sold out. I call it a review for practice cause there's already thousands of reviews and doubt mine will get read. Many people have said it but I will say it again this is an action movie with Dinosaurs in it much like how they turned the Fast and Furious franchise into action movies with some cars in it. They basically did what Ghostbusters afterlife did which was attract the audience by bringing in the original cast that was mostly what drew me in though it looked like a pretty decent trailer too. This is Hollywood's new thing either bring back the original cast or make a sequel to a movie that was made 20 years ago. I. E Coming 2 America/Maverick. Granted I did like Top Gun but it was nothing new. What happened in this film was new to Jurassic Park films in a horribly disastrous way. I still don't understand the clone plot or whatever the child was. I was so bored with the locust plot I stopped trying to even follow it. Now here's the ironic part I actually was the most annoyed by the returning cast. I found Jeff Goldblum and Laura Dern very annoying and Sam Neil must be getting a bit Joe Bidenish in his old age because they hardly gave him any lines (maybe so he wouldn't forget them) or screen time(never show him running or doing any action). Laura Dern was trying so hard to be sexy it was very off-putting and honestly just made her look older. Ian was always supposed to be an annoying character but it's like they turned up the volume on this film. The biggest problem though is I constantly kept feeling as if I was watching two different movies. The story was all over the place, it didn't feel like a Jurassic Park movie, it was too long and too boring at times. Gotta give it to Chris though he is a phenomenal action star. I loved the hot black chick towards the end of the film. She was very watchable, very likable and action is her forte. The only Jurassic world movie that was vaguely good was the first one and it was all downhill from there. I think most would agree Jurassic Park didn't even need a Trilogy. The first two were enough. They disappointed us, they knew they would but they also knew they'd get our money and they did.

title: Just disappointing
text: All I can say is disappointing. Just not a good movie. How can you fail so miserably with this franchise? I gave it a five stars and that was generous. Grew up with this franchise and what a horrible way to end it.

title: Edge of the seat thriller
text: I dont agree with so much of negativity about the movie. It definitely dont deserve 6 rating, the movie has a lot of exciting sequence that one would expect from this franchise. Although, it takes good 15-20 mins to get the grip but it doesnt disappoint after that. It has so much of action, edge of the seat thrill, survival scenes around lots of dinosaurs.VFX is great, background score is what you need and fast paced action. It definitely worth a watch in cinema and trust me, you'll come out having enjoyed this.

title: Bossy female characters without any identity
text: Veeeery bad writing. I gave two stars just because it created some temporary jobs for some people.And about the title of the review - bossy female characters without any essence are thrown in the movie just because of woke culture. They are just cringe.Also, the guy that tries to be a evil Steve Jobs brings no value to the movie. I got so bored that I couldn't even finish it. I don't even know how the movie ends, but reading the reviews here makes me think I took the best decision to leave the movie theaters 20-25 minutes before the end.Hollywood keeps throwing bad movies at us just because they can. And also, they think that bringing in the OG characters can make a difference. It doesn't! At least in this movie where 95% of the script sucked!

title: Garbige
text: The film is like a low-budget film with novice actors.What happened to the actors, the screenwriter and the director? Did they forget to do their job?!? The stupidest and most embarrassing movie I've ever watched...

title: Disappointed
text: Love for Jurassic Movies has been with me since the start. I love the excitement, thrill and suspense that comes when I watch any of the movies, However for this movie I was slightly disappointed in the story. I felt that there's was a nonchalant attitude to it. (if you get my meaning). There were few scenes that I did enjoy but overall it didn't meet my expectations.

title: Fell asleep
text: Wow that movie went for far too long. Couple of good scenes of action but mostly characters hugging. Worst Jurassic park film for sure.Fell asleep enough said.

title: Great fan of Jurrassic series since childhood.
text: I was again thrilled with this movie, as a child after watch first release decades ago, always wondered what would happen if we live with dinosaurs and it was very well shown in this movie.Again it was very interesting to watch a wide variety/species of various dinosaurs.Truly enjoyed, just waiting for another release in coming years, probably something more exciting.Good Luck.

title: Not as well as pretends well
text: It was great to have the main cast from Jurassic world and Jurassic park in this movie but the insects, the origin of the teenage girl, the new lab, new dinosaur mixes, and a different story about the aftermath of the dinosaurs taking over earth. I think it would've been better if a person got bitten or scratched by a dinosaur, the victim could turn into a dinosaur.

title: perfect movie to not watch
text: I loved the jurassic park movies when i was a kid, and i still love them. This just feels like classic jurassic park, a lot of dinosaurs and a lot of screaming. The plot was okay, a world filled with dinosaurs and a divided opinion on if they should stay or go.It's a perfect movie to not watch because i watched this with my girlfriend and it's the perfect movie to just watch with someone casually, not too crazy of a plot, scary tense moments sometimes. You could look away from the screen and still get a grasp of what's going on.I would recommend, for kids and for couples. I don't know about single people though !

title: Really enjoyed it, ignore the bad reviews !!
text: Ignore the bad reviews, it's a little bit of a slow burner with all the characters but once going it's great. Plenty of action, jump scares, new dinosaurs and some great throw backs the the OG JP. The effects are amazing and so is the dolby atmos sound too. Loved it !!

title: Takes real talent to make a movie this bad
text: I dont even want to talk about the acting or the story because there not much in this movie, but whats really amazing to me is how they manage to make the dinos so fake that the Jaws looks like it was made 20 after this movie looolI think studios trying to cut costs in any way possible finally reached a new lowlow.

title: Highly enjoyable if you turn off your brain
text: Is this really what people want to watch today? Mindless action scenes? Nothing in this film is remotely believable. The chase scenes are clich and of course they had to have a T-rex battle. The dialogue is poor, characters aren't developed, and everything feels cheap. There's an overreliance on CGI as well. They should have stopped after the 1st film. Why is there a need to make the same movie over again multiple times?

title: Disappointing
text: I didn't expect a lot from this part,specially after watching the trailer but seriously this part really disappointed me alot in terms of story and screenplay and most importantly there was no wow moments.

title: Not even the dinosaurs were interested in any of the characters
text: This is such a lost and disinterested plot that not even the dinosaurs were interested in any of the characters. Even if there's is no story, just a bunch of bad mad and giant dinosaurs hungry for a chunk of meat there should be a guideline as to how they hunt like the sense of sight, sound or smell. No there's none of that as well. At least it's good enough as time killer. Expect nothing and you won't be disappointed.

title: Sloppy at Points and Forgettable Throughout
text: Not awful, not great. Perfectly mindless fare, maybe a bit too long. The narrative is senseless and totally forgettable, but it's still gonna make buckets of money because the general audience isn't super discerning.Rewatch value: Little to none.

title: Genetic world
text:
This movie in the series has broken with the tradition of the obvious, i.e. That messing with God's creation spells disaster. This cheesy sequel with the usual clichs on running from dangerous animals only really has a simple message: the glorification of gene modification. The movie's content needs less attention than the message it conveys: "Curing disease" and "improving our foodsources" is the clich freecard for all games people allow themselves to play God, conveniently forgetting who would be benefiting from all such achievements, while the rest would never be allowed to be blessed by it. Just watch Elysium for what that would look like. Or think about modified viruses let loose from some obscure foreign lab, for that matter..
As if curing disease or modifying cropse would change anything about the fact of mortality. It's like allowing yourself to drink ten times as much before you get drunk: the result is the same, it's just your bar tab that gets a lot longer. Since it does not exactly solve the issue of overpopulation (imagine people suddenly living twice as long, global population would blow through the roof with an insane amount of people of old age that would need to be taken care of, since nobody would want to work for 100 years, collapse of the global pension system, etc.), let me take an educated guess who the select few would be to benefit from all these "fantastic gifts of science": definitely not the masses..
This is the wet dream of the power hungry due to their fear of being mortal: mortality means that at some point you will have to face your demons and boy, do they have a BIG closet of those!The irony: at the same time the movie proves that such dangerous science will always be abused, neither can it be controlled. The arrogance of the producers of this movie is to propagate something that is simply wrong. Guess it needs an audience of brainwashed to eat their garbage..
Oh, and welcome to the future where men are not needed! Let's just create pregnancies out of thin air and do away with men alltogether.

title: Performance was disaster
text: I gave it three because it was funny, performance was really bad, animation also bad, story very bad.. there was moments all actors were trying to be DEEP but also horrible.

title: CGI fakeness epileptic nostalgia overload
text: Just horrible.A massive FU to JP fans. Right on par with the first two JW movies. Zero substance.Lots of fake looking computer game dinosaurs to not care about. Just like the characters, plenty of but who gives a crap about them? Even the original cast was a giant raspberry. No talent in the writing or directing. The acting was garbage because, how do you react to something still being developed on computer imaging?Go see Top Gun 2. Even if you hate Tom Cruise, a lot more effort went in to that film and should be rewarded.

title: Let me save you the trouble!
text: No spoilers BUT in a nutshell: its basically the same as every other Jurassic movie in this franchise, all that changes is the location, the villain and a few newbies thrown into the mix! Beginning, middle and end is the the same and has the same outcome, its repetitive and boring!

title: Too slow
text: I love the jurassic park/world franchise but this movie was so slow that my kids fell asleep in the theater. Too slow and very little action, the best thing about the movie are the original characters coming back but other than that this was not one of the best. I give it a 5 star because of the original characters.

title: This is an insult to Steven Spielberg.
text: This movie is the clear example of creative saturation within the same saga. Jurassic Park should have only been 1 movie, but let's be real, the producers weren't going to pass up the opportunity to make money on something as attractive as dinosaurs, even if for this they had to sacrifice the quality of the stories, among other things.In this film in particular, there is the complex issue of giving a believable plot. We know that everything on the screen is implausible, but that doesn't necessarily make it unbelievable. Well JW: Dominion fails massively on this. Nothing is believable. There is a fatal combination of poorly achieved factors, such as editing, script and visual effects. If these pillars fail, we have a tedious, messy, and horrible-looking movie. Dinosaurs never feel like part of the landscape. It's too noticeable that they are a digital addition. And the puppets are downright laughable. Unbelievably, almost 30 years after the original Jurassic Park, they still can't top those visuals and practicalities.If this movie doesn't kill the series, I hope they don't make another one to do it.

title: Lots of Dino Fun
text: Ignore the bad reviews (unless you hate big dumb movies), this film is what Imax was made for. Lots of thrills, chills and laughs, it also satisfyingly ends two sagas.My two complaints are, it could of featured more of the wonderful Jeff Goldblum who is brilliantly funny in this, and a little bit more of the dinosaurs rampaging throughout the world. Other than that, Jurassic World delivers on all levels, which must been seen at the cinema!

title: Only half-decent thing about this was the CGI
text: No words... Absolutely no damn words about this atrocious movie. This made the 2nd Jurassic World installment look like Jurassic Park, what even was this? Just as I thought it couldn't get worse after the 2nd one, here Colin goes and proves me dead wrong. Plot and scenes made no sense, characters were just desperate nostalgia acts, this looked like if "Fast and Furious" was a dinosaur movie. Absolute disgrace. Don't ever make another, just end it here, thank you. I will keep it at 1 and a half star just because it was aesthetically pleasing to look at and the dinosaurs as always were well made and nice CGI.

title: Everithing is wrong
text: No soul or Good cinema in this nunsence hibrid. Bad acting, lassy script, bad music choices. It's seems that they just want to make money. They don't think in the full cinematic experience or in the real entertainment of the audience. A real petty. They Just destroyed the saga.

title: Just stop
text: They have to stop making these Jurassic Movies. They have gotten so dumb since the 90s. And everyone is dumber than the one before it. Stop making this crap.

title: ADHD Dino Movie
text: I never watched Fallen Kingdom. I saw Jurrasic world, but only remember snibbits. It was just a popcorn flick.We threw this in out of boredom and it was terrible. Some CGI was bad. Most was fine. The acting was hampered by a poor script. The script was handled like a comedy action flick with heavy-handed post modernism environmentalist schlock.1. Big business is killing our food supply and abusing animals as a commodity. They actively destroy our food for profit. They have no moral compass.2. Dinosaurs are special endangered species who deserve protection even though, in this movie's reality, they are an invasive species that pose danger to the human population.3. Scientists ate pure of heart truth seekers only seeking truth.Our heroes are stupid characters who can't hold our attention unless something is chasing them or something is blowing up. Seriously, there are three moments where the characters seem to not be running and screaming.Then there's Pratt hand. Apparently it just works on every Dinosaur regardless of familiarity.This movie was big, loud, nonsensical, and a waste of time. If you like that, please enjoy yourself. It was not made for people like me.

title: Decide on your own
text: I ignore a lot of the reviews on here now. They are all written by people who think they're world class film critics. I'm a big movie fan and have loved all the Jurassic films and heard its the worst one yet. Its a good entertaining film with action a fairly good story line and if you just simply enjoy a good film then it's a good watch. I'm tired of every person moaning about a film because it doesn't have good cinematography or screenplay or the lighting was terrible. It's a film, sit down and just enjoy it for what it is. It's only a movie, it's not real life. It's great to see all the original cast and new together.

title: It could have been better
text: I watched this movie in IMAX 3D with great expectations as this is a final installment of Jurassic movies but I got disappointed. Only 2 things are good in this movie 1. Animation of Dinosaurs and 2. One bike chase scene. Otherwise story is bad. Movie is kind of boaring. Senseless dinosaur fights. No edge of the seat action or mystry as shown in some previous movies. Conclusion - you can watch this movie but don't keep expectations.

title: A complete waste of money and time!
text: Maybe hiring this number of 'stars' left them with no budget to actually write a script. There's is absolutely no plot here, it's all noise nad music above ridiculous and nonesense lines of dialogue. I really almost walk out of the theater. Worst of 2022!

title: Yes.. The story is bad... To many plothole...
text: Yes the action is good,, but the story is makes no sense and to many plothole,,,, and almost the remake of the same other jurasic park/ world... This is the worst of the frainchise..

title: An Unworthy Successor
text: Dull characters, an unfocused plot, and a lack of any sense of tension completely divorce this film entirely from the original movie - flaws frequently shared by almost all the movies that came after the first, but never more glaring than in Dominion.I wouldn't say it has zero entertainment value; it can be a fun action romp. But it's a part of the Jurassic franchise in name only.

title: Get Over Yourselves - it's a Smashy Bashy Dinosaur Movie!!
text: My wife, my 10yr old son and I just came back from a matinee showing. We LOVED it. Sure it's not perfect, sure there's slower exposition bits but at the end of the day it's a loud smash bash Dino adventure with great action set pieces ( one motorbike sequence better than any Bond film). Some of the one-liners don't land but who cares?? The old gang are back together and there's a keeping family together sub plot which is cute. Don't over think it for crying out loud - it's a Jurrasic Park film and it's great. Unpopular opinion for you - I had more fun watching this than I did last week watching Maverick (which is still pretty great). See it for what it is - fun.

title: Dinosaur movie in which dinosaurs take a back seat to people and bugs.
text: That's it, all you need to know. Check your suspension of disbelief at the door and don't pick it back up for a week. Some fun scenes but the dinosaurs could be written out and you'd essentially have the same movie. Actors are good though. They did what they could with the story given. Seeing the original three was charming and nostalgic.

title: Lost World 2.0
text: Didn't think they could make a Jurassic film worse than Lost World: mission accomplished!Trying to bring back all the old cast for nostalgia to allure the 90s generation sounded good but was a fail.This Colin Trevmoron directed ruined this franchise. Just another example of Hollywood trying to capitalize repeatedly on one good film.This film is awful. I'd like my 2+ hrs back.

title: Out of date actors topping the pensions up...
text: If you was expecting these scaly giants to be roaming around the streets after the ending of the previous movie.... Think again.Another park and the same storylines re-visiting all the same things as before with the odd nostalgic theme tune from the original thrown in.Would have been much better storyline the dinosaurs reclaiming the planet in an apocalypse style movie with humans thrown back to the Stone Age.Jeff Goldblum is his usual annoying self with the same style of dialect and thinks he is funny quips as he does all his movies. That guy has stolen a living.All in all I wasted a couple of hours watching this cac!Don't bother.Up the tics.

title: Jurassic World Dominion (bluray extended edition)
text: I personally enjoyed this more than the Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom.ILM had done a great job on the larger dinosaurs, but sometimes seem a little plastic on the small ones.From the get-go, I watched the extended edition on bluray, but I'm not sure how much extra content is has compared to the theatre edition, so I can't really comment on that one!It was very nice to see the old and new characters mixed together in the film working together, and not just in a nostalgic way.Sometimes I could not help to think the film seem to have a James Bond feel to it, in a good way.Overall a very good enjoyable easy going action adventure movie, with a little of Bond feeling thrown in.A solid 8, although I gave 10 : o )

title: What the Hell did I just watch
text: The whole point or expectation of Jurassic park is the dinosaurs. Therefore shouldn't the plot center around them ? Instead the plot focuses on an ecological disaster . Oh and don't worry when situations get sticky there's a whole slew of women to bale out the incapable men. Congratulations Hollywood on your woke movie and confusing plot . This movie is one word .... GARBAGE.

title: "He slid into my DMs"
text: This movie was so bad me and my partner could not finish it. This movie is overloaded with filler and has a bottomless pit of screenwriting blunders that truly make me wonder if any proofreading occurred during the making of this movie. There are multiple moments where it sounds like real conversations about the movie accidentally made it into the script."Why did we make this movie?" "For the money Alan..."The film has no sense of tone, pacing, plot, or character development of any kind. And we are treated to yet more entirely unbelievable scenes of Chris Pratt taming 6 foot tall velociraptors with The Force. It is a disaster of Jurassic proportions.

title: Fairly awful, doesn't do the original justice
text: Apart from the animation being very rough in places, what's happened to Sam Neil's voice, sounded like someone completely different did a rushed voice over. He also was notably quiet in quite a few scenes. Maybe there's something wrong behind the scenes but it just seemed wrong. I think this has gone far enough now and hope they don't make another one. Sorry if you loved it, it didn't do anything for me though, waiting for it to finish but at least watched it till the end. No spoilers from me here so don't worry about that. I think the old original had better effects even though its a lot older.

title: Go Back To The Drawing Board
text: Jurassic World Dominion provides nothing of what made the original a thrilling time at the movies. There is a short supply of suspense, uninteresting characters, lazy performances, flat story and a bloated running time. The only highlight was a decently shot chase sequence half way through the movie. Nothing else to recommend here.

title: Really enjoyed it
text: I'm not sure what all the negativity was about. I'm a Jurassic fan and I thought it was definitely on par with the previous films. The action scenes were great and the plot is nowhere near as weak as it's being made out to be.Go and see it!

title: Disappointed
text: Too much time spent on revisiting the characters and their past relationships. Would of preferred a good story, some big screen excitement. I would of turned it off if watching it at home.

title: How the mighty have fallen...
text: Jurassic Park has been my favourite film since it had first come out. It is a perfect masterpiece, that overcomes any flaw by grabbing you emotionally, as well as still being one of the most entertaining movies ever made. The sequels, while not being nearly as good, all delivered on the dinosaur action and had some good moments (the action in Lost World and 3 at times rivaled the action in that original movie, and World had some excellent ideas and moments of awe). But each one carried with it a little less of the magic than the last one. Here at Jurassic World Dominion that magic is gone. Its been flushed down the toilet!The film has 2 stories. Owen and Claire are rescuing a kidnapped girl and baby raptor. And then Alan Grant, Ellie Setler and Ian Malcolm are doing some espionage to stop an evil corporation from doing some dodgy stuff. Oh, also there are dinosaurs...sometimes, when the script needs them.There is no sugar coating it. This was terrible. Absolutely terrible! Fallen Kingdom, while not being a film I like, had a weird charm to it; great visuals, good direction and a Corman-esk final act. This, I appreciate now, elevated it from being garbage, even if it had none of what made the original good in the first place. So, and you read right, Dominion lacks what made Fallen Kingdom 'good'.Other than the nostalgia of seeing Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldbloom together again, this film has nothing going for it. It is completely soulless. The story doesn't work, and often uses action scenes to make it look like we are going somewhere. Most of the new actors are giving horrible performances. The music sucks, unless they use the original score in poorly placed moments. It is cripplingly boring on top of it all.The rest of the series coasted on dino action when all else failed. This was why I went to see this one. But even that is a let down. There are many types of dinosaurs here, but the dinosaurs feel secondary to everything else that is going on. The action rings hollow. Not to spoil, but the ending action scene left so little impact, it was shocking. You can't even enjoy the effects this time as they are easily the worst of the whole series. The CGI is fine, if a little wonky at times, but the animatronics are worse than those on the theme park ride. Stan Winston will be rolling in his grave.There are moments here and there. A scene involving a dinosaur with enormous claws was genuinely well done. Sam Neill and the others are great to watch. A tunnel scene with the dilophosaurus was creepy. And there are a good number of moments that had me laughing at the stupidity and absurdity of it all.In the end, that first film being my favourite of all time and the rest being good (or at least dumb) fun, I really didn't like this one. I am unsure as to whether I hate it or not, but that I am contemplating this, it is just sad to me. I felt like I was watching my copy of Jurassic Park burn. I don't care if they make any more, this is the last one for me.

title: VFX is worth but Story / Screenplay was quite disappointing!
text: In a story like this it must be scary, pressure, curiosity and yet most importantly unpredictable! But it was lacking everything the above which made it pretty boring.

title: My son lives for these movies
text: I took my 11 year old son, who because of the Jurassic movies wants to be a paleontologist. This was his favorite movie of the franchise. I'm not a big Dino fan but I was surprised to enjoy this movie as well. We loved the movie and will be seeing it again.

title: Really Bad...
text: After the ending of "Fallen Kingdom" I had very low expectations for the third installment. When it was announced the original trio was coming back my hopes soared. Boy was this disappointing. The plot had almost nothing to do with the dinosaurs. In fact the movie would have ended the same way if the Dino's weren't even in the film. This is easily the second worst behind only "Fallen Kingdom."

title: Fun Classic Movie
text: Excellent classic style American movie. Jurassic World isn't selling any political ideals, nor are there an LGBT scenes. It's a fun movie with good acting, and an excellent story plot. Entertainment at its best, and the way movies used to be like.

title: Disappointing
text: Not a very epic conclusion if you ask me. It's a really boring and uninteresting plot that jumps around a lot with a couple excellent action scenes, and a few terrible ones. The first 30 minutes is used to just catch up on all the characters and it doesn't really have any special moments to make it interesting, even the legacy characters coming back didn't feel as awesome as it should've. For the second act it's mostly 2 different plot points happening at once, the legacy characters trying to expose the CEO bad guy, and the new characters trying to rescue Maisie and Blue's child. Neither are super interesting but the new characters end up in a Malta action sequence that is absolutely amazing. In the meantime the legacy characters are just trying to extract some DNA and it's not really that interesting and not much really happens. A couple really good action scenes with the new characters and then they all converge for the final act, which is the biggest disappointment of it all. There's a few fun interactions between all of the characters, but the action itself is slow and meanders without being really tense. In the end the characters just kinda get on a helicopter and 2 dinosaurs randomly come in and fight, it's basically the end of the first Jurassic world and the second Jurassic world combined to make a really boring ending. Overall the movie underutilized its legacy characters and meanders too much with only a few excellent action scenes and a very unepic conclusion.

title: Not about dinosaurs
text: This movie was not about dinosaurs at all. It was about a girl and some locusts. Too bad, because it was filmed beautifully on 35 mm. Otherwise, I would gave it 1 star.

title: Chris Pratt holds up his hand part 3
text: Welcome to Jurassic world dominion where characters don't matter, plot is the chaos theory, and Dino's respect the hell out of Chris Pratt. This movie isn't just bad, it's so atrociously uninspired I felt a need to review it. The acting was stiff, the script was a masterclass of "NOOOO," and the editing was clearly a badly placed bandaid on a giant mistake of a film because it was all over the place.Please do not help this movie make money because if they make more blockbusters at this quality mankind will be worse for it. I like dinosaurs. I like Jurassic park. I like the idea of dino's all over the modern world. I do not like whatever this is. It's so bad I went from cringe, to laughing, to sadness for whoever has to put their name on this movie.

title: Great Extended Version of the film
text: I have no idea why people are hating on this film so much if their fans of any Jurassic World movie or any sequels for that matter. Jurassic Park (1993) is a great film, it's my favorite film of all time. As a kid I wore out a VHS of Jurassic Park, so needless to say I've seen it hundreds of times.I think Dominion is a good sequel, the return of the original three characters is great to see. The extended version of the film is much better than the theater version. The beginning is better and the extra 13 minutes ads a lot of script and depth to the characters. There was a lot of script and dialogue cut out of the movie for theaters.I will agree it has a lot of mindless action, lots of dinosaurs, and yes lots of CGI. But that is expected with any Jurassic Park sequel. If you watch the behind the scenes you will appreciate they did have puppetry and animatronics throughout the film. More animatronics than probably any other sequel besides the Lost World.Overall this is a very entertaining film with tons of action. The variety of different sets is also very nice to see, and of course the original three characters are wonderful to all see in a Jurassic film again.Again I don't understand all the hate on this film. If you hate this film, then how can you justify any of the sequels? Don't listen to the majority of the sheep. Be a wolf and make up your own mind.

title: Pathetic
text: This is first series that degraded story with upcoming part....with or without dinosaur, the story will remain same. Beside few action scene, its worst movie of franchise.

title: screen with black stripes :( , 3d ???? joke
text:
Movie 3d ?????? :) a good joke . Screen with black stripes , lousie image for a cinema Premiere....
i waited so long to see this movie...an deception ..

title: A Long, Fun Ride
text: Ignore all of the couch potato, nothing creating, over the top hater reviews. These days everyone wants to slam things for what they are not rather than enjoying things for what they are. If you are NOT one of those people and just want to watch a popcorn worthy, edge of your seat at times thrill ride, this movie is for you.People have lost their ability to enjoy things for what they are. This movie is such a great ride. Obviously they had to do some sort of story, but that's not what these movies are about. Crazy dinosaur action with amazing special effects and some great one liners. Watch it for what it is. A long, fun ride.

title: Genetic British accent
text: Fun to watch dinosaurs chase people. Plot is ridiculous and acting seems like the first take every time. But I still found myself entertained to the very end.

title: Err? What Utter Gobbledygook.
text: Where have all the heroes gone?Seriously! What happened to Chris Pratt's role? He was sidelined for a female centric escape into the land of gobbledygook.I genuinely don't know, but, this feels like someone gave a female literature graduate her first writing job.Went with the boy; who snoozed through half of it.3 stars is generous. Poorly written, acted (but they had to work with terrible writing) & directed.I'm presuming this will kill off the franchise in its current form.

title: Not that good - Poor writing
text: Going to keep this quick.Very predictable, almost as if they grabbed circumstances from all the other movies and popped them into this one.You'd think by now that a more modern, realistic depiction of dyno behaviors would be present in this film, NOT. Yes, they upgraded some of the species to include feathers and more bird-like appearances, but the behavior is still 20th century. Carnivore dinos probably were not always running around trying to eat everything they saw, but that's been Jurassic's depiction of them in every movie. Plus the carnivore dynos seem to be made of indestructible material. With exception to other dynos, bullets, cars hitting them, and falling off high places seem to have little to no effect on them.I would've rated this film lower, but the visual effects were good. Please let this be the last film for this franchise.

title: Prehistoric Fun!
text: I don't know why all the critics and some fans did not like this! I actually thought it was one of the best films in the franchise. It was fun to see the former and new cast meet and the amazing chemistry of all of them mixed in with the usual Jeff Goldblum dry humor. The dinosaurs were more of a back story but it was interesting how they introduced a new plot line to make it unpredictable and exciting! Don't listen to the negative reviews and go grabs some popcorn and go see this or stream it and you will be glad you did!

title: What is this seriously?
text: No plotline, no action, no dino... Just pure BD most of the duration. A good fight never came in the movie. Not even in the climax scene.Worst ever jurassic park movie ever.Waste of money.

title: A glorious wrap-up to an epic franchise!
text:
How do you bring to a close a story that has been with us for most of our lives? Chapter by chapter, we've gotten to know these characters well enough to call them friends, and now that the end has come, what could be more fitting than to bring them all together for one last adventure, one that will answer the questions raised in prior episodes, give us hope that the future can embrace the past, and prove that what we're becoming is better than what we've been?The answer, dear viewer, is here on the screen before us, and it is a glorious ending to one of cinema's finest storylines, and a truly worthy coda to this uniquely human journey. Well done, everyone! And thank you to all of the artists and craftsmen who have made this possible, and to the father of it all, Michael Crichton. He would have been proud of you all...Mike Ferguson
Honolulu
7-16-22.

title: I fixed your script, you can pay me in weed
text:
I did not like the movie for numerous reasons, here are just a few:
I like good movies so that obviously ruled out this one.A well written screenplay can be as good as a novel sometimes, yeah with this movie that's a big nope.I like dinosaurs I think they're awesome and I'm a grown man, I have a shirt with a dinosaur on it, I realize that last part is tangential to my point I guess im just trying to establish that i like dinosaurs, this movie talks in the movie all about how horrible exploiting dinosaurs is while kind of exploiting dinosaurs in real life with endless soulless marketing and merchandising. I mean Jurassic World's bread and butter is selling kids dinosaur crap 24/7.I love it when actors turn the words of a script into a real moment, y'know, what we call good acting? Yeah in this movie all the acting is in relation to a computer generated image, it can't possibly be real or dynamic because the shot requires the actors to be secondary to computer crap.I will accept a check.

title: Extinct!
text: This was so boring.I'm not sure why, or how they managed to make a film about humans and dinosaurs living together so dull...but they did!Some of the CGI looked absolutely dire.Honestly, they've been trying to recapture the magic of the first movie for decades - they need to stop! They're NEVER going to do it. JP1 was something new, original...and epic. Everything that's come after it, fails miserably in comparison.I for one, will not be watching any more of the franchise, as every time I do, a little part of me dies inside...and it's a kick in the teeth to the original.Maybe it's the cast, the director, the writer...I just don't know...but whatever it is, it's awful.RIP Jurassic Park franchise.

title: Time to go the way of the dinosaurs
text: The summer box office continues to heat up with this weeks' release of Jurassic World Dominion, the sixth and final installment of the popular movie franchise based on Michael Crichton's novels. Twenty-nine years after Jurassic Park, dinosaurs are living and hunting alongside humans taxing the fragile balance of nature all over the world. Well, that's what we're led to believe is the setup for Jurassic World Dominion, however, the movie we actually get is an altogether different beast.Jurassic World Dominion is essentially two different films with the original trio of Sam Neil (Alan Grant), Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern), and Jeff Goldblum (Ian Malcolm) reuniting in one story (the more interesting of the two in my opinion) and Chris Pratt (Owen Grady) and Bryce Dallas Howard (Claire Dearing) picking up and continuing their story from Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom. Eventually the two stories meet and everything is brought to a conclusion.Sadly, the conclusion, as well as the ride leading up to it is far from spectacular or overall satisfying.The pacing in Jurassic World Dominion is clunky and uneven, particularly in the beginning. Many of the themes are heavy handed and preachy to the point of making you feel you're sitting in a lecture hall. Oddly enough, Ian's actual lecture in the film is more entertaining and thought provoking than the bludgeoning messaging throughout the rest of the film. The call backs to previous films in many cases are stale. With the exception of the original Big Three, the returning characters are lifeless (in Pratt's case the film plays more like a contractual obligation) and uninspired. BD Wong's Dr. Wu takes an unexpected turn and the resolution of his story line feels unearned. New characters aren't fleshed out and act more as props to get from point a to point b than characters.Worse still, Jurassic World Dominion, is a dinosaur movie that has little to do with dinosaurs. Again, Goldblum's Ian says it best when he goes off on the seduction of dinos excusing what's going on. A note that the writers should of taken when sussing out the story. Dinosaurs are freely living among humans, what's that like? Dunno, it's glossed over save for a few references. I mean at one point in this 2 hour 26 minute film you go a good half hour to forty minutes without seeing or hearing ANYTHING about the dinosaurs.Serious bait and switch as well as a major disappointment.The biggest saving grace of Dominion is the legacy characters, especially Goldblum's Ian. The wit, charm, and humor is classic. All three actors seem to be having a blast and it shows and you feel it ever time they're on screen. When you get the dinosaurs they look amazing. These bad boys never fail to delight.All told Jurassic World Dominion looks great, has some shining moments, but ultimately is lifeless. If this is what the franchise has to offer, it's time to let it go the way of actual dinosaurs.Jurassic World Dominion gets a disappointing 5 from me.

title: Generic and cringe
text: I literally walked out of the theater.This movie must have been not fun to shoot, therefore it was not fun to watch.Cringe and corny, generic and bad writing/acting overall. But i still love Chris Pratt.

title: The Return of the B Movie
text: The biggest problem with movie, it's devoid of a working script. The beginning of the film seems like a recycled Indiana Jones movie. It's nice to see the original actors return for this movie. The lack of script gives us a movie within a movie. The new characters vs the original characters. In spots the CGI is bad and will age horribly. Although it's not a Roger Corman film. This is what a Corman film with $150 million dollar budget would look like. Complete with a fiery ending.

title: Listen Up
text: If you're a fan of all the movies- you'll like it. I loved it actually. And if you're really nit-picking.. nobody got time for that. Relax. All the characters together was a very fun touch. I feel satisfied with this ending in the trilogy... there's not much any other direction the 3rd one could have gone. Can't use same formula exactly. It's definitely worth a watch unless you're a very uptight person about these movies.

title: Could have been epic..only thing it dominated was my wanting it over!
text: I honestly don't understand how they decide to bring together all the Jurassic favorites only to what - stop a bunch of giant, mutated locusts?! The writing sucks, the plot sucks, the acting sucks, the action scenes suck...basically the only good thing about this movie is the dinosaurs.I only give this 2 stars because the graphics are amazing! It's very sad and disappointing to go to a movie excited because of the all-star cast and see good actors seemingly forcing themselves through the movie.Owen (Chris Pratt) should have extended out his arm with his hand in a "stop" position to being in this half-assed, thrown together, no heart in it, just trying to fulfill an obligation for a 3rd movie, pile of Triceratops crap that Dominion is!!Another trilogy ruined by the 3rd installment. Save your time and money by not even bothering with this one. I never want to watch it again!!

title: Waste of money and time
text:
Extream boring and slow it's much more like drama and little romance mixed up than a typical dinasour movie.i was praying to god when it's gone end
Complete disaster
Don't wast your time .

title: What a trainwreck.
text: Just got back from a friday early afternoon show. My feelings about this are pretty fresh and may mellow over the coming weeks, but I was not impressed.This is essentially The Rise of Skywalker for the JP franchise. Lots of fan service, lots of Spielberg references, lots of "remember that from the previous films??!" moments. It lacked any compelling story, making a Monsanto-type corporation the antagonist/bad guy with heroes/protagonists that make nonsensical decisions that serve only to propel the audience to the next action sequence.I can't tell if this movie needed to be split into two films so each could breathe on their own and develop its own story, or if this script just needed several more rewrites to get to a better form. At 2h30m, its a bloated frenzied mess that has huge holes in the plot, massive leaps of logic, and no real sense of what it wanted to say.The first JP was a marvel. Groundbreaking visual effects, one of the most memorable scores of the last 30 years, timeless quotes and sequences that entertain my kids as much as it entertained me when I first saw it. And no real heavey plot driven story. It was pure escapism. Jurassic World: Dominion is the sort of Frankenstein's monster it is trying to warn the world about. These hybrid dinosaurs, these man-made attempts to recapture the natural elegance of something less engineered, are to be feared as well as the people that seek the power to make and control them. The same could be said for the current decisionmakers that greenlit this to the theaters. Lots of recycled parts from other better movies to produce something loud, brash and just unintelligible.

title: Bandwagon reviews are saying it sucks, but it doesn't
text: Look, obviously there's no comparison to the first film; it was nearly perfect, and this one has flaws. Still, it's by far the best of the sequels.The dinosaurs look and feel incredible, and in this film they are everywhere. There are a couple main story threads that bring the main characters together, and one is more interesting than the other, but both hold your attention- and once the main characters are together, there is great chemistry there.They didn't bring the old characters in for a quick cameo at the end, either, they are integral to the plot and drive things forward in their own right.Jeff Goldblum, particularly, is just so entertaining to watch.Also, it's nonsense to say this movie is "woke" just because they added a young black female character to the cast. She was a good character. A "Han Solo type" pilot who doesn't want to get involved but can't help herself.Then the other half are mad that Chris Pratt was allowed to be in this film even though he's been publicly open about his faith- it must be exhausting to try to entertain people these days.I brought my 13 year old son to this and I'm so glad I did. This film was a massive spectacle and at the end it felt like we had just finished something special. The long runtime flew by.I don't know what some reviewers were expecting- perhaps the first film again- this isn't that. But it's fun and tense and amazing. I think it's become in fashion to bash these films (and the last one may have deserved it) but this one is very good.

title: Might have been a three...
text: ...but Gay Conversion advocate Chris Pratt reduces the score of all films he's in by a minimum of 10 and I can't mark zero.No spoilers, but there's dinosaurs in it, sometimes. Also it's excruciatingly boring. Glad I pirated it and didn't pay a penny to the studio.

title: Bad writing and many continuity errors
text:
I loved to see Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum returning to a Jurassic movie. But the story barely makes sense and the movie has lots of continuity problems (wait, how and why did he get from there to here in just one cut?, how did he get his hat back?, why is there still a lush field of grain, when it's full of giant locusts...)
Michael Crichton might rotate in his grave when he'd know what they made out of his books.The movie looks good, though. Maybe they could do a director's cut w/o the bonkers story and just the dinosaur scenes in it. I would give that an 8.

title: Disappointed. Disservice to the actors and characters.
text: Loved Jurassic Park 1 and 2. Liked Jurassic Park 3, Jurassic World 1 and 2. Dominion has a story that is just stupid, re-hashed garbage. Several scenes that pay homage to the original but to be honest I wish they didn't do that at all, that is what I hated about the new Star Wars trilogy. Don't want to speak on the story and possibly ruin it for those who have not seen it, I will just say I have no desire to watch this one again as I was bored watching it the first time and never had that problem in any of the other films. Felt the actors did a great job with the crap material they were given. They deserve better.

title: This should be 4* movie
text: This is the worst movie in the franchise.I have watched the whole movie and felt this is not worth watching.In the first scene on horses I felt the graphic are so bad. Overall don't waste your money.

title: Disappointed
text: I thought it was the worst film in the entire franchise.What could have been a great ending the the last set of three was let down by bad directing and an awful script.

title: Gimmicky, has been done.
text: Kind of amazed how bored I felt watching this.Playing on some nostalgic scenes that are just bad.Some cool action scenes in the beginning is the only redeeming quality.Chris Pratt and Jeff Goldbloom are great.

title: "The biggest dinosaur the world has ever seen!"
text: I am shocked the with the reviews this film is getting, which made me very sceptical before going into the theaters.I love this franchise ever since day 1 with Jurassic Park back in 1993. Yes, it has had its up and downs, and will never catch the "wow" factor but a film that has dinosaurs is wow enough. The JW series have made significant changes in capturing that moment to put into their own mark in the franchise, which I think this chapter is the strongest and most entertaining.The nostalgia aspect of the film may lead me to being a biased to why I enjoyed it as much as I did.... but everything else this movie offered was great, though at first I thoughts the pacing of the movie dragged but coming away and really thinking about the story it's just a minimal let down for me.The throwbacks in these movies like to add are an amusing part of why I enjoy the JW series, and they do not disappoint in JW3.Overall this movie is the best of the JW series which old and new character times being used on screen will have you enjoy every moment, that's also including the dinosaurs adding to the enjoyment. DO NOT listen to the negative comments before seeing this movie, and save the agreements or disagreement tIll after you have seen JW3.

title: Corny, not the same quality as previous two
text: Wow. Just wow. Another post lock-down disaster. Releasing garbage movies as quick as possible after things open back up to make up for lost $$$ after the last couple years.Quality is terrible. The storyline is a joke. Plastic dinosaurs that look completely and obviously fake. This is not a Jurassic world sequel. Corny is the best way to describe.Geared for youth. My ten year old seemed to enjoy it, so I give it a few stars. Having known just how corny it is, I would not recommend wasting your time going to see this in theater. Wait till it comes out on video and let your kiddo watch it. I'd say suitable for 6+ years.

title: Wasted potential.
text: Without a doubt the worst movie in the "Jurassic" saga. By a long long way.There are dinosaurs. Unfortunately they're basically playing bit parts to a lot of unnecessary people.They've tried to make this movie appeal by putting characters from the original "Jurassic Park" movies and the "Jurassic World" movies together with some nostalgic nods to various things.It doesn't work. The acting by virtually everyone involved is just insanely wooden. It doesn't matter what reason you want to watch this movie you'd be better off watching any of the other movies and pretend this one never happened.Honestly there's nothing at all that saves this movie.It is actually so bad it made me angry because I was hoping for something amazing.If this doesn't end a few careers I'll be very surprised.

title: Terrible CGI
text: Have to be the worst CGI I've ever seen in a Jurassic Park movie. Predictable with no surprises but I've seen worse. Hope this is the last one because there's nothing more to explore here.....

title: Don't read and WATCH!!! Haters are my favorite...
text: I don't understand, why people ranted against this movie. It's a really FUN ride. I loved it. I went to see with negative comments in mind and it exceeded my expectations. HATERS are my favorite...

title: Big yikes
text: Wow.. big yikes here. I'll start off by acknowledging that the production quality and financial backing for this movie did show up. Also, the premise itself for this movie was promising although it was poorly executed. The story line was severely broken and difficult to follow and far too much was jam packed into a movie that was already way too long. Also, the acting was terrible. It seems as though they too realized this movie was purely being made to capitalize on additional revenue and feed off the Jurassic Park brand. This needs to be the last of its kind before they entirely ruin the legacy.

title: Nostalgia but no story
text: The movie is fun but soooooo dumb. BDH and Chris Pratt play stiff corpses with epic precision so they shoehorn nostalgia into every aspect of the movie in attempt to make the viewer forget the lack of a cohesive story or main characters to root for. The original gang's return is by far the high point even though they are given so little to do. Worth a watch but completely forgettable. Wait until it's available for a bargain. The movie suffers from the burden of its own length. Should have been 90 minutes.

title: The last Jurassic movie is epic!!!
text: I'm very shocked and surprised that there's a lot of negative reviews about this movie. This movie contains great CGI work, a story that brings the franchise to a close, and combining the old cast with the newer cast. Christ Prat and Bryce Dallas Howard out did there performances from the past two Jurassic World movies and made sure that they gave this movie their all. I saw this movie on June 9th, and I believe that this is a movie that should be loved and cherished. The screenwriters and the director did a great job at ending the franchise, unless another filmmaker will picks up this franchise. This movie is made for everyone, kids, teenagers and adults. Everyone should find this movie amazing. This is just as good as the first two movies. I think viewers now a days love to complain about everything. Jurassic World Dominion has everything that a Jurassic Park movie should have in it. Anyone who says this movie is terrible, needs to rewatch it.

title: Ok
text: I enjoyed this movie but it had a lot of flaws that made me confused and saying why did they put this in the film but there are good stuff in this film it's not all bad I would recommend it because I'm a big fan of Jurassic world since the first one so for this movie I give it a 6.2/10.

title: Great movie.
text: It does a great job tying Jurassic park with Jurassic World series. Highly recommend movie for teens or adults. Well thought of. Though starts of extremely slow.

title: Action without a plot
text: Jurassic World Dominion is a movie without a good flow. I found myself falling asleep at majority of the film. And that isn't because I saw it at midnight but because the film never was gripping. With what I saw as a pointless twist with one of the characters that did not land and the nostalgia of bringing old characters the only thing I thought Jurassic World Dominion did well was some and only some action scenes. A young family member of mine gave it a 5 out of ten and I couldn't agree more.

title: The end of dinosaur movies
text: This movie was campy and in no way exciting or amazing. It focused on large cat size crop eating locust, a girl who was miraculously birth due to a lizard gene her mother injected in herself. One of those lizards that don't need a male to reproduce. The dinosaurs didn't look realistic like I would have thought they'd look considering advances in CGI technology over the years. The actors are good actors but they just didn't have a good story line to compliment their craft. So I'm not criticizing the actors. My criticism is towards the producer of the film and the writers. The cgi could've been better especially when the money is there to get quality cgi design but, I guess this isn't a Avatar movie so. I was basically another dinosaur movie that wasn't really different from the others before it. They were actually good because we were first introduced to the images but, as time goes by, we expect those images to improve, get better, look even more realistic. The baby triceratops for instance look like robots mimicking what a baby triceratops would be like but, it was just too robotic in my opinion.

title: Below Average..
text: I had a lot of expectations from this movie specially when the fallen kingdom end on a cliffhanger. But the writers of this movie has totally waste the plot and just makes a simple ordinary Jurassic world that we have already seen before. Though action scenes was good and the appearance of new creature type dinosaurs was a bit of refreshment. But still it doesn't work for the story. Bringing back old characters is good to see but still you need to build the storyline in a proper way so that the old ones can fit properly. And the director & writers have failed to do this. Atleast you can watch one time it has some good dinosaur & action sequence but don't expect too much...

title: Hokey
text:
How many times are they going to use the same plot and expect audiences to pay money to see it...
Did you really think you could just show a mashup of the last two movies with a different title and we wouldn't notice?Throwing in the OG actors was a nice touch but even they seemed embarrassed to be participating in this never-ending merry-go-around.

title: Awesome combo
text: Loved the Union of the actors and how they played. Most of all the role of Mr. Neil's role as Mr. Grant the caring part for his role for each movie. He is so caring for the kids in each movie. While in the 1st Movie he was avoiding the small grand son he cares for them. Awesome. It suits Mr. Neil well. In all movies one of the msges is to do the right thing! Seeing the old school gang keep up with the new school was also awesome. The view.. when reaching the island where Bios was. My goodness. And even tough dinosaur in the movie with blue makes it loving. May no dinosaurs come to life again. Awesome movies the whole saga.Hope that more will continue.

title: How Hollywood murders a franchise
text: So much Hollywood clichs and it turns sadly this last movie into a cheap comedy.I do not have to tell any spiolers because the films itself is a big spoiler from the start. You know immediately which way the story goes and what will happen and this from scene to scene. I also spent money to see the movie in 3D and I could leave my glasses off because there were no effects at all. Sorry to say, and this for a fan of the first films, this last one is just a B film for kids.

title: Meh. I'm Sleepy and Want Tofu?
text: Jurassic World: DominionMeh! SKIP IT!The first 15 min is basically a commercial for PETA, but we'll call it PETD (People for the Ethical Treatment of Dinosaurs) where a group of people risks their lives to rescue a baby dino from confinement.Then we see several minutes of how science is the only truth, science is the best, and how science has the answers and will soon conquer cancer and every other disease that plagues humans... Which is absolutely amazing! I wonder if science will have an answer for sin and death, too. *Rolls eyes*The next few minutes are about how humans aren't special and we don't have dominion, which is a subtle attack against God's Word that tells us...Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the earth and subdue it; and have DOMINION over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over every living thing that moves upon the earth" Genesis 1:26-28and...And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul. Genesis 2:7And...So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them. Genesis 1:27Then there's 30 min of predictable action in a remote jungle-ish area where a group of not-special, "special" people are forced to face off against the monstrous beasts...oh, and, yes, !SPOLIER ALERT! Dinos eat the bad guy at the end. But is that really a spoiler, though? I think not.Oh, there is a part in the movie where one person is sorta special: A brilliant woman scientist who reproduced a genetically-modified and enhanced child on her own without a man. Lord have mercy.(Oh, and why do they only show white people with meaningful relationships in this movie? The black people seem oddly placed with no development simply to hit a quota. But nevermind. I won't go there.)Finally, in the last few minutes, we get to hear all about evolution and how humans are again not special and must learn to co-exist with all creatures. Creatures? Wait, isn't that from the Latin word, creatura, which means to create? Doesn't that imply a Creator? Never mind. I'll digress.Boring. Predictable. Played-out. Anti-Biblical. Anti-Christ. Environmental. Tofu. Californian. Atheist. But good animation! Yet, you've seen this movie 6 times already before. Put the $$ in your gas tank.

title: Just totally unwatchable nonsense
text: I don't know how its possible to spend all that time money and effort on a film and come out with this pile of garbage ... From the offset it so so overwhelmingly uninvolving it is staggering ... Its just really badly made ... It looks like half the actors weren't in the same place at the same time and most of the inter personal scenes were done individually with green screen then shoved together as best as the assistant could do ... If you make it through this it says something about your intellect, or maybe your ability to sleep sitting up ...And that was a better line than anything in this "film" ... Get a life instead of a sore butt watching this for 2 and a half BOOOOOOOOORING hours.

title: Absolutely brilliant
text: Awesome movie. Great fun and entertainment. The dinosaurs were incredible. The cast was perfect and all delivered. A proper movie with fun, adventure and elements of thriller too. Just watch and enjoy it.

title: Milking the franchise
text: Visually beautiful, the CGI is excellent, and it's a good job because this is light on script. Some great call backs to previous films especially the first, but some utterly implausible decisions made my characters. A few plot holes which makes me think scenes were cut, and some really poor continuity errors are disappointing.

title: Slow start,Better ending
text: The start was slow and not very interesting but closer to the end when all the group comes together the movie gets good and the relationships between the new cast and old cast are funny. They ended the Jurassic world movies very well. Had good ideas,just didn't all come together the greatest.

title: OK but to predictical
text: The characters are all good and so is all the effects so without a doubt You can see it was well made with a big budget.The negative side of this movie part of the storyline that makes it feel like go happy Disney production aimed for a much younger audience.Other negative things is that you can almost predict what is going to happen from screen to screen and that they either been lazy or just want to continue with the same typ av camera-shots, angel and close ups as previous Jurassic park movies so there is no surprise there.Is it worth the money to see this film in the cinema then I would say absolutely not but rather wait until you can rent it online or stream it because this is not really anything else then a cash cow they are milking for the brand name Jurassic park with hope that people are just going to watch it because of the name and earlier versions of it.There is a few good supering element of this movie but not enough to make this movie worth seeing in the cinema.

title: Well it has dinosaurs..
text: .. Unfortunately there's plenty of way less entertaining stuff as well. Dominion suffers more than most from Hollywood's seeming obsession with making even the most vacuous popcorn flicks as long as possible. The plot meanders along in two parts (one for the Jurrasic Park characters, one for the Jurrasic World ones) so that they can come together for what would be the last act if this film actually had structure.What is the plot that needs so much attention? You guessed it, evil bioengineering company in charge of dinosaurs. Fifth times a charm I guess. Not that the company have learned any lessons themselves, hiring Jeff Goldblums famous genetic sceptic Ian Malcom to talk about how great their genetic program is. Goldblum is the only real bright spot amongst a returning cast that are clearly going through the motions, although newcomer DeWanda Wise adds some spirit to proceedings and really needed more screen time.The franchise has long teased dinosaurs running amuck in the world at large and there is a little of that here, the highlight bering some unsuspecting cafe goers getting munched, but not enough to freshen up proceedings. It feels as if there aren't enough dinosaurs on screen in general and there really isn't enough imagination on display when they are.
