There are only so many time you can watch two dinosaurs roar at each other and take turns biting necks until one is thrown to the ground before the encounters feel as stale as the evil corporation plot.Had Dominion been a trim hour and forty minutes it might have been worth a watch for dinosaur fans (although probably not T-Rex ones) at least but at over two and a half hours it's impossible to recommend taking that much time out your day.

title: A Lame Duck of an Uninspired Dinosaur Movie
text: What a horrible hunk of junk. There's nothing new except different angles of dinosaurs that look computerized 80% of the time, the animatronic heads not that great, beyond stupid scenes with the same old over-volume music scores, once again the confused young protagonist who looks like someone out of 'Stranger Things', Chris Pratt playing cowboy and rangl'in a much bigger dino-varmint with a rope while riding a horse, the kids in near peril which everyone knows will make it but had to do the zoom up to their frightened faces and screems, I could go on and on with all the rehashed stupidness. It seems the movie was created per request of the celebrities managers just to rake in some dough. It's the same over-used to nausea formula of all J. P. movies, the 1st one the only time it worked.I've noticed or at least believe the ratings here are more accurate than on Prime, there it's almost a perfect 5 which scared me. I wondered if people have become this lame but was happy when I came here and a more believable rating exists.

title: Everything you wanted could have been done better.
text:
Film Review: Jurassic World, DominionPlot and Writing
"Jurassic World: Dominion" opens with a gripping portrayal of humans coexisting with dinosaurs, showcasing diverse reactions and the majestic beauty of these creatures. However, the film struggles with its dual plotlines, one of which-focused on Biocyn's creation of super locusts targeting rival crops-feels out of place in a dinosaur survival story. The motivations behind Biocyn's actions remain unclear, and the overuse of growling and snarling effects undermines the tension, making the dinosaurs feel like secondary elements rather than the main focus.Rating: 5/10Characters and Performances
The blended family dynamic featuring Pratt and Howard provides a comforting familiarity, while the return of fan-favorite velociraptor Blue is underutilized. The reappearance of original characters like Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern), Alan Grant, and Ian Malcolm brings excitement, though their roles often feel wasted on less engaging subplots. The attempt to redeem Henry Wu and revive Dodgeson's character falls flat, failing to evoke much interest.Rating: 6/10Pacing
The film's pacing suffers from a slow start and an uneven buildup of stakes. While the action sequences and chases are entertaining, they often stretch believability and lack originality, making the film feel like a series of repetitive chase scenes.Rating: 2/10Direction/Cinematography
The action sequences are marred by blurriness, and attempts at nostalgic cinematography often miss the mark. Chris Pratt's repetitive hand-extending gesture to calm dinosaurs becomes tiresome. The frequent encounters with new deadly dinosaurs, meant to build suspense, feel contrived and overdone.Rating: 4/10Visual Effects
The fast-paced action scenes detract from the detailed depiction of dinosaurs, and the use of animatronics often looks cheap rather than nostalgic. Wide panning shots and CGI, such as the flaming locusts, are visually stunning, but close-up animatronic dinosaurs disrupt the immersion.Rating: 4/10Sound
The soundtrack effectively uses soothing music to evoke empathy for dinosaurs and employs epic trumpet and brass for scale. The classic theme returns with Alan Grant, adding a nostalgic touch. However, excessive roaring detracts from scenes needing tension, though the slow piano theme at the end provides a fitting nostalgic close to the saga.Rating: 4/10Overall
"Jurassic World: Dominion" is a mixed bag, with strong performances and moments of visual and auditory brilliance overshadowed by a disjointed plot and pacing issues. Despite its ambitious scope, it fails to fully capture the magic of its predecessors.Overall Rating: 4.3/10.

title: Really loved this movie a lot and is probably my favorite entry in the Jurassic World trilogy
text: The film follows a totally different format with new dinosaurs and a brand new story line. What makes the film even better is that Sam Neill and Laura Dern reprise their respective roles as Dr. Alan Grant and Dr. Ellie Sattler along with Jeff Goldblum as Dr. Ian Malcolm who now works for Biosyn a genetics company much similar to InGen involved with bringing prehistoric locusts back to life specifically to consume rival crops. Anyways focusing more on the film, the visual effects such as the dinosaurs are incredibly jaw-dropping and realistic at the same time. There more times where the dinosaurs are animatronics and sometimes there's ones that are computer-generated by Industrial Light & Magic (the same company that did the visual effects for several film franchises such as Star Wars, Harry Potter, Terminator, Men In Black, Pirates of The Caribbean, and the Marvel Cinematic Universe). However, there were approximately 18 animatronic dinosaurs of various sizes along with some being used by puppetry. Despite that this film has gained several negative reviews outside of the U. S. territory making it $55.7 million, the film has projected to gross around $125 million in the U. S. from 4,676 theaters during it's opening weekend. If your a Jurassic World fanatic waiting for the ending of the series, then I would totally recommend on seeing this in theaters.

title: Messy but fun enough
text: Jurassic World: Dominion is a bit of a frustrating movie as all the parts are there to make a potentially great film. Dinosaurs let loose on the world and returning fan favourite characters from the OG trilogy should be a slam dunk, but the result is an overcrowded and sprawling film that lacks focus and originality.There are positives with this film. Some scenes were incredibly tense and well executed. A jungle scene with Bryce and a scene on an icy river were very well done I thought, but sequences like this were too few and far between.The inclusion of the legacy characters (Sam Neill, Jeff Goldblum, Laura Dern) was a nice touch, particularly Goldblum who had some incredibly tongue in cheek but satisfying one liners. I do think though that the inclusion of these characters over saturated the story a bit, and perhaps they could have been confined to smaller roles as there were just too many characters and plot threads crammed into the film.I would have liked to have seen a more meaty role for Bryce Dallas Howard as Claire. I feel like she's been let down by the franchise a bit and could have grown into a more layered character.Most frustratingly though, 3 films into the franchise now and I am very tired of Chris Pratt controlling dinosaurs with his hand. This really isn't as cool as the director seems to think. I also resent the fact that we were fed another sequence where Pratt is chased by raptors while on a motorbike. All the possible dinosaurs, all the potential set pieces, and we are fed the exact same thing from the two previous movies...The dialogue is also very poor. Full of clunky exposition and goofy one liners that didn't land at all. A bit of a mess from a writing perspective.I think the word clunky sums up this movie pretty well actually. Too many characters, messy dialogue, a tad too long, glimpses of cool dinosaur action but not enough of it. There's fun to be had with this film but for the most part it is a bit of a let down.

title: Very silly film, gets better as it goes.
text: I nearly gave up early on but stuck with it, once I had got used to just how silly it was though I started to enjoy it.The Dinosaurs do seem to have the advantage over the humans on the brains front though. I had to wonder if the script might have been a little better if the large beasties had of been given some kind of writing role.There does seem to be some reluctance to shoot dinosaurs, I would have thought this was the way to go when the crafty little devils are trying to eat you. Tazers seem to be the weapon of choice though, best to get close up and personal I guess, give them a sporting chance and all that.Suspend all belief, marvel at the awful script and cheer the dinosaurs on. 5 stars.

title: What could go wrong
text: With so many wonderful actors and a director who made Safety Not Guaranteed, what could go wrong. The answer is plenty. Some of the dialogue was so pathetic, you could even see the actors cringe as they delivered the lines. Saturday night at home with popcorn and lots of alcohol and you can barely get through it. The first two movies were groundbreaking, whereas the only ground this one breaks is the hearts of true fans.So many plot holes and whoops what's the lamest way we can bring them all together so we can at least finish the film with a rush or maybe a whimper.And yet it got made and so many people would have been employed. So there is something good in that.

title: Forget about putting this in a "series" this is a "Stand Alone"
text: This one was quite good and very entertaining, no questionable content at all. Stayed with the story. Glad to see the original actors from Jurassic 1 in top form as well. Don't read the bad reviews, they put this in like a "sequel" to all the others. While this one does take place after the others, it is a stand alone story and movie all on its own. The plot is great and more believable than a few of the previous ones, which is refreshing, the action is quite well done as is the incredible CGI work. Especially the motorcycle chase, when you watch, just don't think of the other movies and you'll have a great time. I remember as a kid that all Dino movies were just claymation and ray harryhausen animation, we dreamed of movies like this, so grab some popcorn and have a great time. No foul language ( very very minimal if any) no nudity, a bit violent at times and lots of suspense, but ok for kids mature enough to handle monster movies. Great addition to the Jurassic franchise. Kudos to Spielberg for another win!

title: Worst Jurassic movie
text: Sorry, this is just awful. The storyline is very predictable, which makes it boring. Apart from a few dinosaurs, there was nothing new. An insufficient film.

title: so wanted to like this one
text: It had all the best ingredients: veteran characters coming back mingled with the newer caste, great CGI (from the trailer) and 5 versions to iterate on finding the best formula and yet...this fell short. It was about bugs, as if we could care any less about those, and the story line kept introducing strong but empty of substance side villains that minutes after disappear without us even bothering about them. Acting from everyone was great as usual, EXCEPT for this Pratt brat. Like i said, i so wanted to like this one.

title: Time to kill the franchise
text: Ok, we ALL love the dinosaurs and the scary action involved with people trying to get away from them with their lives.... why couldn't they stick with that??I won't give away anything you didn't see in the commercials, but COME ON... dinosaurs around the world in peoples everyday lives. Give me a break, do we let or have a Hippo, Elephant, Lion, Bear wander around our cities?? Do we?? The answer is NO, we do NOT.Also, do any large reptiles live in snowy conditions?? I don't know of any, but they have them in this movie. How does a cold blooded animal live in the snow??I know they have to take each movie to the next level, but that is not always a good thing. Sometimes you just need to stick to what is truly and really scary.Stop with the eco story and just give us what we want, people running for their lives with plenty of people getting eaten in the process!Get back to the basics and give us what made Jurassic Park 1 sooo great and scary.

title: A great "I-don't-want-to-think" "empty-brain" movie
text: I think it was great. It kept us glued to the screen the entire time. Bringing everybody back to the last movies was a good thing, so yes.... it is complex to have so many characters but it was a surprise after another. It was nice to see what old characters were doing after so many years, their reunion and how they were still with same mindset despite their fame. We didn't care about the new dinosaurs It is a great movie!My 8 year old watched three times and she can watch it over and over. Overall, a great movie for "I-don't-want-to-think-empty-brain-movie" and will keep watching again and again.

title: I REALLY wanted to like it...
text:
I'm not a hater towards the new JP movies, I actually really liked the first new one, and the second was decent enough, ......But this one is bad.... Just BAD..... I genuinely think they just forgot to add that spark of wonder & magic that these movies in particular Need..A flat political mess, hidden behind a big budget and attempted fan service, as much as I love the original cast, and would love to see them cameo in a good movie, this, is deffo NOT that movie
.....

title: For TV movie
text: This movie played like a old sci-fi channel movie. The acting was terrible, probably because the story was even worse, very disappointed. It got 4 stars because of the dinosaurs, most of the time they looked really cool, some times you see a CGI waver.

title: What a crap
text: I am a big fan of jurassic park series. I have watched original like 10,12 times, but what is this i always give positive reviews for dinosaur movies but this movie made write this reviews it just broke me. What a waste of time and money. Everyone wants an adventure like original ones not this crap. I just gave 2 stars 1 for this crap and 1 for dinosaurs in this movie.

title: A well produced first draft
text: The highlight of this Jurassic movie was definitely the dinosaurs, which is the most important part for the franchise to get right. The inclusion of dinosaurs with feathers was a great touch and the CGI was spot on!With the old characters being back, it included some moments that felt like nudges to the older films and had a bit of a nostalgic feel.However, these things alone do not make a good film.It was as though when making the movie, everyone involved tried to squeeze in their own ideas, leaving a final disjointed feeling. Unfortunately, the story line did not flow smoothly, with certain scenes not linking well from one to the next, standard shots to build on the story being cut out and overall it made moments feel pointless.Often times characters would just appear back in the scene without any context of how they arrived there out of convenience to keep the story rolling with all the shots needed to cram in.Most of the original movies have moments that are suspenseful and rememable but nothing springs to mind with this one.Overall, it all just felt rushed from writing to the final product and maybe the crew were working to a timelimit, but they just needed to cut out some scenes and put more into others.

title: Gorgeous thrill ride with nice references to the original
text: I actually loved watching this (extended edition on UHD Blu-Ray). A very solid 8/10 with a few scenes I'd rate even higher. I certainly think this movie is way better than the IMDb rating suggests.Cinematography is awesome. This is an adventure movie and I liked the totally different environments.The story is simple but fine for me. Acting is solid and the return of so much of the original cast was heartwarming to me. Even some of the humor had been missing in the prior sequels.More than the original this is an action movie with elements you might expect in Mission:Impossible. Purists may not like that, but it worked for me.This is definitely my favorite of the three Jurassic World movies.

title: Absurd story with an 80's style video editing
text: First of all, great to see Tim Cook trying something different.Other than that, not sure if this is just me or the editing in this movie is the worst case of "working from home, look ma, editing a movie with no hands".The story-line is absolutely absurd. A clear case of "hey, let's make another film for no reason" and "if we make it - we are still profitable".I'd struggle to even recommend this for a "junk food cheat evening meal" as a movie where you don't have to use your brain. Again, that's probably because of the editing...

title: Entertaining at best
text: Where do I begin? Trevorrow needs to stop directing Jurassic movies. He thought that by bringing in Sam Neil and Laura Dern they could save the film from an awful story. The story and soundtrack are the worst. On a story basis, he uses several homages to the original Jurassic Park that make me tear up a little, but then that moment is ruined by awful dialog or cheesy forced comedy. The acting is very forced and just very unnatural, as compared to the Jurassic Park masterpiece. There are just so many things in the story that I shake my head at.On an entertainment basis at least it has amazing sound design and fully utilized a 5.1 surround atmosphere.I wasn't willing to spend money to see this film at a theater and got lucky that Amazon Prime paid for a license for a while. This is definitely a movie that can play in the background. It doesn't require your full concentration. It's not scary, it's stupid action that is sometimes fun.It's a great action flick, but a major punch in the face to the 'Jurassic' title.

title: Not the best..
text: Not the worst either. Fans should be able to agree on one thing though, it's better than The Lost World: Jurassic Park. Just finished watching on Peacock. The onslaught of negative reviews and the giant locusts part of plot kept me out of the theaters. Saw the first one in 1993, in the theater. None of the five followups have ever measured up. An impossibly high bar was set. When ever I watch the first movie, I still get the chills, the goosebumps, the sense of awe. It was nice seeing our original favorite 3, but I really didn't feel a sense of nostalgia. I think it was the plot, or rather plots, that distracted from the nostalgia. Yeah, there seems to be more than one plot. There's some character development, but this is a popcorn flick so confuse the audience with grand effects, some cheesy humor, and maybe you got something fun to watch.And so we are left with a very open ending, oh the possibilities. Please Hollywood take your time with the next one, flesh out a consistent plot first. Not asking for pinnacle acting or plot, just give us something with more heart and wonder, that's where the first excelled.Also, the Barbasol can of shaving cream was a nice nod and I'm very aware of how Dodgeson ended up having the can in his possession. I really do think there should've been some sort of callback to Jurassic World: Camp Cretaceous. The ankylosaurus vocals immediately made me think of Bumpy, so there's that.

title: Impressive casting
text: Very woke. They got everyone in, didn't they? Black lesbian, Chinese female villian, etc. Was there a gay man? I can't remember. All just so obvious. I thought the film was pretty mediocre, but I was probably viewing it through a negative lens because of my annoyance with the casting.

title: More of the same missteps as two previous Jurassic World sequels
text: I had hopes this was a different film than the other Trevorrow Jurassic World sequels, especially with the legacy Jurassic Park cast members making a comeback. I was wrong. The opening scene immediately sets the tone by spoon-feeding the audience Chris Pratt wrangling and taming a wild dinosaur. There is no cleverly sagacious writing here, just more explosions and dinosaur fight club from Trevorrow. The plot almost works, but feels too synthetic in having no point but to involve original cast members. The fundamental issue with the film is that, for all the grasping at nostalgia, the story is simply not set in the same world as where we want to see or remember the characters in.While the girls and bicurious Disney fans in love with Chris Pratt may like the movie, the older adults who vividly remember and cherish the first Jurassic Park as one of their favorite movies will be glad this franchise has finally been euthanized.

title: Bad script and too long
text: I think for me the ending of the 2nd part was the worst. How a sane person let a child release dinosaurs just because she feels bad for them. All in all plot was missing from the movie Starting mid ending every thing about this movie is so boring because the script was weak. They didn't use the iconic characters of the OG Jurassic correctly. I mean why hire them when they can't justify their potential. There was just chaos in the entire movie which was again boring. The teenage girl was with them for 4 years can't digest the fact that they are calling her their daughter I mean there was no indication that they were close with the girl.

title: Lives up to the Anti-Hype
text: I had low expectations ahead of this movie, the ratings were in and it was not deemed anywhere near "fresh." That being said, I was pleasantly surprised with how much I enjoyed the first half of the movie - not to say it was a homerun by any means.... Maybe a second base hit at best. Then things truly fell apart at the halfway mark. The movie failed to follow this large cast and give each character justice. The cutting/editing was noticeably sloppy (and I don't consider myself a movie snob), dinosaurs constantly appeared out of nowhere and characters seemed to teleport from one location to another. On a scale of No Dinosaurs to Plenty of Dinosaurs - I would say the movie had Enough Dinosaurs to keep me happy. The number of Dinosaur scenes wasn't the issue... The entire pacing of the movie was.

title: Just fun to watch the final act!
text: This franchise has gone so far away from its roots, meaning the dinosaurs,the evolution on earth and the place of humans in it.One of the positive things though is the fact that they used many more different species of dinosaurs,such as giganotosaurus, and some of the first dinosaurs ever existed.The senario especially at the beginning focuses so much on anything else but the dinosaurs.

title: Nothing new, nothing funny, nothing educational
text: And so talkative, so noisy, so boring.Initially I thought I'd become mad. But after one hour, thank you God and my Airpods, I fell asleep. And 1 hour and a half later, I woke up at the end of the credits, thank you the cleaning staff. 3/10 only because many probably sympathetic technicians did the job they were asked to do.No more dinosaurs on earth (nor wolves nor bears nor dictators) !

title: Glad i downloaded this
text: I knew this was going to be utter garbage and it certainly didn't disappoint.I genuinely feel sorry for anyone ignorant enough to still find themselves paying to see a Jurassic park film at the cinema.Unless you are six years old avoid like the plague.Everything about this movie is trash except of course for the CGI.To think Chris Pratt was paying out on Israel Adesanyas fight for being lacklustre. I'm damn glad he apologised to Israel for bagging his performance.Making us sit through this movie was a whole new low and don't you ever pay out on a sportsman for a poor performance. These Jurassic park sequels are amongst the worst movies i have ever seen.To say this movie is lacklustre would be far too kind.

title: Cash-Grab Written by a 12 Year Old, Unbearably Predictable, Painfully Unrealistic
text: The plot is that dinosaurs are on the streets all over the world and the people have to live with them in their everyday life. But then the daughter (or clone really) of the main characters gets kidnapped, along with a baby dinosaur, and the main character/s have to rescue them. Thus, it's about all the obstacles--the aggressive dinosaurs mainly--that they have to deal with. That's it.The cheesy lines throughout this movie become unbearable. It's also one of the most predictable movies you'll ever see. Oh, the good guy is trying to escape a dinosaur, I wonder what will happen... Oh, the bad guy is trying to escape a dinosaur, I wonder what will happen... No matter how unrealistic it might be for the good guy to survive such a situation, the movie will go for it. Now, don't get me wrong, everyone knows that this is going to be a completely unrealistic movie. But at some point, it becomes completely over the top unrealistic.I should also add, that the movie is not funny if anyone was thinking that that might save it. A lot of the movie was filmed at night, so we don't even really get to get a decent look at the dinosaurs either.So what are the positives? There aren't any major ones. As for insignificant positives, I can say that some of scenery looks nice. Or that there is 1 or 2 dinosaur chase scenes that I might give a B-. But that's about it. In summation, it's 2.5 hours of cheesy lines, poorly seen dinosaurs (because of the night), and predictable dinosaur chases.

title: A Darn Good, Fun Movie
text: I normally do not argue with people about movies because everyone has their tastes. Still, I don't understand the bad reviews and poor ratings for this film. Its really good!Clair (Bryce Dallas Howard) and Owen (Chris Pratt) are living up in the mountains with their "daughter" Maise (Isabella Sermon), the cloned granddaughter of John Hammond. She is a teenage and rebels against being trapped up in the mountains to avoid detection. Dinosaurs are loose on the planet and are an every day part of life. When Maisie and Beta (the raptor Blue's baby) are kidnapped by poachers, Clair and Owen travel across the world to find them.Dr. Sattler (Laura Dern) discovers that a new species of locust are destroying the earth's wheat supply. She enlists the help of Dr. Grant (Sam Neill) to get into the labs at BioSyn to get proof that they are manufacturing these locusts. She gets inside information from Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) who is a speaker at the facility.What I loved about this movie was the plot. They took two generations of Jurassic Park characters and had them in parallel storylines that eventually merge. However, up to that point, its almost two different movies and both are well written and well acted. Along the way, we get to meet a new character, Kayla (DeWanda Wise) an adventurous pilot who assists Clair and Owen look for Maisie. Her character is not as well written as the others, but Ms. Wise is a good actress and she is able to flesh out the character despite her small screen time in the first half of the movie. There is another connection to the original film in the Barbesol can that Nedry has used to smuggle the dinosaur DNA out of the complex in the first movie. In that movie he gave it to Lewis Dodgson. Now, 30 years later, Dodgson (Campbell Scott) is running Biosyn. They even bring back Dr. Wu (B. D. Wong) from the first movie.The CGI and practical effects are top notch. The legacy characters were handled with dignity and came off as more than just fan service as they are intricate to the plot. The globe trotting aspect makes it not exactly feel like a Jurassic Park movie, but it was handled so well, I didn't care. We didn't need another amusement park going haywire. This movie is a fine conclusion to the second trilogy and hopefully, if they make more, they will do as well with them as this one.

title: Watching JP movies now to get over Dominion
text: Ughh! Where to start! If it was some other movie in which dinosaurs were still alive then it'd have been actually good. Why? Because then you wouldn't expect dinosaurs much but their cameos would be exciting. Yup, dinosaurs were only making cameos and it wasn't about them at all. Based on that it was very disappointing because I didn't feel like I was watching a movie that's in the Jurassic park franchise. There were two different stories and none of them was related to Jurassic park/dinosaurs. It felt like one of that action oriented movies where heros do some stunts and come out scatheless. If I wanted this, I'd watch any typical Marvel movie.Before I begin, the Dimetrodon scene was absolutely freaking marvelous. I looved it so much. But again, everyone comes out alive. It's not even about that but you won't even have a single scratch, that's not possible.I also cannot believe that I'm saying this but Laura Dern's acting in the beginning was so so extra. I don't know why because she's a good actor but she was overacting in the beginning. Someone told Jeff to forget about about his character Ian and act like how he did in his Cameo in FRIENDS and he took that seriously. Sam Neill didn't have many lines so can't say how he acted and same with Chris Pratt. Bryce Dallas's character story had nothing to do with Jurassic park or World.There was absolutely no need for the character Maisie to be in this movie let alone lead one of the story arcs. Now when I think of it, the character didn't need to be in fallen Kingdom too. Also, movies in general should give up its typical "I'm a rebel independent mannerless teenager" characters. There was also no need for the new characters. We know why they're here and not so surprisingly, they were righteous. Could have included Ian's daughter Kelly from The Lost world instead of new characters. Such a huge missed opportunity.This also wasn't what they promised.(Dinosaurs and humans together in a chaotic world) They want us to be okay with the fact that they've trained dinosaurs like lions or some other big cats and they won't harm humans. Others that are not trained and are pure wild, they're not harming humans as well. Yup! You heard it right.One thing I like is that at least dinosaurs don't look or act like cartoons like they did in fallen Kingdom. Also, I'm glad no one cracked stupid jokes like when they made the character Claire joke in fallen Kingdom "see, not a t-rex". No one screamed like a cartoon like that guy in fallen Kingdom and I appreciate that.You're also supposed to be okay with the fact that t-rex/rexy always wins. Don't get me wrong, I love rexy too but c'mon like you've an apex predator like giganotosaurus and you're saying that it's easy for it to just get killed.You're also supposed to be ok with the fact that therizinosaurus couldn't see Claire and seemingly appeared blind but towards the end could suddenly see conveniently. Btw the scene with Claire and therizinosaurus that you see in the trailer is the only one of the few scenes that's breathtaking to watch and should have been left for the movie.There was absolutely no suspense, tension, horror or mystery. After a while, you'd figure out that all the characters are immortals. You'd figure out after a while what's going to happen.It wouldn't feel like you're getting goosebumps or at least feeling significant excitement seeing the OGs aka Alan, Ellie and Ian on the screen in this and honestly that was disappointing.It wasn't so so so bad and gets fun after the first half but I had to watch the lost world after it to appreciate the franchise for what it was.Fallen Kingdom is still the worse one for me but I can't believe it's the second worse.

title: Cash grab
text: It felt like if the producers have asked established actors to get paid millions without even acting.It's a photo shoot, not a movie.I want my money back.

title: These are all terrible
text: I think parents must be dragging their kids to these movies, and neither the parents or the kids actually like them. I can't think of any other reason why these Jurassic World movies make so much money. They're all terrible. Even the original 3 from 1993 couldn't save this piece of garbage. And why do the 1993 special effects still blow away all the subsequent jurssic movies? And why is this movie two and a half hours??You may be asking why I saw this movie. I'm asking myself that same question.... The actual answer is that I go see a lot of movies because I like to have popcorn with peanut M&Ms on top and a large Diet Coke in a movie theater... And I already saw top gun Maverick twice...

title: Look and forget
text: Another movie created by Hollywood greed in the hope of making money on gullible viewers, there is a standard set of all sorts of clichs and easter eggs, if you pass by you do not lose anything.

title: A Good Ending to JW Trilogy!
text: This movie was a lot of fun. It had a lot of great references to the earlier Jurassic movies and some great character moments. It's jammed full of action, sometimes going over the top.For some reason the movie was dark in the theater I watched it in and was made even darker when I put on the 3D glasses. Looking at the trailer I'm guessing it will be brighter in Blu Ray format. There's not a lot of great 3D moments in it, either but the movie still works. If you like the behind the scenes videos I'm sure when it's released the disk will be chock full with info. There's a whole slew of amazing sequences in this film.Once it gets started it's a non-stop thrill ride right up the end. It also has some very satisfying personal endings for the characters. Lots of fun. Get your popcorn and enjoy!

title: Cheesy and lacking.
text: Watched the new Jurassic film last night and must say, was quite disappointed. Slow burner, cheesy, nothing new, lacking in action and defo doesn't have the rewatchability of the others.Same lines, same scenes really. So lacking in plot and ideas. Could have done a lot more.If you're a fan of the franchise still watch it, just for the "reunion" of all the key cast members, but don't expect to see a singing and dancing box office smash.

title: Jurassic what!
text: What! What? Whaaat?!That is what the dialogue consisted of, to me. A lot of what. No depth, no originality, just a lot of what. After the tenth what, I was tired of it.All in all, a pretty bland story. Great effects, which is why I give it 3 stars.Thanks.

title: A bit of a let down.
text:
I absolutely love the franchise, and really wanted to love this film.It was..okay:
Overall, it was alright, not the best way, ir the way I wanted, to round of the franchise. Just another movie to make money.

title: Great movie
text: I really liked the movie. It was great to see all the old and new era actors in the same film. It had funny moments, and edge of your seat thrillers. A GREAT movie!

title: Mel Brooks Called It
text: In Spaceballs, Mel Brooks refers to the future sequel as "Space Balls 2: The Quest for More Money". That could easily be the subtitle for this Jurassic sequel. It's not smart, it's not subtle, but it is expensive. I'm wishing I had waited until it was free.

title: duped!
text: You set up possibly the most interesting movie in the series by how the last one ended, with no payoff. I mean, everyone wanted to see dinosaurs in the real world, then they decide to tell a different pointless story instead. One of the biggest letdowns in cinematic history. This was supposed to be what this whole billion dollar franchise was leading up to, then it doesn't. What a copout. Five stars for the great actors and special effects, not the story.

title: Worst yet, but still watchable
text: Certainly the worst of the six so far for the Jurassic Park series and that's saying something. Of course i still had to watch it because i love these films, but this time they just stopped trying. Dinosaurs just hanging out in winter like it's no big deal for their cold blood, characters choking dinos like they're nothing even though they're terrifying killers, lots of logical inconsistencies, and reuse of plot themes that played well in earlier movies but now just feel obviously over done. It's a bummer that they didn't seem like they could pick a lane this time. Too many storylines and none of them really compelling.

title: Better than Fallen Kingdom
text: But that's not saying much. It really did feel totally hollow. It's beautifully done, but I honestly just didn't care about the characters despite growing up watching them. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great.

title: Oh dear
text: Oh dear, it's bad.2 stars for the original characters but even they couldn't save this.It didn't seem like a Jurassic Park movie at all, at times it was almost like watching a generic action film.Dinosaurs are almost secondary to everything else the writers wanted to put in the movie.Shame.

title: Conclusion to the epic series was epic!
text: The callbacks in the movie were mind blowing. It was a mixture of nostalgia and adrenaline. It is a must watch even if you haven't watched a single movie. But the fun amplifies by 10 if you have watched all the movies.

title: "Epic" end of Jurassic Era
text: Yea no. It was decent. This movie was supposed to show us how people would live with the DINOSAURS not some stupid bugs made my some dude that wants to control the food chain. It barely beats Jurassic Park 3 for me. We only had 1-2 scenes with humas and dinos. If whole movie was made like the "Battle of Big Rock" movie it would have been better.

title: Disappointing conclusion
text: Stupid but fun B-movie? Yes. Dignified conclusion of the dinosaur saga? Absolutely not. The film is fun and exciting at times but also incredibly messy. It recycles ideas and scenes from all the previous movies, gives plenty of homage to original Jurassic Park but it's more awkward and laughable than anything else.It seems like these movies are good only within the confines of an actual park - original Jurassic Park was great and first Jurassic Wold wasn't half bad either. Once the dinosaurs escape the park, the movies don't work.Still, it was nice to see the original cast. Now I hope Universal leaves dinosaurs at peace for a while.

title: Dissapointed
text: So sad, It could have been such a good movie. Bad story, bad acting. The old characters came back for this but didn't really gave a show or blew my mind. They were just there. The only thing good about the movie were the dinosaurs...

title: Skip this one
text: This Movie did not need to be made, waste of time for everyone involved, to predictable and don't even get me started on the dialogue. It's just tame and adds literally nothing to the movie.The first movie in a while where I was looking at the clock just waiting for it to end. Skip this one guys.

title: Too many plot armors
text: Diverse cast is not equal to better movie. Better actors and actresses make a movie better!Abysmal plot with poor character developments. The little girl was annoying af. She always screws up. Poor decision making unlike the kids in Jurassic Park!Chris Pratt legit carried.Dinos choose who and when to kill.Movie didn't make sense, nor addressed the issue of the dinos around the world.Overall: As disappointed as a dad learning his daughter is an only fans user.

title: A bit boring for such a long movie
text: You can't expect a masterpiece but it's really tough to say what exactly is wrong with it - maybe it's the 2 movies in 1 feeling or the fact that it's basically a hotchpotch of the other movies. Like a best-of compilation.Everything is just a bit too much, yet not enough. And so many questions remain, mainly "What was the real point here?"They should have used the original trio more or exclusively because they manage to bring a sort of sense into all of this mess. This trio is charismatic & the chemistry is still there.All in all it is a very predictable, very ridiculous story which is only remotely bareable because of Laura, Jeff & Sam - & the T-Rex.

title: At least it was pretty
text: Very beautiful movie, the dinosaurs look for the most part real and impressive. But it doesn't make up for the predictable story or the flaws in its logic. Everything felt very basic, done before, there was no big twist, nothing to make you think. It's a nice, easy, adventure with dinosaurs where everything goes well in the end. I also got the impression that there was no clear idea of what the mood of this movie was supposed to be while it was being made, it changed a lot throughout.

title: Incredible Story Line... I love Chris Bratt <-- Yes I spelled it Right
text: I never get tired of the Jurassic Movies. Yes, the very first one was off the charts Entertaining ! - Incredible ! - This one has a lot more action and suspense but I enjoyed it very much. I think the issue we all may have is it is compared to the other Jurassic movies and well, that is the rub for the lower reviews. Sad but True.

title: Unnecessarily contrived, clumsy, but reasonably fun on its own terms
text: I was incredibly hyped for Dominion. Jurassic Park is my favorite film of all time, I have a deep love for The Lost World, JP3 is a pretty big miss for me, but I adore those first two movies. Jurassic World and it's sequel, Fallen Kingdom, are fairly decent dinosaur-themed actioners that have an Amblin flourish to them, even if their disconnect from the original films is felt. Jurassic World: Dominion promised to bring dinosaurs to civilization, a near-apocalyptic scenario for our heroes to survive in and try to resolve. Added to that notion was the fact that this film would tie the two eras of this franchise together, bridging a gap that shouldn't have been severed in the first place. Colin Trevorrow, the writer/director of this entire World reboot, promised that everything had been leading to this film. So to say that this movie breaking that promise was disappointing would be an understatement. Instead of focusing on the planet's ecological tug-of-war with gigantic prehistoric beasts, Dominion hones in on Monsanto-style GMOs, corporate espionage, human clones, giant bugs and moustache-twirling super villains. Some of these ideas are very Michael Crichton-esque and its admirable that he wanted to pay homage to the late creator of the source material, but sometimes the obvious path is the correct one. We wanted to see dinosaurs wreaking havoc on society. It turns out we can get along with dinosaurs just fine. It's Interstellar-style crop droughts we need to worry about. Despite a poorly conceived, convoluted story, Jurassic World: Dominion does deliver on one promise, and that is Sam Neill, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum. They are a joy to watch here. If Trevorrow and Co. Have completely misunderstood what makes Jurassic Park's filmmaking so powerful, they didn't misunderstand what made it's central characters so likable and compelling. It's like meeting old friends, nostalgia done right. Neill is a bit older and out of his element and his boomer moments, which could come off as cringe, are actually sweet and endearing. Laura Dern commands the screen as the leader of the trio, and while Goldblum is playing up his meme schtick a little too heavily, his performance is still in line with Malcolm's past mannerisms and behavior. The action is really solid here. A chase sequence in Malta is a bit too Mission: Impossible/G. I. Joe, but it's effective and exhilarating. Michael Giacchino is still the perfect composer for this series outside of John Williams. His work is rock solid here. John Schwartzman's cinematography is really slick and shooting the movie on film was a very deliberate and wise decision. My only complaint visually-speaking is that many of the animatronic dinosaurs look incredibly stiff and artificial. It has a lot to do with the lighting and the angles they're shot at, though the sentiment of honoring the work Stan Winston did in the past films is well-intentioned. At the end of the day, Jurassic World: Dominion is an excuse to reconcile the two disparate chapters of this nearly 30-year-old franchise so that the series can move forward without being stuck in the past. It doesn't deliver on anything the previous films setup and that's a tough pill to swallow, but on its own terms, its a very stupid, very bloated, very fun summer blockbuster that's enjoyment completely hinges on your nostalgia/personal connection to the rest of the films in its franchise. I'd also recommend watching the extended edition of the film as it doesn't drag the pacing down, but adds much needed context, character development and gives the movie room to breathe.

title: A ridiculously predictable, and boring movie
text: The pretext of "this movie is not looking for an Oscar" is not enough to save this awful work. It is essential to separate fantasy history from absurd history.It is very hard to find something that is good in this movie.Everything is lousy: the direction, the actors, the development of the history...The only reason I don't put a worse score is that the movie is terrible but not tasteless.

title: Please avoid this at all costs
text: Even the dinosaurs were bad, the acting was horrible. Jeff Goldblum may be a man of fashion but acting has certainly never been his forte...same for Chris Pratt. Bryce???? Meh.I did not pay a nickel to see this insult to our brains...from the library...thank goodness.Life is short, please do not make your life shorter by watching this drivel.The only excellent Jurassic was the original. Sir Richard Attenborough must be rolling in his grave.So in closing, ( I have to write 1000 characters) promise me you will not let your children and grand children watch this disgrace of a movie. Please!!!

title: Great film, best since the original
text: Genuinely don't get what people didn't enjoy about this movie about dinosaurs?! It's funny, action packed and has a great story.I'm 37 and loved the original, this one is second best, it's really good fun, ignore the geeks that are hating on it, go with friends, take your kids, it's a really fun movie!

title: sad autumn melancholy
text: Dinosaurs were put on the back burner and instead of a sense of wonder or a struggle for survival, the creators served us sentimental clichs and a strange vision of genetically modified coexistence!! Where has Grant and Ian's critical skepticism and message gone from the first film? Paradoxically, this third film is better crafted than its two predecessors, but even as I watched in disbelief at Grady negotiating with raptors in the first World, I knew it couldn't end well. Not even the good old guard (Ian, Elie, Alan) will save it anymore.

title: Where was the iconic soundtrack?!
text: Lazy, corny script. Where is the original sound track? Bizarre choice not to include the iconic Jurassic Park theme song. The idea was there, the cast were there, but the execution was poor.

title: First time I was bored watching a Jurassic related movie
text: This movie was boring! Simple as that! It was too long and super boring.Also I don't know if the actress playing the kid in the movie normally talks like that but I found it super annoying!

title: Raptor Rubbish
text: I'm begging you, stop with the Raptors. Why the endless obsession with them. They are so boring after 6 movies. Why do they need to be constant focus of fascination when there are so many other cool dinosaurs. They were cool in the very first Jurassic and that should have been the end of it.Also can another studio please make a dinosaur movie without any connection to Jurassic whatever.Time for a change. Oh an by the way this film was bad in every way. The absolutely lazy writing that paved the way for convenience after convenience was embarrassing.

title: The nostalgia!
text: I'm sad this series will be over now. The inclusion of the original cast (Laura Dern, Sam Neil, Jeff Goldblum) is very well implemented! I feel as long as this movie was, it felt like it was too short somehow. I did enjoy it overall and think most fans of the series will too.

title: You can only go there so many times - corny and predictable
text: I've enjoyed all of the Jurassic Park movies - the first one being the best. I found JW Dominion to be too long, too predictable, too much of the same. I did like the merging of the characters from all of the films. Always enjoy watching Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum.Dallas Bryce-Howard was better in Jurassic World but I still enjoyed her performance in Dominion. Chris Pratt . . . I never did feel a sense of connection between him and the dinosaurs that would lead me to believe the "hand". It's too corny. And while we're talking "corny" - who is going to ride a horse to lasso a dinosaur that weighs 20 times more than the horse? What dinosaur is going to so easily succumb to a rope lasso? Oh, but maybe it was "the Hand"! That's what subdued him.The Giganotosaurus didn't belong in the movie. Why would you want to try to top the T-Rex? The rendering of both of the huge dinosaurs was unimpressive. No detail. Bad lighting. We weren't told anything about the Giganotosaurus so that we could get a sense of who it was. The dinosaurs were portrayed much better in the original Jurassic Park. In addition to how realistic they looked and moved, time was given to working in the traits and characteristics of each dinosaur so that we knew who we were dealing with. Actually the whole Dominion movie was substandard in comparison to the original.I did appreciate that there was no gore or bad language in Dominion! That's about the only positive thing I can say. Glad that I only rented it and didn't buy it.

title: They just get worse!
text:
Jurassic Park was a genuine 10/10 movie. It had everything and was watchable to all ages and tastes. The second and third were pretty good two but I'd read the books by then so they had a lot to live up to.... and didn't quite manage it.Jurassic World was a good concept but they missed the opportunity to make it worthy of the franchise. Too much CGI and not much character.Since then they seem to be riding it for all they can. Trouble us you can't
ride a dead horse. The new characters
are shallow despite being top actors, the old characters are a hard sell for me. Theres no wow factor and no real storytelling in this latest installment. I found myself being very easily distracted while trying to watch this and that says it all.

title: With not so much as a teaspoon of tension
text: An American sci-fi action adventure; A story about a young girl-a clone-who released dinosaurs to save them from being auctioned off is now hunted down by a genetics company. She and others are key to preventing that company from causing an ecological disaster. This is the sixth film in a series, a cautionary tale about genetic engineering. A handful of half-baked storylines clash together in an otherwise paint-by-numbers sequel. One part is a steady stream of protracted chases and dinosaur attacks that involve characters who could never be under threat due to their importance in the story. The other part is time spent telling a story about corporate corruption, which offers up nothing more meaningful than being bad. But the real test of patience will surely come from an ensemble of two sets of characters who have little to do with each other but are dwelt on at the expense of a sensible storyline. Do-gooder Bryce Dallas Howard is expected to flick a switch from doe-eyed and vulnerable to assertive and forceful in an instant; stock character hero Chris Pratt still holds out his hand zen-like to placate man-eaters - gift unexplained. With high production values, a team of technical artists worked hard to bring a picture to marvel at with its impressive stunts, slick action set pieces, and visual effects. But the CGI rendered is not much more realistic than 30 years ago, which is disappointing for a film that rests its believability on dinosaurs moving in fast motion.

title: tragic
text:
Anyone who actually sat down to watch this movie would know it's about trash.If anyone went to the cinema to pay for this ridiculousness they definitely wasted their money and time
scenario 0 acting 0 interest 0
The feeling the original had is not going to be recreated with this ongoing garbage
it's kind of like watching Rambo 5 6 7 8 and......
sure failure
the only thing these movies are worth is downloading them via torrent so you can watch them in fast forward.

title: It's quite good actually - not as bad it's perceived
text: I just watched this movie in cinema hall and loved it so much. The plot of the movie is better than previous one "Fallen kingdom". The CGI of the movie is praiseworthy and it gave satisfying feeling. This is a summer blockbuster type film and the important things are the dinosaurs and action sequences. The movie is a lot of fun and will fuel the imaginations and nightmares of children who watch and give parents a good bit of action. Sound quality and Actings are perfect there's no doubt about it. I highly recommend this one for watching this week .

title: Almost so bad it's good
text: During the first half of the movie I was having fun with the over the top characters and the clunky dialogue. It seemed to be setting up a potentially excellent "so bad it's good" movie. Unfortunately it just kind of petered out and got boring.

title: Out with a Whimper
text: If I'm not mistaken, I thought I saw Fonzie jumping a shark in multiple scenes. If they thought bringing back the characters from JP1 would save this disaster, they were way off target. It was painful to sit there for 2 hours and watch this movie go down in flames. (Pun intended)

title: One word : Wow !
text: I saw it yesterday in 3D and it was amazing. I don't understand the critics ! This movie has everything you want : Tons of dinosaurs, action, a plot that I find good and the nostalgia (the original JP cast, many easter eggs). I think the merge of the two storylines (original JP cast and JW cast) is pretty well done. The special effets are really good. If you like to see dinos on screen and you like JP/JW franchise, go see it in theaters !! You will not be disappointed. I know it supposed to be the conclusion but I really hope that there will be other Jurassic movies !!

title: No feeling at all
text: They have Sattler, Grant, Malcolm, dinosaurs, but they gave the movie no Jurassic Park-feeling at all.Instead it feels like a Bond-movie.Do it again or cancel the series.

title: Bummer end to this era
text: Mostly bad with some good. Lazy writing with an awful spy corporation plot. Interesting concepts that try to be fresh but fall flat. The Nostalgia/callbacks are the high point, especially Goldblum.

title: Utter garbage
text: Everything wrong with Cinema nowadays.A complete and total cash grab and the complete and total waste of my time and money all the original characters were brought back for exactly no reason whatsoever.

title: I dont get the hate
text: Why are people so hard on this? I found it entertaining and surprising. I love how they brought back things from the past, and gave each character time to shine. People just hate Chris Pratt, thats all. Well i like him and think he did great, they all did!

title: DINOSAURS UNDONE BY A POOR SCRIPT...!
text: The latest, the sixth by count, in the series which began way back in 1993. Following up on the events of Fallen Kingdom where the large & scaly ones now roam the Earth w/o abandon, we find our heroes, Dallas Bryce Howard & Chris Pratt, together w/their new clone of a charge, Isabella Sermon, as they try to corral the beastly creatures & shuffle them off to safer climes while a new billionaire, Campbell Scott (modeled after Apple's Tim Cook my viewing partner remarked), who has a preserve in Europe where he's also doing the Lord's work keeping the Jurassics in check but no sooner does the appearance of all this philanthropic activity rear its head, evil shenanigans begin w/the appearance of oversized locusts attacking a farm in spitting view of one of Scott's factories where no harm has come to it. Lo & behold the revelation that the beneficial conglomerate has something to do w/it comes as no surprise to no one except the people on screen who by film's end have to right the wrongs & let the wild ones roam. W/the supposed added benefit of having the original Jurassic Park stars back in action (Sam Neill, Laura Dern & Jeff Goldbloom), the film is clock a block full of action & dino mayhem but what it lacks is a coherent script & an unjustified need to have all these returning players when they could've used the newer characters (DeWanda Wise, Dichen Lachman & Mamoudou Athie) to craft something maybe different (especially since the notion of human DNA manipulation tied to dinosaurs has been introduced). Billed the last in the series (I bet!), I wonder if they'll try something truly new when the inevitable follow up comes a calling in a few years.

title: Pointless montage of cutting room clippings
text: I thought I enjoyed this. Until I left the cinema. Then it quickly dawned on me that I'd just spent over two hours watching exactly the same scenes as I've seen in the other five films. What started well with a Star Wars Mos Eisly-esque bazaar and black market trade quickly descends into the all too familiar run, chase, hide. Disappointing dino-snore-us.

title: Unimaginably bad
text: I knew it would be bad, but figured it would be kind of fun too. Nope. It's just bad. Really bad.I guess it's ridiculousness and horrible script may have some comic value if your into that sort of thing. Otherwise, stay away.

title: Thrilling!
text: I completely understand why this is getting bad reviews from a critical standpoint. But tbh, I loved this movie. It was everything I want in a summer blockbuster. Non-stop action, thrill after thrill, incredible visual effects. Sure a lot of the plot was silly and it was very predictable, but the movie was still super fun to watch!

title: Oh, puhLEASE...
text: Let this one be the last flick in the Jurassic saga!It was good to see Laura Dern, Sam Neil and Jeff Goldblum again since I love them all. But what happened to their characters? Loved the interplay between those three in the first film. But, heck, that was 30 years (almost) ago.Jurassic World Dominion has turned into yet one more action reel with OK CGI but with a lousy story. I will have to revisit the one prior to JWD because I don't remember certain parts that seems integral to what is playing out in this one.As an action flick... OK! It's average. As a worthy Jurassic follow-up it's not!Please! End the franchise after this one!

title: Jurassic
text: Hmm it's kinda boring but I'll watch it for the old actors, the movie has nothing to do with dinosaur, the last dinosaur fighting scene was weird but I'm happy that the jurassic park cast are back.

title: That is one big pile of...
text: If you want a (at least) decent Jurassic film it needs to be based on a Michael Crichton novel and directed by Spielberg; if it ain't, don't waste your time.Especially don't waste your time with this one, unless you like loud pointless dinosaurs and actively resent character, plot, story, atmosphere, intelligence, wit, tension, humour, or any other acceptable currency of entertainment.

title: Others Are Over-Critical Of This Movie
text: The movie is very entertaining. Likeable characters. Very good story. Awesome visuals.There are a few nostalgic moments that some who think too much would deem corny. It is those moments that too many critics latch on to in order to justify themselves because they really are not that bright.

title: A Jurassic mess
text: Plot and storytelling is all over the place. Story isn't about living amongst dinosaurs, it's about the cohabitation of characters new and old. Same caricature of an ol weak villain from Jurassic World 1 and 2. Very stale concept: dinosaurs are deadly, they're bigger, and evil corporation wants to exploit them.Overall...45 minutes into it, we were ready to leave; didn't, because we paid money. Who do I talk to about getting a refund?

title: This movie is a streaming pile of manure
text: The characters in this movie are terribly unbelievable and spiritless the CGI is beyond pathetic the whole movie lacks enthusiasm and spirit no effort just cheap thrills in an attempt to get some cash before the franchise is completely busted.

title: Was going good until...
text: So I was actually enjoying this movie, even though the stars had zero chemistry. I enjoyed the premise of the plot.Somewhere around the 1/4 way mark, I felt like the acting and the characters were... Off.Then around the halfway mark, it just stopped making sense. I can't even go into specifics. You'll see when you watch it.5/10 but watch it anyway.

title: Ignore the Negative reviews it's one of the Best!!!
text: I almost missed out on this great Flick because of the low rating and redicolus negative reviews here on imdb!!! First before I go on you need to ask yourself what are your best expectations before watching a Jurassic Park movie?!?!!! For me it's always the solid engaging story line followed by how it's done in the sense of story sequence and number of key moments that produces maximum audience engagement and for me this movie after watching it clicked all the right notes with flying colours and to me this movie plus the Fallen Kingdom are two of the very best in the entire frenchise and I've seen them all several times especially the very good ones.. Long story short go and watch this movie to have fun without prejudice or prior over expectations that you're about to watch an Oscar winner for its not one however they should make a special category for best action movies in the future and this could well be a contender!!

title: Disappointing
text: The only thing that wasn't terrible was the CGI (props to the CGI team). Terrible script, story, meh acting.Basically no emotional moments or buildup at all...

title: From bad to worse
text: This is coming from someone who loves the first movie and even enjoys the second... This is one of the worst movies I've ever watched, period. Writing, direction, editing, even lens choice... It's all just absolutely horrible. It's a C-level movie with millions and millions of dollars wasted. This isn't a movie thats watchable if you are older than 9 years old. No logic, nothing makes sense. Please just avoid.I've watched student films with better writing and direction. This was so painful to watch, I had to stop multiple times just to try and deal with it. I stopped to write this review because it's so bad, the only redemption I have is to openly destroy this movie in a review. Just don't watch it! Don't give them a dime.

title: Why?
text: Why would you do that?Why would you make a movie like this? Full of weird story parts, weird and boring jokes and riding the nostalgia train like this?I don't want to see Jurassic Park 'Revisited/Remake' because Jurassic Park already exists in 4k.Just go and watch Jurassic Park with your kids and forget this movie...Only left the Cinema before once, with Jurassic World Dominion its now the second time. I got too fed up and bored and i just revisited this IMDB page to see if i might just want to fiinish it but got already turned off by the image of a fliped over Jeep...Plenty of others already mentioned the totally brain dead story arc and all the issues with it...

title: A great way to end the series!
text: Every Jurassic park/world movie are predictable due to the same plots but with slightly different factors.This movie seemed very slow at some parts and then very fast at others.All in all, the wrapped up the ending very well. Giving the new cast and old cast great endings was all a fan could hope for.

title: Too messy movie in so many aspect
text:
Right from the beginning the story felt off even on Jurassic World franchise point. The story line quality degrade in every Jurassic World movies.Too many characters are felt caricature. Too many Cliche. Copied so many scenes from Jurassic Park Franchise.Spielberg's Jurassic Park is one of the masterpiece. This Jurassic World movies are literally butchering the name.After watching this piece of crap i still believe Jurassic Park by Spielberg is miles.. miles.. miles ahead of these movies.Coming to the story, they really tried to put two stories in one movie. That resulted messy storyline, messy screenplay, unnecessary characters just comes and goes for no reason at all.There is no proper establishment in story for the locations where the movie takes place.2nd act and 3rd/Final act is all over the place with zero sense of things happening.1st act felt more like Kidnapping movie with few Dinosaurs. With a lot of scenes which have no sense at all.Too many Repeatedly used dialogues. Thriller scenes have no base or sense what so ever. Thrilling scenes are there just to fill the run time of the movie. Only good thing are VFX and The Dinosaurs. Nothing else.It's better to watch Spielberg's brilliantly directed movie Jurassic Park or even The Lost World.Final verdict:- This is a big budget messy Movie with too many references from Jurassic Park.Direction: 4/10
Screenplay: 3/10
Dialogues: 4/10
VFX: 9/10
Cinematography: 7/10
Acting: 6/10
BGM: 5/10Overall: 5/10.

title: Pretty Silly
text: Totally implausible, overly dramatic, not at all scary. Typical Hollywood lecturing to the rest of us how we are not the only beings on the planet....blah, blah, blah. If the movie had only shown dinosaurs and no people, it might have had a chance at being good....because, of course, the computer graphics were awesome. The first Jurassic Park was SO much better. Stick to the the original.

title: Nothing is terrible. But it's not good.
text: Novelty, action adventure, and monster horror are what made the original Jurassic Park amazing. Jurassic World: Dominion checks the action adventure box. At times, the monster horror box. But, it always falls short on novelty.You can't be surprised by this. After all this is the 6th installment of the series. Novelty left the building awhile ago.The Jurassic series chief conflict has always been man's desire to control nature, and despite the warnings of Jeff Goldblum we attempt it time and time again. Jurassic World: Dominion attempts to wrap up this conflict, and it does, albeit it in an unsatisfying way.There are three groups we follow through out the film. Each pursuing their own goals until they eventually converge. One of these story lines is good. The other two seem like filler with even one of them not having any real tangible effect.Jurassic World: Dominion try's. It try's really freaking hard. And when it hits it hits right. Those moments are just so few and far between. Honestly, if you take away the star power of Chris Pratt, Jeff Goldblum, and the call back cast from the original. It comes off like an early 2000's sequel that should have gone straight to dvd.I don't think it's a terrible movie. But I do think it falls short of even being a good film. If you like the new Jurassic World movies you'll like this as well. If not, we'll at least the dinosaurs look pretty.Oh, and there is an evil version of Tim Cook.

title: Cynical end to a classic franchise
text: I'm pretty open-minded about movies and usually want to make up my own mind rather than be deterred by critics. That being said, I had low expectations going into the theatre but I was treating my daughter to the IMAX experience so JWD seemed a good choice. I even watched JW1 and JW2 from my collection back to back the day before to make sure I was back up to speed. I needn't have bothered. Unfortunately the experience was utterly boring and painful to sit through. Here's a few obvious themes:All in all there was nothing I could recommend about this film and every reason to advise you to save your money and your time and don't bother to see it.

title: Disheartened
text: I'm a huge fan of this franchise.... even when people said it'll be rubbish I was a stubborn fan and stood strong. I'll love it no matter what.Tickets booked for the full family for opening day.. waited weeks to see it. All excited.And it's a mess... an insult. It's made a joke of the franchise.It's full of clichs which is expected but to the point where we actively started predicting to each other the next scene that would be reused.It's so cheesy but beyond comfort cheese of well lived characters it's uncomfortable to watch.There was a few good action sequences... the swamp scene was cool. And the knew dinosaur with the claws... creeped me out.But overall I found myself bored to the point I wanted it to stop.The overuse of CGI made it even more silly aswell...I know people will hate this review. I HATE writing it as a huge Jurassic Park fan but it's how I'm left feeling. Gutted. Should have just been left as was.

title: It's a dinosaur movie not a documentary
text: Hey have fun watching a dumb dinosaur movie just like when you were a kid at a Saturday matinee. Cheer for the good guys and fear not any nightmares as the movie likely won't stay with you 5 minutes after you leave the theater.

title: Absolute trash
text: My goodness where do I begin. It was wayyyy too long, boring as all hell, and the fight scenes/action scenes were dull and just plain boring. Did I mention boring? Yeah, so much for the "epic" conclusion. What a waste. Trailer made it look good as usual. Literally showed all the bits that were cool, if you can call them that, which is about 30 seconds out of 2 and half hours. The rest is uninspired, poorly directed, badly lit, cringe fest trash. Save your money and download it on pirate bay for free if you have a spare 2 and half hours your willing to give up. Seriously.

title: The B'est B movie
text: Shlock dinosaur roaring filled diarrhea you consumers are begging for. Give me 7 more hours of this I'm begging for it.6 movies in and only one good one. Hint: it ain't this one.

title: This is to Jurassic Park as Fast & Furious 9 is to The Fast & The Furious
text: The legacy of the thrilling sci-fi adventure behemoth penned by Michael Crichton in the 90's, is reduced to a carnival ride of paper thin character moments, roll your eyes dialogue and flaccid action. If you get an urge to watch any of the Jurassic World movies, just pop in a blu-ray of the original Jurassic Park and savor the moment of cinematic wonder.

title: DO NOT believe the negative reviews
text: Haters gonna hate...because they have small minds and unhappy lives, clearly incapable of enjoying escapism entertainment. Simply put, if you're a fan of JP/JW, you'll love it. If you're not, why would you watch it in the first place? Shows the level of intelligence right there.It's a good time. Do yourself a favor and check it out. You won't be disappointed.

title: Great Potential Ruined by an Insipid, Formula Screenplay
text: The movie started out great, but started to go downhill with the introduction of Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum and the villain, who was basically Tim Cook incarnate. The idea of a world contaminated with dinosaurs had great potential, but would up getting ruined by giant locusts. We all knew where it was going; extremely predictable. Chris Pratt, Brice Dallas Howard and Isabel Sermon were excellent, but it appeared that Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum were there just for comic relief. But this is what happens when you hire three mediocre writers for a $185 million film. Shame on Amblin!

title: The edge of boring
text: Slow and just a bit boring. Had all the elements of a good film, but the acting was pretty hammy, the story line was 'meh' and the dialog was stilted and borderline awful in places.

title: A loop through nostalgia
text: Bet u all seen most of the bad reviews and it would be pointles to repeat what has been said.So I will try my best not to spoil this lackluster conclusion of Jurassic Park/World.If u find yourselfs at home skipping like 30 minuts of content because the cliche, scene coppy, action sequense has your head filled with desire for more, you know u been hustled for 10 or more euros when you would have seen this in the theater.Since theres no way to skip any of it, i bet you probably fall asleep and wake up at the end credits finaly showing you which movie you are actually watching, Jurassic World Dominion. A movie for all ages, no blood, no gore. Lots of scare moments but no real dread and fear which one could feel from Jurassic Park. When u would first see a T-Rex circuling a jeep inside having 2 REALLY frightened kids for the first time, it was EPIC!Dinosaurs should impress, cause fear.With Jurassic World Dominion it feels like they been tamed to be wild......did that make sense?So be prepared for a letdown unless you like pointless chases which been ripped and coppied out of other movies uncluding India Jones for instance.Iff i wasn't for some of the pointless one liners this movie might have made a bigger impression but even the cast probably felt like they where inside a loophole of cliche action sequenses which at some point seem to be endlessly long and boring.Next time i want to see Chris Prat while doing the pointles hand gesture and see his hand or arm ripped and head thorn of and blood splatter all over the place while the dino's start feeding. Just imagine the loook on the crowds face....omg ....our pointles hero died. Raptor Wins.....FATALITY!Now THATS how you bring dread to Dino's that have little regard to human life other then seeing their prey to be snacked on instead of toyed with and chased to make the camera crew look cool and flashy.

title: Respectful Awesome Ending!!! Spectacular!!!
text: Catching my breath ... whew!!! What a WILD RIDE!! REALLY, this is what Jurassic Park was meant to be! Especially this one: FINALLY THE PAIRING OF THE TWO MAJOR CASTS, AS WELL AS LONG OVERDUE NEW ADDITIONS!! The loose ends are finally tied up. When did going to the movies become WHAT THE CRITICS HAD TO SAY??? I don't care what naysayers or idiots have against the franchise, science, or whatever ... THIS ONE IS THE ONE THAT WEVE LONG BEEN WAITING FOR!!! I WON'T SPOIL IT FOR YOU, BUT YOU HAVE YOU SEE THIS ONE!! A TRUE MUST SEE!! A RESPECTFUL END WITH A SIGNATURE FEEL! GOOD SEND OFF!!

title: A decent attempt but still disappointment for hardcore Jurassic Park fans!!
text: Jurassic World Dominion is a science fiction action film directed by Colin Trevorrow. The film stars Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum, Sam Neill, DeWanda Wise, Mamoudou Athie, Isabella Sermon, Campbell Scott, BD Wong and Omar Sy.The sequel to Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018), it is the final installment in the Jurassic World trilogy and the sixth installment overall in the Jurassic Park film series.Four years after the destruction of Isla Nublar, dinosaurs now live and hunt alongside humans all over the world. This fragile balance will reshape the future and determine, once and for all, whether human beings are to remain the apex predators on a planet they now share with history's most fearsome creatures.Probably the most disappointing film of the entire Jurassic Park film franchise. The best part of the film was to bring the maximum possible star cast of the previous films together but still the film falls on the expectations. Although the good part was the VFX, the chasing scenes, the stellar star cast and off course the dinosaurs but the bad part was that the film gets boring and predictable in between and after sometime you'll feel that you are seeing the cocktail of all the previous Jurassic Park films with DNA engineered insects which becomes danger for the world, climate change, save the dinosaurs, save the humans etc. Etc.Plot of the film is decent and the execution is average, despite of the theme of the film the makers fails to keep the momentum and the films looses it's track in the middle and started gets slow and boring. A more refined and gripping screenplay could've worked in the favor of the film.Acting is good and almost all the star cast impresses be it Chris, Bryce, Laura, Jeff or Neill apart from Isabella Sermon as she irritates me whenever she comes on screen. You could be free spirited or revolutionary kid but i can't understand why do we always stereotype all the time when we have to show such kid.BGM is good and supports the screenplay very well, cinematography is brilliant and VFX are amazing. Climax of the film looked predictable and doesn't excites much.Overall an above average but still disappointing film of the Jurassic Park Franchise. Can be watched once.

title: The definition of MID
text: This is as mid as it get, just raise your hand to the dinosaur and it will stay calm. And the DINO's always take an extra 2 second to try to eat the people which give them/someone time to escape/rescue. Like the hell is that timing, like 5-6 times over the movies.

title: Fun To Watch But Not A Great Film
text: There has a good thrilling actions scenes but characters, plot and writing is so bad . I really sad and not enough dinosaurs and It is even worse than fallen kingdom.

title: Underrated
text: Idk i think it is because i expected it to be bad since i heard a lot of rumors bout this movie. The movie turned out to be actually enjoyable. It was nice to see some actors from the original jurassic park movies. I just didnt get how the girl was necessary, did it have to be a girl? Also the main problem in this movie is not the dinosaur which could be disappointing to some audiences. No Blue??? Aw man they shouldve added her more.In conclusion, this movie added too many characters that some of them did not need to be in the movie. Shouldve made the story more simple like the past movies.

title: What a dissapontment!!
text:
Why oh why?? Worst movie, so dull and boring. What a waste of budget.I am a devoted fan of the first 2 movies and Michael Crichton's books,
He must be very disapponted, definitely spinning in his grave.

title: Dodgson we got Dodgson here!
text: So preoccupied with whether they could they didn't stop to think of whether or not they should? Dodgson you see nobody cares! However enough people care for the nostalgia of old folks returning that this will probably make enough to do the job and be on its way. Memorable? Well there are some nice moments yet many of these moments are a repeat of a story told. The die hard Jurassic fans will happily go along for the ride like always, but the less enthusiastic who will wanna be seeing something different might be more difficult to sway, more stubborn. Mostly this is there own damn fault, what more can you expect? The formula can't change much, it's always gonna be the wow look a dinosaur before all hell breaks loose. If it isn't broke don't fix it! Although maybe a wise move is to say this is the very end of the Jurassic era. Milk it much further and you'll have an even less tangible authentic product, in fact you'll have Pamela Anderson's breasts, except they'll be deflated of any life. You'll be faking it into obscurity.The originals weren't so tiresome they didn't fit, no not by a long shot! They brought life like performances whilst remaining true to the origins of their characters. Jeff Goldblum was a stand out once again for me bringing a lighthearted sense of humour and not allowing it to be taken too seriously. Sam Neil and Laura Dern once again gave very natural performances. I'd say the film did seem a little disjointed at first bouncing from the newer characters played by Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard to reintroducing the originals.Colin Trevorrow certainly brings the action to a new level in this cinematic experience with new locations and amazing motorbike sequences juxtaposed with aeroplanes leaving very little to the imagination. The film seems slightly too long considering the content. I have never been a big fan of the training velociraptors theory to me a predator is a predator. Making them more emotional and communicating with them to the point of a promise seems farcical to me. Dodgsons character portrayal didn't quite work for me his aims and objectives wasn't as clear cut as they should've be in my opinion.
