So without giving too much of the plot away I'd say this isn't the weakest from the series of films but it's a long way from the strongest too.

title: Yikes-saurus
text: This movie has left a bad taste in my mouth, i was so hyped for it and expected an add-on to the past jurassic movies, but no, it was a big flat, story wise, CGI wise, actors wise, it was all a deja-vu kind of thing, yawned my way throught it to the end, and forgot all about it when the credits rolled up.

title: No words..
text: Well after seeing couple of higher and lower reviews i can say those who gave heigher reviews they didn't watch the original JURASSIC PARK (1993) and the 2nd part THE LOST WORLD (1997). So one thing i can tell you go and watch atleast JURASSIC PARK then you will probably understand why we all gave this movie poor rating. This movie is nothing compare with original one. What Steven Spielberg created that time you should watch it and then hope you will update your review again. PEACE.

title: A lesser copy of it self
text: And so, sadly, a waste of Laura Dern and Sam Neill. The Character og Jeff Goldblum is still good. But he should not get to run free with oneliners. Ipsum lorem. Ipsum lorem.

title: Have Something about it
text: Hybrid doesn't comes a long way as native breed. What if Ecological hierarchy is misbalanced and how they overcome it was the crux of the story.Every suspense that was break after the serious of events was well captured in these movies.

title: Hallow and plain weird
text: I have loved every single Jurassic movie. I always thought they were at least a 7,5 but often higher than that. This movie was supposed to show the implications of dinosaurs in our human world. The impact on the ecosystem. Unfortunately they decided to introduce a ton of new things without finishing the various plots that were introduced in the previous films. There are so many weird storylines going on that it is hard to understand what the actual story is about. Comedy is used in awkward times which completely disrupts the already weak tension. I feel very sad that this finale to my favorite franchise feels so hallow.

title: What did I just watch?
text: Dinosaurs may have evolved into birds but this series keeps devolving. What a meandering mess of characters and plot with no direction or motivation. This film is nothing more than a series of things that happen so the next thing can happen, but ignore all that because ... DINOSAURS!I'm very glad I didn't invest anything (other than my squandered time) into seeing this.

title: Waste of my money
text: I've always been a huge fan of Jurassic Park. Because of that, I've seen all the Jurassic movies, which have not even come close to the original. But this one is just sad, really, because it has many of the original actors from the 1993 classic, as they try to create that nostalgia, but it's a huge missed opportunity. It lacks the adventure and humor like the first one had. Instead, you just get a bunch of manufactured jump-scares and horrible CGI dinosaurs. Do not waste your money like I did and pay $20 to rent this.

title: Quite identical to the other Jurassic world/park movies
text: There is no much tension, and is very predictable. Nothing new you haven't seen so far. Nothing will give you goosebumps (maybe except the motorcycle chase) or actual scares. The story is quite lame. It is slightly better than Fallen Kingdome. Jurassic World should be more like a thriller in the future to work, with better characters and unpredictable deaths. Dominion was really a recycle from previous installments.

title: My second favorite JP movie!!
text: I loved everything about this movie! It was action packed, super exciting, and I enjoyed seeing the original cast again! For me, this one is a close second behind 1993's Jurassic Park!

title: Time to stop.
text: No wonder it made it to Amazon Prime 6 months after its theatrical release. It was sort of a Jurassic Park meets Indiana Jones movie. The whole movie was a chase and escape adventure movie. There was almost no plot at all. All of the charm and story of the original movie was gone. This was just another attempt to squeeze a little more money from the franchise.If you have the time, watch the original. It was innovative and entertaining. This was to be expected though. It happens all the time on successful movies. Unfortunately, the originality is lost and we just have the name left. Watch it if it is free, it is worth that.

title: A big, long WTF moment
text: Sadly the movie didn't level up to the production level or quality of the other Jurassic World (legendary) movies. It was shocking to see how terrible the acting was from world-class actors and it was clear that they were chosen for the sake of continuity and not for talent. In my opinion, the acting was the worst - felt like I was watching a school show. The storyline could have been better - the build-up took such a long time, approx 3/4 of the movie and climax (which was a good one, not terrrible) and then everything else rushed through as if to finish the movie quickly. What was the big rush? Because everything after the climax was pretty great and everyone wanted to see a longer timeline.Overall opinion - had HUGE hopes for this movie and was super excited because we grew up with Jurassic World but this was shockingly, heartbreakingly bad.*4 stars for climax and the few minutes after.

title: Not All bad, but most of it is
text: Honestly, this script reads like a producers wet dream, just telling the writers some cool stuff they thought up. Or something that would be a novelized sequel to a movie. It's that bad lol even within the massively contrived conceit that this movie starts out with, stuff happens that legitimately makes no sense at all. And could have easily been adjusted to do so. It makes no sense.Acting is uneven, to say the least. The bad guy is so, so bad. There's so much CGI getting in the way of cinematography it's hard to take in any decent shots. There's a few fun set pieces and stunts. A few more that are wildly dumb. Some weird new creature thing. It's predictably meandering and too long. Most annoying, though: some of the ideas about the plot are actually interesting. They're just packaged terribly. It should have just stayed an action flick. The ecology angle is blown. The "heart" of the film with the child: blown. It can't pull it off. All it can do is wave pretty CGI and make people die and run. That's the only move it can pull off, 12 movies later.

title: Boring, phoned-in
text: My expectations were super low but this is really bad. Who wrote the dialogue? There is probably 15% of interesting scenes in this, the rest... Filler. The dinosaurs somehow look worse than in the original Jurassic Park.

title: Totally worth the hype
text: As a fan of the Jurassic Park Saga, this movie delivers. It was a great installment to the Jurassic World films. It truly hit the mark with reintroducing the original Cast and was definitely done right. If you are a Fan of the movies this is definitely one to see. There are a couple slow moments but definitely pays off in the end. Even though I did enjoy this movie and would recommend it to anyone, I just hope they end the Series here. The ending was Perfect and did not leave any open-ended questions and I think if they did try to continue the series it would just ruin it and would not really have a story to give. If you are looking for a movie that is action/adventure packed and safe for the whole family I would suggest going to see this film.

title: A violent vegan Bitchslap-o-saurus? Really??
text:
Sooo.. I guess most things about the lack of originality have been said.. it feels like a rip off of the latest Spider-Man with characters from different movies..
It was watchable.. the "Daniel and the dragon" moment was funny.. quite a few little hints in here towards the real world that kept me entertained but I'm glad I didn't pay for a theater ticket for this.. it was a B movie with to much money behind it.. finishing of with some new age foolish fairytale...

title: If they made a movie with just the Dinosaurs, It would probably faired well.
text: Money can buy good cast, the set-work the animations. But Money cannot fill Life to a movie. Cinematically I would give it a 7, but the movie is just not up to its origins...The esthetics was cool, The cast were stuck in a bad loop of the script, maybe it was good money and a free ride to old times. But its mind boggling how lifeless the movie was. Funny how some action sequences was obvious non would get hurt but the director tried SOOO hard to make us believe they would lolP. S:- What is up with Hollywood trying to sneak in fake feminist's agenda in Movies. Matrix, marvel movies, now this women who can give birth without a male. Jeeezazzz.

title: Don't bother
text: They managed to bring back a bunch of characters and then under utilize them. Chris Pratt in particular had virtually none of his usual wit. Then they added characters that really had very little connection to the story. So basically it amounted to how many different ways can we make people run away from dinosaurs in increasing implausible ways and still tie in some nostalgia for the original Jurassic park. Add in some unscientific speeches on climate change and you've got a two and a half hour boring movie that gets two stars instead of one for the beautiful CGI.

title: Wonderful
text: It's absolutely wonderful in all the best ways. The reviews are ridiculous, because at the end of the day, it's dinosaurs in the modern world. What did you expect?? Every scene is a homage to a previous film in the franchise. The ending is a little cliche, but just enjoy the ride.

title: It is bad. Really bad.
text: Oh my, where shall I start? Bad acting. Bad script. Even worst directing. Lame boring clich plots, illogical acts, childish conversations. The girl Maisie? I know she is not an actress, but still. I don't think I've seen worst acting in a blockbuster movie. Bryce Dallas Howard is a worst actress than a director. If that is possible. This movie is the perfect example how bad things are in Hollywood. When there is money and everything you could want but you lack talent on every level.

title: Missed Opportunity
text: Typical New Prime, Hollyweirdos, more violence, less good storyline. I fast forwarded through the gross violence. The usual fake storyline that humans are awful is blown into volcanic levels. We Are AWFUL! No, we are sometimes vile. But find one person willing to catch/execute the evil ones/support the death penalty? Ya, no. Cameras off. Hollywood won't EVER step up. Wimps. Big mouths no balls to correct the evil. Sigh. Truly sad to see how Prime has bent over and gone all in with fake stories and huge sex/violence. Sad. May need to walk away from the low-IQ folks running things. Oh and stop freaking advertising CONSTANTLY between episodes when watching a tv show. Beginning to detest Prime/Amazon. Your stock is FAILING. Should I sell????

title: So cliche and horrible
text: So many cliche and horrible reasons to avoid this movie. I am a fan of Jurassic Park and World for the first movies in the respective series. After they leave the parks the movies become cringy and horrible to watch. To the point of having a cloned girl somehow having a British accent despite growing up with parents that do not have accents. Did they really think that a genetic clone would somehow also keep the accent of the cloned mother?! The only thing worth your time is reliving some nostalgia with several members of the original Jurassic Park cast. Otherwise this is a total waste of time.

title: Please stop milking "Jurassic Park"
text: At this point, this is too much.The one and only dinosaur movie are Jurassic Park (1993).Everything after that is downhill and feels like a scam just to grab money from the audience.And particularly this movie is the worst of them all. This movie is silly, and you need to keep your brain in the closet before watching this movie because none of the things happening in this movie make sense.

title: Any Witer There?
text: This movie clearly shows the big title producers does not care about scripts anymore. The movie has full of meaningless story jumps and weird decisions.If you want to enjoy dinasour CGI, please leave you logic in a closet.I gave it 4 stars, just for the sake of old titles.

title: A scientific crime
text:
The last movies was scientifically bad, but we could give then some credit due the age who it was made, like JP3, where at that time it was believed that Spino was a bipedal theropod, but today we know that it are just a quadrupedal fisher, or because they let clear the fiction part (like Indominus being a fictitious dinosaur)But that movie are just atrocious. First of all, Giganotosaurus and T-rex DIDNOT lived at the same age, and much less on the same place, so a prehistoric fight was just impossible.But, if they did, who would wins?T-rex was MUCH MORE smarter, bulkier, heavier, with a much stronger jaw made for make bones EXPLODE and used to hunt the deadliest herbivors who ever lived.Giganotosaurus in other hand, was skinnier, dumbier, with a jaw made to make their preys bleed and used to hunt in group in a strategy of bite and run.On the contrary who many persons believe, they never find any Giganotosaurus bigger than T-rex named "Scotty", in fact, Giganotosaurus being bigger is just a guess based in a BONE FRAGMENT (MUCPv-95), theres no scientific evidences showing that Giganotosaurus was in fact bigger than the T-rex.But yes, it was big and even if it was a bit smaller or even taller than T-rex, it couldnt rivailize T-rex's wheight.That said, Giganotosaurus in most of combats against the T-rex would just be obliterated.Now I know that theres someone thinking "heeey, its just a movie! Everyone knows thats arent based on reality!"
No, people dont know it. Even today I eventually find someone who believed that Indominous was a real thing or that the 300's fighted really in just 300 mens.Movies with scientific and historical sides can and will form people opinion.The average person dont know the things who I writed that and dont have any obligation to know it, that's why when we make a movie based in real scientific or historical facts, we should at least try to be accurate with the facts that we are showing for dont mislead the viewers.

title: Very disappointing
text: The whole film was the same bland plot line. Dinosaur chases people, people narrowly get away but still get away! They need to go back and realise why we loved Jurassic park. Even the Jurassic park music was lacking! Someone must have been delusional when making this.

title: Simply OK
text: It's definitely better than it's number 2 predecessor, but this movie still didn't recapture the self aware, cheeky fun sense of adventure of the first Jurassic World. The production/writing teams of these World sequels are taking themselves way too seriously.

title: Fantastic
text: Great diversity in the cast and a very compelling story with some great humor, enjoyed every moment. Loved how they brought back the original characters and intertwined everything into a connected plot. The cgi was terrific as well. Hope for more!

title: Tried too hard.
text: I was not impressed with this film at all. It was like they were trying way too hard. It was very predictable and cliche. There were so many lines that were just straight up cringey.I was about 7 years old when the original Jurassic Park came out, so it was neat to see the original characters. Jeff Goldblum is the best character in the movie. He's hilarious and reprises his role as Ian Malcom to a T.Overall, disappointed. It definitely had potential, but again, it's like it was just thrown together too quickly, and it just lacks substance. They should have just stopped with Jurassic World honestly, at least I enjoyed that one.

title: More of the same
text: This And The Lost World would have to be the two worst in the series . The film is far too long at 2.5 hours . Why do they have to make films so long ? It gets boring. The film has too many storylines. It started well and had some good action scenes early on .I'm glad the series is ending after this disappointment.

title: Better than expected
text: Good movie. Lots of action. Nothing too over the top/unbelievible. Was never slow. A bit of nostalgia. Old school and new school characters getting on the action. Forgot the critics, see for yourself.

title: Entertaining. Bad plot. No blood. Profanity and innuendo though.
text: So, the oddest thing is that while there is profanity in the movie, there is zero blood. No one even appears to get scratched. I saw a deer get chewed at with no blood, people get eaten with no blood. A hand got bit off, no blood. This is perplexing.Isabella Sermon did a great job in her role. I can see her becoming a future box office star. The return of the old actors was a bit cheesy but I liked that the film did that.The story was dreadfully bad. While I didn't get bored, I just found the plot to be really contrived and nonsensical at times. The locust plot is especially B. S. because the problem spread all over the world. One locust isn't going to affect other continents locusts etc.Again, this could have been so so so much better with some blood, actual injuries. All they do is make the characters dirty. If this is a kids movie, why the profanity and sexual innuendos? I think the scenes where people were being chased could have been made incredibly thrilling if there was even a bit of blood. You don't generally see horror movies blood free? Right?

title: Worst of the worst
text: Worst movie in the franchise. No real story. Just a showing a bunch of familier faces .... Doll and very predictable. To child friendly and themepark family movie orientated.

title: Nothing new here.
text: I don't know if they could have made a more boring, unthought out story than this, with the same old characters, plus a couple of new yet unoriginal ones. Terrible CGI, and bad acting by an actor or two made this hardly watchable.

title: Amazing
text: I dont know why people are dissing this movie. Every moment on it was amazing start to finish! It was amazing seeing the old cast explore this new place and it was a amazing and beautiful end to a great franchise.

title: Walked out halfway through I was so bored.
text: I wanted dinosaurs and what I got was Taken x Jason Bourne with a sprinkle of dinosaurs.There were 3-4 plot lines and yet the movie failed to make me interested in any of them. Chris Pratt holding out his hand like Eleven from Stranger Things even got tiring. I ended up wanting to take a nap in the theaters so I knew it was time to leave, I felt bad for spending money to go watch it.

title: Spielberg's Rolling Over in His Grave.
text: This is not a good movie. Some of the action scenes during the second half are fine I guess but man the dialogue in this movie is 90s basic cable tv show bad. The plot is ridiculous, the villain is just odd, not intimidating at all and I was literally rooting for Chris Pratts character to be eaten. They need to put this franchise to bed.

title: Stuck the landing!
text: Liked: Audio and effectsNot so much: Needs a bit more destructionLoved: Seeing the original cast on screen.Fun movie. Great way to end the series. Not sure what critics were expecting but for me it just had to check off on some boxes to be a hit. It had action, death and destruction, little humor, and able to trigger the nostalgia. It checked each one. I would've liked to see more death and destruction but I liked what I saw on screen. Great flick!

title: An anticlimactic end of a legendary era.
text: This movie sucks.... uninteresting plot, too many over the top action scenes were not necessary for a dinosaur movie, enough with the stale overplayed tropes with stubborn bitchy teenage girls who won't listen and ruin everything, bad pacing and bad choice of plot... lotuses???? Really??? Get real....bad cheesey dialogue, CGI was a step down from Jurassic World, dino boss was super lame, not enough Dinosaur.....in a DINOSAUR MOVIE!!! There's a lot more to say but just save your money and go watch Doctor strange or something else.What a pathetic end to a legendary franchise that deserved a proper send off. I hope it get rebooted 10 years down the line with better direction, better vision and more love.

title: Nothing new to hook us up with the movie
text: I thought the newest movie will bring me something new that can hook me up, but unfortunately, most scenes are just the repetition of the previous movie. The forest, the dinosaur, the running scenes...Even the scene of riding motorcycles while chasing by dinosaurs become a bit bland. Maybe because the plot is not as intriguing as one hope it could be.

title: Finally we can (hopefully) let this series die
text:
It really is quite a shame how far we have fallen from the original "Jurassic Park", a classic and timeless piece filmmaking from Stephen Spielberg. This is yet another prime example of how a big Hollywood project managed to bring loads of cash, heavyweight actors, and a lot of other talented folks behind the scenes together, only for the result to be essentially a giant middle finger to
a beloved franchise and all self-respecting moviegoers. It's just so creatively bankrupt and devoid of anything interesting that I can barely recall what I even watched in the theatres as I am writing this review.Where do I begin? The runtime is as good as any, I suppose. There is no way this movie needed to be anywhere close to two-and-a-half hours, as honestly there is hardly any progress being made to for the characters or the storyline for the majority of this film. We essentially just get a bunch of humans trying to survive dinosaurs while trying to rescue some other humans and dinosaurs, but for whatever stupid reason it takes a millennia for them to get anywhere. The performances in this movie are all decent enough, but because of the massively bloated and poorly-constructed plot I have great difficulties caring for most of them, and not even bringing back the original main actors of Jurassic Park can save this dumpster fire of a script.The action sequences and special effects are all done relatively well, I suppose, but nothing mind-blowing and it still doesn't break any new grounds since the original. In fact, the action scenes are much worse, because I am still not a fan of CGI dinosaurs as they don't look real and thus I don't feel scared for the characters. Give me the original animatronics and practical effects any-day, seriously.Finally, the crowning crap to top all of this off has to be the main villain of the story, or the worst excuse of one I've ever seen. This dude has to be the most incompetent and nicest villain I have ever seen in a movie, because he just let all the good guys walk all over him in his face and practically shakes their hand as they are doing it. Finding out your sub-ordinates betrayed you and actively helped out your enemies? No big deal, just fire him and let him leave right in front of you so he can continue to help out your enemies. Bonus points for literally letting the dinosaur and the person you captured escape under your nose and not have a single protocol or personnel that can stop them. This guy also accidentally destroyed his own laboratory and dinosaur habitat in the process of burning some evidence, which was so incredibly retarded that I didn't even register what happened for a good five minutes. Honestly, bravo.At the end of the day, Jurassic World Dominion is not worth your time or money, because the new trilogy has definitely run its course and then some. Let's just wish that whoever decides to reboot this franchise can give it a bit more love and some semblance of intelligence into the writing, while I find myself a copy of the original title to cleanse my brain from this travesty.

title: Missing just about everything
text: A bit like all of their most recent attempts, they obviously believed that if they threw enough nostalgia at you (props, camera angles, sequences) that you might just like it.Problem is that it all feels terribly empty, lifeless, unbelievable and irrelevant. It was boring. So so boring.They should have scrapped the entire new timeline and started again. Batman style. Give it a new life and something meaningful.

title: RANK & FILE MOVIE REVIEW: Jurassic World Dominion
text: Jurassic World Dominion currently sits at just a 38% on Rotten Tomatoes and it prompted me to do my first movie review. I wondered to myself why so often do critics get it wrong? I'm not alone in this thought because here are the stats from critic's vs audience. I see this so often and I had to ask myself why is this? I think the honest answer is that critics are there because they must be, and audiences are there because they want to be. As the movie starts and the Universal logo rolled into place, I was brought back to my thirteen-year-old self. Jurassic Park came out June 9th, 1993. Twenty-nine years ago. It honestly changed movies forever for me. I have seen every Jurassic Park movie, and Jurassic World movie in the theatre. I remember a group of us going from prom to see the midnight showing of the Lost World when it came out dressed in full tux and gowns. That is fan dedication! So, to get into the Jurassic World Dominion, it is everything it should be, but not everything it could be. The film is a little long at 2 hours and 26 minutes, but it does go by quick. Colin Trevorrow sits in the director's chair again as he did in the Jurassic World (2015). As an artist I am always curious as to who the films cinematographer is? In this case, it was John Schwartzman. The film is stunning. The visuals and dinosaur effects are awesome. I appreciated the return to a lot of the practical dinosaur effects. The plot has everything a good dinosaur plot should have and a little bit more. No spoilers, but this is a straight up dinosaur James Bond movie. Personally, I love James Bond, but that was a point of contention for the critics. DeWanda Wise was a scene stealer as the dubbed Han Solo of Jurassic Park. She calls out another character in the film named Denise who your led to believe was a girlfriend? I am not sure if she is the first LGBTQ+ character in the franchise, but regardless she's great. It is also great to see all the legacy cast return. Laura Dern, Sam Neil, and of course Jeff Goldblum. The cast does become a bit of a scooby gang, and never quite feel like anything bad is going to happen to them. Alright, on to the big bad. Giganotosaurus. Well, he's bad but unintentionally gets upstaged by the Therizinosaurus (had to look that up twice) a terrifying Freddy Kruger like dinosaur. There is scene where it stalks Bryce Dallas Howard's (Claire) into a lake, and it is truly the stuff nightmares are made of. We also finally get to see the return of the dilophosaurus. The film is at its best mid-way through when a chase scene filmed in Malta breaks out. It was a real seat clencher. So, to land this review home I am going to bring it back to it was everything it should be, but not everything it could be. As far as where it lays in the franchise, I would say it falls nicely into third place behind Jurassic Park, and Jurassic World.

title: More life in the extinct characters than the live ones
text:
My Review- Jurassic World Dominion
My Rating 5/10My second journey this week out of my usual movie genre zone but it wasn't as successful as Top Gun Maverick.This sixth and I hope final journey back to the Jurassic Park movie franchise is far to long at nearly 2hrs 30 minutes .The story is drawn out and to my mind is the perfect example of a movie franchise running it's course.In my opinion Jurassic World Dominion breaks all my golden rules of movie enjoyment .I ask the three questions of any movie I see no matter what genre
1 - was I interested in the characters ? Answer for this movie - just the dinosaurs
2- was it an entertaining script ?Answer. No I've seen it all before done far better.3- Did I enjoy the performances ?Answer just the dinosaurs and they gave me a headache after a while.Top marks to the CGI and special effects Production team they certainly put new life into their extinct characters the Dinosaurs. However it's a pity the Script writers and Director couldn't manage the same with the human characters .In a 2004 book by Christopher Booker he explains The Seven Basic Plots: and why we tell stories? He gives examples of famous movies that fit into each category so I tried to place Jurassic World Dominion?They are -Overcoming the Monster
Rags to Riches
The Quest
Voyage and Return
Comedy
Tragedy
Rebirth
This movie has elements of Overcoming the monster and Voyage and Return but misses out on the author's main premise that no matter how many characters may appear in a story it's real concern is just on its hero no matter the genre or plot.Perhaps that's why Jurassic Park fails for me there is no hero in this movie but to many characters.

title: Barely watchable and repetitive
text: The biggest problem for this movie, and the entire franchise is that they are not sure whether to treat dinosaurs and protagonists or antagonists. Thus, we have a situation where they are fighting them and then the next scene they are saving them.Also, in my opinion everything started going down with this franchise once they decided to leave the island and make the larger scale, globe-trotting type of story with numerous characters and plot-lines.It is not without reason that the best movies in this franchise are those who opted for a more intimate, island based story without big corporations and unnecessary convoluted story.

title: SELF-INFLICTED BRAINDEATH
text: How can anyone ruin a Dinosaur picture in today's day & age? We have CGI, actors, dinosaurs what can wrong? NO STORY or a goofy one. How embarrassing for all those well-known actors in this film. Their misstep is probably offset by their paycheck. I cringed as I saw this movie trying to be other than a dinosaur movie and it borrows from other films shamefully. The premise in this movie has us believing and taking dinosaurs for granted like if you would see an ant's nest or a cloud formation no big deal and certainly not worth a second look or a dwelling moment. Even the writers couldn't wait for their script to end which becomes apparent as we wrap things up in the movie. I suppose this film will appeal to some group or persons, but I am at a loss to know who that would be? Methinks this is the end of something wonderous, beautiful and adventurous i.e. Dinosaurs roaming the earth brought to us via a good movie. Hey, here is a good ending: They bring back dinosaurs and they completely take over the earth once again, becoming the dominant species and wiping out mankind. Bye bye Hollywood.

title: Great fun
text: You know the critics does not like this movie, you know why because in this movie people know to which gender they belong and they are not confused about that neither they have any confusion about their sexuality and that's why critics does not like this. Offcourse families all around the world enjoyed this movie and it was 2nd high grossest movie of 2022.

title: Reheated lifeless leftovers that go on and on and on ...
text: There is so little effort put into this movie that there is almost nothing here. It's a rehashing of old characters with no story in sight. Plus its very long.

title: Your scientists were so preoccupied with whether they could, they didn't stop to think if they should
text: I've long ago abandoned the possibility that something will recapture the wonder of seeing Jurassic Park for the first time as a ten year old, that ship had sailed by the time The Lost World dropped a mere four years later. It was actually a pretty impressive hat trick that the first Jurassic World was able to reignite the spark, capturing some of what made the original so special. It was just a simple story of an amusement park filled with dinos, cue the John Williams score, *chefs kiss*By the third instalment of any franchise, things are bound to get a bit rocky. Dominion suffers by over stuffing it's plot with things you can't be bothered to care about. Clone kids, bioethics and a lot about locusts for some reason, all detract from the main event. What should be a straight line is a confusing zig zag of "who's this character, and what do they have to do with the dinos exactly?" It aims for more of a straight up action movie feel with the usual genre trappings of completely unrealistic close calls, plus Chris Pratt's dinosaur whisperer shtick is as absurd as everyone says it is.Of course, it's a Hollywood blockbuster by design, bringing out the best in the biz and investing a small fortune in it's creation, so it's bound to be well made in some respects. When they finally get down to the brass tacks of T-Rex attacks, it's an exciting brawl of high tech camera work and visual effects, with the bonus of far more practical/ animatronics than you'd expect in a modern film.It may be a cheap ploy for nostalgia, but I enjoyed the involvement of the original cast and numerous callbacks. It hinted at the more self aware, tongue in cheek movie that could have been if it wasn't otherwise getting bogged down trying to bite off more than it could chew.

title: Felt like an adult version of 'Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2'
text: Too much going on.What made the other Jurassic Park/World movies so engaging was the presence of ONE (sometimes 2) big dinosaurs that could threaten the survival of the entire group... this movie had at least 8 different threats, it was too much.The group of survivors would survive one dinosaur and literally two minutes later, there was another threat. Just too much going on.The whole plot with Biosyn felt like I was watching an adult version of 'Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs 2'. There was no need for Dr Allen Grant or the other OG characters to be in the movie, it added nothing to the story and don't get me started on the Maisie Lockwood plot.

title: Felt forced......
text: Everyone is just getting a paycheck here. Nothing to spaz out about. Bringing back the old doctors was cool. Could have been so much better but oh well. Sucks to follow up Maverick haha. 2 MAJOR flaws to point out.1) 2 Rex's get lose and are killing people in a black market basement and a fright breaks out hereeen two guys and the guys were better on dinosaurs now are betting and watching the humans fight...... WHILE Rex is behind them eating people haha smh Dear Lord, have mercy on the director who allowed this travesty of a scene.2) Blue is let lose in the wild woods (not sanctuary) and her kid......... uh....... Just one mile up the road is a company of tree farmers and good people. SMH They are surely to die due to this director's stupidity haha.

title: Let the fun return
text: I really enjoyed it. It was fun to see memories repeated. The Dino's were amazing. Special effects awesome as the first time. There were big shoes to fill. I found it extremely entertaining and believable. Yes not perfect. Acting from the actors returning was a little rusty. But I had fun the entire movie. So glad it was made. Thank you! My life needed it!

title: R.I.P Jurassic Park
text: If I list the reasons not to watch it, I'd have to write a book as short as J. R. R Tolkien, to spare them that, there's only one reason to watch this...................................................................................................... Final creditsEra melhor ter assistido o filme do Pel!

title: Was "don't look up" bad for your mental health? Don't watch this
text: Like I know we're all going to die from climate change but sometimes you just want to watch a movie. You know what I mean? Like we get it, there's an evil company destroying the earth and could stop it but won't stop since they are making a profit. But like there's nothing you can do about it.Generally speaking, The movie was ~45min too long. Suffers from The Last Jedi syndrome. This is what movies are now.Go to your local library and borrow the very first book you see and I promise you will have a better experience for 3 hours than wasting your time on this movie. Literally any book. Any book.Best part of the film was Jeff Goldblum just being himself.

title: Not Nearly as Bad as People Are Making it Out to be
text: I've never liked any of the Jurassic Park/World films except for obviously the original. This is supposed to be the last of the franchise. Again I love the original, but I've never really cared about this franchise as a whole. So when it concluded I just didn't care. Though it's another case of nostalgia-baiting I did like seeing the old and new characters together. Overall this film is fine and I don't think it deserves the amount of hate it's been getting. If you just turn off your brain you'll get some enjoyment out of it.

title: A great ride and a good story!!
text: Honestly.. don't listen to reviews on this one.. just see it. I feel like the proof is in the flim and that is why audiences are loving it. Everyone is a critic and the only ones who don't like it are people who somehow pride themselves on being one.

title: What was the point?
text: As a Jurassic Park fan I was so looking forward to this film because of some of the main original cast making an appearance in it.We have to face it, after number 3, and I know some would even include number 3 in this, this film franchise certainly nose dived fast.The franchise lost its mojo once it was rehashed with Pratt and. Dallas as the leading characters.But the idea that Sam Neill, Jeff Goldblum and Laura Dern were returning, certainly put a new hope on the franchise.However, this film once again lacked any substance.I think my favourite part was Dern and Neill's characters connecting. There was nothing special about the dinosaurs. I'd even go to say the one's in the original were far superior.It is a film I'd bypass for my collection.

title: Turrible installment to a dead franchise.
text: This movie is a hot mess. Uninteresting characters, and a feeble attempt ti fuse the original cast with a newer and less talented cast. I feel dumber after watching it. A total cash grab. Dont waste your time.

title: Too generic. What a shame.
text: I wasn't expecting too much when they greenlighted this film. I really love Jurassic Park and is one of my all time favourites, but this instalment it doesn't add anything new in order to become a classic in the future. Not at all, it became a generic flick with dinosaurs included in it. The part of those mercenaries tradding dinos with that chick pointing with a laser to some people so then the raptors could chase them is just simply stupid.Yes, i know, it's a popcorn movie and it's mission is to amuse people who watch it, but in this case is a sequel, it's no more than a following to a classic saga, so they could done it better. Too shame, like i said before, it became a generic film packed with nonsense action scenes and dull moments that don't add anything important to the plot.Having back the main stars of the first film din't work at all, instead, it wast a waste of a valious resource.Anyway, i'll give it a 5 only because it haves the name Jurassic in it.

title: A lot of fun
text: As a stand alone movie, I could see people might have a hard time following the plot. But if you have seen all the other movies, especially the original Jurassic Park, this movie is just plain nostalgic fun! It's entertaining and just plain fun!!!

title: Geriatric park
text:
Hey guys... honestly I really wanted to like this movie... I went into it with optimism... but... the glaring ridiculous themes and action was enough to turn me off...the directors lack of caring for the characters and inability to craft a good story were another glaring flaw.After seeing this,all I can say is wow...All 3 of the central beloved characters
, grant , sattler and Malcolm , were showing their age more than I could've imagined. Goldbloom could barely recite his lines.. and with no comedic timing..and the lines just weren't that good anyway. The action was dumbed down for them because of their advanced age and amped up for Pratt and company.. perhaps to balance out the lack of action... pratts side of the film showed like a James Bond movie rather than Jurassic.. I was confused.. is it bond or a dinosaur movie?well...Aside from being embarrassed for the 3 principal actors,I was confused about the what kind of movie it was.That being said, the first Jurassic park is one of my fav films and will always be a classic to me.. nothing will change that.. and that is how I will remember these characters.. not as they were showed in this "film"..
please don't waste your time with this..
remember Jurassic park the way it was... watch the original... it's still the best and ONLY Jurassic park.. well... The second one isn't bad either lolPeace.. thanks for reading.

title: Just bad writing.
text: Not as bad as some of the reviews suggest, but it does suffer from terrible dialogue and a ridiculous plot. It didn't need so many ideas thrown about and is far too long. Luckily the dinosaur effects are still well done and the set pieces are good and so its still entertaining in places. It just needed a much tighter script and a lot less rambling speeches. Not sure what the point of bringing all previous characters together was apart from massaging the actors egos. It is predictable and there are so many crazy coincidences which ruins any suspense or real sense of peril. The dinosaurs should be the real stars and are fascinating enough without all the extra bad science.

title: Juriassic Bug?
text: This movie was about the Wuhan leak of the pandemic with dinosaurs and it wasn't even good...it would have been much better if they had just released the original JP in the theaters for us to relive the magic of that on the big screen. This ish was whack B!

title: Like a breath of fresh air!
text: The Good: Diverse cast, great performances (Campbell Scott channelling Tim Cook is inspired) brilliant VFX, original script that simultaneously pays homage and subverts the original Jurassics with humour, heart, depth, a real-world that isn't TOO real, and James Bond/Mission: Impossible-esque action set-pieces.The Bad: A gratuitous opening sequence, under-used original cast, and perhaps a distracting conspiratorial sub-plot.The Verdict: After the so-so "Jurassic World" and dire "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom" which are essentially shot-for-shot remakes of "Jurassic Park" and "The Lost World: Jurassic Park" with a few new bells and whistles (see "Star Wars VII: The Force Awakens"), Colin Trevorrow ("Safety Not Guaranteed", "Jurassic World", "The Book of Henry") has returned and delivered a high to end this trilogy on. Honestly, the best film I've seen this summer (if not, the year) that is a deeply satisfying watch that never gets boring. "Jurassic World: Dominion", in my opinion, is up there with the best threequels: "Return of The Jedi", "The Dark Knight Rises", "The Matrix: Revolutions", and "Zack Snyder's Justice League".*Disclaimer: Don't expect a monster movie like "King Kong" or "Godzilla" where "Things Go Wrong", the dinosaurs are treated more like wildlife/exotic animals in this entry. If you are expecting a disaster movie then expect to be disappointed. This film is very divisive as a (relatively intelligent) sci-fi action-adventure and is probably why I loved it.

title: Adrenaline Junk
text: A very disappointing end to the Jurassic World Saga. I am a big fan and I genuinely think they could have come up with a decent storyline and visual effects. For Hollywood 2022 this movie does not deserve to be screened...

title: Sleeper
text: I gave this a movie a three only because it was the first movie I ever fell asleep watching. The best part of this movie was seeing the credits come up. Such a waste of 3 hours of my life.

title: A missed opportunity for a really fun dino-romp
text: Solid acting can't help a brain dead script and pointless storyline. Dern, Neal and Goldblum shine in an ultimately dull adventure that features dinosaurs, for reasons. So many great characters deserved far better than this.

title: The story is a total mess, barely saved by Neil, Pratt, Dern and Goldblum
text: The film survives off the backs of Sam Neil, Laura Dern, Chris Pratt and Goldblum, because the story is all over the place with plot holes you can drive a truck through. Not clear how this ever got through development - someone wasn't paying attention.The set piece chases aren't bad but totally contrived.

title: My favorite of the series.
text: IMHO, this is the best of the entire series. Not sure why all the hate for this one. There was less dino action and more story... which is a good thing. Once you've seen a dino... 5 movies later... it just isn't all that exciting by itself. Tons of references to Jurassic Park. ^_^

title: Slow
text: The movie is of my to a very slow start. I'm already checking my phone 15 minutes in. Really disappointing. There's too much going on and no real reason to care. It felt like it started in the middle and isn't moving in a straight line at all.I don't think we're going to be finishing this movie. It keeps having these short scenes and flipping between them to the point you forget what you just watched. I'm not sure why I kept watching after the second movie came out. That one was weird too. I remember being very confused by it and only bothering to watch it once. Nostalgia isn't exciting enough.

title: Poor legacy for the series
text: Very poor storyline. Like they didn't really care at all and just used the film franchise name, previous actors, and the dinosaurs to get people to pay. John Hammond and Richard Attenborough will be turning in their grave.And why not throw in a few Jason Bourne chase scenes as well.Does not really deserve 5/10.

title: Dumb/10
text: ..that's my rating.This movie is dumb. Very, very dumb. Logic gets chewed up and spit out entirely. This time it's all about shoving in as many references and member berries as possible.>What's the plot? Nope. Things happening. That's the plot. Clone-girl is kidnapped by greedy bad guy. Then she gets rescued and greedy bad guy gets eaten. That's it.>Who's the main character? Who, indeed. Who knows? Equal screen time is divided between 17 characters. You go figure it out!>Is there any dinosaur-action? Yes. Yes there is dinosaurs fighting other dinosaurs. Dinosaurs fighting humans, and dinosaurs fighting other animals. There is even a WWE-style wrestling team-up between two dinosaurs to kill another dinosaur. Are you sick of dinosaurs yet?>Why should anyone see this? If you enjoy a dumb, loud, nonsensical, but at least expensively overproduced mess, that you will never feel any need or desire to revisit, for as long as you live; Then this is the movie for you!

title: Pretty fun reunion
text: Not for the story, not for the new characters... I liked it for the pure fun of it. Yeah-yeah, still the same old everything and yet it was 2.5 hours of not falling asleep and totally enjoying the action. I think reunion of the very old characters with rather new ones was not bad at all... Yes, it was "revisiting" old characters and scenes as someone has commented. However, it was rather joyful revisiting and paced nicely all the way to the end. It was FUN!

title: Terribly filmed action ruined what could've been a fun film
text: As I sat in the theatre watching "Jurassic World: Dominion," I found that a question was forming in the back of my mind - small at first, like a mustard seed, but strong and pervasive in its growth. 30 minutes went by, then an hour, and I still couldn't shake it. The question? Well, I was simply wondering if "Jurassic World: Dominion" was secretly directed by Paul Greengrass due to the obnoxious and excessive use of close-up shaky camera.Listen, I'm a simple man. When I go see a movie called "Jurassic World," I just want to watch some realistic looking dinosaurs eat people and wreak havoc. And "Jurassic World: Dominion" does have that in spades, after about an hour of horrifically boring, haphazard, stitched together plot necessities. You see, this movie takes a long time to find its footing; essentially two films for the price of one, you'll find yourself bouncing from character to character, scene to scene, until, inevitably, the two stories finally collide to form a cohesive whole. You'll be privy to awkward, forced dialogue delivered by actors who look like they'd rather be literally anywhere else. You'll sit through a collage of scenes that feel like they were sliced, diced, and stitched together in the editing room by Freddy Krueger. And in between the mediocre editing, wooden dialogue, and painful sequences of exposition, you will at least be able to feast your eyes on all of the dinosaur action your heart could ever desire. The problem is you won't be able to see any of it because, for some ungodly reason, most of the action in this movie was filmed in close-up shaky cam.I mean, come on people. This is a movie that features CGI dinosaurs taking part in a city-wide motorcycle chase that looks like it was ripped directly out of "The Bourne Ultimatum" - at one point in this sequence the music even stops just so the audience can get a real feeling for how intense the action is. But you know what would've really made me get a feeling for the intensity of the action? A steady camera. I honestly got a headache trying to decipher the action, as the camera feels like it's always a few inches away from people, and it's constantly swaying in every single direction known to man. This faux-Paul Greengrass style of filmmaking is absolutely tiresome, and a pathetic excuse for generating excitement. If you really want to excite your audience, how about letting them clearly see what's happening, and who it's happening to. To say the least, the terribly filmed action ruined what could have otherwise been a fun film.And that basically concludes my review of "Jurassic World: Dominion." This is, simply put, not a very good film. I very much enjoyed the first "Jurassic World" movie and was looking forward to this, but I just found it boring, with the most exciting thing being my struggle to stay away in the theatre. If you want mindless - and I do mean mindless - action, then you can go see this and probably enjoy yourself; it certainly can be a visual spectacle, but past the surface level thrills you'll find a stunning mess in virtually every single department. This is not worth your time, and definitely not worth as many words as I have written.

title: Well...
text: Unfortunately I have always taught that dinausors were big,ugly and without interest...and they still are to me !Plus this movie is typical Hollywood re-doing the same thing over and over and over again.You've seen one film like this you have seen them all.Only good thing about it is that my son, loved it. But he is 11. So ...

title: Unsatisfying finale
text: Jurassic Park/World is one of my favorite movie franchises of all time. I love the original trilogy and I greatly enjoyed Jurassic World. I still liked the second Jurassic World movie, but the ending already gave me a bad feeling for the final installment. Unfortunately, my fears turned out to be justified as Jurassic World Dominion turns out to be a very unsatisfying finale to one of the greatest movie franchises of all time. It's not even necessarily a bad movie, but it lacks the things that made the other movies great. The main focus doesn't seem to be on the Dinosaurs any longer and there was not a single moment that made me excited to see the Dinosaurs. The second half is a bit better than the beginning, but overall it's very lacking. Sad.

title: Hope this is really the end.
text: I read this is the conclusion to the Jurassic movie's. I certainly hope so.Perhaps I'm dumb, but this overlong movie didn't explain much. Save your money and watch when it streams for free.Looked forward to it, but $19.95 for on demand is $19.95 too much.

title: Just go watch it. Ignore the reviews.
text: I went to see this movie with my kids for fathers day. Its a gr8 action movie. Chris Pratt felt like he was just there but every other cast member starting with Bryce have done a fenomenal job. The movie inst perfect but it is a good movie. I feel like there was no dead/slow moment. They made good use ofnthe 2 hours and the movie felt like it had multiple plots wich was good because I really didnt care too much for the main plot. Again THIS IS NOT A BAD MOVIE. Go watch it.

title: They redeemed it at the end
text: The first 40 minutes of this movie is rough with dodgy writing, pacing and acting all over the place. The script overall is weak and struggles to support its characters. Big character from fallen kingdom like Zia and Franklin are sidelined here, whilst new characters are barley given any time to develop with the exception being Kayla (this is purely by a stellar performance). Bryce dallas Howard shines once again as does Dern and Neil. The action is good and the dinosaurs looked good. But the story is so disjointed and all over the place it's hard to look past. For instance we have serval human "villains" all fail to register due to such limited screen time. The main human villain is weak and given barley any time to develop his intentions just being generic. Overall whilst the actors were there and giving it their all and the action was great this film was killed by a terrible story. What a sad ending to a brilliant franchise.

title: A walk down memory lane - with potholes
text: So i'll preface this with the follow admission - within about 30 minutes i'd had mostly lost interest in the film, there with dinos, check, big one small ones some as big as yer ead.... and then there were the original cast playing sort of the same roles as in V1... which was you know, nostalgic and interesting, though also a tad expected a tad dull and a tad uninteresting.I'm not sure why so many american films seem to insist that kids with superhero powers or whatever 'gifts' this girl has are locked away, i've no idea what the gifts are, were they explained I don't know, as i said i'd switched off and the only thing really likely to draw me back was a big dinosaur eating some creepy science guy or some everyone hates tech billionaire (would it be fun to have put mark zuckerberg or elon musk in this film?)...Anyway, there was shooting and guns and plots to destroy secret facilities, and some dinosaurs and some baby dinosaurs (cute) and a very angel lady flying helicopters and saving the day as usual, and chris pratt keepig his covid belly sweatshirt on for this one.I don't lknow, maybe it truely is time to hang up the dinosaur thing - i mean what more can they do with them... well besides another asteroid I suppose... but it feels boring and tired and about as lacking in credible story or plot or goals or points of interest or new learning opportunity as i feel likely to be voted sexiest reviewer of 2022.I can admire the effects , no doubt a lot of moneu got pumped into this plus more for marketing and junkets etc.... and to be honest, that money might better have gone to training nurses or helping ukarine or doing anyting at all that might reduce the damage humans (not dinosaurs) are doing to destory our world....Maybe the next incarnation could have some green goals included but please spare us the hippys and greta and all those god damnawful whining millennial gen y/z types.I've saved the film like every other pirate and if i'm snowed in during a snow storm here in tropical old new zealand, well hell, its sure got to be more meaty than watching the entirey Happy Potter story through, including the dire spinoffs. I'm also still angry the only attractive man (Billy was it?) in the one with Tea Leone got killed off i mean hello, if you have eye candy there is merit in having it live. That is all.

title: Fast and Furious with Dinosaurs
text: I genuinely believe that if you switched the casts of this movie with the recent casts of Fast and Furious, it would make equally as much sense and the movie wouldn't change a bit.Chris Pratt (Owen) is Vin Diesel (Dom) because obviously. Jeff Goldblum (Malcolm) is Tyrese (Roman) because he's witty and hilarious. Sam Neill (Grant) is Sung Kang (Han) because he's back for almost no reason at all. DeWanda Wise (Kayla) is Michelle Rodriguez (Letty) for the tough female support. Mamoudou Athue (Ramsay) is Ludacris (Tej) for the tech knowledge. Isabella Sermon (Maisie) is Nathalie Emmanuel (Ramsey) because they're sought after by the bad guys. BD Wong (Dr. Wu) is Kurt Russell (Mr. Nobody) because they're the intelligence ops leaders.I'm sure I could keep going but you probably get the point by now. The dinosaurs were a complete subplot that existed only to serve the title of the franchise. There's no rhyme or reason to the dinosaur fight scenes for anything but fan service. However, I did still give it a five because a four felt too harsh.

title: Listen, this is nostalgia + comedy + action
text: Listen, this movie is great if you follow the Jurassic Park franchise since the beginning. I've watched Jurassic Park in theatres when I was a little kid and this movie is bringing everything together and lets the oldschool characters/actors shine. Great if you love the Jurassic Park franchise and dinosaurs. Watch it while you can. I've watched it in a small theater, but watching it at home is fine too. The whole combination of the old cast with new talents just works, both Omar Sy, Mamoudo Athie, Dewanda Wise and Isabella Serbon are a good fit with the old school cast like Jeff Goldblum, Laura Dern and Sam Neill. There are funny Easter eggs and inside jokes that you will recognize if you watched all movies, which is an extra fun part too. It doesn't try to be something serious and land wrong like Jurassic Park 3 for example, it understands its genre and the movie it is, which makes it great to watch.

title: Don't waste your time you will regret it
text: This was BAD pretty much the same cast as the previous one's. Jeff Goldblum is still his same old arrogant annoying self. In the rendition the dinosaurs pretty much live amongst us we are cohabitating on the planet. Again Goldblum is soooooooo ANNOYING with his sarcasm and 1 liners it made me cringe. I am done with this franchise I got a refund/credit from the theater as well. This was bad very predictable ho hum.......you have been warned.

title: Ridiculous
text: The Jurassic franchise started out great, but got more ridiculous as it went. Jurassic World: Dominion takes the number one position in this respect. Nothing makes sense, and all the characters are flat. The dialogue is stilted, and the actors feel it. The delivery is phoned in. All the wrong people got eaten.

title: Great send-off for both trilogies
text: First off. Of the 2 most recent nostalgic remakes to come out. This makes Top gun look like trash. They brought these characters back in a great way and I loved it. I watched the double feature with the original Jurassic playing first. That's the best way to watch this.

title: The kids show is more entertaining
text: Well the series was fun while it lasted but this was the straw that broke the camel's back. It was not a horrible film but it wasn't worth a visit to the theater. One big issue (for me) was the dramatic reveal of each original character as if we didn't already know from press releases that they were going to be in the movie. It made no sense to do a dramatic reveal, say their full name, then follow it with "I'm a huge fan of your work" whenever they met someone new or got reacquainted. Nostalgia can only carry a movie so far and the charm wore off within seconds. There were also many plot holes or plot points that just didn't make any sense. You could rewatch every single Jurassic movie and still not understand where they got certain topics from, it was a mess.

title: Dull , no story, pointless.
text: If encourage anyone thinking about watching this, not to bother. Easily the worst of all the JP films (yes, it's even worse than the lost world)If this film were a colour, it'd be beige.

title: People Get in the Way
text: "Jurassic World" formerly "Jurassic Park" is one of those franchises that I just blindly and obediently give money to regardless of the quality of the product. I have such wonderful memories of "Jurassic Park" that anything with Jurassic in the name is a siren call that I must heed."Jurassic World Dominion" or "Jurassic World 3" was not very good, except for the real stars: the dinosaurs. The dinosaurs always show up and show out; the people, however... ehhhh.This episode stars Bryce Dallas Howard and Chris Pratt again. They are still an item and now they have a plus one. They adopted Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon), the little girl from "Fallen Kingdom." Apparently she was a hot commodity. Something about her DNA made her very desirable for the baddies.The baddies in this one were actually one baddie: Biosyn, a flourishing biotech company that brings up thoughts of Monsanto. The moment they showed the Biosyn commercials and their altruistic usages of dinosaurs I knew that Biosyn was going to be evil. It's the easy play. Make the wealthy corporation the bad guy. I'm just as anti-work as the next Redditor, but going the obvious and reused route of making a corporation the villain was weak.Heading Biosyn was Lewis Dogson (Campbell Scott). He was behind the creation of some very large and voracious locust which were destroying the world's crops. His top scientist, Dr. Henry Wu (BD Wong), a holdover from Jurassic Worlds past, believed he could stop the locust apocalypse if he only had Maisie's DNA.To help expose Biosyn, three original cast members made an appearance. Jeff Goldblum, Laura Dern, and Sam Neill all showed up looking thirty years older. Did they add anything of value to the movie? If you consider, "Oh! The original crew is here!" as adding value, then they added value. I would say that they were only written into the movie to generate buzz and perhaps sell more tickets by attracting the older nostalgic crowd.As for the plot, I didn't see anything I liked. I liked the narrow escapes from skulking dinosaurs and that was about it. The people just got in the way, but I suppose the predatory dinos need to have something to hunt. Maybe the next Jurassic World can be "Running Man" style where criminals get released into dino territory and have to make it to through to survive. It certainly wouldn't be much of a worse movie than they continue to release.

title: There was no story or tension just rehashed special effects
text: They had the big blockbuster effects but also two big problems, we've seen it all before and there was no story.Same old characters can't rescue a lightweight script so I didn't care if they all got eaten, it might have meant the film would have been shorten as I was waiting for it to end. With a huge budget they should have spent more on developing the plot rather than on overpaid actors who were just going through the motions.

title: Too much CGI; story often too fast to follow...
text: I thought the trailer looked fun, but the movie wasn't. We've all been told once in a while," Suspend disbelief." Well that's true from the opening scene.....

title: Yes!
text: Much better than Jurassic World 2 and Jurassic park 3. As a Jurassic park/world movie, it ranks as one of the best. Don't listen to the negative reviews here. People with negative opinions in life tend to be the loudest on movie reviews. It's extremely difficult to satisfy everyone, including fans of a franchise. They feel entitled to it's creative future. This movie is fantastic and very entertaining. It achieved exactly what it was made for. I really hope they continue this franchise in the future. Would be great to get a 10 episode series for the next project. Imagine Jurassic Future, based 50 years after the events of this movie, based in a world where we fully harness our dino friends for every day life and such. Kinda like the Flintstones lol.

title: All I wanted from a Jurassic movie and more
text: Like I said in the title, this movie was all I wanted from a Jurassic movie and more.In a world where a movie like the new Dune, where you watch for 10 mins a scene where nothing is happening, just someone staying on the bad, starring into the abyss than moving a little inside the room while the music is literally putting you to sleep, is considered art and great cinematography, I am not surprised that a movie like Jurassic world is not beeing liked.We had crazy cool dinosaurs scenes, likable characters, chases, more chases, more dinosaurs. I mean, what the @$#@# do someone expect from a Jurassic movie? I loved every second of it at the cinema, while falling asleep at a movie like Dune (I loved the Linch version a lot) with zero character dev., zero imersion, empty useless scenes and "special effects" of sand and more sand.I am smart enough to love movies like Shawshank Redemption or Jurassic World Domination, different movies, different genres, take them for what they are set to do.I am curious what people expected from this new Jurassic movie, psychological drama, Oscar wining scenario? It seems that they wanted unpredictable script, apparently a predictable scenario means a movie is trash. The old Jurassic movies where very unpredictable: the animlas escape always, the good guys are getting chased and survive every time while the bad guys got eaten. Simple and fun fantasy with dinosaurs. That's all, great visuals, cool action. That's the genre... Old school movie for old school fans. I really hope the next Jurassic movie is not some psychological drama in slow motion in order to be enjoyed by the new movie fans...

title: If you're a true fan of Spielberg's rendition you'll love it!
text: Don't follow the stupid reviews!! This was a visual treat and much much better than previous 2 parts. This actually felt like it had Spielberg's touch whereas previous two were just kiddish mockery to me. It has one of the best cinematic chase sequences filmed ever. If you have been a TRUE fan of first two, you would absolutely love this!This movie stands directly after the first three parts!

title: Don't hate on it
text: This was a great movie - not a great film- but a great movie . I can't believe people who liked the franchise didn't like this ! So many good throwbacks to the old movies - yeah it was cheesy , yes it had repetition but you had to like it for what it was ! . Bringing back all the old characters together was awesome , great tie ups , good plot and it kept you intrigued . Don't believe the haters it's quality entertainment and if you really love Jurassic park you will love this .

title: Not sure what these others people are watching
text: A perfectly good Jurassic World movie, with two plots that gradually intersect featuring plenty of nods to the other films and still a ton of dinosaurs. I'm honestly not sure why everyone is saying this is a bad movie, I'd say it's 3rd best, right behind the original movie and Jurassic World. The bad reviews kind of made me hesitant to see it, but I'm glad I did. Take a chance and go see this fitting finale to the Jurassic saga!

title: Very good end to the Jurassic Era!
text: What is wrong with you people?! I enjoyed that movie! I love the good developments of the characters that reunite in this movie. Hater's gonna hate! I love the cinematography of dinosaurs, the action and pacing which it was so good! This film doesn't disappoint me at all. It's a very good movie!

title: Great movie
text: Great movie cracking action , great acting and made a lot of sense when you think about it.amazing finale.Really a great movie and one of the best in the series.

title: Much better than I expected
text: I didn't watch any reviews or trailers for this one, but I watched it with low expectations because I really didn't like the previous film. I was positively surprised! The film doesn't try to do a "Jurassic Park" again, but focuses on mostly chase scenes and the classic Jurassic franchise tension of "will the dinosaurs see them". Even though it's predictable, it's still quite effective. I think the new additions to the cast were solid, they did a great job on the worldbuilding (which is always a big plus for me) and they did a good job on bringing the teams from the Jurassic Park and World franchises together.

title: GUARANTEED ENTERTAINMENT WITH A TOUCH OF NOSTALGIC
text: Nothing can probably beat what the first Jurassic Park caused, first because it was a pioneer movie in bringing the theme of dinosaurs, and second because of its amazing visual effects. But anyway there was a reinvention of the franchise with Jurassic World that worked very well. This latest installment also has the added bonus of bringing the original cast together with the current one, which makes it a unique product. The movie has everything from chases in European cities, snow scenes, mysterious caves, new dinosaurs, monstrous insects, dangers on Isla Nublar etc etc. But it also has some homage scenes to that charming first film, with frames almost traced. Many believe they see repeated things but in reality they are deliberately made so that the viewer instantly connects with their childhood, adolescence or youth according to how old they were in the 90s. The second half of the movie does not give us respite and we see our heroes in constant dangers. To buy a bucket of popcorn and sit down to enjoy the adventure.

title: If you like ARK and you like Jurassic Park it's great
text: My favorite part was when they showed a lystrosaurus. I screamed to interact for an experience boost. No its not Jurassic Park but the OG trio made an appearance and there were cute shout outs to the original. I felt like we were in an ARK base getting raided by another tribe and this was that storyline.I know a lot of people have complained but I just think no one is ever happy and they love to look for the bad instead of just enjoying the dang movie.I really think 500 characters is too long, but it's a great action packed family movie especially if you have children who have played ARK before.

title: Fun
text: I watched with my son and his friends and it was enjoyable to see them enjoy this trashy kind of movie. The kids saw a lot of references to today's reality: corporations pushing gene based solutions on populations, famine and starvation due to the meddling in science, swarms of locusts in the context of Klaus Schwab and oligarchs pushing us to eat insects to 'save the planet'. Interesting how these topics are part of cultural consciousness now...

title: Everything I was hoping for
text: A wonderful way to wrap up all the characters. It moved fast and I definitely did not feel like it was a 2:25 he movie. I'm going to have to see it again soon!

title: Ok it's a Dino chase movie
text: When it comes to Dino movies, are there any better? Unlike previous ones there are plenty of new dinos that are not hybrids which was good to see. Unlike others I thought the storyline was quite good, yes the end is predictable but what do you expect for a blockbuster that intends to finish a series? Could it be better? Possibly, is it better than Fallen Kingdom, most definitely! First film that I have seen on a big screen in years and I really enjoyed it.

title: Eh...
text: I give it an 8 mainly for the nostalgia of seeing Ian, Ellie and Alan together again.All the nods to the original movie were cool too, but the story itself felt a bit... Hum... I don't know, it felt like something was missing. And the whole locus storyline was kind of odd too.Great action sequences as usual, and amazing effects. But definitely not my favorite movie in the Jurassic Park/World franchise.I's rank it right next to Jurassic Park III.

title: Thoroughly enjoyable romp.
text: Spoiler free review:There have been a lot of mixed reviews for this one, including a 29% rotten tomato score from critics.I've just finished watching this and I have to say, I thoroughly enjoyed it. Now I do need to point out that if plot holes, unrealistic set pieces, and an underdeveloped political/economic/social world are issues, then please avoid films with dinosaurs in the modern world.I also need to state that my expectations for dinosaur movies are:1. Dinosaurs.2. Dinosaurs fighting each other.3. Dinosaurs eating people.4. Pretty people to look at.I was not disappointed.It's mad fun, it's daft in places, it's thrilling, there are some great throwback moments. It's fantastic to see the cast together and overall, it's a great conclusion to the franchise ...so far.

title: Best of the Jurassic park franchise and has a strong message
text: I loved it so much and wish for them to make another. Jurassic park movie. And it should have a 100% on good ratings. It has a strong message that everyone needs to listen to and fallow and learn to coexist with others. And pay attention to what is going on around you and pay attention to the national world and do something to help the world and protect it. From business from killing the earth. It has a lot of real meaning. And it needs to be really watched and listened to it will help people learn to coexist with other species. Thank you for reaching the end of my review. Stop killing the earth and other species.

title: Don't be put off by bad reviews
text: If you have enjoyed the Jurassic World Series so far and are a fan of the original trilogy you will have a great time watching this movie. Plenty of action, cool throwbacks and some interesting eco concepts that are pause for thought but don't try to hard to preach coz this movie knows you are here to have fun.

title: SUCH A GOOD MOVIE! BUT SO DISTURBING IN SO MANY WAYS!
text: I LOVE DINOSAURS!AND I LOVE JURASSIC PARK / WORLD MOVIES!!And I LOVE THIS MOVIE! I've seen them all!!ALL THOSE DINOSAURS!And they're AT THEIR BEST EATING BAD GUYS and other BAD DINOSAURS!!THIS MOVIE HAS SO MUCH THAT MAKES IT A GOOD MOVIE!Lots of ACTION! Lots of CONFLICT!! Lots of GOOD GUYS & BAD GUYS!!!And LOTS OF DINOSAURS!!!But they're SO MUCH about this movie that's SO (SO) DISTURBING in SO (SO) MANY WAYS!All those EVIL SCIENTIST, disguised as BENEVOLENT BENEFACTORS to society.You recognize them as BILLIONAIR CEOs. Trying to CHANGE FOR THE BETTER - or so they tell us.Where is the line between TRUST and OVERSIGHT?Whose monitoring all those scientists and others conducting GENETIC EXPERIMENTS?This s is a GREAT MOVIE that ENTERTAINS AND makes you wonder where HELL are the REAL HEROESthat are going to take on all those RERAL EVIL SCIENTISTS intent on changing the world FOR THE BETTER (e.g. Their bottom line).

title: This Movie was GREAT!!! What's everyone's beef?
text:
This was a fantastic and extremely entertaining Jurassic Film. It had some awesome action scenes, great use of several NEW dinos, scenes with ALL our FAV DINOS, (FINALLY some screen time for the dilophosaurus) and actual highly enjoyable storyline. Plenty of throwbacks to the first Jurassic World, as well as the original JP, The "full circle" back to the original film not only delights with familiar faces, its connects this films' Villain, while concluding a "open ended" storyline from the original Jurassic story - WHO PAID NED TO SMUGGLE OUT THE DINO DNA INSIDE THE FAUX BARSOL SHAVING CREAM CAN, AND WHAT WAS THEIR INTENTIONS?" DODSON!!! WE GOT DODSO HERE! SEE, NO BODY CARES.... until now. 3 decades later when Dinosaurs regularly roam the earth and Dodson genos-pursuit exemplifies playing God with nefarious plans to bring chaos & manipulating life itself. Like real life, there's a wussy nerdy rich man who enjoys cloning and stealing others proprietary property, along with Asian sidekick hell bent on gendercide and the concept that women can get pregnant by themselves, together they push to create a modern day holocaust by controlling all of the worlds supply of medicine and food. AND just like real life.... WHISTLE BLOWER TO THE RESCUE. OH, and WOO gets a conscious...
Not sure what's with the negative comments and bad reviews. I don't know what movie they saw, but this was a great Summer Popcorn Flick. Plenty of dinos, plenty of action, plenty of great cinema, and plenty of enjoyment for Jurassic fans! Better than Fallen Kingdom and my 3rd fav in the entire series of 6 films. (JP, JW, JWD, TLW, JP3, JWFK) Colin actual knows how to make good sequels. You watching Steven?

title: Awesome. Better than I expected.
text: It's obvious that it wouldn't be like Jurassic Park, but it didn't disappoint, quite the opposite, it went beyond my expectations. Electrifying and exciting.

title: Loved it!
text: This is the first film that I have watched all the way through in a long time!I love the first Jurassic Park, not so keen on the second and third. Jurassic World was good, the second ok, but this just had a bit of everything in it and lots of dinosaurs!!!I can't understand the poor reviews.This is the first film that I have watched all the way through in a long time!I love the first Jurassic Park, not so keen on the second and third. Jurassic World was good, the second ok, but this just had a bit of everything in it and lots of dinosaurs!!!I can't understand the poor reviews.Give it a go!

title: Third Best Of The Six: An Honest Review
text: I am a huge JP/JW fan, and I WANTED to LOVE this film, but I'm going to put together an honest review here.First, the pros: The plot line is a logical continuation and doesn't feel forced. The way the JP and JW cast get meshed together works very well, in my opinion. The movie has some very exciting and suspenseful moments....more than I've seen out of a JP/JW movie since Lost World!!Now, the cons: It is a slow moving film, and the VAST majority of the exciting and suspenseful moments occur in a 30 minute window near the end of the film. I wish there was more. There are definitely some great action sequences at the start and middle of the film, and they are FUN, but they are predictable and, therefore, don't build suspense. My final criticism is on the CGI. Honestly, there were some sequences where the CGI did NOT look fluid, but rather looked choppy and lower quality than anything since the original JP. It almost felt like their CGI budget was cut or something. The most exciting sequences, the CGI was spot on, but in other sequences, it was just WEIRD to watch.All in all, I give this film 8 stars since the plot was logical/believable, the acting was good (VERY good acting by the original JP cast), and the end of the movie saved the day by bringing in some REAL suspense.

title: Brilliant Film for all Jurassic lovers
text: I've loved all the previous movies and introduced the franchise to my kids as soon as they were old enough. We think this was a brilliant follow on with lots of action and dinosaur fights. There are plenty of dinosaurs which haven't been seen in the other movies and it was really good to see the original Jurassic Park actors incorparated. The kids LOVED this and trying to guess all the different dinosaurs, as did I. Is it a bit predictable? Yes. But it stayed true to itself and had iconic moments from all the other movies which we found really fun trying to guess which movie. This follow on is perfect and will be well loved by all Jurassic Park / World fans. Well worth a watch!

title: Perfect end to a trilogy!
