text: Perfect ending to this trilogy and so fantastic to see the original cast back, especially Laura Dern! Made all of my childhood dreams come true and the action sequences were masterful. Amazing to see so many accurate dinosaurs depictions too!

title: A Satisfying Conclusion
text: In Jurassic World Dominion, there are many things that deserve praise. The story and its ending, visual and sound effects, direction, performance of Goldblum, action scenes, and emotional weight all deserve praise.But does this mean that the movie does not have flaws? Of course not. Jurassic World Dominion has several flaws that can be easily noticed if the person focuses well in it. First, the opening sequence makes the person who is watching confused regarding what the movie will be about. But what is good is that everything starts to gradually become clear as the movie progresses. Second, to be honest, I did not find anything special concerning the performances of the cast, except for the one of Goldblum. Even when it comes to Neill, I expected much better performace from him. But unfortunately, that didn't happen. Third, the person who is watching the movie can feel that there is neither an upgrade nor a downgrade if we want to compare Jurassic World Dominion to the previous installments. It would have been better if they worked on at least one upgrade.But do all these flaws mean that I did not like Jurassic World Dominion? Of course not. On the contrary, I liked it so much and the way it ended the story that started with Jurassic Park 1993. When it comes to the score, I give Jurassic World Dominion 8 out of 10.

title: Worth Watching
text: Little lengthy but a nice movie..little slow before interval but after interval, it picks up the speed..movie is worth watching once and all the actors have done justice to their roles.

title: People are broken, so good.
text: Seriously, people are just broken. This was the best of the series in my eyes. People complaining there was no plot or dinosaurs throughout the movie but I can remember nothing else but these things. If you want the same movie as the originals, rewatch them - this movie was great.

title: Way under Rated!
text: I never went to the movie theater to see Jurassic World Dominion because all the bad reviews, even IMDB had terrible reviews. After seeing this film in my home a year after it was released I can say "DO NOT BELIEVE THE REVIEWS! It was far more enjoyable and entertaining than what all these BAD REVIEWS reported. WHY? WHY all the bad reviews is the question I ask now! What was their motive? The cast was great: Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Laura Dern, Sam Neil, Jeff Goldblum, DeWanda Wise, Mamoudou Athie, Isabella Serman, BD Wong and Dichen Lachman and more! The storyline was well thought out and is easy to follow. Editing was well done and special effects were as good if not better than the five previous films in the franchise. Here we see all the main characters are brought together for one incredible climax. I felt very satisfied with the action and how the plot rolled all the elements of the science together. If the reviews keep getting it wrong like they have in the last few years, they will be out of business. Someone wants to kill Hollywood and I can not help but think about all the competition from overseas nations now vying for profits at the box office.

title: A Great Conclusion In Every Way
text: I was stoked to see this epic saga brought to such a well thought out conclusion.Everything about this film worked - it's homages, its animatronics vs. CGI, its plot and mystery, its twists and its character development... It all worked so well.It felt like I was an 8 year old kid again watching Jurassic Park in the movie theatre again... But instead it was a movie in 2023 that didn't require me to overthink and guess every step and decide what I should be offended by - I was simply able to enjoy every scene and every minute.I love that they brought new school and old school together, and still ticked every box that needed to be ticked.Plus, that bloody scene with Bryce Dallas in the pond... Honestly! Some of these scenes were the most terrifying scenes since the 90's!!!!!!10/10.

title: An Unfortunately Unsatisfying Finale To The Jurassic Era
text: Jurassic World Dominion is the 6th and final entry in the Jurassic saga and with that comes high expectations for this film, While it manages to be highly entertaining with intense moments, the majority of the film fails to capture the Jurassic feel, cramming too much into its First act. The OG's returning ultimately don't add much to the story because "Hey I remember them". And Fan service moments (That I loved). Although the final act of the film is an absolute thrill. It feels unearned due to the boring first act. As much as I wanted to love this unfortunately this final entry into the Jurassic franchise leaves me just barely satisfied with a 8/10.

title: There was no other way to finish it, so I get it.
text: To me, this ending made the most sense given all that we've seen and done over the course of the previous 5 movies. We've seen the big dinosaur fights. We've seen the genetically modifed dinosaurs. We've seen the main characters in dino danger many many many times. We even got to see the park come together the way we knew it could be. I understand it's what we love, but with this being the very last movie, I know they had to be careful about tying up loose ends while also keeping us entertained.To me, this type of ending made the most sense. The nostalgia factor was high and I thought that was a really good move to include the OG cast. We have our closure and we feel good about all they've accomplished. The park has been done, the dinos being released into the "real world" has been done - what was left other than to close up the genetics storyline and make sure we understood that the dinos weren't going anywhere? You can't put it all back in the box, so there was nowhere else left to go.I guess I just don't see what people were expecting. There was plenty of action given. We've had all the wow moments we wanted, and I felt this movie did a decent job at giving us Dino scares mixed with real story. Was the "magic" there? Not exactlyyyy- and while I appreciate the nods to previous movies with the dino fights, it did feel a bit lazy. But it's the end so I didn't go in expecting some big twist and surprise. We knew what was coming and needed it to be wrapped up tightly, give a nod to all that we've seen and done and that came before us, and say goodbye. I felt this did exactly that and nothing more, so I appreciate it.

title: Not so bad as they say
text: I watched the movie and Its not so bad, as they say in the reviews, but its nothing special. The cast is awesome, old and new but together, But anyway I like Bryce Dallas Howard, my favorite redhead. And its now just action.

title: Just enjoy the ride
text: Most reviewers feel they have to overthink every movie. I on the other hand, either: enjoy or do not enjoy a movie. Sure this is not one of the best of the series but it still scary and fun. I found myself drawn in and just went with it. It was delightful to see many of the previous cast reprise their rolls. The production values are high, the visuals are stunning (unless you are allergic to CGI). I could definitely enjoy seeing this movie again in the future.

title: I loved it!
text: My husband and I saw this as our first movie in a year. We thoroughly enjoyed it as a fun summer movie. Nothing will equal the original Jurassic Park, but I didn't expect it to. I loved the original cast reunion joining with the Jurassic World group. There were plenty of dinosaurs throughout and I jumped a few times, even though i could have predicted what was coming. Loved the Easter Eggs from the original, especially the open shirt joke for Goldblum/Malcolm.I can and have seen so many wonderful, serious, Oscar contending movies. Is Dominion one of them? Nope. Is it a fun summer movie, that's great on a big screen? Yup. Relax, go see it with no cares or high expectations, and you'll have a great time at the movies.

title: Not Soo bad Not so Good I like this movievary much but locust WHY?
text: Not Soo bad Not so Good I like this movie.vary much but locust WHY? Now what is a feature of Jurassic trylogi? But I'm still happy and setisfied CGI is vary awesome VFX is Soo good dinosaur looks like a natural Beta is looking good.

title: Fun reunion.
text: This movie is definitely not as bad as people have been saying. It is long, but you know that going into the movie. The reunion of old cast and meeting up with the new cast is fun and there is a lot of action. The story mimics the original Jurassic park, which I found fun.

title: Great movie
text: Loved the never shown before new dinosaur species in this movie. Not "invented" species either. Good to see all the flashbacks to the older movies, especially the original. Acting was good and the special effects were awesome. Still could have been better, but a good dinosaur movie nevertheless.

title: A half-decent movie (great sets and Dinosaurs, and a semi-predictable story)
text: This is a good movie in general. Mostly. The story was the main issue. Very wonky pacing, and a semi predictable story, and occasionally poor writing. But as a Jurassic movies fan, you'll probably have at least a semi-decent time. The jokes were pretty good, but sometimes they didn't land. It's half dinosaur sequences, 1/4th sprinkling of exposition and dialogue, and 1/4th both. Mostly enjoyable characters, extremely cool prehistoric animals, and if ya like action movies, you will love this movie. The epitome of a summer blockbuster.

title: Extended cut finds a way
text: I've yet to compare it to the theatrical cut which seems to be the problematic one. After reading Colin Trevorrow's Twitter posts fully endorsing the extended cut as the better version, I had to give it a watch. I wasn't disappointed! I'm a trooper!

title: It's actually not that bad, well not as scathing as other reviews.
text: Sure, there were elements to Dominion that are far fetched, there many extremely valid points made by other reviewers. Of course there are lots of ways to wrap up a franchise as grand as this, and this might not have been the correct vision, but it is still worth the watch, and there are some really nostalgic moments also for the die hard fans like me.There's nothing that will change the results now, it is what it is. So just grin and bare it if you do have annoyances or things that you would have done differently had you written the script. There are a few Jar Jar Binks type flaws that if we dwelled on it would ruin the whole experience, but don't over-dramatize it or shout at the screen.Instead, just do it for your younger self, give that high-5 to your childhood and be proud that you were there fantasising about dinosaurs thanks to the Jurassic Park franchise 30 years in the making.

title: Plenty to love for fans of the series
text: There's a lot of discussion about the final installment of the Jurassic Park/ Jurassic World franchise. Some people love it, some people hate it. I've had the pleasure of seeing it in advance, and here are my thoughts.Jurassic World: Dominion is the final planned film in the 30 year franchise. It brings back core characters from the original movies and the new cast. It has a lot of work to do, and moves quickly. Honestly, it did everything I, as a fan of this series since Michael Crichton's novel, wanted for the final film. If you're a fan of this series and it's characters, you'll enjoy this one.Full review with spoilers on my website morbidsmile dot com.

title: I actually loved it
text: It looks like my opinion will be quite different from the general public's one.I actually loved the movie, the dinosaurs were perfectly made and it seems like people aren't talking about it as much as it'd be expected, like, they look so real in the movie, it's fascinating, we are experiencing a reality in which dinosaurs are real...Another thing that's getting me confuse is people complaining about the old characters being given a call back to their roles and getting reunited. Why's that a problem? Shouldn't we (the fans) be grateful for that?I also read some opinions in which were said that the movie was to much of an action movie. I guess that's what got me stuck to the screen. A lot of breathtaking moments, as it was expected. We already had time to introduce the dinos and the main plot in the past movies, now we need to evolve and develop the history, and that was what they (the writers/directors) did.I loved the movie and I'm happy i went to the cinema to watch it. It was very entertaining as I was expecting :)

title: Was this movie Review Bombed?
text: Totally not getting some of the comments and the low review. JW:D is perfectly fine, full of excitement, paced well, excellent CGI, and just an overall entertaining movie. My only gripe is that it's not as violent as it could be, but that's minor.For anyone who has not seen it, trust me, the negative reviews here are not accurate, even as opinions. The movie is entertaining.

title: Best Sequel
text: Best sequel since the original. Every other film was a sell out. I hated the Jurassic Park franchise until this. Problem is franchise always want to appeal to the masses with no originality. Just cheap action with a lot of special effects and loud explosions. No thanks.

title: Unbelievably good.
text: First off, this was hands down the best JP sequel to date. If you liked any of the movies leading up to this entry, you'll enjoy this one.Second, this is the first time I've watched one of these since the original and been genuinely thrilled. There were even a few well earned jump scares.Third, I do not understand the negative reviews in the least. The fan service was minimal, never stood in the way of the story, and I felt made the movie more fun.The story, by the way, was great. Somehow managed to bring everyone together in a way that didn't feel cheap, and managed to introduce a couple of new and interesting characters that could further serve future entities if that ever happens.While I did go into the movie with low expectations based on these reviews, I was accompanied by someone who had much higher expectations and we were still both pleasantly surprised. Give it a chance. It's thrilling, interesting, engrossing and sometimes a little scary, and it really brings home the message that the previous iterations have only touched on, while still managing to give us more action and intrigue (the original excluded, it's still the best).

title: Give this a 4/5 And 88% good critic reviews on rotten tomoatos
text: Watch this YouTube video review then understand how this movie is awesome. -Search up Jurassic world dominion is GOOD!The giganotosaurus looks awesome and just because it's not enough dinosaur, doesn't mean it's a 30 % movie, it deserves a 60 or even an 80%.

title: Jurassic Park not Jurassic World!
text: I enjoyed this a lot. It was a lot better than what I was expecting. Definitely better than Jurassic Park 3 and more fun than the Jurassic World movies. It felt more like a Jurassic Park movie than a Jurassic World movie. It captured the same magic and innocence of the Spielberg movies. I'm glad that we didn't see the same old repeated again. Dinosaurs eating people. It felt different and fresh. I also loved the evil Tim Apple.

title: Great movie!
text: I really enjoyed this show. It has all of the things I want to see, action, adventure, and dinosaurs, with a bit of nostalgia thrown in. Take the kids and go!

title: Respect for the past
text: Typical action and monsters that make the whole Jurassic franchise what it is a survival of the human race story with dinosaurs Frankly I think all of the nods to past movies are excellent and respectful of those that came before it This is a fitting end to a great ride Rawr! (Couldn't help it)

title: A FUN RIDE
text: If you want more than fun, adventure nostalgia and dinosaurs: go watch another movie. I had a really good time watching this movie. Granted, I just watched all of the Fast and Furious and then all seasons of S. W. A. T so I'm definitely an action person, I just love any fun, adventurous and new thinking action. "New thinking" is an expression in my language, not sure it is in English. Anyway, this movie was also very cosy, it has a nice ambiance and is a perfect weekend movie.I love the actors, of course, it was great seeing the old team back and the new pilot lady was a great addition. It was simply a fun ride!

title: It's Dinosaurs, what's not too like?
text: Think we get to a stage where we massively overly analyse films, it is dinosaurs living in the modern world, it's made-up, it's fun...I don't care that a dinosaur can run at 50mph and not get tired or that the heroes don't limbs ripped off. Was it a great Friday night movie watching comfy on the sofa, eating sugary snacks...YES! Did my 10yo think it was the best thing ever...YES, yes he did!Just leave your brain at the door, sit, watch and enjoy.As someone in their 40s and having seen Jurassic Park at the cinema I loved all the little nods to the originals.I don't understand people complaining that there was too many dinosaurs?!

title: Great job of tying all the different sequels together
text: We thought the movie was a great sequel and most likely final movie in one of the great theater experiences in a lifetime! The content and story line were in line with what a Jurassic World lover would have expected! Great performances and an interesting story line that tied together past movies.

title: Over-the-top, but pure entertainment
text: I don't get the negative reviews. Yes it's a bit too long (it's the finale, so it needs more runtime to conclude the story of all characters). Yes it's over the top, but again, the finale of any multi-part movie series needs a grand finale. There's nothing woke here (that's a big sigh of relief to most of us). The CGI is great. The action/running/driving sequences are great. It has all the important characters in the franchise (that's a proper way to please all the fans). It has a proper ending. I mean honestly it's a pretty decent finale. Don't listen to the haters. They have nothing better to do.

title: the 6th one is better then the first 5
text: This got to be one the scariest movie I have seen. 5.6 is underrating it. This is a 10 out of 10. This has great acting. It also has a great story line. The first 5 movie of Jurassic part are scary. This is scarier. This is scarier then A Nightmare on elm street. It is also scarier then Friday the 13. It is also scarier then Halloween. The Silence of the lambs is only scary to people who are easy to scary. And if they see this movie it will make them go mad with fear. This movie is scarier then the original Poltergeist. This scarier then The Bride of Chucky. This is scarier then the Shinning. If this does not scary you no movie will.

title: Dominion delivers action.
text: The acting was good. Action was riveting with great graphics. Storyline good enough for a great sequel. People complain about the storyline in an action movie. They just don't like the series to begin with. The storyline is dinosaurs against mankind. This story has held up the franchise well. The pilot actress is a great addition to the series. She really adds to the film. The chase scenes are superb and are what really makes the film. The villain has believability and gets his due. This film will be looked back at in history as a great non-stop action film that delivers. You don't want to go to the bathroom during the movie because you are afraid to miss something....that defines a great action movie.

title: I loved it
text: To be honest I get with some people hated it but me I absolutely loved it mainly because I'm a Jurassic Park fan but I think this is a great movie to close it off I do wish they filled in some plot holes and I loved how old are you old characters came back in one pot give me a little jump I also love it because The person who made it also has the same name as me.

title: Everyone hated it
text: I don't know why y'all hated the movie, I loved it.I can say this is one of my favorite movies 'cause I really like Jurassic movies, also Blue and her children was too cute and their relationship with humanity, specially with Owen.Btw, I really liked the plot and I'm happy 'cause I don't feel like their ruined Jurassic, it's fascinating. Humans were so kind to dinosaurs, at least most of them and that's so cute, the way the builders guided those two dinosaurs was literally so beautiful and peaceful.I don't know what else should I say, it's literally everything I can say without including spoilers but maybe y'all don't agree with me but I'm fr, I really liked the movie and I enjoyed every second when I watched it in the movie theater.

title: See it for yourself
text: Enjoyed this one more than those previous two. More action scenes and more entertaining. Disregard the negative reviews.Not the best jurassic park movie but not that bas as they say.

title: DANGER TURKEY!!!
text: So i came in not expecting anything really, started off a little dull but ramped up really fast! Well made, fast paced, over the top action scenes. The slower scenes where they mostly talk are like a mini skirt: short enough to retain interest, long enough to cover the subject. I must say that i'm surprised how much i liked it, will def rewatch in 4KHDR... oh, and i might have a small crush on Kayla.. yumyum.

title: The negative reviews are completely unjustified
text: This review is based on the extended version. The movie was quite decent. I have no idea why so many people chose to write negative reviews. What exactly were they expecting from the movie is beyond me. Were they expecting the dinosaurs to dance or sing or write books or participate in a cooking contest or play chess or join machines to rule over humans? Who knows? Some said there was no story. How many different ways are there to write a Dino story? Most negative reviewers probably thought if they could trash the movie even before they could stop and ask themselves if they should. The CGI was great and the story was good too. Please do not go by reviews alone and if possible, watch the movie. I would say that there is a good chance that you would end up liking it.

title: Amazing film but... Not for everyone
text:
This film was diffrent
Where the previous films where mostly about people being stuck on an island, hiding from dinosaurs, this films did something diffrent. I'm a huge fan of the Jurassic Park trilogy and I have seen Jurassic World 1 more times than the T-Rex making an appearance in all of the Jurassic films combined. I feel like this film was more modern than the previous films due to there being cities and interesting places. The film's story was a bit blurry and i don't know how i feel about bringing back thr older characters (REMINDS ME OF A SIMILAR FILM FROM LAST YEAR, IM TALKING ABOUT NO WAY HOME)Definitely a must watch for a Jurassic fan, but do remember it's diffrent from the rest of the films.

title: Amazing
text: It was amazing. I went in hoping it wouldn't ruin the franchise. Thankfully, I left the cinema happy! Now i can say that this is the greatest franchise of all time, (I even like it over the Marvel cinematic Universe.)

title: best jurassic world
text: Fantastic movie grate to see the old cast again and highly entertaining grate story. Easy to follow if you've seen a jurassic movie before cool to see the dinosaurs. Chris pratt was grate and cool to see his hand wave to control dinosaurs again in fact the whole cast was awesome.

title: Nostalgia at its best!
text:
I really enjoyed it. Great ending and as a massive fan of the films (3 aside)
So good to have the newbie gang meet the old gang - just made me smile so much.Don't be a hater, how else could it have ended tbh.

title: It was a fantastic movie
text: I think, this movies is very overhated it have much action, dinosaur and suspens!!! The only positive is the cgi in dinosaur!!! In addition, in my opinion is the best jurassic world movie maybe and jurassic park!!

title: An unrealistically real Dinosaur movie
text: Jurassic World: DominionMaisie who is the daughter of a single parent, her mother who gave birth to her without a father. The Jurassic Park movie series is very old, i was a kid back then when i used to watch Jurassic Park.The dinosaurs and Trex and all that stuff, which i think i was introduced to about dinosaurs because of the Jurassic Park movie series. Although in reality there's no such thing as dinosaurs and any concept of dinosaurs being alive in this era.All of the dinosaurs went extinct almost 65 million years ago, when a great asteroid hit our earth. So no dinosaurs exist after that. Jurassic Park is a movie series which reminds many of their childhood memories.I instantly recognised that Doctor who gave an access card to both of them who went into that basement to collect a sample of locusts. The VFX is great in it, but sometimes you can easily tell that this is all computer generated.After all, the idea of dinosaurs being alive or anything like that is terrifying as hell. 9 April is the last day to watch it on Netflix, so i had to watch it today before it went.

title: Worth every one of ten stars
text: This film is a great climax to the series. Brilliant special affects. Lots of action it even let you explore Malta & Comino. Getting all the old stars back together was an added bonus. Ignore the doom mongers complaining about the movie it is much better than what they say. Watch it end enjoy it. Special affects are amazing as they always are. Watch it in UHD if you can.

title: I have never
text: Seen a Jurrasssic Park movie ever, cause I just figured the writing would be very sparse owing to big monsters all around and I love a well crafted script more than anything in the world literally and figuratively! But I have to say, after watching this on Prime cause it was so for free I was like what the heck did I just watch, this was truly a work of art! I have to say, I was expecting a very low level script owing to giving more time to big like dumb fights that mean nothing in storytelling! But not here, they were put in with extremely good timing so that not to make it feel like a some odd contrivance! But the dialogue was spot on , a few things I would of tweaked here and there entering some scenes and maybe leaving them, mainly at the beginning but after the set up I was like this is adorable and the star-studed cast was so much fun and it worked remarkably well together! I Mean I would of given it a lil' more more sweetness by opting for a comedic pump-up in a few scenes but that's it! Otherwise I found the ride to be so exciting and really darling and my favorite part was the end! I just felt like it all worked so well and the message was so worth! I think who ever downs this should really re-think it cause it really was something terribly fun! I just want to commend everyone involved in this thing! I never thought these big budget films could deliver without just relying on their main vehicle to entertain and that's long action sequences that sometimes make me go like why? But this never made me ask why! Sure some of the things were a lil' too fast and strong for like a scooter-bike but I never once was like this is not cool! Cause it so totally was and is! Yes give it a shot! I just have this really cool feeling you will love it was well! Maybe don't compare it to the other ones , like I said I'm a lil' virgin but I'm definitely a whore when it comes to the wonderful gift of story! Most def!

title: Shocked at the bad reviews
text: One of my favorite Jurassic Park movies. It had me on edge from the beginning till end. I really really enjoyed it. They could have slightly added a little more stuff but I enjoyed it just the way it is and am currently watching it again.

title: Jurassic Park - meets Dawn of the Planet of the Apes - meets Peter Isherwell from Don't Look Up - meets Netflix's Space Sweepers
text:
FINAL TAKEAWAY:Overall #JurassicWorldDominion is Space Sweepers - meets Dawn of the Planet of the Apes - meets Jurassic Park - meets Peter Isherwell from Don't Look Up.That sounds like such a great mashup, but the team didn't blend everything up well with this final installment. I mean, is it a bad film? Not at all. It's digestible; but honestly, this isn't my favorite film in the Jurassic Park franchise, and I am a little disappointed that it's the conclusion film. Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom could have been the real conclusion to the franchise with some tweaks in my opinion.And you know what...I knew the off-vibe this film was going to take when I started seeing them 1990 Dinosaurs sitcom baby dinosaurs (LOL). It just really changed the feel immediately for me.OTHER THOUGHTS:
Highlights: All action and tension scenes with the dinosaurs, overall pacing, the scene with the burning locusts is possibly the best moment of the entire film for me, the realism of the adult dinosaurs, & seeing Omar Sy.Could've Been Better: Better use of Dr. Lewis Dodgson, better use of Maisie, and the focus on/inclusion of the dinosaurs more with the story-the whole point of the Jurassic Park franchise.

This movie is not good for 2d and 3d because story is not so good...End of Jurassic!!!!

title: Science Fiction
text: The class "Dinosauria" was originally defined by "Sir" Richard Owen of the Royal Society, and Superintendent of the British Museum Natural History Department in 1842. In other words, the existence of dinosaurs was first speculatively hypothesized by a knighted museum-head "coincidentally" in the mid-19th century, during the heyday of evolutionism, before a single dinosaur fossil had ever been found. The Masonic media and mainstream press worldwide got to work hyping stories of these supposed long-lost animals, and then lo and behold, 12 years later in 1854, Ferdinand Vandiveer Hayden during his exploration of the upper Missouri River, found "proof" of Owen's theory! A few unidentified teeth he mailed to leading paleontologist Joseph Leidy, who several years later declared them to be from an ancient extinct "Trachodon," dinosaur (which beyond ironically means "rough tooth").Firstly, it should be needless to say that it is impossible to reconstruct an entire hypothetical ancient animal based on a few teeth! But even more importantly, it is dubious that a myriad of ancient reptile/bird and reptile/mammal transitional forms necessary for the blossoming theory of evolution, would be hypothesized and then conveniently "discovered" by teams of evolutionist archeologists purposely out looking to find such fossils! And it is even more dubious that such fossils have supposedly existed for millions of years but were never found by or known to any civilization in the history of humanity until evolutionism's Masonic renaissance in the mid-19th century!"Why are there no discoveries by native Americans in all the years previous when they roamed the American continents? There is no belief of dinosaurs in the Native American religion or tradition. For that matter, why were there no discoveries prior to the nineteenth century in any part of the world? According to the World Book Encyclopedia, 'before the 1800's no one ever knew that dinosaurs existed.' During the late 1800's and early 1900's, large deposits of dinosaur remains were discovered ...Why has man suddenly made all these discoveries?" -David Wozney, "Dinosaurs: Science or Science Fiction"

title: Good timepass in OTT
text: It's not bad, it's a good timepass movie for weekend with family, my son loved the movie, he enjoyed telling names of all dinosaurs that appeared on the movie, we had good time.

title: Fun saves bad plot
text: Bad plot holes and head scratchers, but hold on to your butts this movie is fun. The visual effects are amazing and the acting was great. DeWanda Wise As Kayla Watts was a great performance. Great action and a fell well timed laughs.

title: Great of you need help sleeping
text: I nodded off and had the greatest dream about 10 minutes into the film, I would highly recommend this movie if you are having trouble sleeping or just love to snuggle up on a winters night and like to drain all seriuos thought from your mind and distract yourself from the rat race of the real world and occupy your mind with mindless dribble, that eventually ends in a deep sleep with your subconscious creating a better story while you dream.The dinosaurs are robotic but are S. G. I, which is confusing, star lord is so serious and not funny at all and miss Howard goes missing half the movie, plus there are so many useless plots to keep up with, it makes it that much easier to switch off and visit la la land.The best part you can wake up anytime during the movie and find nothing has eventuated and go straight back to sleep, everything is so predictable anyway.Thanks again for the great sleep, look forward to the next instalment in this over milked franchise.

title: Did we see the same movie?
text: I don't quite understand all the terrible review on this one. I actually was quite skeptical going in because of the IMDB score and was very pleasantly surprised. Guys....this is a predictable final sequel. The entire point of this film was getting the old cast back together again. That's it. What more can they improve upon with the dinosaur CGI and/or dinosaur chase/encounter sequences? I think some people have way to unrealistic expectations for this movie. For myself, I really enjoying seeing all the old cast. They are just as memorable, humorous, quirky and fun as I remember them to be. Also, everybody looks great to be so much older! I found the story to be sure....predictable, but still entertaining. The similarity between the Bison CEO and Tim Cook was hilariously uncanny, lol. Anyway, check your brain out and rent the film. It's not as bad as some would make it out to be on here. I probably enjoyed it even more than the last one.

title: Sticks to the formula
text:
Just watched this at the cinema. So here is my spoiler free review.Not bad but not excellent.Flawed in places and it's too long.There are parts where it gets a little dull but then it soon picks back up.Good points
It ties up loose ends and has a perfect ending.Also there are nice nods to the other movies that came before it.Overall, it is an entertaining movie with a kinda generic plot but stunning visuals and the old gangs back.So what's to complain about. I wouldn't say it's the best film ever made but it kept me on the edge of my seat and entertained.I would 100% recommend it.Go watch it and you won't be disappointed.

title: a few dinosaur is enough for me
text:
To be honest, the acting and plot isn't very good, but i do really appreciate dinosaurs and the fights between them
At first, i didn't really expect this movie can be as good as the movie in the series before this, it is really a big surprise for me to see Dr. Alan and Dr. Ellie and Dr.lan show up, and there is really do enough exciting dinosaurs fight which is enough for me, i am such a shallow person

title: Good movie.
text: This movie is just as good as the older ones. But with way better and more realistic animations! The acting is really good. And the story is really good. I don't understand why there are so many bad reviews.

title: TIM COOK was a villain! 100% nostalgic value but no wow factor at all.
text: I'm a really big fan of Jurassic but I'm really disappointed this time, I won't say that this one was weak I'll say it was quite bad. Music was good overall took me back to the original Park & World movie but very weak story line. No big fight between T-rex and Gignat....... Whatever saurus, Blue and mosasaurus wasted.

title: Certainly Not a boring pile of crap, ! Great fun action movie imo
text:
This follows the normal rules for the third part of a trilogy - more and bigger, and more dinosaurs that are bigger too is a good thing in my book, it's also a lot more fun. Being a big fan of the first film having seen it at the cinema when first released I actually found many scenes quite emotional and not just on a nostalgic level. Yes it's a blockbuster big budget epic that was very expensive to make, but it held true to the original with great special effects and there's some good cinematography too if you bother to notice.Reunion, Repentance and Retribution.After 20 years Sam Neil and Laura Dern are back together again, will it be third time lucky for Dr Alan Grant and Ellie Sattler ? And of course to complete the comeback trio Jeff Goldblum is in on the action as Ian Malcolm again with more words of witty philosophical wisdom. The next (World) generation are of course also reunited and join forces with the original generation.BD Wong knocks up his 4th Jurassic appearance ( matching Goldblum's) as Dr Henry Wu, is it time for him to repent for his sins ? At biosin (ok BioSyn) or play along with the new mister big Dodgson. ?.
Although this might seem cast heavy they all contribute enough to make the movie more than the sum of its parts, it's a long film at near 150 minutes so they all get a chance to shine.The story moves on from the disastrous release of dinosaurs onto the mainland from Fallen Kingdom and their spread around the world through trafficking
The Return of old friends in the dinosaur ensemble cast too, just for a bit more nostalgia from 1993.Recycling the corruption plot with a world domination boost was inevitable with a subtitle like Dominion, and the latest villain on the block takes on a new satirical? Cliche in the guise of corporate meta , sorry I mean mega billionaire Dodgson , yes he is a bit dodgy, but well played by Campbell Scott.Young Maisie , Isabella Sermon isn't just a clone ? She's an actress with potential rather than talent at this stage, but reminds me of the young Kiera Knightley.Representation and diversity boxes well and truly ticked, including as many Redheads as Grey.Lots of laughs and love in the air plus a blast of mission impossible action for good measure, after all this is a ComActionRomDinoSatire.There are so many nice little jokes dropped in with many nods to the original trilogy, I also like the modern jokes, particularly the coffee barista guy and the scooter guy, maybe I just found it funnier than other people?.Looking at the many low ratings and review headers of 'boring' and pile of crap, I can't help think some people had no intention of trying to enjoy this fun action movie, it's far from boring and if you think it is crap the problem is with the viewer not the film, which has such a lot of good things to offer. Ok, it's not faultless, I noticed many little niggles in the plot and continuity errors but rather than let them spoil the overall entertainment I was able to ignore them because the fun and action more than compensates. Well, I have really enjoyed it 3 times at the cinema,so far.

title: I understand why this got bad reviews.
text: Critics from the main stream media massacred this movie and it makes sense why. This movie warns us of the dangers about something's that's happening right now with out food suppliers, our farmland and Monsanto. The message is clear and it's real. The CGI is several steps back from even the original Jurassic Park but I liked the movie. You should check it out.

title: More of the same, but what a show.
text: Yes, it still more of the same thing and it goes like this several times, but it's more and more spectacular as fx improves. Let's put it this way, the movie could have been fantastic if the previous titles of the saga did not exist. And to see the originals characters returning a ton of years later feels funny.

title: Not sure what all the hate is about
text: I have never written a review before but after seeing all the hate for this movie I felt compelled to. I think this is the best movie since the first one. I'm not saying this was better than the original. This movie had a good enough story which wasn't just about surviving the dinosaurs which has already been done. The cloning of the girl and DNA splicing of the locusts gave the story some amount of depth in my opinion. There were plenty of on the edge of your seat moments which kept the movie moving at a good pace. Not a lot of humour and Pratt and his hand and everyone who thought they would also join in with the hand got a bit old.I'm not sure what people are expecting but this was a thoroughly entertaining movie from start to finish that both the adults and children in my family really enjoyed.

title: GREAT MOVIE. Don't Listen to the critics.
text: I really loved this movie. I grew up watching Jurrassic Park as a kid. I watched all 3 movies nearly every few months growing up. I had the toys and would dress up playing "dinosaur." I even had a "vest" pretending I was Dr. Grant haha. Goes without saying, I'm a huge Jurrasic Park fan. I just saw this movie on Saturday with my wife, and we both absolutely loved it! First off, they did a really good job bringing back the original characters and blending their storylines with the new cast. The dialougue between them, the way they interacted, was really well written and well acted. The writers were careful to pay their respects to the original cast. They didn't rush any scenes. They spent time on each scene/gave time for things to develop. They were in "true character/how they would have acted in the originals. This means everything to fans! Well done! Also, we were so happy to see how they added to the original characters' storyline, as I am sure other fans are also (I won't spoil anything :)). GREAT action, the actors have good chemistry, and it ties up all loose ends from all the movies!

title: Fun packed cheese fest!
text: It won't win any awards for ground breaking story lines or writing but for anyone who is a long standing fan of the franchise, this is a really fun way to round up the adventures. Plenty of action and scares. Importantly, plenty of laughs too. If you are a geek like me, you will love all the nods to previous films and the buddying up of the original and newer characters. Really enjoyed it and always great to see Alan Grant

title: Enjoyed
text: I enjoyed this film, although maybe many people think this film is bad, for me to see the old characters in the frame, it makes me very proud and happy.

title: Chris pratt should've been killed off ages ago
text: Why the hell he is still allowed to be the lead role when he single handedly ruined the franchise is beyond me. This film with the old cast is so much better. And new dinosaurs to boot!

title: Can service
text: This movie gives the franchise the closure it needs. Excellent CGI, but at times unrealistic- but who are we kidding? This is a Jurassic movie- hardly an everyday occurrence (yet)

title: Feel let down
text: Breaks my heart giving one of my favourite film franchises.It has all the things you want, but I feel let down. Would have been nice to have clips of John Hammond instead of a small mention.The CGI which normally is perfect in one scene you can tell it's not Pratt . Small things like that .My major thing is a character who deserves to die becomes good. Nope he should have died .

title: Surprisingly good
text: A early reviewer had written that they'd walked out of the movie, and had asked for a refund. So I didn't expect much. But the trailers had looked exciting, so I went to see it. And, surprisingly, I really enjoyed myself with all the realistic CGI, and the very many, many exciting, hair-raising chase sequences kept me engaged throughout the film. I came in with such low expectations, but I left feeling very satisfied. This movie featured excellent acting, acceptable dialogue and story line, and a pleasurable amount of amazing artwork and graphics. Perhaps not a perfect movie, but a very, very good summer blockbuster. Considerably better than most, in my opinion.

title: Best movie ever
text: Best movie ever! Favorite one by far. I loved all of the dinosaurs as they looked really life like. I also loved Chris patts hands and how strong they are fighting the dinosaurs. I hope they make another one soon. I won't spoil the movie for you, but you need to watch ASAP. It reminds me of the very first movie, but this one has a couple of twists so it leaves you wondering what will happen next. Good.

title: Was I watching the same film?!
text: I think that I must have been watching a different film to most of these reviewers! I thought it was great! Very moving to see the old gang together and I loved the fact that both groups were finding their own way to eventually meet up at Biosyn.Great performances and many funny moments and tributes/Easter eggs.

title: Action packed
text: Enjoyable! Loved seeing the old characters. Not sure why it doesn't have a higher rating. The dinosaurs were terrifying. A little predictable, but kept my attention.

title: Its a good movie for me!
text: Many people said the movie is bad, but actually it is directed by the same Director from "Jurassic World". I think this movie is entertainment, exciting and enjoyable . This is not fair to compare with the "Jurassic World", since the Story background is totally different. And I think this is hard to create a story when the Dinosaur outbreak to the world. But for a commercial movie, this is still a good movie.

title: Slow but still enjoyed
text: Found it a bit slow . But once it got going loved it . Brilliant to see the original characters back and unite with the new characters . Not as many dinosaurs to start with . Defo improved as the film went on. Loved it x.

title: Ridiculous. Unnecessary. Pointless. I loved it!
text: So it probably shouldn't have been made. But it was fun and I enjoyed watching it hugely. Doesn't take itself seriously (how could it), but a great 'suspend belief' film that I'll never watch again but I'm glad I did.

title: Exciting, overwhelming, scary, amazing!
text: I saw the movie on Imax and I was speechless! Out of all Jurrassic Park / World movies, this one has the most amazing sounds I've ever heard! The visuals are crazyy!!! And above all - to see the Jurassic Park cast together with the Jurassic World cast was incredible! I got so excited to see it! I am definitely going to see it one more time!

title: Just want you need in a Jurassic movie
text: Look, the movie may have some plot that don't make sense and some that do, but the whole point of movies is that they are meant to entertain us and tell us a story. In my opinion the movie may be a little bit behind others but they give us a chance to see some classic dinosaurs we know and brand new dinosaurs even characters we all know and love, new and old. They may have made this movie for money and all that, but that's not important. What's important is that we have something to watch over and over in the future or in fact, just to keep for safe keeping. If the Jurassic franchise kept me entertained and you love the Jurassic franchise, than this movie is for you.

title: Best paired with an edible
text: This film hits every ridiculous tired trope from all genres and when paired with an edible, it is the most brilliant thing you will see.Recreating the logo in the film? Check.Fire? Yes. Ice? Absolutely. Cowboy wrangling? Ha ha ha ha, yes. And it doesn't even seem out of place that we would domesticate dinosaurs any differently than we would domesticate horses.This will be a perfect Halloween movie.I love that it opened feeling like a National Geographic scene from 65 million years ago.Double points if you watch with film crew who enjoy pointing out every implausible source of tension building.

title: A good one !
text:
Thrilling,great cinematography
It does have some boring and unnecessary scenes but it was truly a great movie not quite in the same level as jurrasic park and first 2 jurrasic world.It brings together both parts of the beloved franchise in a really great way.100% worth watching.

title: What's wrong with everyone
text: Perfect, couldn't ask for a better ending to the story!I thought they did an amazing job introducing new dinosaurs and bringing everyone together. With all the fun action it didn't feel to long at all. People saying they're sink of Owens hands makes no sense, he's a tamer of freaking raptors, it's what he knows. Don't believe these other stupid people. Just enjoy the characters and dinos you once loved!

title: Totally Amazing
text: I could not have loved this movie more! I am a huge sucker for all of the Jurassic Park movies, so it shocked me when I saw that this movie got only a 5.4 out of 10. I clearly thought the director did brilliant.

title: Worth seeing.
text: I don't agree with negative comments...Speilberg can do no wrong in my eyes... and the acting and all characters being thrown together again was exciting and their acting superb! Maybe there were one too many dinosaur chase scenes but overall worth seeing.

title: Unbearable to watch
text: This movie is absolute disappointing way to end this franchise. There is no need to sugar-coat or draw this out. I couldn't even watch the whole movie. The plot is ridiculous as are the characters. Even the beloved characters from the original are only bearable through nostalgia purposes. Chris Pratt is unbelievable are The Dinosaur Whisperer. I'm not even going to acknowledge the clone girl. They even turned the dinosaurs into caricatures.

title: All over the place
text: Really wanted to like this one more. It's easily the best and worst Jurassic World film. Lots of visuals to love here but the story and most performances were all over the place. I attribute this to the dialogue. Young Isabella Sermon and Campbell Scott are the two consistently good performances throughout, but the rest are hit and miss. There are way too many things happening to justify an interesting story. And far too many main characters running around for all of them to survive without a scratch. My favorite part of the film was in the middle, as things start escalating. But the beginning was kinda boring and the finale just disappointing.If there is anything to like about the movie, it's the hybrid dinosaurs not introduced previously. It was also great to have the original cast in the film, but I believe they were overused, making their presence almost corny. Overall, I think for a dinosaur movie, the Jurassic Park films do a better job at capturing realism. The Jurassic World films, especially Dominion, was just way too obscure to capture the realism of the original trilogy. Unrealistic.

title: Not even original actors could help this Woke hot mess!!
text: If you like seeing a movie about evil corporation's and illegal breading farms, this is the movie for you. It's a woke hot mess of a movie that sounds like it was written by a Greta. Just another Hollywood fail. Again and Again.

title: Great action but no movement in plot
text: There are definitely some amazing action sequences in this movie, but to be honest there was little imagination in advancing the plot of the series, and the movie ended EXACTLY where it began.After two years of post-apocalyptic real world events I was just super frustrated that the writers re-used variations of previous locations and plots.Really, Dinosaurs are out in the world, people are likely eating them, and no one thought of a Wuhan market type pandemic as a result? I was hoping to see the genesis of a cool Cadillacs and Dinosaurs" movie, and how real people would respond to this eco disaster... but alas, no.

title: Where do I start?
text: Special effects are great, but that's about it. Chris Pratt cannot act himself out of a bag. There are so many plot holes and scenes that just make you scratch your head. And two and a half hours? A wasted afternoon.

title: SAVE this movie by...
text: Releasing it in a version that includes the prologue and the short movie Battle at big Rock,otherwise it will be a serious letdown to everyone who is a fan of the franchise.it would also help to shorten it down by cutting out several character scenes ,especially the human villains and or additional characters.Although i lowered my expectations and was already disappointed by its predecessor i felt kinda betrayed by it.my 7 out of 10 rating is really well meant because it belongs to the franchise that i adore ,but it lacked dinosaur action and epicness.especially as a conclusion to the series it unfortunately is a serious disappointment as much as i hate saying that .

title: Too much and also too little.
text: Like most who were born in the 1990's I grew up with the original Jurassic Park and would watch it almost endlessly on VHS. It not only entertained, but also sparked my interest in all things dinosaurs and was one of the movies that made me want to be a filmmaker. I am happy that even as I have grown older, and my cinematic tastes have matured I still am able to rate the film highly. I would echo with most regarding the sequels and that they all left much to be desired. The Lost World is entertaining and has some nice world building and spectacle but lacks the charm of its predecessor. Jurassic Park III is essentially one long action set piece with a storyline that is neither interest nor very exciting. Jurassic World is essentially the first movie on a larger scale but still is charming and entertaining. Fallen Kingdom has a nice set up but after the island is engulfed into ash it essentially becomes a monster-in-the-house kind of movie. Dominion I am sorry to say is not the complete home run a fan has been hoping for in 29 years.Dominion has the ambitious task of concluding this trilogy of Jurassic installments, finish the arcs for the new and old casts of characters, and ultimately conclude the franchise as a whole. It aims high but doesn't grasp at the greatness it's hoping to achieve. There is too much going on in the plot that often it feels like two different movies spliced into one. There are so many concepts, themes, characters, and set-ups that it honestly comes across like somebody edited down an entire season of television into a two-and-a-half-hour film - To be honest, I think I would have preferred a series over a movie given how much Colin Trevorrow sets out to do in such a span of time. The cast all do fine, everyone is charismatic, the imagery is often dynamic and fantastic, and the spectacle is often incredible to witness on the big screen, though the wonderment of the original and even The Lost World and to an extent Jurassic World feels almost entirely lost.Watching the film, I couldn't help but think that Trevorrow learned a lot from his experience with working on the ninth episode of Star Wars and how Kathleen Kennedy and Lucasfilm/Disney mismanaged and letdown legions of fans, and when he left and set out to try and avoid the pitfalls of The Rise of Skywalker by trying to give everyone as much as he thought they wanted; he succeeds to an extent, but the overlong runtime and constant juggle of storylines and characters make the more satisfying moments lacking total and complete emotional impact. I don't blame him for trying, especially given that Fallen Kingdom wasn't as well liked as Jurassic World and trying to make a picture that pleases every fan is satisfying as well. I wish it had worked out in his favor, but alas.

title: It was nice but I like the first one more
text: I've watched whole 'World' series at cinemas so I didn't have any choice. Also it's one of 'Jurassic' series and this one is the end of the 'World' series even it's good or not.I liked 'Park' trilogy a lot when I first watched them and were a kind of revolution of film history by CGI.Then the 'World' series. This sequel is started with opening of amusement park called 'Jurassic World' which the first series couldn't make. But there were some problems and it got out of control as first 'JP'. Not only that, the volcano in the island exploded and people decided to put the dinosaurs out of the island.Now, a lot of dinosaurs are all over the world. How do you deal with this chaos? That's the story of 'Dominion'.I think it was really hard to finish this story because of the bigness of scale.My fear was right. It was too much even creators did great job.Of course I was really excited for those people from 'Park' series and homage from old series. I enjoyed actions and battles of dinosaurs a lot. I was touched by the last scene by Chris Platt and the velociraptor because I like them even they had been getting smarter and smarter in the whole series. It was really unexpected thing that I was almost crying because of T-Rex.

title: what do people want these days? rating - 7.5
text:
I didn't compare it to all the others...i just popped some corn, kicked back and had fun...all the low ratings here really amaze me...the only criticism i might make is it WAS a bit too long...otherwise, a lot of fun...
i think lots of people that review on this site just can't wait to tear whatever movie it is apart...i'm glad they have a place to vent their general unhappiness...but their reviews would've prevented me from having seen a bunch of movies i enjoyed...this being one of them...

title: What's the plan? Whatever happens, that's the plan!
text: We enjoyed this somewhat more than we expected to, considering the abundance of negative comments. This is an entertaining movie that never takes itself too seriously. Of course there are some scenes very reminiscent of prior Jurassic Park movies but that isn't a bad thing.There are mainly three things going on and as the story develops they get tied together. One, a number of places where dinosaurs are being bred illegally, and we some involved in illegal fighting for sport. Second, the appearance of some really big bio-engineered locusts, maybe as long as 18 inches or so, and they are systematically devastating crops. If left unchecked it could lead to a worldwide food shortage.And third, the little bio-engineered girl, a clone of her scientist mother is now a teenager and typically rebellious, but also figuring out how her DNA was engineered can be a critical link to solving other issues.The movie has the mandatory manic action, most of it involving evading and fighting off dinosaurs that seem to want to eat people. The various stunt doubles get really good workouts. And there is the airplane, heavily damaged, when asked "What's the plan?" She responds, "Whatever happens, that's the plan." Fortunately for the story good things happen.My wife and I watched it at home on BluRay from our public library. Great sound track also, gives the subwoofer a good workout. Also the BD has some interesting extras on making the movie and how they tied in characters from the older Jurassic Park movies. And how they were able to use so many different animatronic approaches rather than CGI for everything. A real treat for movie-making nerds like me.

title: What a joke. The movie depended on the stupidity of the audiences.
text: When I see Chris lassoed a giant dinosaur on the horseback and pulled it with a single hand at the beginning of the movie, my expectation dropped to the floor level. Does the writer has a Hulk arm or how he could think that would even be possible? And the CG of that scene was very bad too. With every scene other scene the movie managed to pull my expectation even further down. Oh, and want to ask, did they tried to resemble Tim Cook in the movie as the CEO of the company?

title: as Ian Malcolm once said: dinosaurs had their shot and nature selected them for extinction
text: Dinosaurs roam the Earth, and not just on a Costa Rican island anymore; dino "liberator" Claire and dino "wrangler" Owen have settled remotely out west, embraced "parenthood," and adapted to a world cohabited by humans and hadrosaurs, plus Blue Raptor is their unofficial neighbor. There's ooh, there's ahh, there's running and screaming, plus a subplot involving some rapacious corporate rats and Henry Wu (yeah, he's still around to keep meddling in science he can't possibly control), but still not a story worth the padded running time. Trying to bamboozle longtime fans by bringing back some legacy characters makes no difference when there's nothing worthwhile for them to do, even though Goldblum does have an inimitable way of delivering his lines. **

title: "Whatever Happens, that's the Plan"
text: 3 stars for the visuals. The rest are for the script and direction. Mindless nonsense! BORING endless repetition of thrilless escapes, chases, etc. They just threw everything at the wall to see what would stick. It looks like 15 scripts got thrown in a blender.

title: Not so good as the last one Fallen Kingdom
text: In a few days I enjoyed to watch the last two Jurassic World movies. Sure, in Dominion the value of entertainment is still there but the story was in my opinion too long stretched. I missed some suspense and surprising moments and it could have been cut for at least 30 minutes. I was disappointed for the poor end and that nothing has been shown to be continued in a sequel.The special effects were less good and sometimes cheesy but the dinosaurs seemed again real done. As I mentioned if you like this kind of franchise you will spend an entertaining time but only if you have really nothing other to do.Rating is near 6/10.
